description:
AN ABSOLUTE MUST if you're traveling to SF or live here. You have to try Golden Boy! I consider myself a bit spoiled since I live around the corner and can grab a slice whenever I want. Not many people are that lucky. Expect LOOONG lines as the inside space is super small but trust me, your slice is going to be well worth it. I've tasted almost every single slice they have and as a Pizza Purist the regular cheese pizza has my heart. 

My ranking for the slices goes:
1. Cheese
2. Pepperoni
3. Sausage
4. Combination
5. Veggie
6. Clam & Garlic (This is their most famous slice. I'm not a fan of clams so it's at the bottom of my list.)

No matter which one you try, it will be a doughy cheesy perfection.

TOP TIP - They are CASH ONLY! They do have an ATM inside :)
author: Inci A.

description:
3.75/5
As a NY-style pizza gal, I was a little iffy when I saw the pizzas in the window but the line stretched down the block and I had to give it a try. Honestly the wait wasn't too bad. About 35 mins that passed pretty quickly. There's some bar seating inside where you order then snag a spot. The space is tight like a lot of other spots in the area.

We ordered the clam and garlic pizza for $4.25. It's a decent size slice and like many people have mentioned it's carby so it'll fill you up. Like I said I'm not a huge thick crust person but I was pleasantly surprised. The crust was delicious and crispy. The bottom-most layer had a crisp but firm crunch and the carb layer above that had that smooth chewy doughiness. As an overall bite the flavors were pretty balanced. I felt like I got a good amount of clams and garlic to live up to the base. I was also pleasantly surprised that the clams weren't gummy canned monstrosities. The ratios are still a bit off for me though because I really wanted more cheese and a more robust sauce. However it was solid slice.

Overall, I wouldn't wait 35 mins for this again but earlier when I passed by I saw a short maybe 5 minute wait right around 6pm on a Saturday so there's definitely times the line isn't crazy. If that's the case, I'd consider stopping for another slice.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Okay there's only one maybe two things that you need to know about this place: 

1) Expect a short line outside because the place isn't that big. 

2) TRY THE GREEN looking PIZZA. It's the one with a bit of clams, garlic, parsley, and maybe basil? If you like garlic like I do, that's the pizza you never knew you needed in your life. MMMMMM. I also got a slice of the everything supreme, which was good, but paled in comparison to the flavorpacked green pizza. So save the green pizza for last because that garlicky goodness won't be leaving your mouth anytime soon after consumption. 

One should not expect to have good breathe after consumption of the green pizza. But... no regrets!
author: Janice W.

description:
CASH ONLY!!! 

This place probably doesn't need my review but I always come here late at night with friends after a long day of hanging out in the city. Of course the main attraction is the garlic clam pizza, which IMO is good but every time I've had it it's been a bit salty. I feel like it needs to be paired with a beer or something. Good thing it's a lot a bar. All the other slices are pretty good too. You get a thick squared slice of pizza and it's roughly around $4 depending on the slice you get.

The line is usually out the door but the moment you step in, that's where you order. It moves relatively quick because all they are doing is heating up the slices that you order. You can see the slices of pizza from the store front window. For sure a place I'd recommend but given the popularity I probably don't have to do much persuading.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Sicilian style pizza, fresh toppings, thick but not dense crispy crust that has an ever so slight hint of the yeast tang.  Lots of shredded motz giving just the right amount of an oil slick on top. Delicious and the perfect size for a late night snack. A slice will run you $4-$5.5. 

Interior is an old school diner counter with stools. The hours posted here are for sit down. They are still open well into the late, late night, selling pizza out of the front window only.
author: Julia K.

description:
Garlic clam pizza. Say no more.

What I tried:
*Garlic clam
*Pepperoni 

Overall thoughts:
*Usually a wait out the door but it's worth it 

*Quick service 

*They heat up your slice for you and it comes out with a perfect crispy crust

*My garlic clam slice was delicious 

*Affordable lunch or snack ..or dinner

*Limited seating bar stools 

*Cash only 

*10/10 recommend!
author: Sarah W.

description:
ERR, Duke of Golden Boy Pizza, has been coming here a lot so I noticed and bookmarked it. When I came up to show my in-laws around the Bay Area, I planned to meet him here for some pizza and to catch up. Unfortunately my in-laws were exhausted so we weren't able to meet up. I was quite disappointed because I wanted to have my first experience here with ERR. Looking on the brighter side of things, we went to dinner at Sotto Mare and Golden Boy Pizza is like 30 seconds away. At least I can stop by after dinner this trip. 

I got ERR's recommendations (Clam & Garlic if it was my first time and Combo or Pepperoni) prior to going. He sold me on picking up two slices to snack on after dinner. I'm so glad I listened! He also warned me of a line but it does move relatively quickly. The guy who takes orders has this system and I gotta say, it was impressive how he remembered all the orders while still being a cashier. Very efficient! Best part was he was super friendly and calm the entire time. 5 stars for him! 

The first slice I ordered is the Clam & Garlic pizza because it's their most popular. It's good but a little too much garlic for me. If you like garlic then this is your pizza! The second slice was their Combo and I loved it! It had sausage, tomato, mushroom, pepperoni, zucchini and cheese over their pizza sauce that was amazing! Crust was very good and held up well with all the ingredients. Even after eating a full dinner at Sotto Mare, I polished this slice off after eating 1/3 of the Clam & Garlic slice prior. 

This pizza spot sells by the slice and is legit. With so many options in Little Italy, it's hard to decide but I urge you to check this place out. They have been in business since 1978 and are still around for a reason. Some things to note is that they are cash only. They also have chili flakes and parmesan cheese in take out packets if you ask for it. No oregano unfortunately but that's all good because they give you an opportunity to add anything you like prior to them packing it for you. Great slices of pizza at amazing prices. 4.5 stars!
author: Daniel C.

description:
If you're like me and you love bread, Golden Boy is paradise. They make their pizzas on focaccia bread - just let that sink in real quick - FOCACCIA. I've only ever been here after a night out, at which point the line tends to be at least 45 minutes to an hour long and you also run the risk of them running out.

For me, it's worth it. I've never regretted waiting in line for this pizza, and it's always fresh and immensely satisfying. Of course, the earlier you go the better as they'll probably have a larger variety and more reasonable wait times. My favorite is the classic cheese, but they have several options - I've had many people recommend the clam and garlic. If you like thick crust pizza, this is the place for you.
author: Apoorva A.

description:
Wow, this place was delicious! I work fairly close by, so I decided to finally try a slice. I had ordered the combo sheet pizza.

Combo pizza: 4.5/5 
I love eating pizza once in a while when I'm craving something cheesy. The crust is soft but crisp, and the slices are decently sized with delicious flavors. The only problem I have about this pizza joint is the pricing. I ordered a sheet and it costed me a whopping ~55 dollars. 


I understand that this pizza joint is good, but I think a 55 dollar pizza is a little steep.
author: Elsa W.

description:
Wow, this review is looooong overdue! I've been coming here for years and their pizza is delish! You must like deep dish style or this place is not for you, or it can be if you like overall tasty pizza with killer service.

Don't let the line fool ya, it goes by fast and it's worth the wait. I'm not brave enough to try the clam pizza yet but everytime I go it looks delish! I usually get the pesto veggie and a mushroom slice.

Get two slices! One to eat and one for later, or eat both!


**Cash only, they have an ATM if you forget to bring some cash**
author: Evangelina B.

description:
One of our pizza must trys during our SF trip over the weekend. A few of us were waiting in line at Mama's on Washington Square brunch and a couple of us wanted to bring back some pizza to try.

Golden Boy was not too far down so we walked over and decided to get the Garlic and Clam pizza (what they're known for) and the Vegetarian Pesto which looked promising.

They only take cash so make sure you have cash ready!

We tried it right away and OMG BOTH WERE SO DELICIOUS AND FLAVORFUL!
The Garlic and Clams one was full of garlic flavor which we all love and the Vegetarian Pesto was full of pesto flavor which is always a favorite.

I would definitely recommend if you are looking for good quality pizza!
author: Katelin N.

description:
My coworkers all rave about this place so I thought I would give it a try since I was in town. I came on a Sunday night and the line was out the door. I think that isn't unusual for this place because the pizza is a quick grab and go. Waited around 20 mins to finally get some food and it was well worth the wait. My boyfriend and I wanted to try at least one of everything so we did that (but opted out of the cheese pizza). My favorite was the clam/garlic pizza and the pesto veggie pizza! Both extremely unique and very tasty. But fair warning, chew some gum after eating the clam/garlic one! 

I also just want to throw it out there that two pizzas are more than enough to get full. Slices are pretty big and they run from $3.25-4.25 a slice. We were ambitious and got three slices each person but I guess the remaining two slices we couldn't finish was good for my lunch the next day. Word of advice though, try not to have it as leftovers. It tastes fantastic when it's freshly heated out of the oven but the taste suffered when you reheat it the next day. 

Service was great, good vibes in the restaurant with a cool skater vibe to it (graffiti and art on the walls). Love it!
author: Amy L.

description:
Did Oscar De La Hoya get permission to use "Golden Boy Promotions" from Golden Boy Pizza? 

I mean, Golden Boy Pizza was established in 1978 and De La Hoya's GBP was in 2002. Look at the logos....even similar. Copyright infringement, perhaps?

Anyways, Golden Boy Pizza's original location is still in the heart of North Beach where a lot of hungry, drunk people go to a "quick" bite to eat. Line is out the door, especially late at night on weekends and you might get hangry while waiting in line. It won't help if you'll stare at the window at the fresh batch of wonderful, smelling pizza straight from the oven as it will only make it worse. Get ready to suffer and drool until it's your turn at the front of the line.

Their pizza selection is cheese, pepperoni or sausage, clam / garlic, pesto / vegetarian and combination. A slice cost $2.75 and sheets go from $35.00, $41.50 and $48.00 depending on the type. You can also mix it up and get half and half, which is what we ordered. 

I'd also recommend eating these bad boys on site as they are still hot and you can see the strings of melted cheese stretching as far as North Beach to Baker Beach. Really, that's not an embellishment, I tell ya. 

You can also watch the show inside as you can see how the staff communicate and work during a busy night. It's quite a production to marvel at, and the efficiency and the speed with how they operate is probably comparable to the best assembly line of any factory.

You might also dig the graffiti and stickers that has evolved throughout the years with layers and layers of patrons leaving their mark...literally speaking.

Drunk or not, the pizza is a knockout!
author: John G.

description:
The ever present line did move quickly enough--I think we waited maybe 15 minutes before we got into the doorway to order.
I opted for the combo. (mushroom, zucchini, pepperoni, onion, tomato and sausage)
We also ordered a slice of cheese pizza.
I really enjoyed the crust.  It's a good size slice of pizza too!
The toppings were flavorful and there are oregano, cheese, garlic powder and hot pepper shakers everywhere if you want to add even more flavor.
Service was great considering the non-stop line of people waiting to get in.
We scored the only two seats left at the counter and ordered Peroni to go with the pizza.
Two slices and two beers came to $15.50.
Most people were getting take out that was neatly wrapped in red/white checkered paper.
You gotta try this local institution.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Last minute decisions when craving for pizza leads you here in SF. Definitely worth the drive for a few slices if you are the spontaneous type.  Do not fret when you arrive as you will encounter a line outside of the establishment.  I had ordered the delicious Pepperoni pizza which was a typical choice, but I was told that the Garlic Clam pizza was "to die for" so that will be my next try when I return.  Service is quick and there are some indoor seating.  

The only thing that disgusted me about being at this place is the man that was standing in line behind my friend & I who just literally spit on the floor inside the establishment with not a care in the world.  That guy was a disgusting pig!  I hope I do not encounter him when I return.
author: Jennefer C.

description:
When slave girl and I visited San Francisco, we were told by our amazing bartender at happy hour to try this popular pizza shop called Golden Boy Pizza. Since he was awesome, we took his words and checked out the place.

After we finally hiked to the restaurant, oh my, there was a pretty big line and it wasn't even peak hours for dinner. I was excited to eat at this hole in the wall joint. The line was long but it was moving fairly fast with people in and out.

The pizza was baked on a rectangular sheet and they cut them into rectangular shape to serve. There were 6 different types on display. Me being fat and all, I ordered one of each so we can try them all! With 6 slices and a bottle of water, it was only $25 and I was very pleased with the price.

We tried combo, cheese, pepperoni, sausage, pesto veggie, and clam garlic. My favorite was clam garlic. It was garlicky with an unique taste, but it wasn't exactly clam. Very addicting. Least favorite was actually the combo. I guess I just didn't care for zucchini on my pizza even though I liked it on the pesto slice.

Overall, I loved everything. Service was fast and friendly, and the pizza was delicious. Just because I had a least favorite, it didn't mean it wasn't good. The pizza wasn't greasy and didn't give me acid reflux after. I would be coming back when I am in town again.
author: Fan H.

description:
Simple selection. Get the garlic clam and combo pizzas. Both had good flavor and the square shape is a nice touch. Crust was nice and crispy, not too thick, mounted with tons of cheese and toppings. Pizza should be really easy for places to perfect.

BTW, it's cash only.
author: Mary X.

description:
Y'all don't know what my friend and I had to go through to in order to arrive at the holy doors of Golden Boy Pizza (GBP).

After searching the streets for parking and finding that there were way too many people in town either going to one of the strip clubs or bars nearby, we finally found a sacred parking spot near one of the strips of Chinese businesses. Although we were looking for parking for a good 15~20 minutes, our walk from our spot to GBP turned out to be less than 10 minutes (whew). It was freaking cold (let me tell you). And, it ain't safe at night on these mean streets (getting too dramatic eh?)


But yes, after breathing a huge sigh of relief after finally parking, walking swiftly amongst other pedestrians and aggressive drivers, and bracing the cold in our not-too-ready-for-this-situation jackets, we reached GBP.

Upon arriving, we discovered two things:
1) People (I mean a lot of people) eat pizza after normal hours (after 9:30pm).
2) GBP is "cash only."

Thank the Lord that we both had enough cash on us, AND we were at the front of the line after about 15 minutes of waiting. During our sweet waiting, we almost witnessed a fight between a bartender and a customer down the sidewalk, but thankfully it just ended with "Pay for your damn drink" and "Watchu gonna do about it?" And some angry faces and some unnecessary comments from people in line at GBP...And then there was this half-sober/half-drunk guy who walked down the GBP line saying "Happy Saturday" and tried to get high-five's from everyone. When it came to our turn, we initially didn't respond but were like "what the hell, he won't leave till we give em' a high-five." By this point, even the smell of the pizza was becoming slightly unbearable.

Anyways, once we entered the narrow door, I ordered a single slice of the following:
-Clam and Garlic
-Cheese (poured pepper flakes all over)

YUM. Must I say more? The slices were piping hot, the ingredients were fresh, and the toppings were magnificently flavorful.
And, the individual slices go from $3.25~$4.25. 

I also just wanted to give props to all the employees...they were all so efficient, and two of the guys (the one taking orders at the front and one of the "pizza makers" were so amazingly quick and accurate at what they did and were friendly all at the same time). Mad respect for being pleasant even when things were getting more and more chaotic.

Note: There IS indoor dining space as well as two bathrooms. Although many order and take their food to-go, there is always an option to eat inside the restaurant.
author: Christine H.

description:
Ate at the famous Golden Boy on a recent weekend trip to the Bay. Yelp and all of the great reviews brought me here and I'm always on the hunt for a great slice in every city I visit. 

1 star for the terribly long line. We waited a solid 45 minutes with only about 20 people in front of us. 

Price per slice was about average for most cities. Pepperoni was just shy of $4 although they had more expensive slices. 

4 stars for the quality and flavor of the pizza. It was good but wasn't a WOW slice and certainly not worth the wait. I am not from SF so I don't have good alternatives to suggest but I do know that there are at least a dozen slice joints in Portland that are better or at least equal with no wait. I really liked their sauce the most of all the separate components of the slice. Cheese and pepp seemed fairly ordinary and dough was extra extra thick but very nice flavor.

Ultimately, it's a solid choice if no wait. Otherwise I would pass altogether. Don't believe the hype.
author: Michael B.

description:
We stumbled upon this pizza parlor in San Francisco July 2017. Just went back in July 2018. 

They make Sicilian style pizza in a couple of ways. Plain, pepperoni, meat, veggie, meat and veggie. 

This pizza is really good. Great crust. Great sauce. Lots of cheese. Fresh toppings. My favorite is the plain and the meat. 

Downside is that the Restsurant is really small and essentially a takeout pizza parlor. Also - there are usually lines. Worth the wait!
author: Patrick A.

description:
My SF standard for Sicilian, thick crust pizza. Tasty slices, even when you aren't drunk! I get the corner slice for extra of the oven fried, crisp crust. Not super generous with the meaty toppings, but well balanced between gooey cheese and tangy sauce.

And at under $5, one of my top cheap eats in San Francisco. Of course, this means you usually will have to wait in line. Five, ten minutes tops unless you come at 2 am on a Friday or Saturday (not recommended).
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Great and edgy little hole in the wall. There was a long line when I got here and I get why! 

FOOD //
I got the combo slice, which includes zucchini​, pepperoni, mushroom, tomato, and more. It was bomb. I was kind of skeptical on the size at first because it seemed slightly small. However, it ended up being the perfect in-between snack/small meal for me before dinner. The server puts your slice in the oven before serving it to you to ensure warmth and crispiness. 

SERVICE //
The service here was simple but great. There's a huge familial vibe in here with no real cash register. You order, give the server your cash, and find a seat and wait for your pizza. 

AMBIANCE //
It reminds me a lot of a dive bar. There are stickers all over the place and it is super small and quite dark. The noise level is pretty high. I enjoyed how informal it was!

OVERALL // 4 stars
A couple of my friends mentioned this place when I told them I was heading to SF. I see why they like it! I would tell my friends who have never been to come here. If I was in the area, I would stop by but I don't know that I would go out of my way to come back!
author: Vy P.

description:
I dough not want to sound cheesy, but Golden Boy Pizza stole a pizza my heart! 

Preface: A few years back, my coworkers and I decided to try a bunch of pizza places for lunch. Seeing the high reviews, I forced them to accompany me to Golden Boy Pizza... on a rainy day. After discovering this establishment was *CASH ONLY* we had to hunt for an atm.... in the rain. Finally, I got to order a slice of pepperoni and was unfortunately disappointed  with my experience. The slice felt too doughy/heavy and the flavors were lacking. Maybe they're having an off day? Maybe it wasn't fresh enough? I never thought about going back... until now. 

Today: After years of my friends continuously raving about GBP and one of my friends craving to go, I finally caved and decided to give them another shot and I'm glad I did!

The line was a lot longer this time around. Seating is limited so be prepared to grab and go. 

Staff was kind and provided us with great service. 

I ordered a Pepperoni and a Combination Sicilian Slice (total -$8). I went during the right time (6:30 ish) because they were pushing out fresh sheets/slices, yay! 

The toppings were pretty good and met expectations. It was interesting to see cucumber as a topping for the combination slice - but still enjoyable. Let's talk about that dough though- come through carbs! This time around, the dough was toastier and fluffier! It complimented the toppings so well that I finished everything it a few bites. 

Overall, I had a great experience. For less than $10, you can grab a delicious bite with friends and enjoy it as you explore/relax in the city. Really happy I gave this business another shot and looking forward to my next visit!
author: Ida H.

description:
Wow omg I've live here my life and never has golden boys. Been missing out! I went to nyc recently and thought I had the best pizza there but nope I found my new favorite spot! GOLDEN BOYS!!!

Their pizza are amazing especially garlic clams and there are no side crust which is the best part, honestly I feel like pizza shouldn't have crust. Instead they should be like golden boys all cheese and ingredients. No crust!

TAKE MY MONEY! GIVE ME GARLIC CLAM PIZZA! My life is complete! Best no crust pizza in SF! Also bring cash since it's cash only!
author: Christopher G.

description:
Both locals and visitors of SFO swears by this place. May be the best pizza I've ever had! The line was ridiculously long, but it was definitely worth the wait. The owner was serving at the front of the store, he was nonstop and so very friendly. He recognized his regulars and made sure they were well looked after. He was kind to all of his customers, and staff. Great environment. 
The pizza was fresh, packed with ingredients, and it was just the right about of doughiness. Loved it!!
author: Michele L.

description:
I am still dreaming about this pizza even while on my break at work right now.
The garlic clam pizza was honestly life changing.
There was a wait to get in and the line does go out on to the sidewalk but they keep the line moving and you get order pretty quickly.
There's like barely any space to sit inside but if you can sit and eat right away do it because the pizza tastes super good fresh out the warmer they have.
Also make sure to put the pepper flakes on the pizza because it elevated the flavor to another level.
There are bathrooms in the back!
author: Erin S.

description:
Pizza? Open late? (not that late but still late enough for second dinner) COUNT ME IN!!! There is a reason why this place is so highly rated... it's some good pizza they got in here.

Lines may be long and may move a little slow, but the pizza is affordable and worth it! I do wish they had more seating because who wants to eat their pizza out in the SF cold? Like, are you gonna wait to bring the pizza home to eat? THE HORROR. We were fortunate to find seating towards the back and they brought our slices out to us.

I barely took a bite of mine but my boyfriend already finished his. It was THAT good. I love how it's soft on top but the crust at the bottom leaves it crunchy. Yummm. I gotta come back to try the other flavors and leave a sticker on the wall.
author: Crystal N.

description:
If the line is short enough, it's pretty worth it. 

Nothing incredibly special, but still worth picking up a slice if you're in the mood for a quick bite. The line goes by pretty quickly, but it can take time if they need to reheat a lot of the pizzas. 

For my visit, I grabbed a pepperoni pizza and my friend grabbed a clam w/ pesto & garlic. I liked it and it seemed like the clam w/ pesto & garlic was a popular choice. 

For both pizzas, it was a total of $8. Make sure to bring cash!
author: Robin C.

description:
It is my first day in San Francisco and I just met a girlfriend for a weekend of fun. After meeting up at the hotel we decided to seek out food. The places on our list were either closed until evening or about to close. My friend was in the mood for pizza so I searched Yelp and Golden Boy came highly recommended. We caught a shared Uber and 30 mins later we walked up and snagged a place in line. The line was out the door just like previous reviews stated it would be. I ordered a slice of pesto veggie and sausage. The pizza ranged from $3.75 to $4.25/slice. I also grabbed a can dr. pepper for $1.50. I ended up spending a total of $9.50 and my tastebuds and purse were impressed. 

The seating is limited. The restaurant is long rather than wide and there are bar stool style seating. No more than 15-20 seats in total and that may be being generous. 

The restaurant is located in North Beach/Little Italy and a short walk from ChinaTown. The pizza is fresh and can easily be seen through the glass at the front of the building. Once you order, your slices are placed into the oven and if you are able to find a seat, they will bring your food to you. If you cannot find a sheet then you just wait around as best as you can since like previously stated that space is quite limited. 

On each table you find the following: Parmesan cheese, red pepper flakes, pepper, salt, and parsley flakes. The pizza comes in a plastic wicker basket with a knife and fork. 

The restaurant is covered in graffiti and stickers. People leave their lasting thoughts everywhere. I mean you can find funny writings on the ATM and all over the bathroom walls and anywhere else you look. There are two bathrooms available for use. DO not get distracted inside of the bathrooms and lose track of time trying to read all of the writings.
author: Latrunda S.

description: This is the best pizza ever! I have been here with my mother and we were amazed by the fast service and the fantastic taste of the pizza. I bought a square of fresh pizza served on a paper with a knife and fork, sit and the bar and eat. Quick, delicious and inexpensive. Highly recommended!
author: Elena L.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is great for those who like fast, cheap pizza. 

The slices range from $3.25 to $4.25 and the slices were pretty big. They were about the size of my hand (my hands are not too small!). They were very cheesy and the toppings were cooked very well. 

The crust was just ok and tasted kind of plain. The taste reminds me of a typical baguette even though it did not look like one. It was very crunchy though! Whenever I order pizza, I usually go for the slices that have large crusts. I think tasting every part of the pizza is important. In some pizza places I have been to, the crusts would be seasoned well. Some would be stuffed with cheese and sauce while others would have a lot of herbs on them. 

As weird as it sounds, I felt a little nervous walking into the bathroom. There were graffiti and stickers everywhere and made me feel like the place was unclean even though it wasn't (it was the exact opposite!). I ended up just washing my hands and figuring out how to turn off the faucet for a couple of minutes since water kept dripping out... My boyfriend thought I was walking into a janitor's closet and did not see this bathroom door at the first or second glance.

Other than that, I think I can imagine myself coming back.
author: Kristina M.

description:
This place right here is a must try! 
Golden Boy is a small pizza place that has a line that goes on forever. I waited about 30 minutes to get some pizza that was well worth the wait. 
The inside is really small so it may be hard to find a place to sit. 
This is a cash only place so be sure to bring cash. 
Service is quick. 
The quality is amazing and I would definitely come here again.
author: Amy N.

description: So, I went to this place when I visited my little bro on the west side of this country because a girl I follow on IG raves about it - follow stirandstyle if you don't already. Well, I'm glad I came out. There are tons of pizzas to choose from, all with crisp crust and all so delicious. The bro and I tried 4 kinds cuz we're gluttons. The place is tiny and has lots of character. I'll come back when I visit again.
author: Marivic L.

description:
Love coming here when we're in SF.  It's pretty close to Chinatown, so in the midst of buying roasted duck and chicken feet I dragged my mom with us to get some delicious Italian pizza!  It was a trek for her, but she made it.  

The place is small, but don't underestimate the little ones!  Their pizza is squared/rectangle, so you get to pick crust or no crust.  We usually eat there, so they would heat up our slices and we'll just sit at the bar.  They have a few options, the typical cheese and pep, combo, but I usually order the garlic clam pizza.  It's delish!!  I've heard horror stories about people getting sick eating clam pizza, but not here!  It's been great to my tummy except getting it bigger . 

For sure we'll back whenever we're in town!
author: Lisa V.

description:
What more can be said about one of my favorite pizza spots in San Francisco! I live in the mission district and go out of my way to come all the way to north beach, and wait in what is usually a 10-15 min wait for some of the best pizza I've ever had.. that says a lot about golden boy!

What I like most about golden boy is it's straight and to the point. They have 5 different types of pizza ready for the taking; Cheese, pepperoni or sausage, clam/garlic, pesto/vegetarian and a combination. My personal favorites are the clam/garlic and surprisingly the cheese! Simple but you can't go wrong with the cheese slice here.
 
What makes the pizza so good, aside from the bomb cheese and toppings is the focaccia bread that it's baked on. It's thick, but not too thick, always crunchy and most importantly super tasty! 

When ordering they give you the option to eat it as is (which is already cooked and sitting under a heat lamp), or they can heat it up for you in an oven they have. I prefer it a little more hot and crispy so I opt for the oven. The customer service is always on point and polite, and they always have a good way of attending to you all while keeping the line moving in order to serve everyone. 

A must visit when in San Francisco and when in the mood for a little trip to north beach for some pizza! 

5/5 burritos!!
author: John James M.

description:
Great pizza for da price in North Beach neighborhood of SFO! 

A childhood friend of mine paid me a visit and I took him for a walking tour of the North Beach Area and of course Pizza and Beer where on our mind.

My Yelp APP quickly narrowed down our options and I was in the mood to try a place that I had not tried before. Golden Boys came up as da place!

You will usually find a line out the door for those seeking that slice to go. 

While in line I dialed their number and asked; Do you have a thin-style crust? A: "No only pan." Q; can I order a small Combo to go? A; "We only have one size." Q: Whats on your Combo? I don't want green peppers! A: "We only have one size to go, Pepperoni, Sausage, Zucchini, Tomatoes & Onions." Do you have Canadian Bacon? (My favorite topping besides cheese on pizza) A: "No." Q: So I ordered: A Combo Pan Pizza with extra cheese" to go. Not knowing that the "Pan" is an Huge Cookie-type Pan! 
So in really, It's the equivalent to getting two Large Pan Pizza's!

They have limited counter-style bar stool seating for those that wish to dine in. 

The Cheese, Sausage and Pepperoni Slices are great! I didn't try the pesto or clam.

Oh! And for the ever present question of Do they have "Gender Neutral" bathrooms?
Forgive me, I'm not sure what that symbol really looks like. 
The bathroom doors indicate Man/Woman figures and their is a regular toilet inside.
Hope this answers the question!

There is great beer on tap $5.00 pint or $15.00 pitchers and an assortment of bottled beer that pair perfectly with their unique butter brushed, pan-style, thicker than usual crusted pizzas.
I think I saw wine bottles on the counter too.

All in all, a great place to grab and go after a bar hopping San Francisco day or night out!

Four stars for value, taste and overall great pan-style pizza that pleases the palate!
author: Don G.

description: Tbh not sure what the hype is with this place. My bf really liked it and thought it was good but I thought there wasn't much flavor at all! I had high expectations for this place and was kinda disappointed when I finally tried their infamous clam and garlic pizza. Waited about 20 mins in line. Got 4 slices of pizza for $17 total. CASH ONLY! There is an ATM inside or you can go to the ATM machine inside the bar next store which has a $2 fee. I also tried their pesto veggie pizza and wasn't impressed.
author: Vanessa L.

description: "Golden Boy" is such a fitting name because this pizza really does stand out from the crowd. Even though I am a firm believer in thin crust pizza with bubbly edges (you know what I'm talking about), I now have a newfound appreciation for the thick and crispy crust of Sicilian pizza. My sausage square was oh so satisfying. This pizza must be heaven for people with drunk munchies!
author: Marie S.

description:
Fan-freaking-tastic.

I visited this place over the weekend, and I wasn't entirely sure what to expect. I solely went off other Yelp reviews, but didn't look deeper into it at all.

First off, this is a slice shop that focuses on Sicilian-style pizzas. When I got there, around 11:50am, there was already a line extending outside of the restaurant. This line may be daunting, but it's pretty fast moving since it's a slice place after all. The pizzas are on display at the front window too so go ahead and figure out what you want before going in. 

The menu is very straightforward with just a few options (cheese, pepperoni, supreme/combo, clam & garlic, and pesto & vegetarian). The seating can be limited, but thankfully most people in line were getting takeout. 

I went with the cheese pizza... at first (more to this later). My god was it delicious. The crust was crunchy, and the cheese to sauce to dough ratio was perfect. The sauce was well balanced. Typical carryout pizza joints tend to be too tart for my taste. Back to the point, I luckily got a corner piece, and I would recommend for you to do the same. I enjoyed this cheese slice so much that I went back and got a pepperoni one. It was amazing too. I normally prefer toppings on my pizza, but if I were to do it again then I'd recommend just getting the cheese slices. You're better able to appreciate the flavors this way.

I'll 1000% be back, and I am telling you that you should go there ASAP.
author: Nick Y.

description: If it's a line, it means is good!!! I've been here a couple of times and have loved every style of pizza I've got. The crust fills in with the topping soft bread. Each bite is filled with rich flavors and beautiful texture to your mouth. I went in this Sunday and was surprised to see 4 people in line. Finally ate inside and got a different feel of the place. If you are looking for a delicious RICH flavor this pizza tops it for me in the area that is located. Most days be ready to be in line but for a pizza lover is WORTH the wait.
author: Lucy G.

description:
When you see a place with a line like Golden Boy's, there's a reason for it. People come to this spot because they know it's good, fun, cheap, and familiar. It's a staple of the neighborhood. 

While the line can sometimes be a bit unruly, and it's not my favorite pizza ever, it's hard denying Golden Boy as as an institution you should try.
author: Joey T.

description:
I used to think that the Bay Area didn't have great pizza places until I visited Golden Boy in North Beach. I came here on a Monday during lunch time and wow, it got pretty crowded shortly after I arrived (around 12:30). I got the garlic clam pizza and the pesto veggie and my boyfriend got the combo and the pepperoni. 

We decided to take the pizza to go since it's pretty crowded in there with just a few bar stools. They toasted the pizza for us before we headed out, which was great! 

Out of the pizzas I tried, I really enjoyed the pesto veggie and the pepperoni. I know they are popular for the garlic clam, but I preferred the simpler pizzas. The pesto is tasty and that pizza wasn't too filling compared to the combo. What I loved about the pizza was the focaccia crust - it was buttery and delicious. 

North Beach tends to be a little pricey from my experience, so I was happy about the quality for the price of Golden Boy. I would definitely come back to North Beach just to get their pizza!
author: Arianna B.

description:
Wow. 

Like...WOW! 

This place is AMAZING. AMMMMAZZZING!!!

That crust though!!!

It MUST win awards.   This is the best pizza I've had in my entire life, (and I've had a LOT of pizza)!  The crust can not be beat! Wow! The menu is simple yet efficient.  6 types of pizza: Cheese, Pepperoni, sausage, combo, pesto veggie, and finally **Clam & Garlic** (TRY IT!!!)  

Be advised:

-Cash Only Establishment

-Drink Selections: soft drinks, water, 15 Types of Beer on Tap, 1 Cider, and wine

-There will be a line down the street and limited seating (ITS WORTH THE WAIT) 

-TRY THE CLAM AND GARLIC PIZZA!  SWEET JESUS PLEASE TRY IT! 


Did I say WOW? Because WOW. 

WOW!
author: Cody A.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is an establishment that every neighborhoods must have.
down to earth, family owned, friendly, approachable, and delicious.
I had a slice of Garlic Clams Pizza this afternoon and I enjoyed so much.
Golden Boy Pizzas are not like any other conventional pizzas you see everywhere, they are baked on Foccacia Bread with pizza toppings.
so, Golden Boy Pizza baked their Foccacia Pizzas on the square sheets and cut them in squares per slice orders.
you can eat their pizzas either with hands or with fork & knife.
a square slice of garlic clam pizza cost $4.25
not cheap, but they're delectable.
author: Rudy H.

description: Always a 5 star rocker experience in North Beach. Go garlic and clam - you  wont be sorry at all
author: Matt T.

description:
TIME: Saturday 9pm

I just so happen to be in the area for an art show and thought "there's so many pizza options here! Where should I go?"

Thanks to Yelp, I decided on Golden Boy.  With it open until 2:30am, there's no way they can run out of pizza by the time it's my turn!

There was definitely a line but not a bad one. We waited 20 minutes until it was our turn to order and less than 5 for them to heat it up.  The guy working it was super friendly and did it all: take order, throw slice in the oven, purchase transaction, and package pizza.  I hope he takes plenty of breaks.

Most people seem to do take out, but there's a good amount of bar stools to sit and it.

All though thier menu looks like a they sell a bunch of things, they really have maybe 5 kinda of pizza to choose from:

1. Cheese
2. Pepperoni
3. Sausages
4. Combo
5. Pesto Veggie
6. Clam + Garlic

Okay that was 6, but the slices I had was:

VEGETARIAN & PESTO - $4.25
Mushroom, Zucchini, Tomato, Onion, Olives, Pesto. 
Really good! Lots of wonderful toppings with a not so over powering taste of pesto.

CLAM & GARLIC - $4.25
More garlic-y than clam-y.  Anyone who isn't a fan of shellfish wouldn't mind this slice at all! I really enjoyed it.

COMBO - $4.25
Mushroom, Zucchini, Tomato, Onion, Pepperoni, Sausage.
I love how huge the sausages are...they are like mini meatballs! I love the genius amount of toppings. So good!

So while all the slices I had were pretty good, I think what hit the spot for me was the crust. I grew up on that buttery pan style crust of Pizza Hut, and this is what it tastes like--but with plentiful and fresh toppings!  I'm so glad I came here!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
Every time we crave a slice of pizza, we ask ourselves: Tony's or Golden Boy? The answer depends on 1) the wait at Tony's (how accurate was the Yelp waitlist estimate?) 2) the weather (the line at Golden boy is mostly outside and on a cold rainy day can be torture) 3) how much cash do we have, and 4) are we in the mood for super garlicky pizza? 

Golden boy consistently delivers! The wait creeps out the door and can be upwards of 1 hour on a busy weekend evening, but is well worth the wait. I always crave the clam pizza, and my husband loves anything with meat (pepperoni, sausage). There is beer on tap as well to enjoy with your pizza (beer + pizza = best late night combo) and there are seats inside - because the line moves slowly by the time you get to the front there are usually empty seats so that is not a problem.

CASH only (though not expensive, each slice is about 3.50-4 dollars). Very garlicky pizza (esp the clam) which I love but if you are a vampire beware! Best slice house in the city. Enjoy!!!
author: Michele L.

description:
Came here not even hungry, but after sinking my teeth into a slice of that garlic clam, I couldn't have enough. 

My friend and I stopped by Golden Boy at around 7pm on a Thursday, and there was a line outside the storefront (as there usually is). It's not really a place to sit, given there's very limited seating inside, but with Washington Square Park close by and the bustling activity of the Russian Hill strip clubs, why would you limit your pizza consumption to the place itself? 

You can see the pizza they have in the window, and when we arrived there wasn't any garlic clam. But wo and behold, a beautiful full tray of steaming garlic clam pizza arrives just as we're about to order like the heavens had ordained it. We eagerly pointed to it. Usually upon ordering, they slide your slices into an oven to heat up, but given how fresh this pizza was, we got it immediately and piping hot. 

The guy who served us was super friendly and not gruff at all, even with the long line. Since we were sharing a slice between the two of us, he offered to cut it down the middle and put the halves onto their own napkins so we could easily hold them. The pizza smelled so good and the cheese looked so melty that we just stood on the sidewalk outside and started eating. I love focaccia, and I love how this crust wasn't soggy at all but pillowy and slightly crispy. I didn't get too much clam flavor, but no complaints about the amount of garlic and cheese on that thing. 

Good thing we left or I would've been sorely tempted to line up and order another slice just for myself...
author: Sophie W.

description:
Been eating here since I was a kid and they actually made sausage across the street! 

One of the last remaining icons of SF food. Lord help us. 

This is NOT NYC pizza. There is a crust. It's a square slice. It's delicious. 

My favorite is the pesto veggie but I dont discriminate with pizza -- haha or anything really so sometimes I'll just say surprise me. 

Cash only and I like that.
author: Christine V.

description:
So you wanna be a Golden Boy, eh? Well go ahead... have some of this Golden Boy Pizza and fill that belly up with joy!

I did it. I gave in. The hype... yes, it's real. You wanna know why? Because this pizza is DAYUUUM good, boy! Or shall, I say; Golden Boy! This here pizza is probably the closest that you're gonna get to Chicago Style in the Bay Area. That, or you'll just have to take a flight out to Chi-town to get the real thing. In the meantime, Golden Boy will appease your pizza cravings to the fullest. 

It's thick, a little greasy, cheesy, and packed full of flavor. Perfect for anytime of the day, but especially popular with the late night crowd. You know greasy pizza helps to sop up all of that late night alcohol and Golden Boy's Pizza does just that. It's open until what seems like the crack of dawn, but everyone else knows that too. Hence, the ridiculous lines in the wee hours of the morning. 

Is it worth the wait? Well... if you ask me, a person who really hates waiting for things, I would actually say yes. BUT... it depends on the situation. I would wait for this deliciously tasty pizza over getting something that's fast but just average in most instances. But if you're hangry and are about to rip someone's head off because your belly is rumblin', then it would be an obvious pass.

Have to draw attention to the spectacular customer service here! The service is A++! Even after serving an extensive line filled with drunks, hangries, and rowdies, the guy who took my order was as kind as can be. He didn't rush me and he greeted me with a smile. He even told me to have a nice day once I got my pizza. He was cool, calm, and collected. This is how I know that the staff here is tenured. They are professionals, and during the wee hours of the night when people be actin' cray, they are greatly appreciated. 

Thumbs down for the cash only though. I still can't understand why there are so many businesses still operating as cash only in 2018. But, I have no choice but to comply. The pizza is good, so I'll take the inconvenience of it being cash only. Should you try it? If you want some good ass pizza then yes... yes you should! :)
author: Shayla B.

description: We were walking around after a night of bar hopping and saw this pop up on a Yelp search. As we approached and saw the line spilling out of the place we knew we had made the right choice. I had a piece of combination and a beer on draft. OMG, the pizza was filled with toppings, soooo cheesy, nice thickness and piping hot! Don't let the line deter you. The service was quick and we were served fast. Definitely check it out if you're in the area.
author: Claudiana C.

description:
This review is based on a distasteful experience my husband and I had at Golden Boy Pizza last night. I knew this review was something I had to sleep on and really try to grasp my experience before taking further action. My husband and I enjoy the pizza here but unfortunately the service last night was terrible due to a specific employee. It was so bad, we lost our appetite for our pizza and ended up tossing it out. I had too much adrenaline running through me, not from the usual excitement of delicious pizza. But, from the anger of seeing what i normally see on social media happen right in front of me.
When you pay for something at a restaurant you not only pay for the pizza, the pasta, the burger etc. You also pay for the service, and I don't care if the restaurant is a 4 or 5 star rating. If the customer service is terrible, I don't care how good the food is, it is not worth my money. 
Whenever we are in SF, Golden Boy Pizza has been our go to pizza joint. We know the routine of waiting in long lines for minutes on end and some times chatting it up with our fellow pizza consumers. A good sign the foods good, usually has a long line outside. We stand in line outside for about 20-25 minutes give or take. So, my husband and I make small talk with a group of 3 male senior citizens. They were just a ball, their humor got us through that line. One of the men had an east coast accent so, we knew he was not originally from SF. After short conversation, he gave my husband a tip on a restaurant in NY from a famous Seinfeld episode. 
The senior admitted that this is his FIRST time tasting Golden Boy Pizza and that he was not sure what to get. So we briefly walk them through what they normally have and what we like to get. 
We all get to the counter. The senior citizen was next to us, trying to put in his order. Mind you, this man could be roughly in his late 70's to early 80's. He asks the employee , "What do you got over there?" Pointing at a specific pie.  This employee snappishly diverts his question with "which one? I don't know which one you're talking about" without even looking, all while she continued on with finishing our order. Than, she follows with, " Read the menu. That's why there's a menu." She repeats that 3 times. Meanwhile, the senior citizen was very calm and collected. He ignored her obvious irritation, and continued to ask her more questions about the types of pizzas that we're available. She then adds, "You had 30 minutes in line to think of what you wanted to order so look at the menu, that's why there's a menu ." 
That's where I stepped in, and I told her. "He's asking you what pizza is there because this is his first time. This is new to him. You do not talk to him like that. " 
After coming to his defense. Our 2 slices of pizza we ordered, one sausage and one clam garlic were basically thrown on to a sheet on a counter like it was for animals. Wrapped up like they were leftovers. 
For anyone who is familiar with Golden Boy Pizza, there are usually 6 types of pies. I repeat 6, and at this time there were only 3 types left to choose from. Whatever's left, that's what you get or you have to wait for more. Shocking that this PIZZA restaurant employee couldn't help a senior customer in choosing a slice of pizza to buy. If that's how Golden Boy Pizza treats a NEW PAYING CUSTOMER than they just lost our business. There is nothing laborious you have to do but utter words, not prepare and cook the pizza so this type of disregard is outrageous. I will never stand by when an ignorant, ill-mannered, impudent person shows no respect to a fellow senior/elder.
I work in the medical field and I have a lot of experience with caring for senior citizens. And i have learned some invaluable things from them. I never forget that baby boomers played a huge part in paving the way for Our economy, and for our rights. So, with what ever humanity is left out there, I can't turn the other cheek or standby when someone gets bullied or treated wrong. 
I saw this senior man wait patiently with the rest of us in line anticipating our turn to get a slice of pizza. Even one of his friends that was waiting with him went to Tony's pizza instead just up the street and tried to convince his group to try Tony's. But instead, they waited patiently for GBP. 
The level of DISRESPECT and RUDENESS that this fellow senior citizen received was APPALLING! No one deserves this type of treatment, ever. 
I took a picture of this employee to make it clear who she is. This employee should be reprimanded or fired because she obviously doesn't like her job. But, unfortunately, there's this thing where we label a person who is fully grown or developed an adult. But the moment an ADULT loses their morals or manners they fall into the category of a ignorant CHILD. So to that fellow employee, I wish you well. I hope that you're developing doesn't stop here because you have a very long way to go dear.
author: Harriet T.

description:
I was surprised to see a long line outside this pizzeria at 10:45 PM and as soon as I took my first bite, I realized why.. its because the pizza is here is HELLA GOOD. I ordered a plain pepperoni pizza for less than $4 and it was perfect. Idk who Golden Boy is but he has perfected the balance of a crispy crust and moist pizza dough.

Definitely try this place!
author: Henry W.

description:
I was sitting across the street when I saw a line for this place, the line was long and stayed constant so I was intrigued. The different pizza options were displayed at the window so you could change your mind multiple times before you ordered. You order pizza, pay and then the pizza is brought to you. There are stools and a small counter space along the walls for eating. 
In order of preference:
1. Pesto vegetarian
2. Combination
3. Pepperoni
4. Clam/garlic (you can definitely taste the clam. This was an interesting option so I had to try it...and I will not be getting it again).

My top picks:
1. Pesto vegetarian
2. Beers on tap
3. Friendly staff

My Negatives:
1. Too much cheese for my lactose intolerance...but it was worth it
2. It was good pizza but I wasn't blown away
author: Gina H.

description: Best pizza ever. That garlic clam got a lot of flavor. So yummy! Yes there is a line, and it is cash only but the staff make an effort to get the people rolling thru and it is totally worth the wait. The crust is crispy on the bottom and a little bready and they come in rectangular slices. The cheese has that extra melted stringiness when you take a bite to the point you gotta pull away a couple time to get the cheese to finally come off. It's everything you want.
author: Jane K.

description:
You've heard of the golden rule, but do you know the Golden Boy rule? Whoever buys this pizza ... pretty much rules. 

Golden Boy Pizza is more of a secret on how to "win friends and influence people" than it is "pizza" in the classic sense. The soft bread (instead of crust) with gooey cheese on top, reminds me of that thick, chewy pizza they served in elementary school when I was a kid ... and I loved it. 

Baked on huge sheets and served one square slice at a time, Golden Boy Pizza walk-up munchies available include classic American toppings like Pepperoni, Sausage, Cheese, Vegetarian, or Combination. A cheese slice costs $2.75 while a whole sheet runs $35. Prices go up to $3.75/$48 for the combo.

This restaurant has been San Francisco's golden boy for 40 years and the line out the door reminds us that sometimes, like silence, pizza can be golden.
author: Michael S.

description:
Probably the best pizza in San Francisco.

There was literally a line out of the door, but it moved pretty quick. The establishment wasn't too large and it was pretty tight. Not to worry, as there was a pretty decent amount of barstools for those who wanted to sit in and eat, but the majority seemed to take it to go. 

There was 6 options to pick from.

1. Cheese (3.25 per slice)
2. Pepperoni (3.75 per slice)
3. Sausage (3.75 per slice)
4. Combo (4.25 per slice)
5. Pesto Veggie (4.25 per slice)
6. Clam & Garlic (4.25 per slice)

Got the Clam & Garlic as it seemed to be the popular item on the menu. You can really taste the clam, and I really enjoyed that aspect of it. Will be looking forward to going back to try their other slices!

Note: They take cash only!
author: Timothy D.

description:
Great alternative to Tony's, but not a "quick slice."

Golden Boy offers a no-frills, delicious square pizza (in about 5 varieties of toppings). They are displayed in the window and replenished often, and there is no way to say "hold the olives" on the veggie pizza. A slice is pretty filling enough, and very satisfying. 

There's always a line, and it sometimes does not move that fast, so be prepared to wait at least a half hour. But then the slice is ready right away, so you'll be ok.

If you want to dine in, you grab a spot at the bar or counter (first come, first served) and maybe order a cheap glass of wine or beer.

OR, if the weather's nice, take your slices to Washington Square Park and enjoy a little picnic! Grab your beer and wine at a corner store beforehand, and enjoy a drink while you wait in line and afterwards at the park :)
author: Roya B.

description:
Best place to eat in San Francisco- hands down. Came here right after we landed on a Friday night. 

Located in North Beach aka Little Italy, this is the place to be. Cheap slices of pizza served pipping hot and the line was out the door- literally! 

Even though the line was long, the service was fast. But be warned, this isn't a place to sit and eat. More like grab and go. If you do snag a seat, take in the wall decor. 

Now let's talk pizza! Had to grab a slice of the classic cheese pizza and a slice of a vegetarian pizza. Best choices I made that night. My mouth is watering just thinking about the place. Only regret, wish I had gotten some more slices. 

The only upsetting part about this place- it's cash only. Yes that's right, cash only. 

Would I go back? Man, I wish they delivered to Houston =|
author: Natasha L.

description:
Well worth the wait! Let me tell you

I just wish the crust wasn't so thick (almost deep dish style) and also wish they had ranch. Yes, I said it! 

Super friendly staff even during peak hours. Great for a late night grub.
author: Adelina M.

description:
Yum! Loved the focaccia-like crust and the hearty toppings.

The garlic clam was by far my favorite. The combo came in a close second. One slice is definitely enough, but I had to get 4 to try all the toppings!

What I didn't love, however, was the extremely long wait. There was only one person serving customers and they even put the fresh pies into their mini oven, which took forever :(
author: Shirley H.

description: Great pizza , I loved it but horrible wait times. I went there at 5 and even then it took me half an hour to eat. It's a small place, service was decent, nothing spectacular. Food is amazing though and I will certainly go back for their pizza. I wish it wasn't this packed all the time though
author: Ryan S.

description:
This was a fun/different style. You wait outside in line as you see the square pizzas getting made. Hey have a good beer selection as well. Bring cash as it's required. The pizza reminded me of Detroit style. A popular chain known as "jets". Not deep dish but a make shift version of it. We got a slice of cheese, which was good; and a slice of clam bake. Not a clam bake type you get in Connecticut,  but still a good flavor if you like garlic, because there is a lot of it! The good news is there is still a light layer
If red sauce under there. If you want a slice and a beer, and want to try something different- give it a try!
author: Patrick A.

description: Small pizza joint in San Francisco. You cannot order a specific pizza unless you want to order the whole stack. Their pizzas taste delicious. Also, a veggie friendly place.
author: Abhay P.

description:
Cash only! 

Garlic Clam Pizza. What more does one need to say? Late night and inexpensive. Favorite pizza place while growing up.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
My friends and I had a weekend trip to SF and one of them recommended that we go to this place. When we arrived, there was a really long line so be prepared for that. Wait time for us was about an hour and when you go inside there are very limited seats so most of the time, people just order and leave.

I was surprised at how fast the pizza came! It took like less than 20 minutes and they come in fresh. 

Huge tip: TRY THE GARLIC CLAM PIZZA! 
It may sound exotic and you probably don't wanna take any risks trying it out but it was one of the best decisions of my life lol! It was pretty freaking good! They had other flavors like pepperoni, sausage, and veggie pesto. The flavors were aight nothing special... but the garlic clam was by far the best!!! Ahhh

If I come back to SF and come across golden boy pizza, gonna get me some of those garlic clam pizza!!
author: Lean T.

description: I ordered two slices of the garlic and clams. It was excellent. The aroma was too good to be true.
author: Selby C.

description:
My homeboy recommended this place so we decided to check this place out. Here was our experience on a Thursday evening.

Ambiance
Parking: Mainly street parking....you're in San Francisco so good luck.

Seating: Seating is mainly inside from bar seating and table seating. Pretty small space for about 20 people.

Feels: 
It's in a lowkey popping area. Not very touristy spot but a place locals knows. The space itself is small and intimate. Pretty much a run down hole in the wall like a bar with rock music in the background. It could be family friendly but mainly great place for a grab and go.

Food:
Garlic Clam Pizza (Recommend)
Much yes. I got a good slice - fresh, cheesy, and delicious. The garlic wasn't too intense but just right, it fused well with the clams.

Customer Service:
Cool - friendly and vibrant people

Overall:
4 Stars. The price was reasonable, service was good, and food was delicious. If you're lucky, you'll find parking but don't bank on it. Good place to hangout or grab a bite to go. Regardless one must takeaway is their pizza.

TL;DR Tips:
* Must go for a late night snack or a simple SF foodie adventure
* Don't be heart broken if they sell out.
author: Leland S.

description:
My boyfriend recently moved to North Beach and we always like to visit Golden Boy Pizza whenever we're looking for a quick bite. We love the Garlic Clam Pizza so much that we even ate here for Valentine's Day. Talk about romantic!

The Garlic Clam Pizza is definitely a must try and staple in San Francisco! It's the perfect late night snack after hitting up some bars around the North Beach Area. Fortunately they're opened until pretty late and they're always serving fresh slices of pizza. Cash only though!
author: MyTien P.

description: Very good pizza slices and they are open really late. Great place to go to especially after a night out with friends. The line however is very long at night so expect a long wait. I had a regular pepperoni pizza and I really liked it. The slices are in a square fashion and the crust is on the medium level of thickness. The slices was filled with awesome toppings and you could really taste the fresh ingredients. Overall I am very satisfied with their pizza and their service
author: John M.

description:
All I can say is "Wow".

Their was a line to get in. To some people that may be a bad thing but to me - it shows people want to be here and that's great. We ordered 3 slices in total - One sausage, pepperoni and the veggie pesto.

It reminded me so much of Sicilian pizza without the calamari on top. Deep in flavour and a delicious, crispy crust. 

The service was friendly and efficient too! You can't ask for much more really.
author: Jack D.

description:
First visit. High expectations.

Service 5/5
Clam & Garlic Pizza-3/5 not my cup of tea 
Pepperoni Pizza - 5/5 absolutely delicious 

Would return again.
author: Cari S.

description:
How many sober people have eaten pizza from Golden Boy? I dunno. More than you would think. I stopped by mid-afternoon and either there are a lot of day drunks around, or the reputation that this has of just being a late night after-bar stop is highly exaggerated. The lady in front of me was picking up a sheet for the office, the two girls behind me looked to be on and food photography quest, and I just wanted to finally try the place that has been eluding me every time I'm in the neighborhood.

Finally, after many trips to this part of town I did slide in and grab a slice... er.. square. I was wandering the streets up here, as I tend to do when I'm visiting. I had all afternoon before needing to head to work meetings, and I was food touristing the city a little. You just head to your set destination and then follow your heart/Yelp app. My heart took me to truffle town and the app to pizza (and also a bakery, and also homemade pasta, and also gelato... wouldn't you have loved to come along on that adventure?) and the whole afternoon was *almost* perfect.

The clam pizza seemed like the right answer, and I honestly dunno how much it costs per slice because it was a cash situation and I handed the guy a fiver and felt like that was just fine. They throw them in the smallest of ovens, blaze up the heat, and then pop it into the checkered paper. He offered to wrap it up for me as I was eating and walking, but you can stay and occupy one of the cramped seats in the narrow entry or back area if you want.

Now, I won't deny that this is probably a 17 star joint when you're coming out of one of the neighboring watering holes. You're going to soak up the fizzies with the cheese and crust. Every town -- shoot, every neighborhood -- they need a late night divey pie stop. So if you think of it in that context, you will set your expectations correctly.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Came in recently to see if max or Julian wanted to talk again sadly no. I love how they bribe customers with a free soda to boost their yelp rating to hide true comments on how soggy the pizza is at golden boys or how the veggies on the combo are stale.
author: yoo s.

description: Great pizza place with a huge selection of Sicilian slices!! I was lucky to have arrived at 11:30am as I was leaving a huge line was forming! Later that day around 10pm my fiancé and I just finished dinner at sodini we saw this huge line nothing like what I saw earlier. We wondered what could it be? It was the Golden Boy Pizza! People love this place! Very long line! I'm not sure if I would've waited on it lol. If there's no line definitely give this place a shot! lol also cash only which urrggh I hate! It's not that big inside. No tables just bar stools. I would have to say perhaps around 15 or so. Very small place.
author: Cary R.

description:
Dude, my boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place for forever and we're super glad to have finally done so. Line was fairly long even at an odd time (2pm, post lunch rush) so that was a good sign. The male cashier was totally hauling ass though while being super friendly, shout out to him

You wait in line, order your pizzas, and if you dine in there's a limited amount of seating inside. It's like a hallway. If you do to-go, you wait outside the window and get your slice handed to you once it's done heating up. Overall it's a simple place, and doesn't break the bank

I opted for their highly rated clam & garlic pizza, and while it was good objectively, it wasn't really for me. It was more a suuuuper garlicky pizza with a liiiiittle bit of clam. If you like that, then maybe that's for you. My boyfriend also thought his combo was just okay. We definitely would just stick to pepperoni next time, still a pretty good deal at ~$4 a slice
author: Nicolette E.

description:
Flaky delicate crust and really luscious pizza. Perfect taste.
We had: combo (best), clam and garlic (good).
I'm from Nyc and have had a lot lot lot of pizza and this was great. Not like a slice of Nyc thin, not as heavy as a Chicago pie. A must for a visit to sf for a "best-of" SF eating through the city trip. Cash only but atm inside.
author: D R.

description: The raving reviews and line out the door were enough indication to me that this is a super popular place. The staff was very friendly and the pizza is well-sized and tasty. I really liked the pepperoni and also decided to give the garlic clam a whirl - needless to say it was very garlic and very clam (a good thing, I just preferred the pepperoni). Having been to NYC, I honestly think the pizza there is slightly better, but as far as SF goes, this is one of the top spots!
author: Philippe D.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is a very solid pay by the slice deep style-ish pizzeria in Little Italy.  On Friday and Saturday nights, it's drunk central and the lines are out the door so I recommend going on a non peak time.

The pizza are square and thick and they heat them up for you on the oven after you select what slices you want.  I recommend the clam pizza - it's pretty good.  Ambiance of the place is pretty nice as well.  Probably one of my favorite pizza places in the city.
author: Mark C.

description:
I tend to eat things in waves, and the recent wave has been one of pizza. After having a ton of chewy crust pizzas in the past several weeks, it was time for some crunchy crust pizza.

I had a chance to check out their pepperoni, clam garlic, veggie pesto, and combo "za"s. If you ever meet me, ask me about how I once lost in a Scrabble game to someone who used "za" on a triple word and triple letter score, and I will probably still be bitter about it. Anyway, I digress....

They heated the pizza back up before we ate it and it was super melty, with strings of cheese every which way. The clam garlic stood out the most to me-- I could smell the clam on it when opening my mouth to take a bite 3.75/5. The parsley flakes covering it were a nice touch, and the ingredients were stacked thickly. The veggie pesto had a light pesto taste (this is always a complaint though, I like to layer on that stuff) and the cheese was also piled on. Combo and pepperoni were the two that were just standard ok-- good, but I didn't find anything to love about it. The crust was crunchy underneath, but definitely more like a focaccia, as others have said.

Versus Goat Hill (another crunchy crust spot), this place was more down to earth / not bougie, but I liked the cheese over at Goat Hill more. The walls were lined with stickers past. 3.5/5 for me.
author: Nicole H.

description:
This place is a real hoot. Stickers all over the wall, tasty, buttery, crunchy pizza in both classic and unique flavors, and quick in-and-out service. We came here from a coworkers recommendation and we were very glad we did. Definitely trendy and renowned amongst locals and tourists alike.

We tried the pepperoni, oyster and garlic, and combo slices. It was the perfect lunch and great way to follow up a long day at Alcatraz.
author: Patrick B.

description:
For late night eats in the city, this is a decent choice. Affordable, fast and filling. It isn't gourmet, but are you really expecting that at midnight? The crust is thick with a nice crunch at the bottom. The clam pizza is very garlicky, which I loved. The combo is a safer choice if out on a date. 

Important info: Cash only. I saw vegetarian (cheese) pizza but not vegan. Also, if you see a line, don't worry. These guys know what they are doing and you won't be waiting for long.
author: Shoole S.

description:
This place never disappoints! The only downside is cash only but there's a BOFA less than a block on Columbus! 

The clam and garlic pizza is worth the try and if you honestly don't like it then there might honestly be something wrong with you! The pesto veggie has to be my 2nd favorite pizza there. 

The photo is a pic of the clam garlic w tons of Parmesan and crushed pepper. Enjoy!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
I usually don't like thicker pizzas, but this place is a must try! 

Pro tip: This place is cash only! 

I absolutely loved their clam and garlic pizza. It was just about $5 bucks for a huge square of carbby goodness! There was a lot of basil and tons of garlic that will leave you with a strong garlic breath, but it'll be worth it.
author: Judy L.

description: We stumbled upon this place as we were hungry and we saw a huge line. So it had to be worth it, right? Totally was! At first we just bought 2 slices and were like "omg this is so good". So we waited back in line to get the giant boxed pizza! This place is a pizza treat, a must stop. It's always busy and is so good. I love that the pizza is cut into squares well more like rectangles and the box is so big and rectangle that that you actually get more pizza unlike round pizza in a square box like typical pizza joints.
author: Nicolette C.

description:
Golden boy pizza is good. Maybe it is pretty good. 

Unfortunately it is definitely not "omfg this pizza is so good that I'm going to stand in line in the rain and then write a 1000 word essay on Yelp so I can maintain my elite status next year" good. 

If you are fascinated by square pizza slices and are convinced that the shape will make it taste 10x better than other amazing pizza places in SF (that take reservations), you may want to try out the Treehouse at Stanford. They have equally good, square shaped pizza slices, minus the unnecessary line, or verbose yelp reviews that don't really say anything about the quality of food.
author: Karanveer M.

description:
What do I say about this place that hasn't already been said? Golden Boy Pizza does only 6 types of pizzas and boy do they do it well. 

We ordered 3 slices along with a soda between 2 people and had a tough time finishing our food. The cheese slice was standard and as good as they come but it was the Clam Garlic and the Veggie Pesto slices that won my heart. 

If you're in the city and craving pizza, look no further than Golden Boy pizza! 

PS - Makes sure to carry cash since its cash only.
author: Gaurav K.

description:
OMG! This place is SO worth the wait. My friend took us out to Chinatown for a night out because she wanted us to try GOLDEN BOY PIZZA after. WOW!! Amazing!!!

Despite the line, everything was so worth it! Guy at the front was friendly. We ordered the Garlic+Clam pizza and the cheese pizza. The garlic and clams was a very interesting option, but really enjoyed it.

Cash only!
author: Angela V.

description: So incredibly delicious. I got the combination meat and clam garlic, would recommend both! Would definitely come back for more.
author: Rene C.

description:
One of the greatest food recommendations. All signs pointed to a good pizza place... cash only, long line, and boxes of pizza being carried out. This is definitely a to go place, there is a bar to sit at, but I'd say plan on taking your pizza to go. 

The pizza was so good, and had a nice crispy crust (crispy cheese). The pizza is a bit deeper but not deep dish. It really was great and worth the little wait in line.
author: Talise D.

description:
Food: 5/5 Very large and thick slices (squares). 

Combo -- scrumptious onion, bell pepper, pepperoni, and sausage on top of cheese and thick crust

Garlic Clam -- combination of garlic and clam yields an interesting, strange taste

Pepperoni -- friend said it was delicious

Ambience: 4.5/5 Place is popular so a bit crowded with long lines and narrow seating along bar stools next to the wall. Fascinating combination of graffiti and stickers from all over plaster all the walls, including the bathrooms.

Service: 4.5/5 Friendly staff behind the counter to take your order. One person took our order and then another took over, putting freshly heated pizza slices into a nice box for us. The second person got a bit confused with our order first, but promptly corrected it.

Value: 4.7/5 Definitely a cool experience for pizza in Little Italy! Not suitable for low-carb diets.
author: Haoyu Y.

description: I'm glad this place isn't in San Diego because I would eat here every day and weigh a million pounds. Consistent, delicious, perfect pizza. And open at all the times when you typically crave pizza. It's outstanding!
author: Sarah W.

description: I have the garlic clam pizza and it was good . I ate it 2 hours later and it was still good . Good choice and good food
author: Isabelle L.

description: Rock music, some beer selections and pizza with lots of bread. Good for those who prefer Chicago style deep dish but perhaps not for those who prefer thin crust.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
it's embarrassing to admit that i waited on line for 30+ minutes to experience a golden boy slice. I only did it because:

- the place has nearly 3000 glowing yelp reviews
- i figured that if others are waiting on a line for something, there must be something to it
- after standing on line for 5 minutes, i felt committed
- i couldn't really think of another place to go for a slice at 10pm
- they make their pizza on focaccia
- the lady ahead of me in line was literally raving about their pesto garlic clam slice

so i got the pesto garlic clam slice. it was pretty stinking good and totally loaded with toppings. Would i wait again? probably not. but i'd totally hit up golden boy during off peak hours for more pizza if in the area again
author: Steph G.

description: This is the spot for pizza. I must say it's probably the most popular pizza spot in San Fran. Loved the pizza. Very light and tasty. Can't wait to come back and try it again!
author: Avi K.

description:
Every single time I eat here, I always burn the roof of my mouth! Each and every time I eat here, I know that the previous five times I burnt the roof of my mouth and yet I still burnt the roof of my mouth, today.  The reason why am telling you the story is to let you know how fresh their pizzas are. It was very hot and fresh every time I've been there.

A lot of people compare their pizza to Chicago deep dish but that's not quite accurate in my opinion. Every time I eat here, it reminds me Of cafeteria pizza from my elementary school, except it's 10 times better. I was actually eating here today and after I took a couple of bites, I started thinking about all of my elementary school friends because the taste brought back old memories. Anyways!

People swear by the garlic clam pizza. I think it's pretty good but I don't quite honestly see what all the hype is all about. Their combo slice is just whatever's.  The combo pizza is probably my least favorite. The pepperoni pizza is really good and their sausage pizza is also really good. I love cheese pizzas so their cheese pizza is also very good and I have never tried their vegetarian pizza and I don't know if I ever will.

P.S. $5 pints!  They have like 20 tap beers.
author: Jang N.

description: Came from out of town & went out for a night of dancing. We worked up an appetite & so glad we ran into this pizza place! We luckily beat the line & picked which pizza we wanted! We had pepperoni & cheese so delicious and everyone was so so nice! Highly recommend this pizza parlor!!
author: Alisa R.

description:
You know how you always see a line out the door of some establishment and you just got to peak to see what it's all about.  I'm sure we've all seen it at Golden Boy and have hear from everyone about the pizza.  Finally I decided to go with the crowds and wait for this pizza on a random hour where there was less of a line.   

My friend and I were disappointed.  Maybe it was hyped up too much for us.  The flavor was pretty bland and the ingredients weren't that fresh.  It was hard to eat the pizza since it wasn't that crunchy but more soft and soggy. 

The famous clam pizza was interesting but I think something was off. I think it could have been real good if made differently.  It was just ok.   Maybe the veggie might be better?
