Maybe it's one of those late night spots that taste real good after you've been out and really fills you because its so hearty with dough.
author: Michelle T.

description:
This pizza joint has a special place in my heart. There has been a line every time I've gone, but always worth it. Can't deny the buttery, crisp crust and cheesy goodness. 

Cash only!! And if needed, there is an ATM machine down the street inside this bar. There is an outdoor sign, so you won't miss it.
author: Nani V.

description: Man these dudes know what they are doing. No gimmicks. No frills. Just cheap, thick, good pizza. Got two slices of sausage at 3.75 a pop and let me tell ya, I should have gotten one but cleaned off both. Please tho, you may think you need two slices but just get one. Go with a friend, try a bite of theirs. My husband got the clams and garlic which is also just simply delicious. Whole restaurant has a rough and ready feel, stickers all over the wall. We had fun pointing out funny ones. The guys working all seemed like generally nice people. Great experience. Thought seating would be a problem but shouldn't be too long of a wait for things to open up. Just don't try to go there with more than 2 people, even 3 would be pushing it.
author: Daisy K.

description:
First and foremost this pizza was delicious!

This pizza was also fairly priced, $4.25 for a crunchy, cheesy slice.

It would've received 5 stars if the guy serving didn't seem so stress/moody.

I didn't feel welcome, we told him we travel to sf just to try it and he just was dry, didn't seem like talking.

We were going to get more, but because of his service we decided to go else where.

I'm not complaining, all I'm saying is that in my opinion this business would do way better with a friendly person providing service.
author: Tanya C.

description: Very good pizza! Most people do takeouts but I was so hungry I decided to eat there - nothing beats fresh pizza. Loved the vibe, very young and hip and friendly. You get to see them slicing gigantic square pizzas up and serve to you. I got the combo since it's a pretty big square piece and I didn't think I was going to be able to eat that much of one single flavor. The combo was divided into 4 tiny squares of different flavors. It was so fun to eat! Each flavor was great but I think my favorite was the sausage.
author: Iris H.

description:
The garlic clam pizza is absolutely amazing.

Didn't think golden boy could live up to the hype but it definitely did! The line goes by sorta quickly during the late night hours but this place is sure worth the wait! Safe to say I was sober and still thought this place was worth a try! 

Each slice is $4.25 and one can mix and choose different slices to go into their box. The garlic clam is one of their most well known and is super duper garlicky YUM. The Italian sausage and pepperoni was also a second favorite. 

Make sure you check your exact change cause the guy at the window forgot to give me back an extra $10!!! But I wasn't flipping out that much since it honesty looked like it was a mistake cause he was so busy. Still, doesn't hurt to check your change especially if you aren't 100% sober :p
author: Kenneth L.

description:
Short story: great pizza, nearly no seating, amazing characters.

Longer story: Some things survive, against all odds, some things survive and even thrive due to their hardships. Golden Boy is like that- a dump of a pizza place in one of the most competitive dining areas in the West Coast, especially for Italian food. So with nearly no seating, an often crusty staff with a sharp attitude, and a fairly dirty and seedy atmosphere, what keeps the line out the door every night? Exactly those traits, coupled with amazing pizza. The pesto is powerful, rich with basil and balanced with generous mozzarella. The meat pizza is a heart condition in edible form, and worth it. But my favorite, as a Norwegian, is the clam. Salty, rich, the kind of pie that you and your friends will remember for hours as the taste lingers on your palate and on your breathe.

Don't bother to come if you're looking for clean, or nice, or fancy. This is serious pizza, and it's a slice of SanFrancisco.
author: James N.

description: Honestly the best pizza experience I've ever had in my life. Recently visited golden boy with my brother and was blown away by both the quality of the pizza and the overall experience as a customer. I will 100% be back and highly recommend this place to anyone looking for and excellent slice of pizza in the city!
author: Anthony A.

description: Not a bad little joint. Stopped off here on a recommendation from a friend who lives in the City. I was told that around 6pm the line starts to form and goes around the block, so I took some initiative and went around 3pm. There was no wait and most of the seating was open - I walked by later in the evening around 8pm and there was definitely a long line outside. I got two slices: one cheese, and one sausage. They are heated up in the oven and brought out to you - you can also get the slices to go. All of the seating are stools and the bar doesn't have much depth to it: I found myself turning sideways to feel comfortable enough to eat. The slices were really good (but I am partial to Sicilian pizza) and I was impressed with the quality. Nice crunchy bottom, thick but not dense, and just the right amount of cheese. I was watching the guys make and spread the dough - they use special square pans that help to create that golden buttery crunch - spread the sauce - both green and red - and toss on the cheese. I would recommended this place to anyone and the only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because they only accept cash.
author: John C.

description:
Grabbed a slice of garlic and clam pizza recently and while it was tasty I wasn't blown away like I was expecting to be . 

Was it good? Yup
Was it cheap? Yup especially by Sf standards
Was it worth returning to ? Yes and no , I think kids would love this spot obviously since every kid loves pizza. 

Service was great the guy serving up the pizza and packaging it was efficient and patient with newbies ahead of me and people who had kids in tow.

A little bit disappointed but still a solid venue .
author: Rod M.

description:
Delicious!!!waiting in line is totally worth it!!
You won't regret it!!and loved the service the decor is so cool!!
author: Gladys G.

description: You know this place is bomb if it's cash only and there's a line out the door! Make sure you have cash!there an atm inside in the back if you don't. We got both pepperoni and the clam pizza. I wasn't a big fan of the clam pizza but the pepperoni... omg melts in your mouth. Even tho it was busy and there was a line, the service was awesome too. The gentlemen that served us was funny, made conversation with everyone and had a smile on the whole time. Loved this late night snack joint.
author: Becky S.

description: Well, I think the monopoly rules work at this spot. Since this is the late night spot , they don't care about the customer service at all. Rude workers and just an ok pizza. It is not worth it to wait for 25 minutes for a slice of an ok pizza ... this place is totally overrated... don't forget to have "cash only"...
author: George B.

description:
WOW!  I'm definitely a tremendous Pizza snob being born n raised in NYC and having owned my own Pizzeria in the past.  This place knows what they are doing when it comes to pizza and overall ambiance!  Very simple, nothing fancy here.  You walk in, pick from the selection of Sicilian slices available in the window, pick your drink, once you're called, sit back, enjoy an incredible slice of pizza and some people watching!  We walked up in the middle of the day and thankfully the line was not that long.  My wife and I got a seat at the bar and ordered a couple of slices, I ordered a nice cold beer.  The experience was great, I love the system and overall vibe they have in place.  The line moves very quick as they are very organized about moving people along.  I personally think it's a must visit while in SF.  I've sent a few people already and they feel the same way now!!

Keep doing your thing Golden Boy, it's greatly appreciated!
author: Jeff G.

description:
Stumbled on this place by default. Thank god for the Uber driver. We were initially going to a seafood restaurant in the area to meet up with coworkers, but plans got changed. The Uber driver suggested this pizza place and boy oh boy he wasn't kidding. 

Quick note to add is they only except cash. They offer pan style nicely sized pizza with options of a few different toppings. I decided to get the pesto/vegetarian slice which was absolutely delicious!!! The crust was baked to perfection m. Edges were perfectly crisp, but not hard and the dough excellent. The was simple but the pizza was superb. I just love when you stumble on a great spot.Definitely would be back!
author: Gerard T.

description:
Probably THHHHEEEE BEST I have never had. It was cheap and so good. When I went the line was pretty long but they were super fast. Cash only which sucks but whatever. I got that combination and then the clam and garlic. I like the clam garlic the best. Its a must get.

If you are ever in the city are from the city def check this place out. You won't regret it!

FYI cash only tho.
author: Christina T.

description:
Looking for a good square of pizza at an affordable price in the city of San Francisco? Then Golden Boy Pizza is the place for you. They been serving their signature square slices on Green Street in San Francisco's North Beach for forty years! I finally got the chance to experience this well-known landmark on a late Wednesday evening after a group movie outing at the Metreon and although the food didn't disappoint, the service and the fact that they still, after all these years, only take cash made my first time less enjoyable. 

I came with a trio of friends after walking around the North Beach neighborhood to see what we wanted to try out. Despite it being late on a Tuesday evening there were many options to choose from, but we were surprised that the only fast casual option in the area was in fact Golden Boy Pizza. It's in and out at Golden Boy as the lines stretch out to the front of the store mainly because the order counter and cash register is right in front right next to the front door. Talk about bad feng shui or good business as it seems they are always busy, which technically they are not, as you can get through their line in speedy order.

This time around my friend was smart and decided she wanted to try one of each they had displayed. So it was Cheese ($3.25), Pepperoni ($3.75),  Sausage ($3.75), Combo ($4.25), Pesto Veggie ($4.25), and Clam & Garlic ($4.25). All told the total bill was 24 dollars for six square box, which in hindsight is not a bad deal considering the size of the squares. Unfortunately our fun only-in San Francisco experience was ruined by the fact that our server was really brusque in attitude and made our make a decision on what we were going to order much faster than we would have liked. But nonetheless we ordered away and the slices in the window are already pre-cooked, once you make your decision, they heat it up in their re-heating contraption right next to the front counter area. Although my friend wanted to bring most to her slices home to her famished family, she nice enough to be willing to share in one of her slices so I could get a sample of what to order in the future. We split the Pesto Veggie slice, and although it was warm to the touch, it was also rather a greasy piece of pie. A full five napkin adventure for even half a slice.

Golden Boy Pizza has been serving focaccia style pizza since 1978 so to be in business at the same location for forty years, they deserve our respect and praise for sticking it out after all these years in a competitive environment. The pizza could be a smidge better, but it you're looking for an affordable option in what is normally a highly trafficked tourist location, they you could do much worse. I still plan on returning one evening in the future especially when I have those hunger pains late at night.
author: Jason F.

description:
If you want fresh, crispy pizza with amazing dough & fresh ingredients--look no further! Golden Boy Pizza is my go-to place for normal or late-night pizza cravings, & it has never failed to satisfy my craving (which unfortunately comes way more often than I would like). I usually get the combination pizza slice because veggies on my pizza is a must. I've tried the clam one, too, & it's not bad! I typically don't go for clams on my pizza, but Golden Boy's does pizza so well.

Watch out for the intoxicated crowds at night! My warning is more about the line that forms, not because anyone is unfriendly. If you're intoxicated & found your way to Golden Boy's then you must have a really good sense of direction & even better taste in food.
author: Carol N.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: parking in the area is hard to find. 10-15 minute wait to buy a slice to go.

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: fast food service. Wait in line to order and receive a slice. Very cramped. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: the garlic and clam pizza was good. Tasted like the ocean. Hot fresh square slices.

_____

Overall Experience

2/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

A small hole in the wall place.
author: Elliott N.

description:
Pretty good.
Recently came here with my boyfriend after coming here with my mom previously before. In my previous and last time I came here, the line wasn't too bad and it went by pretty quickly. We both ordered a combo pizza and ate at the little side tables they had. 
The combo pizza came with sausages, mushrooms, onions, and bell peppers. The pizza slice itself was a square shaped and i think it's pretty worth the price ( ~$4). For me, when eating pizzas, I would tend to see if there are any burnt crusts/ashes on the bottom of the pizza and if there isn't then I have a pretty good indication that it's pretty good. Their crust didn't have any of those burnt ashes/ blackness on the bottom of their pizza and also I liked how it wasn't too oily like many pizzas are. 
I also appreciate that the table has extra chili peppers and other seasonings to put on the pizza because I am a spicy kind of girl. 
Overall, the pizza slices are worth its price because I was pretty full after one slice and the wait time isn't that bad either. 
Would recommend coming here.
author: Kochamon S.

description:
Very nice..

If you're looking for a hearty slice of pizza, close to deep dish "Chicago style" pizza This is a place you may want to try..

Just be prepared to stand in line because this place is small and usually packed..

Just like many of the reviews before me..
The "clam garlic pizza" is a must try, very unique, tasty and full of flavor..
author: Head Chef F.

description:
"I really don't like when things are all polished and perfect - the perfect love story and the hair is perfect." - Marisa Tomei

Ciao Marisa! Yup, pretty much 2,500+ reviews and a 5-stars rating says a lot about this place! It's everything a 5-stars rating should be, not boringly perfect by any means, but before I get carried away and your mind goes drifting off to shirtless golden boys dancing to relax don't do it... hey, this is a legit pizza place in North Beach, aka Little Italy! To me, and obviously many others, it's a 5-stars rating because:

The Golden Boy vibe: It's old school to the core. I mean it's been on the corner of Green street since the disco days of 1978. That greasy spoon vibe, 40-years of layers of stickers on the walls, the decor that screams "original" is what's it all about. Expect old stools, dim lighting, and loud music! 

The Golden Boy value: I mean you could buy other things here, but it's all about the pizza, yo! The mouth watering pizza! By the slice, or by the pie, you won't stop at only one. The best part is for $5 or less you can get a killer slice of the tastiest pizza your tongue has ever touched. It's hella tasty and damn it's guido cheap too! I highly suggest at least two slices to compare, y'know what I mean, son? 

The Golden Boy Taste: Tell me your best pizza spot on the planet and then try a Golden Boy slice. Go ahead compare it! I do know not everyone sees pizza the same way, some take the gourmet route, some will take the freezer burn route, but if you want a legit pizza with goo and dripping everywhere, taste buds savoring every old school bite... you'll be in love. Not with little Danny, or big Tony, but you'll love your slice, home slice! 

Lastly, there's some unsaid "Golden Boy house rules" that are legendary to those in the area, but in all honesty it's mostly urban legend. No silly, no big ass Tony will bounce you from the place if you look at his baby sister the wrong way... we've come a long way since the guido stereotype days. Just know this... Golden Boy is CASH only, it's straight forward ordering (pointing works too), and it's no fancy restaurant, so don't expect fancy or special treatment and you'll love it! Expect a little and get a lot in return is my motto. Any slice is a good slice at Golden Boy, but if the garlic clams is available grab a slice! The everything combo is killer too! Oh my! 

It's 5-stars rating is not because it's perfect, but it's perfectly imperfect with hair just perfect enough...
author: Eric R.

description:
The boyfriend is a big pizza fan so we came here finally to see if all the hype was worth it. We've been to Tony's in North Beach, but we're excited to find a simpler pizza joint where we could quickly get a slice or two.

I got the veggie slice and my bf got the clam + garlic - both were so good! The crust is just the right amount of dough-y, and I appreciated that they didn't skimp on the veggies! 

We went around 3 pm on a Saturday but there was still a small line (15 min). I've heard it can get much longer at peak times, so plan accordingly! Btw it's a small space, so I don't recommend eating there (take it to the park nearby!)
author: Nishita, S.

description:
Completely worth it! Worth waiting in the line out the door on a chilly SF night and so deserving of the praise. 

Heard about Golden Boy from a list of 'must eats' in the city. I was skeptical at first because it didn't seem like anything special. I'll admit it, I was wrong! 

GB pizza is no frills, located on Green street just a block off of North Beach (aka SF's Little Italy) thoroughfare Columbus Ave. Easy to find with it's kitschy neon sign pointing to the door. You may have to search a bit for street parking depending on what time you go. This is a popular spot so anticipate crowds during peak times. Don't worry the line moves quickly!

GBP whips up pan after pan of tasty pies. The scent of Italian herbs, marinara, cheese, and garlic wafts out their door and will get your mouth watering. This is a straightforward pizza place with a few varieties available by the slice (about $3-4 each). Most are standard- cheese, pepperoni, sausage, combo, and veggie. But a standout is their garlic and clam!!  Firstly their pizza is unlike any other I've tried, it's fairly rectangular slices, with a thick, plush dough and crust, the mozzarella is ooey-gooey wonderful (they'll pop your slice in the oven once you order so you get that molten cheese glory).  The clam & garlic was very, very garlicky (which I love) not at all "fishy". Highly recommend! The pesto on the veggie slice was ridiculously delicious and made for a rich, sumptuous slice. 

There's not a whole lot of seating available inside, bar style seating, kind of half to luck out with timing if they are busy to snag a stool, but they will deliver your order with real silverware! I recommend taking advantage of this as this pizza is thiccccck. At each seat they've got all you need - grated Parmesan, red pepper, garlic powder, black pepper, and seasoning.  If you need a drink to pair with your meal they have a good beer selection available by pint or pitcher. 

Not a fancy spot, it's cramped and loud, but it's delicious, filling, and satisfying pizzas are incredible. You have to try it for yourself!  Can't wait to grab another slice when I return to North Beach.
author: Megan A.

description:
When I visited earlier this year, it's more like the pizza visited my very being. It may have taken over a bit, lol. It was and is the best focaccia pizza I have had on the West coast so far, at the very least. Probably the best pizza overall too. There are some close seconds, with different styles, etc of course. Pizza is a very picky, moody and delicate situation. 

I would recommend the garlic slice. Wow. Then the pepperoni. The pesto one was not amazing, but I generally don't like pesto versions of pizza anyway, so thats my pickiness, not so much the place itself.
author: Brian P.

description:
Amazing Pizza! It's similar to a small pizza joint in New York with the amazing crust! So it brought back nostalgic memories of this Italian place I went to but forgot the name lol. Thank goodness I came midday where there was no line around the block! 

There was still a wait though. Their original cheese pizza is amazing. I'm not much of a seafood person, but my buddy absolutely loved it and devoured it in an instant. The pricing is decent and the place is too small to dine in. More of a grab and go type of place. But would I come back again? Most definitely. I have to come back and have their deep dish pizza when I find the time.

Only downer is that this place is cash only! 

Other than that, go!
author: Daw M.

description:
I was recommended to try Golden Boy Pizza by many people, and it did not disappoint. They have the normal pizza toppings- a combo pizza, veggie pizza, plain cheese, pepperoni, but they also have a garlic clam pizza. We ended up trying the combo and veggie which were both super delicious. The veggie pizza has pesto, so I would highly recommend! 

The pizza slice itself was huge and very filling. The edges were super crispy while the middle was nice a fluffy. Would definitely recommend getting a slice to go to eat at the park nearby!

(they also offer beers on tap)
author: Kelly C.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco no question.
DO NOT be afraid to try the clam and garlic. It is the perfect balance of both and is one of the most unique, and delicious, slices of pizza you will ever have.
author: Taylor B.

description:
Not a huge fan. I tried their garlic clam and their pepperoni.

For me, the pepperoni was far superior. The garlic clam had a) too much garlic and b) not enough clam. I'm pretty sure several pieces of garlic were much bigger than the pieces of clam. While the pepperoni was a lot better, I also expected a lot more from the rave reviews. The pepperoni itself didn't curl up at the edges, and while the slice was pretty decent, it just wasn't anything special. Maybe it's because I've had too many pepperoni squares in New York, but I honestly just expected more. 

The only thing I did really enjoy was the cheese. Super stringy, super melty, and overall delicious.
author: Hannah H.

description:
I was told this was the best pizza in SF. The style of pizza is definitely unique and it's in contention for the best! Square slices with a thick fluffy crust, super crispy bottom, and perfectly melted cheese. It's like a mix of NY style and bread sticks. Plus you need to try their clam and garlic pizza, very good flavor that I haven't found anywhere else. 

Service is ridiculously quick and efficient even if there's a line. Prices are decent too. Only thing I don't like is the interior is super dark with loud music and limited bar stool seating. But other than that this place is awesome and lives up to the hype!

Food: 4.75/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 4.25/5
Overall: 4.5/5
author: Brian G.

description: The line is worth the wait. I REPEAT, STAND IN THIS LINE AND YOU WONT REGRET IT!! The pizza slices are a nice size and I love that they're cut into square pieces. (Who doesn't love square pizza?) The slice is seasoned so well, we tried Pepperoni, combo and sausage. All were delicious! The line moved really quick, only downside is there can be slim pickings to choose from if you get there once all the good slices have been bought. Lucky for me, I made it in time! Good luck, and enjoy!
author: Krystal C.

description: Great pizza one or two slices is enough for one person. They have stickers all over the wall which is cool. Great staff and fast service. Would definitely one check this place out.
author: Nicole G.

description: Can't beat it- thick soft dough smothered with cheese. Not a place to eat in really - cold airway and bar stools - so pick it up and roll.
author: Denyse M.

description: Great place to grab a slice!  Good call to go to Colombus Cafe for 2 for 1 HH beers and a slice of Golden Boy pizza. There are other options in Notth Beach, but a Golden Boy And Colombus Cafe is a winner for the price.
author: Derald C.

description:
Down home pizzeria in the heart of Little Italy. They have good beer like Lagunitas IPA and wines which I haven't sampled. The counterman running the operation was amiable & personable handling taking orders, putting squares of pizza to warm, serving beer & wine, taking care of customers with a bright smile. 

The pizza base here is like foccacia bread: thick, bready, chewy. Great for carb lovers. However, for me, the toppings to bread ratio is unbalanced. Four small pieces of Salsiccia Italian on a large square of pizza bread with a whisper of Salsa Marinara & glazing of mozzarella was rather austere. 

Combination pizza is better since there are more toppings: zucchini, tomato, onions, button mushroom, pepperoni slice, Salsiccia Italiana. But it is still a bit too carb rich. 

The clam & garlic pizza is enriched with more mozzarella cheese, green onion, Italian parsley. There is a creamy Besciamella like garlic undertone. But again the heavy chewy bread textures predominate. 

The Golden Boy pizza may be manna for carboholics, but I find that even one square slice is overly filling. 3+ Yelp stars.
author: Gary I.

description:
DAMN YOU!
So good.
So effin good. 
Please for one square of combo??
One pint and one square??
Pleeeeeeeeeease?!!!!
author: Skevos L.

description:
So much hype and friends' posts on other social media outlets has gotten me very curious about this place. So I placed Golden Boy on my list and took a drive out there while on a trip into town. 

We went in the middle of an afternoon so there wasn't a line at all. Inside, the walls are covered with stickers, postcards, graffiti and random things customers stick to their walls. The restrooms are even more insanely decorated with more of the same. (not a good place for drunk people, you might get disoriented)

Only counter seats are available, on a tall stool w/o a back, so watch your little kids. The process is simple if you haven't been yet. Check out their options by the window, walk inside (or wait in line) place your order and pay. Hopefully you'll fins a seat and they'll call you when your pie is heated & ready. 

Like most of the people that come here, I got the clams & garlic and a combo. The c & g was a little light on taste. I had it at other places before and it was bursting with garlic flavor and had piles of clams. Golden Boy's lacked that burst of flavor and some bites lacked clams. I had to add basil and red pepper to liven things up. The combo was not terribly generous with the sausage. Both were good, but neither had me craving it when thinking back about my visit. 

Perhaps it was the heightened expectations from all the great reviews and never-ending lines, but my experience gets a 3 star. I'm not ruling this place out, but will not go out of my way to come here.
author: James L.

description:
My husband says 5/5 stars for great "San Francisco" pizza but still not as good as New York pizza.  Pfffft, who's he kidding?  

Love Golden Boy!!!  Definitely the best pizza I've had in the city and would at times go out of my way for it!  Their pizza squares are pretty thick and it's easy to get full off of one slice.  Not a lot of space for seating as it is first come first serve but their turn over is pretty quick.  Highly recommend!
author: Jann B.

description: The pizza was good. The line was out the door and people were friendly we discussed the flavors ultimately got a combo and pepperoni bother were great! I
author: Me S.

description: Golden Boy Pizza turns it up to 11! This place pumps out some loud rock music and also serves up some nice Sicilian 'za by the slice. I went with a classic cheese slice and a pepperoni slice. The pizza has that herbaceous crust that you expect in a Sicilian. The crust is fluffy with a crispy end. The cheese is good and well balanced. This place is cash only, and two slices will set you back $7. Golden Boy is a five-star pizza spot for its uniqueness and quality slices. There's not a ton of seating, and it can get a little warm in this cozy pizzeria. Be prepared to shed layers if you're eating inside. *They also have a decent beer selection too.
author: Sean W.

description:
Daaaaaamn. So impressed.

I don't like Sicilian pizza (NYC thin crust all day, baby) so I was just going along with my bf, who's a pizza freak. 

Lemme tell you - this pizza is the real deal. Their secret to awesomeness is focaccia bread. It's the perfect mix of airy and crispy and works so well as a pizza. I tried the clam and garlic - AWESOME! plus the plain cheese (also delicious). 

Couple things to know:
+ CASH ONLY! 
+ Take out or eat in. The eat in vibe is very divey with limited seating. Their bathroom was straight out of a dingy dive bar. I LOVED IT. 
+ Anticipate lines. There was a short line outside when we came. Don't fret. The main reason for the line is that you order as soon as you walk in so it's kind of normal that a line forms. It is also pretty popular. 
+ I only saw metered parking outside.
author: Maria E.

description: Always my go to spot for late night pizza. But dont go too late on weekdays or they'll sell out of certain pizzas or on weekends when the line get progressively longer as the night goes on. I love the clam and garlic, pesto, and supreme pizzas. You really cant go wrong with any pizza because their crust and tomato sauce are delicious. Even their plain cheese pizza is worth lining up for.
author: Al W.

description: This place was outstanding!!! There was a bit of a line when we arrived but it was well worth the wait. The pizza was fresh and delicious!! There is an instant crisp, crunchiness to their crust coupled with soft, pillowy interior. I ordered the combination, the clam, and the veggie pesto. They were all delicious but the veggie pesto is hands down my favorite!!! It has great flavor and it wasn't too heavy. A great find in Little Italy !! Very limited seating so be prepared to eat fast and leave or take your slices to the park around the corner.
author: Ricardo C.

description: LITERALLY SOME OF THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! You MUST MUST MUST try the clam and garlic pizza. Forget calories and do yourself a favor and order 2 pieces! The entire kitchen was so helpful and nice. The vibes of the restaurant was awesome and had a 90's grunge feel to it with great music. It is a little small inside but honestly the pizza was well worth it. I cant wait to come back to SF to eat at the gem of a pizzeria again!! Hey Golden Boy!! Bring this to LA, we need REAL pizza!!!
author: Arica R.

description:
The pizza is good but the best in SF? I'm not sure. I guess it would depend on what style pizza you are going for. 

If you like a thicker focaccia style dough this is a delicious slice. Pro tip - get the corner slices. 

The combo was my favorite. Flavorful meat and veggies. 

If you are not big into seafood skip the clam and garlic. I myself like seafood but I did not like the overpowering clam taste. It was too strong in my opinion. And pepperoni was just ok.
author: Amanda H.

description: Delicious square pizza, big slices for $3.75, awesome interior, service was great and nice to see availability of chilli to put on top of the pizza! I got a cheese slice and pepperoni slice and both were sublime. There was a line (went on a Tuesday at 6pm) but the wait was only about 15 mins; you ordered then sat down as they brought the pizza out to you. Definitely will be back!
author: Nadya C.

description: This place was crowded as hell when I went in but it was worth the wait.  The slices were humongous. Everything was fresh and the cheese!!
author: Jin K.

description:
When I think about what a great pizza tastes like, I think of Golden Boy's pizza. To be specific, their clam and garlic pizza is among the best I've ever had, and it's great that its available as single slices instead of having to buy a whole pizza for it. The clam and garlic is my go-to pizza whenever I come here and I usually get two slices. Nothing better than two warm slices of garlicky goodness during a cold evening. They have other types of pizza, but the clam and garlic pizza is what they're famous for.

The clam and garlic pizza are plentiful in chopped clams and garlic, and it's pretty cheesy. It's peppered with herbs on top and the crust is crunchy, and I would recommend trying to get one of the side slices for the crust. What enhances the flavor is some little chili flakes on top, gives it that nice spicy kick. 

The only con that I could think of is that its cash only, which isn't that big of a deal. Usually, I would see some kind of short line outside, most likely waiting for the clam & garlic pizza so that might be a slight con. Golden Boy Pizza is basically a hole in the wall bar that serves excellent pizza, and in my opinion, hands-down one of the best pizza places in SF. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great pizza and a place to chill.
author: Nelson X.

description:
If you haven't been to Golden Boy, you need to go.  Like my fellow Yelper, Ann S., said in her review, there are windows that you can look through where the pizzas are displayed for you to look at and choose which one(s) you want.

Facts:

* Seating in here is pretty limited and, seeing as they're open super late, I wouldn't be surprised if there's nowhere left to sit on a late night.

* Don't expect to come here and order a personalized pizza or to have a menu with a million different kinds from which to choose.  There are only five or six kinds of pizza on their menu.

* You can either order by the slice or by the sheet.  If you order by the slice, they'll warm your pizza up in the oven before they give it to you.

I ordered a garlic and clam slice and a cheese slice to-go.  The garlic and clam, from what I understand, is their signature pizza.  It was AMAZING.  There was a lot of garlic yet it was not overwhelming and it was straight-up delicious.  Also, it wasn't dripping with grease as I initially thought it would be.  The cheese slice was damn good too.  

Don't be surprised if there's a line out the door when you go.  This place is popular and for good reason.  My advice if you're going for lunch: get there around 11:30-11:40 as there isn't too much of a line around then.

Minus one star because they gave me my to-go order in a paper bag and with each slice wrapped in paper.  This caused some of the cheese to get stuck to the paper and come off when I unwrapped it.  They do have have boxes from what I saw so I'm not sure why they couldn't box mine.

If you're a pizza lover and in San Francisco, come through.  You won't regret it.

4 stars
author: Michael F.

description:
We walked by this place when we were going to the restaurant next door but the AMAZING smell caught our attention.. we promised ourselves that we would come back at the end of the night for a 2nd dinner :D 

so glad we did! the pizza was amazing, I tried their famous clam and garlic and it was very good! I really liked the thin crunchy crust and it was reheated but honestly tasted like it was fresh out of the oven! the place is a bit small and cramped so keep that in mind if you plan on eating there.

cash only as well! which I usually hate but man so worth it here!
author: Jon T.

description: Unfortunately I felt extremely underwhelmed by the pizza here. I was in the mood for pizza (when is one not in the mood for pizza actually) and I found this place on yelp and decided it was worth standing in the 15 minute line outside of the door on a late weekday night. If there's a line it must be good right? So I decided on the garlic pizza and though service was polite and efficient my pizza had the consistency of toasted French bread that was simply layered with tons of garlic and mozzarella. My pizza tasted like cheap garlic bread, and I was sad. Underwhelmed and sad.
author: Skipper M.

description:
My first time going here! We got a slice of the Clam and Garlic pizza and the Pesto Veggie.

If anyone decides to go here, 10/10 would recommend those slices. They're pretty decent sized for the price!

SO SO good! 

Tip: CASH ONLY!
Also, if you don't finish your pizza and you ask for a box, it's 50 cents... 50 cents for a box y'all like really?

So finish your pizza or else you'll have to wrap your pizza and carry greasy parchment paper around.
author: Christy N.

description: This was a delicious, thick pizza, similar to Chicago style but not as deep dish. They keep it toasted for a long time so comes out piping hot and the crust is toasted well! Absolutely delicious, expect long lines and not much seating inside but worth their wait if you like thick pizzas!
author: Amita S.

description: Love it! Worth the wait wish I would've ordered a whole sheet of pizza. It's worth the drive as well. I am craving it now.
author: A M.

description:
best pizza in the city.  whether you're looking for a full sheet or just a slice...  this is the place.  love the combo and garlic clam.  love can be pretty long, but it's well worth the wait.  my new favorite pizza joint!

the guy up front is legit.  i forgot his name, but really welcoming and picked it the largest slices.  tip the man.

bring cash... unless you feel like using their atm.
author: Roger K.

description:
One of the best pizza joints in the city! I love the pizza here and the employees are super cool, easy going and attentive. 

They can get busy with a line out the door but they're good at tending to it and minimizing it quickly. 

I got the pepperoni slice and sausage slice. Both really amazing with yummy sauce and thick buttery crust. 

The only downside is some folks treat the space like a bar versus a pizza joint and that can be annoying but it's not GBP fault. 

Overall I love the pizza and can't believe I'm just now eating here - Give this place a try!
author: Mone J.

description:
Clam pizza. Hands down, probably some of the best cheap, unique eats you can catch in SF, the city that sleeps early, after a late night of drinks and dancing.

Seriously though, the clam pizza is pretty good. All of the pizza is baked fresh, hot and perfect for a cold night out in the city. The only downside is that there is sometimes a line, but it usually goes pretty quickly 15-20min tops!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
I came Tuesday afternoon and there was no line! Which was perfect because I just wanted a quick snack. I had the clam and garlic and it was so flavorful! They do not skimp on the clams and garlic. It was cheesy and savory. The crust was not doughy but had a bite. And the bottom of the crust was crunchy. 

The staff were also friendly, so I had a positive experience here!
author: Joyce S.

description: Best pizza I've ever had. The bread and crust were perfectly crunchy, and the cheese and flavors were out of this world. Honestly better than most pizza joints in NY!
author: Andy H.

description: Still the best by the slice in The City.  Perfect every time.  There is always rock music playing, and sports on the tube.  Perfection.
author: Evan M.

description:
Tasty spot for pizza! Served in square slices! More of a place to come at the end of your night and not for dinner as there are only high stools to sit at inside.

Definitely the tastiest pizza I had in San Fran!!! Expect a q out the door which moves fast.
author: Shane R.

description: The dough literally melts in your mouth. The veggie pesto was incredible. The garlic crab was great but pretty strong after taste
author: Sarah R.

description:
You honestly can't go wrong exploring and eating pizza in the North Beach area and this place is no exception. Expect lines to go out the door since the place is pretty small, but it does go quickly. 

I enjoy that this place is dive bar-esque with its own vibe and tons of stickers lining the walls. The seating here is more stools lined up against the back wall and near the entrance so not really a sit down type of place. But it's a great place to enjoy a slice by yourself! 

***CASH ONLY***

FAVES: veggie, combo, and clam & garlic 

I originally was going to come and order 2 slices just for me, but once I saw the portions I only ended up getting one and it was perfect just for me. Slices vary between $3.25-$4.25. 

I enjoy that the pizza here has a nice thick crust and crunch when you bite into it. They have the right amount of toppings and cheese without it being overwhelming.

The clam is a fave but it was definitely more garlic than clam. Don't get me wrong it was tasty, but I was expecting to have even portions of both ingredients. Some might get turned off by all the herbs on top but it added to its flavor for sure. 

If you're area definitely stop by to grab a slice, a spot by the register, and have a great conversation with the workers!
author: Keizzel C.

description:
I will say three things about this pizza, in the hopes that you will visit and enjoy what I enjoyed. 

1. I'm not sure if Golden Boy classifies themselves as a Sicilian pizza joint, but this was the best Sicilian pizza I've ever had. The problem with Sicilian pizza is that it can be unpleasantly doughy if not done right. Golden Boy is very different. The pizza is a little thinner, and has a crispy and buttery underbelly that is absolute worth the calories. 

2. The establishment itself is very charming. There is a pickup window for to-go orders and some stools for eaters in. Very low key and cash only.

3. The famed clam pizza was absolutely the best pizza I've had in a long long long time. I've been to New York and had Joe's, Lombardi's, Bleeker street...there's something about this pizza that makes it so satisfying even though it's not my usual favorite fold over NY slice. The dough is phenomenal. The clams are whole little clams and actually have a satisfying chew and paired with the cheese, garlic and parsley, it's definitely one of the best slices I've ever eaten.

If you are in SF, please find this slice, you won't regret a single bite! Happy eating!
author: Kyung E.

description: Love Golden Boys! Long line but well worth the wait. Pizza is hot and delicious. Not very much room inside. So I took our pizza to-go . Do your self a favor and stop here when your in the area .
author: Nichole S.

description: Line was worth the wait!  Standard cheese and one with the works were EXCELLENT.  The crust was light, buttery and crispy.  But the stand out was the clam pizza, which sounded like it'd be a questionable topping, but was anything but!! Like, why aren't clams a topping we can normally order?!?  It was AMAZING.  The showstopper.  Unexpected.  Delicious.  Golden Boy Pizza lived up to the hype.
author: Karin S.

description:
There's something to be said about focusing on one thing and doing it right!
They have 5 pizza choices, and have craft beer on tap. No frills. That's it.
This place is tiny and usually has a line. It's worth the (relatively short) wait.
By far the best thick/Sicilian slices I've ever had, and prices are low considering what you pay at other pizza places in North Beach. Considering getting an entire pizza if you have a crowd to feed - the discount is worth it.
author: Perrin H.

description: There is usually have a long line outside the door. I only tried this place because a friend insisted that they have the best pizza in San Francisco. I always order the clam pizza. It never disappoints. Note they only accept CASH. Tip: there are numerous banks in the area - all walking distance. Get their pepperoni or veggie pesto! They're also very good!
author: Charlene F.

description:
This is my go to pizza spot in SF. Though sadly recently more and more people go here, which is great for their business, not so fun for people like me who have loved going here for years. The last few times i have been the line has been not fun. Nothing crazy, but i am used to it being a quick in and out. 

There are a select option of pizzas, because they are the best. 
I always get the cheese, because well, its delicious.
I often get it to go and then go eat it in washington square park. 

THIS IS CASH ONLY. So be prepared. Thought this is common in this area. 

You can eat inside if you choose. There is bar seating. They have a small drink selection as well. 

You can also order a slab of pizza for events or things like that. 

I kinda recommend checking them out, but not, because i don't want to wait in a longer line.
author: Tabitha D.

description:
There's pizza and then there's pizza.  Golden Boy has been serving its delicious Sicilian style pizza at its Green St location in North Beach since 1978.  The line waiting is a testament to how good is the pizza.

The pizza is prepared on rectangular sheets and you can order per slice or sheet. There are six choices, cheese, pepperoni or sausage, combination, pesto veggie and clam and garlic.  You can eat in or take out your pizza.  They will put your pizza into the oven to make sure its piping hot when you get it.  Enjoy your pizza with their large selection of tap beers.  There's bar counter seating in front and along the wall in back. 

Tried the combination and the clam and garlic.  Both were delicious, but I liked the uniqueness of the clams, garlic and pesto pizza.  The savory clams with the potent taste garlic.  Heaven!  But what makes the pizza so delicious is the focaccia bread crust that supports the toppings.  This focaccia is so light and airy than your typical focaccia.  

So glad that I finally was able to try Golden Boy's pizza and I was not disappointed. Will definitely be back.
author: Al L.

description:
Not NY pizza by the slice, but pretty good pizza!

When some 20 years ago I left Brooklyn for San Francisco I immediately felt certain withdrawal symptoms, two top ones being that of NY bagels and NY pizza by the slice. 

It took me a few months to discover Golden Boy Pizza, but once I did, my shaking hands somewhat stabilized, my nerves settled and I stopped being a short tempered SOB!! I knew then that whenever I craved a slice, I could go to Golden Boy and sniff up a couple of cheese or pepperoni slices and all be fine!! Shoot, I could even do it as late (or early) as 2:30 am on Saturdays and Sundays!! 

Listen you fellow NYers who may read this, I still miss NY's pizza badly, the kind that you could buy at any neighborhood pizzeria, drain of grease, fold in half and swallow in four bites, but being on this side of the continent at least I have Golden Boy! So please be understanding and instead of disowning me, come and try a slice of Golden Boy Pizza and judge for yourself!
author: Afshin A.

description:
Solid pizza! The slices are squares and the dough is nice and fluffy. 

The everything is delicious as is the clam slice. The line can get long, but it goes by fairly quickly. There's also seating, but again, it gets busy!
author: Valerie N.

description:
This is my favorite pizza in the country. It's SO Good. Whenever we are in line, if we go at night, people always ask us if it's worth the wait... oh yes, it is :) we are living in LA right now and we usually drive straight to Golden Boy when we pull in to the city every other month or so. 

It's cash only so make sure you're prepared. The slices are big, square pieces. We get the cheese and they're about $3.50 each. I want to say a whole sheet is about $40. Enjoy!
author: Rikki M.

description: I honestly don't know what more I can say about this place that has already been said. The garlic clam pizza is amazing. The crust is crunchy and fluffy at the same time which defies all logic to me. They have a good selection of beer to help you wash all that deliciousness down. If you haven't tried Golden Boy you haven't lived.
author: Tristan S.

description: Such delicious pizza here! I'm a huuuge sucker for pizza so anytime anyone wants pizza, I'm down. I was walking around china town and stumbled upon this place and decided to give it a shot. The pizzas are cut into squares and they sell pizza by the slice or box. I got a slice of cheese pizza that they popped in the oven for a couple minutes to cook. The place is really small and the seating is kinda uncomfortable (bar style seating) but it's not really a place to hangout you kinda just stop in for a quick bite and then leave. The pizza was made within minutes and was very yummy. About $3.25 per slice and cash only!
author: Nargis A.

description:
I love the whole experience. Heading over to north beach. Checking out the fresh slices in the window before getting in line. I am usually so excited for the amazing pizza I'm about to eat that I don't ever mind the line. I don't mind the sketchy neighborhood or the long trip into north beach. I just have to have golden boy pizza. 

The service is fine. There is a small amount of quick turnover seating at the bar inside. The pizza is great whether you eat in, or take it home. Everyone says to try the garlic and clam pizza, and I finally caved in and tried a piece the last time I was there. Not for me, but try for yourself.
author: John W.

description: Clam and garlic all the way you kind of have to be a genius too invent a clam and garlic slice wait is worth the slice.
author: Ahmad M.

description: Last person left in line to order and they turned me and everyone behind me away. Figure out a way to treat a busy line without making loyal customers suffer.
author: Michelle G.

description: This spot was soo good. Their clam pizza was pretty good (and what my siblings) hyped up. For me, it was a little much after a few bites. However, their pepperoni pizza was sooo good. I'm not one to get just pepperoni pizza, however, this was totally worth it! Definitely a must try in the city. It's not great for group settings and rarely any seats available to sit and eat (during the times I went). Their bathroom was surprisingly clean, I will add. Go - to pizza spot for sure.
author: Janice L.

description:
Sicilian slice thick pizza with a line that resembled the wait in New York.

And mind you this was at 10pm.

OMG this place has great service and a great slice of pie.

The crust was perfect and the flavor of the toppings and cheese rocked it for me.

They heat up each and every slice even though it's already piping hot from the quick turnaround.

Cool joint....hole in wall pizza spot for locals and tourists alike!

I recommend going with any of their slices, from pepperoni to combo, to their clam. It's all a bunch of YUM!
author: Jack R.

description:
Love love love this place!!!
Their pizza is insanely good!
I usually take the Margherita, aka cheese pizza, it's SO freaking GOOD!
Do not even care of being in a line for who knows how long and all I order is one piece. That's how good it is!
Ingredients are fresh (perhaps imported) and very well balanced. 
When it comes right out the oven is really irresistible. 
Dough is perfection and easy to digest as it should!!! 
If you eat in , try their peperoncino, parmigiano e origano, they make a great, tasty addition to an already amazing pizza!
You haven't tried this pizza yet? On My!!! You have no idea what you are missing. As my friend Tina would say:
Simply the Best

PS, have tasted their garlic clams one! Also super delish
author: Hosna A.

description:
I had the clam and garlic pizza, and at $4.25 a slice, it wasn't bad choice for the area. They have a display case of all the pizzas out front, and when you order one, they grab it and put it in the oven to heat it back up.

Unfortunately, it does kind of taste that same way too when you eat it. The pizza lacks that super fresh taste of new pizza, and while it still is decent, it would have been better if it wasn't just mass made, reheated and just sitting out there.

The flavors were interesting for the clams are garlic pizza, mostly because I enjoyed the garlic, but it didn't really stand out or have anything that really captivated me or would make me want to crave or come back here, besides the price of course.

This place is cash only, so make sure you withdraw some cash before coming!
author: Tyler T.

description:
The have delicious sicilia style pizzas in the bustling Italian neighbourhood of SF.
I tried the veggie and the cheese pizzas.. absolutely delicious!! Coupled with the lemonade they have, it's an excellent option at anytime of the day...
author: Saarthak C.

description:
Parking is a booch! But so what. Just get in line & deliciousness awaits you.  I have not been let down yet.

They are always consistent!  Everything is really good, and I always end up burning my mouth cuz I can't wait.  If you plan on coming, order ahead. Bypass that line and send your wingman out to pick get your order! 

Do try the clam pizza, I wasn't a fan of the idea. Someone ordered it in my group, I took a bite & polished it off.  But try it, at least once!  It works on this style pizza and it's really good.
author: Jasmine T.

description:
Cheap, filling, delicious, and excellent service. Dare I say it possibly the best pizza by the slice in the city. The kid at the counter was super friendly and helpful and I went with 2 house specialities off their small menu the garlic clam and the pesto vegie. Now usually I always order several slices Im the guy who solos a whole frozen pizza when im at home netflixing but I felt pretty full after 1 and stuffed after the 2nd. 

They only serve square slices and when it came with a knife and fork I thought it was heresy at first till I quickly realized it was so loaded up was greasy dankness I would have ruined my suit halfway into the work day otherwise and it was totally justified. Both were super tasty and packing distinct flavors. Probably even better when your drunk and the place is always a cool dive bar so feel free to test my theory. Long story short what are you doing with your life? You need to be here eating this pizza!
author: Sean G.

description: Cheese pizza!!!!! I love simple ingredients like a juicy pan pizza. Just thinking about the cheese pizza from here has my mouth watering. I also tried the veggie pizza but was not a fan. I highly recommend the cheese tho! Please try! You won't be disappointed :)
author: Yolinda S.

description: I really enjoyed this pizza spot - there are four standard pizzas - $3.75 or so for a rectangular slice - freshly toasted upon order. I tried cheese and combo - loved them both
author: ClassyCurvy C.

description:
Maybe it was cause I was sober and we all know pizza tastes bomb after late night drinking. I got a slice of pepperoni and a combo both for $4 each. It was underwhelming and looks can be deceiving. In this case, it was too soft/fluffy with the dough too soft: i was expecting more with all the raving reviews. Always a line and I ended up waiting 5-10 minutes for ehhh slices. 

I'll come back after a few drinks next time and see if it changes the verdict.
author: James H.

description:
1. The ac is not that strong inside.
2. Really bomb pizza 
3. Line on the weekends but there is an awning
4. Pizza churns out really fast
5. Slice of pizza is around 5
author: Bruce S.

description:
Showed up at Golden Boy around midnight on a Friday, completely sober amidst a hoard of obnoxious drunk people. Waited for ~20 minutes in the line of said obnoxious drunk people. 100% worth it for the garlic and clam pizza. First of all, the slices are huge. One square slice is probably the equivalent of 2 normal slices. They re-heat it your choice(s) of pizza for you, so it's nice and crispy. 

The garlic and clam pizza is my favorite. So garlicky and pungent and everything you want in a greasy late night pizza. The lady who took my order said that there is usually zero line on weekdays, so that's probably when I'll come back next time a Golden Boy craving hits.
author: Denise L.

description:
It just doesn't get any better for slices than this great place.
Try It!! ~~ You'll Like It!!
author: Kdu b.

description: Pizza was Fire!!!! single slices Small spot hard to find a seat but still amazing food.
author: David H.

description: Awesome Pizza!!! They are open very late and the price is very reasonable. When you're in north beach and you're ready for a late night pizza, dont forget to walk to GBP.
author: Paulo F.

description:
Almost 2,500 reviews with a 4.5 rating, I was expecting some bomb ass pizza. NOPE. I left disappointed. Coming in, there was a 4-5 people line to order by the door. Really awkward placement since the line starts by the door and you have to squeeze though people to come in.
The squares were less than impressive. Bland and too fluffy, barely any sauce.. I never had Cici's pizza but this is what I imagine it tastes like. 
The most exciting part of going to Golden Boy was the cute British bartender.I really don't have anything else to say, I could of skipped this experience all together. Well, at least now I can warn others, don't bother...
author: Natalie K.

description:
Garlic clam pizza from golden boy at 11 pm or 2 am or 11 am is absolutely one of the greatest joy in SF. 

Do yourself a favor and come to Golden Boys on your visit to SF or whenever. Take your boyfriend, girlfriend, mom, sad, grandma, everyone, here!!!!!!
author: Dana Z.

description:
If you like pizza and you are in SF you have try their pizzas. 
Parking is bad ( like everywhere else in SF ) inside is small so I would suggest you to get a to go order :)
author: Laila M.

description:
Pizza toppings on focaccia bread sliced into squares/rectangles. It's genius! It's brilliant! It's where I'll be to satisfy my late night munchies.

Pros:
+ Affordable: $4.25/slice
+ Rectangular/Square! Dare to be different!
+ Out of this world delicious and fluffy!
+ All the old SF feels in the heart of North Beach
+ Possibly my new favorite, surpasses Seniores

Cons:
- Gets packed. At 10:45PM. On a Thursday. Daaaang!

Pro-Tip:
+ Cash Only. None of that Apple Pay, Bitcoin BS. No dolla bills, no fluffy pizza.

Aside from its unique shape, Golden Boy is also known for their clam and garlic pizza. In other words, order that. You won't regret it. 

Someone please tell me why it tastes so much better after 9PM. I don't eat pizzas unless I'm out late or I've been drinking, but damn, each bite is so comforting. Real talk.

Coming back, but only after 9PM. Pizza doesn't taste comforting before 9PM; it just tastes basic.
author: Fanny W.

description:
Golden Boy is so hyped up and from all the raving reviews, I had pretty high expectations. I visited around 11:30pm and there was a line out the door, but it moved pretty fast. I ordered a slice of the 'famous' clam and garlic pizza and then a slice of the combo to share with my boyfriend. There's only bar seating inside since it's a small space, but we were lucky enough to find two seats at the counter. The stools were rather small and uncomfortable and the counter was too high up. There also aren't any hooks to hang bags so I was clutching onto my bag while trying to eat my pizza and not fall off the stool at the same time. 

As for the pizza itself, I really didn't think it was as amazing as people say. The clam and garlic pizza looked and smelled good, but as I was eating it, I barely tasted any clam or garlic flavors. The combo pizza tasted like a less oily, less toppings, but better crusted Costco pizza. I'm sorry if that comparison offends some people (lol) but as I was eating it, that's what I was thinking. I put so much parmesan and red pepper on my pizzas but it still didn't satisfy my tastebuds. I kept thinking about adding Tabasco, tbh. At $4.25 a slice, it's pretty decently priced, but I don't think it was worth standing in line for.
author: Cecille W.

description: Was recommended by a friend to come here for the best pizza in town and I was not disappointed at all. The staff is extremely friendly and had patience with any questions from out-of-towners (I was visiting from Los Angeles) The Clam Garlic pizza and Combo pizza were the only slices my physical body was able to chow down. A friend I was with got a slice of the vegetarian pizza and by the looks of it, it was as good as the two I ate! 100% best pizza spot in SF. Also bring a sticker if it's your first time coming here, their walls + restrooms are filled with plenty of them and it's cool to add your own.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I was told by several coworkers how delicious Golden Boy Pizza is so I had to go after work. So far I've been here twice, once around 8PM and once around 4PM and there was a long line each time. So be prepared to wait some. But I assure you, it will be worth it. 

I have tried the pepperoni, combo, and the garlic clam. The pizza is cut into squares and they are pretty thick slices! I got full off of one but definitely needed to eat a second slice since it was so good. If you are taking it to go, you should definitely heat it up before indulging. My favorite would have to be the garlic clam since I love me some garlic. I was told they can run out of the garlic clam so if you really want to try this one, go earlier!
author: Nicole K.

description:
I ate a slice of combo pizza, which was amazing!
I liked how fluffy it was.  Limited seating at the restaurant.
Bought a slice of Pesto & veggie to go.
I was surprised that they did not want to sell me a small box for the slice, even though I requested for it and I agreed to pay the extra 50 cents...weird.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Finally an affordable pizza place that I can go on a regular basis. I go to Chinatonw pretty much everyday (I'm from Hong Kong) and recently decided to venture into little Italy, or Littly as my friends and I like to call it. And even though food here is still cheaper than the rest of the city, it's still alittle over my budget as a newly grad unemployed college student. But Golden Boy is well within my budget, and the people are nice and hardworking. Usually I don't tip my waitors and waitresses very much since I just find them rude most of the time. But the people at Golden Boy Pizza really dig their job and do it really well - that I admire very much and I'm happy to say that I will be tipping very generously whenever I come here to get that delicious .

100% recommendation. Try to come on a weekdays afternoon so you can actually sit in because there's always a line on weekends.
author: Damon L.

description: We waited for about twenty minutes later on a Thursday night after a long hike at Big Basin. The pizza was well deserved by that point and devoured quickly. I got a slice of garlic clam for $4.25 and next time would definitely get a beer from the ~10 taps or so that they have. We sat next to the bar, but I could see how this would be a nice place to chill after work or watch a sports game on one of their televisions.
author: Clayton B.

description: Best Pizza in Town. Highly recommended will surely try it again. Keep this quality forever.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
So far this is the best "Grab n' Go" pizza shop! Hands down, if you're looking for a pizza joint by the slice but gourmet style, Sicilian cut with a Detroit pan influence, this is the spot. Their pan crust is legit and freshly hot from their oven. 

My favorite is their clam & garlic which is off the charts. It has the perfect amount of saltiness and a nice load of clam meat; they don't skimp. Their cheese, pesto, and mixed veggie combo are all delicious as well! 

This place is CASH ONLY and a slice will run you about $3.50-4 a slice. I recommend this place if you're looking for an after hr bite, going on a pizza crawl or even just for a quick bite to get you through before the big meal. They have bar stools along the wall so arrive early before they fill up. This place is pretty small so make sure expect a line outside.
author: Allister D.

description:
After eating lunch next door, I spotted some civil servants grabbing pizza from this place.  They said it was a must.  So, We walked around in the area until, we could give it a try.


I had the pesto vegi and hubby had the works (not sure of the name.  Fresh, tasty ingredients. Got a little side of sauce for the pesto. Oh that sauce was perfect blend of tomato and spicesz The bread was flavorful like pizza bread should be.  We sat at the bar/counter.  A nice guy recommended beer for hubby.  Was perfect with the pizza.  The guys in the back were hustling that pizza dough in the ovens.  Cool neighborhood vibe.  Stool seating.  Most were taking it to go.  Most sold by slices.  Not sure if whole pizza are sold.  I'm a creature of habit once I find something tasty.  We'll be back.  Price was right!!
author: Fancy G.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco! I love their business model: "yo-we are gonna serve 6 different types of pizza by the slice, and have them constantly churning out fresh. And dammit we are going to do them WELL!" 

Great spot if you're trying to grab a spot on the run,  not many spots to sit and eat-so they get people in and out of there very quick. 

My favorite is the combo pizza with the meat and veggies. So tasty!
author: Steve S.

description:
We went to a nearby bar to celebrate my roommate's birthday and when everyone bounced, we made our way naturally to get pizza!

I'm so glad Golden Boy was a 1-minute walk away from that bar or else we would've ended up at some mediocre pizza joint. When we arrived, like any tasty place in SF, there was an expected line on the sidewalk. I like lines, I can reflect on life or really debate on which pizza to get. I ended up doing the latter.

My beau ordered some green pizza with clams on it and I opted for a combo and a pepperoni. I'm the fatty in our relationship and it's ok. My other roommate also opted for two slices and she ended up reheating the second slice the next morning (I was jealous!) I wish I ordered extra for leftovers sake because it was so good!

Probably my favorite pizza spot in SF!
author: Nitar L.

description: Great spot to come through late night. Line gets long but goes by fast. Very small joint so you can't really sit down and eat for a large party.  I like the clam garlic and veggie pesto pizza. The slices come in squares and each single slice is around 4 bucks each. A large pizza is 15 slices but it has to be the same kind of pizza no mix and match. Parking is not ideal but it is SF.
author: Lena M.

description:
There is nothing bad about Golden Boy Pizza except the fact that it is miles and miles away from where I live. Why does something so good have to be so far away? 

I tried combination the first time. I know, you're probably thinking...why combination. But it was the best frikken combo Pizza I've ever had and I've had a lot of combo pizzas in my life. That says something! 

The next time I had it, I tried the clam and garlic. Yes, yes. I made the right choice this time. 

There's just something about their cheese. I bit into my pizza and strings of it just gracefully formed as I pulled the slice away from my mouth. It's as if all the world stopped and it was me and my Pizza in slow motion. Nothing but angels singing. 


Until we meet again, golden boys!
author: Melanie B.

description:
I've heard about the hype about this place for a while, and I didn't get to check it out until last night! 

THE HYPE IS REAL!!!

Golden boy pizza will not disappoint, and I loved the combination and garlic clam pizzas. The pizza dough is nice and chewy (but not too chewy) and crispy!

My friend and I shared a total of three slices, and it was more than enough. 

This place is a great spot for late night drunk food, or if you also just want to chill with a couple of beers. ^_^
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Square slice focaccia pizza? Yes please!

I almost always end up here whenever I'm in the area. Even when I'm not in the area I seem to end up here. My go-to definitely has to be their garlic clam slice, plenty of clams, garlicky goodness, melted cheese, all on top of a fluffy focaccia with a crispy bottom. My boyfriend usually gets the pepperoni or sausage slice and we split a combo slice on top of that, super satisfying. 

Unless you're coming here for late night drunchies, highly recommend coming in the afternoon if you don't want to wait in a long line as it gets pretty crowded at night.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Best spinach pizza I've ever tasted! We had some leftover the next day, and it was still delicious -fresh or not.
author: Jenny N.

description:
I walked by this a few times and kept seeing the lunch lines, and finally decided to walk in and give it a try (after carefully looking at Yelp to decide on my choice of slices of course). 

I ordered two slices to try on my first visit:
Combo: This is a solid combo pizza. The sausages were great, and perfect ratio for toppings. I would definitely get this again.
Clam and garlic: I was a bit disappointed by the clam and garlic to be honest. The flavors were decent, but not as fragrant as I would have liked - I thought they could've gone heavier on the garlic.

Overall, Golden Boy Pizza is a bit pricier than I'd hope for a quick pizza lunch (likely because I needed two slices to be full), but the quality is definitely there. I love the crust, and their cheese is perfect. Perhaps reading the reviews left it a bit overhyped for me, which may explain my disappointment with the clam and garlic pizza. I will probably be back to try some of the other flavors next time, particularly the pesto veggie pizza and perhaps the sausage.
author: Michael L.

description: Being from the northeast, I guess you could say I'm a pizza snob. While its not NY pizza, its pretty damn good. The crust wasn't too thick and it was extra crispy. Good topping combinations, drink selections, and really great service. The dude who served us was so nice, he complimented every customer and had a huge smile on his face the whole time. Just a heads up, its cash only.
author: Taya A.

description:
If Sicilian Style Pizza is your thing, then I would encourage you to stop by Golden Boy Pizza in North Beach and pick up a few slices! It definitely hits the spot if you're craving a late night snack. Parking might be a bit of a hassle to find in this area, but if I'm in the mood for pizza, I'll take my chances and find a way to get here.

They offer up a variety of pizza slices here. If you've never heard of Sicilian style pizza, it's basically a thick toasted square with cheese that will melt all the way through each layer. They have some great toppings like the Garlic & Clam, but I would recommend the combo slices because they fill you up quite nicely. 

There will be a line that you'll have to wait in, but it's no more than 15 minutes to a half an hour. Totally worth it though. There really are a lot of great Italian places to choose from, but if you're craving a quick bite, then make your way to Golden Boy Pizza and see what all the fuss is about!
author: Steve N.

description: Great pizza.  Worth the wait.  I had the pepperoni. Friendly staff.  A bit grimy inside.
author: Kristine N.

description: Childhood favorite. We used to live on the same block growing up and sometimes this would just be dinner. I usually order the combo or sausage slice center piece please!
author: Tasha L.

description: Great low brow restaurant in north beach area. I had the plain cheese pizza and my husband had the pepperoni. Both were delicious and plentiful. Would highly recommend for a quick bite if you are in the area.
author: Ali A.

description: I'm an avid pizza eater, and I had been wanting to try this place for a while. I usually prefer traditional ingredients on pizzas but the flavors of the clam and garlic paired together so well. Be prepared to stay in line because this place is popular! Also, it is cash only. There is some seating at the counter and at tables but it's dimly lit and not a large space. I would suggest getting the pizza to go and eating it at Washington Square Park if the weather is comfortable.
author: Kristen P.

description:
Atmosphere:  Barlike atmosphere with pizza and beer.  Not a kid friendly spot; not much of a dine in either.  It's more like a stand and dine.  Small dining area with not much tables.  

Service:  First off, service was great!  The cashier was very friendly and helpful.  She was patient too.  Unfortunately, the wait for pizza can be really long.  With only one cashier and many customers, you can only imagine the wait time.  I came on a Saturday night and the line was way out the door.  Waited 40 mins for pizza.  

Food:  The pizza was good.  With orders by the slice, we were able to try out most of the flavors.  The menu was very simple.  Choices are cheese, pepperoni, sausage, veggie, combo amd garlic clam.  The crust was thick for u thick crust lovers.  My fave was the combo that came with tomatoes, zucchini, mushrooms and sausage.  The garlic clam was okay.  It wasnt what i expected; i expected more clam flavor instead of the overpowering garlic.  

Overall, i would come back again but will not be looking forward to the wait.
author: Felisha L.

description:
The pizza is good, but not quite the hype that this place gets.  There are many different options and few that are outside the box.  Before you walk through the door you can pick you pizza as you look through the window.  The pizza is cut in squares, ala Roman style, but not paid for by the kg or lb.  

I did not grow up eating Golden Boy and my preference is Tony's just around the corner.  They are very different styles of pizza and very different wait times.  If I was looking for a slice, my preference would be New York style.  

What did I learn today?  I wish that I kept track of all the places that I have eaten pizza in my life.
author: Ryan C.

description: Definitely one of the best pizza in the area. We were waiting in line about 35 - 40 minutes but at the end, it was worth it. The pizza was really good and not so expensive. There are not so many spaces where you can seat and eat, it's like you take it to go.
author: Ratmir K.

description:
I live and die by the clam pizza at Golden Boy!! Lezz be real. I haven't been to Golden Boy outside of a late night, post drinking sess in a while (maybe ever tbh), but THIS spot is a SF staple. 

Most north beach goers know this is the pizza window to get some LEGIT after hour eats. The line is always long past midnight. If you're out and about and REALLY want one of these slices, get there around 11-11:30pm...you might even get a seat inside! After midnight though, the doors to the restaurant closes and they only open up their window to serve you the slices. 

The pizza always comes out toasted (unless they literally brought the tray out 10secs before, then they won't reheat it).  

FYI, Golden Boys even serves some alkie. The cutoff time for the alkie to be consumed is SUPER SUPER strict though. We got there just before 11:30 and the cashier said we could get a pint, but it HAD to be finished by 11:30. No exceptions. True to his word, he came by 5mins later waiting for us to finish chugging our beers. 

Aside from the unplanned beer drinking contest w my friend, the entire experience is always truly SF to the core. Quick sassy staff, amazing food, and probably a few too many drunken ppl screaming up and down the street (and the line). 

New trays of pizza come out every 20ish mins. WAIT FOR A SLICE OF THE FRESH CLAM PIZZA. No lie. You musttttt get it. 

PS they have a sister sit down restaurant in SSF. Shocking, right?! And it's the cutest sit down Italian restaurant ever! The BFF's dad happens to be BFF's w the owner of Golden Boy and Bertolucci's. Look it up. The fresh bread they give you in the beginning of the meal is amazing - it's basically free Golden Boy pizza as a free starter. And honestly, who can pass that up?!

5 stars!!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I had been craving pizza for some time and it just so happened I stumbled on my favorite food blogger on my snapchat, and she had a snap of this pizza joint that just looked amazing. And it's shaped in a square slices, which I like. Since I was going to SF to visit my gf I had to check this spot out! The inside is very small and slender. More of come in eat your slice or pick up your to-go and leave. I loved the vibe though.  A small mom and pop kind of store that has that edgy look. It was pretty hot inside. It was not a huge menu, very simple, about 4 different kinds of pizza and they served beer as well. I believe it was CASH ONLY!

The slices are huge! We pretty much tried one of each, since my gf and I both got 2 each. It's pretty cheap and you get a whole lot of it, so I'd say it's a good deal. I did not know at first, until I went to the bathroom, but there was a few more seating in the back. 

_Combo ($4.25) Mushroom, zucchini, tomato, onion, pepperoni and sausage. You can never go wrong with a combo. This was pretty darn good. All the yummy saltiness from the meats, and the veggies were great. The pizza crust was a bit on the thicker side and dough like in the middle. And the slices are huge so it's more on the thicker side, rather than thin. Either way this is a solid must!
_Pesto Veggie ($4.25) I wanted to try this since it's different and l love pesto. This was very good, you really get that deep flavor of earthy pesto flavor. The veggies zucchini, mushrooms, onions, olives and tomatoes. The crust was also perfectly crisp. The cheese just melts and oozes as you bite into it. Because they are huge and they add a generous amount of toppings it's easier to cut it with a knife and fork, and you get more in the middle than use your hands and get in that bad boy!
_Clam and Garlic ($4.25) I had to try this seems this is one of those rare kinds. And it was pretty popular on yelp. Definitely not for those whom aren't too crazy about garlic. I can smell the garlic right away. As soon as you bite into it, you get that potent flavor and aroma from the garlic, and the sea like flavor of the clam. A good mix, but after a few bites it got a little too rich for me. The garlic was just very overpowering. I felt bad for my gf since she's allergic to garlic, I probably reeked so bad hahah. But I'm glad I got to give it a try. 

Although I prefer thin sliced pizza, and less doughy, this was a nice change to try. Lots of great flavors, friendly staff, and very hearty you get your money's worth for a slice.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
First off, let me just say that I am extremely lactose intolerant with a ton of GI issues but for the clam pizza from Golden Boy, I would risk it ALL. I don't think I've ever had such delicious pizza in my 23 years! The flavor is amazing, it's the perfect amount of crispness, and they truly do not skimp on the amount of garlic (coming from garlic's #1 fan).
