I think it's a great bang for my buck as well - it's around $5 for a slice and those slices are HUGE!!!! It makes this place all the better to me. 

Just a few tips: prepare to wait; the lines are usually long. Also, bring cash with you as Golden Boy is cash only. I usually like to bring my pizza home to eat because the establishment is a bit small so seating is limited and it tends to get pretty hot in there. Regardless, it's SO WORTH IT. You won't regret it!
author: Shannen N.

description:
Very casual joint with delicious slices of freshly made pizza served 'til late at night. WHAT MORE CAN YOU ASK FOR?! If only it wasn't so difficult to park in North Beach, I would be here often for a midnight snack haha.

The pizzas are served in individual squares and toasted before serving to you. I'd suggest buying one slice of each and trying which one you like best. I love the veggie pesto & the combo with sausage, pepperoni, & zucchini! My friend loves the clam pizza, which looks really good if I do say so myself.

Cheap too! So if you're looking for a bargain & delicious slices of pizza, head over to North Beach & pay a visit to Golden Boy!
author: Ralph N.

description:
Surprisingly overrated.

I get that a good slice of pizza is tough to come by outside of NYC, but I thought I had found the one place that could make it happen. I did not.

Came here while doing some urban hiking in the Bay Area. It was a quick stop since I was just looking for a good slice to get some energy to continue exploring.

You walk up and there isn't much instruction on how things run there. If there is, it's not super clear or maybe I was just tired and low on energy. Pizza is on display and you can see it from outside. Que up and let the cashier know what you want and you can go ahead and pay. I order two regular slices and a can of coke. It was $10. You read that right. $10. I'm on vacay though I took the L on that one. The guy lets me know he'll bring it over to me. He puts the two regular slices down and it's clear, this is not two regular slices. Maybe I should have asked for plain slices? It's all square pizza with all sorts of stuff on it. I honestly couldn't tell you what this thing had on it. I was too tired to ask or care. I proceed to eat. When you're hungry--as I was--anything you bite into is usually heaven, but it wasn't anything special so I'm surprised by all the reviews here. Cheese wasn't especially good. Sauce was like something out of a college kitchen. Crust was ok.

Overall I wouldn't recommend going here. I thought the price was high and the pizza not only didn't live up to the hype, but seemed more like college kitchen pizza than anything. The folks here are pretty nice though.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Visited this place for the first time recently and was very pleased with the quick service and delicious pizza. Garlic clam is definitely a must try since it's so different.

Seats are limited so I took it "to go". My only reheat is not devouring the pizza right after I got it since I'm sure it would have been divine piping hot. After a few minutes it was still good and I would definitely return next time I'm near by.
author: Cheetos C.

description:
Good Sicilian-style pizza! Thick, doughy slices, soft and chewy on in the inside with a little more crunch on the outside. Pretty sizable slice. They're served hot, cheese super gooey, so they're extra satisfying, but also very greasy. Delicious sober or drunk :P

The line was long on a Friday night but it moved pretty quick. Not much seating inside so we took our slices to the park nearby instead.

I got a slice of the GARLIC & CLAM ($4.25), which was very garlicky! I couldn't really taste the clams (had to really think about them to notice them) but I really loved the garlic flavor. Not for anyone who's kind of iffy about garlic!

They also have classic pizza choices like cheese, pepperoni, combo and pesto, all $3.25-4.25/slice
author: Jessie L.

description:
Golden Boy is the kind of place where the length of the line makes you think it's better than it is. If you come here in the evening, be prepared to stand half an hour in line.

The pizzas are made on focaccia, which is interesting but ultimately results in a very bready experience. It didn't feel like either of my slices were very cheesey or saucy. I got a slice of sausage, and a slice of clam. The clam was interesting, but I ended up wishing that I had just gotten two slices of pepperoni instead.

Cash only.
author: Yves L.

description: Best pizza ever.   We where having dinner next door and we notice a constant line of people waiting for pizza.   We had to try it.   Only cash about four dollars for a slice with 5 choices.  The crust was very light and crispy With perfect amount of sauce cheese and pepperoni .
author: Jim M.

description:
Probably the pie I liked most I'd say flavor wise when I was running around to different places to try for pizza. Plus the experience was awesome despite the place being really busy.

I had gotten here a little before they opened, watching from the outside as the view at the window opened up for the pizzas to see. I also parked like a few blocks away on a Saturday which was probably a stroke of luck on my part.

*side note: a lady saved me from being runover at the corner too, also possibly a stroke of luck. Or by proximity she didn't want blood on her, one of the two. 

Since they had a veggie option among the multiple pies, I grabbed that one. The size is quite good for the price, and the sauce is pesto. I'd say this would be one of the best applications of a pesto sauce I've had on a pizza since it was strong enough to be in every bite but not overpowering where you'd lose the taste of the veggies or the cheese. Plus I like a lot of pesto. If I wasn't trying a bunch of places that day, I probably would've taken one home for good measure. Maybe even a whole pie if I lived close enough. I also liked the crust for it more than the other places I went since it was thicker and had more flavor to it in comparison.

I contemplated a beer and the guy at the front recommended a fieldwork ipa. Worked really well with the meal. I continued to banter with the people over beer at the front til it got really busy. Friendly, cool people. Kinda wish it wasn't so busy at times but what can you do.

I'd certainly come by again for the whole experience, and hopefully when I'm not battling the crowd.
author: David C.

description: Def one of the best pizza spots in the city.... love the clam pizza... but the combo is pretty good too if you want a more traditional taste... the crust is crispy and perfectly baked and the flavors really come together... makes me hungry just thinking about it... it's not too pricey for a slice of pizza but not exactly cheap either imo...
author: Jonas E.

description: BEST. PIZZA. IN. THE. STATE. Everything about the pizza there is perfect. The lone is the only issue but it's 110% worth the wait. Again, amazing.
author: Evan H.

description: Good pizza, long lines though. Order over the phone and you can just walk past the line like a big shot
author: Aswath K.

description: Really good pizza but terrible service, the cashier was very rude and incredibly unfriendly !
author: Amina E.

description:
Amazing thick crust. Pretty oily and authentic. Worth the hype! 2 of my local friends recommended it when we were in town. It's in the heart of Little Italy so parking is impossible. I dropped my brother off in the front to order a few slices while I circled the block. 
Note that when we tried to order a full pizza they warned us they had too many take out orders and it would be a 3 hour wait. So we opted to order 5 slices instead that were ready in a few minutes after we walked in. There are a lot of other pizza places in the area as expected, but this spot did not disappoint, busy and all.
author: Mansta A.

description:
Amazing! I'm not really one to rave about pizza, but Golden Boy is literally killing the game. They have a
variety of pizzas to choose from. They are also well priced for the amount you get in a slice. I wasn't exactly sure if I was going to like it, but I was pretty pleased.

I got the pesto veggie and my friend had gotten the calm pizza. My pesto veggie was amazing, the pesto flavor wasn't overwhelming the veggies. There was a small wait, about 5-6 minutes, but it went by quickly. This establishment takes cash only, but there are a ton of banks all around it. Definitely coming back!!
author: Siera O.

description: The best pizza ever hands down! I've been going here since I was a little girl living in the Bay Area. Moved away to Fairfield years ago and still hop in my car and take the hr drive down to the city just for a couple of slices. The atmosphere is great and I know bring my 3 kiddos with me everytime. They love it and hate the drive but they suck it up for some Golden Boy Pizza.
author: Cynthia A.

description: Delicious deep dish square pizza!  Four types of pizza to choose from when we visited, all looked amazing, I had pesto veggie, yum!  Inexpensive and sold by the slice.  Small sitting area (pub stools along the wall) which works to eat but not a place to hang out.  Bathroom and atm in the back.  Cheap good eats and then be on your way!
author: Michelle M.

description: Everybody is all about Golden Boy so I tried it first chance I got when in North Beach. Two of us got a veggie and one a meat combo. I liked the thick but crispy crust but I felt like it had no discernible sauce which made it feel a little heavy. One friend wasn't a fan at all for that reason. Not sure it's worth the hype it gets but I mean, you have to try Golden Boy. Especially as a last stop for the night.
author: New2Northbeach N.

description:
This place was pretty good, I like the fact that they have garlic salt and oregano in shakers along with the parmesan cheese and red pepper flakes. 

Unfortunately the beer selection was pretty small and the pizza was not Chicago style, it was just puffy pizza that was slightly thicker then most but I don't think this place has real Chicago style pizza like I was told. 

Overall the service and decor was great but that line out the door is a bitch! I'll just order pizza over the phone next time I'm in SF.
author: Vincent C.

description: Amazing!!! I am from the East Coast and this is the best pizza I have ever had! I was staying in SOMA and a coworker recommended that I take the walk to North Beach! I am so glad that I did because at the end of my walk I found the best pizza on the planet... GOLDEN BOY!!!!! Also the crushed red pepper finely ground is so money on top of the pizza...
author: Graham S.

description:
Wandering around Little Italy, and we were actually heading to a spot a few doors down when we noticed the line outside Golden Boy. As there was no line, or signs of life where we were headed, we quickly changed plans and came here instead. Lots of locals, and we guessed (correctly) they knew something we did not. 

It's got that grungy bar feel (not a bad thing) with stickers plastering the walls, and about 10 bar stools total for seating. I liked the thick, bready crust as it reminded me of one of my favorite spots from the Italian immigrant-rich area of West Virginia (yes, this exists.) We had a late dinner reservation, and the slice of pizza, along with a few dim sum items from Chinatown, were perfect to tide us over from breakfast til our evening meal. 

The garlic and clam looked great but neither of us could pass up the pepperoni fresh from the oven.
author: Ranae W.

description: Clam garlic pizza!! They don't skimp on the garlic so if you're a garlic lover, this slice is for you. The crust is delish and has the perfect amount of crunch. All slices are less than $5!  It's more a to-go type of joint. Minimal seating inside. If you do sit inside though, at the bar top, they've got a TV playing local sports games.
author: Lexi R.

description: Rectangular slice! Perfect Pesto Veggie at the counter. Crust is thick and crispy, sauces are balanced with the toppings. Drove from Elk Grove for a slice of North Beach. Thank you Tri Counties' Rigo, Yasmine, Preet for introducing us to GB. Parking is challenging  on the street. A $20 Flat Rate parking lot across the street is worth it as slices are $3.25-$4.25. Great service and remember CASH ONLY!!
author: LaVerne I.

description: The garlic clam pizza is the BEST! it's what I usually always get but the vegetarian pizza is also good! This place is cash only so keep that in mind and also there is always a line out the door but it usually goes fast and for their pizza you probably wouldn't mind waiting, cause I know I don't! Lol
author: Mica G.

description: Must try the combo & pepperoni. Crispy crust, fresh ingredients and perfect amount of cheese and sauce. Great prices and delicious food. Highly recommend!
author: Adylene C.

description: The only good by-the-slice pizza place in the city. And by good I mean THE place to grab some pizza and have a beer or two with your mates.
author: Lucas D.

description: This is a damn good slice of pizza. My San Francisco friends rave that it's the best. It's a Sicilian slice in my book and a damned good one. The combo and veggie pesto might be in the top 5 slices I've had from Rome to Brooklyn to Chicago and beyond. Cash only! Yep. Cash only!
author: Marc R.

description: Best pizza I've had in awhile! The sauce was excellent, it wasn't too over powering and it complemented the crust and toppings without outshining it. The crust was moist but crunchy at the same time making it the most savor-able pizza I've had in awhile. The atmosphere was perfect and inviting as well as comfortable. I was most definitely come here again!
author: 文瀚

description: Garlic Clam Pizza is the way to go to get KTFO here!!!  Would definitely come back here again if I was to land in SF!!!
author: Wayne K.

description:
Good ol' Golden Boy Pizza, no its not owned by Oscar De La Hoya and no they don't serve in fishnets. 

The line was long, it took over an hour to get to the pizza. The anticipation was fun. I almost felt like I was waiting to meet the soup nazi, but thankfully the guy at the counter was a little nicer. 

Pizza by the slice. Squared out slices. The pizza was light in cheese, the toppings were nice and greasy, what more could a drunk man ask for? 

I had the pepperoni pizza and umm I forgot. How unprofessional of me. Honestly Golden Boy pizza is a must when you're on one. Its not going to suck. At worst it'll be okay. And if you're a Seinfeld fanatic you get to experience the closest thing to the soup nazi that you'll find on the westcoast...but without the soup...or the nazi.
author: Javier J.

description:
Pizza can't get better than this.
Ordered two pepperoni, 1 presto and 1 combo (for two people) 
Buttery crust baked to perfection, had almost biscuit like texture to it. 
Cheese was the best part I guess. Would definitely want to go again, although the place is a little cramped up
author: Asmita V.

description: Their pitzza is different and it's a place you should try once, but I personally like thinner crusts and less cheese. This place was a good try though.
author: Jay G.

description:
Wow. If you're in SF and in the mood for pizza, you should definitely bike up to Golden Boy for a slice or two. The clam and garlic is absolutely delicious (if you like garlic!) with perfectly combinations of crispy crust, chewy dough, and flavor-packed toppings. 

The ambiance is great and casual, a shotgun layout with some bar seating. Would love to come again!
author: Rebecca L.

description: Sicilian style pizza that you can order at the window. & eat it on the go. The pizza has a fluffy dough, tasty sauce & cheese with all kinds of fixings to choose from. It's one of my favorite pizza's in SF.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Really enjoy this pizza. We prefer the square side to the traditional and the pizza was smothered with sauce. 

Time of day: 12:30 on a Saturday 
Crowded: no crowd
Seating: about 15 stools but compact, majority of people eat with hands outside 
Cash only

Overheard the tour guide saying this place gets slammed in the evening so beware! But for sure worth trying to grab a slice of you are in the area.
author: Brett H.

description:
WOW...
I passed this place several times before trying it. I mainly avoided it at first because it looks like the kind of place you would get food poisoning. Well I didn't get food poisoning, I did get amazing pizza though. It is by no means gourmet pizza or a place you should go if you want to sit in quiet with your kids, but if you're out drinking and get the munchies, this is the absolute perfect place to go. The pizza is greasy, cheesy, full of flavor, and a great price. It tastes exponentially better the more you've had to drink. I cannot attest to how it tastes sober, but when I think of San Fran, Golden Boy always comes to mind as the shining binnacle of my experience here. I'd suggest getting a slice of "normal" pizza (pepperoni) and a slice of the clam. It's not as bad as it sounds.
author: Shelby B.

description: We didn't love the garlic clam as much as everyone. Too garlicy imo - but if that's your thang - go for it!!! I preferred the sausage combo instead (: It was good and really filling.
author: Jenna L.

description: I wanted to love this pizza, but I wasn't crazy about it. Maybe I just don't like pizza on focaccia bread much. I don't know... We tried pepperoni, plain, and the garlic/clam pizza because we were starving. The line was all the way down the block (around 10:30 at night). We waited and finally sat inside at a booth. The staff were great and our slices came quickly. The pepperoni and plain slices were good, but the clam was way too salty for me. I think I just like thin crust best.
author: Julia M.

description:
Y.u.m. 
Good prized pizza in North beach. Not too much seating inside but that's ok. Rocker vibe. I appreciated the fully filled parmesan and chili flake bottles on the counters. 
Good job guys!
author: Tracy L.

description:
My husband and I were quoted an hour wait at Sotto Mare. We were told our buzzer would only work in one block radius so we decided to grab a quick bite at Golden Boy Pizza which was only three establishments over. 

The line at Golden Boy never seemed to end. My husband and I waited about 20 mins to even get a foot in the door. We then had to intensely stalk out by the bar for a seat to enjoy our slice. We opted for their famous clam and garlic pizza. $4.25 for a slice was definitely a bit steep. 

Our slice came straight from the oven and the cheese was still bubbly. The flavor though was way too salty for my taste - Not much clams but loads and loads of garlics. The pizza crust was interesting - tasted as if it just dissolved in the mouth within two chews. I personally enjoyed the crust more than the toppings. 

Overall - glad we gave it a try but clams and garlic just isn't the dreamy combo for me.
author: Wing C.

description:
It's late. You've been on a carb free diet for the last 2 weeks and you find yourself worried that the water you're drinking has calories. Then it's time after a long night of drinking sparkling water with calorie rich lime wedges, to break the carb rules and grab a couple slices of Golden Boys. 

That's what I did, and after the first few minutes of getting the panicky carb sweats (more psychological than real), you find yourself immersed in cheesy gooey dripping yum nirvana.  

I grabbed a couple lives, meat and seafood and loved them both. Chilli flakes are a must for the seafood slice, but otherwise I was very very happy. 

The lines are long, have cash in hand -- no credit, and go to town. I suggest walking down the street and just eating off the hood of a parked car. Less crammed than the standing bar. 

I'll be back. 

Oh, watch out for the tripped out heroin heads walking around. Easy to get in a fight, and have a good night go south. Or, just share your slice and they'll back off. But don't share a bite -- oh my goodness that would be gross. Herpes etc. Ok. Weird review. 


The pizza is amazing. Yum.
author: John C.

description:
In summary:

cash only

garlic clam square is bomb

3 if you're sober

5 if you're drunk

10 if you're shwasted
author: Cindy W.

description: I came here on an early weekend, it was pretty packed already for a small restaurant. It was a pretty small restaurant, but the food was delicious. When I went it was already half packed, and luckily there wasn't a line. The pizza was fresh and good. I really enjoyed the "everything" pizza, it is full of flavour and packed with a lot of ingredients. I also tried their other selections, which was also good. Overall, it's a great place for a quick meal, great food, and great service.
author: Jackie Hk G.

description:
PSA: It is a nightmare trying to find parking here. Come here with one other person so someone can buy the pizza and the other have emergency lights on pulled over to a random curb. 

I got the clam garlic and combo pizza. Honestly, expected a lot more due to the raving reviews. It's nice that they heat up the pizza upon your order so it's fresh to eat. 

Clam Garlic was the better choice of the two. It wasn't overly strong on the Garlic and had just the right kick to it; the pizza was slightly bitter from the Garlic as well. They weren't skimpy on clams either. 

Overall, for the trouble to get these pizzas, it wasn't worth for me. It was good but probably won't return again anytime soon.
author: Amber T.

description:
The pizza here is fresh, cash only (ATM in the back). You can see all the pizzas they have available at the window. From clam & garlic, pepperoni, sausage, cheese to veggie pesto. They heat it up for you and its piping HOT! Caution: The roof of your mouth is not ready. 

Great for a snack - couple pieces coming out to ~8. Seating is pretty limited, bar seating with maybe about 20 seats. 

I really like their crust and dough, they don't have a very saucy pizza so if marinara everywhere is your thing it might seem a bit on the dryer side. The bite holds well and the toppings are pretty generous. 

Would definitely recommend this pizza joint to any pizza lovers roaming in this area. Round the corner of this place you'll find some great Happy Hour deals on drinks too. Pizza & Beer, need I say more.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yo the crust on these joints is HIT. Somehow amazingly crisp yet chewy, and a great vehicle for delivering savory sauce, gooey cheese, and whatever combination of toppings you happen to be craving. I had a slice of the clam and garlic and think I saw a piece of Golden Boy Pizza heaven. In fact, it may be my go-to for returning visits!

Note: this place is cash only. So bring it.
author: Vi T.

description:
Fantastic service! Everyone there was super friendly and it has a pretty chill  atmosphere.

The pizza itself probably could have been a little warmer when it was brought out and it tasted a little bland to me. At least for the pepperoni. The clam and garlic pizza was pretty good! If I was in the neighborhood. I would stop by again!
author: Rene N.

description:
This place! Come here for the deep dish pizza you've always needed! 

Friendly staff, sticker adorned walls, low prices, and pizza that makes you happy you're alive! 

Only thing deeper than this delish pizza was my conversation through bites of dinner- but let's not dive into that right now! Lol
author: Tina L.

description:
Get the clam and garlic. Get 5 slices. 

Cash only but there is an ATM in the back and a Wells Fargo just up the block if you do not want to pay a fee. Thankfully for my USAA account, I never get charged for pulling out cash which I did that day. I pulled a $20 but should have pulled $40 to satisfy my pizza cravings. 

Best thing: the 2 guys that helped w/ my order, got our waters, and checked on me constantly to make sure Gavin and I were cool. 

In. Love. 

I will be back this Sunday!
author: Tram N.

description:
Cash Only! Your fault for not stopping by the ATM beforehand. Each slice is around $4 BTW.

Fun Facts:
Golden Boy Pizza has been around since 1978 and expanded to several locations before scaling back down to just the O.G. location in North Beach. Arguably, their most famous pizza is the clam and garlic.

And it makes total sense. Think about when your order linguini with clams and garlic or garlic butter sautéed clams at a restaurant? Soon enough, you will be dipping that complimentary bread into the broth and asking for more like Oliver-freaking-Twist. Golden Boy simply combined all that together atop a handheld device called a focaccia pizza. 

iPizza.
Golden Boy - pure genius!

The pairing of clam and garlic goes together like love and marriage ahem or a horse and carriage. However, I need to point out, why no love for the special 3rd ingredient? Parsley! 

Since one of my many mottos is "three is never a crowd", let's take a moment for the chopped up parsley that is used as an herb as it should be and not as a useless fancy dinner plate ornament, capiche?

So I will call Golden Boy's "numero uno" pizza that knocks down all the other girlie rival pizzas like "dominos" [drumroll]... CPG. Clams. Parsley. Garlic. Who needs CPK anyway?

The CPG is simply delicious. It's a focaccia-style square-cut pizza so it's not too thin and not too thick. Like Goldilocks, Golden Boy is just right. But I think the golden refers to the perfectly golden crust on the bottom of each slice.

They do offer a few other options like pepperoni, sausage, and vegetarian but don't be a square, get at least one slice of the CPG. Just be forewarned, garlic causes bad breath and flatulence (farts) lol. At least it keeps vampires away.
author: Richard K.

description: Excellent pizza in the heart of San Francisco and well priced too! A cheese slice for only $3.25 is totally worth it. The restaurant/bar is pretty neat, but expect some heavy metal jams!
author: Alyssa M.

description:
This place is next to a dive bar me and my friends frequent occasionally. One late night after drinking we decided we HAD to try the pizza (because we had the drunkchies, of course) because the pizza smelled so good and the long line made us think it actually tastes delicious too!

Someone in line recommended me the garlic and clam pizza. This is NOT something I would normally request on my pizza but I figured, if people are ordering this by the whole pie, it's gotta be good! I will say, I was definitely satisfied with my purchase.

Love that this place is open late night; definitely meant for after the bar and night owls. Try it next time you're out late in North Beach!
author: Katlyn H.

description: Omg. Sooo good. Cheese! Pepperoni! Sausage. Eat in or to go!  You can order one slice. Order beer at the bar and eat.  When you're ready for a second slice, just let the bartender know. No need to wait in line
author: On C.

description:
Yo, this place is amazing! We came based off yelp reviews, particularly the one about the depressed chick that has made this her "depressed eating spot." Any food that is worth running to for comfort is worth checking out. So my wife and I came for lunch and we're blown away by the clam garlic pizza. Sounds like an odd combo, I know, but golly it'll knock your socks off as the smooth tandem has a succulent fiesta on your freaking tongue. 

Enjoy my friends, enjoy.
author: EJ M.

description: If you want some delicious pizza, go here. I stumbled upon Golden Boy Back in 2014 and have been going here every time I'm in San Francisco. The pizza slices are big squares filled with flavor. My favorite is the combo or sausage pizza. I recently went here with my mom and we ordered two sausage slices and one pepperoni slice. My mom ordered a beer and they gave her a different sample of beer so she could try them. The workers were very helpful and nice. The atmosphere of this place is great, especially if you go at night. They are open late and only accept cash. This is my favorite place to get pizza and hangout. The ambiance is lively. The bathroom and walls are filled with a variety of cool stickers. Definitely make a stop here when you are in the area!
author: Ismael P.

description:
Simply the best pizza in the Bay. 

Whether you stop by for a late-night slice after some drinks or you grab a whole pizza right when they open, you can't go wrong. 

Some people prefer thin crust, others want deep dish...Golden Boy is just right. 

"Straight cash homie!"
author: Roger D.

description: We are a family of 5 that were on vacation in the area June 2018.  We were trying to not spend an arm and a leg for meals yet enjoy something local.  We selected Golden Boy off of Yelp without reading too much and I am so glad we did it this way.  The decor was not something we would normally pick when we are with our kids (ages 10, 15 and 16) yet none of that mattered and we all enjoyed it.  Actually, the decor added to the entire experience.  The staff was friendly and helpful as soon as we walked in (order at counter as soon as you walk in).  We then spent a bit walking and waiting to find some seats as there are not a lot of seating areas and the place stayed packed and busy.  Since turnover of customers keeps moving, we were able to grab some seats in time for our pizza.  THIS WAS DELICIOUS!  Even my husband who is from Chicago and has lived in NY loved this pizza.  Do spend some time reading the menu posted on the wall behind the counter too, it is great!  We loved the pizza so much that we almost went back for a second meal even though we had limited days to enjoy various places.  Can't wait to return to Golden Boy Pizza!
author: Stephanie D.

description: I love their pizza! I don't think you can ever go wrong with pizza and I say its worth the wait! Its a small place and you can see, smell and taste the pizza just by standing in line! Every time I come here I order a ton of slices. I pretty much by two of everything if not more. I love love love their clam/garlic pizza and pesto. The crust is made to perfection, and its always made fresh and they re-toast it for you so its ready to eat!  Service is great, an they are quick. I've always came here  on a drunken night, or even if I'm in the area. Their flavors and combinations of the pizza are great. The area they are in is always crowded so there is absolutely no parking if you go, so I would say park far and take a walk. They don't accept card, CASH only so beware! All in all love their pizza , I wish there were other locations!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Came to Golden Boy finally after having it bookmarked for so long. Beware, this place is cash only but I think I saw an ATM in the corner. Little hole in the way mini-restaurant with some of the most amazing pizza! They sell by the slice of anything on the menu; very straight forward and simple menu. Golden Boy is decorated in edgy street-art kind of way. Inside there's about 15 bar stools and a small counter to eat at. The pizza is fresh and delicious. I'm already looking forward to the next time I can make it back to Golden Boy Pizza!

Review #1 of 2017
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I've been on the hunt for the perfect pizza in SF and I must say Golden Boy Pizza will be on my top five list . We waited in line for about 25 minutes out side in the cold while a man sang to us with his guitar . It was finally our time to pick out the pizza slices we wanted , I was sad that they ran out of the sausage pizza . We ordered one pepperoni, cheese and two combinations. I really wanted to try the pesto and clam pizza but no one was ordering it ;( The pizza was served hot, crispy and crunchy! I wish it was a little more saucy but that's ok !!! We were lucky enough to find a seat at the bar so we could enjoy our date inside instead of outside.
***** CASH ONLY ******
author: Monica M.

description:
Not worth the hype. I don't know if it's drunk people that have reviewed this place thousands of times or what, but it is so overhyped. It would be worth it if you were already in the area and you just snagged a piece quick, but making a special trip and waiting in line for 30+ minutes behind a man smoking weed in your face is not worth it. If you do go, order the pepperoni or sausage, avoid the veggie. 

With all that said, the service by the restaurant was top notch. He made me feel extremely valued as a customer. That's worth a lot these days.
author: Nile R.

description:
Get there early to avoid the line. 

That being said, this is the best late night pizza I've had. You will be assaulted with the smell of pesto, roasting clams, and rising dough in little Italy. 

PESTO CLAM (PC) PIZZA IS DANK 
This is such a hard review to write because I'm starving and thinking about this pizza is burning a hole in my heart. I miss it so much. I never had seafood on a pizza, but this was a great introduction. The pesto is not overwhelming, and compliments the clams to add a bit of freshness to the slice. I'm dreaming of a tv night with a bottle of white wine and just this pizza. If you have PC pizza you don't need a girlfriend. 

VEGETARIAN PIZZA WAS GOOD
Not as memorable as the PC, but how can you top that? The onions on this are slightly caramelized, and make this worth the trip for any veggie person. 

Each slice is roughly 4-5 inches squared and it's about $4.50/slice. Still, some of the best real estate I've thrown in my mouth.
author: Zachary L.

description:
First off, the pizza was delicious! No complaints about the food at all. It was my first time at the place and I lived it! Melty cheese, crisp crust, and great flavors! 

The only gripe was the service. I came in late at night on 2/16/18. I have heard amazing things about the clam pizza, so naturally I wanted to try it. Upon entering I asked the woman up front if there were any clam pizzas left. She responded rudely and with a harsh stare that broke the soul and dampened my excitement for the pizza, "Does it LOOK like we have any clam pizza left?" As a first timer, I was taken aback , I have no idea what their clam pizza looks like which I communicated to her. She repeated the same line with the same stare and stated "Your friends can get pizza, but you can't!" 

Tldr: pizza good, service bad
author: Joseph H.

description: The pizza is very good, excellent customer service, the only reason why I give 4 stars and not 5 is because they only take cash, I don't carry cash, i only have like 15 bucks with me and I had just tipped someone on my way there (the guy from the truffle place nearby) and because of that, I didn't have enough to buy enough for me and hubby, he had to run to the bank, and yes, there is an ATM in there, but I do not like wasting my money on small fees, you guys had a lot of business , I made a line, come one, unless it's something related to tax evasion or something, I don't understand this nonsense... Anyway, portions are very big and tasty, I will come back, but NOW I know how to be prepared to eat here
author: Veronica L.

description: New fave pizza place in town. Love the clam and garlic pizza: never tried clams on pizza (not focaccia pizza) but it was great! Other slices are just as good. Super garlicky, and the foccacia dough was fluffy with a crunchy bottom. Not NY slice prices either but definitely worth the 4 bucks.
author: Kevin N.

description: I probably don't have to tell you but just in case you don't know now you know. You gotta try this place out for a bomb slice of clam pizza. The aroma that comes off of the slice makes your mouth water. Always on point even if you get a plain Jane slice. The corner piece's are great even writing this review makes me want to go downtown and grab a slice . If you enjoy pizza and haven't tried them out give them a shot you probably won't be disappointed.
author: Sal L.

description: Absolutely delicious! I'm a fan of the veggie pesto, combo, and the clam (although am not obsessed with the clam). My favorite pizza spot in the city, easily.
author: Catherine W.

description:
Great neighborhood pizza. Famous for their SQUARE PIZZA!!! If you order a whole sheet you can skip the line and pick up your pizza. Seating is very limited so I'd suggest ordering and taking your pizza while you walk. 

Came here with a bunch of friends after a late night at the bars. We ordered a huge sheet of the combo and it was enough to feed 10 people if not more. Great ingredients and very fluffy dough.
author: Mel S.

description:
I would highly recommend you try this pizza spot out! 

THE GOOD: The pizza here is delicious! They serve pizza by the slice, which I think is pretty cool. They are open pretty late, which I also like a lot. I am not from San Francisco, but it seems like this is a go-to spot for people after a night of drinking. The first time I came here, it was around 1am on a Saturday, and the line was hella long. I got a couple slices of cheese pizza, and it was probably one of the best cheese pizza's I've ever had. I normally don't get cheese pizza, but that was all they had at the moment, and I didn't want to wait for Pepperoni or Sausage.
The pizza style is a little different than at most places since it seems to be made on focaccia bread. The slices are also cut up into rectangles.


THE BAD: The location is very, very small. This pizza spot pretty much looks like a bar. There is actually just a bar as the sitting area inside. The line pretty much starts out the door since the only register is right at the door. Getting your pizza during busy times is awkward since you have to squeeze back out the door that has a long line of people trying to order. Plan on taking your pizza to-go since the location has very limited seating available.


BOTTOM LINE: You should definitely try this pizza place out. I've come back multiple times when I'm in the area, and the pizza has always been really good. I would also say that the pizza is relatively well priced.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Pizza is my favorite food and I'm not afraid to admit it. Living in SF on-and-off for 18+ years I've seen my share of San Francisco pizza trends. Deep dish, fried eggs on top, specific 'firing temperatures' and everything in between. 

But Golden Boy a has been my boy since 2001 and we'll never be apart. Fun fact, I reluctantly had my first kiss here with my now husband about a decade ago post drinks sesh around 1am. It wasn't cute but turned into a life long friendship! 

The pizza is my everything. Combo, cheese, pepperoni, clams, get one of everything paired with beer. Rules: No kids (in my opinion, and I own a kid). Don't arrive too sober. And lastly, try to pick a little more charming place if you're looking to plant a 'first kiss' on someone.
author: Alison C.

description: Soft, thick, greasy comfort pizza that is so satisfying, especially if you just stood in line on a summer weekend. Which I didn't! Was here on a Monday, there was some wait and no seats open. Clam pizza has very strong garlic flavor which just does it for me!
author: Chari G.

description: Great drunk food or sober food.  Both the clam and pepperoni slices are delicious.  With chewy dough with a soft crust, these are some of the better Sicilian style slices I've had.
author: Simon L.

description:
Bolden Boy Bizza.
These extra B's are metaphors for BUTTER or BUTTAH' - as I like to call it. Delicious, garlicyious, melt in your mouth buttah'. You'll sleep well at night under blankets of thick-drooping cheese. A healthy helping of crispy pepperoni pillows for your delight. All atop the perfect non-Chicago deep dish square of heaven. Now, please accept this Tums milkshake as dessert. You're gonna need it.
author: Ryan M.

description: Best pizza in NorCal. Clam and Pesto and Combo are my absolute faves. They are packed with so much taste and the dough is perfect. It's a must have when is SF and North Beach area.
author: Ite H.

description: I honestly do not see the hype with this place. The reviews are crazy high for this cash-only place. The pizza is good and unique but not 4.5 stars good. It's really overhyped and nothing to go out of your way for. It's good but if you're going to be in Little Italy/North Beach you have a plethora of other pizza options to chose from. We got the infamous clam pizza as well as the supreme. Its pretty much pizza with some seafood on it, not something that blew me out of the water. It is a cool little place though, bar included and stickers/tagging everywhere. Really cool vibe.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Came to San Francisco with three hungry boys so I wanted something filling and good while not breaking the bank.  I Googled "cheap eats in SF" and found this place.  

Let's start with the pizza.  The crust was focaccia bread and served square.  Very generous with the toppings and very flavorful.  The service was fast and very friendly.  The only drawback I found was the parking around there is insane.!  I ended up parking in some spots marked for motorcycles.  There's a line that stretches out the door and down the sidewalk but it appears to move fairly quickly.  I ordered a sheet (whole pizza) over the phone and was instructed to bypass the line and just pay up front.  

All in all, I consider this one of my golden finds while here and would definitely come back again and again..!
author: Kenji A.

description:
GARLIC CLAM PIZZA!!!!!! You wouldn't think it would be a thing but these culinary geniuses made it a thing and it is amazing! and they're open late! Their slices are thick and always fresh and delicious, they do not skimp on the toppings. It's also super reasonable, only $3-5 per slice depending on the toppings!


CASH ONLY.
author: Katherine K.

description: Can't go wrong with the Clam Pizza if you don't eat pork. Its the best!
author: Gardenia H.

description: Probably one of the best slices I e ever had on my entire LIFE! Worth the wait. Great customer service, great food, just amazing experience all together.
author: Quanita D.

description:
Best pizza you evere gonna eat in SF! 
It was crunchy, cheesey, and just bomb! It's pretty cheap too. Definitely coming back.
author: Brigitte S.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is my go-to for late night drunchies. The sucky part is it's only cash only. The good part is each slice is dirt cheap that in the end you feel dang rich cause you can eat two slices, feel guilty for it, but not feel guilty for breakin' the bank! $$$$$$$$$

I usually order the combo or pepperoni and if I'm feeling adventurous I order the garlic clam even though I feel it's salty for my liking. The pizza comes in little squares wrapped in red and white checkered paper. Classic.

The crust is on the thicker side but it's by no means a Chicago style pie. The toppings look fresh and they re-toast it in front of you before you eat. I'll always have fond memories of Golden Boy because this is the place I've taken some of my dearest friends to have a bite of North Beach.
author: Connie M.

description: Always a good call to stop for a slice or 4! Love the combo nice crust just enough sauce. The long lines are there for a reason! It's worth it
author: Ty A.

description:
Tl; dr; the pizza is ok, but they're kind of assholes

The pizza is decent. I'll be honest, I don't like clams. The rest of their pies are ok, but I'd recommend Tony's, Little Star, Delfina, Zachary's (East Bay), Delarosa, and some others over Golden Boy. Probably top 15 in San Francisco. A solid 3 stars if it were only the pizza I was rating.

The service is why they deserve 1 star. We waited 45 minutes until they told us, as we walked up to the window, that they were closed. Why couldn't they tell us, 45 minutes earlier, that we'd likely not be able to get pizza? Even 15 minutes? I'm not even asking for a guarantee; just a "we're running low" warning ... It's not required, but it would have been a nice thing for them to do. 

Anyway, I'm personally not a fan of Golden Boy. They're golden only because they're open late; not because of their pizza or their manners.
author: Justin P.

description: Great pizza.  Had a 3 different slices:  the pesto, pepperoni, and combination.  All were good and can't wait to try them again.
author: Jim I.

description: Most likely one of the most delicious sicilian pizza I've had. I really like Sicilian, but usually it's either too soggy, too crunchy on the edges, burnt or just not quite right. But here, it's the perfect medium. One complaint though, could use more cheese, and could be bigger especially at $3.25 for just a cheese slice.
author: Marie D.

description: Delicious! Omg I wish they had one closer to home. Everything about this pizza is amazing.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
the best quick slice ever.
There are definitely better pizzas, but if you just want a slice after a late night, its A+
author: Kamran R.

description: There was a line when we got here but it went pretty quick. Pizza is good but I need more meat!!
author: Linda W.

description:
I LOVE this pizza joint. My boyfriend introduced it to me and i love to come here whenever in the area. I have tried the vegetarian pizza and it is super good. The pizza slices are pretty generous for what you pay. 

I love the atmosphere it has too. The bartenders are wonderful and they are pretty funny when you engage in conversation with them. 

Only wish i had is that it wasn't cash only.
author: Payal R.

description:
HELLA NOSTALGIC, HELLA SF, HELLA CARBS, HELLA NORTH BEACH!!!

What else can I say, when you're in North Beach, one must come here.  I used to come here more frequently during the days of Mangarosa (for those who remember) after catching Samba with scantily-clad samba dancers shaking their tail feather.  

SF North Beach stays open late, unlike the Avenues.  Who doesn't crave pizza on late nights, especially after partying and drinking.  I can't party like I used to, now I'm old and moved to Marin LOL j/k! 

Just know that Golden Boy Pizza is HELLA GOOD!!!
author: Christine R.

description: Well worth the little wait in line. Delicious pizza to either eat there or take home. Whatever the case may be.. it's well worth it! Came up to visit from LA and we had to stop by twice. Great go to as well for a late night craving.
author: Rox C.

description:
I've been here in person once and my housemate has picked it up for me twice. I can always rely on this consistently delicious pizza! 

My go-to's are the veggie slices and garlic clam slices. I've never had a slice like the clam one from here, so it's pretty unique and might I say - very San Francisco (i.e., clam chowder)? Each slice is loaded with just enough toppings, so every bite is packed with a ton of flavor. 

The line was about 15-20 minutes of waiting in the cold at around 9 PM (it's a small place inside) as you stare longingly at the fresh pizza in the window. But this is one of those places I'll always come back to (or at the very least, send my housemate to pick up more pizza, haha!).
author: Melanie W.

description:
Golden Boy is one of my favorite pizza places in SF easily. 
The slices are square, by the slice, and cash only (there is an ATM in the back).

The pizza is really tasty, all of them are great. I love their combo with pepperoni, my girlfriend likes the clam pizza and the veggie. 

The line can be long when the bars are busy, but the line is usually pretty fast.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Best pizza in San Fran. There's often a line outside but it's worth it. I suggest the clam pizza
author: K. W.

description: Over the years, I've grown to like pizza less and less, because the quality of many pizzas has gone way done as its become a fast-food commodity. But Golden Boy reminded me of what good pizza can really be! Many pizza afficionados say that the dough is the most important part of the pie, and I now fully agree. The crust that Golden Boy uses is extremely similar to focaccia bread--soft, tender, yet crusty and chewy. After a short wait in line, I got a slice of the clam & garlic, which came with just the right amount of tomato sauce (not too much) and and topped with a ton of clam, parsley, and cheese (though perhaps a bit TOO much cheese for my liking). The pie had just come out of the oven and was still hot and fresh. Yes, a single slice is rather expensive, but it's definitely worth it for the amazing quality and flavor!
author: David K.

description: Located in North Beach off of Columbus Ave, GBP is my favorite cash only hole in the wall pizza spot. This place never disappoints after a night out of drinking. Beware, there is always a line on the weekends.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Cheese pizza is boring you say?! Nope. Not here. I quite enjoyed the cheese pizza slice! 
Pesto (vegetarian) was one of the best vegetarian pizza I've had. So good. 
Garlic (something?) was pretty garlicky but hubby liked it. 

Overall great pizza place. We'll be back!
author: Amy K.

description: This place was super good! The crust on the pizza was execllent! Super crispy!  My husband loved their pepperoni slice and I loved their combination slice! Can't wait to come back to this place!
author: Tatiana M.

description:
With all its glowing reviews, I was really expecting a lot from here, but unfortunately, I hyped it up for myself too much. 

I got to try their highly revered garlic clam focaccia pizza slice, but I found myself rather unenthused about the flavor. It was okay...not as tasty as I had anticipated. I also got to try the combination, which was just as passable as the aforementioned. 

I'm sure the pizza is good for soaking up the booze after a night out in North Beach, but when you're sober, the pizza isn't all that appetizing. 

Overall, this joint is ideal for those late nights--quick and cheap, but I know you've had better [sober]. Uh, where my Costco pizza at tho? 

+ Beer and wine on tap
+ By the sheet or the slice, eat in or take out
author: Merica S.

description: I didnt know what to expect since it had high ratings but it truly was delicious... I had to try several different ones but my favorite was definitely the pesto one. We had a good walk from fishermans wharf to this little pizza place. By the time we arrived i had burned a good load of calories which really made me enjoy the pizza much more. Highly recommend to come and be ready to wait a while since they do say the lines can be long but worth the wait.
author: Esmeralda C.

description: So good. CASH ONLY. Not a ton of seating inside so go during non busy hours. Just great thick buttery crusted pizza
author: Alex B.

description: Even the plain pepperoni pizza here is amazing. My favorite is the combo though. Delicious food and great 2am munchies
author: Diane H.

description: Really good pizza! Decent prices! Very friendly staff! It's cash only though so be prepared for that. Also, bring a sticker to put on the wall because many customers have done so. My kids had a good time looking at all the stickers but were disappointed they didn't have their own to add. You'll be glad you came here.
author: Lindsey M.

description:
I usually like NY style pizza, but Sicilian pies are really growing on me. There are very few ppl I trust with food suggestions and the one that suggested this place was spot on saying the clam & garlic slice was the best the west coast had to offer in terms of a Sicilian slice. The best is in NYC, duh. 

Clam & Garlic! Sounds like a weird combo of toppings for a pizza, right? Nope, not at all. It's delicious! Taste for yourself why it's their signature :)
author: Grace C.

description: Pizza slices were delicious.  The line was about 15 min on Saturday around 5pm.  If I am in the area, I will definitely try 3 other kinds.
author: Stanley L.

description: Visiting from New York. The pizza is absolutely delicious. Crispy crust lots of flavor. Staff is extremely nice. I highly recommended this pizza shop!!!
author: Laura L.

description:
Bottom Line: Delicious Sicilian pizza by the slice or pan in a small, grunge-trendy atmosphere.

I usually like a New York Style pizza but the thick-crust Sicilian pizza at Golden Boy is so good that I went here twice during my most recent trip to San Francisco.  When in Rome, do as the Romans do so on my first trip I got a slice of the Clam and Garlic pizza.  I don't particularly love clams or garlic but I did really enjoy this slice of pizza which also has wilted spinach or pesto on it - something green.  Neither the clams nor garlic were overpowering and the meal reminded me of a linguine with clam sauce.  On the next trip I tried the veggie pizza and really enjoyed that too. Because Sicilian pizza is thick many people eat it with a knife and fork.  But if utensils aren't for you, I found it easy to eat with my hands by slicing my square piece into thin strips.  BF used a knife and fork to enjoy his pepperoni pizza.

Golden Boy kinda feels like a trendy, dive bar that serves pizza.  You order just inside the door and then the restaurant (using that term loosely) is dark and the walls are cover with corrugated metal and then wallpapered with stickers.  I really like the stickers that are interesting and tell a tale about who sat on the stool and enjoyed pizza before me but some of the stickers seemed more like vandalism and less like a fun form of pop art.  

I think if I got the pizza to go or came here for late night drunk chow, I would give this place five stars. I just might not be cool enough for the funky wall décor.
author: Courtney K.

description: Loved the pizza it was affordable and within walking distance from my place. I ordered the garlic calm pizza and it did not disappoint me. Definitely will come back at a none peak time to order more slices.:)
author: Megan G.

description: Delicious!!!! Love the pesto. Can't wait to try the rest of the flavors.  Pepperoni was ok.
author: Jyoti A.

description:
We loved this place!
From the moment you step inside this tiny place you feel welcomed.  We had 4 slices and two sodas and it was just under $19.00.  CASH ONLY and be sure to tip them, they deserve it. 
Deep dish pizza, hot & fresh and delicious!
The crust is super crunchy with soft middle. Salt, pepper, garlic powder, oregano, Parmesan and hot pepper flakes are available right in front of you...but it doesn't need it. 
Bar stool seating only.
author: Susie N.

description:
Best pizza spot whether you have drunchies or not.

Golden Boy is just a sweet, unique pizza spot. Pepperoni or garlic and clams are my favorite slices. 

Line can get long and parking situations are worse.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Unbelievable that this place lived up to the hype.  The pizza is melt in your mouth fantastic.  We shared the combination and the clam slice and although the clam wasn't my favorite I can certainly appreciate the quality of both.  I even wanted to try it again another night while we were waiting for our table at Tony's, not worth the wait in my opinion but got overruled to try out even another pizza place while waiting for Tony's.  I still wish we had tried another slice of golden boy because the two slices we tried were so different and I imagine each of the other slices would be independently wonderful too.  Til next time golden boy!!!!
author: Gena L.

description: Words just can't describe how good this pizza is.  Like a NY/Chicago deep dish, with a crust that is amazing
author: Terry T.

description:
I ordered a regular pepperoni pizza. It was decent especially since they heat it up in the oven so it comes out hot. I'm not sure I understand the hype though - it was good, but it wasn't the best pizza ever or even the best pizza in the Bay. I wouldn't wait more than 15 minutes for a slice here.

Personally, I thought the crust/dough tasted like pizza hut. If you like the thicker, chewy dough on your pizza, this is for you.
author: Michael L.

description:
Went to this place for the first  time.  Love love the vegetarian and garlic and clam pizza.  If you're in the North Beach area check  then  out.  Go early  since  the  line gets quite long and it's CASH ONLY basis.

Very reasonably priced too.
author: Sonia S.

description:
This was Yelps SF Elite Squads 2nd stop after the Lets Get Irish At Chief Sullivan's Elite Event . This was the Starting Point Of The After Party. 

Golden Boy Pizza is a San Francisco Institution and has almost a Cult Type Following . There's a Good reason for this the Focaccia Bread that they use is The Bomb !! Especially after a good number of Moscow Mules LOL . There was a good sized line when we Arrived . But  its a great place to People Watch and the  people in line are quite Social to say the least. 
So the wait isn't too bad . When  it was my turn . I Ordered a Slice of Pepperoni and a Slice of Garlic , Clam and Parsley . The Slices are Little Square Pieces Of Pizza Pie. They are Wrapped in Red and White Checkerboard Wax Paper. Both Slices were Delicious !!! I really enjoyed Munching out on them . 

Golden Boy Pizza is a Baller On A Budget Approved Establishment!!!

I wished they would open up a Golden Boy in the Eastbay . I would probably be a Regular there .
author: Eugene L.

description: Really good but they barely put any pizza sauce on their pizza. If you're a sauce guy then this prob is not the place to go. If you're a dough guy, this place is great.
author: Garrett S.

description: Awww grew up on this back in the 70's. Good to know its still there. All the Chinese kids would go there after to school back then and use their money to get a square slice of authentic pizza bread.   It was a little oily but no one cared.  It was hot and hit the spot.  I think we paid like .75cents back then for the slice.  Ahh. The good ol' days...
author: Keriena T.

description: No regrets, ever. They serve their pizza hot and fresh! Always the best after a night out.
author: Mako U.

description:
Their pizza is fluffy and tasty. I would advise you to eat it right away since it is best devoured while hot. The staff here has a good system going on, taking orders, filling orders, serving beers, repeat. Quick and easy ordering even though the line was long. 

Favorite slices include the clam and pesto and combo. I'll get the pepperoni only if they ran out of those two. And veggie would be last. Those clam slices go quickly!
author: Sam Y.

description: For vegetarians this place is overrated. They try to put just too many different vegetables into their pesto veggie pizza. This results to a not so enjoyable taste. Another thing I didn't like was their pesto sausce in the pizza, it lacks the required spice blend. Third of all why is it so greasy and cheesy. It's like they soaked the slice in fat bucket. The other day in the morning I had really bad stomach,I guess they are trading off quality for price.
author: Akshit J.

description:
Recently the pies in the morning have given me bad stomach. 

It usually happens with cheese pizza. 

Today I went at around 1 PM and the pizza slice tasted like dirty metallic tray and dishwashing liquid. It also unsurprisingly got my stomach upset.

Please see your hygiene practices, they have slipped. Also customer service has gone way down. Usually a sign of poor leadership, maybe the owner stopped caring.
author: Sam B.

description:
HOLLY PIZZA!!! I was so excited to finally try Golden Boy Pizza! 
I had the chance to try this gem this weekend and let me tell you the pizza was BOMB.Like all great hole-in-the-wall type spots, it's a very small space with limited seating. We ordered at the counter after waiting 15 minutes in line but every minute was worth it!

I had a hard time picking which pizza I wanted and ultimately went with the combo which was very good. The pizza is hearty and although thick, I love that the outer crust is crunchy & seasoned.One square slice of the pizza washed down with Stella on tap was more than enough for me. And to think I actually debated ordering 2 slices. This place is great for late night bite after a long night out in the bars of North Beach!

Can't wait to be in the area again just so that I can grab a bite to eat here :)
author: Mavy A.

description:
So this place caught my eyes a few years ago because it was like 2am and they had a line going up the hill. I told myself that I had to come back and check this place out at some point. 
So I finally did.......
While waiting in line was juiced at the idea that this pizza was going to be on point, the ambiance, the people in the line and the face's of people coming out of the building had me convinced that this was going to some amazing pizza....
Well!!!!!!
It was Aiiiiiight!!!!!!!
I had 1 if each slice of pizza, pepperoni, combination, and clam. I'll Start on the Good Foot, the clam was on point, the saltiness of the clam on the cheese and garlic (GrEAT), now all the rest of the slices were cheese~meat~bread, like with no seasoning at all or it was just missing something. The person I was with said the same thing. I was so disappointed, I just knew I was about taste greatness, more like tasting Lackluster!!!!
I'm not saying to not go there but don't get caught in the hype!!!!!!!!!
author: Brotha S.

description:
One of the pizza places I've eaten in San Francisco! The line was out the door, but it moved fairly quickly. The slices reminded me of Little Cesar's since it was square, but it was nice and "fluffy" consistency to the bread which I love. Not too much tomato sauce and the cheese was just right. Seating here is limited and there are no tables. It's bar-style seating with stools. They also serve beer on-tap.

Now I know why the person who suggested me to check out this place drives all the way from the East Bay just to get a slice. It's that good.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
The line at lunch time told me a lot about this place. The pizza is great. I had a slice of vegi, and split a slice of pepperoni with a friend.  Couldn't eat it all. Love the crispy crust.

The seating is minimal inside, and the stools seem a little close to the counter but it worked, and I'm sure it discourages lingering. I'm sure we will be back.
author: Susan U.

description: You can smell this place from down the street and you can see the fresh square slices of pizza through the window which makes you even hungrier. The line was out the door so we figured it was a good spot. It's a little tight on space once you find a spot but the staff is great and I love the vibe. Their menu has some funny stuff posted up on it and there are several other things that give this place character. Put your phone away and visit with the strangers next to you! Make some new friends! We did! We enjoyed a slice of the pepperoni, the combo and the clam and garlic while watching the Warriors smoke the Rockets on TV! The clam and garlic was definitely different but I liked it! I'd have to say my favorite was the pepperoni though. Great place and we'll stop by the next time we are in the city.
author: Dominic L.

description: Now this garlic and clam pizza was something else... however it is spelt, this was honestly a great hole in the wall spot... good local beer an great pizza... I'm from Southern California and I wasn't disappointed... great pizza with a real local and chill vibe... must go to spot...
author: Mark G.

description: The pizza is totally worth the wait. Pepperoni & combo pizza being my favorite. The clam & garlic is also great but a little too much garlic for my taste.
author: Steff S.

description:
Had the pleasure of trying their vegetarian and clam garlic pizza, delicious nonetheless.

We came right when they opened so the line wasn't too bad. Quick and easy. Choose your flavah and move on. I believe this is ca$h only, just FYI. 

Overall, would come back!
author: Yannie S.

description: The line can get big but moves pretty quick. They have seating inside and I'd suggest one person in your party to stand in line and others to go sit inside. Tried the veg slice which was delicious.
author: Nidhi A.

description: Legit pizza, especially late at night when trying to sober up.  They serve pizzas as fast as they can, but the line still gets longer (depending on time of day/night).  Cash only so be wary of that.
author: Brian C.

description: Meh. It was ok. It was super busy, so I'm assuming everyone else had better pizza than I did that night. I had the vegetarian pizza, by the slice. One slice was filling enough for me, so that's a big plus.
author: Xochi Q.

description: This is a SF go to place for both locals and tourists. Make sure you try the garlic pesto!
author: Elin D.

description: This place is worth the hype. Pretty thick crust, but not too thick. Really good flavor. There's usually a line out the door and it's cash only. Worth it. Totally worth it. It's a small place so you may or may not find seating. The staff is always super friendly and ask about the flavors they have because they always have interesting pizza flavors. I love this place!
author: Lisa O.

description: Best pizza ever! The cheese is amazing and we got our order very fast even though it was packed. I love the square slices and size.
author: Lauren B.

description: Amazing late night pizza! Highly recommend the clam and garlic. There's probably going to be a bit of a line but it moves quickly and it's worth the wait.
author: Nate C.

description: This place is great! Usually a line at night there's a line. Has bathrooms and friendly staff. Would definitely come back.
author: Albert M.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza

The pizza here was amazing and the service was great. We got the pepperoni and clam & garlic pizzas which were fantastic. The slices were placed in the oven as soon as we ordered and were served hot in 5 minutes. The prices are very reasonable too. In fact we came back for seconds in less than 5 minutes after leaving! We are sure to visit back soon.
author: Liza H.

description: Discovered this place a month ago and i can't stop coming back for more!  My absolute favorite is the clams with garlic.  I have tried all of them but the clam is by far the most flavorful.  Always ask them to re toast it so that the crust is crunchy.  Their crust is like focaccia bread.  My new favorite spot for pizza
author: Kim T.

description: I thought this pizza was going to taste like school pizza because square pizza reminds me of school pizza. But it was so good!!! Staff members are so nice! Just sucks that the place is so small and there is a line but it's freakin worth it. I thought Tony's slice house pizza was good but Golden Boy beats it by far in my book.
author: Yarely M.

description:
Best in SF! Just go, you wont regret it! 
CASH ONLY!
author: Dee L.

description: Great pizza the prices are reasonable and pizza is delicious and worth the wait in the long line. The things I don't like is the line especially when it's hot. Also, I don't like that the place is tiny and only takes cash. The service is good very casual. Great place to visit for a bite while enjoying the day or for a funky date night.
author: T D.

description: Found this place on yelp and wasn't disappointed. The pizza tasted like pizza lol. No but it was delicious! Service was on point, prices were not ridiculous and did I mention he the pizza tasted good. I will be visiting this spot on the regular. Great location and plenty of street parking nearby. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed. Nice selection and the right amount of draft beers!
author: Al C.

description: Don't understand what the hype is about- husband and I waited in a 35 minute line amongst 16-20 year old somethings that were ewwwing and aweeeing the pizza in the window- the reviews were excellent so we thought how could 2,000+ people be wrong? We pretty much have eaten pizza all over the globe and certainly all over the US, so we were quite intrigued to discover what all the hype was about. Let me tell you, it's not the pizza. The pizza was terrible. It wasn't the service either. We figured it was the only place in the area to get a single slice of pizza, in any number of flavor selections up to 2:30 in the morning while socializing in line with a young crowd. Definitely not for us! We prefer to not waste our calories on food that probably tastes better when drunk (as more than half the line was)- save the time and save your money, spend a bit more and get some real (good) pizza that doesn't taste like the crust was made with a Pillsbury dough boy roll-out dough.
author: Jessica K.

description:
I came because my friend who lives in the area recommended this place. I was in Little Italy and was going to eat at another place, when the bright neon sign caught my eye instead. Remembering my friend's recommendation, my family and I decided to grab some pizza for a quick bite instead.

There are no table seats inside, only bar stools. You order at the line and then grab whatever seat you can find or just stand around. They had the Cavs Celtics game on their one TV, perfect for their bar atmosphere.

The food itself: My family and I got Combo and Garlic&Clam slices... oh my goodness. SO good. The dough and the crust and just the combination of toppings... everything is absolutely delicious. Perfect with a glass of beer, which they also conveniently offer! The pizza was so good we got two more slices to take home!
author: Lydia K.

description:
Pretty interesting little hipster SF pizza joint. Seeing the tiny little storefront and a barely fitting line out the door, I was a little concerned because I had my mom and dad with me. As we finally wedged our way through the entrance, I glanced at the freshly baked trays of pizza displayed near the window. You order at the register (cash only, ATM in the back) and they bring the pizza to you. The employee was friendly and despite being busy, still managed to bring us water and food promptly. I also like how you can watch them swirl, knead, and make the dough!

The interior of the restaurant is TINY. There are maybe only about 6 stools with a slim counter for seating. Coming with just 1 friend may have worked but I came with two older folks - the stools were also kind of awkwardly placed for me because there isn't a bar to rest your feet on and you can't pull them out. They're shoved almost too inward. There's also a strange shelf that blocks the already dim lighting on about a third of the already slim 10" counter. If they allowed for unfixed stools that might have made it more comfortable. The residual heat from the ovens also made it really hot inside.

The selections were pretty good but I wish they had hamburger/beef or chicken as well. We opted for the clam and garlic, vegetable, and cheese pizzas. A single slice is $3 - $4. A slice and a half would be a good meal for me. The slices are piping hot and about 6"x6". The clam and garlic was very fresh and perfectly salty. I also appreciated how it wasn't fishy tasting. The thicker crust is simply perfect - crispy on the outside, doughy, soft, and breadlike on the inside. The vegetable and cheese pizzas were also solid. 

The food was pretty good, but the discomfort from the seating, lack of options for payment or toppings made me take some stars off :*( I would definitely recommend doing takeout!
author: Anita N.

description: Good pizza. Cash only. Line goes by pretty fast so don't be scared. Tried the garlic clam and combo pizza and both were excellent. I'm more of a thin crust pizza type of girl but golden boy was really good. They toast it for you if you dine in and it was super delicious since it was piping hot
author: Joyce K.

description: Big "meh" from me. Another reviewer said the crust reminded them of Pizza Hut, and while I agree with that opinion, I disagree that that should lead to a 5-Star review. The pizza was fine (overall better than Pizza Hut$, but not spectacular. Service was efficient but not particularly friendly. Sausage was tasty, but pretty skimpy. Decor was "crowd-sourced," with stickers posted all over the walls by patrons, & the stereo was blaring mediocre heavy-metal music. Overall, I'll go somewhere else next time I'm nearby, but I can understand why some people would like it here.
author: Kyle K.

description:
While waiting to eat at another restaurant nearby, we passed by a huge line of people waiting for some pizza. We decided to join since we had to wait 1hr and a half for the original place we were going to eat at. 
Looking at reviews, people raved about the clam and garlic. I was quite unimpressed with it unfortunately. It lacked clam flavor and it was overpowered with garlic. 
I had 3 other people with me and we all seemed to agree it was not that good. 
We also ordered the sausage and cheese pizza which had just come out of the oven and that was delicious! The crust is buttery and fluffy with a little bit of crisp, and the sauce is a little sweet and tangy. Not sure if it's because it had JUST come out or if it's actually delicious. 
I've definitely had better pizza elsewhere, but this place is a decent place to try if you're in the area. Slices are a little overpriced though... sitting at $4+ for a relatively small rectangle.
author: Carolyn T.

description:
Golden Boys, perhaps one of the best pizza joint's in SF. You can either eat this sober or drunk, either way it'll taste HELLA good. 

There's nothing better than a slice of pizza that has a nice balanced with fluffy Sicilian-style dough. Clam Garlic? I'm sold.

Pizza Selections:
Cheese, Pepperoni, Sausage, Clam Garlic, Pesto and Combo. (Most slices are $4.25 each, well worth the $ and it's CASH ONLY!

Luckily my girlfriend lives 3 blocks away from here so I'll never have to be upset about not getting enough Golden Boy. :)
author: Danny L.

description: Eh, not for me. It smelled intoxicating and had a line, so assumed it would be amazing. Was let down. Ok, but not somewhere I would return. Foccocia  style crust, but other than the very edge texture reminded me of very processed white bread tasting. Cheese pizza crust also has some herbs in it, which just didn't taste that great to us. Sorry! Tony's slice house around the corner FAR superior in my opinion...
author: Megan G.

description: Literally the best pizza ever. I had a slice of the combo and garlic clam. The garlic clam is out of this world lol. Seriously life changing slice of pizza. It's a must when you come here! You can really taste the clam and so much garlic flavor. Omgoshhhhh I love the pizza so much. Dying for another slice. The combo doesn't even compare so don't even bother getting anything else. Also, cash only!!
author: Annie H.

description:
Last night, post Elite event a few of us headed over to Golden Boy because there were a few "first timers" in the mix and it's a must experience kind of place. We had to wait in line for about 10 minutes but, the anticipation of consuming this pizza makes the wait tolerable. Plus, you get super anxious that your favorite corner piece of clam, garlic, and parsley won't get taken. In fact, it's kind of like a sick, twisted game. I love it. After ordering a slice of clam and a slice of pepperoni, we found plenty of open stools in the back. 

Armed with a Miller High Life and "2 Minutes to Midnight" by Iron Maiden blasting in the background, I consumed the heavenly focaccia pizza. Guess what? It was as good as ever and I was very happy to be back. It has to be the quality of the focaccia bread that makes these slices so great, right? Whatever it is, this stuff ranks amongst the best in San Francisco and if you are looking for a slice of nostalgia, this is your spot. 

I'll end with the words of Bruce Dickinson from Iron Maiden's "2 Minutes to Midnight" because it's fitting, "The Golden Goose (Golden Boy) is on the loose, and never out of season!"
author: Benjamin F.

description: There's always a line out the door.  I have been in San Francisco for a long time and this place is always suggested by a lot of people who have been this area for a while.  This place opens late also so if you need to curb that midnight craving, then get in line.  The pizza here are cut into squares and the bottom of the pizza has a consistent crunch to go with it.  They have all your tradition pizza toppings, but what separates them is their pizza with clam and white sauce.  The price is reasonable too.  If you haven't had Golden Boy, give them a try, you'd be doing yourself a favor.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Came here the other day with a friend and I am so glad we were walking around and stumbled upon it!

The pizza was really affordable and there was a great vibe coming from the servers and workers in the joint. The only thing that could be a downside for some is that it IS CASH ONLY. 

I highly recommend coming here if you're a pizza lover.
author: Mia H.

description:
Oh boy I don't know how I haven't written a reivew for this place.  Golden Boy is located in Little Italy.  You can't miss this place because the sign simply stands out, especially at night.

Golden Boy is a convenient place to come to when you're on the go and want a quick bite.  There is normally a line even late into the evening on week days.  At $4 a slice prices are pretty reasonable and a slice is filling.  My usual order is the clam and garlic slice. The crust is thick.  The clam, garlic, and parsley combined make a great tasting pizza.
author: Peter C.

description: Favorite pizza spot in North Beach. If you're feeling adventurous you can try a slice of their signature clam and garlic pizza. Beware of the strong garlic taste left in your mouth afterwards. The square slices are each about $3.25 - $3.75 depending on the toppings. The pizza slices are very thick. The restaurant interior has a trendy hip vibe with loud music, sports games on TV, and stickers all over the wall. The seating situation is not great and often feels a little cramped. You get more satisfaction than what you pay for at Golden Boy.
author: Trevor J.

description: BEST PIZZA JOINT IN SF. Love the crust, love the taste, love the shape and the different flavors. It is fresh and good and cheap and I love it! Must try the clam and pesto pizza its bomb
author: Sophie E.

description:
How clam is he?
Do I look like a garlic?
He licks pretty texture to me.
Follow cash only.
Pizzer.
I eat crazy. You know that?
I eat crazy about wanting cheesy to stay out of trouble.
If he was square like me, he would be in this hot mess.
If he was slices like me, he would have ran in that north beach.
You better fork up, man.
You just better fork up.
Get two like me and you don't get hangry.
Watch out for yourself and eating can fill you, man.
We beat the mozzs, man. Cheesed them right in our neighborhood.
It's useful.
Eating ain't no bad.
They're still writing editorials in the internets about you being a pizza.
We are all crust of you.
It's gonna be all dope.
Stay Golden, PizzaBoy.
Stay Golden.
author: Dan B.

description:
For 2000+ reviews, I expected a lot more from Golden Boy Pizza. Don't get me wrong - it's still good and definitely worth a try. But coming here again isn't worth spending 25+ min looking for street parking and getting yelled at from other drivers because Erick T. was pretending to be an Uber driver parked in the middle of the street with his blinkers on. Guess it was reasonable for him to get yelled at because he was was the source of traffic while I ran inside and ordered to go. I'd totally pay $$$ for a parking lot but there was unfortunately none nearby. I guess this is what needed to be done in order to simply grab a slice of the famous Clam Garlic pizza.

The Clam Garlic pizza. Sounds so unique and so interesting... well, it did taste very unique and interesting just like you'd imagine.
