There was surprisingly tons of garlic on the pizza which I absolutely loved because I love garlic, but I prefer to have clams and garlic with my pasta or soup dishes. Or maybe it's because the clam was room temperature so my pizza wasn't really hot? As you all know, the best pizza is always really hot with stringy cheese after each bite. Yum. :0) Dunno, but a regular italian sausage combo pizza from Pizza My Heart would've probably fulfilled my pizza craving for that night. 

Restaurant is extremely small - maybe about 10 bar style seats. Expect to doggy bag your pizza and eat it at home, which TONS of people do! Maybe you can throw it in the microwave too.

P.S. Check out the bathroom! Sort of dark for my liking but sort of cool!
author: Christina L.

description:
They say this place is famous and you kinda have to believe when you see a line forming out the door on the daily. The smells coming from this place are intoxicating and being that I live about 30 steps from this place I always find myself fighting a battle of should I grab a slice or not-no lie. 

They don't make it any easier by having fresh pizzas sitting on display through a glass window. It's kind of a quick stop and go place. You basically pull up, say what you want, get out the way, and wait for them to either warm it up for you or immediately wrap up a fresh slice if you're on the go.

It's limited seating inside and I've only gotten to-go orders so I can't speak on how it is on the inside. The pizzas are great! I've had the veggie and combo and they're bomb. I love the bread to filling ratio- not too much bread and just enough filling. I'm not a big bread fan, so the slices here are perfect for me. 

Individual slices will run you under $5 but they're a decent size for the price you pay. ALSO, it's CASH ONLY, which is probably my only complaint, but do what you do. 

Will I be back? I'll probably get some at the end of the week, so yes.
author: Michael T.

description: Classic late night pizza. Open till after the bars let out. Get there before midnight and the line is much shorter. Call it in and grab it To-go if you are really crafty. Eat in, take out, or right on the sidewalk..yum..
author: Dan W.

description:
Golden boy is a unique neighborhood institution. Its special for the unpretentious accessible product it delivers but more importantly for the one of a kind vibe it creates. 

Its on the opposite side from the likes of delfina on the pretentiousness spectrum, but it gets there without losing any originality which is why it gets the stars :)

Also its super fun to say Goooooooldeeen Booooyeee after a few beers at the local bars.
author: Oleg H.

description: Sicilian pizza!!! Mi amore! I used to go to elementary school a few blocks away, so I've been fortunate enough to have always had Golden Boy in my life. The pizza here is one of the best! I love the clam & garlic and the pepperoni! It's so good! It's so fresh, it's hot, it's perfection! Seriously, if you've never had this before, you have to try it now! And their slices are inexpensive, about $4-$5. There's usually a line, but they have their business down to a science, so you won't have to wait super long.
author: Eva C.

description:
Whoa I haven't written a review yet?

Cash only.

SF staple.

There are only the following types of combinations to choose from: 

Combo (this is my go to every single time)
Veggie pesto 
Sausage
Pepperoni
Cheese
Clam pesto

That's all you need to know. They have beer. Small eat in area with a bar stool style seating so if you have a family and it's a weekend night, good luck.

They heat up the pizza right then and there for you. It's pan style but like a little different, you just have to try it to know what I mean. For some reason, I will never understand why, but it's a really hit or miss type place for people.

Prices are decent for the City. Around $4 a slice and you order as much as you want, no special deals really if you order more or less. 

I could literally eat this every day. It's seasoned well and I just love love love pan pizza. But it's not the cheesy type pan style it's more bready. And the they're squared not triangled. Ok that should do it. Hope you enjoy as much as I do!
author: Guisela L.

description:
I used to think this pizza was only good after I rolled out of Geno and Garlo after beer or ten, but they really do have good pizza. The Clam and Garlic is my personal favorite, but I do not recommend it for a first date. 

The line moves quickly if you stay off of your cell phone, so please don't be that person.
author: Ben L.

description:
Clam & garlic pizza all day every day. The bottom of the crust is so crispy. You get a hint of the tomato sauce. The clams are a little small as you don't taste them much other than the saltiness from the brine. You get hit with a lot of garlic, which I love. Golden Boy is a little small, so you may have better luck standing outside holding the box as a platter. Only downside is that Golden Boy is CASH ONLY. They only have like one oven to heat your pizza, but that's ok. It's worth the wait. 

We got here around 5:50 on a Thursday evening and only had one person in front of us. I guess if you come after 6 during the dinner rush, you'll be waiting more
author: Jake P.

description:
Wow i love this place! I am not sure what happened to my last review but here we go again.Golden boy is my go to pizza joint for those late night turn ups.
The line can be crazy but its the bay you always have to wait for something. They are fast and the pies come to you piping hot. They really do not have much seating so your best bet is to get it to go. The little square pieces are perfect for eating on the run.Just so you know this place is cash only so make sure you put that extra cash in your sock before you it the clubs.I haven't tried everything but  so far i've had  the clam and garlic,Pepperoni and the sausage. Shoot you cant go wrong with any of those choices. So next time youre in north beach check these guys out!
author: Tony B.

description: It was clear and sunny in SF this weekend, and pizza was a great decision - especially at this joint. There was definitely a long line, but it was so lovely out I didn't mind waiting. The pizza is super fresh and piping hot. We got two slices to-go all wrapped up in wax paper, walked over to Washington Square Park, and ate them on the grass. Try the garlic clam!! Super garlicky and flavorful. I am lactose intolerant but I didn't regret taking one for the team with Golden Boy. 12/10 would recommend.
author: Pooja K.

description:
This place is fantastic! We tried every pizza flavor they offered and wasn't disappointed by any of them. The staff is helpful and quickly does their part to take and deliver the orders swiftly. The crust is buttery pan pizza, that absolutely melts in your mouth.

This is a "walk-up" and "by the slice" pizza joint with limited seating. If you are looking for a sit-down restaurant with a large group, this likely isn't the venue for you. With that said, I'd rather order a pizza to go and eat it in the park a few blocks away. 

This is easily the best pizza I've had in my many trips to San Francisco!
author: Brad G.

description: Great place to have pizza by the silce and a peroni! A pizza joint for sure limited seating but food was good. Lots of cool stickers all over the walls !
author: Liz C.

description:
This is a good pizza spot in the city. I came here of course because of the Yelp reviews I read and I wasn't disappointed. The garlic clam pizza was packed with flavor in every single bite taken. The texture of the bread was good as well. I feel it would have been better had I be fortunate enough to try it fresh out of the oven although it's one of those places that's it's luck of the draw with your timing of arrival. 
The Pepperoni pizza was my least favorite slice here, the sauce was just okay and the bread felt to overwhelm just about everything else as far as taste and texture. 
I do recommend if you come here to stick to the garlic clam pizza that I feel is their most famous and recognizable option. 
Great staff working here, two girls and a guy cooking the pizza, all which were very polite.
author: Ryan S.

description: I loved the atmosphere of this shop. Very laid back and chill, like I was walking into my brothers room with loud music and the game playing on the TV. It had a diner feel to it because of the long bar and small space beside. I would come back for a beer and maybe to try the garlic and clam pizza but the pepperoni I got wasn't all that tasteful. Seemed bland for all the hype it got.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
If you're looking for a quick slice, or something inexpensive and filling, Golden Boy Pizza is the place for that. It's a small, old-school pizza counter that can easily be missed, but slightly more noticeable at night when the neon-lighted hand with index finger pointed towards Golden Boy is lit up. The pizza is displayed by the window. The interior is a long narrow bar with very busy graffiti & tin-wall decor. 

Mr. Joy & I once got a few slices here for V-Day, because pizza sounds so much more satisfying than a boring prix fixe menu. 
Plus, we both like focaccia, especially when it's fresh, fluffy, and warm. I haven't had too many Sicilian, or focaccia-style pizzas, but Golden Boy's pizza does execute well. The thick crust has a nice crunch. It is also quite fluffy and not too chewy, so it doesn't end up feeling like you're chewing on a lot of bread. 

I've tried the Pepperoni, Combo, & Clam & Garlic. Each slice or square is pretty big and can feel heavy pretty quickly.
Pepperoni is always good. 
The Combo is not bad, but the vegetables could use more roasting time and a little more seasoning. 
The Clam & Garlic pizza is covered with chopped cilantro. A lot of people mistake it for pesto at first glance. It seems like a lot of people point to the Clam & Garlic and refer to it as 'pesto.' Sometimes the person working the counter gets pretty annoyed repeating, 'That is the clam & garlic' all day long. I would be annoyed too, but can't they just make signs? 
Anyways, it's good to try, but not great. Sometimes, it tastes more like garlic & cilantro than anything else. On the plus side, the clams are nice & savory, and are covered in cheese, so that prevents them from tasting too chewy. 

There's also a pretty nice beer selection. Bummer that they do not accept cards. Cash-only is inconvenient, but for about $3-$4 a slice, I guess I can't complain too much.
author: Joy W.

description: A great place for focaccia pizza with an awesome dive bar vibe! The line can look pretty overwhelming but it tends to move pretty quickly. I had the combination pizza and the garlic and clam and will say that both were great! The clam and garlic is pretty heavy on the garlic so maybe not the best choice for date night but to each their own!
author: Helen F.

description:
Hear about this place and need to see for myself. As I was waiting for my pizza at least five other people walked past and commented that this is the best place in SF for pizza. 

Wellll it was pretty darn good!!
author: Mandy P.

description: Gereally I prefer thin crusted triangles over thick crusted squares... But the Pizza is soooooo bomb here. I got the pepperoni/sausage and the garlic/clam. Both were phenomenal! I do wish it was in a better location though, but that's the only thing. Don't be off of by the line down the block. It moves pretty quickly.
author: Christian F.

description: Every time I'm in San Francisco I have to get pizza here! I'm beyond addicted to this place and I love that they're open late! There's usually a line but it tends to go pretty quick!
author: Marlene B.

description:
I was so excited to finally try Golden Boy Pizza! On a weekday lunch, it was busy but not crowded. Like all great hole-in-the-wall type spots, it's a very small space with limited seating. We ordered at the counter and snatched the last two seats. 

I had a hard time picking which pizza I wanted and ultimately went with the combo which was very good. The pizza is hearty and although thick, I love that the outer crust is crunchy & seasoned.. almost tasted like garlic bread. One square slice of the pizza washed down with Stella on tap was more than enough for me. And to think I actually debated ordering 2 slices. I'll definitely be back to try the garlic clam pizza!

-- Update: I returned for the garlic clam pizza and it was delicious! You must really love garlic to get this slice of pizza since there's quite a lot of garlic & it was hours before I could taste/smell anything other than garlic. Only a few people lined up around noon. By 12:30pm, the line was 10-15 people deep so come early!
author: Ruby C.

description:
Reminded me of spots in Florence, such good, unpretentious pizza.  Walk up counter, long line, but worth every minute.  The dough is light and fluffy squares with cheesy, meaty, veggie goodness...oh, and a clam and garlic pizza for the win!  

My only recommendation is letting me open a spot in Sacramento!
author: Paul P.

description:
I liked the pizza. Got 4 slices. Pepperoni, the clam one, combo, and cheese. 

Love all the madness of the stickers everywhere. Guys behind the bar were cool and keeping it going with efficiency. I like small places like this. 

I really wish they had ranch, I know it might be a sin to ask for it but it would have been nice. 

Didn't booze but heard they have cheap drinks. 

We got there and there was a line out the door. I don't know what the hype was all about. It was worth the wait but the hype seemed too high. 

And they only take cash.  And that brings me to another point. Always carry cash. It drives me nuts when people don't carry cash. You need it for emergencies and pizza.
author: David H.

description:
Somehow this has become my go-to pizza place when I'm depressed. I like to get a slice and a beer and look at the stickers my ex put on the wall. 

Their veggie slice is hella good. If you're into seafood you definitely need to try that clam slice. I'm fine with two cheese. I love that they give you a fork and knife if you dine in - the slices are so deep and gooey. 

These days there is a line out the door but you get your food really quickly. I'm pretty sure it's cash only which is coo because then a lot of people leave the line to go to the ATM and you get to the front even faster.
author: Aarie C.

description: The only reason I give this a 3 Star is because it is too hot to eat inside, small place and no tables to sit outside. BUT the pizza is to die for I love it!
author: Nancy O.

description: throw away that garbage digiorno pizza where it belongs and come here. when you casually walk by a place window shopping but it's food? you look at it and think to yourself like holy mother of ghost that looks slap AF and guess what??! it was. when it comes to pizza, this has become one of my top choices no doubt
author: Richard J.

description: I loved this place after riding 20+ miles over the hills and through the streets of SF. Ate 5 slices and wasn't disappointed by any of them-sausage was my favorite. As square pies go, there are legit reasons why this place has been open for so many years.
author: Ray F.

description: This is the best late night spot for pizza in San Francisco. Don't be surprised if there is a long line cause there typically is but oh man it is so worth it, even when you're sober! The pizza is like a Sicilian style, square slices, crispy crust with soft chewy dough. The pizza is fairly simple. Sold by the slice, CASH only which is annoying but the quality of the pizza it's worth a stop at the ATM. The menu options for the pizza are simple they only have a handful of options but the good old cheese and pepperoni I think are best. If you're hungry late night and craving pizza this is definitely a place to check out.
author: Peter P.

description:
Holy Cow!! 

100% Italian
100% New Yorker born and raised...
This Sicilian pizza was the bomb! I have been in Cali for 10 years and never got a slice that tasted so much like home. These guys are the real deal! Super bomb pizza. I wish i took some back down to SoCal with me! Also the pizza guy in the front was so awesome. He had customers of the door the whole time and was a machine but no matter how busy he got his customer service was flawless. 10/10 if you are looking for the best pizza in San Fran you better stop here!
author: James M.

description: DAMN!!!!! The best pizza I have ever had!  The crust was thick and fluffy with a perfect crispy-ness to it! LOADED with topping and full of flavor!  Perfection!
author: Natalie C.

description: Got the pizza to go after reading reviews. Kinda long line out the door, but we patiently waited and the pizza paid off! Delicious and hot! They expertly packed up our 4 slices and we were out the door in no time! Seemed like a cool atmosphere inside, but definitely not for big groups. Next time we're in San Francisco, we'll be back!
author: Christopher W.

description:
Sevice was nice, i always seen this place super packed it was clean very welcoming their
Combo pizza slice was the bomb. But their cheese slice was la king cheese.

As a 225 pound men with a pizza belly i know cheese pizza 

It was ok the rest was awesome
author: Don Y.

description: Pizza was bomb. Would definitely recommend this to my friends.  Staff was cool and atmosphere is very hip.  Its CASH ONLY!  So make sure you take out a 20 at least.  Authentic italian pizza though, and no, Oscar de La Hoya does not own this place.
author: Joseph R.

description:
I know where my pizza by the slice to-go-to place is!!! I LOVED the garlic clam pizza - piping hot from the oven. The crust is spectacular - a thick, crunchy, and yet very airy. It wasn't overloaded with cheese, which I feared, and the garlic + clam taste to it was very satisfying. 

Great dive place with a casual vibe. For $4.25/slice it's a little pricey but very filling. I wished there were more variety though but I'll probably be sticking to the garlic clam since it was just that good!
author: Cindy W.

description: This place is really cool. At first I did not like it but it really grew on me. Pizza is so delicious (specially the cheese) They have a great variety of beers and everything is very affordable. I really like the vibe and how chill it is. Definitely coming back next time I go to San Francisco
author: Laura R.

description:
I came here while visiting little Italy in San Francisco. The overall feel for the place was similar to a dive bar, but with pizza. The service was quick and easy and I was able to get a couple slices within a few minutes. 

The pizza itself was good, I had a slice of pepperoni and a slice of cheese. Bang for buck, the pizza is worth it if your in the area. The only issue I had was that the pizza were square slices, but I suppose that's a preference issue (I like triangles).
author: Giorgio G.

description: This place has a very cool and friendly vibe and delicious American pizza. I had slices of the pepperoni and pesto veggie. Both were hot, had plenty of tasty toppings and a nice crisp base. All watered down with a cold Stella.
author: Ratnesh S.

description: This pizza is AH-maze-BALLS! Be ready to wait in line but trust, it is worth the wait. I only got once slice because I wasn't really hungry but one slice left me drooling and wanting for more. The crust alone is great!
author: Lisa J.

description: The crust is what makes this pizza so amazing! Its thick and has a light crispiness at the bottom. Clam and garlic is where its at even though I taste more garlic than clams...didn't really taste the clams at all. There aren't alot of seats so you'll either have to keep a lookout for people leaving or find a bar area to stand and eat if there's space. This is definitely a fork and knife type of pizza so don't expect to be able to stand on the sidewalk and eat with your hands the way you would with a New York pizza. What I like about this place is you won't have to worry about ordering a type of pizza that has been sitting in the window for a while because they'll immediately throw it back into the oven and heat it up to a melty crisp for you. So just order what you want, it will all taste great.
author: Lina P.

description:
The best pizza in San Fran!!!! Love their pepperoni!!! 

Also they have a clam and garlic pizza that my brother loves. You have to come here. If you get here when they open it's hot and fresh!! Thanks for always having the best pizza!
author: Missy L.

description:
Delicious Sicilian (square) style pizza. The dough is perfectly thick, chewy and moist while the bottom is crispy. They always have four options to chose from, including one vegetarian pesto pizza, that you can order by the slice or by the sheet. I recommend the garlic and clam pizza: salty, garlicky and delicious! 

A few negatives: 1. Only getting one slice 2. Seating is rough, but when it's a nice day out grab a slice and hit the park!
author: Adriana G.

description: Cash only!! You could definitely call it a hole in the wall but that only increases the charm in my opinion. Pizza is heated fresh for every order and ridiculously good. The man behind the counter was very nice, definitely a great place to stop by for a quick bite while touring the city or to take back to your hotel. Very fresh and very delicious. I already know I'm going to crave this stuff when I go home
author: Elisabeth G.

description:
Damn good pizza that really hits the spot. The flavors of the pizza are really good and I quite enjoy the crust since it's crisp and golden. I like that the pizza doesn't have too much sauce, which is usually something that turns me off. I just wish there were other types of pizza with white sauce since I don't like clams. I liked the pepperoni and the combo. They just hit the spot.
Remember this place is cash only and it's super popular so bring your patience too.
author: Jenn T.

description: I have a handful of favorite pizza places and this is definitely one of them! Living in the city you hear of a lot of good places but this one is famous! Almost always open late night but after they close the inside it's CASH ONLY so remember to bring cash. Pizza is amazing, delicious and fresh! A must go to if you love good pizza!
author: Chanel F.

description: We landed in San Francisco in the evening and wanted a hearty meal. Walked about a mile to get here and the reviews were honest. This is one of the best Pizza pies you can eat. The team is friendly and to the point. Pizza slices (square and deep dish, on a focaccia bread) are just the way you need to do them. We were a party of 2 and had 2 slices each, my wife got the cheese and pesto and I got a Combo and a clam with Garlic. Fell in love with the place, they are going to be closed for a few days, but am sure we will be visiting them before we fly back to India.
author: Gagandeep S.

description: Can't get any better - be it a comfort food day, a friend's visit to city or a late night food spot - Golden Boy Pizza is always our go-to place. Their clam garlic, pepperoni, cheese, veggie,.. and all other pizza slices - everything is so good and delicious.
author: Nikita A.

description:
Pretty much the only thing in North Beach that I'm familiar with.. I always get the Clam and Garlic pizza and it's OK. It looks and smells better than it tastes but the crust is really good. 

I just really like the ambiance of this place. I love looking at all the stickers people post on the walls while I eat and have even posted a sticker of my own once. :)

I love that this place is open late so I always make it a point to visit here if I'm ever in the area. Saw a show at Cobb's Comedy Club so of course, I had to stop by! Would I take the trek out here though? Nah, but it is undeniably an SF staple.
author: Jayne S.

description: It's that queue where you wind up with your friends at some time of day or night. I didn't go here for years until I was taken one night. The line of friendly folk waiting for a pizza. Usually a homeless person courting you for a dollar. Grab and go fluffy yet crunchy crust and cheesy goodness. It's amazing how it defibrillates you back into existence. Broccoli and/or clams seem popular here on the pie...no thank you.  Cheese please.
author: David S.

description:
This is really good pizza.
Ordered this pizza for a large group for carry out.
We got two very large pizzas.
The taste was amazing and it fed 11 people with plenty of leftovers.
I would recommend this place.
I will definitely be back.
author: Kevin S.

description:
After a few drinks nearby, food was on my mind.  I asked him if there were good fries nearby and he mentions Golden Boy Pizza.   Fries over Pizza but whatever, can't lose with pizza.  "Bout to blow your mind in pizza" he says and a few minutes later, he's back.  The line can get pretty long, supposedly, but somehow he managed to get back pretty quick.  Being the ungrateful b*tch that I can be, I don't think I thanked him.  As he picks up a slice and attempts to feed me, again, being the ungrateful b*tch that I can be, I said "I have hands, I can feed myself!".  Hope you like a little sass with your pizza.

Clam Garlic - I'm more of a thin crust person but I love carbs in general so this pizza, especially the toppings were good.  I have to admit, I didn't nibble on it too much due to too much alcohol consumption but from what I remember, I enjoyed it.
author: Linda N.

description: Less than $4 for a hefty slice of pepperoni pizza.   It was delicious and I was surprised how much I like it as I typically don't like thicker pizza.  Lots of tasty stuff on it and cooked perfectly.  Could explain why there was a line out the door and I couldn't resist finding out why.  Now I'm a fan of this place.  Kinda in the back of the main streets so you have to look for it around the corner.
author: Steve T.

description:
In town for the weekend from LA. Walked past this spot over the weekend and today we decided to wait in the line that continued to build up the street. We tried the Clam & Garlic, Pepperoni, Combination, and the Sausage. First off, the owner (I can only assume) was extremely nice and attentive. I heard him thank and check on every person while we waited for our pizza. The staff obviously  cares that their customers have the best experience possible. Even with the line growing outside, with a staff of what might have been 4-5, they kept the establishment clean and made sure condiments were filled for the customers pleasure while fulfilling the orders at hand.. 

Will never forget this spot. You can't find pizza like this along with great customer service in LA. The pizza was so flavorful and delicious but the Clam & Garlic was amazing. Thanks guys!
author: Alexzandra R.

description: So good. The slices are bigger then they look in the window but are a very good price.The staff was also very friendly.
author: Emma J.

description:
Maybe I was hungry or mainly it was a pretty damn good slice.

Slices are square and if you don't like crust, get the center piece. Meaty, doughy, chewy and all around yummy (you see the pun?!). This place has restored my faith in pizza for under $4 a slice.
author: Julie L.

description: Don't forget to bring cash! Love the simplicity in ordering! Great pizza, great service. So fluffy and yet you get a crispy crust! Yuuuummmm! Also great for little ones, my 9y and 3y both loved it!
author: Lynnette V.

description:
One of my SF favorites. One of the best freakin' pizza slices ever!
- clam & garlic 
- pepperoni & cheese
- everything 

... my go to's
author: Mae M.

description:
The only mistake I made during my visit here was not getting another slice lol. 

Cash only, slices are at most 4.25 each. 

It really doesn't matter what topping of pizza you get, the crust is what makes it so good. Crispy and it has a nice crunch, a great platform to hold all that cheesy goodness...

Place is a tad bit small but I see people standing around inside and outside eating their pizza. The majority of the people are probably faded anyway, so who cares lol

10/10 woulddddd eat again!
author: Catherine T.

description: For the price of pizza this place hits the spot. I tried the clam and pesto pizza as well as the combo and both were very tasty. The restaurant gets pretty packed through the night and they are cash only. Luckily there's an ATM in back so utilize that if you want cheap, good pizza.
author: James B.

description: Without question this place serves the best pizza I have ever consumed. The crust was a perfect mix of crisp and light and soft. The decor and vibe was very welcoming.
author: Aubrey H.

description:
I love this place!

Been coming here for years.

Really good pizza, price is good, beer, drinks, TV with sports, great location, hole in the wall in North Beach, non-comformist punk music playing all the time.  What's not to love?
author: Jason R.

description: My favorite pizza in San Francisco.  Great ambience and location.  The draft root beer is great.
author: Gary C.

description: My absolute favorite pizza in North Beach!  Busy at lunch time, but worth the wait. Two thumbs up!
author: Sean R.

description:
All I got to say is this starting off this review.....Clam Garlic Pizza....Boom! The Bomb! And let me just say this much I made the big mistake of just getting once slice, I should of gotten two, especially at the price of ($4.50). This place has definitely left an impression on me, one that has me torn between the other two North Beach pizza restaurants I like. But, this place isn't the "Golden Boy" for no reason. Let me rant about this place for a little bit....

2 - 28 - 16
My Mission : To grab something quick to eat and finish watching the Oscars. I was wanting to get back in time to see if Mr DiCaprio was going to take home that best male Oscar....anyway as to not stray so far away from the point of the review. I asked my bartender at Grant and Green.."Yo I need something to grub on to balance my buzz level" he said "Golden Boy Pizza Kid" so me being a the Yelper I am I stepped outside G&G (Grant and Green) and as I was about to type the place in on Yelp I just looked to my left and seen the small line and then the amazing smell.....yea no need to "Yelp it Out" at that moment "I saw the sign, I opened up my eyes and saw the sign" Golden Boy Pizza, even the finger pointed to where it was at.....cleaver!

5/5 stars for the way they displayed their product....fresh and hot pizza in the window which just made you want to crack the window and steal some slices and run! Man I was in shock to see the pizza leaving faster than they could replace it in the window. I was hoping the greedy people ahead of me hurry up because I was hungry, buzzing and wanting to see if Leo was going to get that Oscar. All the slices they had looked amazing but one stood put in particular as I pulled out my phone and checked out some reviews and pics of this place, as well with checking in. The Clam Garlic Pizza seemed to be the star attraction, based off reviews and the two dudes in front of me talking about it. I like, Pizza, Clams, and Garlic soooooo my mind was made up.

I finally got in and the fast moving cleark greeted me with a "Man that's a dope chain" and I smile and thanked him and said...."I want that Clam Garlic Pizza Slice Yo!" he nodded and gave me a nice and piping hot slice, it had just been replaced so I came at a good time :D I hurried back to G&G with my slice and "The Oscar for Best Male went too....." Leonardo DiCaprio just as I had hoped it would and in the midst of the cheering I took my bite into the pizza slice.....

This pizza is unlike any seafood pizza I've ever had let me tell you. The crust was buttery, light and surprisingly not to greasy,  it had a nice crisp to it yet it had that nice chew to it. SF Focaccia bread style pizza, the perfect balance! The clams wasn't over cooked, and the garlic wasn't overbearing, everything complimented each other nicely, over all this was a nice slice of pizza and I honestly regretted not getting two. Because when I ran back the dude said it was going to be a wait for the next pizza....dang I had somewhere to be so waiting wasn't really an option at that moment.

Will I be Back?

Umm..Yea! This place makes bomb pizza and propabubly moves to "First" in my favorite North Beach pizza joints. This place is like the "Gold" standard when it comes to pizza now in my book. This place is small, but has a lot of character and judging by the consistent action and the quickness of the pizza moving here, I'm not ths only person that things this place is special.

As always, Yelp your own experience if you come here, take a snapshot and get a slice of that Clam Garlic Pizza!
author: Tre S.

description: BEST PIZZA EVER!!!! You never think of pizza when you say something "melted in your mouth" but this was totally the case with this pizza! Definitely worth the short wait in line! It all looked delicious but we tried the pesto veggie... soooo good!
author: Robyn A.

description: I live in LA and go here whenever I'm in town it's the first thing I do. Everyone is super friendly and nice no problems at all. I love the Pepperoni pizza I get 3 slices and coke. I need to get shirt because I just love this place it's really awesome! Thank you guys you guys are awesome!!
author: Andrew V.

description: Nabil is the best and the pizza is incredible. Must visit this pizza spot... I recommend the pesto veggie :)
author: Briana S.

description: This place is an SF must when visiting to any newbies in the area! The pizza is great and it was a traditional Italian/SF feel to it. Definitely recommend to all! Also, I'm from SF so I know what I'm talking about :)
author: Joseph S.

description: The pizza isn't terrible but it's far from amazing. If your a vegetarian there a lot of toppings available at least. I am not sure why people think the pizza is so good. Maybe they just haven't had really good pizza before? Fast and friendly service or it would have gotten 2 stars. Don't forget to bring cash because it's a cash only establishment.
author: King Y.

description:
When you're craving for a slice or two of pizza in North Beach or Chinatown, this is the place to go.  Always hot and always delicious.  The pesto and cheese sausage pizzas are always top notch and solid.  Cash only however, and this place does get crowded so be prepared to stand in line for at least 10 minutes or more in the day or when the bars are about to close.  It's also small, so seats are limited but people usually leave after grabbing a quick slice.

Parking is a problem, so Uber or just walk over from the 45 or 30 MUNI bus line.
author: Chan L.

description: I always loved this place. The line can get long but it goes by quick. Get the combo! It's my favorite!
author: Susan Y.

description: 10/10 Hands down some of the best focaccia pizza or just pizza in general I have had in the city of San Francisco. Cash only quick service.
author: Ajay N.

description:
Can't go wrong with the slices here, just amazing every time,,, that is all!
Everyone is so nice and eating in or taking out, the best experience. My two year old loves it too!
author: Tina T.

description: Good pizza, great customer service - not worth the 1hr+ long wait. I wasn't even hungry when I got in line, so I can imagine how people with normal appetites felt.
author: Hannah D.

description:
They are a victim of their own success.  Super popular means they are inundated with tourists at all hours. Inundated with tourists means that their servers over the last year or so have gotten a lot less friendly. Today was kind of the culmination of it - they decided to close on time - which is fine, but the lame part is that they didn't warn anybody they were closing.

So about 15 mostly drunk people wasted 20 minutes of waiting in line with no indication that they weren't going to be served.  And because they're so popular, they can keep being lousy to people, so i'd rather go somewhere who needs customers enough to keep being nice to them.
author: drew n.

description: The best pizza ive had in a very long time. Long line down the street during dinner hour but there's a good reason why, its delicious and affordable. Love the atmosphere too. All around, 5 stars!
author: Irene R.

description:
In the midst of all the Santa Con activities, I managed to grab a bite to eat. Sure enough, Golden Boy Pizza came to my rescue.

If you can look pass the long lines and their *CASH ONLY* policy, you'll come to realize that their pizzas are the best late night meals. Their pizzas are freshly made. The crust has a nice crunch. The center is warm and chewy. 

Incontestably their Garlic Clam pizza is the most popular dish on the menu. But the garlic overpowers the pizza that I'm always left with a pungent smelling breath. As basic as it may seem, my favorite has been their pepperoni pizza as it not as oily as most pizza joints that leave me self-loathing.
author: Denzell S.

description: I only had one slice of sausage and cheese the next morning. So I wasn't able to eat their pizza fresh but it was good. Their pizza reminded me of New York style Sicilian pizza square shape pizza. I heard their clam pizza is really the hit, I wasn't able to try it but I was glad we got a slice of sausage and cheese it was very good.
author: Jaci Y.

description:
I had to try the clam and garlic pizza, but the veggie veggie pesto was still steaming hot and calling out to me.  What's a girl to do?

I think it's great to try out this San Francisco institution once, but the flavors didn't stand out for me.  Or maybe I'm just not into clam pizza.  I've had it in the past at a famous place in SOHO, which was known for its clam pizza.  And this was def better.  So if you're into clam pizza, get yourself over here!
author: Lan N.

description:
Best pizza in the world. Get a sheet, order whatever you want - our usual is 1/2 pepperoni, mushroom and olives for the hubby and my 1/2 is pepperoni, mushroom and pesto boy oh boy - the ratio to the crust to the cheese to the sauce, to the toppings...wow. Pop it in the toaster oven, we can eat this for few days and it tastes exactly like it did he first day. Hubby will actually drive to the city just for this pizza and he hates going to the city. 

Or if you want a quick lunch. Get a slice of a clam pizza, or veggie pesto or pepperoni. I love you Golden Boy.
author: Nicole M.

description: Good tasting pizza, quick service. I got the pepperoni and the pesto one. Would come back
author: Abhay D.

description:
Golden Boy is a great spot for a late night bite. I had the garlic and clam pizza. It's a square style pizza with toppings covering every inch of it. It's truly a pizza for garlic lovers. The crust wasn't as crispy as I hoped, and it didn't have any char. 

They had a bunch of draft beers including some craft options. The selection focused on IPAs and hoppier beers.
author: Joseph T.

description:
Yelp hype! Nonetheless this was one of the best pizza joints that I have ever ventured into.  Like many other reviews have mentioned before me, the garlic clam pizza was simply amazing, and it looked so delicious, sitting in that hot steamy tray.

They have various other pizza choices, but the garlic clam seems to be their best seller and we were fortunate that they prepared a fresh batch when we were about to order.  I regret only getting one slice because it was extremely light, yet jam packed with flavor.   Depending on now long the tray of pizza has been siting under the heat lamps near the window, they might warm it up for you, but it still tastes amazing.

On the garlic clam pizza, they gave a generous amount of clans that you can actually see and taste, with the garlic providing another dose of flavor.  I wish I could come back again and get me another slice, but I'm back in Los Angeles now.  

Cash only, lines can get long on the weekends for those craving pizza after a night of drinking, but hey it's just that amazing, so wait in line!
author: David L.

description: Good pizza in SF is hard to come by. People may disagree, but I have eaten a lot of pizza in my life and I can say that the majority of pizza in SF is only ok. Golden Boy is good. It tastes good, they have beer, soda, maybe wine idk, and a really cool little restaurant to eat it in. If you're into stickers, like graffiti stickers and stuff, this place is a must see. It's a de facto museum. It's up in North Beach with a lot of neat shops to walk around nearby. CASH ONLY. ENJOY.
author: Kevin M.

description:
A+++ pizza place. 

Oh my gosh, I can't get over this pizza place. I'm so glad I decided to drop in randomly. Best pizza I have had so far. 

The slide is not too thick nor too thin. Perfectly crunchy. My favorite is their CLAM AND GARLIC combo. It is their most popular combo. The pizza is not too salty, not too bland. It was perfectly garlicky. I was pretty skeptic about seafood being on pizza but I got hooked!! 

The slide is huge for ~$4. Box is an extra 25 cents I think. The place is kinda small. Everyone just eats outside in front of the store.
author: Veronica N.

description: Walk up and order. Long lines and not much indoor seating but delicious pizza. Would highly recommend if you are taking out or at least aren't counting on sitting down.
author: Melissa L.

description: Damn that pizza is goooood! We waited in line at 2 am after the bars closed for maybe 15-20 minutes, and I would do it again and again. Holy moly. Definitely the best pizza I have had in SF, and maybe ever. I got the Hawaiian, and cheese, and it melted in my mouth like no other. It was 4 bucks a slice, so pretty reasonable too. There is going to be a wait, but if you are looking for some awesome pizza, Golden Boy is a golden move. You gotta do it!
author: Ross S.

description:
This place is close to my house and hence I go here quite often, mostly because I am lazy at on weekends to cook, and this places is open late at night, plus has really delicious hot pizza.

There is always a queue, but its worth the wait, you can see all the delicious pizzas on display.
This place is really good if you are looking for a midnight not-so-expensive pizza bite, or are crazing for food( like so many of us after a few drinks on a friday night)
author: Vipul S.

description:
Probably the best Sicilian style pizza you will find in SFB.

Good variety of toppings and fast service.
author: Serious E.

description:
ERR MAHH GEEERD! GARLIC PARSLEY CLAM PIZZAAAA! **CASH ONLY**

After a day of exploring the city and day drinking, it was just fitting to grab a pizza for dinner prior to the beginning of our hang over. Although the line was pretty long, I couldn't help but wait to try their clam pizza. 

For $4 a slice, you've got yourself a warm and freshly made slice of your choice of pizza. If you're in no rush, dine in and pair it with one of their beers on tap! 

Even a day after I'm still thinking about the warm combination of cheesiness, clams, and garlic!! I'll definitely be returning, maybe to bring my out-of-town visitors and possibly to order one of their full sheets! Golden Boy Pizza, you is doin it right!
author: Jana V.

description: 3.5 stars. We ordered a slice of the garlic clam. Nice and garlicky, which we loved! Friendly service. Just not "amazing" pizza...not a huge fan of softer thicker crust. Personal preference.
author: Ashley C.

description: Having returned to SF after 9 years I was thrilled to discover the golden boy is still around!  The square is a pizza taste the same and the staff is still nice and friendly. Prices are still relatively reasonable for San Francisco. You can score 2 slices and a soda for $10 or less. They still use great ingredients and big thick slices of vegetables on top of their pie's. And I love how the crust is soft on top and crisp on the bottom. This will continue to be a staple place for me to visit while I'm back in the city.
author: Robert C.

description: It was a sunny day walking around the North Beach district with two of my friends that I brought along with to San Francisco, breaking their City cherries. We were looking for a quick bite to eat: something not too big, but just right to snack on before adventuring to other neighborhoods. We came upon this small shop due to the line that was piling through the entrance that only fits one person at a time. When it was time for us to order, the worker helping us pointed out which pies were which. We decided to share two slices of the clam and garlic pizza between the three of us. I will tell you, I was shocked out how good this pizza was. The first thing you taste is garlic, then you bite into the perfected texture of the crust, and pieces of clam in each bite. At only four bucks for a sizable slice of one of the best pizzas I have ever eaten, I have to say, damn good stuff.
author: Anthony P.

description:
You're drunk. You want pizza. Golden Boy is your spot. 

These thick-crust, square pies definitely hit the sauced-up spot, and the late night line for slices attests. I broke a decently-long-standing carb-free diet to chow down on some much needed alcohol sponge here, and loved every bite. Especially the clam pizza, which is the standout specialty here. However the sausage pie is damn good too. 

The crust is thick and doughy, but at the same time not too bready or dry. A perfect softness. Like a damn good focaccia. The cheese and toppings are generous. The service... serves. 

Overall, a total dive with a very solid pizza offering.
author: Don B.

description: Everything about this place is perfect! I tried the garlic clam one, and the flavor was phenomenal. The bread was nice and thick, with a soft center and a crispy crust. The slices are pretty substantial, so I think 2 pieces would be perfect for a regular meal. I'll definitely be coming back when I can!
author: Diane Z.

description:
I really didn't want to come here initially, but I'm super glad we did. It's defiantly a whole in the wall, but all the best cheap places are. We had three pizza slices and a beer for $20. Not a bad lunch in SF.  Also the kitchen area looked pretty clean, watched them making the dough by hand was neat. 

Cons: You may have to stand because the place is small
author: E L.

description: Was in town and of course I had to get some slices from here. First night my friend did not feel like going out. So I ran down and picked up slices to go. This is the trip I realized as delicious as their pizza is, you have to eat it there for the full experience. Reason being is that when you take your order to go, the pizza crust soften from the heat. Over steamed that is. Of course it's still delicious but when you eat there, then you get to the full experience of that lightly crispy crust. So do yourself a favor and dine it. This place is easily my favorite pizza in the city.
author: Minga T.

description:
This place has a special place in my heart.  Something about it makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside.  5 stars for ambiance, 5 stars for beer, 5 stars for location, 5 stars for that garlic clam pizza (omg so fucking good.)  

One star taken off because the other slices are kinda so-so.  I might give the other slices a shot another time and update the review if necessary... or I'll just forever go for the amazing delicious sure thing that is that garlic clam pizza.  Hot damn.
author: Emma A.

description: This place has AMAZING pizza. We waited in line for about 30 mins before we were able to order, but it was totally worth the wait. The 2 guys in front of us were locals and said it's the best pizza around and they would wait so we knew it must be great! We had the clam & garlic pizza, pepperoni, and cheese. They were all delicious! The customer service was awesome as well. Definitely recommend!
author: Lacy J.

description: Was in San Francisco for the area and told to check this spot. I ordered the clam and garlic pizza and a combo slice, along with a $3 PBR. Overall, the pizza was amazing and not too long of a wait. Plenty of seating
author: Andrew R.

description: Had Pesto veggie pizza with extra sauce and garlic and i was slurp slurp slurp!! . Ofcourse long lines and high wait time.
author: Namisha G.

description: Good Pizza! Place was packed but the service was great and it didn't take too long for us to get our order. Pepperoni slices are 3.50. They accept cash only.
author: Candis S.

description:
Loved everything about this place!!! Great friendly service. I'm a vegetarian and had the vegetarian pesto, my husband had the sausage.

Delicious !!!! Highly recommend
author: Sonia G.

description:
1000000% YES. After my umpteenth failed attempt of trying to eat at Tony's, I figured there had to be a legit alternative. Cue Golden Boy, the answer to all my pizza prayers. 

This place is my holy grail of Sicilian style pizza, not to mention that it just oozes cool. We arrived on National Hangover Day (aka New Years morning) about 15 minutes before opening and there was already a motley crew lined up. 

The whole process went a little something like this: drool at selection of pies through window, order the combo and garlic & clam, make the bf and friend order all the other types (cheese, pepperoni, veggie), pay and find a seat in the small bar-style area, listen to Depeche Mode and Bowie, share hot pizza, die of happiness and watch my soul drift into pizza heaven. 

Perfect crispy crust, just the right amount of cheese and fresh toppings, beer, good service, and cheap prices. Could not ask for anything more, other than a clone of this place down in LA.
author: Kate K.

description:
I don't have much to say, because it's quite simple... I've been around the country, 35 states now playing music. I'm always looking for the best pizza I can find, Golden Boy is my favorite pizza place, by far. 
You can't go wrong with a slice of pepperoni, highly recommended.
author: David S.

description:
Waiting in line as we speak. A street musician sits in the rain on two plasric crates stacked on one another. The line is loud with cheerful bar goers. Make friends with the people around you. I've got a couple from Minnesota in front and some bros behind me. A rare sighting one bro is SF born and raised.  With all the alcohol in the systems of the people here its a real love fest.

A passerby covers his head with a pizza box. There are beautiful square pizzas displayed in the window.

If you are next door at Gino and Carlo there is no more convenient way to manage your buzz.

Tv and ventilation fan up front. Unexpectedly super clean bathrooms and atm in back.

Cold drinks and beers on tap. The bottles are so cold they are icy.

A young guy and gal up front friendly moving the line along and two more guys in the back working feverishly on making more pizza.

The pizza has a thick crust and they heat it up for you.  I liked it lots and will be back
author: Stefan T.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is perfect. You read that right, PERFECT. I don't want to hear about San Francisco is not a pizza town, or how that Tony guy has a bunch of award winning pies near by, or how this isn't classic NYC thin crust preparation, or how you have to ascend into a tourist trap to acquire it, or blahblahblahblahblah. It's PERFECT.

I can't think of a better Sicilian-style pizza I've had on the West Coast. Maybe Lamonica's in Westwood, CA rivals Golden Boy for taste but that place is a drag to spend any time in. In contrast, Golden Boy is awesome to hang around here, have a couple of slices of pepperoni or sausage, have a beer and take in the mostly dive-y atmosphere they've been hosting for several decades. I can't really comment on the clam pizza because gross but people I know who enjoy that sort of thing think it's pretty tasty.

What's not to like? It kind of sucks getting here if you don't actually live in North Beach and parking your car will take you about a thousand hours. Worth it though, IMO.
author: Matt M.

description:
One of my absolute favorite pizza places in San Francisco and the entire state of California! Service is usually fantastic! Admittedly, I did receive a bit of "attitude" from a staff member. But, that was purely an isolated incident. I actually had the pleasure of meeting the grandson of the man who started this whole operation (sorry, can't remember his name) and he was super cool and generous with his time!

The pizza is deep dish and cooked on a "sheet" in that it's rectangular shaped. My mouth, literally, waters as I step inside and smell the delicious flavors emanating from this eatery. The taste of all the ingredients are cooked just right, there is a perfect amount of sauce on every slice and the crust is firm enough so that it's not too crispy or too "dough like." What can I say? It's almost the perfect pizza. Try Golden Boy Pizza and you will leave beyond happy!
author: Peter C.

description: Best freaking pizza in the world. The dough is tremendous and cannot be match by any. I was in SF for 3 days and had their pizza 2 day in a row.
author: Ravin M.

description: What can I say!! Yelp you are always dead on with the ratings!! This pizza is different than what I've ever had. It's a little on the thick side but packed with flavor. I had just the cheese and it did not disappoint. It has many herbs and what taste like garlic that add tons of flavor to it. I was in town for 4 days and I came twice already. Friday and Saturday night and there was a line each day. The only bad part is there is very limited seating which makes great for take out but hard if you want to eat in. Some of the best pizza we have had!
author: Ari Y.

description: The Sicilian style pizza was super good! The thick slices they serve can be filling so I'd recommend 2/3 slices if you're hungry. I was surprised how soft the pizza was. Don't pass this place up if you are a pizza lover! The line can be long but it's well worth it!
author: Darwin V.

description: Garlic salt on the tables! Sicilian style pizza and sodas in a can. Felt like a NY pizza place. Everyone loved the pizza. I'm not a huge Italian sausage person but the sausage pizza here was even great. If you have a stroller it won't fit lol. It's very cramped.
author: Chad E.

description: This pizza is delicious! Two slices will do you well... FYI - pizzas are pre-made and heated so no custom orders... there's about four options. It's a small hole in the wall so chances are you won't find seating. In addition, anytime after 7pm, you'll probably be waiting in an extremely long line so be ready to stand around. Plenty of street entertainment while you do, lol... but worth the wait!
author: Dee G.

description: WOW! No wonder it's on the top 20 places to eat in San Francisco before you die! It's DELISH! Beyond DELISH! The pizza crust is a family recipe and yes you can taste the authenticity of it!  The line is down the block so you'd better get here early! The slices are big and the sheet is HUGE!
author: Elisa A.

description: A couple of homies from work who went to school in The City recommended this place as their favorite.  They told me there could be a line & they weren't kidding, we waited in line over 20 minutes. They both recommended the garlic & clam pizza which I thought was just ok, but I really enjoyed the pepperoni a lot more.  My kids didn't care for it so much as they prefer thin crust but I would go back for another slice of pepperoni next time I'm in North Beach.  ~A
author: Anthony A.

description: No doubt the best slice of pizza in North Beach ! Tony's is good too; however, Tony's pizza is not consistent. The NYC  slice at Tony's sometimes taste like real NYC pizza other times it taste like Escape From New York Pizza which isn't that good. My point ?  Golden Boy Pizza is always good. The only.draw back at Golden Boys Pizza is there is almost always a line.
author: Stash P.

description: Best pizza I've ever had every flavor was just as good as the other, but i would definitely recommend getting a freshly baked slice. Just try it, you won't be disappointed!
author: Miu K.

description: this was some amazing pizza! had it to go then went over to park to devour this  crust was so crispy yet soft and toppings were just to die for! Now I know why SFO has such high standards for pizza
author: Marco T.

description: After a long day of biking and exploring SF we wanted a hot pizza on a cold evening.  Looked online for the best pizza in SF and came across this.  We arrived tired and hungry so the long line was disappointing.  Decided we'd wait as finding another joint would have been just as time consuming.  So glad we did, WELL WORTH THE WAIT!  We got a slice of every type they offered.  Hard to say what was the best, they were all fantastic.  Claim and garlic is a must.
author: Jennifer B.

description: So after all the good things I've heard about this place I had to come and see what it was all about.  I came to window happy and excited but was disappointed to find they were cash only.  I then left to meet up with some friends and let them know about this place and I was lucky enough that a friend of mine was also interested and had cash.  So I returned!  I had a slice of their supreme pizza and it was incredible!  The topics were great and the crunch of the crust was unmatched.  At almost $5 a slice it was well worth it and I'll be sure to come back next time I'm in SF.
author: Maurice O.

description: Deliciousness! Clam one was the best! Perfect little pizza joint! Staff was fast and efficient! Eat your slice of joy!
author: Julie T.

description:
Great place to grab late night bites.

I came here with a few friends after a night out at the bars. When we arrived at 2am, there was a line of 20 people. 

My personal favorite was the garlic and clam pizza. The pizza is thick and filling. Definitely a good idea after a night out!
author: Claire W.

description:
OVER HYPED. Been told this place was one of the best pizza places in SF but it definitely was not! The pizza was okay. I thought it lacked in flavor and it was bland. Not enough sauce on the pizza but there was a lot of cheese and I didn't like that. It was really thick and doughy 

I did like how they rebaked the pizza and it was crispy again. 

There was a line out the door waited about 20 minutes so we assumed it would be really good but it was OKAY. 

I've had really good pizza in NY and so far I have not found another place that can compare to it. 

Spent $34 on 4 slices of pizza and a Sprite.
author: Melody P.

description: OMG - how do yo begin to describe this deliciousness? From the moment you start walking up the hill the enticing aroma of baked dough, garlic, basil and oregano fill the air- you know there is something good happening ahead. Then you see the line and think wow how happy and excited all those people are waiting in anticipation know full well there are like a million other choices in this city to grab some food but they still wait and you happily go to the back of the line in the same anticipation. As you inch forward you begin to determine you selection and anticipate that first delicious bite. Soon it will be your turn! Then you step inside and enter the excitement of it all. The fresh baked smell, the anticipation of your turn to place your order, the enjoyment of others all are part of the experience. If you are lucky enough to get a seat at the counter and enjoy your pizza, maybe with a beer, the show of staff busily working making sheet pan after sheet pan of deliciousness is entertaining! This is greatness for $3.25/slice!
author: Lisa W.

description: The most delicious pizza! The prices can't be beat, and the line moves quickly. My family tried the pepperoni, cheese, combination, and clam slices. My husband especially loved the clam. The focaccia crust was buttery and crisp, and the sauce was delicious. We took ours to go and had a lovely picnic in Washington Square Park. I highly recommend!
author: Michelle M.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is an amazing place to grab a slice.  There might be a line, but it will definitely be worth your while to wait in that line and get an amazing fresh slice of pizza.   I like to stop in at 11:30 AM right when they open. There is usually a small group already waiting for Golden Boy to open, which obviously indicates that this place is legendary.  The prices are reasonable and the quality is undeniable.  This Sicilian-style square pizza is doughy and the toppings are fresh and tasty. I love the combo, it has great veggies and meat! This place also has an amazing assortment of beer (and root beer) on tap. The Fieldwork IPA is my current favorite, and the root beer is actually incredible.  You can grab a slice to-go, which I now do pretty much anytime I visit the North Beach neighborhood.  Last weekend I woke up with a killer hangover and was able to heat up a slice of Golden Boy Pizza from the night before. Bringing home that slice of pizza was the best choice I made all week.  I will certainly be back soon!
author: Alex E.

description: Got the clam garlic and pesto veggie. Liked both but pesto veggie was phenomenal. No-frills pizza spot. The walls are plastered with funny and inspirational bumper stickers.
author: Shalini C.

description: Simple, awesome flavor, incredible place to eat pizza, great service, i will come back.
author: Wonka M.

description:
I don't consider myself some self-proclaimed aficionado when it comes to pizza....but I can certainly tell you when I've experienced a delicious pizza.  I have been here to Golden Boy Pizza probably 3-4 times.

I've always liked the vibe here. Fun, yet casual. You can get it by the sheet.....or by the slice. I've had it both ways. 

Even though they have a few selected choices, got to say The Clam/Garlic is my absolute favorite!!  Give me a Stella with it, and I am a happy girl!!!!

The crust is almost indescribable. Focaccia-style, Sicilian style. Perfectly squared since they send it through the oven when you order it. You can even add parmesan cheese or chili flakes at the table, but why would you....its already THE BOMB.COM. 

All you San Francisco natives, bring your out of town company to GBP at least once.  Its a Staple.....its a Landmark....its "authentic" San Francisco.  Its unique and amazing.

Your welcome.
author: Janet T.

description:
The pesto veggie pizza is sooooooo good! I'm craving it as I write this. I have never had a pesto pizza like that before. The crust was perfect and seemed like it was maybe a focaccia crust? It was perfectly crunchy. The mix of veggies in there made the perfect taste for a pesto pizza. Wish I discovered this wonderful gem sooner. The cheese pizza was ok. It's all about that veggie.

Plus, the guy giving us pizza was friendly and aimed to give us corner pieces without us even asking for it.
author: Reese E.

description: Best pizza I have ever eaten hands down no questions asked best crust. Best topping best sauce... I just cannot say enough I would drive 350 more miles for this pizza. It was a complete accident that I discovered it waiting for Caffe sport next door to open. Decided to have a snack and didn't want to eat it Cafe Sport after that just wanted to horge ourselves on that delicious amazing Pizza. We had one of each the combination, the pesto, and the pepperoni. All three were in comprable what can I say?
author: Patti P.

description:
YEAH. Maybe I'm over excited because we found this place by chance after wandering the streets for pizza for nearly an hour, but WOW. You'll know you're in the right place when you see a window full of pizzas. It's a little shotgun place absolutely slathered in bumper stickers. If nothing else, you'll feel cool being there. 

It's CASH ONLY, but there is an ATM. Definitely go for the veggie pesto slice.
author: A C.

description: Best pizza in the world hands down. The cheese melts in your mouth. I want to come back here again maybe all the time. I got combination pizza, beat one ever hands down
author: Mayank V.

description: Super friendly staff and pizza is very well proceed and super delicious! They have great customer service and are quick! I highly recommend them. I ordered 4 half sheets of pizza so we got to try all 4 flavors!!
author: Kaori B.

description:
CASH ONLY

The place has a fun vibe and the service is really nice. I ordered a slice of clam and garlic pizza ($4). The thick crust was amazing and the flavors were super savory and strong. I was tasting garlic for the rest of the day! Definitely recommend trying this unique pizza.
author: Linda X.

description: We came here for a pre-dinner slice of pizza - the signature garlic clam slice. I was impressed with the slice, which had a ton of toppings, sitting on a thick focaccia crust. They reheat the slice when you order it, so it comes out piping hot! Overall, service was quick, price was cheap, portion was large, and pizza tasted great. Would 100% recommend for a cheap lunch/dinner/snack!
author: Jaimie X.

description: SUPER DUPER GOOD PIZZA!!! It was my first time coming with my husband and it was very delicious. The sausage and pepperoni pizza was what we got. They were very busy but the service was fast!!
author: Andrea S.

description: Come here if you want lukewarm service and high school cafeteria pizza. The pepperoni slice tasted like bland frozen pizza, the garlic and clam is flavorless. Don't be fooled by the line outside.
author: Natassia B.

description: Really good pizza. We came here late at night and had to wait 10-15 mins in line. We got a slice of the pesto, combination and pepperoni. The pesto one was probably our favorite. The slices are rectangular so you don't get any crust. The dough is a bit thicker but I enjoyed it. The interior is very small and it can be hard to find a seat and the line of people waiting to order never seemed to slow down.
author: Poonam A.

description:
I recently read an article about this place being one of the cheapest place to eat in the city.  Also, there were lots of high reviews. So, I gave it a try. 

I ordered a slice of sausage and a slice of clam and garlic pizzas.  Both pizza was delicious and I highly recommended.  The clam and garlic was especially awesome.  Both didn't break the bank at $3.75 and $4.25 respectively.  

Customer service was awesome. Would come back again and try other pizzas.
author: Paul C.

description: Bomb pizza and great customer service. Long line but well worth the wait. Beers are cheap and food is awesome.
author: Tim R.

description: Very impressed with the pizza. Fresh and tasty :) The turnover of pizza sales is so frequent that most slices you get is often just fresh out the oven or just coming out! Outdoes the competition on price too. Definitely going back there again.
author: Daniel G.

description: One of my favorite pizza places in the area, if not all of SF.  The garlic & clam pizza is my favorite go-to here.  It's definitely packed on Friday and Saturday night, given the number of bars nearby.  Since I've recently been going mid-late afternoon for a late lunch, it's been wholly different experience when it's not packed or busy, and it's fun to watch whatever game's on at the moment.  It's cash only so be prepared.  I always recommend Golden Boy to anyone who hasn't heard of it!
author: Shane G.

description: Thick crust pizza with burned cheese on the bottom, can it get better than that?  Great local beers on tap and friendly staff.
author: Jackie J.

description: Golden Boy Pizza does not disappoint! Be prepared for a wait and bring cash. I ordered a slice of sausage pizza and a beer and luckily found two open seats at the bar. The pizza was SO good. The crust is perfect and crunchy and soft at the same time. I'm seriously craving it right now. Definitely recommend this place and can't wait to try the garlic and clam pizza.
author: Cameron R.

description: This was one of the best hole in the wall pizza joint in Little Italy  I ordered the clams & garlic slice and it was delicious. Again expect to wait in line but well worth it.
author: Breana Huey D.

description:
Yes yes yes. Hungry just thinking about this place. 

We came here because we were so hungry we couldn't wait any longer for a table at Tony's. SO GLAD WE DID. The square focaccia slices are bomb. 

Remember, cash only though! And more of a grab-and-go spot! Though they have counter seating and beers on tap. 

Combo (sausage, pepperoni, zucchini, onions): I drool, yum. Classic. Delicious. 

Clam garlic: Drooling more. So much flavor! Must-get, but it's not for everyone so share a slice with someone!
author: Ashley S.

description: My best pizza shop in SF. Lines get longer the later it gets at night. Go earlier, if possible. The pizza is on focaccia bread which is amazing!
author: Gaurav K.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza restaurants. Me and my cousin went here for lunch and the service is excellent. I only waited for 5 minutes for my pizza. The pizza tasted perfect, I would rate the pizza 5 stars out of 5. I would definitely come back here.
author: Rolen G.

description:
I rarely eat pizza but Golden Boy Pizza was damn delicious!

After running a half marathon around SF, my friends and I decided that we would check out Golden Boy Pizza to reward ourselves.  Although I am not much of a pizza person, I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed the overall experience here.   As you walk by the window, you seee the freshly baked sheets of pizza that are on sale at the moment.  Inside you see the oven firing up more pizzas and the walls are plastered with different hipster stickers.  With each slice carried on a nice sized layer of crust that was both soft and melt in your mouth delicious, I was in love.

Either available by the slice or by the sheet, I was lucky enough to come with friends so I could try a few different pieces they had available.  Each slice was a pretty nice size and at $2.75-3.75 a slice they are a good bargain!

Clam/garlic: My favorite!!  Although the pieces of the clam are not super present, the combination with the garlic and cheese creates a nice a savory bite.  

Combination:  I enjoyed it but it was hardly anything special.  Like your standard combination slice, it had the pieces of sausage, tomatoes, peppers, and olives.  The ingredients are great but again, I didn't think I would necessarily come back for this slice.

Pesto/vegetarian: A surprisingly tasty slice!  I am usually into vegetarian slices but I am very used to them being on the blander side.  However, I think the pesto added to them added an extra level of flavor to the vegetables of an awesome slice of pizza!

The service was fast and friendly.  The inside does not have too many seats but they do allow you to take out!  

Overall, Golden Boy Pizza has great quality pizza that is worth walking for even after already running a half marathon!
author: Patrick S.

description: So the other night I was waiting for my friend to show up - we were going to Soto Mare next door. I kept looking at the pizza, looking at the pizza, and just couldn't resist. Already had another pizza slice somewhere else that day - but hey - one more won't hurt! Got a slice of sausage pizza - it was a deep crust with barely anything on top. Didn't compare with the other slice earlier that day. Well it was a few bucks cheaper. But I'll pay more for GOOD pizza!
author: Jrfromafar R.

description: Great crust and delicious sauce. A must try if you're looking for a good slice of pizza. The slices are large and they only take cash! I enjoyed a slice of their plain cheese and pesto veggie. Both were excellent but definitely filling. Enjoy!
author: Ryan H.

description:
Wow...amazing pizza.  I guess it has to be considering they serve nothing else.

I had the veggie pesto.  Amazing crust....crunchy and gooey all in the same bite.

There is very limited seating and no air conditioning (normally that's not an issue in SF, but dang was it hot out today).

If you want super delicious pizza, be sure to stop in!
author: Lucky S.

description:
Went here with 2 coworkers while visiting from out-of-town. The slices each of us had felt undercooked as they were very doughy in the inside. My slices were more "doughy" than "fluffy", a sign that the crust could use some more cooking. There was no crunch in the crust that other reviewers refer to. 

Because of the pan style of the pizza, there's no real edge crust to hold onto either, so if you like edge crust you won't get any here.

I bought 3 different pieces to sample their pizzas since I was a visitor, and I was underwhelmed with the taste of all of them. The tomato sauce was bland, and the toppings did not make up for that.

The dark, crammed interior must make this a cult-favorite of San Francisco that only the locals truly enjoy. If you're just visiting in town, this might not be a place to go.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Five stars for a fabulous pizza and a rowdy place.  It's a little hole in the wall place with scant seating, mostly counter seats.  It's common to stand in line for 30 minutes or more but I swear it's sooo worth it!  No sourdough dough (thank goodness) but a focaccia dough that's crisp and tasty with a nice variety of toppings.  It's best to order by the slice (generous sized square slices) and two slices gets you full.  Delicious and authentic Italian flavor!  It's so worth a visit!!!
author: Lorraine M.

description: An excellent institution with good music, barmen, beer and, of course, a cool pizza. The staff is fast and efficient. If you love pizza, you will not leave disappointed. Amazing.
author: Mary F.

description: Finally made it to Golden Boy.  It's great for what it is - thick crust, fast and easy.  The clam was very heavy on the garlic to the point of being a little bitter so I would probably skip that one next time.  But overall, we were happy and would go back.
author: Diana M.

description: Great Pizza, quick on the go bite, especially liked clams and garlic, but make sure you aren't talking to anyone after!  There is a line that starts as soon as it opens, but they get them in and out pretty quick.
author: Jonathan C.

description: I was in the city to take some photos and do some reading, at nearby Cafe Greco, when I noticed a line of people standing out the door to this pizza spot. After realizing they only accepted cash, I walked down the street to Walgreens, purchased a Coke, got my cash, and walked back to Golden Boy. It was all worth it in the end. I chose the combination slice, sat at the bar, and dug in. Mmmm I'm still thinking about that slice and nearly a week has passed.
author: Evin S.

description: Garlic and clam pizza with an ipa is my go to when I come to this place. It's super simple, the only down part is that the counter next to the wall has its sheets pretty close to the counter and there is a line most all the time when iv been here but that's because it's great pizza.
author: Drew K.

description: Best pizza ever. I just wish it was bigger because the line is always insane, but really the best pizza I've had in the city.
author: Natasa S.

description: Went up to visit from LA and tried this place because of the reviews. I got the combo pizza and my gf got the veggie pizza, this was literally the best pizza me and my gf ever had. It's was so good and the crust was just right. We literally went back the next day lol we first went on a Thursday night and we walked right in, ordered and sat down. Then we went back Friday night and there was a line outside. I understand why, the pizza is great. The people who work there are super nice and friendly, even the people eating in there are nice and friendly. Good vibes all around and it made this dine in experience even better. It is CASH only so make sure you have it, if not they do have a ATM in the back near the restrooms. If we ever drive back up to SF from LA we will definitely stop by this place again. Thanks for everything.
author: Brian M.

description: Don't be fooled by the reviews! It might be all paid. The pizza was HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE to say the least. We ordered Pesto veg, 2 slices of cheese, and 2 slices of meat lover. I have never had such bland and tasteless Pizza in my life. I don't recommend this place and literally out of of words for the 4.5 star rating it has. It's a HOAX!
author: Himika R.

description: Golden boy is god, bow before him. Fcuk off all other pizza. This coast sucks (other than g boi).
author: John D.

description: What a place small but good pizza and cheap food for its location will come back nice selection of drafts and bottled beers
author: Daniel N.

description: I felt like i was eating little Caesars! I didn't find taste to the cheese nor the tomato sauce. The crust was goo.
author: Lili A.

description:
About to make the trek from Marin to SF just to grab a pie. The line outside the door just means that the locals have figured it out. Most impressive is that impossible to find crust with a fluffy pillow top of sauce, cheese and delicious veggie toppings. 
Try the clam/ garlic pie. It simply cannot be beat!
author: Carlos F.

description: The smell is what drew us to this place. Looks like everything is made in house. Kids absolutely LOVED the pizza.
author: Mari D.

description:
My family and I went to San Francisco yesterday, we checked in the hotel and took a lift ride to Little italy, best thing to do when in San Francisco or anywhere for that matter.
After appetizers at this other place  we were  a little hungry so we bought a slice of pizza at Golden Boy.  Best slice of pizza ever deep dish style , cheesy like no other, soft to the bite... just PERFECT. Brothers and Sisters out there Searching for a good slice of pizza... STOP YOUR SEARCH,  Buy a slice here and if you get it to go buy a can of coca cola with it, you will need it. Trust me! If you buy your pizza and stay there you got to get a nice cold beer with it, modelo especial is what I like with it, why??? Because it has a crisp flavor to it and Is consider to be gluten free so you won't feel extra puffed up when having pizza and beer.

(Shout outs to our Lift driver, OG Ray from Oakland, good peps)
author: Ra- T.

description: Love this place! Delicious, affordable, and always friendly. Clam and garlic is the best! I just wish the line moves faster. My only advice is, if you can somehow get people in and out faster, it will be win win. I've seen so many people who wanted to grab a slice here, got intimated after seeing the long line, and ended up not eating.
author: Francis F.

description: Super tasty warm doughy pizza with a ton of toppings and at a super affordable price! Very limited seating and the wait will be long but this is one of my favorite pizza spots in the city.
author: Y W.

description: Loved loved loved your pizza! The best I've had in a long time around bay area. The pepperoni was the best one. I didn't love the garlic clams one but It was fun to try!!
author: Emilé M.

description:
Delicious pizza! We were on our way to an Italian restaurant and we passed by this small place.  The smell of fresh made pizzA made it hard to ignore.. CASH ONLY.. .the line was long but  moved quickly
We got veggie pesto pizza and a slice of the garlic clam  pizza.. totally worth it!!! Loved the garlic clam pizza..
author: Fatima R.

description:
Just had an extraordinary corner slice of their signature clam pizza.  It was simply a masterpiece!  The cornmeal deep dish crust perfectly compliments the intense taste of the freshly chopped Gilroy garlic and clams that were still in The shores of the Pacific this morning.
