We have been going to this place for years and years and it never disappoints!  All varieties of pizza are great if clams don't float you boat.

Now for those of you are from out of town, I do have a bit of a warning.  The music is very loud and raucous and the clientele can be seedy - rockers with tattoos all over, jazz club types, and also a lot of the horse track betting crowd who gravitate to the joint after the last race at Bay Meadows across the bay.

Even if you find the crowd off putting, the pizza will quickly make you forget.  Shut your eyes and enjoy - the taste is so wonderful, it will take you anywhere you choose to go!
author: Gideon T.

description: There's a line for a reason, and it's worth waiting in. Golden Boy's Sicilian slices are easily the best in the Bay, if not in the entire state. The clam and garlic pizza is outstanding. Get two slices, because you're going to want another one immediately after the first one is gone.
author: Liam S.

description: Read the previous reviews our first stop was here to eat! Was delicious we had the clam and garlic is a must! And the Veggie pizza was good as well. Will definitely come again when we come to S.F.. Love the sticker wall inside and the smell of homemade pizza!
author: Andrea E.

description:
Apparently, this is the holy grail of pizza in SF.  People worship this place dude.  Lines are outrageously long (anytime of the day) and if you're looking to cut your wait time, I'd suggest calling ahead, ordering a sheet, and finding some friends to share it with.  When you do that, you don't have to wait in the long line and it'll probably take about 20 minutes before you a get a fresh sheet.  That's exactly what we did.  So after the many times where I've only experienced Golden Boy the day after warmed up, I finally had the opportunity to try it fresh from the oven.

I will preface that I'm not a pizza connoisseur and I'm not a huge pizza enthusiast but I'll have a slice once in awhile.  Golden Boy is good, but not 30+ minute wait long good.  At that point, I'd be happy with a slice of Pizza Hut.  Anyways, I've tried slices of the combination, sausage, and garlic clam.  My favorite being the garlic clam followed by the combination.  Some people find shellfish weird on pizza, but if you're into it, it's quite tasty. If you want to play it on the safer side, the combination would be my second favorite.

I'd probably lean more towards a 3.5 than 4, but I rounded up cause it is some of the better pizza joints I've tried.  Def not worth the long wait though just to get a slice.  20 minutes for a sheet though?  Yeah, sure why not.
author: Carena N.

description:
After celebrating a friend's birthday at a bar. We all have a good buzz going on. Then someone suggested to get some pizza at the Golden Boy Pizza and their best seller is the clam pesto pizza. 

I ordered a slice of the clam pesto pizza and personally, I think the pizza was okay. The flavor was kind of bland in my opinion and there are not much of a texture from the pizza. When you think of eating a clam, you would be able to taste the clam and its kind of chewy but not rubbery texture. But you cannot find the seafood flavor or the texture from the clam. Which was a disappointment for me. But overall, the pizza was still nice but would I go back just for the pizza? Probably not
author: Jeff H.

description:
Chose this spot off of yelp and the look of the pizza.  It's a very cute place situated in a fairly narrow space with counter seating and beers and cider on tap and in the bottle.  
The service was friendly and helpful and my boyfriend and I ordered the pepperoni, the pesto, and the combo.  The dough was par-baked and delicious in the center and slightly crispy on the outside.  The crust tasted like French bread.  Really good. We thought even though it was a thicker crust than some other types of pizza, it was surprisingly light and didn't make us feel like we just ingested a bunch of cheese.  The sausage is divine on the combo and the cheese is nice and creamy-tasting. 
I really like that you can order just a slice of everything.  Makes going to a pizza shop much more convenient. 
I'm really glad I tried it!
author: J A.

description: Me and wifey visited SF from Sactown for a practice run for the Bay to Breakers. Wifey found a place to eat after, so we tried out Golden Boy. As soon as we got there, geesh, there was already a line out the door. Place was crackin'. They have several stools inside, where we sat and ate the pizza. I had the Godfather of pizzas, the pepperoni and wifey had, think combo. Place was pretty cool inside, theres a wall full of stickers. The restroom was surprisingly clean. They had a place where a mirror would be, but in sharpie tells you that you have oregano in your teeth. Funny thing, we did. The pizza, SMH, not sure how to describe it. IT WAS BOMB DIGGITY! The crust had a perfect crisp, middle, not to doughy, and the topping was good. Wifey face dives into the pizza. Me, its toppings first then finish it off crust last. We were thinking of getting a pizza to take home, it wouldnt make it back us, probably wouldnt make it passed the toll booth. We definitely will be coming back.
author: Greg K.

description: GARLIC CLAM PIZZA= to die for! Lol however they don't have ranch haha but all around such fire pizza it's a must try if your in San Francisco but be careful, the line could me around the corner
author: Courtney B.

description:
I've only been here twice, but if I lived closer, I'd brave the line much more often.

Having lived in NYC for a few years, I'm pretty judgey when it comes to pizza, but this place satisfied my requirements. Perfect bread to topping ratio, cheesy is of excellent goo level, and anything else you requested is plentiful. Just. Nom. All around!
author: Shendi X.

description: Nice place , cheap and good testy pizza at Italy area in sf. Easy to find and either u can eat inside or to takeaway!
author: Miraf B.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for quite some time now. So excited I finally got to try it and I must say it was one of the best pizzas I've ever had. 

Everyone kept talking about the clam and garlic pizza.. I was a bit skeptical about it since I am not big on clams but I must say that pizza was amazing; very different to what I am used to.

The crust is amazing. I will be back.
author: Phuong K.

description: Mama Mia, what a great pizza. I have to tell you that this is some of the best pizza I have ever had and that includes when I travel to Italy. My son loves it and has me get him a few slices when he gets out of school. If you're ever in North Beach and feel like a quick slice of great pizza, you have to try Golden Boy. Your taste buds will thank you. Ciao!
author: Ang S.

description: I come from afar to get their pizza squares. And each time I visit, there is always a line of people waiting for their slices. I'm a big fan of the cheese pizza. As basic as it sounds, it's not.
author: Martine D.

description: Had been wanting to try this place for years, but parking hard to find and there is usually a long ass line out front.  Got lucky one day and saw a spot and ordered some slice to go, have to say this is hands down, the best slice I have ever had! and the price was not bad.  Two slices = one of the many pizza boutiques with expensive mini pizzas.
author: John C.

description: Always tasty and fresh, a San Francisco classic! My favorite is the clam and garlic, you can't go wrong with it!
author: Babs J.

description:
YES. Came at 5:30 and there was a line, but nothing crazy. Within 15-20 minutes, I walked out with my two glorious slices: the infamous garlic & clam and the combo and ate them at Washington Square Park.

The garlic & clam is interesting and worth trying, but I actually enjoyed the combo slice more! I think I would try out the pepperoni or the veggie pesto next time. Loved the crust. It wasn't too heavy or cheesy.

$4.25/slice isn't cheap, but it's definitely one of my favorite casual pizza places in SF now.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Golden Boy's been on the SF bucket list forever, but I wasn't motivated enough to come here until (of all things) I saw my friend post a picture on Instagram of their pepperoni pizza. After my initial "DAMNNNNN!" response, I hurriedly made plans to come here ASAP!

Since I had to make up for lost time, got the combo, pesto veggie, and (of course!) garlic clam. The pizza is definitely as good as advertised, although I can't say it is my favorite pizza ever...I think I've gotten too used to bomb New York pizza. Either way, the focaccia-bread crust is crispy, yet flaky holds the toppings well. Definitely liked the garlic clam when it came otu fresh, but the combo the next morning held up pretty damn well.

Cash only as everyone has noted. Good luck finding parking around the area. And since we are in North Beach, the later the hour, the busier it gets.
author: Alexander Y.

description: We were visiting from out of town for the weekend and were in the mood for some delicious pizza. We decided on Golden Boy due to the reviews and pictures on Yelp. We found the spot right away due to the line forming outside and the big fluorescent sign. The line went by quick due to the efficient service and before we knew it, we were ordering our slices. We opted for cheese and the combo. We thought one slice would be enough but boy were we wrong!! It was so delicious that we had to ask the waitress for more. The price, service and vibe of the whole place was great! Be aware that it's cash only and that you might not be able to sit inside. Either way, I can't wait to visit Golden Boy again!
author: Jessica M.

description: Fresh, tasty and good prices. Inside is a fun punk rock aesthetic. The only downside was the long line, but it's popular for a reason!
author: Ryan T.

description:
CASH ONLY!!!!

Team Golden Boy over Tony's and any other pizzeria in SF!! I waited so long in line for a slice and guess what, it was worth it. You have to get the clam and garlic. I didn't have enough cash for another fancy slice so got a basic cheese but it still hit the spot.
author: Joy M.

description: Oh boy. It's Golden boy pizza. As usual, long queue even at 2 am. I liked their veggie pizza with no meat. Sad that they don't have chicken pizzas. But still I recommend it.
author: Umapathy R.

description:
The pizza is bomb here! The crust is soft in the inside and crunchy on the outside. Amazing texture. Cheap prices! 

Nice customer service and super busy.
author: Hasan M.

description: Busy on a Saturday night but it is worth the wait! My friends and I stumbled upon this place while waiting for a table to open at a restaurant next door. There was a long line. Lots of people were recommending to try the clam pizza! It was REALLY REALLY GOOD!! and did I mention $4.50/slice?? The pizza came out toasted so you'll get that cheesy garlicy bite with that warm nice crunch from the bottom crust. The dough in the middle was nice and soft. My recommendation is to EAT IT as soon as you can, I was lucky to get 3 bites before putting it away and eating it later wasn't as amazing as right out from the oven :p.
author: Cindy N.

description:
This place is such a good place for pizza - especially drunk eating. They have a clam pizza and it's definently different from the norm. We also got a combo pizza, which wasn't too special. But the clam slice was so good and I'm craving it right now as I am thinking about it. 

-Kristen

5 stars from Kristen, Edmund still wasn't here to rate.
author: Kristen L.

description:
One of the best places in the city to get a slice of pizza!

They have a great variety of slices. I've had their Sausage as well as their Clam and Garlic and was highly impressed both times around. Fresh, warm, and a crust that delicately embodies both soft and crisp--Golden Boy is worth the line. While in line you can spend your time drooling over the pizzas in the window and worrying that your slice will be taken by the time you have to order. 
Service is fast prompt! 

An absolute must for pizza aficionados and late night snackers alike.
author: Naveena S.

description:
This was my first pizza in SF, and what a way to start! The crust is a bit crisp and oily in a good way, and the toppings were all well balanced and flavorful. The wait was fairly short and the slices are not bad value. The guy at the counter was pretty observant, seemed to notice that it was my first time here and explained the ordering process and options

I personally liked and would recommend the clam garlic pizza
author: Neal B.

description: I have been coming here for 10 years every time I'm in the Bay Area, and I am NEVER disappointed! By far my favorite pizza place in the U.S.! The line can be a bit long if you come when everyone is off work, but no matter when you can make it, the wait is worth it!
author: DeVonn C.

description:
CLAM

GARLIC

PIZZA.


Pizza is its own food group, and Golden Boy its own subcategory.
author: Susy C.

description:
4.5 stars

Me and my friend got a tattoo next door so we've been around the area a few times. Every time, she tells me to bring CASH and I always forget. Until one day I finally remembered and got to treat myself to a slice. I got the combo and each slice is in a square (rectangle if you want to get technical). The crust is perfectly crispy on the bottom and the edge, the cheese is melted and stretchy and the toppings are the perfect addition to top off the pizza. it was really good. I tried my friend's clam and garlic pizza and that one is really good as well. 

Overall, it's pretty damn good. They toast it to my liking. Bring cash.
author: Sophia Y.

description: I heard the clam pizza is good I had a veggie slice I've had other pizzas from here this time in particular it was doughy I didn't even finish it ‍
author: Donyae L.

description: Fast, tasty, pizza by the slice, affordable, and a convenient SF location. What more can you ask for? Pizza is baked, however, they reheat before serving to you and the pizza still tastes amazing reheated. The combo pizza is the first pizza I tried with zucchini on it and I must say that the zucchini blended well with the other veggies and meats. Only reason this place is not a five is because they don't take credit/debit cards.
author: Juan M.

description:
The best pizza I have ever had in my life! It tops New York pizza. The only downside is the seating kid limited and uncomfortable. 

Must try.
author: Anonymous R.

description: Pizza is the best in the city and the service is great! All the employees genuinely care about their customers!
author: Breanna B.

description:
I don't get why this place has a 4.5 stars on Yelp. We waited 20 mins at 2am because it's the only place still open in the neighborhood at this time. Paid less than $4 bucks for a perfectly squared slice of sausage and tomato pizza. I took my very first bite into it and I knew I was in for a big let down. 

The pizza was 3/4 dough and 1/4 cheese and toppings (but mostly cheese w/ little to no sausage and tomato sauce). Food should taste especially good when you're drunk and starving but Golden Boy pizza is honestly not that great.
author: Constance Y.

description: The first time I came here I was drinking a bit and I was starving so I thought the pizza was the best thing ever. After coming a few more times after, I have to say the pizza is pretty average for the price. Its about $4 per square which is about 4in x 5in. I've tried the pepperoni and Clam and garlic which both tasted good but ONLY if you get a center piece. I've noticed everything I get a corner or side piece, it's not very good. It doesn't have enough cheese and the texture isn't that great. Also, don't forget to bring cash since it's CASH ONLY!
author: Jonathan L.

description: As a newly non vegan, I really really can't describe my first experience eating this pizza. I was literally inhaling my pizza..... I sat next to friends for years while they would eat their pizza, and now I frequent this place, alone just to enjoy their amazing grama slices and cry tears of joy.
author: Emmy M.

description: I was told to find my iconic ny sicilian slices in this spot. To my preference, the pizza was too doughy and greesy, nothing to be compared with NY. Based on their line outside , im sure others disagree or like that kind of pizza. ;)
author: Shira T.

description:
Totally hyped. I tried the clam pizza, and while the crust was very crunchy and chewy and delicious, the actual content of the pizza was just okay. It was garlicky, which was great, but I felt that it was lacking some sort of sauce to tie it all together. It tasted like a garlic cheese pizza with canned clams sprinkled on top. 

I wouldn't go out of my way for Golden Boy.
author: Evelyn N.

description: Bring your appetite... and cash! (Cash only, ATM in back) This place rocks!! Super tasty thick cut slices that will make your mouth water! Be wary of long lines around lunch time!
author: Greg W.

description:
My buddy along with our wives went on a pizza bonanza in North Beach SF. One of our stops included Golden Boy Pizza. I have always been a thin crust NY style fan, well that changed after my first bite. We went in for the foccacia style square. We ordered a square slice of pepperoni and a pesto garlic clam. The crust was light and not like anything I ever had. The flavors, from the meats, cheese, vegetables and sauce were to perfection. After finishing our squares we headed for some delicious gelato but we couldn't stop talking about the pizza we just ate. So we convinced ourselves that we only live once and went back for four more squares to take home. If you enjoy pizza, go to Golden Boy Pizza. If you are like me and thought thin crust was the only way to go, give the square a try and you wont be disappointed. 
Check my buddy and I gout on Instagram at Feedyourfacewithmark&jason
author: Mark J.

description: I adore coming here anytime I have a reason to be relatively close to North Beach.  All of their pizzas are delicious.  They come out piping hot and fresh, and there are cold beers to wash it all down with (or a can of Coke if that's more your jam).  The staff is always friendly, and if you're good with waiting for a minute, there's typically a seat available for one or two people.  The best local colors and flavors in this small little storefront.  Even better when you're just walking around and order it out the front window and take it to go.  YUM!!
author: Jes G.

description:
I visit this restaurant about 2 month ago, i drafted the review and now i am posting it.
Good pizza. If you buy it by slice, it's faster since it's already made . It's the thick type of pizza, not thin! Also it's a small local with mostly a lot of people.
The pizza was for my 7YO boy and he love it, I tried a slide and it was good for mr to.
author: Octavio L.

description:
This is my favorite Sicilian style pizza in SF. 

Whenever I go to SF, I'm obligated to bring a few sheets of pizza back with me to Sacramento so my family can have some. Actually, whenever anyone in my family ventures to SF it's pretty much a requirement to bring Golden Boy or some other kind of food back to Sac! Anyways, if you want good square pizza, go here. They display it sitting in the window, but crisp it up deliciously for you to consume. The reason I like this Sicilian pizza better than others is because I'm not a huge fan of tons of bread when I eat pizza (I usually prefer NY style). However, Golden Boy does Sicilian style pizza the right way. It's perfectly crisp, and expertly seasoned. 

Whether you're sober or lit, check this place out. It's open late-the only drawback is parking, but you can pay in a little lot right up block on the opposite side of the street if you don't want to waste awhile trying to grab free street parking. 

This pizza is also great to go, but take it somewhere where you can heat it properly!
author: Chelsie H.

description: How can you go wrong w a slice of golden boy pizza ?!?! This place cuts there slices in squares rather then the original triangle shape. But besides from that difference, the taste is one of the best pizza around!  Love picking up a slice here when partying in north beach of broadway. Some nights the line is crazy though.
author: Mark P.

description:
Saw a line and got in it. Turns out it was for a pizza place, which was lucky for me because I was hungry. 

They move pretty fast. Line always stayed about the same length even though new people were queuing up all the time. Some guy tried to buy my spot with some Totino's Pizza Rolls. Back of the line, buddy. 

Inside is a little cramped, but only because it was crowded, and that makes sense, because the pizza was incredible. We got some kind of combo pizza; veggies and sausage -- that sort of thing. My buddy got a veggie pizza because he thinks plants can't feel. 

Everything was delicious. Best pizza I've had in a long time. Not too greasy. Not too much bread. Perfect. 

Pro tip: if you don't wanna wait inside, the large window near the entrance opens. They'll open it and hand the pizza to you while you stand outside and wonder why someone would build a city on a mountain.
author: DK A.

description:
Focaccia pizza at its crispiest... Cheesiest.... Chirpiest.

Best when you're hungry..Better when you're not.

I would get this homedelivered every other day if I could. May be I would... Coz really I very much should.
author: Auroshikha R.

description: Little bit of a wait but the pizza is 100% worth it. The seating is very limited inside and not meant for if wanting to go have a sit down with the family but luckily in SF there is plenty of places to go sit somewhere and enjoy a bite.
author: Charlene S.

description: My wife and I had the clam&garlic along with the veggie. Both were beyond outstanding! I enjoyed the Pesto Veggie the best, and my wife the clam&garlic. The crust is to die for!  Make sure you check them out if visiting SF. We are from Illinois! Best pizza I have ever had! Great energy!
author: Buddah S.

description: Fantastic pizza! The Sicilian style slice is hard to get ahold of in California and these guys are just great! The clam and garlic is probably their signature, I always get at least one slice of it. The sausage is also excellent and you get a big slice for only a few dollars. They also have a good beer selection. It's not a big place but it has lots of character. Also be careful when you first touch your slice because it's super hot!
author: Nina L.

description: One of the best pizza by the slice places in the city.  There is usually a line so that should tell you how good it is.  They have a unique pizza which is oysters and garlic.  I have not tried it yet but everyone raves about it.  If you want a really excellent, quick meal while in little Italy then stop by and try it.  You absolutely will not regret it.
author: Piyush P.

description:
I have had Golden Boy Pizza on my list of pizza places to try, but to be perfectly honest, the only reason I went to Golden Boy Pizza this Saturday was because I was pre-gaming my dinner at Tony's after being quoted a 1.5 hour wait.

Despite the lack of purposeful planning, I enjoyed my clam and garlic pizza, and the guy at the front was friendly. I can't say it was to-die-for, but it was tasty, cheap, and held me over until my dinner. I shared my slice with my friend, and it's definitely big enough to split with someone else if you're just snacking.

I wouldn't go out of my way for a Golden Boy Pizza slice, but if I were in the area looking for a quick fix, I'd totally come back!
author: Kelly R.

description: Loved the textures and flavors on the clam & garlic pizza!Generally, the regular style crust or large square slices are not my thing, but they overcame that preconceived notion & made me want to come back a second time!
author: Jessica R.

description:
The pizza is good. Better obviously after you have been drinking. The inefficiency of how the line works and how slow the pizza comes out has made me change my mind over the years about the value. 
Time vs getting a slice. 
Last two times have not been worth it. 
They should have a floater out taking orders in the line to resolve this issue.
author: David B.

description: I should start this by saying I am a pizza snob. Tried their clam pizza during lunch time. The pizza was not reheated all the way. I've had Sicilian style before but I wasn't impressed with the crust here. I loved the garlic but I kept wondering what the pizza would taste like if it had been heated all the way (it was just warm). The workers here were nice and friendly. The cheese did not taste that great. They are cash only. I feel like this is a great place if you need a quick bite and work in the area.
author: Beth M.

description: They are the reigning champions of pizza in my life! Love the pan pizza that is perfectly cooked! Piping hot and amazing taste. I brought several of my friends, best pizza on the west coast, hands down. Want awesome pizza? This place is it!
author: Jon O.

description:
For those that follow my reviews you know I don't eat pizza often but when I do Tony's is my go to spot.

While I am definitely a creature of habit and found myself walking to Tony's for a pizza fix I decided to call an audible at the last minute and mix things up by checking out golden boy. I'm glad I did.

First, I would say golden boy compared to Tony's is spokes to oranges as a comparison because Tony's is while pie sit down and golden both is by the slice and a bar.

Secondly, food wise golden boy versus Tony's is again a draw in my book as both are excellent but it depends on what type of environment you are looking for.

Golden boy only does Sicilian style and you can see the pizza from the window outside. Dinner may think this means the pizza is not fresh but oh no no! The pizza here moves fast.

I went with two slices of pepperoni and one slice sausage. Both were great but I preferred the pepperoni only because more pepperoni came on the slice.

If you want top quality pizza by the slice or even a while pie to go this is your place.

I don't drink but they had tons of beer on tap and plenty of Nirvana in rotation so it's hard not to love this place.
author: Corey H.

description: Great service and great selections of awesome pizza! A must try when in Little Italy. Will be back soon!
author: Trang Ashley P.

description: Amazing pizza. This place is usually packed and there's a reason that it is. Their pizzas are on the thicker side, which I really like and hard to find here in SF. I tried most of the different toppings and my favorite has to be the combination slice. Their seafood and pesto veggie one are good choices too.
author: Camera P.

description: This is a review, I almost don't want to write, because I don't want this place to get too crowded. People already know how incredible the pizza is. Delicious focaccia crust pizza. They don't have a lot of different choices, but the pizza is so sublime, you won't care about that. Last time I was there, I tried the garlic-clam pizza (with fresh basil) and it popped in my mouth it was so good. You can also have beer here (pizza's best friend). Great place to grab a slice and a beer, and enjoy the vibe.
author: Jason P.

description:
This is exactly the kind of pizza you're looking for, I can tell you right now.

I mean... IF you like pizza.

First of all, it's called Golden Boy. Don't you just trust a name like that?  Then, there's often a line outside, which might be off-putting... if you didn't see how excited and enthusiastic and UNRELENTING all those faces in line are. Instead of turning away, you're convinced of the goodness that awaits and determined to stand there until you get your slice. It doesn't take long before the wafting smell hits you, and suddenly you don't mind standing in line at all - you're happy just to bask in the garlic-oregano aroma.

It doesn't matter what you order when you get to the front, as long as you have the cash to cover it (and you don't need much, the slices are quite reasonable and just one would make a meal... but trust me, you'll want two). Surprise bonus: plenty of beers on tap, including seasonals like my personal favorite the Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA. Does it get any better? 

It does. The whole thing is the right balance of bad-ass and best-in-class.

Beastie Boys on the stereo. Cheerful, yet snarky bar staff. A bathroom completely covered in the signatures of pizza-eaters past. Bumper and band stickers line the ceiling and the walls. The list of rules (which you'll likely only notice after it's too late) entertains you, and warns you, "if you don't see it, don't ask for it." Next time you'll know... and there WILL be a next time. And you will 'do the clam.'

(Disclaimer: In case you're wondering why I give this a four and not a five, there are two super small reasons. One: I'm kind of mozzarella intolerant, so I wish there were an option with low or no mozz, or that I could ask for one... but the rules state I cannot, and rules is rules. Two: if you need to take one or two slices to-go, they wrap it in red and white paper - which is charming, but impractical.)
author: Catie F.

description: Not impressed, but I am also more of a thin crust pizza person in any case. It is a good deal though- 2 slices and a soda for less than 10 bucks.
author: Cyndi L.

description: Amazing pizza, great laid back atmosphere...place was completely packed by the time we left.  I ordered extra to take home.  Prices are very reasonable!
author: Rachael S.

description: Unbelievable pizza. So good, with a true urban feel. Pizza and beer here is unbeatable.
author: Tracy W.

description: Cash only but great service none the less; nice little selection of pizza slices and good price two slices and soda for $8. Quality worth the wait thanks so much! A+ in my book.
author: KillJoii X.

description: This pizza was great had the taste of a pizza I've never tasted it was perfect in everyway. Recommend this place. Traveled close to 2 hours and was definitely worth it.
author: Ariana L.

description: Holy crap do it do it do it! It's such good pizza!!!! Decent beer selection too, the atmosphere is great. The sarcastic comments on their chalk board seriously crack me up. But yes... if there is a long wait it's worth it. And honestly don't get just one slice... you're gonna want another!!!!
author: Aly S.

description:
Slice house just off of Columbus in Telegraph Hill. Counter seating only and grungy atmosphere.

Combo pizza - 2/5
Clam pizza - 3/5 - Unique, better than expected.

Overall, while it was interesting to try the clam pizza, I wouldn't come back because there are better slice houses both nearby and throughout the city. "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description: Good pizza!  Being from NY, I am a pizza snob, so giving this 4 stars has to tell you something. We had to grab something quick and we were not expecting much. To our surprise, we had a hot slice within a minute and it was great. Go here!!! YUMMERS.
author: Robert C.

description: 4 stars only because when I really want it, the line stretches down the sidewalk.  This place has great American-style pizza and a neighborhood staple.  Avoid anytime between 7pm and 1am (unless you have been drinking, in which case bring your appetite and patience).
author: Ben M.

description:
Yum, square pizza! Garlic clam is what I had and I thought it was delicious! The ratio to bread to sauce to topping was near perfection. PLUS IT WAS SQUARE.

Kinda small bar scene kind of place with some stools, TVs and beer. It had good vibes for chilling.

It's a 10-15 min walk/hike but we grabbed our pizza and ate it t coit tower.

Cash only.
author: Mimi T.

description: Some of the best pizza I have ever had which is saying a lot as I feel I've had some pretty good stuff in Chicago, NYC, all over Italy and many other iconic places.  One piece fills you plenty.  Crust was outstanding.
author: L B.

description: This has got to be one of our favorite pizza spots. Some of the best pizza I've had in a long time. We even make our way all the way out here from the South Bay on a Thursday night just for a slice. The line is ridiculous, but it is so worth it. I definitely recommend the clam & garlic slice.
author: Camisha B.

description: Very unique place and eye appealing slices!  Forget the calorie count and  see for yourself !
author: Ally M.

description: Visiting San Francisco for the weekend; on our way back to our hotel we wanted a quick bite. This place did not disappoint. (5) stars, friendly staff, prices are great for what you get, pizza is the Best!
author: EJ M.

description:
I love you Golden boy. the best pizza i've ever had in the bay.

Pros:
+ Clam and Garlic Pizza brought me to a state of heavenly bliss for the 2 minutes I was eating it
+ Straightforward to order and the slices are nicely portioned

Cons:
-Cash only 
-Can be pretty pricey

This is the one place I have to go to if i'm in SF
author: Kevin L.

description: This is one of the best pizza places in San Francisco. I loved the feel of the building when I walked in. Also, the service was quick and the employees were very helpful.
author: Parth S.

description: There was a lot of hype behind this place and I left with a lot to be desired. The bar tender was super cool. The pizza was hot and fresh out of the oven, unfortunately it didn't have the taste I was looking for. It was kind of bland. I don't want to completely write Golden Boy pizza off... Next time I'm in SF I will definitely give them another chance. There is NO WAY the reviews could be this high and my experience was this far off... I'll chalk it up as a bad day.
author: Damion W.

description:
This place is so good. With all the pizza places in North Beach, where does one even go? Whenever I am out in this area with friends, we usually end up at Golden Boy when our night ends (it's open until 2:30 AM on Fridays and Saturdays...clutch.) I agree with most of the other reviews on this place - no frills, cash only, pick up your slice at the window and eat on the go pretty much. I've had a bite of the clam garlic that this place is known for, and it was pretty darn good. Pretty unique and nothing I've ever had before. The garlic balances out the seafood-y taste of the clams well, and the herbs and cheese bring it together. I usually get a slice of the veggie pizza which is loaded with a good amount of veggies. But what I like most is the pesto sauce on the veggie slices - yum! 

Highly recommend this place. Minus one star because it's cash only. The wait can also get pretty bad here, but I've only ever been late at night on Fridays and/or Saturdays. So you can imagine with the popularity of Golden Boy in conjunction with indecisive, incoherent, drunk humans, the wait can get very long. But it's worth it if you're willing to wait a bit - once you order, the food is ready relatively quickly, and you'll be on your way with a satisfying slice.
author: Steph V.

description: Stumbled on this place after visiting a few dive bars. Great pizza by the slice, cool vibe and beers by the jug. One of the better pizza slices I've had
author: Andrew F.

description: We came right when it opened. There was a small line forming and so we were happy to have come at the perfect time. We just got 2 slices since we weren't even hungry, but wanted to try it before leaving SF. We got the clam and garlic and the sausage pizza. Definitely the star was the clam and garlic pizza. Omg it was delicious and I never could have imagined clam being a topping on a pizza. The garlic was strong but was perfect with the clam. The sausage was good as well, but I definitely recommend the clam and garlic if this is your first time here!
author: Dayae K.

description: Pizzagasms served all day and night! This cash only spot typically has a line, no matter what time it is, but is totally worth the wait. They have a few pizza selection slices, but I usually go for the combination. What makes this pizza the most delicious that I have ever had is their crust. Their handmade crust is made with some type of herb dough and is just so fluffy, crispy and delicious. This pizza is so flavorful that you don't even need ranch! There are a couple of seating options inside of the place, but it can get cramped. However, if you do choose to inhale your pizza inside, they also have delicious beers on tap. Overall, if you are seeking the best pizza slices in all of San Francisco then you definitely have to check out Golden Boy pizza!
author: Cristal C.

description:
OMG- Golden Boy Pizza is AMAZING. My wife and I went after a late night of bar hopping with friends. It was the perfect treat at the end of the night. 

A lot of our friends have been telling us we have to try the pizza here, and now I am telling you, you must try it!  I feel like it is a "must try" kind of place in San Francisco. I would say we waited for about 15 minutes (in the rain- don't worry, we had an umbrella), and it was definitely worth the wait.

My wife has the pesto veggie pizza and she was in love with it. I had the clam and garlic pizza and the cheese pizza. All were incredible. It was perfectly crunchy and they even warm them up on the spot right before they give you your slice.

It is a bit pricey per slice, and there is apparently never any space to sit ( it is a pretty small hole-in-the-wall place), but I absolutely think it is worth it. It is probably the best pizza I have had in San Francisco.
author: Umang P.

description: We waited almost 45 mins for our 2 slices last night, but I'll still give Golden Boy 5 stars. Just gotta remember to get there earlier than 1:30am and I think we'll be fine. Also forgot to note in my previous review that it's CASH ONLY!
author: Camille B.

description: I work around the corner and let me tell you how difficult it is to walk past this joint everyday without turning right into the door- basically if I don't already got cash, I run across the street to the atm and get my ass back as soon as possible to get a place in line. It's open hella late, and by that I mean, always open when I need it to be, uh, I've made so many friends standing in line at this place (be prepared to wait, y'all, Golden Boy always poppin' from the early evening on to the ungodly hours), I take everyone who comes to visit me here, it's hella chill, the pizza is so damn worth the agony of standing outside while the freshly baked cheesey smell wafts out the door, I always think I'm about to die and need two slices but I always end up getting full on just one, do I even need to continue at this point? Bottom line, get cash, get here, order from the tap, hang out, make friends, watch the game. And don't graffiti the walls if you're drunk, you might end up immortalizing your ex's name by accident. (P.S. Clam Garlic is helllaaaaa garlicky, so don't get that unless you got the cajones for it. Pepperoni's my all-time fave)
author: Justine K.

description: I gave this place one star to show the unreliability of Yelp.  I have never been to this restaurant so I have no idea how their food taste.  My suggestion is to just eat it and then decide.  But don't expect Yelp to tell the truth.
author: Alex W.

description:
First time I came on a Friday night around midnight and had to wait about 20 minuets in line. Every second was worth the wait. Clam & garlic pizza was delicious (warning you should like garlic if you try it). The crust is crisp and firm, but not over done. Good ratio of cheese to crust. I didn't get enough the first time, so came back two nights later to satisfy my yearning for another slice. Will go back again and would tell my friends to go here as well. 

Just be prepared to wait in line.
author: Bobby J.

description: The best place for delicious and cheap pizza in SF! I devoured three slices by myself. My favorite by far was the clam and garlic pizza. The veggie pesto was really good as well though (even though I tend to be a carnivore). They're open pretty late as well so it's good for sobering up after hitting the bar! Expect it to be busy if you go anytime between 5-9pm. Don't be upset if you have to wait in line, because it's worth it. Usually, there aren't many seats available inside so grab your pizza to go and get some gelato!
author: Isa M.

description:
Pizza snob! Hate it or hate it.

It will be forever a challenge to satisfy east coasters when it comes to pizza in California. I don't get why Golden Boy has the reputation it does. We ordered a plain square for each of us and thought it was really boring. There was barely any sauce, the cheese had little flavor, and it was way too bread-y. Yes, it's a square, but dry tasteless bread doesn't make it acceptable. If want to change your life, try the Sicilian at DiFara's in Brooklyn!!
author: Priti K.

description: You already have enough reviews here to see the details of this place. I'm just writing review here to add another vote for "this is best pizza in SF." Thick and crispy pizza. I think the name of the pizza was combination that had clams in it. GET THAT ONE. so good. Whatever you get here will be amazing. Best food to have post party since it closes later than other places.  Not much space to sit down and eat, so make sure you figure that out first before standing in line to eat it.
author: Serena Y.

description: Unbelievable bad. I dont know how this place got these review, either people are starving for food or go by 5 star reviews. The pizza base is 3/4th the pizza, it was not the fresh slice we got. Clam, veggie and plain cheese is what we got .. unfortunately trashed most of it.
author: Sid K.

description:
Little Italy is FULL of pizzerias, so it makes it hard to choose when you have so many different options. 

A friend suggested Golden Boy Pizza and boyyyy is this place golden!

They have large, open windows that face out towards the street, showcasing all of their freshly made focaccia style pizzas. Already made, the pizzas are lined up and ready to eat. Topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and a variety of other ingredients. 

Once you enter, you can tell that's it pretty much all about the pizza. Grungy, dark, bar table seating, no frills; this place has an edgy, cool, I don't give a damn type of feel. Just gimme my food, yo. 

If I had my way, I would've probably ordered one slice from each pizza, but I contained myself and settled on three separate slices. 

One for brekkie, lunch, and dinner. That's my idea of meal planning. 

So, my first slice was combination. It consisted of sausage, pepperoni, zucchini, tomatoes, and mushrooms. My favorite slice by far.

I also ordered a slice of the clam and garlic. For those who really like seafood flavor this would be a great choice. The clam flavor was really pronounced and was an equal component to the garlic. I looooove seafood, but I'd have to say that this one was a tad bit overpowering for me.

The third slice was good ol' pepperoni and cheese. Who could ever go wrong with such a classic combination? Hit. The. Spot. So good. 

If you're a fan of thick crust, you'll love it here. The bread is so soft, moist, chewy, and delicious. They even heat it up right before serving so you'll get it piping hot.

This place is cash only, but there are plenty of banks in the area for ATM use. Pizzas are roughly $2-4 per slice. 

Their hours are prime for those who like to have a drink at the local bars and in need of munchies afterwards. Open Sunday through Thursday, 11:30 am to 11:30pm and Friday and Saturday, 11:30am to 2:30am.

Ordering your food to go is a cinch. Pizza is good. Casual setting. Service is friendly. I'd be happy to go here anytime!
author: Ann S.

description: Square doughy pizza that's simply incredible. Popular late night spot. Cash only!!!! I'm a plain Jane and get cheese and pepperoni that's amazing. They have fun flavors like clam and white sauce, that is a crowd favorite. There are Wells Fargo's, Bank of America, and a chase around the corner.
author: Melissa R.

description: Excellent focaccia-style slices.  Even better reheated at home!
author: David B.

description: What can I say that everyone else has already said about Golden boy pizza. I've been here like five times and have never been disappointed with their pizza. Wish they sold half sheets of pizza cause buying a whole sheet is just to much pizza. If you in the city you got to stop by here and try their pizza you won't be disappointed.
author: Dennis T.

description:
Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm. That's all I have to say! 

Srsly though it's really good, clam one is overrated go for the pepperoni.

My gf likes the veggie one.
author: James K.

description: Good and cheap pizza in little Italy. The restaurant is small and you may miss it easily. Would definitely be back as it's quick and simple. One slice is enough for me so it's a cheap lunch.
author: Cecilia C.

description: Golden Boy is American pizza and it's damn good and damn cheap. A slice or two will fill most people up. The clams and garlic is the most unique flavor, but everything is good.
author: Alivia V.

description:
Nothing beats finding food that remind you of your childhood and these hit the mark perfectly for the breakfast pizza's I remember eating in elementary. Back when you were served real food as opposed to food in wrappers. These slices are the adult version of that and I am glad to have found a nice spot in SF where I can grab a slice like that. Luckily, SJ has a similar spot but if I could exchange it for Golden Boy, you bet your arse I would. 

Place is really cool bar style eatery. It is very hole in the wall type business with a long and narrow interior. Lots of cool stickers and tagging along the bar seats and bathroom. It's really cool to stare at while chowing down. I recommend bringing a sharpie so you can make your visit a little more memorable. Who knows, maybe one day you'll be bringing your kids here and can point out the tag from the first visit you made. 

In a really great walking area of North Beach/Little Italy. It is CASH ONLY but there is a BoA down the St and a Chase around the corner and also atms in shops nearby.
author: Maria M.

description:
I like this place. This is the first time I actually sat down and ate here. The first time I just got a slice and went to Washington Square Park. 

I like the cool vibe of the place. I like the old rock music they where playing. 

The pizza was very good. Their pizza is square shape. It was more than enough. I got the pesto veggie slice. Next time I will try the other ones. 

This place is pretty famous. I heard about it years ago, but never paid too much attention. I have to say I like it more than the famous North Beach Pizza.
author: Edie G.

description:
It's hip to be square. ;) Golden Boy Pizza is pizza crack.

Focaccia pizza with a crispy crust and piled with generous toppings. Order it by the slice or wait a little longer and order a slab!

I have been to Bertolucci's Ristorante for Golden Boy's Clam pizza but have never had the opportunity to stop by to the original location.

Small and efficient, there is a long bar if you wish to sit and enjoy your pizza with a drink.  

Order the clam pizza, it's my favorite! Generous clam bits in each bite.

What an experience! No better way to complete the evening then a slice of pizza to end an eventful and fabulous day of eating and drinking.

What you need to know:

 - Steps away from Amante so stop by both places
 - There are two parking garages located about a block away
 - Cash only 
 - Eat in or take-away
 - Beer is available
author: Jess N.

description: One of the best pizza I've ever had!  Discovered this during a North Beach food tour and will be back for sure.  Everyone in our group LOVED this pizza.
author: Sean M.

description: The pizza here is the right size, is not pooling with grease on top, and the crust is not too thin and has the right amount of firmness to it like a focaccia bread.  Every slice I've had here has been consistently flavorful, especially the garlic and clam ($4.25).  In addition, the friendly service and the unpretentious decor make the trip to North Beach worthwhile.  Thanks to one of my Facebook friends for posting a photo of her slice; I would not have known about this place if it wasn't for her!   This place is cash only.
author: Yoshi O.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is definitely worth the stop.  The crust is full of flavor and just the right amount of crunch.  We tried several types of pizza, our favorite was the clams & garlic pizza.  
Great place for pizza and beer.
author: Sherry M.

description:
Can't say it's the best pizza experience in SF but it's tasty, cheap and satisfies the pizza cravings. Hot, cheesy, square focaccia slices - Sicilian style is not something you can get just anywhere in SF. Visually it reminded me of pizzas from elementary school lunches back when I was a kid but less soggy and blandness. 

There was a decent sized line formed outside upon arrival but thankfully the line kept moving. We each ordered two and sat at the bar watching the Warriors lose to the Lakers. At least the pizza offered some solace in this sad loss, and to the Lakers of all teams! 

Cash only but there are plenty of banks and ATMs nearby.
author: Esther A.

description: We came here after we getting rejected by fisherman's pizza, but we soon found out that it was a blessing in disguise. We got here at around 1AM there was a little bit of a line, but I could see it's well worth the wait. We get inside and order pepperoni and a combo 2 each me and the lady. They are already cooked but they put it back in the oven to toast it more which really got my attention. Once we got it I could taste the freshness and the crunchiness. I instantly wanted more. HANDS DOWN BEST PIZZA I've ever had. I recommend for anyone looking for a good pizza place.
author: Aaron R.

description: TINY!! Long line but moves pretty fast. Service is total crap but the pizza was great. We got the combo and the sausage. Both were great, but they give very little amount of sausages so maybe pepperoni next time and the combo barely had the "combo" aspects. It was majority mushrooms all around the pizza and two pieces of zucchini and onion on the side. Overall lacks service and consistency in pizza but the pizza is great.
author: Sarah T.

description: Definitely love that this place serves deep dish pizza. My favorite is the garlic and clam! Service was friendly. Waitress brought my slice to me while I was seated in the back chatting away with my friend. It was lightly toasted on the bottom so that made for a nice crunch. The pizza slice had so much cheese on it which is good. Only thing was that I wish there was more garlic on it. Oh! And this place is cash only.
author: Cynthia T.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is great for the price. I'm hesitant to call it the best pizza place in San Francisco, but you definitely get your money's worth. The portions are filling, and the service is timely. This place can get busy in a heart beat, and seating is limited.
author: Damian M.

description: Really? This tastes like Little Cesar's. Thankfully it costs about the same. The female bartender sucks. She never even helped us and the guy heating up the slices was rude. Not worth the wait.
author: Lauren D.

description: Delicious!  Best pizza I've had! We loved the Pesto veggie, combo and pepperoni. Very laid back place with great pizza!
author: Aizha S.

description: As a child my only experience with pizza was deep dish. My family only ordered Pizza Hut pan pizza, the veggie kind. So when I discovered thin crust, it was an exotic new prospect, one that I've preferred for many years. But now in my old age I'm going back to my roots and seeking out that golden crust, spongy thickness, and abundance of sauce and cheese and oh so yummy toppings. So color me surprised when we found ourselves in the line for golden boy after an afternoon of day-drinking. The pizza (I got the combo) was delicious! Perfect consistency, and held up to reheating in an unexpected way. Had no idea I'd want more than one slice so that's the lesson of this review, order 2 slices!!!
author: Archana P.

description: I love this pizza. I wish they deliver. I literally can have this pizza every day. It's soooooo yummy.
author: Ellie E.

description: Everyone I come to the city my wife and I make it a point to get some pizza from here. The first time we saw locals lining up sometime after midnight and figured if it's good enough for the locals we got to try it..glad we did been hooked ever since I am a fan of thin crust pizza and really can't stand thick pizza but with golden boy I will eat thick crust everyday (if it's theres!!) By far better then Tonys pizza around the corner
author: Mike B.

description:
Great customer service!
Small place but still has plenty of seating! 
Clams and garlic pizza was the best!
I also got the spinach and veggies... Second best! (Usually a cheese pizza type of person)
Big slices for $4 
Wish they still had one in San Mateo!
author: Brittany C.

description: Their Clam & Garlic is the BEST pizza I have ever eaten. Without question!
author: Ankit A.

description:
As far as I'm concerned if you haven't been to golden boy stay away.. I be been going there way before they ever had a line. So if I'm in the line now and someone ask me if it's worth it.
I tell them to go down the street if they need to ask. As far as I'm concerned natives and locals only !!!!!!
author: Stef M.

description: And our eating tour of San Francisco concludes with some of the best pizza around. Tiny spot in North Beach, sort of a metal vibe and shit for seating, but nice folks and killer pie. Try the Clam and Garlic, and anything with sausage and pepperoni! Great squares, they get focaccia dough right. Solid beer selection too.
author: Dave S.

description:
So delicious and worth the wait, in my opinion. Sure the line is out the door, but that didn't stop us from waiting and devouring our pizza. 
We will definitely return for pizza when we visit San Fran!
author: Noemi C.

description: Best thick crust pizza I ever had.   Nuff said......
author: Franco M.

description: We were in town for just the night and asked a few locals where to hang out that's under the tourist radar on a Monday night. We headed over near Golden Boy. There was a small line to order and the pizza's  lined up in the window looking oh so yummy. We had the oyster, veggie, and pepperoni. All are fantastic! If your in the city, on a budget, and looking for some great pizza, stop by Golden Boy for a slice.
author: NoFrills J.

description: This was a place I saw on yelp that had almost excellent reviews as I was visiting SF for the day and craved some pizza. Came to this place and ordered a pesto veggie pizza. I came to this place with high expectations because of all the good reviews about the taste and service that I read on here. The pizza came out to be $4.75 for a SMALL ASS RECTANGULAR SHAPED SLICE. For almost $5, I expected this pizza to be much larger by the slice and for it to be good quality. The first few bites around the edges were good- they were baked to crisp which I love. But then once it got to the middle, I felt like I was eating a pool of grease. IT WAS DISGUSTING. Not to mention the service I received from the man with the glasses re heating my pizza was very rude with an attitude (that's probably why they don't get as much tip and had to put it on their wall to remind customers to tip their servers). Overall, I did not enjoy this experience and will not come back.
author: Uyen V.

description:
When there's a line out the door, you know you're in for some good pizza!

The location was prime! We were hitting up the bar next door for Santa Con so we grabbed a bite before drinks and I'm so glad we did! 

The food:
The slices of pizza are huge and square! I thought that was unique and it's probably easier for them to make a lot more pizza like that. I got two slices of pepperoni which I don't recommend! I was starving. Like I haven't eaten all day and I'm famished. So naturally my eyes were bigger than my stomach. It it the spot and then some. They had unique flavors like clam on one slice and pesto and garlic. All choices are excellent! When I'm trying pizza at a new place I always get a classic pep because I want to taste the quality of their ingredients. THEY PASSED..with flying colors of course.

Inside:
The inside is super tiny, hence the line out the door. You can't go to the bathroom without brushing against someone while walking down the hallway. It's pretty dive bar-ish. Meaning there are tons of character and the bathroom is covered in stickers lol. 

Overall I loved it here! I think it's the perfect place to grab a bite. They are quick, have great service and have amazing pizza.

HEADS UP: 
****Cash Only****
Also, if you want to have your pizza inside a to-go box rather than a piece of paper then you'll be looking at a 50cent charge. No biggie, just be prepared!
author: Breanna P.

description:
The slices are expensive. I would rather pay the same price for a pizza that is made fresh to order at any other pizza place.

Try to go before the late night so you don't have a long wait.
author: Evan W.

description: Great customer service!  Attentive and friendly.  High quality pizza with soft top and crispy bottom and side.  I don't normally eat pizza but this I will!  Two slices too!  The garlic and clam is flavorful.  Combo was delicious.  Price is very reasonable.
author: Janita s.

description:
Oh man... Now I know why this place is such a hype. Although the pricing can be quite expensive, I think the quality matches the price! Seriously, one of the best pizza I've tried in a LONGGGGGG time. I love the crust and keep in mind that one slice of pizza is like equivalent to two slices. I got full after one slice and a half.
I got the:
Clam/garlic: at first, I thought this would taste weird because I'm not used to the flavor of clam on my pizza but MY GOSHHHHHH IT WAS AMAZING. The clam was mild but the garlic.. You can really taste the garlic. I'm a huge fan of garlic (: 
Combination: this was pretty mouth watering. If you can't figure out what to get, might as well get the combination. 

Definitely will come back here if I ever visit San Fran again! A must. 

P.S VERY tight space. Just get it Togo.
author: Tilia L.

description: Omg the clam and garlic is so awesome.  The breading is fluffy and light too!!! So yummy!!!
author: Cindy A.

description: Pizza was ok but the guy taking orders is a very mean and rude person. Never going back.
author: John W.

description: Some of the best pizza I've ever had!! Definitely recommend if you're in SF. But, be prepared, it's cash only.
author: Erin C.

description:
Soooo gooooooood. We waited in line for maybe 30+ mins for two slices of pizza each, but totally worth it. The pizza slices are generously portioned and just so, guiltily amazingly, good. 

I tried a slice of the garlic and clam pizza and the pepperoni and cheese. Garlic and clam was definitely a lot more garlicky thank I expected, and I probably wouldn't get it again because I couldn't get the taste/smell off of me for the whole weekend, but I'm glad I did - it was great! The pepperoni was my favorite. The crust on both was the right amount of "crispy" and "doughy," the cheese was nice and melty, and everything was flavorful. Two slices was more than enough to leave me feeling really full!
author: Natalie C.

description: So we went to San Francisco last week as tourist, and this place was highly recommended by g/f's friend.  It was somewhat close to our hotel on Sutter, took a walk there and noticed the night life around the area.  The line was long, out to street long.  Then again, the ordering area is by the entry door, so the line is understandable.  It was rather chilly out, and I hoped the pizza would be worth the wait.  Well, 2 slice of cheese, 3 slice of sausage was $22.  I guess that's normal in San Fran.  They were square pizzas, with really thick dough, maybe around 5"x5" per slice.  It was pre-made, sitting behind the glass shelve.  It goes into the oven for a quick reheat, so it's not exactly fresh.  It wasn't great as I hoped.  The dough was too thick for me, and too little cheese and too little sauce.  The g/f thought it was the best thing ever, then again, she believes the hype of anything from anybody.  Inside, there were no heating, the door was open for the people waiting outside, so the cold breeze just kept on drafting in.  Like all place in San Francisco, it was small, basically a road home size.  Not many places to sit and eat.  The owner was very friendly though.
author: Jake L.

description:
Came here with my ex-girlfriend at the time and her friends. I've heard a lot of hype about this place. I've seen pictures of the slices, and at first it didn't look too appealing at all. We ordered a slice of the garlic clam and I believe just a Margarita. I was BLOWN away by the clam and garlic slice. 

If I knew it was going to be that good, I would of ordered a whole pie. 

Now I understand the hype and why this place is a gem in SF. 
This is definitely a drunk person's best place to dine in after getting hyphy at the club. 
I'm definitely coming back here again with good company and will enjoy the crap out of their pie. 

For the record I'm not usually a big pizza person, but this and 2 other places really have me giving hope to my love for pizzas. 

It's OK for dates.
author: Huy H.

description: Tiny, but who needs a lot of space? I come for the incredible pizza, and a beer. I always bring my out of town guests here!
author: Douglas A.

description:
Note: the pizza here tastes a lot better when you're intoxicated.

Came here the other day completely sober, expecting mind blowing pizza. The pizza itself did not have enough sauce and I thought the dough to everything else ratio was off. It was good but not as amazing as my drunken alter ego thought it was
author: Derrick W.

description:
Golden Boy is a SF treasure. It's essentially pizza on focaccia that is cut into hearty squares and then heated to perfection. You can view the available flavors by the window and the garlic & clam or combo are my personal favorites. You can't go wrong though.

There is limited seating, so you can grab a bar stool and a beer or take it away. Whether a casual dinner or a late night snack, Golden Boy competes with Tony's as the best pizza in North Beach.

One note is that it is cash-only, so come prepared! Also, probably not the best to dine-in with large groups due to limited seating.
author: Peter D.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza more like best pizza in the world!! I live in SoCal and have never had a pizza this good! It tasted fresh and was the perfect portion. I got the pepperoni pizza and it was phenomenal!! 

Also customer service was great, everyone who worked there was super friendly. The only down side (for large parties) is that the space is small with bar styled seating. To solve that problem order to go.. I would be worth it!! Other than that I would highly recommend coming here if your craving a delicious slice of pizza.
author: Emily O.

description: Visited this place one Friday night around 11:30pm. Long line of loud "hipsters" with several drunkies were waiting to order. Once I entered the shop there was almost no room to breathe or stand. However, even after 30min of waiting and being surrounded by rude customers, I cannot bash down on the quality of their pizza. It was actually amazing because of its depth of flavour and the soft, chewy texture. It's moderately salty which I really appreciate - I honestly think those places that make super salty pizza (eg. Patxi's) don't know how to create authentic flavour so they end up pouring salt at least to provoke our taste buds. Anyways, the price is also incredibly low compared to other pizza selling stores so try it!
author: Emma N.

description:
One really shouldn't be in line at Golden Boy unless the bars are closed and one needs to have some late night dirty shame-eating because one is otherwise out of luck for a slice that time of the night. 

For a better Sicilian slice, head around the corner to Tony's slice house during the day. Golden Boy's crust is just a little too doughy, they can be a little inconsistent during peak hours, and the long line for it is just not worth it. If you must though, the veggie pesto is the way to go and the slices go for around $4. Sober up now.
author: Jon L.

description:
This place was pretty good the dough is like focaccia bread but light airy and crispy.

The pepperoni was slightly spicy but yummy yum.  The combo was good with the sausage.

The line was about a 30 minute wait for us.  Three slices for 12.25.
author: Toma C.

description:
Ready to be popped into the oven! The placers really small - more of a long, narrow bar with stools lining the counter and wall but I love that we were starving, walked right  in, picked out slices that went straight into a warming oven for about 3mins and came out the perfect temp. 

I got the garlic clam because those are two of my favorite things and hubby got his usual pepperoni. I was SOOO elated to see actual chunks of garlic all over my slice instead of just minced cubes. Seriously, there was probably 2-3 cloves worth of garlic on my pizza and I loved it! The other impressive feature of this slice was the dough. The underside was the lightest version of crisp - more like a lightly toasted piece of bread - and the middle was light - almost like focaccia bread. Absolutely wonderful because it didn't overwhelm the toppings and wasn't super bloating. This is actually the first slice of pizza I have ever had that did that cheese-stretch thing when you don't bite it fully - which has always been a dream of mine. So Sooo sooooooo good! It's 8am as I write this yet I want some more. 

Although there were bar seats inside on this Sunday night, we walked with the slices to where the parentals wanted to eat because they didn't consider this "the little Italy experience."

Please understand- this place isn't for the fancy pants diner inside you - it's for the pizza/beer loving no frills starving-from-walking-all-over-the-city-one... And that side of you will be happy you came!
author: Kimmy T.

description: So I finally stopped by the famous golden boy. Parking is a B, so I suggest muni, or getting dropped off. The slices are moderate and full of flavor. The pizza was great, and a good quick bite
author: Selvin J.

description: Came across this place by a recommendation and let me say nothing shy of excellence; amazing food, amazing staff and amazing atmosphere. If your looking for pizza, it's a must!
author: Isaac H.

description:
The pizza wasn't the best pizza in the world but it was really good. 
The stools and tables were pretty cramped and it was a bit uncomfortable to dine in.
author: Marcus J.

description: That clam pizza. No other place compares for such a cheap, crispy slice of goodness. Try it!
author: Dee N.

description: Who hasn't been here in the wee hours after spending a night out clubbing? The pizza is DELICIOUS, there isn't any seating, so you'll be sitting curbside. The lines are long, but so worth the wait.
author: A B.

description: went today and had a combo slice! amazing! hands down  the music was blasting the ballgame was on the big screen it was crowded but everyone was doing their own thing. After all it is San Francisco! had that slice washed it down with Dr Pepper and headed to get my tattoo next-door at Tattoo Bugaloo ! awesome times!
author: Bianca W.

description: Me and a few friend's went there last night and i must say this is a really good to go pizza place food was delicious, staff friendly and quick and slices fill you up. I had two and was full. Its a must try if your in the city.  Not much seating but who cares tbe pizza is whats good about this place.
author: Christy M.

description:
This pizza is delicious. They sell by the slice and you can see their selection from the front window.

For under $6 I ordered a slice of hot and gooey, pesto veggie pizza. It's thick focaccia style pie and worth every calorie filled bite.

Parking in North Beach is a nightmare though so be prepared for a lot of driving in circles.
author: Shay I.

description: I don't really like pizzas,but I really liked Golden Boy!  Came in with a friend and we ordered a few slices and a couple of glasses of beer.  Cash only (not expensive), and you stand in line for your slice and hope there is a spot to sit - but it was worth it.  Pizza still is not my favorite meal, but I would definitely return for a few slices.
author: Theresa C.

description: I tried the veggie one and OMG such perfection. Is the ultimately late night munchies pizza. I also loved the place bc it remind me to barrio pizzerias from Buenos Aires, my hometown.
author: Maca M.

description:
I'm really not that into Golden Boy Pizza. I think it's really overrated. However, it must be noted that I'm just not that into Sicilian style pizza (the thick dough, square cut pizza). I much prefer a traditional thin NY slice. 

Now, if that's your preferred style, you may like this place. It's definitely Californian style, where as in they do interesting toppings.

I just thought the dough was too chewy and kinda underbaked? It's more bread than pizza. Also, it's not that cheap. I'm from the East Coast, home of the $1 slice (okay, I'd rather pay a bit more for better slices, but still....). CA pizza ain't cheap and it's a gripe of mine. 

Also, there's often a long wait and I like hot out-of-the-oven fresh pizza. This is the type of place that it's already been baked and then they have to warm it up for you again. 

In Yelp's perfect words for a 2 star review, "Meh...I've experienced better"
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Love it! Local feel, pizza by the slice! Everyone in line was a local sweating it is the best pizza in town! 

Thick cheese! Great toppings!
author: Adam C.

description:
It has been awhile since I have been to Golden Boy as we had been frequenting Tony's the past few years.  However, Golden Boy is like that friend that you have not seen for years but can pick up right where you left off.  

I love myself a good slice of Sicilian pizza which was one of my slice of choice back in Jersey but with deep dish and attempts at NY slices being more common, Sicilian style seemed to have taken a back seat in the Bay Area.  It was probably 10 years before I had a slice of Sicilian the way I remembered it.  Bad news is it was down in San Diego.  As I lamented to the owner of Sicilian Thing that it took me so long to find a comparable slice of Sicilian but yet they are still a plane ride away, he pointed me to Golden Boy in SF for a closer slice.  Between $3-$4 for a slice of goodness, you can grab a seat inside, eat it standing outside, or take it to go.  If to go, pop into an oven or toaster oven at 350 for about 10 minutes to refresh and it is just as good.  Just don't microwave it as the crispiness of the Sicilian style doesn't stand up well.   We happened to find a space right around the corner so bought 12 slices to go between us for lunch the next day and to share.  You may find a choice of combo, cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, clam and garlic, and sausage so something for everyone! 

Note:  It is cash only here and you need to order minimum of 3 slices to get a box to go.  Line up, order, pay and either take a seat inside or wait outside where they slide you your pizza box through the window.
author: Joyce Z.

description: This is the best pizza joint in SF. It's by far one of the most delicious crusts. The crust is extremely crispy and the tomato sauce is exceptional.
author: Radhika B.

description:
Omg their pizza is amazing! Get the garlic clam and pesto when you're there. The crust is a bit thick for my liking but the flavors are on point. 

Oh and they're cash only but they have an ATM inside and Wells Fargo down the street.
author: Kristy L.

description:
The pizza here was fine but nothing exciting, and ready quickly. The selection is limited to 4 flavors that get reheated as ordered. It was interesting that they had an option with clams. 

If I'm in the area again, I'd probably risk trying a new place, in the hopes of finding something better, but Golden Boy is a fine back up.

Cash only.
author: Iris H.

description:
Pretty good pizza! You can smell it from a few feet away. Only down thumbs is that it CASH ONLY. The cashier was super cool about it and even guided me to the bank on the corner or the atm on the back. Good prices (3 slides and a Coke for about 13 dollars). The inside is kind of small but it's okay for a fast snack.
I was pretty satisfied with the service it was fast. Also the Mexican guy with the tattoos making the pizza was very helpful. He recommended the combo pizza with all the vegetables. The cashier were busy so I asked him if I could use the restroom. He was kind and told me where the bathroom was.
author: Erika D.

description:
It's true.
You haven't really done North Beach proper if you haven't done Golden Boy Pizza.
At 2 AM.
After a night of...over indulging.

But, that's not to say that you shouldn't do it at other times.  Whenever you need a hot, quick slice in the hood, this is your joint.  

You're more than welcome to bring your slice into Gino's next door, & they regularly supply them w a pan or two for the house.

It's simple & straightforward.  Other than the clam & garlic, the options are your standards...cheese, pepperoni, & pesto veggie.

The pepperoni is my favorite.  Solid sauce, & cheesy goodness.

They deserve the 4 stars for being open so late, & putting up w the 2 AM chaos.  And props for basically sustaining the big night out crowd.

Good, cheap eats.  

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Tried it for the first time just recently.  I had the combo, I believe (one of those nights, lol).  They were already out of the clam & garlic pizza.  I ended up buying another slice for myself.  AND THEN, I went back the next day and got their Clam & Garlic.  I keep thinking about it.
author: Joane B.

description: Great pizza but a long line. It was super affordable though. I got two slices and a pint for $10! That's a freaking steal in San Francisco. Someone told me to eat whatever is fresh out of the oven but I didn't like that as much as just getting the pepperoni.
author: Noah Y.

description: My friends and I came here on a sunny afternoon and ordered the clam and garlic slice and combo slice. There was a line but moved pretty quickly. The crust of the pizza is pretty on point here, but everything else was lackluster. There wasn't enough sauce on the pizza, and the cheese wasn't melted enough. If you like your pizzas heavier on the toppings and cheese, this place is for you! The seating is limited, so you may want to take your pizza to go.
author: Vicky P.

description:
After a few brewskis in Chinatown, my friends and I took a walk up Grant street and came across this gem of a place! The folks I was hanging with have been to this place and have raved about the pizza. The smell was strong a block away and so enticing, I couldn't help but stop in and try what they had to offer!

This place gives off a hole in the wall vibe. They only take cash so please be advised. We got in at the right time, 20 minutes later there was a line down the block. In the window of the joint, the pizzas sit. you walk in, order, they grab what you want and put it back in the over to crisp up. There's bar top seating and other table tops in the back. They also serve beer at this joint which was totally up our alley! The staff was a little cold at first but totally opened up to us by the end. They just needed some of the charm our group had to offer! The gal that helped us was having a baby on Christmas Day so if she reads this, an early CONGRATULATIONS!

For my slice and beer, I got the clam and garlic slice for $4 and a PBR pint for $3. The beer was cold and refreshing. Now the pizza sounded pretty weird but OMG, it was such an awesome sliced! It was more of a deep dish style but not a true deep dish. The bread was thick however they also packed on the toppings to balance the bread. Along with the garlic and clams was cilantro. This pizza was packed with flavor, perfectly crispy and soooo delicious! I can't wait to return for another slice. 

Do yourself a favor and get down to this place. The masses of people  waiting in line will definitely prove how good of a place this joint is. The pizza speaks for yourself and you owe it to try. You will not be disappointed!
author: Rockne H.

description: HEAVEN. 4 words: Garlic and clam pizza. effing amazing. Cash only. I would buy the whole freakin pan if I could. The dough is so fluffy and the crust is super buttery and crunchy on the outside and fluffy on the inside-- I want to cry tears of joy just thinking about it.
author: Kris L.

description: Got the garlic clam pizza slice to go after 25 mins wait - it was worth it! Perfect greasy crunch to crust, they also didn't skimp on the clams. I had the last slice before a new batch was coming and it was still amazing...I can only imagine even how much better it would be piping hot from the oven. Great to grab a slice and just enjoy in the park.
author: Tim S.

description: Hands down in my top 10 pizza beats out Blondies and Fat Slice! The flavors are like a party in your mouth. I can't wait to get an entire tray for my birthday in February
author: Micheal P.

description:
We passed by this place at around 9 pm on our way to Amante and there was a long line.  And at 11:15 pm,  there was still a long line!  My friends and I had just finished having drinks at Amante, and were hungry, so we decided to stop by this place before going home.  Luckily, we were able to get our pizzas by 11:45 coz we had to dash out of there and take a taxi to the BART station.  We needed to take the last train for the East Bay at 12:15 am 

I had the combo slice which had sausage, pepperoni, zucchini and bell pepper I think.  My husband just had the pepperoni.  The total for both was under $8.  Didn't think you can eat this cheaply in North Beach!  We just paid through the nose to eat at Don Pistou's, so I was just so happy that we wouldn't have to take out a second mortgage to satisty our after drinking hunger!  It is cash only so make sure you have a few dollars in your pocket.  The pizza was piping hot when we got it, but we couldn't eat it till we got to BART, so they weren't as hot then.  They were still good though.  Crispy crust and nice sauce with good toppings.  I liked the sausage.  Yum!  We'll stand in line for their pizza again if we're in the area!
author: Hazel C.

description: The best pizza in town. I recommend anyone who comes to San Francisco definitely come get a slice. Whenever im in town me and my boyfriend make this same must location to go to. Pizza is always hot and fresh. Worth wait!
author: Gizelle S.

description: Maaaan the pizza is amazing!!!!! I'm giving it 4 stars because the guy taking our order interrupted us in the middle of talking and screamed at his co worker to turn the music up. Started talking to his co worker instead...I'm all for having fun at work, but come on dude... don't be rude... he had an "I don't care" attitude, that's about it though, it was just a bit rude. We would go back again, hopefully deal w someone who is more friendly.
author: Sonya O.
