description: The clam and garlic pizza is the BEST!!!! Will definitely come back for that. $4.25 one small piece. Two pieces are enough. The only concern for me is the combo and veggie are too oily.
author: Danyang W.

description:
We have hung out in this area in the evenings and the line is always piled out the door. As we were driving by Sunday afternoon, we saw no line, open parking, made a quick decision and decided we were going in to grab us a snack!

From the outside the place looks small, it looks like a grab and go, but as you venture in, you will notice there is bar seating all along the length of the shop.

What you see in the window is what you get, They offer 4 types of pizza, Pepperoni, Sausage, Cheese and a combo that has Pepperoni, sausage and zucchini. We got a Pepperoni to share since we had lunch maybe 1 hour prior. It was heated up quickly for us , and we took a seat at the bar. While the cheese and pepperoni was nothing out of this world, There was something very magical about the pizza dough. The way each bite crunches , and breaks off with the knife, it was very satisfying and delish. 

You can order an entire sheet of pizza but you must call in first.

The bathroom is pretty intense, There is like not one spot that isn't covered in stickers!
author: Sharon N.

description: First time visiting this place, heard it though a friend of mine. Very small sitting place, a good quick eat it and go place. One of the better pizza places I've been to in SF, would definitely visit again on my next trip. I would recommend asking for the edge or the corner slice, that crust is amazing and gives a crunch throughout your slice!
author: Crystal B.

description:
This place is an institution in North Beach and I can't recall how many nights I have stood in line for a pipping hot Sicilian style slice of whatever is placed in the window after bouncing from bar to bar on Grant street. 

You can never go wrong with any of the choices from your standard pep and sausage to any of their incredible combination pies. However there is one slice that tops all others and if you are not a seafood fan I will apologize ahead of time, and then will gladly have your portions of the Garlic-clam combo pie. 

The place is very divey and that's what makes it a perfect fit for this neighborhood. North Beach is known for classy restaurants and countless bistros but Golden Boy exudes that North Beach tough guy attitude, and man are we thankful for it.  

First class service, a thick foccacia style square cut crust, fresh toppings and an incredible collection of beers in tap. What more could you possibly want after a night on Broadway or after a pub crawl with friends? Just go get in line already, your tummy will thank you later. 

And after a garlic clam slice you will be able to ward off everything from vampires to every girl or guy that gets within a 3 foot radius of you... 

Viva la Golden Boy!
author: Josh H.

description: We came here at 2:28 AM (they close at 2:30) and we were next in line but they closed the window on us. I informed the gentleman that we had travelled there all the way from SoMa because we were loyal customers. He literally said "fuck you (flipped me off)" and said "leave a bad review on Yelp, it doesn't matter to us." I am following instructions here and am leaving a pretty negative review. Was a longtime customer, but this place has a stick so far up it's a** that I will no longer be returning and tell my friends to avoid it at all costs. (Especially avoid the fat guy who works from 1:30-2:30 am, he was he one who flipped us off). Never been treated so poorly by a business. I am filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau. If you must go, make sure to leave no tip.
author: Ben M.

description:
I came here at around 10 pm and there wasn't a line. Also, it's cash only! 
I got the clam and garlic slice and it was BOMB. I'm still craving it, even a few days later. The crust is thicker than I prefer, but it was actually pretty light and crisp. I loooved how garlic-y it was and had so much packed on top. Even though they heated it up, I think mine could've been a bit hotter since the middle was partially cold. And there isn't much space inside so it's better to grab it to go. But this is great pizza, and I'd definitely come back here!
author: Stephanie L.

description: IMHO, this is the best pizza in SF, and some of the best pizza I've ever had!
author: Brad K.

description:
Solid 3.5 stars actually. Sicilian style pizza (thick crust square cut). Had a slice of garlic and clams, a slice of the combo, and a slice of the pepperoni. The clams one was VERY garlicky (yum), but too fishy for me. The combo was good, but too much going on. 

The pepperoni was the winner of the night for sure. Sometimes simple is best. 

It can get crowded, but the line moves fast so wait it out if you really want pizza.
author: Aviva G.

description:
This review is long over due. I'm in and out of North Beach several times a year and I always have or grab a few slices to take home.

Sicilian squares are a big thing back east, but not so much in Cali. GB puts out a beautiful light and airy Sicilian Pizza (when in Sicily, Pizza like GB is called sfincione, pronounced Sven-Juni). GB reminds me of the pizza we grew up with. I loved to watch my Mom, Nana's, aunts, godmothers with their loving oversized arms working the dough into the tight corners of the pans, their hugs and kisses were just as tight! I can see and smell my childhood at this very moment, that's what great food does. 

If you haven't been to GB, you should, GB are the heavy weight champions in the Sicilian pizza category. Garlic clam its a must!

Quick service, cash only, make time for a drink a Gino and Carlos. Thank you GB for taking me down memory lane. 

Eat well my friends -VCard MyBlackCar.com
author: Vince C.

description: The sauce was off a bit,but It's good pizza for the price .long line but got our slices in less then 30min.the sitting area was pretty cool too.might have to try out again with other toppings.
author: Noemi D.

description: I normally do not use the word "OUTSTANDING" but the pizza was so good.  I had the garlic & clams with a cold beer.  Next time back, will differently return.
author: Joe R.

description:
After a night of your nonsense, get your ass in line for some hot pizza. And EVERYBODY is in line. Couples on dates, lame double dates, friends, pals, honeys from around the way, you & your dj crew, homeboys, flygirls, fine ass rucas, squads from the club, posses from the bars, you, your little sister, her best friend & her cousin. Hell, I'm pretty sure even co-workers that hang out together outside of work come here!

It's a pretty small location with a bright neon sign that illuminates where these hot cheesy squared slices can been had. Open late, some seating inside, cash only. A delicious cheap eat in SF .

A definite must if you're ever in this town. 
Big ups Golden Boy!

Your Homegirl,
Violy
author: Violy M.

description:
Walking around Little Italy we stumbled upon this small pizza joint. Clever marketing strategy displaying the pizzas in the street window where people passing by can't resist getting a slice! The pizza smell is completely intoxicating. 

It's a small pizza joint with limited seating in the back. Most people order by the slice and eat outside or to go. It seems to be a popular late night snack stop for those who need to sober up. Be prepared to wait in line. Each piece is a large thick square ranging in price from $2.75-3.75 based on the topping. The pizza was just divine! The bread was perfectly crispy and doughy and the cheese just melted in my mouth. Yum! 

A great stop for pizza anytime. By the way, CASH only.
author: Essie K.

description:
When you vote 5 stars for this place, you are telling out-of-towners that this is some of the best food you've ever had. Stop lying. This is not even close to some of the best food you've ever had.

The food is on par with Costco's pizza (which is good but not amazing), and the staff act like they are doing you a favor by letting you eat there.
author: Omar A.

description: Holy fuck in my balls. This is the best pizza I've had in the bay area. This place is as good as trump sucks. It's as good as Amy Schumer is not funny. It is as cheesey as Dane cook. A bite of this pizza will transport you to the mystical, hedonistic islands of riotikaompoda to bathe in lavender scented hot springs fused with cocaine.
author: Edward H.

description:
Hands down, the BEST pizza ever! If there is a line, its worth the wait. I had the cheese and pepperoni slices. Fresh, fresh, fresh. Its a thicker crust, its a nice crusty, crunchy crust...lol. So its very affordable and you can have a couple slices and a drink for about $10. CASH only! No worries, though because there's an ATM machine in the back. The seating area is small, so if you have a large group definitely just take out. 
     But people, the pizza is so good. The girl working at the time had it together and was taking orders and getting them out within a couple minutes. Give them a try!
author: Nicole E.

description: Okay let me start by saying that I was initially very excited about this place. I read a few reviews on Yelp and decided to give it a try. We saw a line and thought that was a good sign. It seemed to be in a trendy area. After eating I was disappointed. I don't understand what all the hype is about. My boyfriend and I ordered three different slices. The dough was too chewy and the flavors were okay. They have one restroom for both men and women and it was filthy. I will not be going back.
author: Mere R.

description: It's a joy to give the 2000th review for Golden Boy Pizza. I've heard about it for a long time as a true establishment in North Beach. So it only appropriate I started the evening by tying one on at Vesuvio Cafe for a Litquake reading before tasting the delights of GBP for the first time. I'm glad to say the pizza did not disappoint. While I'm an east coaster who grew up on NYC pizza I can still appreciate the sumptuous flavors of the sturdy squares of the Sicilian style offerings of GBP. Biting down into that thick square is a delight that's hard to fathom if you've never experienced this joint. The cheese comes dripping off of each toasty piece, cooked to perfection. It's clearly a line worth waiting in, so queue up!
author: David A R.

description: Great pizza joint. Lots of flavors without overloading with sauce. I had a combo and garlic clams, and both were delicious. Portion size isn't as large as everyone states, as I had two slices and could have eaten another combo. Garlic clam was indeed garlicky, however, I have to go with the combo as my favorite.
author: Brian J.

description: Best place to grab a slice of pizza while in the city! Many different options to choose from as well. Will definitely hit the spot! Came here at least once a day because there's no pizza like this back home. Will be returning :)
author: Nicole L.

description:
Square pizza at its best. I wish there was more time in the day to hike up to North Beach for a slice of clam garlic pie and beer from the draught. That's my retirement dream.

Cash only, about $10 per person will get you one piece and an adult beverage. Pop a squat on a stool and listen to the rock music playing inside.

Simple, kinda grungy, and absolutely required for any San Franciscan.
author: Abby S.

description: I'm not usually one to pick pizza to eat but based on the reviews I thought I might regret not coming here. Pizza was good! I tried the pesto, cheese, combo, and clam. It was hot, ready, and hand delivered through the window!
author: Mariah R.

description: This might be my favorite pizza place on the West Coast. All pretense is left at the door. Thick, flavorful Sicilian slices are served up straight from the warming oven on paper plates. You sit (or stand) at a small bar top facing corrugated metal that has a couple of decades of stickers covering it. They have such a generous beer selection as well. Go here. Go out of your way to go here. It's so good!
author: Josh H.

description:
Note this review is for take out only!

Came here around 2am on a Friday and there was a line out the door! You walk by the window with all the fresh pizza right before you get to order and at that point I just WANTED SOME PIZZA!!! 

At that point I just wanted to get the pizza and eat in my car since it was so cold out. Luckily, we were able to get the two slices out of 4 that was left when we got to the front. Unfortunately, they only had cheese left. Oh well, whatever to fill my empty stomach at that point! I like that they have a shaker of crushed red peppers right by the window - easy access.

The pizza was pretty good, but I wasn't blown away by it. It's a solid 3 stars!
author: Lillian C.

description: There was a 40 minute wait for this North Beach pizza joint, and if not for the clam pizza, I'm not sure I would want to wait that long in the future. I've never had any type of seafood on any pies I've tried, so this was a new experience for me and I enjoyed it. The pieces of clam were generous and packed with garlic flavor underneath cheesy deep dish pizza. It was yummy. I also had some of the combination style which was really good too.
author: Monica V.

description:
Came here in hungry anticipation, after reading the reviews. Approximately, 15 minutes in line on Friday during lunch time, I suppose wasn't too bad.

Most slices are $4.25, and come fully loaded.  

Unfortunately, the pizza was nothing special.  I liked that the bottom of the pizza was crisp, while the inside was soft and doughy.  The clams tasted like what one would get from a can.  Of the three of us who ate it, one person really liked it, while 2 of us thought it edible.

We also ordered a pesto veggie pizza, which was said to be so-so.

The combo pizza was also reportedly okay, though my lunch date said he has had better.  

So all in all an okay experience. Nothing that I foresee myself ever craving.  However nothing really to complain about.  

Extra kudos for good service.
author: Deb L.

description:
Cash only. Get the garlic and clam. Garlic and clam might be my favorite pizza ever now. 

Boyfriend and I got two slices each because we'd walked around so much today. We both got garlic and clam and I ordered sausage and he ordered the combo. They were completely packed and brought me pepperoni instead of sausage but I decided to just eat it anyway. I don't regret it. Both slices were excellent. I'd happily wait in that line again next time.
author: Aryana W.

description:
I'm completely in love with Golden Boy Pizza! Let me just say that it's probably a good thing I live on the other side of the country because I would be here all the time. For those of you who know me, this would be my Harbor of the West!  I was only in town 6 days and I ate here 3 times! 
One night I went with another Yelper and it was the first time in the restaurant for both of us. Boy were we pleasantly surprised! The pizza is just way beyond anything I anticipated! We were able to sit once we ordered, and if your only getting a couple slices and drinks it's really cheap. The pizza is amazing of course, and I really like the atmosphere of the place. I also had a good experience with all of the workers. They were all very nice and helpful even when it was packed. This is a pretty small restaurant with limited bar seating, but it's so cool! Even with the long line you will normally see here it's really not that hard to find a seat because the few times I was there I noted people who sit don't hang out too long. They sit and eat then leave. I did sit next to a few people who were very friendly and didn't mind chatting while they ate.
I noticed the pricing board and whole pizzas are a little expensive, but if I lived in the area I would never mind paying because I would know I'm getting a great pizza! It's too bad I could not bring any pizza home with me, so I did the next best thing and bought one of their t-shirts. You just need to ask for one and its $20.  I was very happy to bring a bit of Golden Boy Pizza back to New Orleans with me, and I can't wait to get back to San Francisco for more pizza!
 
(A side note... Once you order and sit you can order more pizza or drinks from your seat if you just catch the attention of a worker and this is a cash only operation)
author: Kate D.

description: Definitely recommend this place. Food is fantastic! As per others yelpers recommendations I tried out the clam & garlic pizza and had to go back for seconds.  Staff is super friendly and place is chill. If you're out in North San Francisco check this place out.
author: Nori H.

description:
My girlfriend (girl that's a friend) suggested we go here before a comedy show at Cobbs. The service was quick and the pizza was legit. There were 4 options to choose from, and then the staff heats the pizza in the oven before giving it to you. Two complaints - they are cash only...really?! And I get that they have a grunge feel, but the music was awful! I would have preferred to listen to the commentary from the baseball game on the tv, and I'm not even a huge sports fan.
I would like to give the staff kudos to quickly resolving a fight, there was a drunk patron bother another person, and the drunk person kept getting louder and louder and waving his hands in the air, and the staff quickly sent someone over to get the guy to leave, especially impressive because the drunk was a tall middle aged guy, and the cashier, was a rather small stature male.
author: Lisa H.

description: Pizza is good but like it's crazy long. Mostly a tourist trap but I was in the area and hungry. It got the spot!
author: Cameron S.

description: Incredible pizza. It's served in thick squares, but still maintains a crisp and tasty crust.
author: Drew H.

description: Cannot believe it has taken me this many years in the city to come. Wellll, I kinda think I mighta had a slice years ago, but it was late at night and all. in any case, I'm biased against square pizza as a rule, but this was EXCELLENT. had clam garlic and combo. the crust absolutely makes it. cold beer, giants on TV, friendly staff and great prices. coming back for sure.
author: Erica W.

description:
I'm a pizza kind of girl and Golden Boy is my kind of place. It's simple, delicious, and filling for those nights you've been drinking enough for two, or if you just want some pizza in the afternoon or evening. It's saved me from tossing my cookies more times than I'd like to admit. Also it's cut into squares which is nice if you're on the go.

Stopped in last night before a comedy show at Cobb's and had a slice of pepperoni. It was fluffy, cheesy, and hot, I wanted to add some crushed red peppers but my friends were being super pushy to get to the show early (which we did, with time to kill. Leave it to boys to eff up your pizza enjoyment).
author: Crystal C.

description: It is the best pizza in the world. Golden Boy Pizza is the reason I love San Francisco. I wish they had a delivery to LA ;-) great pizza for great price. Beers are just $5 so get the darkest one. I ate 3 slices there and bought 6 more slices and took them to LA. I can't wait to back there and have 10 slices
author: Samina M.

description:
Delicious square pizza with a nice buttery crust and flavorful toppings. I picked up 4 slices on a Sunday afternoon after spending some time in China Town.  My 4 year old son only eats pizza so the Yelp app sent us to Golden Boy.

We got two slices of cheese, a veggie and a sausage for a total of about $15 bucks.  The pizza over all was cheesy and buttery.  The pans they cook the pizza in are very well seasoned so the crust has great flavor.

Plan on waiting as they are pretty busy.  I think we waited about 10 minutes in line.  Customer service was fast and friendly.
author: Henry S.

description: It is definitely a really good deal. In San Francisco, it is hard to find a slice of pizza less than 5 bucks per slice for that kind of quality. It is crispy with an adequate amount of cheese in addition to it being very well seasoned.
author: Sophie C.

description:
The garlic and clam pizza is everything. Try it! You will not regret it. 
The line can get long. If you come after midnight when all the clubs get out the crowd can get obnoxious, if you're sober. If you're drunk it's all fun. 
Cash only. 
The staff is patient whether you're drunk or sober. 
Parking is difficult in the area. If you're not on foot, opt for take out and have someone idle the car while you run in.
author: E D.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco. Worth the trek to North Beach, the ridiculous prices, and the lack of seating. GO GET THIS PIZZA!

Trust me, I'm from New York, I know good pizza.
author: Daphne W.

description:
Amazing pizza! highly recommend it and its delicious to order and just enjoy every bite as you sit outside and listen to the sounds of the city at night. 

Great ingredients and even better crust and dough.
author: Jose B.

description: Golden boy pizza has the best slices in the city! No wonder there's always a line out the door! Have been coming here ever since I was a little child growing up and haven't turned away ever since! Every slice is cooked to perfection and each bite is like heaven in my mouth! I always grab a combo slice and a beer on draft when I'm there. I've tried all the other slices and they're great too! Another honorable mention is the clam and garlic slice. Never had one like this and it rocks and it will definitely keep the vampires always for the night! Definitely recommended when you're in the hood!
author: EccentricAura A.

description:
This place was delicious! 

After le fiance decided a sandwich wasn't exciting enough for his lunch in little Italy, he wanted to find the best pizza around. This is what popped up! He got a slice of everything and a slice of pepperoni to split. 

The pizza was great, but not my favorite. I would want to explore the other local options before this would be my go-to. However, it's super casual and really easy to get on the go. I would definitely grab a slice for a quick lunch in the park.
author: Courtney C.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked ever since a friend told me how good it was, and I finally gave it a try last night. I have to say this might honestly be one of the best pizza places I've ever had.

A few friends and I got here close to 2am after going out to the bars in the area. The line was really long and we were a little worried we wouldn't make it before closing, but they're really good at moving the line along as quickly as possible when you're dealing with tons of drunk folks. We made it to the front in about 30 mins and were able to get everything we wanted.

I got a slice of the clam and garlic and the supreme. At first, a clam pizza might sound a bit odd but trust me it's AMAZING. The clams tasted nice and fresh, and the garlic was such a nice touch. And the supreme was just as good! It had Sausage, pepperoni, onions, tomatoes, mushrooms, and zucchini. The crust and dough was cooked to perfection - nice and crunchy right on the outside but soft and doughy on the inside. After eating each slice I almost wished I had gotten more!

I definitely recommend trying this place if you're in the area (and even if you're not as well). Like I said, I consider it to be one of the best if not THE best pizzas I've ever had, and I can't wait to go back again!
author: Jaymie S.

description:
I guess I'm biased towards thinner, slightly sweeter pizza, but Golden Boy is pretty ok.

The dough is a perfect gradient of gooey to crispy. 

My two cents: clam pizza? I guess it's an adjusted taste but it was decent. Milder on the palate than expected. 

Sausage pizza? Very standard, nothing crave able. Reminded me of NYC school lunch as a kid for some reason, the kind that tasted flat.
author: Jenny L.

description: The veggie pizza tho.. my new spot! The only thing I don't like.. same tray and utensils for veggie and meat pizzas. I would go there more often if that wasn't the case.. I don't like cross contamination on my veggie food.
author: Anum M.

description: The bomb of pizza had the clam n garlic so yummy cheap beer crust perfectly crispy wouldn't change a thing yum well done !
author: Trish M.

description:
Truly as good as it gets.  My advice for SF eating...follow the crowd.
The line was out the door and wound down the street. We waited around 2:30 PM on a Sunday for almost half an hour to make it to the door and order 'at the window'.  We both had the cheese pizza and ordered to eat in since we were lucky that 2 barstools had just opened up at the otherwise full counter (max seating 20ish). Excellent service (very funny too) and delish food. We were served from a new pie straight out of the oven and piping hot...no reheat needed even though they will heat up the ones in the window for you if you are served from there. One relatively fair size 'slice' which is really a 4inX4in deep dish square was $4.  A full tray of cheese was $40. Cash only. TOTALLY WORTH IT. I wanted to go back again and would have if I had more time and not an already long list of places I wanted to try out. Will go back next time I am in SF.  Worth the wait and the price.
author: Nunya B.

description:
For the most part I stick to my philosophy of the "simple things in life". Pizza is an example of a food that should be kept as simple as possible to bring out each individual topping. When done right it is an example of great comfort food in addition to being quite the tasty way to get rid of alcohol in the system.

No1DP requested to eat a good pizza the next time he saw me because there isn't good pizza anywhere in Japan. I combined his desire of pizza with wanting to explore the North Beach part of SF.

The restaurant, though small, shows a bit of character. As you eat your pizza you can see what other patrons leave behind in the form of stickers. The No1DP and I had a good time deciphering what the stickers were trying to advertise. 

Good beer selection but there were more IPAs offered than other types of beer. I told my server that I wasn't too fond of IPA's but was recommended a beer that still had IPA on its name. When I tried it the beer was not too hoppy.

No1DP ordered the cheese pizza ($2.75). His philosophy on pizza is that he likes to keep the toppings to a minimum so that the main ingredients can shine - mainly the crust, tomato sauce and cheese. A sign of a good cheese pizza is that the cheese immediately falls when separated from the pizza. He enjoyed his pizza and is comparable to what he's had in Chicago.

I had the Clam and Garlic ($3.75). I enjoyed the thick crust on the pizza as well as the generous amounts of garlic and clam. It was generous enough that I downed my beer so that I wouldn't have to ask for mints. No1DP tried my pizza and liked it as well.

This place is good if you like your pizza with a thick crust and for SF travelers on a budget: you can get a good slice of pizza and beer for less than $20.
author: Isabella B.

description: My favorite pizza in the city. Sometimes there is a long line outside, but it moves quickly! I suggest the clam and garlic pizza and don't forget cash!
author: Jenny H.

description: I just ordered slices and the guy at the counter was a major prick to me. He ignored my questions resulting in me not being able to eat what I ordered. So I basically wasted my money on pizza because I felt obligated to pay for it since he'd thrown it in the oven after telling me to hold on, implying he wasn't ready for me to place my order but putting two pieces of cheese in the oven for me without saying anything. Then served my slices wrapped in paper because I didn't want to share a box with the combo piece after me because of the meat when the order before mine was 2 pieces served in a box. So he heard my question about it being cooked together with meat but choose to ignore it and then give me this dirty look when I said I didn't want it cooked together because I won't be able to eat it then tell me the total anyways. I realize your establishment is busy but maybe you should hire someone who can actually communicate with your customers.
author: William W.

description:
Only regret of the night was being adventurous and trying two different flavor. I should've been a square and just gotten two squares of the garlic and clam. INCREDIBLE.

4 dollars a square, cash only.

Interior reminded me of a dive bar, loved it. The stools aren't made for people over 5 feet tall.
author: Trang B.

description:
This place has pizza squares for $4!

There was a line out the door at 2pm on a Sunday. This is a bit deceiving considering you order just inside the door (so don't get discouraged by the line). If you eat in, they warm your pizza and then bring it to where you're sitting.

A cup of water is free, thankfully.

There's beer on tap and a TV for sports fans!

Employees are friendly and helpful.

Cash only
author: Jen G.

description: Excellent pizza the sausage is bomb I would def recommend trying this joint out if your in the area and have a craving for pizza
author: Steve M.

description: As we were walking down the street to go to another restaurant we passed Golden Boy Pizza and nearly drooled at all the steaming pizza in the window. Nonetheless we kept going to our destination only to discover it closed on Sundays. So we decided to head back to the pizza place we had passed and we're glad we did. Loved the Sicilian style thick crust with the crispy bottom. My boyfriend and I shared 3 slices and it was just the right amount for two people. Delicious pizza and very reasonably priced!
author: Angela A.

description: This place is amazing!! Probably the best pizza that I had. The only downside is that there is always a long wait - but it is worth it. I had been wanting to try their pizza for such a long time, and on when in San Francisco last month, I finally got the chance. They are known for their clam pizza, and I was hesitant at first, but it was worth it. The clam pizza has intense garlic flavors - so don't eat it if you're planning on kissing anyone. The place is small, and someone recommended that we take the pizza to-go and eat it at a nearby park.
author: Shelby B.

description: Thank you for fattening this hobbit up even more with your delicious pizza! Not a lot of room inside the place, but it's great to buy pizza and sit at the nearby park. I shall return with Gandalf :))
author: Bilbo B.

description: Pizza was delicious! Love the crust and super fast and friendly service. It's a tiny place, all bar stools seating. Definitely look for the hand pointing it's finger down and bam you found the Golden Boy Pizza
author: Sapna R.

description: I normally don't like thick pizza but this was surprisingly good. Crust is crispy as they heat it up for you . Will be back !
author: Laine L.

description: Wow. Service is incredible rude. I know they are busy with a line out the door but that doesn't excuse the person behind the counter. Pizza was cold. Asked for it to be heated up and he stated it was fresh out of oven. Got it and it was cold so asked again to heat it. So he took the place and tossed it in the trash. Incredible. So basically if you want cold pizza and rude service this is your place.
author: Monica B.

description:
stop by here while we were waiting for sotto mare. OMG what is this!!
crispy dough with fresh stuff on top with lots of cheese.. heavenly!!
clam and garlic pizza is the bomb and veggie pizza is refreshing. quick service and funky atmosphere.
author: Woong C.

description: I honestly don't know what all the fuss is about. I love Sicilian-style pizza and was excited to try this place. Solid slices, a little gummy with a pillowy crust (mine was slightly undercooked.) I ordered the combo with sausage and pepperoni, and while the quality of the ingredients was very high, I don't personally think it was worth the wait or the hype.
author: molly d.

description: Pizza was really good. Super doughy and made from scratch. Great place to stop by and get pizza to go, or go for drunchies after a night out. Very casual / grungy ambiance. Definitely keep in mind that there will be a line, but I think it's well worth the wait!
author: Michelle H.

description: The pizza is delicious we tried the combo, pepperoni and meatballs slices. All were great. We got there and the line wasn't long. Glad we took a chance on this place. The place is small only because they get so many costomers. A heads up, they ONLY take cash.
author: M Teresa C.

description: Waited 40 min in line. It was worth it. The clam/garlic/ pesto pizza is delicious! And of course pepperoni. Will come again next time I'm in town!
author: Jessica P.

description:
The best in all of SF for a awsome slice of pizza the price is right and the service even better 

Go golden boy you rock
author: Aaron L.

description: Clam and Garlic is so good! Combo was just as good, but not a huge fan of zucchini. Came around closing on a Thursday night and made it inside just before they closed the doors so we were still able to eat inside. Line was still pretty long as we were leaving 15 minutes later. I guess they serve everyone in line until they don't have anymore slices even after closing. Great late night eat!
author: Courtney D.

description: Love this place!!! Pizza one of the best I've had! And the vibes are amazing!!! A must when in San Fran
author: Selina R.

description: If you are ever in the mood for an inexpensive meal in the heart of SF, then you gotta get yourself a slice of pizza at "golden boy pizza".  I always get their sausage pizza.  If you get sausage only with a soda, then it's $5 exactly.  That should be enough for your meal depending on how hungry you are.
author: Buortau L.

description:
The best pizza slice I've had to date!

I went on Labour day at around 3:00 PM and there was a ~20 minute lineup. Unfortunately, the group in front of me ordered the last five Combo slices so I needed to wait another ~10 minutes for a fresh sheet, but it was worth the wait. The crust was crispy on the bottom, but soft and chewy on the top. The toppings were tasty and the mozzarella was very fresh and stringy.

A must eat for any pizza lover in the city!
author: Anthony S.

description:
Best Square Pizza in SF. 

Clam and Garlic is a good choice a.k.a the fan favorite but I've tried them all and haven't had a bad slice out of the couple of dozen times I stumble here after a night of bar hopping in North Beach. After the bars kick everyone out the line here will explode so be prepared to wait it out if you're coming here late night. 

Pizza Break down:

Crust: They warm up the window slice upon order so it comes out steaming hot with a nice bit of crunch on the bottom.

Toppings: Good portioning and distribution on all slices. 

Cheese: because they heat it up on order the cheese is nice and gooey but not rubbery. I believe good cheese should make you pull the slice away from you but not take all the toppings with it. This place uses the good kind. 

Sauce: depending on what is picked it could be a standard tomato sauce or a garlic pesto. Not quite as much as I'd prefer so I usually ask for extra to go. 

verdict: If you don't mind your pizza being square and don't mind waiting in long lines of drunken north beach frat boys/hipsters then Golden Boy is a great choice.
author: Norris T.

description:
A yummy late night eat.  I normally prefer a thinner crust like new york style pizza, but they have managed to not make it too doughy here.  
The line might look long, but it goes fast.  Around 4 dollars a slice and they are pretty filling.  small thing, but I enjoy how they package the slices wrapped in paper.
Great toppings, sauce and cheese in perfect ratio.  I love getting a corner piece too!
Nicely located near the bars round Polk and such if you need to be revived.
author: Maivy N.

description:
You think you've eaten all kinds of pizzas in your life. Thin, Italian, New York, pan, artisan, Chicago-style, flatbread, and whatever weird concoctions Pizza Hut and Dominos offer (hot-dog pizzas, cmon guys...).

But once again I was surprised to discover a new and intriguing slice at Golden Boy.

It is a thick, square pizza, with a healthy dose of cheese and generous fresh toppings. The dough is crispy on the outside, and very soft on the inside. And there's plenty of it... one slide should suffice even the most drunken, hungry patrons.

They offer limited choices of pizza flavors and, per San Francisco's too-cool and obnoxious businesses, have the standard limitations:
- No delivery 
- Cash only
- Lines, tons of lines

But it's worth it. This is a type of pizza you need to add to your list.

---

Distinguishing factor: Much more than a square pizza. Every slice tastes fresh and comes with great toppings and hipster attitude.
author: Nick A.

description:
I'm not a pizza purist.  I like my pizza crust thick, not thin, greasy and loaded with toppings, and yes, I don't mind that it's cut into square slices.  I love the clam and garlic and the combo slices.  

The decor is really divey with stool seatings against the bar counter and wall and a bunch of random bumper stickers against ribbed metal wall panels.  But do you really care when you're drunk after last call in North Beach?  Cash only and for the unpretentious.
author: Bailey N.

description:
I love Sicilian style pizza - yes, pan pizza, square pizza whatever you want to call it. Delicious. There aren't many places in SF that serve Sicilian style pizza but Golden Boy is top notch. 

I didn't order the clam and garlic (which everybody loves) but had a bite...it was good but I was happy with my meat lovers and combo slices. 

Not surprisingly, the line can get long late at night but it's worth it...
author: Wendy L.

description: Hell yeah!!!! Best pizza I've had in a longtime, had the combo- yummy stuffs and the crust (omfg) was thick n'crunchy heavenly bliss. It's a great little place with slaps and graffiti all around to keep your ADHD in check, not to mention the great taste music to warm your soul. (Insert devil horns here!) I will definitely been visiting again soon.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Until I find a better pizza joint, 5 seats for golden boy. Come here for the fantastic pizza, stick around for the atmosphere. That's it. If you have other expectations, leave them at the door. 
It's a simple pizza joint that serves really well make pizzas: crust that's perfect (almost like a bread-like dough that crunches and melts in your mouth), just the right amount of sauce and toppings. The pies are prepared in a rectangular pans, and slices are in square-ish cuts. They'll warm the slices displayed by the windows, and they come out tasting awesome. 
There are prob 10-15 bar stool to sit and it's a tight space, so mind your elbows and backpacks. And there could be long line to order, so keep that in mind if you're in a hurry.
author: Cris L.

description: I was pretty inebriated when we stopped by this place.  But it must be good because the line was never ending.     I decided on the garlic clam pizza.  It was pretty good, didn't  really taste too much clam just lots of garlic (I'm totally regretting it this morning)  and its been a while since I've had a thick doughy pizza like this (all the rage is thin crust these days).  But I was satisfied.  I would probably get one of the original pepperoni next time.  At $3-5 a slice it's super affordable and I'd totally be back.  FYI it's CASH only
author: Lindsay C.

description: My friends have been raving about this place and it did not disappoint. Definitely worth every minute you have to wait for the clam and garlic pizza. Just know it's a long line and cash only. We will be back!
author: Young L.

description:
Walked by here with my dad around 4:00pm. I had eaten lunch at 1:15 and was by no means hungry, but the second I walked by I became hungry. We went in and split one slice/square of cheese. I bit into this beautiful, delicious goodness and went right back and took another! By far, the best pizza I have ever had! This place is a must! It really sucks that I don't live in SF, and can't have it everyday! Now if only there was a location in LA...

If you are even remotely close to golden boy, you must go!!!
author: Shayna R.

description: Best pizza in town! The guys behind the counter are super sweet! Only bad thing is that they only accept cash, but if you don't have cash on you, there is an ATM machine in the back. Price is pretty reasonable!
author: Zari G.

description: Sober or not, the clam pizza is great. The crust is crispy and fluffy focaccia, and the pizza is loaded with delicious clams, bright garlic, and zesty parsley. It's very flavorful and satisfying to eat in whatever mental state you happen to be in.
author: Nei N.

description:
I know San Francisco isn't known for pizza but we wanted to try pizza in north beach and found this place on yelp. It's located in a busy area alongside other restaurants. 

They display the pizzas on their window and if you don't see the pizza you want don't ask for it. That's a sign by the register. The pizzas are square shaped and 3 dollars a piece which I thought was a good price. They also have PBR for less than 5 dollars. We ordered two slices and two PBR and only paid $14! 

I'm taking away a star because the place is really small and if there are more than 2 people ahead of you in line you will have to line up outside.
author: Mary P.

description:
I was instructed that Golden Boy pizza should be eaten one way and one way only. Drunk!

This is the spot to go grab some grub on the late, when in the North Beach Area. 

Being from New York, my pizza standards were set high. Though Golden Boy wasn't bad at all. In fact it was pretty good. A good sicilian slice is what the doctor orders when drunk. Actually doctors probably don't drink or eat late, and it probably wouldn't be pizza. 

I knew they closed at 11 on Thursdays so didn't expect to get a slice then but sure enough I was just walking by around 12 and saw they were still selling slices out the window. 

It was a take what you can get type of situation. I got one slice and needed it too. It was someone's "great" idea to start drinking at 3 o'clock (Moron!) and I was getting bit tipsy.

Nice crunch to an airy sicilian slice which hit the spot quite well. Then continued onto the next bar.

Now I don't normally eat late night when I'm drunk, but it's vacation time. So after my last night out on a Saturday. I made it all the way back over to Golden Boy (I was in the bar next door), and grabbed two slices. Line was a little long, about a 15 minute wait, but it was some good late night eats.

Well worth it!
author: Mitch E.

description: Stopped here after a night of drinking, line out the door. The pizza was good, however I'm not sure it was worth the $4 something per slice they were charging for it. They were open late so that's a plus. Not sure if the prices are any better for a whole pie, might try them again next time I'm in town.
author: Ramon V.

description:
My wife and our friends did our own " pizza tour" of North Beach trying different places and styles. Golden Boy is absolutely one of the best. We went there twice within an hour.... Pesto Clam-Combination-Sausage-Pepperoni..... so simple yet so unbelievably good. I love the square-I cannot wait until our next " slice-fest tour"
@feedyourfacewithmarkandjason.... ck out our review and follow us.
author: Jason P.

description: Great slice of pie. I wish I had room in my belly for more pie!!! Great food & service for a reasonable price.
author: Hugo G.

description: Best pizza in the city. Ordered a cheese and pepperoni pizza that were decent size. Definitely will make someone full very quickly. Highly recommend.
author: Mark A.

description:
It's good. Constant line on a Saturday afternoon. I got the combo. I love Sicilian style puffy pizza and the dough here was light and moist but I wish it tasted more "cooked" throughout. On the other extreme I doubt I could find a thin crust with the mind-boggling texture combo of Bleecker St Pizza in NYC. So this will probably be my go-to. 
I heard someone ask for theirs extra crispy so I will try that next time. 
Guy serving you pizzas is super sweet.
author: Catherine L.

description:
First, I don't eat a lot of pizza. Not because I don't like it but let's face it , it's not very healthy. Tonight I wanted pizza.
Second, this pizza is frickin delicious. Combo and pep omg so good. The sausage on the combo is amazing and packed with flavor. 
The place is small and is packed because it's busy but it works. There is rock/punk playing loud and it's awesome. My kinda place. 
One of the BEST places I visited in my 4 days in SF.
author: Dean P.

description:
Their pizza is good! It's super cheesy and the crust is nice and doughy. Veggie pesto and pepperoni are delicious. Garlic clam is good too but it gives you major garlic breath afterwards. Always try to get something straight from the oven.

The place is small and cramp. Service is nice and friendly.
author: Samantha C.

description: This pizza is awesome. The only downside is the wait. The line was extremely long because this is the spot after a night of drinking. I decided to come here around 2am because I saw it on yelp and it was good. I would prefer the crust be a little crisper but its not a deal breaker. Definitely worth a trip to try it.
author: Rosalind C.

description: I've always walked by this pizza joint and never had a chance to try a slice of pizza due to the long line but I finally did and the cheese pizza was real good! Square cut pizza slices and served hot! We also ordered the clam & garlic pizza but we prefer the traditional toppings on our pizza and not seafood. The service was good, a cool spot to have a quick bite. This place is tight in space so be sure to take it to go.
author: Noor S.

description: Long line, but TOTALLY worth it. I got the cheese and the pesto - cant' decide which one was tastier. =)
author: Noor R.

description:
Small pizza place. Cash only.

I tried the clam and garlic slice for $4. Their slices are cut in square shaped. Dough is not too thick and not too thin. I enjoyed my slice! It tastes like what it sounds like: clams and garlic. Worth it!
author: Christine L.

description:
**Make sure you have cash. Cash only.**
Tried this place for the first time yesterday during an adventure in SF and tried their clam/garlic pizza. I was a bit off-put by the price to amount ratio ($4 for maybe a 5-by-5 square slice) but I was blown away as soon as I took my first bite. The crust straight up tastes like garlic bread -- crispy, flavorful, and amazing. I'm not too sure why the line moves so slowly -- it was barely out the door, but it still took a good 20-25 minutes to order and get our slice. I would recommend people to check this place out, but it's not SO extraordinary that I would frequently visit.
author: JaeMin K.

description:
A great place to grab a quick bite. I shared slices of the clam garlic, pesto veggie, and combo pizza. I'm a thin crust kind of gal but the thicker foccacia that serves as the crust of this pizza is tasty and fresh. The toppings are very flavorful too. The clam garlic pizza definitely stuck with me and I mean that literally since I had garlic burps for the rest of the night. 

If you aren't taking your pizza to go, there's a bunch of stool seating inside.
author: Maya S.

description: Golden Boy Pizza. The best pizza in North Beach. Where else can you line up for good old Sicilian style pizza, pay in cash, sit (or stand) at the counter and order a draft root beer to wash it all down with? I ordered a vegetable slice - waitress handed me a knife and fork. I wondered why for about a second and then realized this was no thin crust, standard fare - I would have to hunker down to consume this. This spot feels like it should be a hole in the wall in NYC, but if it were, it'd lose the unique and inimitable quality it has as a refuge from the over-priced and over-saturated Little Italy places.
author: Emily M.

description: Always wanted to try this place, we love pizza. Just a few people in line so it was a short wait. We each had the clam and garlic pizza which was the best we have ever had, SERIOUSLY!!! Service and food is excellent!!! The staff brought us our beer and pizza in the back of the place, service extraordinaire. Definitely our new pizza place.
author: Veronica L.

description: The pizza here is sooooo goood! There is always a long line late night and there is usually not a lot of choices by the time it's your turn. My favorite is the garlic clam!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
We stopped here as part of a Food tour of North Beach. As part of the tour we got the basic cheese pizza on the nice thick Foccacia bread crust.  Our guide recommended that the next time we go there we should probably get the Basil Garlic Clam Pizza as that is her favorite. We figured why wait and get a small pie to share with everyone. It was a great decision. This pizza was the bomb. I get if you don't like thick crust you might not like this place but I think of it more like foccacia with cheese and toppings than like a pizza. It's more like nice thick breadsticks with toppings so don't come here expecting thin crust east coast style pizza or you will be disappointed.

I'm guessing this place is hopping with people that get drunk and want a late night snack. I bet that would take really good. 

Come here if you want to grab a snack and get foccacia bread with toppings, not thin crust pizza. Basil Garlic Clam Pizza!!!!!!! Get it, you'll thank me.
author: Vincent W.

description: Really tasty pizza! Grabbed 3 pieces by the slice. Enjoyed them in Washington Square park, no complaints! Next try will be the clam!
author: Braden F.

description:
I don't see what the hype is all about. My friends and I were really excited to try out this place based on all the great reviews, but it actually wasn't all that. In fact, everybody else in my group thought the food only deserves two stars. I thought it was a solid 3 (love that the bottom is crispy).

The clams and garlic was really garlicky and everybody had a hard time eating more than two bites, even though we generally like a lot of garlic in our food. However, it does have a lot of "flavor," so if you really like garlic, you might like it. The combo and pepperoni were okay to me. I read another review where the pizzas were described as "muted" in flavor, which is a pretty accurate description. If you are a big foodie/super picky, you may not be a fan. 

Service was a 2. The employees were pretty nice to me throughout our limited interactions, but I witnessed them being really rude to my other friends. ):

Cash only.
author: Sam N.

description: It just didn't live up to the hype... The garlic clam had no taste of garlic or clams for me and their pepperoni was really greasy (but I kinda liked it lol)... The crust was the perfect amount of crisp which is why they get the 3 star rating...
author: Dana M.

description: I'm from Jersey and New Jersey/New York knows its pizza. That being said, this is some of the best pizza I've ever had! Be sure to also try the slice with clams on it; pure awesomeness!!
author: Patrick L.

description: The best pizza ever! I'm picky but This pizza has great taste and fluffy dough to die for! Please go and try it !  I'm from Sacramento and drive up to have this pizza !
author: Angela O.

description: A tiny little building with a crowded walkway and small bar serve some of the best pizza I have had in San Francisco. Hot, fresh and about $4 for a piece, this place served some great food. We would definitely come back in the future! Just a short walk to Washington square park, where you can hang out and enjoy some great slices.
author: Jacob W.

description: Typical pizza joint for a bite after a long night out. There was a line up of about 30 people around 1 in the morning. We got the clam and garlic pizza and it was fresh. The slices are huge.
author: Anh T.

description: Not sure what all the hype is. Had the oyster and combination pizza. Both were okay. I think there are other pizza places that offer tastier, cheesier pizza. Service was sub par too. The person taking orders and ringing up the pizza seemed like she hated her job and had a slight attitude. The other worker just looked at me and walked away when i requested for an extra fork and knife. On the good side its cool that theyre open late
author: mike d.

description:
My friend brought me to Golden Bay Pizza!
Nice interior, Kind people and Delicious pizza!
I ordered Pesto Vegeterian Pizza. My friend ordered Garlic glam Pizza. Both of them were nice! I tried my friend's too. I liked mine more Their dough is really crispy and the pizza is not too salty.
author: Kim Y.

description:
Fantastic. Just amazing.

Whenever I go to pizza places and I see the pizza is premade and just needing to be warmed up, I get nervous. Whenever I see very doughy pizza's, i get nervous.  I was nervous this would be either too doughy and or too dry. It was neither.

It was everything a pizza on focaccia bread ought to be.
author: Ajit K.

description: Was across the street at the church for a wedding and got super hungry! Of course every girl wants to devour some pizza while wearing a tight formal dress. The garlic clam was amaZeeeeeeing. The slices come in squares. But huge squares. One slice will def get you satisfied. What's cool is that it's kinda like a pizza bar? I guess. The only reason I knocked one star off is that it was a bit dirty.  Good place to try out!
author: Chelsi D.

description:
NEW YORK THIN CRUST, CHICAGO DEEP DISH, SAN FRANCISCO FOCACCIA (CLAM GARLIC)

Several years ago when I travelled to Italy I had a nirvana experience eating pizza. The importance wasn't toppings as they are emphasized in the US, but the crust. Without a great crust the toppings don't matter. The crust supports the toppings not the other way around. Have you had an experience of eating a pizza when the toppings were great but the crust was stale? If you did then you know what I'm talking about.

I believe in this country there are three regions that have a distinct style of crust of a pizza: New York, Chicago, and San Francisco. While New York and Chicago are known for their thin crust and deep dish pizzas I really had to think about what San Francisco pizza known for. I concluded San Francisco pizza should be known for its usage of focaccia bread as a crust even though focaccia bread originated in Italy. The usage of focaccia bread as a pizza crust is what attracts people to Golden Boy Pizza in San Francisco. The first time I went to Golden Boy Pizza was several years ago at the North Beach Festival. I noticed the long line at this pizza joint and wondered why. After eating the focaccia bread crust I was hooked. That focaccia crust was crispy yet light. Normally I would only eat one slice of pizza because the crust was dense and stale. However I ate four slices of pizza at Golden Boy Pizza. Ever since then I was hooked.

There's a saying "think outside the box". Whereas pizza joints these days still focus on the same geometric figures of a circular pie and triangular slice, the pizza at Golden Boy Pizza is distinct with its own geometric features of a rectangular sheet of pizza with rectangular slice. In a sense Golden Boy Pizza is thinking outside the box by having a pizza shape like a box. If the pizza is sitting on the tray for a while the slice of pizza is heated again where you get that slightly charred crust that makes the crust light. There are only six toppings at Golden Boy Pizza. I'm not a vegetarian, but the pesto vegetarian is tasty. The sausage is my second favorite pizza because the sausage isn't thinly sliced in a small ball. However my favorite topping at Golden Boy Pizza is the clam garlic. This is somewhat similar to garlic fries in presentation but instead of fries you get diced clams. 

Some of the food that originated in San Francisco has made great contributions to American cuisine such as crusty sourdough French bread, Mission-style burrito, and fortune cookie. So what is San Francisco pizza? Since clam garlic is somewhat similar to garlic fries, which originated in the San Francisco Bay Area, and the usage of focaccia bread as a pizza crust is distinct from other regular crust I believe the "official" San Francisco pizza should be clam garlic on focaccia bread at Golden Boy Pizza. Which city has that specific pizza? I rest my case.
author: Gerald R.

description: Best pizza I've had in San Francisco, reminded me of my favorites in Rome. Good music, yummy beer and service with a smile!
author: Raechel H.

description: Surprised by dough quality and solid flavor. The guy there was quick and made good suggestions. I would go out of my way to get a slice here compared to most other pizza in sf. I would say best quick pizza in the city.
author: Rad F.

description: DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!  Came her with my husband on one of out random "let's go to sf" trips I have to say its one of the best kept secrets San Francisco has to offer! So walking up there was a line out the door. Which threw my husband off and he wanted to keep walking and find something else but I insisted and got my way. I'm glad I did! The line moved quickly the register is right by the door and you order the slice you want, how many, and for here or togo. We opt to eat there, the place is narrow and long with bar type seating. The walls are decorated with stickers and writing (it give the place character) our pizza was the bomb! Not super fancy like other places like to doll up pizza. You have the crust cooked threw fluffy but crusty at the bottom sauce cheese and pepperoni (I always get my pizza classic) portion size was good too and the price!!!
author: Allie E.

description: Four words. Clam and garlic pizza. Just do it. You're welcome. I'm getting hungry just writing this. Also - remember to bring cash.
author: Jennifer M.

description: I found this hole in the wall on Yelp and am not disappointed. I've been back three times--every time I visit the city! Tip: get a corner piece. I love their pizza and sodas. They do offer beer to eat with your pizza. Excellent service as well.
author: Sherri C.

description: BEST PIZZA IN SAN FRANCISCO. Their crust is f*cking perfect. Crispy but yet fluffy at the same time. Their combo meat/ veggie is my favorite. My boyfriend always gets the clam pizza which is also delicious. Service is quick even when it's busy. Sometimes there's a line out the door but it's so damn worth it.
author: Alyssa A.

description: This place is a bit overrated in my opinion. I got the Clam/garlic & Combo slices, each for $4 a square. It's more of a snack spot. You can see the pizza displayed in the front window, and the store itself is quite narrow and small, but good vibes overall!
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
The best pizza I've ever tasted, period.
Have waited out in the cold like a junkie for half and hour to get my dose :)
author: Shishir S.

description: This is probably my favorite pizza place ever. Came here after drinking with some friends around 1:30am, saw there was a line so we decided to get some phillies at busters to snack on while we wait in line for some pizza. The line probably took around 20 mins but after we got some slices to go, they were so good!! We got a slice of combo and pepperoni and were really satisfied. I'll definitely be returning if I'm ever in the area and I'll probably try the clam pizza next!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I was hungry for some Pizza and wanted some late night food. Yelp showed me that this was one of the only places that was open. 

The line was quite long, and because it was such a tight space, I had to wait outside.  

The guy serving the food looked like he had been doing this for years. Like clockwork he worked at cutting up the slices, reheating, and serving. 

I got two slices of cheese pizza and I think it came out to 6 bucks and some change. 

And boy o' boy did it satisfy my craving!

The only bummer is that they were cash only.
author: Moe E.

description:
Parking is horrible! It seems like there's always road constructions going on. You're lucky if you can find street oarking. But yet again this is SF and you're in between chinatown and little italy so...

Super loud music. Not good if you want to spend time catching up with friend (which I did). Bar seats are not adjustable. There's restroom but doesn't look like they are taken care of.

$4 for 1 slice pizza...no tax. Cash only.

Yummy pizza tho.
author: Inez J.

description:
There's always a line out the door......so it has to be great, right?   I ordered a slice of the combo for the bargain price of only $4 and it was Heaven in my mouth!  The combo is a deep-dish square containing mushrooms, pepperoni, large meatballs, zucchini, and onions.  

The place is tiny and there isn't much room for sitting.  This isn't a good place for large parties.  While waiting in line I observed that most people were coming in to pick up takeout.  The menu is pretty simple:
 Cheese
 Pepperoni or Sausage
 Clam/Garlic
 Pesto/Vegetarian
 Combination
all are available by the slice and by the sheet.  

In true North Beach fashion plenty of beers are on tap.
author: Andrea H.

description: The mushroom pizza was a crowd favorite. However, the combination pizza had too much going on. The pepperoni was tasty but could've used sausage or mushrooms for added taste. Customer service is great here! I ordered two sheets to pick up for a party and waited not very long for pick up.
author: Maniya G.

description:
On Saturday, 3/28/15, my girlfriend and I ate at Golden Boy Pizza in SF. We heard a lot of good things about this particular pizza place so we had to give it a try. 

Atmosphere:

Golden Boy Pizza is really small. It's really dark and congested inside. It's more of a bar type, stool seating type of place. The music that was playing sounded more on the punk rock side. You totally get that punk rock type of vibe while being inside of Golden Boy Pizza. 

Food:

I ordered a slice of the Combination Pizza. I thought it was okay. It reminded me of the pan pizza at Pizza Hut but a little bit better. The sausage and pepperoni tasted good. There's was also onions, zucchini and mushrooms on it. 

My girlfriend ordered a slice of the Pesto/Vegetarian Pizza. She thought it was okay. She said the pizza reminded her of Pizza Hut. She thought the pizza at Golden Boy Pizza was average at best. 

Service:

The girl that took our order was very nice. We put in our order and the girl took a slice of pizza and put it into the oven to heat it up. Our pizza was ready within a few seconds. We paid then sat down and ate. All in all the whole process only took about a minute or so. 

Overall: 

If you like Sicilian pan type pizzas then give Golden Boy Pizza a try. The pizza at Golden Boy Pizza isn't special. There's no wow factor. But if you're looking for a quick bite to eat then this place might work for you.
author: David R.

description:
This is by far my favorite pizza in the world. The guys and gals who work here are very consistent and always provided delicious pizza.

This pizza is not too thick, or too thin, it's a medium crossed pan Pizza and there are five different kinds to choose from, making it easy and convenient.

My favorite slice is a tossup between the veggie and the combo. They also offer clam, cheese, pepperoni, and sausage.

The combo is my favorite because you get A little bit of everything except the clam: two pepperonis, Two sausage balls,z a little zucchini,and a little onion, on top of some delicious cheese and the best crust!

I've been to Italy and try their pizza in Rome, New York and try their pizza, I was born in Chicago and definitely tried their pizza, but I must say every time I have golden boy pizza its a true pleasure.  Nothing really compares to the quality at Golden Boy.
author: Justin G.

description: Best pizza in the World. It melts in your mouth and i think the owner of this place put some kind of drugs in it...... it's addictive!
author: Russ K.

description:
One of the best pizza place in SF.  

- Clams and garlic pizza is the way to go!! $3.75
- Be prepared to wait in line. Always a long waiting. Service is fast, so line moves pretty fast. 
- Space is tight inside. But there are a few stools to have a quick bite. 
- This place is CASH ONLY!
- Its open till 2.30 AM, one of the few late night eat places in SF. so its THE place to go when you are drunk and craving for food.
- Ambiance - divey casual
author: Payal B.

description:
Ok pizza
Tried 4 slices: calms, cheese . Meat, and mixed. Mixed was the best 
About $4 a slice 
Service was good
author: Jones T.

description: I stopped in earlier and ordered the clam & garlic slice. Generous amounts of garlic and clams, as well the perfect amount of cheese. Not at all greasy and for $3.50, I'll come by the next time I'm in The City.
author: Ruben M.

description: I drove allllllllll the way from La to try Golden Boy Pizza for the first time ever because I heard how great it was and I was 10 min late and the lady that answered said "sorry bud".  Big disappointment.  I wanted to try Golden Boy pizza out and I got denied even though they answered.  Very upsetting.
author: Matt P.

description: Not your typical pizza, but very unique. It tastes as if the pizza is toasted as opposed to baked, which gives the crust a more crispy crunch. Had the garlic clam white pizza, which was decent. It has a small hole-in-the wall feel to it, with a few bar stools against the open kitchen and a few TVs with games.
author: Christina S.

description: Mmmm...the clam garlic pizza rocks!  The stools are a little uncomfortable, but the pizza is amazing.
author: Marty C.

description: Best slice on the west coast.  The clam and garlic pizza is incredible.  Worth the 20 minutes in line and the trip to the ATM (though it's 2016, cash only???).
author: Eamonn H.

description: Delicious... pleased that they had vegetarian pizza. The hype about this place is true
author: Mandy E.

description: Want a quick slice of pizza? This place is made for you. Amazing pizza, great flavors and charming setting.
author: Shinji J.

description: Wow. I am speechless. The dough of Golden Boy Pizza was incredible. On a cold Friday evening this pizza was hot, fluffy and absolutely incredible. They only keep a few types of pizza (cheese, pepperoni, clams and garlic, and veggie) and they reheat every slice for each customer which is awesome. When I first took a bite the pizza just melted in my mouth, I've never eaten anything like it. The veggie pizza in particular was amazing with pesto and mushrooms - it was just the perfect meal! If you are in SF's little italy you must make a stop for this delicious snack!
author: Millie B.

description: Pizza is pretty good, but one tip: Count your change when you go to this place. Since it is cash only, they've tried to short change me on multiple occasions. They probably do this endlessly throughout the day with so many tourists and unexpecting patrons stopping by. Will not be supporting this business any longer. Many other, more honest businesses in North Beach with much better pizza honestly.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Cash only! ATM inside.

First time to San Francisco, and man thank you to all you Yelpers! This City believes in yelp. Being from Atlanta our average restaurant is a couple hundred reviews, SF has thousands!! We did our whole trip on yelp. Lets talk about this awesome whole in the wall- 

Ambiance: This place is a dark seedy place with about 10 places to sit, its all ovens inside. Really a cash only to-go concept to me. Fresh pizza in the window, cramped space. I have to say, its what it says it is. Couple bar seats and maybe one or two tables. 4 stars, would have liked to not bump into people the whole time. 

Food: Pizza isn't what I expected, but it was awesome. They do a square cut pizza that's crunchy and delicious. We had a slice of pepperoni, cheese, "everything," and the Clam and Garlic pizza. I would consider this a great lunch spot, but with so much in the North Beach area I would go somewhere else for dinner. 4 Stars. 

Service: Exactly what they market. They had the pizza out in maybe 5-7 minutes. Nothing spectacular just fast service. 3 stars- right in the middle. 

Looks like the judges have voted and its 4 STARS! (cue the applause) 

"Seize the moment. Remember all those women on the 'Titanic' who waved off the dessert cart."
author: Lucas H.

description: I've heard about Tony's and Golden boy from local friend foodies so I was in the area on what seemed a dead Sunday night in North Beach. I found a parking spot right at the door, I guess if I like it I'll be returning at 10 pm on Sundays because this seems too easy for a top reviewed place. Um, no line? Walked in and ordered right away from the braided beauty behind the counter. I had intended on ordering every available slice choice but it's a cash only joint and I wasn't about to pay their fees from the ATM in the back. I settled on a cheese and a pepperoni slice since I only had $8. I got it to go so it was wrapped in two pieces of checkered paper and stuffed in a bag. I was expecting a small box but no big deal. The dough is a thick pan style with a soft bottom crust. The only crunch you'll get is from the crispy cheese edges. It's doughy but not chewy. I'm pretty sure what gives this pizza the great flavor is the sauce. The dough is good, the cheese and seasonings are great, but the sauce is awesome! It makes the pizza. I'll be back, on a Sunday night at 10, with cash..
author: Staci C.

description: We've made this a "must go to" place every time we're up in the city. Nothing's changed: cash only, line out the door, but most importantly: BOMB ass pizza.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Damn you Golden Boy! May all of your future children be born as pizzas.  You have ruined me, corrupted my family and placed a pox on my existence. 
I say please and thank you and I always tip well but make no mistake I am a total food snob at heart.  I find my favorites and I stick with them.  And now that I know you are out there, with your delicious, filling, utterly heavily slices of pizza I can never order from other places without thinking about your damn pizza.  Thanks for that.

My daughter and I tried a different local pizza place yesterday and it set the bar pretty high.  Today we (my wife and daughter) were in North beach again for the North Beach Festival and decided to grab a few slices from you. Bar destroyed.

We had the combo, cheese and the clam.  Combo for us was the hands down winner.  It looks and feels undercooked when you pick it up.  But much to my delight it was perfectly cooked thick and light and just perfectly crunchy. It's the perfectly blended piece of pizza.

As others have said cash only.  But they have an ATM in the back inside.  So as long as you are from the 21st century you'll be ok.

I spoke with the guy manning the pizza oven and he was super cool.  He told me the best time to come in this week to order a full pizza for our company that is working locally.

As an aside the walls are a blend between skate punk meets grunge married to a snow boarder that listens to techno. This place looks like it locked graffiti artists with stickers in there for a week and only fed them pizza and Red Bull.

Again, Curse you Golden Boy!
author: Sean L.

description: I'm lactose intolerant, but if I lived in San Francisco, I would eat this everyday. THE CLAM PIZZA is a MUST
author: Nichole M.

description:
Normally I love their pizza because it's amazing which is why this review has any stars. But today I wanted to call and reserve two slices because I have a very high stress job IN CUSTOMER SERVICE and I knew that if I just waited around without letting them know I was working under a time constraint I would never get back to work on time. However I spoke with an incredibly rude woman on the phone who had no reason to act the way she did. I tried to tell her my situation but she kept cutting me off and didn't make any attempt to listen, show any sort of empathy or in short do her job. Instead I got a rude woman on the phone that HUNG UP ON ME when I told her I was sorry for being insistent and was again trying to explain my situation.

You can keep your effing pizza. It's not that hard to work with a customer. I know I'm not going back.
author: Kate J.

description: Just had a slice of delicious pepperoni pizza! Deep dish, fluffy, tasty crust! Love it! It's a must visit when in the city.  Worth the wait in line. The staff was nice and cute too! ;) Viva l'Italia!
author: Lety J.

description: Good pizza place, this is thicker cut square pizza. I thought clam pizza would be weird but it's actually really good, it tastes nothing like clams though, just garlicy.
author: Elena K.

description:
Good pizza
Not enough sitting inside of rest
Each slice was big for one serving
Had garlic and clam pizza
Was good
If i am around that area again, will go back to try different flavors
author: Jane K.

description:
Thick square pizza with thick topping!
Price is reasonable and the taste is delicious. The combo is awesome.
Cash only though.
Prepare to give extra 20 minutes for queueing.
author: Hendra B Suharso S.

description: Cheap late night food, pretty overrated for pizza that's just ok. Clam and garlic tastes mostly just like garlic, combo nothing special. Thick dough, not enough tomato sauce on either. Didn't leave a good feeling in my stomach.
author: Philipp A.

description: Awesome place to get some solid, budget-friendly pizza. It's super quick and the space itself has these super cool punk vibes that really make it stand out amongst the other traditional pizza spots in North Beach. Nice service and clearly really good quality ingredients are in the pizza. The combo is a great classic and the clam garlic slice looks and tastes like sexy garlic bread, for real.
author: Desiree S.

description: Came here around noon on a Saturday needing to have my pizza inch scratched and it certainly was.  I like all types of thicknesses when it come to crust and this was definitely on the thicker side. It has a really nice soft texture inside and a little crispy on the bottom.  I had the pepperoni slice and my wife had the combo and the toppings were solid. The sausage on the combo had a really nice fennel flavor that I would come back for.
author: Bob F.

description: Good pizza I recommend the clam and garlic slice and there veggie thick Sicilian type slice or deep dish don't know what kind it is really but really good if your in north beach give them a try
author: Sam A.

description: Ordered ahead, still had to wait, not worth it.  Light on the meat.  Not all it's hyped up to be.
author: Barb G.

description: What's not to like about Golden Boy? I've enjoyed their delicious square shaped pizzas since the Excelsior days and enjoy them in North Beach now.
author: Ken C.

description: Man this place was hyped up as one of the best pizza joints in town. After we endured the long  line, we had a couple of slices that were sitting in the window. They were room temperature and not all that. The place isn't really set up for comfortable dining so if you are a tourist and you've been on your feet all day, you're not going to rest up here.
author: Michael D.

description: An institution that I never miss when I am in the SF Bay Area once a month. I find any excuse to grab a corner piece of veggie, or combo, or clam. You can not go wrong with any choice here.
author: Matt H.

description:
Just about one of the only pizza joint we go to when we are in the city. 

The line is ridiculously long. Whatever time you come, be sure to know that there will be at least a 30 minute wait time just to order.

My family and I have ordered various of different combinations. 

I am not a huge fan of seafood, so the pizza with clam on it is a turn off for me. I tried it, but could not get over the taste. 

The other pizza without any seafood on it is amazing though. That 30 minutes we waiting in line each time we come is worth it.
author: Jessica T.

description: When you see 4 cops standing in line for their slice of pizza, well you know it's gotta be the best pizza in SF! And it is! Fresh ingredients, great crusts, several toppings including clams, no wait, stand up or sit down bar area, great selection of tap beers, friendly staff, clean restroom, and if you are lucky the chef will give you his tips on making this amazing pizza dough! Located in the heart of North Beach (Little Italy) and you can also stand in line for your slice out front with all the locals who also know it's the best pizza! I've been searching forever in the Bay Area for the best pizza and now my search is over! Wish they could deliver to Danville!! Thank you Golden Boy for your scrumptious pizza!! We'll be back!!
author: Barbara n.

description:
Not sure if the pizza was great because I came after a fun night out, or if it's that good.  It doesn't matter because I remember it hit all the right spots at 2am.

The garlic and clam pizza is a must and THE reason why you come here.  It was worth waiting almost half an hour for the pizza.  The pizza are Sicilian slices, so they are in squares and a bit thicker compared to your normal triangle slices.  I think 2 slices is good enough to fill you up.  There seems to always be a line, so that means their pizza is probably always fresh.
author: Geoffrey C.

description: Went hunting around North Beach to find pizza by the slice. Found this spot, converted an old dive bar to a pizza joint, looks awesome here!!! Love it! Definitely coming back!!
author: Jared V.

description:
a friend who lives in north beach raves about golden boy, and im currently in a pizza phase, so i walked the whole way from soma last night to try some. and boy is it good! for $20.50, i got four slices - clam, combo, pepperoni, veggie - and a trumer pils. dont worry, a gf and i shared the slices and we didnt finish them all.. haha

the crust is light and fluffy and perfectly square, the cheese is melted since they send it through the oven when you order, and izz soo good. ingredients taste really fresh with good flavors, and you can add parmesan cheese or red pepper flakes - shakers are all over the restaurant.

good amount of seating, cozy atmosphere, friendly and fast service, cash only!
author: Christina L.

description:
My favorite pizza in San Francisco.  A CLASSIC.  Pizza in the window and the old-school sign.  And, for my money, there is no better spot in North Beach than that stretch of Green Street.

Excellent Sicilian-style slices.  There is something to the sauce that is just perfect, and it is nicely balanced with the fluffy Sicilian-style dough.  The sausage slice with parm and crushed red pepper is just about perfect.  The clam, garlic and parsley is outstanding.   You've gotta love $3 pints anywhere in SF, and ladies and gentlemen, they've got'em.  

Grab napkins if it's to-go.  And, bring your slice over to Washington Square Park!
author: Adam S.

description: What a cool pizza place to go to at North Beach! Their clam & garlic pizza was AMAZING! And I like their beer choices, too. I'm willing to come back to eat more of their Sicilian-style pizza. Just the best!
author: Vivian L.

description:
It might have been the fact that I was drunk
It might have been the fact that it was 1:30 am
