It might have been the fact that I hadn't had a full meal in 14 hours
But this might have been the best pizza I've had in California

We had just stumbled out of Maggie something, all of us a little hungry and wanting something to absorb the combination of Jack and Coke and the few vile sips of Bud Light that I regretfully tried. Fortunately Golden Boy is within stumbling distance. There was a line, but they were still letting people in, and a seat sounded nice after 4 hours of standing.

The window shows the variety of already made pizzas available in thick crust square shaped goodness. It was late so pepperoni was gone, and my friend got the last garlic and clams (but he let me have a bite), and olives on pizza is gross so I got two slices of cheese. Boring, delicious cheese.

It was just enough greasy, and just enough cheesy. The dough was thick and the cheese just right to be enjoyable in my current state. Polished off both squares voraciously.

The interior is thin - main cooking area goes from the window all the way to the back, with ovens, making stations, and beer taps. There is a wall counter opposite this, but not a lot of people can fit - our party was just big enough to occupy the back. Walls and every surface area are covered with stickers and graffiti. 

Cash only, so either be prepared or mooch some bucks from a friend. And by 2 they shut the door, but you can still order through the window while supplies last.
author: Michael C.

description: Typically long line. Sicilian style, i found it less delicious than it looked. The flavor just did not come through.  On the positive side, generous portions and one of the more reasonably priced meals you can find in this way overpriced city.
author: San T.

description: Excuse my French, this place is f***ing amazing!! The crust has a nice crisp on the bottom, yet once you bite in, it is a delicious delicate cloud of goodness. The flavor is incredible. You must visit this place if you are in SF.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Classic square Dish square pizza by the slice - go to for late night north beach pizza or lunch when near Columbus. Cash only, def worth driving across city to try.
author: John O.

description: Fantastic all around!! Great food, great price, great people!!! Hidden gem in north beach!! Love it every time we get it.
author: Emilee B.

description: The pizza is absolutely amazing.  Worth the wait!  Highly recommend. Pizza and Beer you can't go wrong.
author: Yvette S.

description: Probably one of the best pizzas I've had in the west coast. Chicago style deep dish reinvented in SF. The garlic clam pizza was clever and delicious. $4 a slice is well worth it. I think it might be better than the deep dishes in Chicago.
author: Minh L.

description:
One of the best I've ever had....yummy!!
Fresh, tasteful and I loved the selections they offered. 
You will not be disappointed eating there.
author: Naima-Natalia C.

description:
Came as a friend suggestion.Be prepared to get a stink eye if you don't have cash ready. ATM in the back saved me. Parking is a problem. Across the street its $5 every 15 min. A small, sticker laden dark, pizza and beer counter, feels big city.

Pizza isn't my fave, but had to try the clam and garlic. Stayed with me all day. Gooey cheese and crusty deep dish made it memorable.

Would have been nice to bring some home.
author: J P.

description: Ill say best square size pizza slices in the city down in old Columbus st best late night snack the only reason im giving it 4 stars is theres not many options around four to five different types of pizza hot and ready even though your probably not going to be picky when your a little tipsy i do wish the have Hawaiian pizza when i come because pineapple do belong on a pizza.
author: Anthony R.

description: Pizza heaven! Great veggie slice after midnight (yes, a place open in North Beach with food after midnight as originally was seeking dessert). Sit at counter and don't be intimidated by a long line as it moves fast. Cash only!
author: Sharon M.

description: I feel like you can smell the deliciousness from a block away! Huge square slices. Decent variety. Super flavorful. The line was long & there really isn't too much seating inside. We took the family, ordered to go & enjoyed our slices on the bed of our truck people watching. One slice is plenty! Really quick service. Super yummy pizza. Cash only.
author: Gia M.

description: CASH ONLY. Was really disappointed when we came here and saw that sign. We had to use the ATM inside. The pizza was really great. Very doughy, not a lot of sauce, but a good amount of cheese and toppings. They are also reasonably priced. They don't have ranch for your pizza which was really disappointed seeing as though that is a staple for me. Also, be prepared to wait in like for 15-30 minutes. Overall, good pizza with a very small and compact environment. Probably would get to go next time.
author: Karlee I.

description:
Hands down, best pizza in the world. My pick is the clam & garlic, although they are all so good. 

Cool vibe in there, too. It's fun to watch them make the pizzas. I want to get a job working here on the weekends just so I can be around it more.
author: Kelcey M.

description: Bomb pizza...need I say more? We got in right at opening and avoided people (it was starting to get packed when we left.) there is a pretty friendly vibe in the place as well.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Love the North Beach area.  Has an edgy feel to it. Golden Boy Pizza continues this edge with bar seating (only) and Metallica playing just loud enough to restrict conversations to maybe three bar stools.
Ordered a slice of the Clam & Garlic and the Combo. Nice beer selection, but I went for the 'Fine Red Wine'. I thought the C&G would have had more clams and red sauce - I asked the staff if this was Pesto, but no. The Combo was decent. Wine is served in small water glasses (no snobs here).
Overall, I liked this place.  If I lived in SF, it might be one of my regulars.
author: George S.

description: Definitely worth coming here! The combo pizza was delicious! The garlic on the clam/garlic pizza was a bit overpowering but I also had insane amount of garlic at The Stinking Rose the night before. The size was perfect, the slices are square so you can eat the whole thing and not worry about the crust like you usually do. The pizza has perfect amount of thickness. This place wins a spot in my top 10 best pizza places in the country!
author: Nin A.

description: No complaints. Fast, inexpensive pizza.  I just prefer my pizza thinner vs. thicker.   Not sure if they offer both kinds. Friendly staff, cute small inside.
author: Christine V.

description: Up there for some of the best pizza I've ever had. The pizza was soft and fluffy in my mouth with just the right amount of grease to make the pizza satisfying. Highly recommend if you're looking for a good deal on good pizza
author: Brian C.

description: My husband was not very impressed, but I really liked this place! The pizza is already made, so you order however many slices you want at the counter, then hope there's a stool available so you can eat! We went on a weekend night, and it was packed, line out the door. Totally worth it! Pizza was excellent, crispy crust, cut in squares (which is my preference), and delicious! Highly recommend!
author: Kathy B.

description: It's average pizza. Since it's in S.F. it's a good price per square. All the same, I've had equivalent quality from Papa John's or any fast food pizza. They also need to update the Yelp menu. It's misleading. Now it's pretty much 3.25$ per cheese slice(add 50 cents). The overworked looking employee himself said the Yelp menu prices sounded 4 years old.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Pretty decent deep dish. Really long and let slow-moving lines... Even at like 10:50pm. And little space to eat inside. The basic stuff is definitely better than the works (didn't try the clam, though). Not sure I can get on board with the super high reviews. I'd get pizza here again but I like my pizza with a lot of stuff, and I do think this has really come up with very solid classic pizzas (cheese, pepperoni, or sausage), but its works style wasn't my favorite. Good crust and portions though... Two to three hefty square slices are probably a good portion to fill the average person (4 slices fill a box); they're about $5 a slice. 

Prepare wait in line!
author: Kat B.

description: The pizza was incredibly delicious. Two slices was more than plenty and very filling. The best part was the service and hospitality. I will definitely make it a ritual to go to Golden Boy Pizza every time I visit San Francisco.
author: Charli G.

description:
Almost got into a fight here stupid drunk people thinking they are slick with their inebriated powers. 
Service was pretty quick and the guy in front actually tried to step in with the idiot who tried to cut us. (my husband will laugh telling this story because I actually got up on the stairs getting ready to straight punch this fool - I am fun size so I needed the steps to see him at eye level)
Onto the zzaaas
Garlic clam so good
Pesto and veggies the best one out of the 4
Combination it was ok
Sausage it was ok
Line can get long and it will feel longer in the cold, but well worth the wait. Never mess with a tired hungry mogwai or else!!
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
So in North Beach I looked into two options for pizza- Tony's and Golden Boy. 

Tony's had at line down the block at 11:30am and multiple people suggested Golden Boy, so the choice was clearly made we went around the corner (next to the renowned Sotto Mare, btw) to find Golden Boy. 

Slices, or should I say squares, were inexpensive and piping hot out of the oven. The garlic and clam was interesting to try, but you must like the underlying fishy seafood taste. The veggie was my favorite, but what made the whole pizza experience incredible was the CRUST. The crust was SO light and fluffy...with crispy edges and melty cheese over it the whole thing was just delicious. 

The review cannot be completed without mentioning the sticker collection. It's worthy of a visit itself. Wish I brought one to share!
author: A.J. S.

description: CASH ONLY! ATM in the back. This place is bet for Togo orders. Only bar stools inside. Friendly employees, clean, very good pizza and slices do squares are generous. They have a good selection of beer on tap.
author: Cee B.

description:
Yum - how did I live so long without Golden Boy Pizza. Okay - it's a tiny bit overrated, but the pizza is delicious nevertheless. I ordered the pepperoni, clam and garlic and combo. My favorite is pepperoni then calm and garlic and then combo. Yes, I had all 3 slices. No, the level of fullness did not distort my taste buds. I had a few bites of each in intervals. 

The line moves relatively fast. There is seating inside. Parking is awful, as expected.
author: Jess W.

description: The clam pizza was delicious! And the server was very friendly. Remember cash only! Would definitely go back.
author: Kevin D.

description: Delicious cheesy, thick square cut sheet made pizza by the slice, or whole sheet. I got the combo and I will be back for more when I'm in the area. Worth the short wait in line to order.
author: Jay P.

description: Went to Golden Boy on the recommendation from a bartender at Topsy.  And was not disappointed pizza was great!  They had beer and wine and the price was cheap compared to all the other places we had eaten in San Fran. Definitely will be back again
author: Gil R.

description: Delicious! Decided to be adventurous and try the garlic clam because it's the one that kept having to be replaced as we watched from the line outside. I love the crispy crust and thought it had great flavor!  Also, my kids never eat the crust but they both devoured their pepperoni slices!
author: L. W.

description:
Finally got to try this place after hearing my coworkers rave about it.

We walked in at about 3pm after eating a big brunch over at Mama's earlier today. We sat at the counter and ordered a slice of the combo, a slice of the vegetarian pesto, and a slice of the clams and garlic. Served with a knife and a fork, the pizza was toasted to perfection with a nice ratio of crust to cheese to toppings. We passed our slices around so we could try a bit of each.

1. The combo - pretty much your typical combo pizza, nothing extraordinary, but a solid slice.
2. The vegetarian pesto - a slight pesto flavor, but they could add more.
3. The clams and garlic - probably my favorite of the three. It had a nice herb seasoning on top that made it unique and tasty.

The place has a nice casual feel with counter service and to-go options (good for those drunken nights when you HAVE to get a slice of Golden Boy or you're just on the go). They also have a nice beer selection. The employees are nice and attentive.

Boxes are 50 cents, but bags are free. We packed up our leftovers in the wrap from the wicker trays and put the in the bag. Done. Solid pizza, but not sure I'll go all the way out there just for the pizza.
author: Leana L.

description:
Overall, GBP is very overrated for what it is.

Sure, if you're just there because it is "hip" and a good place to take cool IG pics or check in, GBP will provide a good experience because the food is decent too.

But if you go for just the food like me, don't expect too much. I've tried their Clam and Garlic + Combination. C&G is better but the major fault is that the thick crust is just sloppily made. It is too flour-y, not crispy at all. I may have unrealistically high standard as I've tried Sicilian Pizza in Italy too but even compared to Escape from New York here, the size is double for the same price and it is at least equally good. 

And as always, for any "hot" and "hip" place, there is a long line and services aren't the best. Some busy places are worth it and some aren't. This falls in the latter category.
author: Trung N.

description: I typically don't wait in line for food but with few good options for pizza in North Beach I joined the 10 or so peeps already queuing.  Super simple operation and setting which I like, old school.  The guy working the counter was taking orders for slices, spinning to heat them, spinning again to cash out each customer in an impressive highly coordinated hustle, can't imagine what the line would be like without this MVP!  (give this guy a raise!)  Pizza is rapidly served up and just as quickly replaced by piping hot delicious fresh pizza.  I had the cheese, cause lets face it - when pizza is good, cheese is an iconic choice.  The Vegetarian Pesto looked tempting, the Clam Garlic intense, and the combo a full blown no holds barred deal.  If you like Sicilian deep dish style pizza, this is your place, don't let a little line (and no parking) deter you!
author: M M.

description: I came in here because I needed to use the restroom really bad. Decided to grab a pizza to go since I was going to use their restroom. What an amazing surprise this place was! Their flavors is top notch! The decor is graffiti-unique! Customer service was on point! Bathroom did have an odd smell to it but other than that! Amazing! Didn't even realize I was walking into a 4.5 hole in the wall!
author: John O.

description: Very tasty good pizza they arrived on time. Nice customer service.  There cheese pizza is the best.
author: Angela M.

description: This place definitely lives up to its reputation. Pizza was delicious. Will definitely keep going back to this hidden gem of San Francisco. Keep it up guys.
author: M J.

description: This place was a small, but very friendly and open space. It was very crowded because it was lunch time. I really liked the stools, although instead of tables, there was a counter along the wall. Seemed like a bar space previously, but converted to a pizza place. The pizza came in thick squares, and it was hot and delicious. As a New Yorker, I would say the pizza was pretty good - even though I scoffed at the fork and knife. I would recommend this place as a in-and-out space, not for a long meal. Great lunch space. Would recommend if you're in the area.
author: Hanna C.

description:
Amidst all the different pizzerias in North Beach and the Broadway area, this is the one place I'd pick for a good slice of pizza! My friends and I literally walked from Montgomery Bart Station to Golden Boy before heading out to The Warfield for a concert. So yes, you could probably call us fans of this place! Haha! 

My usual selection is the Clam and Garlic pizza. Such a unusual combination at first glance, but it works wonders on the taste buds if you're keen on garlic. The clam is subtle and not too fishy and it lays on top of a crust that has a similar texture as focaccia. And I love how it's in square slice form.

A close second for me would be the pesto/veggie. 

So sad when they closed the San Mateo location, so trekking the walk to this location is the small price to pay to enjoy this gem of a slice.
author: Vincent L.

description: Imagine a great pizza place like blue line pizza, but instead it's a cash only place like Golden Boy Pizza where a bunch of drunken people are trying to get a slice of pizza. It seems like they could make it a 5 star place if they actually cared....
author: Michael S.

description: Awesome late night pizza joint ! Great tasting thicker crust with good toppings.... punk atmosphere in the heart of North Beach.
author: Nate E.

description:
God damn this place is good. Silicon style slices that have a light crunchy, airy, thick crust which just enough cheese and sauce on top. They are delicious and pretty cheap. I usually get two slices of cheese and a pbr and it is under $10. A rare steal in the city. 

Just make sure you order at the front and then go sit down.
author: Logan T.

description:
THE pizza place in San Francisco. Hands down! Thick, cheesy, hot, delicious, cheap slices. Draft beer at the bar, TV's playing the game, and a great staff that makes me feel great everyday. 

Love you guys and I enjoy supporting such a great place!
-Naem from Wells Fargo
author: Naem N.

description: Just like everyone says, order the garlic and clam pizza and you will not be disappointed. The pizza is hot and the crust is crispy. In a single bite you can taste both a garlic bread like flavour and the seafood taste of the clams. There are a lot of customers but not that many seats.
author: James S.

description: Golden Boy pizza is delicious. Perfect place to grab a slice for lunch/dinner. They reheat it for you, so it's always piping hot and perfectly cooked. Crisp yet chewy crust, amazing sauce. You won't be disappointed.
author: Rachael S.

description: Best pizza in North Beach!  Cheapest too!  Pick out what you like in the window and eat inside at the bar or take it to go.  Wash it down with a good selection of bottled beers.  A simple business model that works well.  Enjoy!!
author: Marco R.

description: This is mine and my husband's favorite place on Earth. It's one of the inspirations for our restaurant... and we don't have pizza on our menu. Their concept, values, and size are all a dream! The best pizza you'll ever have: Balanced, dream toppings, and crust is on fire! Love you forever GB!
author: Lauren L.

description: Went last Saturday night which was my birthday bar and food crawl through San Francisco. This was our last stop around 11:30. Early night as we were doing the Giants run in the morning. Anyway there was a line about 12 people deep . Not too bad and the line went fast maybe 10 or 15 minute wait. Got ours to go and went and chowed down at Washington square with a gorgeous view of St Peter and Pauls Cathedral. What a yummy perfect ending to a fun night. Best pizza ever and cheap too!!!
author: Candia M.

description:
Whenever we make it out to North Beach this is one of the potential spots where we will most likely end up. With many, many options in the area there is certainly plenty to experience in North Beach. 

This is certainly one of the places you should check out if you are in the area. If you have a hankering for a great doughy, chewy, flavorful slice of garlic/clam, sausage, pepperoni, or vegetarian pizza give this place a shot. The slices are light on crust, big on flavor and they disappear down your gullet with a dangerous amount of ease. To optimize your pizza tasting, plan on ordering at least a slice of each flavor and split each slice into two, they are big enough to do so.

You are likely to encounter a line that goes out the door and down the block but don't be discouraged. Part of the reason for the long line is that the ordering counter is right next to the entrance, so unless you are next up to order you will be out the door already; they also crank those crack laced puppies out fairly fast, so the line moves at a pretty good pace.
author: Jose U.

description: Best place to come between 12 and 2am when you are in the financial district or north beach. The line is always long, but worthwhile. I personally love the clam one. It is a unique flavor, but if you are down to try something wild, do it.
author: Nikita K.

description:
MY GO TO PIZZA PLACE for those "pizza night" cravings. This is the only pizza place and that my boyfriend and I actually crave. I always get the clam garlic pizza, which, depending on the day, can sometimes be way too garlic-EY. My second fave is the vege pizza, NOM! 

We usually come here on the weekends during the early part of the day, which almost always has no line. However, if you plan on coming here later in the day or at night, you'll end up waiting forever in line. TOTALLY WORTH IT THOUGH!
author: Shela D.

description:
If you ain't a crust lover, but love the pie, this is the place to come. You probably won't get any "crust" in your slice but if you do, fear not... it's just a nice thin piece of crispy and cheesy foccacia.

I did not know about this place until I walked by to the next-door Ethiopian extravaganza, Massawa, for NYE dinner. 

We saw the giant line of bright-eyed, eager customers forsaking whatever NYE plan they could have chosen to stand in the cold for Golden Boy Pizza instead. Talk about opportunity cost. Then, as we saw the combination slices and veggie-pesto slices looking all warm and gooey from their pizza pans, we literally did a double-take and made a mental note to come back for lunch the next day. Low and behold, we did.

The combination pizza was amazing. All my favorite veggies--zucchini? yes please!--plus the pepperoni and sausage on a hearty, substantive but not-too-doughy focaccia crust. The clam and garlic was definitely too garlicky for me and won't be getting it again (you NEED to have Altoids on hand), but I'm glad we tried their novelty. 

My main takeaway? The combo pizza is like a glorified Round Table Gourmet Vegetarian (my childhood favorite!) but meat-ified and on steroids. I'm definitely coming back to satisfy my pizza cravings. Best part: GBP is on point for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike.
author: Arushi S.

description: Friendly service and good pizza. The pizza is light, tastes fresh and has a wonderful crunch to it. I would come back for it if I were in the area or out at night. Highly recommend the vegetarian slice and the clams one also looked great.
author: Lily P.

description: OMG!  I am still thinking about the clam and garlic pizza!   This place is awesome. Excellent service. Pizza the best I have had to date. Glad we followed the reviews!
author: Anne P.

description: Amazing as always. There wasn't much of a line this time and beat the rush a bit which was great. The crust is so perfect and the toppings. Will definitely be back more!
author: Emily F.

description: I'm ADDICTED to the pesto!  Little garlic shake takes it to the next level (sm. glass shaker at bar). Remember to bring cash.
author: kristine a.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is always the best way to end the night after bar hopping in North Beach. I've been here many times before but my most recent trip was at 1am on a rainy Saturday and the line was down the block. Probably took us somewhere from 20-30 minutes to get some pizza, not too shabby I guess. The Garlic Clam pizza is the big specialty here and I think it's great -- beware that garlic will make your breath staaank for days. Their other pizzas are great too -- combo, pepperoni, sausage, cheese, veggie etc. All the slices are super cheap, anywhere from $2.75-$3.75 a square slice, that's a damn good deal!
author: Elaine N.

description:
Each of my go-to North Beach Pizza places holds a place in my heart.
...If you want thin gourmet wood fired pizza, visit Tony's around the corner. 
...If you want pan, deep dish pizza with any toppings you want, visit Capo's down the street.
...If you want to be waited on and impress a date, visit one of the dozens of other restaurants in North Beach.
...If you want something quick, basic, delicious and cheap, visit Golden Boy. 

What you see is what you get with Golden Boy. The always have the same 6 pizzas on a rotation. They heat them up in the tiny oven, making the bottom crispy and the top melted. They smartly fan the aroma of pizza out into the street, above the heads of hungry or soon to be hungry patrons. The pizza is $4.25 and it's probably one of the best deals in North Beach. They are open really late and have surprisingly good service.  So my question to you: why not? 

Tip: I would not use the bathroom here.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
This is a great hole in the wall place in North Beach to grab a bite of squared pizza.

+ Uniquely shaped, squared pizzas!

+ Cheap and yummy!  My all time favorite combo pizza was for $3.75!

+ They toast up the pizza they have on window display and when it comes out of the oven, it is piping hot!  The crust is at a perfect, tasty crunch and they serve it to you when it is ready!

+ They stay open till the late night hours!

+ Service is fast and on point!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I do not know how to explain the Golden Boy Pizza experience other than with it is as good as it gets when it comes to pizza. Being a Chicago native, I must admit that I enjoy a particular style/type of pizza. Golden Boy Pizza is completely different from my "pizza comfort zone" as the sauce is not heavy, the meat is not under the cheese, and the pizza isn't a traditional deep dish. All that being said, the pizza is simply fantastic. 

Perhaps the best pizza I have had from Golden Boy is the pepperoni. In regards to favor, it might just be the best I have had. 

The only draw back from Golden Boy is the cost; as it is somewhat expensive. (I believe $46 for a large.) That being said, a large at Golden Boy Pizza would likely be an extra-large at other places. (The pizza comes in a sheet rather than circular.)

Thanks Golden Boy for the positive experience and I look forward to coming back soon.
author: Kourtney B.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is one of those nostalgic San Francisco businesses to me. I love the crust that is formed in their rectangular pizza baking sheets. It gets so nice and golden and seems to retain a one of a kind flavor of previous bakes as if it were a great cast iron pan. It's always a treat to come to this place. A nice slice of freshly baked pizza (all flavors are good, but I always get the super garlicky clam or pepperoni) and an Anchor Steam Beer, and you have one of the best combinations that exist in the food world.
author: Toby F.

description:
Amazing Mouthwatering Pizza. 

I had garlic clam and combo. The crust was perfect. Tomato sauce, cheese, and toppings were in perfect proportions. Counter-style seating.

Tip: Ask for corner pieces...
author: Ashutosh Z.

description:
Decent pizza. Had bigger hopes for it. But the icing on the cake was finding a blonde strand of hair baked into the crust of my slice of cheese pizza.

Update: I'll admit based on all the other spots out here, this is probably the best. Hands down. I guess coming from New York my expectations were set a bit high. But I've gone back to this place a few times after bar hopping and it's always on point.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I love it here. I'm a big fan of Golden Boy's pizza. They have a unique square pizza that makes it distinct from the Chicago's deep dish pizza or New York's thin crust pizza. The restaurant has a sort of hippie and punl rock interior that makes this place rocks. Remember, They are cash only. You can dine in or to go. 
P/s: eat pizza with a cup of beer is superb!
author: Tran M.

description:
I usually go here after drinking/clubbing since they open until 230am. The wait is usually at least 10-20 minutes.. but I hear its much longer during usual business hours. The pizza is one of the best I've ever had. I usually always get the combo and it sucks that its located in an area where parking is horrendous.. but at 2:30am you can park literally on the same block. If you're ever in little Italy, this place is a must.

It's about $3.50 a slice, which is worth it. If you're not from the area, I'd suggest buying extra and bringing it home. If you toast it in a toaster oven the next day it still tastes amazing.. almost better sometimes if you get that light crisp on it.

Don't forget to bring cash as it's cash only. Otherwise, there's a BofA, Bank of the West and Wells Fargo on the corner of Stockton and Columbus..
author: Milton F.

description:
Good pizza solid service! We got the pepperoni 

Check them out next time you are in SF and try a few slices
author: Bay R.

description:
Now, this is pizza! Who doesn't like their pizza with a side of punk rock? Well, if you don't, stop reading now. This place isn't for you. 

Golden Boy serves up some amazing pizza. Probably the best pizza I've found in the Bay Area. They serve up the fattest, most delicious squares of French bread pizza, I think I've ever had. 

Can we pause for one second? The ambience of this place is insane. They have killer tunes playing. Is that a B-side off Dookie I just heard? YEP! They have awesome wall tags and stickers all of the place. AND they have one of the coolest logos I've ever seen! 

This place is legit. Bring your vegetarian friends also, because they have some serious veggie pies on the menu. 

I'm going to keep it simple and tell you to order the sausage pizza with a pint of anchor to wash it down. I mean, c'mon? When in Rome!

Stay golden, Golden Boy!
author: Andrew D.

description:
Walked by while on a pub crawl and stopped dropped and rolled back for the pizza, came at the right moment, when the line was just ending and hot ass pizza in my face just in the nick of time. Super cheap and the golden crust was the bomb (yes pple still use that term).

Would go back again and again. I wonder how much a whole sheet of this goodness cost? I'd get it and throw a party ! and of course dance and eat my way to happiness.
author: Mira T.

description: Super delicious! The crust was amazing, the pizza packed plenty of flavor and didn't have a lot of grease. Service was fast and the price was pretty good. The look and feel of the building, exterior and interior, was great. The atmosphere was very friendly and welcoming and so were the employees. I would highly recommend stopping by Golden Boy Pizza.
author: Toni H.

description: Amazing pizza if you enjoy a bready crust.  Garlic/clam was delicious, once piece was plenty to tide me over to the next bar.  Great value at $4 a slice.  Friendly staff, too!
author: Scott S.

description: Stopped by for a late dinner after hearing great reviews about this place from locals. The pizza did not disappoint! The veggie pesto was delicious and I loved the thick crust. Took home a slice of cheese for later that evening and it was still delicious when reheated. Would definitely recommend this place for San Fran visitors looking for something off the beaten path.
author: Samantha A.

description:
Fast, efficient service. Great food. Perfect hours for late night grubbing.

PS
If people are complaining about the garlic & clams  pizza being too garlicky...don't order something with the name "garlic" in it....duh.
author: Todd L.

description:
Ok so we were really hungry (tired of waiting for a table at the Italian place a few doors down) and cold - but this pizza really was good. 

Cheap, square, hot and delicious -- add a cold beer to that and you have made me a happy girl!  

They have a variety of options, including yummy vegetarian choices. Between us, I think we tried them all and everyone was happy. 

It was photo-worthy pizza and that pic is still making me drool! I am looking for an excuse to go back. Seriously, any excuse.
author: Mary G.

description: Garlic clam pizza is a must get every time I'm in the north beach area. It's a square, grandma style pizza with that slight crunchy bottom and crust. Killer anytime of the day. Tip: cash only and if the garlic clam isn't available, you wait till it is.
author: Michael S.

description:
Used to be my favorite pizza place in the city. Every single time people visit,  and any time I want pizza, I come here. On average this is once a week... For years now. 

That's no longer the case. Today I got handed a combo slice with two tiny pieces of sausage and half a pepperoni. When I complained I got told to purchase another slice. I am used to San Francisco having no standards but what I liked about this place is there were standards. 

Not ok with it. Of course nobody working here today cares.
author: Anthony O.

description:
Great location, great price, very good pizza.  Thick, hearty, satisfying.   Could use more seating during the lunch hour.  

Had the pepperoni and the sausage slices.  Close to my work place enough for me to go back and try the clam and garlic one.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
I am a self-proclaimed pizza snob. I love pizza but it is rare that I find a pizzeria that impresses me.

Well... Golden Boy really impressed me. During my first visit, I had their clam, garlic and parsley pizza. It was delicious. The pizzas are prepared in sheets and served in rectangular slices. As you bite into the pizza, the gooey cheesy peels off and clings onto your mouth--my favorite part when biting into a delicious pizza. The clam was not overwhelming, but just enough to make it's presence. The dough is soft but has a crispy bottom, giving you a nice "crunch" when you hit the bottom. And $4 per slice? You can't beat that. The service is QUICK. The server cuts a slice, pops it in the oven, BOOM there you go! There is a nice selection of beer on tap as well. 

MAKE SURE TO BRING CASH. It is a cash only joint.

This will definitely be my go-to in North Beach for years to come.
author: Justina L.

description: Love their pizza exspecially garlic and clam. Their puzza is so tasty even when you eat it cold or hot.
author: Mel O.

description:
The pizza is great, the line is slow. It seems that they need to reheat each individual slice one at a time. Even on a slow week night, its going to be slow to get your slice. Cash Only for the pizza bar, but most everyone knows that already. 

I got the clam pesto pizza. It was good, but not worth a 30 minute wait good. However, GBP is a fan favorite for the bar hours, so it will always be busy. They would get 4-5 stars from me if they could ever get the line to be more efficient. I like how they wrap the one slice in the pizza paper. The pizza always smells delicious, and there is always demand, but couldn't you find a way to serve your customers a little faster? My review is 3.5 stars.
author: James N.

description:
I admittedly was a bit skeptical about finding quality pizza at 1:30 in the morning, but boy was I wrong. This place is incredible. The pizza is thick, but not deep dish thick. Maybe pan pizza? It doesn't matter. You need it in your life. The pesto veggie one knocked my socks off, and I still haven't been able to find them. 

The lines can get frustratingly long late at night, but when that steaming hot square (or more likely squares) finally comes out, all of your pains and sorrows will have been fully worthwhile.
author: Madhur B.

description: Living in the East Bay keeps me away from Golden Boy too much these days but it is definitely my go-to plaza place in SF. No hassle, no drama, no ostentatious bull, just great pizza. A couple squares is a good meal.  Only hassle is parking but riding my motorcycle gets around that problem.
author: Paul D.

description:
Um, I feel like all of the 5 star reviewers need to have their heads examined.  Golden Boy is certainly fine.  Adequate in a pinch, but it is FAR from exceptional.  Pretty typical Sicilian slice reheated in a conventional pizza over.  This pie is as far from good as it is from bad.

If you go, don't go with lofty expectations.  This is probably the key.  I was expecting much more quality than what I had received.
author: Rolf V.

description: Pizza was on point! I prefer thin crust, but this pizza is fluffy on the inside and crisp on the outside. It's not dense like other pan pizzas.
author: Ryan C.

description: Garlic Cilantro clam. Garlic Cilantro clam! Garlic Cilantro clam! Pretty sure they are owned by San Fran psycho...regardless this place rocks! You can order take out or sit in. Everything is by the slice and is worth the trip to North Beach. I recommend the Garlic Cilantro clam pizza so good! They have beer on tap and it goes so well with the pizza! This place is a must try!
author: Shea C.

description: The pizza flavors here are unique and all delicious. Service is okay but the ambience of the place kind of gives a IDGAF vibe. I don't remember the type of beer I had but it was some sort of light beer that tasted surprisingly sweet! I don't know if it's because my taste buds have been so used to dark European beer, but this one was pretty good. Seating is very limited, but it seems like most people do takeaway anyways. Most pizza slices are about $3 each
author: Hannah C.

description:
If you are in North Beach, look for a giant pointing finger. Within its walls contain some of the best pizza out there! 

My friend and I stopped in for lunch and there was a small line of people waiting to order. I'm pretty sure this is a common occurrence, and we were lucky to come here when the line wasn't too long (it started building up as we were sitting inside). Did you know there is such a thing as garlic clam pizza?? Well, it exists and delicious and is available at Golden Boy!  I tried the clam pizza and veggie pizza with pesto. Holy cow. It's so good. The employees are very fast and efficient, plus they serve beer and wine here. Perfect combination! 

Thanks for showing me what the Golden State is all about when it comes to pizza!
author: Sheena T.

description: This place was recommended by a good friend as a Local's favorite. We stopped by and found it to be completely true. The pizza was fantastic with plenty of cheese and toppings. The crust is thick and fluffy and definitely filling and the flavor was fantastic. The only bad mark is that one of the slices we got was a little burnt after being reheated, otherwise a great experience!
author: Lawrence S.

description:
Yummy! Visited from New York this past week and still managed to get stuck in a 15 minute line in the cold - well worth the wait!

Nice guy working behind the counter, open late, slightly pricy $3 Regular & $4 Pesto Veggie slices - but served hot and fresh! Would recommend.
author: Raj M.

description:
I've had Golden Boy Pizza on numerous occasions - usually because friends insist we go there after a night out in North Beach.

This is a case of where a place was too hyped up before I tried it, so it had difficulty living up to my expectations.  The way folks talk about this place would make one think that it's the best late night spot ever.  In my opinion,  it's just OK.

Most recently,  I had a clam and garlic slice, which is a signature dish of sorts at Golden Boy.  It's definitely a  unique take on pizza toppings, but taste-wise, it's fine and nothing to write home about in my view. In fact, I much prefer other standard slices from Golden Boy or otherwise.

The line up late at night can be annoyingly long too. I'm sure I'll be back; it just won't be me leading the charge.
author: Sebastian N.

description: Great slice of pizza!  If I wasn't so full already I would have tried every single slice.  Good amount of cheese and toppings.  The dough was crunchy and not soggy.  The service is fast. You don't have to wait long for a slice of pizza even if the line is long.
author: Alice T.

description:
This pizza is absolute heaven on a piece of bread.  I remember hearing form this place during a uber ride and decided to check it out one time with my friend.

It's located in little Italy but surprisingly not hard to find at all! 

The place has a grungy punk feel to it, but very nice staff and ambiance.  The pizza I kid you not it too die for! Even the cheese pizza is legendary if you have to satisfy you pizza cravings go here! Best and does not disappoint !! Prices are very fare too!
author: Henry T.

description:
Somewhere between a Roman al taglio and a Sicilian/Brooklyn square.

This is probably the best slice of pizza I've had in California. This is coming from a Brooklyn born guy from an Italian family.
author: Miles L.

description: Love Love Love this place. The clam and garlic is a must! So good line out the door, but worth the wait! Been going here for years and the service and quality of food is always top notch! Must visit if in San Francisco.
author: Dr J.

description:
Had Golden Boy last night for the first time and will definitely be coming back! Had the garlic and clam slice. SO YUM. And their crust is perfect! Can't beat the price. Friendly workers. No seats available at the bar so we sat at the other counter. A tad awkward for my claustrophobic self. It was cool to look at all the stickers tho! But the ambiance isn't what counts here, it's the damn pizza. Can't wait to have them again!

CASH ONLY!
author: Christine R.

description: The pizza here is perfection - perfectly crispy and chewy crust with tasty toppings!  I was nearly giddy when I saw that Williams-Sonoma offered their pizza crust mix, but found out it's no longer available - boooooooo!  I wish I'd gotten a chance to try the mix, but at least the real deal's available until 2:30 am on weekends (Fri/Sat)!
author: Lyn Y.

description: That was some good pizza.....it's in a convenient location for ordering a slice to go and continuing to explore (if you're a traveller who read yelp reviews for what to eat in San Francisco, like me!).
author: Coco C.

description:
Many many early mornings, I've ended up at Golden Boy Pizza after a night of bar hopping in North Beach. It almost became customary that we stopped by the Golden Boy before we headed home. I always got a slice of veggie pizza. It was always satisfying.... all warm and lightly toasted up with the perfect toppings. Standing on the sidewalk and stuffing my face with pizza never felt so good. You can bet there's a long line after hours, but even earlier in the evening, it's hard to even get a seat inside. 

One time I had a local celebrity sighting there. My friends and I met KTVU news anchor Ken Wayne on the side walk. He was not eating any pizza but seemed to be enjoying the night with his brother. My gfs bombarded him with questions and I just stood there as usual, devouring my pizza. Sorry Ken Wayne, I still choose Golden Boy over you.
author: Liv A.

description: I wanted to like this place more than I did. I went for the garlic and clam pizza. It tasted good but my stomach hurt all day...so this a no return for me. We went about 1:00pm on a Sunday and waited in line for only 5 minutes. They brought the pizza to us and gave us two large cups of water. If your stomach can take the large amounts of garlic and oil than more power to you, I couldn't hang.
author: Lauren R.

description:
I am a big fan of anything that has melted cheese and golden boy pizza is still one of my favorite pizzas in SF

I love the square shaped no crust pizza and every bite is just filled with cheese and toppings definitely what a pizza is all about!

I've tried all their pizzas and my favorite is still the garlic clam, combination and pesto 

Tip: perfect for satisfying your munchies after drinks at a local bar near by. They close at like 2am in fri/sat but beware the lines get long but move pretty fast.

Enjoy!
author: Joanne K.

description:
Easily my favorite slice in San Francisco. The crust seems to me like a hybrid between sourdough and focaccia, deliciously crunchy while retaining and soft and delicious interior. Sure it can seem like a brisk "What's your order...ok. NEXT!!" sort of experience but that's part of the fun. 

Oh yeah, if you can remember to do so you should order a "corner slice" on your next visit. Trust me it's worth it!
author: Ben G.

description: Great pizza on focaccia bread!  Limited menu...6 kinds of pizza by the slice or by the sheet.  Quality is superior, taste is fantastic, and price is more than fair!  I'd recommend it!
author: Craig D.

description: By far one of the best pizza spots in SF no to mention how good the price is for the slice of the pizza you're getting!
author: Jerry C.

description: It has great reviews and I was expecting some amazing pizza. It was nothing to write home about. I had the pepperoni and pesto veggie pizza, it was greasy and just okay.
author: Wildeflower M.

description:
Their big square slices of Sicilian-style pizza are good, but after having it drunk AND sober, I don't think they come anywhere near living up to all the hype. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/golden-boy-pizza-san-francisco?select=jNFfhrrDcqWAzFVX9zKveg#jNFfhrrDcqWAzFVX9zKveg
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/golden-boy-pizza-san-francisco?select=uGEfdUe2SeMyBuqdbzvqGg#uGEfdUe2SeMyBuqdbzvqGg
I don't like clams or garlic, so that's the only slice I haven't and won't try, but here's how the other five ranked:

1. Sausage - 3 1/2 stars
- Either this really is better than the other four slices, or I just think it is because I had a few bites as soon as they handed it to me, before getting in my car and taking them home to eat

2. Pepperoni - 3 stars

3. Combination - 3 stars
- You're probably not used to getting zucchini on your combo pizza, but all the combo slices I saw here had that, a few other veggies, and one or two pieces of sausage and pepperoni

4. Pesto Vegetarian - 3 stars
- Got one of those annoying friends that complain because they don't like pizza w/ tomato sauce? Throw one of these slices their way to shut them up... this pizza uses pesto instead of tomato sauce

5. Cheese - 2 1/2 stars
- I was surprised that I liked all the other slices better than this, especially since my fat *ss also took a few  bites out of this before getting in the car and heading home

Misc.
- Cash only
- Yelp directions were inaccurate, so if you feel like you're lost, put down your phone and read street signs (look for Green St.)
- Late night, only the walk-up window is open, and you can usually expect a long, slow line
author: Ocee D.

description:
The 3 pizza's I tried were mediocre at best. Tried the combo pizza which seemed decent nothing special, but the nice crisp when you bite into it was nice. We tried the pepperoni pizza which was alright as well, would prefer Pizza Hut or even Digiorno frozen pizza. Let's just say I made the mistake of trying the clam & garlic pizza.

     First impression of the staff was not very good. The cashier seemed pretty unmotivated to be friendly let alone show a bit of personality. One thing that really turned me off was how she lacked the skills to accommodate my friend being a vegetarian wanting to add ingredients to a cheese pizza. Her response was "you have to order a whole pizza if you want to customize it...". They have the ingredients to add to the pizza plus they reheat the pizza in the oven when you order by the slice. Why not go the extra mile for your customers to be happy, we would of paid for any extra charge it didn't even matter. I work in customer service and can tell she was either just lazy or didn't care.

3 stars for the food, and a 1 star for the service, so I give em' a 2.
author: DeAngelo L.

description: This used to be one of my fav pizza joints in the city. The garlic and clam pizza is hands down out of this world. I always recommend     Golden Boy to others. Came here after work to pick up a couple slices of the clam pizza. Shoutout to the male with the blonde hair wearing the Giants cap, you just made me night. Worst customer service I received at this establishment. I was going to order more pizza, but the lack of customer service not even a hello or a your welcome after I thanked him.
author: Victoria y.

description: I looovw this place! Totally would go back! the pizza was soo good. Their pepperoni pizza was the best. I would come back here all the time. I love the pizza.
author: Mira B.

description:
I can't care that tons of reviews say differently and mine likely won't mean much, but I will have my say regardless.

We ordered one slice of the veggie pesto and one slice of the sausage. We didn't get 4.5 star pizza as the reviews suggest. Oh no. What we got was a warmed sandwich without the top. Yep. The dough was not pizza dough whatsoever. It was something that tasted like French bread. There was almost no red sauce on the sausage and little on the pesto. What makes pizza pizza is mainly the bread and sauce. The toppings were OK. They need to learn to make pesto like Hot Lips in Portland makes. But I guess that doesn't matter because their doing quite well per the reviews, and the long line we waited in. Well, the line wasn't too long actually, it was how long it took for each person to get their slice. Also, the bread is too thick, not just for a low carber which I am not, but for anyone.
author: Betsy B.

description:
I've read the Yelp reviews and tried the pizza multiple times but honestly, I never understood the hype with Golden Boy.   The pizza is just meh and the only reason I can think of for the grand Yelp reviews is that the place is open late (until 2:30am on weekends) and everyone is either drunk or high when they're eating here and, well, we all know that everything is yummy when you're out having fun and under the influence.  I mean, really, I don't get the rave reviews otherwise.  

Given that it is a thick dough pizza, cooked in rectangular sheets and cut into squares, I guess it can be best described as pizza al taglio style.  I love thick dough pizza.  I like all styles of pizza but I especially love thick dough so you would think this pizza would be right up my alley but meh, it's not.  Although the clam and garlic is interesting, there's nothing really special here.  

But the most annoying thing about this place is their lack of reliability and it's that lack of reliability that makes this place a less than average experience for me.  For example, just today, I picked up an order for a work function.  Because the pizza was for a small seminar that my company was hosting and we needed to make sure we got the pizza when/how we wanted it, 2 days prior to the event (on a Monday), I phoned in the order (one sheet of pizza: half veggie and half clam) and was told that an advance order is not needed for a single sheet of pizza and to call back the day of.  I called about noon the day of and was told that the order that I wanted (for a 5:15pm pick up) could not be done because they pre-sauced all of the pizza dough and couldn't make a pizza that was half one sauce and half another and if I had only ordered at least a day in advance, they might have been able to accommodate.  Ok, first of all, really?  I tried to order in advance and was rejected!  Secondly, it was a Wednesday and this place was open 11:30am to 11:30pm that day.  By noon, they sauced all the dough for the entire day (12 hours)?  Where are they keeping all this pre-sauced, dried out dough (I mean, once it's sauced, you can't really cover the top without making a mess so this dough has to be laying out somewhere)? That's just gross and is probably part of the reason their pizza sucks.  

So, in response to their dumb, contradictory policies, I change my order to half pepperoni and half cheese - not at all what I originally wanted but at least the sauce matches.  I ask them to cut the pizza into smaller pieces and they agree.  At 5:15, I arrive to pick the pizza up.  The box is lukewarm and has obviously been sitting out for awhile.  Why did they make it so early and not at least bothered to keep it under a heat lamp?  Oh well, don't have time to deal with it now so I pay the $39 for the pizza plus a tip and start walking back to work.  While walking, it dawns on me that I should have checked the pizza before leaving so I look for a table and open the box - the pizza is cut wrong and we need it cut right because of the way we were planning to serve it.  So I walk back to get the thing re-cut and by the time they cut it and give it back, the pizza is already cold.  If this was purchased for personal reasons, I would have been disappointed but would have just re-heated it and chalked it up to the "Golden Boy" experience but this was purchased for a work function and their poor service resulted in us serving cold pizza late.  I might be a "whatever, stuff happens" kind of gal when it comes to my own personal pizza needs but I can't be that way when I'm representing my company.   I'm so over this place!
author: Linda H.

description:
I was in San Francisco less than 10 hours and already found better pizza than I ever have in Los Angeles since moving there 3 years ago. This Midwest girl needed some good pizza!!!

My roommate yelped some pizza and chose Golden Boy because of the excellent ratings and over 1,700 reviews. I can see why!

The pizza is cut into squares and is the Chicago-style that I love most. The sauce was DELICIOUS (my fav part). I bought 2 pieces and could barely finish both so they are quite filling. Luckily, I did finish them due to losing thousands of calories climbing the infamous mountain like San Francisco hills. 

The place is not big. It was a little cramped getting into the door just to order the pizza. It was hoppin! There is a long bar you can sit at and eat, but we decided to eat our slices else where. 

THANK YOU GOLDEN BOY PIZZA FOR MAKING MY TRIP AWESOME!
author: Ashley F.

description:
Very overrated, in my opinion. Decent, but not great. I prefer Giorgio's in Crocker galleria to this place.

The crust is much thicker than most pizzas, which is my biggest issue.
author: Dan T.

description:
On the last stop of our petite adventures, my friend took us to Golden Boy Pizza. When  she told me about GBP and I responded with whats that, she was in utter shock. She couldn't believe I never heard of GBP! 

I guess she decided she had to fix that, fast forward a year or so later and there we were. First off, there was no line which was great but the selection was limited. They still had their famous Clam Garlic Pizza but seemed to have been out for a little while. We were deliberating if we wanted to wait for a new batch but decided to just roll the dice. I also decided to grab a fresh slice of meat combo that just came out. 

Clam-super abundance of clam pieces, garlic wasn't overpowering,crust was super crisp yet so buttery and light.. I felt like I was eating air and not at all weighted down by the dough

Meat-standard flavors, sausage was my favorite (good meaty bite and flavorful). The crust however was not as good as the clam. I think they under baked the meat pizza and think reheating actually helps the crust get to its golden perfection

Cash Only...long lines depending on times

Overall Thoughts

Delicious Sicilian style pizza that's well worth coming back again for more
author: Eddie W.

description: AMAZING!!!! here for the weekend and it was recommended to us and not only is it the BEST pizza we've had but the customer service by Jullian was awesome! We will be coming back a couple more times before we leave! Thanks guys!
author: Laura C.

description:
CASH ONLY, but they do have a ATM inside. This is a tiny pizza joint in North Beach, which is easy pizza to grab and go. I love their clam & garlic, pepperoni, combination which are all thick crust pizza. Golden Boy is a bit on the pricier side, $2.75-$3.75 per slice but still well worth it. You simply order, and they throw it in to heat it up for you - it's pretty quick.

They also don't offer any ranch and you have to pay extra for a pizza box. Parking is horrendous in this area.
author: Karen C.

description: All are bomb but the clam and pesto is alright. But the sausage and pepperoni well dammmnnn Gina it's bomb! Pizza is my life!
author: Gabby M.

description: I had pizza here when I was in San Francisco more than 5 years ago. It was so good, I could not wait to go back on my 2017 trip.  Just look for the pizza sign on the finger pointing down and all of the squares in the window.  The sausage, pepperoni, broccoli/tomato, and fresh seafood will not disappoint.
author: Dave L.

description: Went here yesterday for a slice and had a good experience. The slices and prices are good. Check them out if you're in north beach.
author: Kevin C.

description: OMG the best pizza ever in San Francisco... its sssoooo yummy, fluffy and a good crunch. I've only tried the cheese and pepperoni. I am def coming back to try the rest.
author: Maylene M.

description: Fast service, humble front desk man, and amazing pizza! If you're looking for great pizza in SF, this is a must place to go!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Adequate but overrated. 

I tend to like saucier pizza and found Golden Boy to lack a real punch of tomato sauce. Crust is on the doughy side and flavors overall are kind of muted. 

The staff are remarkably friendly and accommodating, particularly by the standards of a cash-only, late night dive!
author: Andrew D.

description: The best Pizza I've ever had! I'm from so Cal and my friends recommended this spot. It was delish! They do cash only so make sure you have cash on you before hand. My fiance and I got the clam Pizza and a regular cheese and pepperoni pizza. Hands down the best!
author: Habeeba M.

description:
I was born and raised in NY in the 80's, pizza was .25c a slice, ok... I am a pizza snob.

This is good pizza.

That is all.
author: James W.

description:
I love love love places that don't do a lot, but do what they do really exceptionally well. Take Golden Boy for example- they make giant sheets of Sicilian style pizza and serve up slices for aprox. $4/ea. You can get your pizza to go as you walk around North Beach, or eat it there with a cheap pint of beer. There's plenty of seating and likely a Bay Area sporting event on the TV too. 

The garlic clam pizza was so dang good and kind of the perfect snack to eat in nearby Washington Square Park. Staff are super friendly and it literally takes no time for them to grab your slice.

I wish there was a place like Golden Boy in every neighborhood.
author: K M.

description:
Bathroom has cool grafiti on it, which I love in a restaurant, the server was SO AWESOME, huge beard, black hair, friendly, nice, knew what the vegetarian pizzas were (my wife is veg). I loved him, we loved him, I hope the pizzas are just as great!! We'll see when I'm done peeing (currently yelping to you in their clean and stocked bathroom)

I'm back!! And the pizza is delicious!! fluffy crust & good cheese (I only eat cheese pizza) & my wife loved the veggie! A+++ for Golden Boy
author: Chessie C.

description: Must Try a slice when in San Francisco!   This pizza is worth waiting in the line outside for.
author: Mike B.

description: Thought we'd check this out since the reviews were good. It's lunch counter atmosphere, which is okay but I was not impressed by the pizza in the slightest. I'd give 2.5 stars if I could but since I can't, I'm comfortable rounding down to 2 stars. Given that this is San Francisco, I expect more than this.
author: Gogo A.

description: Bomb dot com!!! pizza is smackin good selection of beer great atmosphere cool people pretty much sums this place up. If your hungry and want a quick bite this is the best pizza around!
author: John D.

description:
My boyfriend and I both ordered the clam and garlic pizza ($4 each). I expected a different taste based on the reviews, but it wasn't bad. It was an interesting taste, but not something I would try again. I would probably try some other pizzas there. We asked for marinara so we could dip the pizza in it, and it was decent. I really liked the bread part of the pizza because even though it was thick, it wasn't heavy, but more light and airy. 
This place seemed more of a rock vibe; somewhere good to come late at night.
author: Geeyoung L.

description:
The Yelp reviews for this place is unrealistic!! Had 3 slices, pepperoni, sausage, and combo. All of them were just okay, nothing special. It's a combination of NY style thin crust and Chicago Deep dish. The crust was underwhelming but toppings were fresh. I don't like the small oven in which they heat up the pizza which lacks power and doesn't do any justice for the pizza.

This place should only get 5 stars if one, you are drunk or high, two, you are famished from walking up and down the hills, three, this is the only place that is open after your night at the local bars and strip clubs...
author: Louis Z.

description: Getting a late night slice at Golden Boy Pizza is a San Francisco rite of passage. If you're out in North Beach and need some pizza before you head home, Golden Boy is your place. Tip: head over before bars close, otherwise you'll be standing in a long line for quite some time.
author: Audrey A.

description: Wow golden boy you sure made my road trip a good one. We saw the rating on yelp and came here for a quick slice. There is a lot of street parking but good luck finding an open spot. Once you get to the location there is a large variety of slices to choose from. My son chose this place so of course we went with a plain pepperoni slice. The slice was less than $4 and it was a thick square. My youngest gave me a bite of his slice so I could experience the pizza here and it was really good. The crust was well seasoned and the quality of the ingredients was good. Everyone that got a bite really liked it and almost decided to just eat there. Unfortunately the pizza didn't hit anyone top pick but it was really good so it is an option if you are in the area.
author: Gary M.

description: Great service for me and my daughter! Pizza was fresh, hot, fast, yummy! Mike gave such great service- special water topper for my daughter and even let us get two pieces when we were 50 cents short. Thank you!
author: Diana R.

description: Golden Boy Pizza serves a small variety of great pizza in a fun and grungy bar setting, with a gritty 90s rock playlist playing in the background (at least they did when I went). But is it worth the long line that stretches down the street? Maybe? I got a Stella Cidre, and a slice of the Garlic Clam Pizza for only $7, which is a pretty good deal given how unique and delicious the pizza was. I was lucky to find a seat at the bar, but not everyone could.
author: Carolina S.

description:
It's a shame that all pizza isn't like Golden Boy... but then again it wouldn't make this place special.

I went in at 10ish on a Saturday night and the line went 2 houses down. Plenty of seating though, since most orders were takeout.

I followed the advice of everyone and got the clams & garlic pizza. 2 slices. $8 of bliss. Nice and crunchy, and the toppings were great and fresh. I never thought I would have seafood on a pizza, let alone clams, but god damn these were some good slices. Everything was perfect.

If you find yourself in North Beach, get in line and wait 15 minutes. It's worth it, I promise you.
author: Roger F.

description: This is my favorite pizza in San Francisco. I think it's better than most pizza's I've tried across the United States. It a focaccia style pizza. They have a combo, vegetarian, clam & garlic, cheese, sausage and pepperoni. It's about $4 a slice, cash only. It is well worth the wait.
author: David F.

description:
Don't be discouraged by the dark setting, narrow entrance, loud music playing in the background, and the occasional long line. 

The pizza here is delicious and the service is quick and friendly. The square slices of garlic&clam, roasted veggie, and pesto are my favorites!  

Roughly come up to about $4 a slice and close enough to Washington Square Park where you can sit in the grass on a nice sunny day.

Cash only!
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Oh my! This was one amazing slice!! The dough is crispy yet it's soft kind of chewy...how do they even do that? The pizza was super fresh even though they reheat them in their oven, I could tell it was super fresh still.
I had the regular cheese slice while my friends got one pepperoni and one clam slice. We got them as an appetizer before going to another restaurant. I definitely would have had 2 but it was really a nice starter.
You can always tell how good a pizza place is by trying their regular cheese slice. No need to go fancy the first time hehe. A must try!
author: Eleonora B.

description: Tonight was my first time there and I was definitely pleased with my slices. I got the Clam and Garlic and the Combo. I loved the Clam and Garlic but I felt like the combo was a veggie slice with 3 pieces of sausage. Maybe next time I'll try the cheese pizza. The crust was the best part.
author: Rommel A.

description: A Beach Bum's afternoon. Grab a slice, or two and wash it down with a brew, or two, at Gino & Carlos. When pleasantly lubricated and satisfied wander through the square and grab a coffee at the Trieste. Drop in at The Beat Museum and City Lights. End your adventure at Specs. If you've followed my directions you will probably need to get a cab home. Enjoy the trip.
author: Patrick M.

description: This is my second time coming to Golden Boy. Honestly it is pretty good. My review is basically on customer service. Last week when I called they said they take to go orders before one. Today I called before 1 for a take out order and they wouldn't take it. They said it varies depending on how busy it is. That's ridiculous. They should have a set policy even if they are busy or not. The guy on the phone now said he can't take my order at 12:00 am unless it is a whole pizza. Honestly I think they change their take out policy on how busy they are. Yes the pizza is good, but I wish their take out policy was better for the non drunk people.
author: Christina C.

description: Great local spot, pizza had massive flavors and very authentic.  We tried just about every flavor available while stopping in. Servers were very friendly, loved the experience at this place.  Make sure to take a few stickers or a Sharpee to add to the abstract wall art!
author: Philip And Dahlia A.

description:
Damn the pop up window and carrying cash while drunk in the area. This is quite some good pizza if you can grab and go. As for sitting down and spending loads of time here... I'd pass that option as the seating is limited and I'm not sure it's really worth that much of my time.

At the wee hours of the weekend nights with not much else in the area this might have to be the move. Good pizza if you make sure they bake it for long enough so it's a tad crispy.
author: Joseph L.

description:
I'm extremely picky when it comes to Pizza but Golden Boy has one of the best pizza's in the Bay Area!

They are square cut pieces of goodness. So do not be surprised if there is a line. My favorite thing to do is go during a weekday during odd hours, luckily I only work about 15 minutes from this location!

The most expensive slice (clam and garlic, combo) are $4. Still affordable. Cheese is $3 something still. YUMMMM.

If you choose to sit and eat, there is limited seating... But they serve beer too!
author: Amy H.

description:
Walking along north beach... my mom freaks the F out and is like "oh my god, my children, you guys want pizza???" Hell yeah I want pizza if you're paying for it! My mom says "this is the best crusted pizza place you'll ever go to" I just LOL'd because there are so many pizza parlors in the city. 

Anyways, you walk past the window you'll see all the oven-hot pizzas... You go inside and it feels like a bar, BUT you order before you sit down. Once you order, she will pop your order in the oven to heat up and you just take a seat. The server will ask you if you want any water or drinks... anyway... leading onto the pizza...

I got myself a regular pepperoni, and from a far it looks small but it is actually a pretty big size square. Sicilian style pizza is what they serve and it is by slice. 

The sauce is sweet, the dough is flakey and crunchy (how I like my crust), crunchy but soft at the same time. And to be honest. one slice is not enough.... its too good to even stop eating when you are full! 

Such a hole in the wall. Will be back!
author: Crystal C.

description:
Tasty pizza and beer (on tap).  They do Sicilian-style pizza, and usually have 4 or 5 different types.  Crust, sauce, and cheese are solid.  Toppings are good, and the "combo" slice is tasty.  Also often have a clam-garlic slice which is good if you're into that sort of thing.  Certainly not the most amazing pizza I've had, but it hits the spot when you're hungry.

Service is really fast, though it's popular, so there's usually a fairly long line out the door during meal times.  Bar seating on the inside.
author: Brian T.

description:
I really liked Golden Boy. Its got a dive bar feel and decor but it was totally clean inside. Pizza and a few beers on tap make it a nice place for after work hangout. The people were really nice and took my order with patience and a smile. As for price, the pizza was about $3 a slice which is a really good price point for the quality of pizza. Most importantly the pizza was super delicious. 

The pizza is rectangular and the bottom is a bit thicker, crisp and buttery. Its not floppy NY style or thin crust wood fired but closest to a deep dish pizza that you eat with a knife and fork. Except, its not super deep and thus not as heavy on the sauce and cheese. Its not something that I can eat often but that's only because I don't workout enough.
author: Huy V.

description: my definite to go drunk late night pizza spot.  hands down the best pizza in the whole san francisco.  so tasty and so delicate.  its like having a fancy pizza without the fancy and the pizza which didn't make any sense.  me and my friends have been coming here for quite some time and they do open until late nights for those late night munchies.  grab a beer and grab a slice of pizza and enjoy all the graffiti they have inside the shop.  they can even give you a marker if you kindly ask them for one.
author: Ben Z.

description:
Pizza: one of the best in SF
Customer Service: One waitress was super rude, but then the bartender was really nice so im 50/50 about their service. 
Price: Reasonable
Overall: Its a great spot for a quick bite and great pizza. I would go again.
author: Betania S.

description:
Pizza here was absolutely delicious. Came here around 1am on a Saturday night out in the city. At first we were wondering if it was worth the 20 minute walk or if we should have settled for the pizza next door to the lounge we were at.. 20 minutes later we got our pizza and I can tell you that it was definitely worth the walk & wait! 

We tried the clam linguini, the cheese, sausage and the pesto vegetarian slices. The Clam looked and smelled really good, but we thought it tasted ok. The cheese and pesto were probably the best. I'm normally not a fan of cheese pizza, but this one was super tasty. The bread was very thick, almost focaccia like except a bit crispy on the bottom. Pesto vegetarian was also very tasty. 

My bf accidentally dropping our pizza box on the floor and the remaining slices of our pizza fell into the dirt =(. Unfortunately, we didn't get to finish all the pizza we bought but I guess that just means we will have to come back for more!
author: Susan M.

description: every single person that hears my bag and my friends bag was stolen inside the pizza place are always surprised that no one did a single thing to help us. every single one. never coming back here and I hope the staff steps up to the plate. we didn't even get a "im sorry that happened inside our restaurant".
author: Sâmara C.

description: Attempted to go here twice, once they were closed for a holiday and another time the line was too long and I didn't want to wait in it. Finally, this past Sunday I went and there was still a bit of a wait but noticed the line moves quickly. There's only one small counter space with a guy and girl tending the line and register. The staff is super friendly and patient. We ordered two slices each and noticed they were huge square slices! One is definitely enough but I wanted variety. I tried the clam and garlic and one sausage slice. The clam and garlic is stacked with garlic and in some ways bland.. wasn't my favorite. I did however enjoy the sausage a lot and I really liked it. Good pizza, I'll be back!
author: Tiff C.

description:
What do you do after a full night of celebrating with your good friend for landing a new kickass job? After last call? After the bar owner tells you (the first time) that he's locking up? After he says "you don't have to go home but you can't stay here"? After he tells you to get the f*k outta here? You go loiter somewhere else and annoy the owners, of course.....it's only natural.

At 2:15 am, there's still a line going out the door to order a slice or two or three of Golden Boy Pizza's little squares of heaven, however many slices that will help the kidneys absorb booze. Good thing Golden Boy starts their pizza with a thicker crust. It's crispy on the outside and fluffy and chewy on the inside. Next, top it off with awesome toppings and bind it all together with ooey gooey stringy cheese. The end result is a combination that anybody, drunk or sober, can appreciate.
author: Mike L.

description:
Mmmmm pizza! The love of my life. I was originally going to eat dinner at HRD next door, but saw a line outside Golden Boy Pizza.I went over to check it out, and saw rectangles of cheesy, delicious looking pizza. Golden Boy won me over. 

I ordered the clam & garlic, pesto vegetarian, pepperoni, and the combo. The clam & garlic and the pepperoni are bomb. The pesto vegetarian is okay, nothing special. There were too many veggies which overpowered the pesto! 

Since it opens until 2:30am, it's a great place for latenight drunchies!
author: Fanny H.

description: I don't often visit the area, but Golden Boy   might be a good reason to from now. Great pizza with good amount of sauce.
author: Jimmy G.

description: The pizza had olives, bacon, lots of mozzarella cheese. It was the perfect balance. absolutely blown away, we finally tried the pizza that everyone raves about and it was delicious!
author: Perla W.

description:
Get the pesto vegetarian, you'll thank me later.

The pizza here is absolutely delicious.  It's really fresh, there's a perfect amount of cheese, and the crust is light and crisp.  I loved the sauce on the pesto veggie pizza, and honestly I wish there had been more of it, I'm a big fan of sauce.  

My boyfriend got the clam and garlic and he was also a huge fan.  I wouldn't say this is the best pizza I've ever had, but it's still pretty damn good and I would go back.  

Keep in mind that this place is cash only, so plan accordingly!
author: Jenn T.

description: I thought the flavor of the garlic clam was definitely incredible, but the dough and crust underneath was certainly not... The dough and crust wasn't crispy in chewy way... It was more crispy in a dried up airy way... Kind of like biting into crouton.
author: Betty T.

description: Thick slab of clam and garlic pizza with an ice cold pint of PBR for $7.25. Bam! What else do you really need? Oh yeah, friendly peeps and a good local vibe.
author: Surely F.

description: We have had pizza all over this city. We just discovered this place, walking around and exploring. I have to say, some of the best square pan pizza in SF.  The price is unbelievable as well. You can not beat the the service either. It's not really a sit down place.  I can see why there was a bit of s line.  Well worth it. The people working there are super nice and very patient with the crowds. This is definitely a place to go out of your way for.
author: Rebecca Larson G.

description:
OUTSTANDING PIZZA!

It's a popular late-night snack spot.  We waited outside for about 30 minutes in the cold, but it was totally worth it.  

They constantly bake square shaped pizzas and display them in the window.  As I get closer to the line and see them package one slice after another onto make-shift plates made of wax paper, it's torturous.  When's it my turn?!

I'm not going to recommend any one slice because they are all delicious.  Get one of each.  Live a little, yeah?

I live in southern California so I don't have the privilege of enjoying this very often.  But whenever I go, or my friends ask for suggestions of what they should eat when they go "up north"... my answer is always the same: "Golden Boy Pizza.  Please bring me back at least one slice."
author: Miyeon L.

description:
I've eaten here two times in a week. Both slices were incredibly fresh and tasty. Don't let the line dissuade you. It moves fast and the wait for any pizza that is running low is not more than 5-8 minutes.

Tonight we ate inside and that was hard. The stools are too close to the counter and the heavy metal music was way too loud. I recommend you take a slice to go but then you don't get to enjoy their amazing selection of beers on tap...

The clam pizza is surprisingly good and the vegetable combo with pepperoni was also really good.
author: Tera K.

description: One of the best pizza places I've been to in the Bay Area. The taste from those squared slices is unique and keeps you wanting more. This place is also super affordable! Beware: the line could get a little long, and you might not be able to find a seat inside, so be patient. It's all worth it though!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This place is like a dive bar/pizza place and couldn't be more awesome. Even the menu on the wall has personality. 

My boyfriend and I were doing a mini restaurant crawl through Little Italy and needed a good appetizer. Saw the slices in the window and knew we had found the perfect way to start our eating adventure that evening. I was really tempted by the garlic and clams but since I wanted to leave the door open for some smooches later I chose the sausage instead. The crust is good and bready, and the cheese wasn't greasy at all. In fact, for a slice of pizza it was relatively light, if that's even possible. We bellied up to the bar to enjoy our slices and the vibe was great. Good punk tunes playing in the background, friendly staff and customers. We felt like we'd been there before even though it was our first visit.

If you're looking for a good slice, a cold brew and a cool atmosphere, check this place out. And bring cash.
author: Holly R.

description:
Quick  (if the line is not long).   Simple.   Tasty.   Fresh.   Yeah, what's not to like, right?
