Our whole family came to try Golden Boy.  I especially like the garlic and clam pizza.  All are good.  Please note that these are all thick pizza, and are sold by the the rectangular slice.
author: Mike Y.

description: This is the best pizza place I've had forever !! Heard it was the place to go and it did not disappoint. The service and friendliness of the staff was top notch.
author: Kelley P.

description: Not very flavorful reminded me of elementary pizza back in early 90s. It wasn't horrible but wasnt as good as I expected its great for late night drunk munchies. Service is excellent
author: Brandon N.

description:
Gotta try the garlic clam! It's actually not my favorite (I like the combo the best here), but it's kind of their "thing"... so you just gotta. 

To be completely honest, every time I've been here has been after night of bar hopping in North Beach, but it looks like everyone else here seems to agree. The pizza/crust itself is crunchy and crispy and all of the toppings are delicious... and piled on pretty generously.

There's a bit of a line at my usual time, but it seems to move pretty quickly.
author: Terra C.

description: Excellent hole in the wall pizza joint. Sit at the bar type eating area, no tables. Hefty square slices of crisp edged, doughy pizza! Mouth watering good pizza! Lots of choices for beers on tap. Worth the stop!
author: Shelly R.

description:
How come I ALWAYS come here after a night of drinking?!

This place has AMAZING pizza! So flavorful! It's well worth coming here and they are open late.
No matter what topping you get on the pizza, it surely is the best pizza I've had!
It was freshly made, straight out of the oven.  

I love pizza!
author: Remie M.

description:
I love Golden Boy! It's the only pizza place I have been to to get a slice where they cut them into squares. It's still a great portion and you get it piping hot so watch out! You can also order the pizza by the pan, which will cost you over $40, but is well worth it since it will feed a lot of people. 

Golden Boy is the place to be!
author: Vanessa S.

description: I've starting carrying cash on me more frequently for the sole purpose that I might get a craving for Golden Boy that needs to be satisfied. Clam and Garlic is where it's at.
author: Amy H.

description:
Discovered this spot after a recommendation from a local Bartender. Pizza was super good for post drinking. Loaded with toppings and flavor. A must try. Worth the price. 

Heads up: Cash Only. They also have a full bar.
author: Ethan P.

description:
I had this place bookmarked for a longgg time & finally had the chance to try it out when I attended the North Beach Festival. I ordered 2 slices: Combo & Garlic and Clams

I enjoy thin crust pizza, but GB's thick crust was really good! The pizza crust is a little dense, not too doughy thankfully, but it still had that nice crisp to it, esp on the edges. For the Garlic&Clam, it tasted kinda bland to me. I was really looking forward to it since I love both garlic & clams, but sadly, it did not live up to its hype. Maybe I should'be toasted it to enhance the flavors. The winner, however, was the Combo! Great flavors w/ the sausage, zuchinni, onions&tomatos; not too cheesy but jst enough; and good tomato sauce, not your Prego basic kind.

Overall, awesome pizza and will definitely come back to get their Combo & other kinds of pizza. Definitely check it out when in North Beach. The line is worth the wait,& it will not disappoint!
author: Trina N.

description: This is a staple in SF. I posted a review long ago after eating there only once. But I've changed my mind since I been a few more time with friends. Claim is my favorite and the cheese pizza. You know what just go there. Grab a slice and a beer and enjoy!
author: Ryan M.

description: Their pizza  is awesome especially the soft dough. The guy on the register seems like he hasn't got laid in years and can't stand long lines of people!!!
author: Santosh G.

description:
I. can't. even.

I hate life. This place has ruined all other pizza forever for this Bostonian pizza lover. I don't know what to do with myself. I'm crushed. Let me go sit in the corner and cry. 

Okay I'm back. Still crying.

The garlic clam pizza was bomb. Didn't really taste the clam but whatever the flavor was so good. The pizza is pretty thick, pan pizza style but it's so chewy and soft with the bottom 2 mm super crunchy. I'm in love and I'm heartbroken that I can't eat this 5 times a day for the rest of my life. I've always wanted to move to SF and have been looking for the right opportunity. Never imagined the right opportunity would be in the form of a square pizza.
author: Francis C.

description:
Looking for pizza in San Francisco? This place will get the job done, my friend. A couple of worthy notes:

1. The pizza is made in giant squares, so one will typically purchase by the squared slice... and they're huge and delicious.

2. Seating is mostly at the bar.

3. Music selection is enjoyable (Master of Puppets-era Metallica made an appearance on the playlist during our visit).

4. Product is tasty, affordable and quick.

This is a prime spot for local pizza. Do not miss this Golden opportunity.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Must make good on my last review posted after St. Patrick's Day. I will forgive Golden Boy for serving me a subpar pie on a drunken holiday (they were probably overwhelmed with orders). Came back here again last weekend and the pizza was glorious -- particularly the pepperoni. Clam garlic was just aight.

Right when I walked in, I saw a giant bucket of pizza sauce just emanating the most fantastic tomato smells, and I knew this place was legit. 

So. Damn. Good. I take back every word in my last review.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Delicious pizza  i tried the vegetable one and pepperoni really good you'll get full wIth like 2 or 3 slices. They look small but they are good
author: Erica Y.

description: The only downside to this place is it's small and you might not get a seat. Other than that... good beer selection, great ambiance, and fantastic pizza. I especially like the clam and garlic.
author: Montgomery G.

description: Just touched down in the Bay, already Yelped places the eat late night. Golden Boy had great reviews, was so excited to try it. WASN'T DISAPPOINTED! Amazing pizza! Loved loved loved the clam pizza!
author: Danielle D.

description: Inconsistent.  Ordered slice to go after standing in line in the cold for 20 minutes.  It was undercooked. I had a great slice here during last north beach festival so they know how to do it right, just not every time.
author: Kris K.

description: If you have cash and are looking for a great slice of pizza for lunch this is your spot. The garlic and clam pizza is awesome. For about $4 you get a huge slice.
author: Garrett W.

description:
Golden Boy showcases its square pizzas in the window, reminding me of displays in Florence.   We stumbled in while waiting for a table at a nearby restaurant.  Upon walking in, they take your order, and yes, they are CASH only.   The most intriguing pizza was the garlic and clam --- and it did not disappoint.  The slice was gently warmed in the oven and served.  The crust had the perfect crunch, but the rest of pizza was fluffy (yes, I said fluffy).  It's an amazing combination. The garlic was pungent but not overpowering, and there was a uniform distribution of clams. 

The menu and decor are entertaining, to say the least.  How can you go wrong with a pizza clock ?

I am definitely coming back.
author: Risa G.

description: I have been here 3 times now and would say this is the best pizza I have had ever. Its always packed of course due to the great pizza they serve. I got the pepperoni and it was just perfect. Third time I came here I got the sheet instead of slice and it cost $40 not bad given the size. Can't wait to go back.
author: Aman G.

description: Definitely some of the best pizza in town, it wins the not-NY style category. Even the cheese pizza is worth ordering, it packs a ton of flavor into an unassuming slice.
author: Kurt N.

description: Great pizza , but maybe a bit over rated ! I'm not saying this pizza isn't good because it is, however I had heard about how it's the best pizza in the city and I have to disagree ! I think it's my fault for thinking about it too much before going ... But it was still good. I got three different slices and I actually think the simple pepperoni was the best , it really allowed me to taste the sauce and it was great! The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's not as amazing as expected ! But still delicious ... If in the area I would probably try another place !
author: Amy D.

description: Best pizza in San Francisco. Hands down. I'd gladly pay more for this pizza but you don't have to, the price is great. Be prepared to stand in line during peak hours. This place is popular and totally worth it. You go Golden Boy, you go.
author: Scott A.

description: Place is cool for the atmosphere and the pizza is good..Not great but good and hits the spot when you are hungry for a slice.
author: Rafael A.

description:
Pizza is somewhat like an injured bird. 
One middle square of clam garlic & a Stella .... This is:
BELA LUGOSI'S DEAD & FREEBIRD !!
 blended into an alchemy of the beyond
perfection of a Golden Boy slice.
  It's akin to a religious sacrament the one dozen times I've sat down at this quonset hut onto a 50s style diner stool....
 If it was completely quiet at Golden Boy that would be more than enough, but add the juke box music selections which have been as boppin as the pizza is WONDERFUL!! 
And the staff has always been fun to watch !! Let's go now. I think about GB
all the time!
author: Eye Am ..

description:
Tasty late night pizza. This place was toward the end of Tony C.'s pub crawl and it was much needed. After a dozen or so drinks, I was famished and needed to get my munchies on. 

This place hit the spot. After a five minute wait of staring at the beautiful rectangular pizza slices, I stepped inside and snagged a couple delectable treats. 

I scarfed the pizza down with the quickness. Ooey gooey cheese and fresh toppings adorned the slightly crispy crust. 
Bomb dot com.
author: Justin C.

description:
remember those square cheese pizzas from elementary school?  this is that and a lot better! the combo is my fave.  this place is awesome for a quick pizza fix and the staff is super friendly.  the decor inside rocks and if you get a chance to eat inside, go for it.  

Cash Only and there is an ATM in the back if you are in a bind.
author: J. T.

description:
Best Pizza I've ever had.  Seriously a game changer.  The combination slice is simply amazing.  I would be even bigger if I lived closer to this place.

I had the combination and pepperoni.  The staff was very helpful and polite.  The place as that perfect secluded local vibe that I love.  Seating is tight but the park is 2 blocks away with a good view of the city.
author: Jason L.

description: Normally I am not a fan of deep-dish pizza, but the squares cut in this place were incredibly satisfying.  The crust was crispy on the bottom and cooked through, with just the right amount of sauce.  My slice had clams, which were toasty and not chewy - it is a small miracle to find properly cooked clams!  The beverage selection is perfect and the long counters gave the place the kind of relaxed, cozy feel that makes me want to be a regular here.  The prices make that entirely possible.
author: Michelle M.

description:
If you have ever walked by this small shop and wondered "why the line?", in this case the line does not lie. This small pizza shop is SO good I would go out of my way for a slice of any of their pizzas any day.

The Garlic is a little strong, so if you're not a fan of having garlic on your breath you might want to order something else, but it's hard to go wrong with any of their pies. This place is CASH ONLY, $3 a slice. Portions are generous, and there is limited seating in the back.

Go with a friend, have a conversation in line, and grab a few slices to enjoy over a cold bear or soda. If they're busy (as is often the case) you might have to wait a bit to get your order, but remember it's worth the wait.
author: Kyeimin K.

description: I got the clam and garlic pizza and it was delicious! The pizza was very flavorful and the crust was soft and crunchy at the same time because of the focaccia bread! I also tried a bite of the pesto veggie one which was also pretty good but I would definitely prefer the clam and garlic one over that one.
author: Annie L.

description:
This is some bomb ass pie! Good, thick crust, good sauce and some damn good cheese.. That's what I got.. cheese, so simple yet so delicious.. If you're looking for NY style pie, this isn't it...but you will not be disappointed with this pizza.. 
you order, pay (cash only) and you grab an available stool next to a stranger and you talk about how good your slice was.. is there a better way to spend your lunch time?...they've also got you covered in the beer department, because you gotta have beer with your pizza...any other way would just be un-American.
author: Maryella P.

description:
Went here for late night drunk pizza. Benefits for being one of the few places opened late at night. The pizza was pretty solid. 

In my opinion does not live up to the hype. Coming from the NYC area, I've had much better drunk pizza for a fraction of the price.

Good crust. Dough has a nice exterior crisp with a nice chewy center. Cheese was OK, sauce was pretty much a non-factor. Overall the flavors weren't there to make it stand apart and justify its cost. 

This tasted a little too much like a better version of pizza hut. Go and enjoy it, just don't let the hype train fool you. Solid B-
author: Travis M.

description: (4.5 stars) An amazing little hole in the wall with great pizza. I especially recommend the pesto veggie pizza! However, it does have a relatively small selection of choices...
author: Jason S.

description: We stood in the long line late Sat. night as the place was highly rated, it smelled amazing and they had the pizzas displayed in the front window as if it was a bakery - how can you resist?! It was really good pizza - surprisingly light and not too greasy. Was fun watching the guys prep the dough and huge sheets of pizza from our seats at the bar.
author: Michelle U.

description:
It's an awesome pizza spot in North Beach, serving Sicilian-style pizza by the square ($3.75 per slice).

Basically, there's two occasions one goes to Golden Boys. The first, is if you're craving some cheap, fast, and bomb ass pizza. The second, is if you've got late night munchies or alcohol-induced hunger from a night out. So whether it's 2 in the afternoon or 2 in the morning, Golden Boys will never disappoint.

Tip: It's cash only. If you see a line (which you probably will) don't worry because it moves fast.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Mmmm tasty!!

Tried the clam pizza and that was a first but wont be a last, very good!

As usual I try a slice of cheese at a new pizza joint and this place passed the test with flying colors.  Crunchy crust, great sauce, man im going for another slice lol
author: Patrick O.

description:
I only tried half of one slice of the combination. 

But that half slice was delicious and has imprinted itself into the heart of my stomach & taste buds.

Next time I will come back and eat one whole slice of the combination.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Finally, I get to try GB! I went during dinner time and I must say the clam and garlic pizza - so freaking good!
author: Van Bich N.

description: Standard focaccia pizza. Didn't taste spectacular but it wasn't too bad.
author: Raya K.

description: As an out of towner, I try to get my fill of different restaurants while visiting my favorite city. Golden Boy will always be a stop on my trip. Amazing Pizza and a great historic location! Whether you want something basic like a slice of Pep or you're feeling more adventurous for a slice of Clam & Garlic, this pizza is phenomenal!
author: Mitchell B.

description: Some of the best pizza I've ever had. A must if you're in the area! I loved the veggie pizza. Can't wait till I'm back to go again.
author: Michelle M.

description:
A great solid affordable place to get a great slice of pizza at a great price! The slices are all way below $ 5.00 for all the pizza slices most ranging about $ 3.00 to $ 4.00 per slice. My boss and I went for lunch time and I had never been so Golden Boy Pizza it was. Since I work in North Beach we frequent many of the restaurants and eateries in North Beach. Who doesn't love pizza right? 

Since it was lunch time during the work week the vibe was calm and laid back. We went up and sat at the bar to watch all the wonderful pizzas come out. I knew I wanted to try the infamous Clams and Garlic pizza and I also selected the combination as well. The slices are quite large and packed with toppings the crust was flavorful and had a thicker crust. The combination came from straight out of the oven which was one of the reasons why I chose it. 

You can rest assured the pizza doesn't "sit" as they sell pizza pretty rapidly so it is fresh,tasty, and hot. For me the infamous clam and garlic lived up to the hype! It was the right amount of garlic to clam ratio. It was quite good and filling. The combination was also delicious with plenty of toppings. I felt two pizza slices were plenty for me. They also have a good selection of beer to wash down that pizza with!  

The space inside was small but as I said we went for lunch during the week so it was busy but far from packed! With one beer and two slices of pizza my tab was under $ 10.00! Not bad at all for lunch! The service was quick and friendly too. The young lady and guy who was tending to my boss and I were efficient and fun. I would come back since I work in the area and after hours as well. After a long day at work or after a night out at the bars of North Beach I would come here and get some fantastic pizza!
author: Veronica Y.

description:
A friend turned me onto this place 25 years ago.  The 5-star food has not changed much, which is good.  While all their slices are good, their clam and garlic is the best in the city.  

The music is up to whoever is working the counter, but recently, their late night playlists have centered around old skool metal, so a win there.

The beer they have on tap is no slouch by any definition.

This place is "okay" for groups if said group can put up with being split up.  This place is fine for kids as long as you are there during the day.  Night is a different ballgame to say the least.

The crappy parking situation hasn't changed either--probably has gotten worse, too.  You've been warned.
author: Herb L.

description:
The pizza here is real good, and real fast. However I had the rudest experience last night around 9:00pm 7/22/15 with one of the employees. She was about 5'4" in her twenties, brunette. I think she was wearing glasses. We go in...sit down at the counter and asked to place an order. Immediately the girl says that we need to go outside and get in line. No hello - nothing!!!! Wow. Abrasive. 

Then we get behind the two people who made up the line at the moment (usually the line is much larger).THEN the same employee blurted out "No, the line extends outside!". We said...."those people already have their food." She said it in such a demeaning way. 

So we decided to leave without spending our money or buying golden boy pizza. We went to Tony's slice house where we were warmly welcomed. Glad someone appreciates customers. Might be time to find a new job, sweety! You costed golden boy $20 plus another $150/year from both of us moving forward.
author: Tom R.

description: I'm surprised this place has such a good Yelp rating! It's pretty basic pizza - I gave it 4 stars and not 3 because of the combo. It had a great flavor and has a pretty fair price. Definitely do not get the clam and garlic if you are unsure if you like clams - the lady at the counter said you can't really taste the clams (mostly just the garlic), which I found to be completely untrue. Also this place is cash only!! (They have an ATM with a 2.50 fee)
author: Tracy B.

description:
Best pizza by the slice in Frisco! 

They have their pizzas displayed by the window. It's a small restaurant with seats along their walkway. 

Near the back of the restaurant they had a couple of guys making their pizzas which was pretty neat. 

The vibe was pretty causal and chill with good music
author: Sal B.

description: There was a wait only one person taking orders and 3 employees watching her. Place was so small one could not even walk through the place without bumping onto other people. Seating was limited  and very tight facing wall. Pizza was bland lack of taste. It is located in a mostly Italian part of the city. My tip. Don't waist your time standing in line with so many other pizza joints in the area
author: Jon B.

description:
This place has its fans but it struck me as a middle-of-the road pizza place. The dough's like focaccia and cut into squares, and the sauce is pretty good. 

It's cash-only which is... well, inconvenient and sketchy.

On the upside they're open later than most places, so they're definitely the best-tasting option late-nite.
author: M M.

description: This place has the best pizza in San Francisco!  I'm not a fan of their clam and garlic pizza though. Docking one star because cash only.
author: Jane H.

description:
Great hole in the wall pizza place! Would definitely recommend stopping by here if you're ever shopping in the area and need a quick bite.

I got the clam/garlic pizza for $4, and they heat it up for your right away. It was great and not too oily and perfectly crisp! Probably would not recommend this one though because the garlic will stay in your throat for the rest of the day.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
This is a local spot, so the opinions of the foreign are questionable. I love this place, been coming here all my life. The pizza is San Francisco styled dish with a delicious crisp to its bite, definitely holds its own against the best of em. See, every pizza topping is the same no matter where you go, so it's about how you make it, and the way it taste. I'm recommending. 
Although before you judge the atmosphere when entering, think about the culture of The City.. What you see is what you get. Bear with us, it's a west coast thing.
author: Santiago E.

description:
A must have for everyone, local and tourist.

This is by far the best thick pizza I ever have. The dough is soft and the stuff on top are tasty. I had garlic and clams and sausages...will definitely try every other one showing deliciously at the window!
author: Rodolfo Y.

description: Omg so hectic inside! If you are looking for a place to have a seat and relax from a long day of tourist activities THIS IS NOT IT. If you are looking for the most delicious reasonably priced slice ( square slice) of pizza heaven you have come to the right place. Pepperoni amazing, sausage great, vegetarian pesto delicious, COMBO slice was the WINNERRRR by far!!!! Will dream about this often! Do the ship to LA???!
author: Daniela N.

description: The veggie pesto pizza is awesome. Cheese pizza also great. Quick service with pizza prepped ahead of time but re-heated perfectly. This pizza reminded me of pizza back on the East coast. Hidden gem. Not a ton of room to eat, so grab it to go.
author: Adam B.

description: Grew up on Golden Boys pizza and always thought that pizza was suppose to be square.. Lol ...that was a ride awakening. Those who know me will know that I don't usually crave pizza or bread for that matter *sound the alarm* yes I don't like bread and no I'm not allergic! But when I do crave pizza all I want is a couple slices of the garlic,pesto,clam golden boy pizza. I say I want a couple of slices but usually can't finish the second slice cause they give you a good big portion! The staff is always super friendly and just reminds me of my childhood getting picked up and walking pass that magical window and then it magically appears in my hands!
author: Fanny C.

description: I freakin' love this place. The pizza is so good! The dough is so crunchy yet the toppings are soft. One of the best pizza place here in sf.
author: Rafael A.

description:
Yummy pizza but lines can be annoying at 1AM when everyone is drunk/obnoxious. Love the focaccia bread but it is a bit greasy. Thought the clam garlic was just OK. 

Would come back if in the mood for less traditional crust/bread.
author: Siv L.

description:
Golden Boy in SF, and Da Baffetto in Rome, Italy ( Piazza Navona) are my 2 favorite pizzerias on Planet Earth !!!  Both are completely different...
Golden Boy has thicker golden, crunchy, chewy crust with amazing sauces and quality ingredients; da Baffetto is super thin, crispy, amazing ! 
I come to SF often, but never miss eating @ Golden Boy !  I've begged the owner to open a branch in my hometown...
E 'il migliore !

Alan M.  
Manhattan Beach, CA
author: Alan M.

description: The idea that there is a line outside this place every time I go there almost makes it 4 stars. But it's so good! Pizza in SF can be tricky, there is so much of it and so much of it is so incredibly average that I have to encourage better pizza when I find it.
author: Nick J.

description:
yum. after a late night of boozing it up at "Hitchcock"  on Sarayon Place a short walk to Golden Boy was F' ing  worth it.  It was heaven on a plate.  

I am a pizza fan and I have been known to pick pizza over sex... This pizza is sex worthy.
author: Princess P.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is so square. Like literally!

This store serves delicious square-shaped pizza straight out from the oven. It's hot, cheesy and there are many cool options to choose from. My favorite has been the clam and garlic. I really like it when the cheese stretches out like a yoga instructor after every bite. You can wash it all down with one of the beers they have on tap too!

Golden Boy Pizza also serves as a great hangout place for when you're waiting for Sotto Mare. It's a cool place with great pizza, you can't go wrong : )
author: Ringo M.

description: Love the square pizza. Great flavor perfectly cooked. We try to get by every time we're in San Francisco!
author: Lon A.

description: On Google it states that they are open until 2:30am... walked 8 blocks got here at 12:45am... closed extreemly dissapointed and irritated, I feel cheated!
author: Francesco F.

description:
Nice, hot, square slices of pizza on a cold and rainy night in downtown SF. It's also great because these guys are open late night and they have beer as well.

It's not New York or Chicago style, it's like a thicker version of NY style and the cheese is fresh and awesome. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PTFxtXS47ZVRCdZIrEWvGw?select=VeGDVHkfXT68Fmm6Qqej-g

There are many other pizza and Italian restaurants in this part of town and I'm sure that they are great in all respects but at least with this place, you're gonna get a good slice at around midnight on any day of the week.
author: Mike C.

description: Ohhhhh yes! The pizza is as great as the reviews. The line is worth the wait. Have one wait in line and the other snag a seat inside. .best Pizza in cali ever! NY trumps all. Chicago is a close second!  I do love this place and the large fresh square pieces of pizza! Delish!
author: Laurie R.

description:
FELT SO SILLY KNOWING I WAITED 2 HOURS FOR TONY'S PIZZA WHEN THIS PLACE IS RIGHT NEXT TO IT. :( 

They seriously don't even compare. Golden Boy is best pizza in the world in my book! Go here instead of waiting for hours for average pizza and okay service at Tony's. 


Awesome friendly staff and amazing pizza! Worth the trip to SF just for this!!
author: Pamali Z.

description: Yes, go. It's great. No New Yorkers, it won't remind you of anything at home. Yes go with an open mind and accept that there can be delicious pizza even in SF. It's a thick-appearing crust that somehow goes down deliciously light. My only mistake was getting 1 piece. Get 2 and make one of them the garlic + clam. Sit at the bar, get a beer, and soak in the music and dirty nostalgic wallpaper of bumper stickers, sharpie messages, and posters.
author: Alyson G.

description: Brought a friend to North Beach for a Sunday evening stroll yesterday and was looking for a place with a good authentic Sicilian style slice. Found Golden Boy on Yelp and it was perfect. For a reasonable $3 you get a well-cooked thick slice of cheese pizza served by a very friendly and accommodating staff. You can take it to go or enjoy a beer while you eat. A short wait, but well worth it. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Chris D.

description: 4 stars for a pizza place for me is a big deal. Let's just say if someone said "free pizza!" I wouldn't be the first in line [I'd be second tho cause its free ;) ] So basically what I'm saying is that I'm no pizza lover, but I really enjoyed my two slices at Golden Boy. I tried the clam and combo and to be honest I liked the combo more than the garlic clam. Could be cause the combo was real fresh and the cheese was all melted and stringy which i LOOOVE. The garlic clam was on the room temp - warm side soo it wasn't the best thing i ever ate. I did enjoy the food here and it was so fast! Well I've been told that theres usually a long line here but i came around 6 pm on a friday and ordered within 10 min and got my pizza in 5 so no complaints from me! Overall, if i'm in the area and craving a nice pizza id come here again :]
author: Jeanette L.

description:
oh boy oh boy , just want your mom use to make when you were a kid , home style Sicilian , thick , crunchy , cheesy , addicting , whatever you want to call it, this is by far the best slice I ve had in San Francisco after 9 years of living in this beautiful city ,
Thank you Golden boy
author: NAEL K.

description:
I love pizza, I've tried many pizza places, even went on a pizza trip to New York!  I stumbled upon golden boy pizza after finding that my original pizza destination Tonys, was closed. I found golden boy pizza and read the reviews and decided to try for myself. Sicilian style pizza is what they serve. A Thick, square, crispy, flaky pizza. They sell pizza by the sllice, so I tried the pesto, the sausage and a combination. All three were really really good!

The sauce is sweet and the dough is flaky with a crisp crust bottom. You take one bite and your addicted! You feel like you just have to have another slice because one isn't enough! It's a good size slice too. I was hooked after the first taste. I almost ordered a whole tray! 

I found my new favorite spot for pizza! There's lots of pizza places in north beach and now I think I'm pretty much gonna come to golden boy pizza if I'm in north beach. And they close late! Even better for that late night craving!
author: Roger P.

description:
"Without question, the greatest invention in the history of mankind is beer. Oh, I grant you that the wheel was also a fine invention, but the wheel does not go nearly as well as pizza." - Dave Berry

Golden Boy Pizza is the default go-to place for late-night-after-crazy-party-at-North-Beach pizza. I know anything would taste amazing at 3 in the morning after a crazy night, but the pizza here is really legit even without the beer goggles. 

If you're inclined to sit-in for your slice, they serve it up with a knife and fork. That's how cool they are.
author: Don L.

description: Best pizza by the slice on this side of town. Great price and fast service. Loved that they sell large bottles of water for $1.25 its cheaper the store on the corner near there. If you are looking for a quick bite to eat this is my choice.
author: Bryce L.

description:
Bottom line at the top: great vibe and music but less than decent pizza.
--
Don't come here for pizza, come for beer and good music. 

Clam garlic was okay-- this is Sicilian style which I always think is too dense. 


The guys behind the bar are super great and this would be a fun spot to watch a game at.
author: Dahlia S.

description: Crisp on the outside, fluffy on the inside - try the garlic/clam. The slices are light but filling. Service is great - friendly and quick. Only bar seating so don't come in looking for a long, comfortable meal.
author: Asmaa H.

description:
My friends bought me here for the first time and I'm glad they did!

Never even know this place existed?! Especially since I been to the bar next door. I am not a pizza person but dang, Golden Boy pizzas smells good and tastes good too! The crust isnt oily and plenty of toppings. 

The vibe of the place reminds me of New York. Just bar seating and quick service. Perfect for late night munchies.
author: Carol Y.

description: I will join the chorus of folks in praising Golden Boy Pizza. It is one of the better pizza places in the city, and it is on my short list for one of the best places to end up when you have the late night munchies. There is always a line out the door, but it moves reasonably quickly, and you can have your pick of a square slice that gets reheated in the oven. They did not seem to mind my pickiness about which slice I wanted (I'm all about that corner slice). You can take the slice to go, or you can seat yourself at the bar or one of the tables and dine in. They will give you a metal fork and knife for your pizza, which has always been my preferred way of consuming pizza. There's music, a TV with sports on, and a small selection of different beers - I like the vibe of the place.
author: Sidney L.

description: Mmmmmm...the pan pizza was to die for. It was filled with fresh ingredients and the pizza itself had lots of flavor. We will definitely be back to this place for there other pizza selection.
author: J L.

description: Best square style pizza I've ever had. The crust is thick but super light and crisp. Had the pepperoni and also the clam with garlic. Holy Smokes! If you're in town and want to have the best pizza in town then Golden Boy is a must! Atmosphere and staff are great. Best part is the old punk music in the background. Can't say more about how great this place is.
author: Nelson F.

description:
After seeing all of the reviews on this place I was excited...and a little disappointed. Their pizza was very fluffy and over seasoned. I got the clam and the sausage/veggie and they both were good...but not amazing. I am a New Yorker though so my love will always be the famous NY slice...which this, is definitely not. 

That being said- for being in Cali, it's probably better then the other options nearby.
author: Sara R.

description: Enjoyed some delicious focaccia pizza  paired with a deschutesbeer Mirror Pond beer. This place has excellent pizza with a cool vibe. The pizza is cut into squares and sit in the glass window to entice passers by. My wife loves the pesto veggie and clam & garlic slices. Slices are $4 or less and there's a tasty selection of draft beers available. All seating is at the bar, so it gets crowded easily. The only downfall is that they only accept cash. Totally recommend for the pizza and the experience.
author: Lee H.

description:
Pizza here is great! Can't give it 5 stars because I am a NY pizza fan through and through. This is very different. 

The shop if great. Watched them make the pizza which is essentially a square pan pizza for a while. The dough is on the sweet side and a little thicker. The crispness on the bottom is impeccable. 
The choices of toppings weren't many. I think there were only 4 or 5 combinations. I tried the clam and garlic one. Sounded so bizarre for a pizza topping just needed to see what it was all about. It was strangely very delicious. It was more garlicky than clammy, which is probably a good thing. 
Served in little wicker plates on two pieces of thin red and white checkered paper. With a fork and a knife. I thought the presentation was lovely actually. Didn't bother with the fork and knife, my slice was a corner one and firm enough to hold up on its own. 

The dough was almost a tad undercooked in some places because it's thicker. 
Overall definitely worth a try if you are in the area.
author: Irina K.

description: Good ol' Golden Boy pizza. I have been eating pizza here since the 1990's and I am glad it is still a mainstay of late night eats in North Beach. I also have come during the daytime and just recently ate in instead of take out and had some beers. I am glad the prices are still reasonable and food is fresh.
author: Infodiva B.

description: Pizza is really good and line is always out the door, down the sidewalk. Luckily if you don't want to wait there are tons of good pizza places in this area; you are in little Italy after all.
author: Cynthia L.

description: So good! $3.75 for a decent "square" Had the garlic clam pizza slice! Yummy! Highly recommend! Hubby had the pepperoni! Almost wanted to order another "square" but knew it would of been too much! The only down fault was they didn't have black ice-T.  Definitely worth searching for. Its on Green St cross St Jasper! Crust thick but crunchy! Cash only no credit cards!
author: Sara C.

description:
Stop! No need to go anywhere else in North Beach... this "locals' favorite" has the tastiest, most affordable pizza in town.

The front window houses multiple pans of pizza from which you can choose slices from... once the line, which moves quickly, leads you to the ordering counter, you place your order with a smiling, posh employee. They will then quickly reheat your slice(s) in an oven and either box it up to-go or plate it for dining in.

My girlfriend and I chose slices of the garlic & clams (briney, garlicky and delicious as all get out), pepperoni (classic) and combo (a great mix of flavors).

Do yourself a favor, next time you're in the city, pay Golden Boy Pizza a visit. You can thank me later!
author: Mo P.

description: Grabbed lunch here about a week ago. I had two slices of pizza, which are square slices if you didn't know. Also, they only take cash and there's a $2.49 charge on the atm in the back. I ordered the combination and clams and garlic. The combination was pretty good l, but the cashier seemed lazy when explaining what was on the toppings. The clams and garlic was quite average. Two slices was definitely filling.
author: Dan G.

description: I love Golden Boy!!! This spot rules, whether you live in SF or are just visiting you need to stop in. In an age where hype is king, this place really lives up to it. I lived in the city for a few years and no other pizza place topped my dining experiences here. It's located in the North Beach neighborhood and adds to that old school vibe that still exists in only a few parts of this lame, fake, shitty, tech-boom-douche identity San Francisco has recently developed (I'm not bitter or anything, hah.) The spacious front windows display the large square pizza you are about to consume, and you can watch the staff hard at work making more. There is evidence of the diners who came before you, with some tags and stickers plastered around the bar tables and walls, but its not gross it's actually kind of nice and cool.
author: Alison M.

description: It was good, but didn't quite live up to the raving reviews. Their clam and garlic pizza is certainly original and tasty, but not out-of-this-world great. It was just about average semi-deep dish pizza. Certainly better than some of the pizza joints nearby, but nothing to go out of your way for or that justifies the incredibly long line.
author: Nick M.

description:
Unique, crunchy, yet moist slice with a nice assortment of topping options. Solid selection of beers on tap, a dark, low key (stool & counter) layout, good tunes, all at a very reasonable price. Worth a visit of your in SF and there's no excuse for nit doing by of your in North Beach.

This is not a NY slice but your not in New York!  More of a Sicilian style but... not. Like I said, unique, especially the clam slice.
author: Michael F.

description: Amazing pizza! The dough was perfect! The atmosphere is great too!  thank you golden boys pizza! Best pizza in SF !
author: Mitzi T.

description: This place is bomb. Small hole in the wall pizza joint. Square thick slices of heaven!  They have all your typical flavors, however the clam and garlic is good.
author: Patrick W.

description:
What's more to say? Cheap, delicious squares of pizza served well into the wee hours. Not a lot of seating inside but quite frankly I was happy to sit on the curb.

Plus the Golden Boy logo has a dude in boxing gloves on it, so that's cool.
author: Lauren M.

description:
The kind of stuff you get when you are drunk and reeeeeaally hungry. There's a constant line out the door, but the individual slices come out quick.

We paid $48 for a half/sheet of clams and garlic and another half/sheet of combination (veggie with sausage and pepperoni). The sheets we huge (each larger than a standard large pizza) and fed all 8 of us drunkards. 

The clams and garlic will ban you from making out with anyone for the next month... unless you find a hot chick that digs garlic (and if so, marry her, you're all set). It will be worth it tho, it has tons of flavor and a nice pesto base. The combination is bursting with meat and veggies and has tons of flavor. Both pizzas come with a thick bread base and are baked fresh and on the spot.

Their beer selection is also quite good and if the inside isn't jammed, its a cool place to hang out and stare at the drunk girls hitting on men for more pizza. Sigh. Pizza whores.
author: Emily G.

description:
Dee: "Let's go to Golden Boy's for their Clam Garlic Pizza!!!"

Me (thinking): *GAG!*

On Saturday, 3.26.11, I woke up hungover with a pounding headache and nauseous (Thank you, Patron), so the LAST thing on my mind was pizza much less pizza with clams. The mere thought of anything remotely fishy made my stomach churn. However, my friend had been raving about Golden Boy's for some time and we were suppose to go the night before after clubbing (closes at 2:30 AM on weekends) but it was another one of "those" nights and we (I) never made it there. 

With a little convincing, I decided to give it a go. At least I was sober and would be able to enjoy the food rather than my usual drunktard etiquette of face shoveling...

As I walked into Golden Boy's, the mere sniff of the garlic that permeated into the air enticed me enough to want to order a slice of the Garlic Clam along with a Combo even though I was still hungover. 

Golden Boy's Sicilian style pizza is showcased at the front window and the menu is Drunktard Friendly. Can't talk straight? It's simple, just *point* at one of the 5 Choices: Cheese, Pepperoni, Sausage, Clam Garlic, Pesto and Combo ($2.75-$3.75). 

After several minutes of heating up in the oven, our slices were brought to us piping hot with ooey goeey cheese and vibrant toppings.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PTFxtXS47ZVRCdZIrEWvGw?userid=eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg

I must note that I HATE Focaccia with a passion. Something about the oily and dense texture is just very off putting to me. However, Golden Boy's focaccia pizza completely changed my mind. Fyi, the pizza slices are pretty hearty, so one square should be sufficient.

CLAM GARLIC: MOUTHWATERING!
The focaccia's caramelized bottom crust was super crunchy with a flakey-like texture and the inside was doughy and chewy, but not too heavy. The garlic clam topping was PACKED with bold flavors; pungent and extremely garlicky with a sweetness from the clams (not fishy at all), saltiness from the cheese and a burst of freshness from the parsley. SOOOOO EFFEN GOOOD!

COMBO (Sausage, Pepperoni, Zucchini & Onions): GOOD!
After having several bites of the Clam Garlic, the Combo was pale in comparison in terms of flavors which was to be expected. Although it was salty, savory and smoky from the sausage and pepperoni, it was nothing like the Clam Garlic which packed a big punch. 

Whether you're sober or drunk, if you come to Golden Boy's you MUST get the Clam Garlic pizza! Don't knock it till you try it right?
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Mostly standing room only, this dimunitive pizza-window/bar-seating by-the-slice pizza cafe offers a quick and cheap meal for on-the-go travelers. We stop in often for a quick bite while exploring nearby North Beach, Russian Hill, Embarcadero, Chinatown or Telegraph Hill. 

A large square of pizza - $3.50 or $3.75. About four choices; the clam and garlic tastes more like garlic and garlic!  The place is tiny - don't go expecting to hang out long. If you're lucky, you can score one of the 15-odd seats around the perimeter of the place, facing either (a) the cashier and tap puller, (b) the pizza maker, or (c) the graffiti-covered walls.

But you'll leave full, and happy. And the tap selection, though not extensive, is good.

Golden Boy's choices are few: Cheese, pepperoni or sausage, pesto/vegetarian, clam/garlic and combination. Prices $2.75-$3.75 by the slice, or $35-48 by the sheet to feed your cycling team!

After your pizza, try walking down to Fisherman's Wharf, then east along the Embarcadero to the Filbert Steps, finishing at Coit Tower, and you'll work off your entire meal!

At a Glance:
Food: 4 - Belly filling, and better than many that cost double!
Service: 4 - You'll get your food quickly!
Setting: 3 - Yo, it's North Beach! Walk around.
Value: 4 - Anything under $5 in the city's a deal! 
Date worthy: 1 - In 10 years, it'll be a funny romantic memory...but don't take her here on your first date!
Dogs: Are you kidding??
author: John H.

description: Went up to SF for the weekend and straight out of OAK airport, there we were - standing in line at Golden Boy and it was worth every minute! My favorite there is the combination slice and I recommend getting at least two of those bad boys to put in your belly!! Remember that it's CASH ONLY so make sure to pull out some cash before standing in line!
author: David Y.

description: Really fantastic pizza. Had Carmel Pizza yesterday and both my son and I liked Golden Boy a little better. Different style pizzas, both great though!
author: al g.

description:
Never disappointed making the choice to come here anytime they are open. 

Easy grab n go slice, cash only, and to be fun it's in square form. If I am ever in the north beach area, I always recruit the friends to swing by this pre or post cocktail hour. 

Keep staying strong GB and delicious ;)
author: Lynette G.

description: Stopped by this place for a late night pizza snack twice and it is by far the best pizza I have ever eaten. I tried the pepperoni and combo slices. The crust is baked to perfection and the toppings are generous. One slice will fill you up. This is a must go to pizza place if you are in SF
author: Sumathi D.

description:
Pizza. Oh Pizza. Let's face it. We all know Pizza.

And if you know Pizza you know why Golden Boy is so tasty. So perfect.

It's the reheat for sure. It's the choices of topping. It's the dough. It's the sauce.

There is no better honest Pizza Slice in The City. There are fancier ones and they are good in a different way. This is real Pizza at it's very finest.

I would put any single slice of Golden Boy up against any slice in NYC, Chicago and the real Pizza capital of the US....Detroit.

I love you Golden Boy.
author: Dave C.

description:
These square slices are hefty, real bricks of things with good solid slatherings of cheese and at least a couple of palm's worth of herb sprinkles.

I got a clam garlic behemoth for $3.75, which was extremely tasty and more than worth it.  Plus, where else can you order clam and garlic on your ONE slice of pizza?  Most places that do pizza by-the-slice confine your slice choices to the usual suspects like cheese or pepperoni, and leave the fancy stuff for the whole pizzas.
author: Hannah E.

description:
Awesomely delicious! Super tasty with many toppings in every bite! Best pizza shop I been to in SF. 
Tenderness texture
Not dry and Not too oily
All the flavor still exist after reheat.

Must go place for Pizza any time you are in SF!
author: Andy W.

description:
**CASH ONLY**

Good cheap square-pizza-by-the-slice made by good people. Order and pay at the door, then wait for your pizza to be reheated to eat in or carry out.

I love that they're open much later than most restaurants in this godforsaken city...so because of that, you'll see some kind of line of late-niters going out the door - prepare to wait. There's not a whole lot of seating inside, about thirty counter seats, but that kind of adds to the charm.

Good for: solo diners, casual bites.
author: Kaitlin G.

description:
WOOOOOOOOOOOOOO so good!! Our friends from SF rave about this place, so we finally decided to make time to check it out this past weekend when we were in town. I had seen photos on yelp of lines out the door, so when we approached the door and saw no one, we were super frantic that they were closed. Alas, we had just beat the crowd! It was nice and empty inside, save a few dudes, so we placed our order and grabbed a couple of stools.

Cheese- I think this was my fave, pure and simple. The crust is delicious, crunchy.

Combo- Hubby loved it, and devoured it before I could try any.

Pesto- Really tasty, I thought it'd be funky but I liked it. I adore pesto though.

At about $4 a slice, their prices are pretty cheap, the pizza comes out melty and toasted, and it fills you up. We contemplated going back for more at the end of the weekend, but didn't have time :(
author: Lisa M.

description: If u like pizza, try golden boy pizza. Small spot, sometime lines r way to long, but might be worth the wait. Go during week days if you don't want to wait in line. Better than the franchise. Highly must try!!!
author: Larry D.

description: Not much flavor. The pizza looks inviting and delicious but that's the best part of it all. lol 4-5 isn't an accurate rating and just raises expectations that won't be met.
author: E E.

description:
Cute and delicious square pizzas. My husband and I ordered: 2 pesto vegetarian, 2 clams, and 1 combo. The pesto was good, but lacked some oomph compared to the other pizzas. Definitely come back for the clam pizza. Lots of clams, garlic, and parsley. YUM! My breath still tastes like garlic. My husband said the combo pizza was pretty good. 

Total cost: $18.75. Cash only place. ATM is located in the back of the restaurant.
author: Jackie S.

description:
As we partook of our delectable BaoNecci pizza on a bench in front of the adjacent tattoo parlor, we noticed a curious line forming one door down under a sign that said 'Golden Boy Pizza'. "Hear ye", said I, "what lieth yonder?" After conducting a simple random sample interview of the line and consulting the internet, we determined that a slice was worthy of our consideration, plus we still had an hour or so before Tony's would call us over (which would eventually become our third dinner).

Golden Boy was a small grody bar that looked like it belonged to the post-hardcore movement. Though there are a few brave souls dining on the interior, it's more geared as a take-out place (rectangular pizza sheets in the window).

We ordered the CLAM/GARLIC, which was pretty good but a little too strong. The garlic overwhelmed the clam, which I almost didn't notice. Not bad at all, mind you, but this three buck seventy-five by-the-slice pizza was eaten with the marvels of BaoNecci still lingering on our tongues.
author: Elliott D.

description:
This is the best smelling pizza in San Francisco. The pesto/veggie is really, really good. The cheese was fine, but not spectacular. The dough is thick and yummy. It's soft but substantial.

You can't beat the price and convenience of this place. It's a great spot to pop in and out of. You can even get slices out the front window to eat while you walk to the nearby park. 

I say; get the veggie slice to go, enjoy the amazing smell, be full and happy.
author: Lisa F.

description:
There comes a time, after closing time, 
leaving empty handed, still mad thirsty, 
traveling with the wolf pack, situation is the dire, 
dark is the midnight, hungry desires, 
Golden Boy Pizza, here to answer the holler,
reminder cash only, only speak dollars, 
can't miss the spot, red neon sign follow the finger, 
square slices, homerun four bases orange october, 
mad flavors to calm the senses, garlic clam the savor,
this ain't bush league, water for amateur, 
clam juice son, the cure for hangover, 
little extra cheese, pepper, straight devour, 
bump a loosy, spray s'more drakkar noir,  
this is that lifestyle, that weekend warrior-ish
author: Roy C.

description: Best pizza ever man. 3-4$ for a nice fat slice, quality service, and never fails to hit the spot. One thing i can say though is that if you go after 8/9ish you can expect to have a nice 15-20min wait in line.
author: Aaron W.

description: By far my favorite pizza place in SF hands down. That Sicilian slice, to die for. It's great any time of the day. Cash only though. Wish they had delivery too.
author: Maria E.

description:
One of the best places on the planet (the PLANET), to get a quick pizza fix (for big or small appetites). I feel like eating pizza in a square shape makes it taste a little better and you get a little more for your buck. Any of the combinations are taste bud pleasers. Beware that the lines can get long and you might be waiting outside in the cold/rain when they exist.

One night, I was at a bar next door, got hungry, so I picked up a slice, went to another bar down the street, was still hungry, so I went back to Golden Boy for another slice. It's a convenient and trustworthy place to go when you're playing around North Beach.

For someone who is decently hungry, get 2 slices. I recommend a slice of pepperoni and a slice of clam.
author: Marlon T.

description:
The Good
- Excellent tasting pizza
- Beers available
- Good service

The Bad
- The place is small with a limited amount of seats
- There is usually a long line to get pizza
author: Dipesh G.

description: Their pesto pizza is so delicious. Quality pizza and I love the overall atmosphere of this place!
author: Hoku L.

description:
Um, can I just continually praise this place?

I took some New Yorkers here yesterday, and they claim to have the highest expectations for pizza and they were crying from joy with the garlic and clam.
author: Sally C.

description: I really liked the fast service and hoe nice the staff was. Very casual, almost food truck feel and was surprised to see a line of around 30 people even at 2 am! The pizza was pretty tasty although I am not particularly a fan of deep dish, thick crust pizza so it was a bit too oily for me. If you like that type of pizza, definitely check this place out though...
author: Prithvi N.

description: The people I babysit for just brought this home tonight, and I think I'm in love. I probably could've been paid in pizza and been totally okay with it. Yes, yes, yes. The vegetable one isn't really my favorite, but the bread will blow your mind. It's so...wow...
author: Emily N.

description:
Top notch pizza slices!!!

Like: Thick slice, hella cheesy
Dislike: Kinda limited choices, line, slices kinda pricey (standard for SF though; got 2 slices for $7.5)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
In a city by the Bay...a long, long time ago...a young adventurer embarked on a journey to find the sacred spots offering up neverending pours of liquid libation.  Given the devotion that this quest commanded, there were many late nights and there were many times where copious quantities of bad brews were forced upon the adventurer.  Fortunately these battles were not fought alone.  There were faithful allies like Golden Boy.  Golden Boy served up savory, doughy slices of clam & garlic goodness that served as the perfect antidote to soak up the gut-disrupting effects of the ethanol overdoses that were encountered on particularly rough nights of adventure.

While the passage of time has caused the once young adventurer to gray with age and be forced into an indefinite hiatus...Golden Boy lives on to help other late night journeymen.
author: Justin L.

description: This place is awesome I freaking love their pizza I love this place I don't think I can say anything negative about this place besides they should definitely expand dude all the business coming in it's a little crowded other than that this place is awesome I did experience one time or one of the ladies was completely rude because I didn't give her a tip sour ho3 but it's OK definitely go here and buy some pizza if not this place go next-door so sodinis  Greenvalley restaurant is bomb as well!!!
author: Lei S.

description: Definitely lived up to the hype! Clam and garlic was surprisingly good, but I LOVED the pesto veggie!! Get it if you love pesto for sure. Worth the price and the wait.
author: Genevieve T.

description: I had this somewhat distant strong memory of loving this pizza........ I had it again & damn was I right. I think it's all about the right balance this place somehow achieves to perfection. Combo slice is where it's at - some pepperoni, sausage, tons of veggie toppings. Mate loves the clam and garlic as well. Anyway, yep Golden Boy. Thank you.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Who doesn't love pizza? 

Golden Boy is delicious and perfect in so many ways. They have squared-shape slices instead of the traditional triangles. Their about $4-$5 each and they usually have cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, combo, sausage and the infamous clams with garlic. I've tried them all and thought they were all pretty good. However, I must say, the clams and garlic slice was super garlicky. The garlic overpowered the entire slice which made me feel a bit disappointed. As for the interior, it's more of a bar-scene. But there are plenty of stools you can hop on. The restroom is pretty crazy. The walls are covered with stickers and graffiti. I'm not complaining though.

Would I still come back? YOU BET.
author: Laura T.

description: Quick, cheap and this one waitress/cashier lady seemed to do absolutely everything. In one sentence, it's a dive pizza bar.
author: Saira G.

description: I think this place is overrated. Yes, some of their selections are unique as in different, but still I don't think it's lived up to its hype.
author: Johnny N.

description: Not sure what the big appeal is. The pizza was soggy pretty quickly.  They only take cash. Not a particularly great value.
author: Khalid N.

description:
So I was definitely drunk when I came here, but rest assured! My taste buds are always on point even if I may have been slightly intoxicated due to Santa Con festivities. Plus you can never go wrong when you stand in line for literally 45 minutes to get a slice of delicious pizza.

So where do I start. the first thing you will notice about this place is the shape of the pizza. SQUARE BEEZY. That's right. It's no longer a triangle. This place said screw the 3 corners, I'm rolling with 4. And so the square pizza began and man oh man was it good.

I had the supreme topping one which included almost everything. The pizza here is gooey and crispy at the same time. The crust is amazing (not too hard, not too soft), but just right. This is starting to sound like goldilocks, but it's the truth. So going back to the pizza. They have lots of different kinds and you can't go wrong with any of them. Slices are pretty pricey though if you are used to dollar pizzas in nyc. It's around $4-5 but the square isn't even that big. Though I will say that I will gladly pay for a slice. So do yourself and your tastebuds a favor and hit it up.
author: Nathan L.

description: Great for everything but the pizza, good for the pizza. I love the fact that they are constantly open late, they serve a nice variety of beers, and the wait staff actually has personality. Feels like a pizza joint you would find in a 1990's action movies based in Chicago. If you enjoy the thicker crust, squared kind of pizza, then you will probably love the pizza also. I don't, but I still scarfed that bad boy down no problem (pepperoni). I will be back for some late-night pizza, and I look forward to trying some of the quirkier variety's.
author: Eric W.

description:
smells good
looks good
so it must taste good, right?

exactly. 

pizza is a little greasy for me, but when your drunk, all pizza taste the same! I never understood why people cut pizza into rectangular shapes though :/
CASH ONLY!
author: Philip M.

description:
Have been meaning to try this place for years and finally did. 
Let me just say if you love focaccia bread you will really dig this great pizza !
I grew up eating focaccia so golden boys little crust rocks !
The place is tiny so go on off hours lol not that this is possible as we were there at 1:30 and with in 10 min it was full. 
I had pepperoni also a slice of combo.
I recommend either one !
Try this cool little place.
author: Chuck S.

description: Good stuff.. typically  don't like thick Pizza but this was bomb.. Had the Clam and a sasuge.
author: A.j. C.

description:
short and simple: COMBINATION PIZZA! YOU MUST TRY! For the fans of amazing, warm, hearty, generously topped pizza. For fans of food in general, this is top notch pizza. I love that the slices are square!! :D :D With other pizzas, I feel like some bites are subpar because of lack of toppings or uneven distribution of sauce/cheese, but this is not the case at Golden Boy!! Every bite is spectacular, no joke. 
A visit to North Beath without consuming a slice from Golden Boy Pizza is just all kinds of injustice all around.

perfect flavors, amazing sauce, perfectly crunchy crust accompanies a delightfully fluffy pizza (not thin crust). Everything about the sum of these ingredients makes this pizza a huge win for any time of day, drunk or sober. 
 The line moves fast, if you are greeted with a line, do not be discouraged!!
author: Tuwie N.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is pretty damn good.  And I'm pretty much referring to all their slices: cheese, pepperoni, veggie, and their ever-so-popular clam and garlic.  But believe it or not, I actually think their pepperoni slice trumps over all the others.  The sauce and very sweet and tangy and the pepperoni wasn't too spicy.  It's a personal preference but I love it!  Just look at these slices and salivate (http://bit.ly/SyJK6e). They're in line as one of my favorite pizza-by-the-slice joints and I love how they're made Sicilian Style.  If you're ever in North Beach, go off tangent from Columbus and check out their location on Green St.  Their pizza slices make for a great snack or even just a meal themselves.  You won't be disappointed!
author: Rodney H.

description: I always appreciate a place that keeps it simple and sticks with what works.  Slices are excellent
author: Stuart K.

description: Tybg. Blessed to have such deliciousness. Thank you for the love. Clam pizza. Extreme pizza. Great pizza. You have saved us with your lovely
author: Bradley C.

description: New York Style pizza with a thick yet light crust. Stellar pies here! Came to this spot two days in a row. Brief walk from Loews Regency Hotel. I got there at 11:25am, and was the 5th person in line before they had even opened! Expect a line anytime of the day. CASH ONLY
author: Kirk B.

description: Really good pizzas and reasonable price. There is always a line unfortunately which proves it's a good pizzas spot. My favorite was Combo. Cash only.
author: Ilona N.

description: This place had awesome pizza and the place welcomed us to San Francisco. We had pizza in our hand and were walking the streets late at night making our first nite here pretty darn cool. The pizza slices are kept near the window and if you wanted an entire box of pizza (because they were boxed shaped) you can choose which ones would go in your box to take home. It catered to people's wants. Downfall is they only accept cash.
author: Melanie L.

description: Sweet late night pizza spot in North Beach. It's fun seeing the fresh squares come out in the window...not so fun when there's a huge line though. If you're looking for your food fix around bar closing time at 2am, then be ready for the wait. If you get there around 1am, you won't find much of a line.  Either way, I think the wait is worth it. Their pizza is made on focaccia bread so you really can't go wrong there. The crust was delicious, fluffy, thick, crispy on the outside soft on the inside. I had the veggie pesto slice and it was pretty large all for $4; the pesto sauce on that pie is deeeelish. The guy taking orders at the counter was friendly and efficient which I appreciated because it can tough dealing with the late night rowdy crowd! I knocked a star off because I think they're a bit heavy handed with the cheese and I also wasn't a huge fan on the interior. It's a tight squeeze in there and there isn't much seating area except along the wall. I recommend grabbing it to go.
author: Renu A.

description: Seriously the best pizza we have come across in SF!! It's casual and they have the cheesiest  most delicious deep dish pizza I have ever had. Our waitress was amazing and always asked if we needed anything else. Mind you she was also the one serving and ringing up customers along with heating the pizza. She kept checking on my 4 year old and making sure we liked everything. Pizza was phenomenal!! Definitely will be coming back! The pizza melts in your mouth. I had the combo and veggie pizza. We also ordered the pepperoni and the cheese, my goodness I can't wait to come back!!! Try this place out. You will not be disappointed. It's a very casual bar type place but it's delicious!!!  Also read the board with their menu. It's funny with hidden messages.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Best Sicilian Style Pizza period. Sweet friendly staff here also ~ would recommend this place to anyone visiting SF！
author: Roy O.

description: Not your typical slice of pizza pie, it's a square crustless pizza slice. It's absolutely delicious though!! I tried the vegetarian pesto and pepperoni and they both tasted great. My meat loving husband even liked the pesto
author: Lindsay L.

description:
I've been here once - cruised by around 1am after an evening of drinking and went "Doh!" after seeing a line outside.  Well, we already made the trek out there and we were hungry, so we opted to stand in line.  We stood about 30 minutes in line; I think we were considered "lucky" - by the time we got our pizza, the line was at least double what it was when we first got there.  At least we got some extra entertainment waiting in line by watching those that were obviously a little too intoxicated - one girl somehow toppled over the homeless guy's guitar case and broke it.  Her BF proceeded to pay him off with some "herbs" from a sandwich baggie.  Only in SF I suppose.

Gal took our order from the walk-up window; we ordered our pizza by the slices.  These are square, sicilian style slices of pizza - just the right amount of thickness.  They'll grab your slices and toss it into the oven for a nice reheat.  There were about 4 or 5 selections to choose from - combo, cheese, pepperoni, and clam.  We didn't have enough clam to go around, so I took a slice of combo.  It's good pizza - tasty and it was fresh.  Just the right amount of crunch on the crust and not overly greasy.  The cheese was good and wasn't heavy.  

Roughly $4/slice.  I'm a small/medium eater and one slice was perfect for me.

Overall, I'll definitely come back (but hope there aren't lines next time).
author: Laura C.

description: Quite possibly the best pizza ever, at least on the West Coast! I have flown and driven 3,000 miles more than once for a slice if this amazing pizza. YES, it's that good! The Clam pizza is amazing! As is the combo. Hell any way you slice it, this is amazing pizza. Don't forget to pop in next store to Gino and Carlo for a beverage while your at it! North Beach's best kept secrets? Mayyybe!
author: Kelley S.

description: One of the best cheap eats in No Beach...and open late for those who need something to soak up their alcohol! :D
author: Mitzi A.

description: I took advantage that I was in San Francisco for the Outside Lands festival and decided to check this place out. Parking sucks but it's SF so it was expected. The line was long but moved faster than I expected. We waited in line for about 25-30 minutes but it was totally worth it. The pizza was sooo good! It's a small place with great service and a great vibe.
author: Patty R.

description:
My FAVORITE late night pizza place. Sometimes a line. But worth the wait!!

Pepperoni is our favorite. Recommend getting extra to take home for later.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Divey, small and super cool. Very good pizza at reasonable prices. Beer on draft with a few in bottles.  The clam pizza is awesome. If you're up in North Beach definitely worth jogging over one block and hitting the spot especially if you've been drinking
author: Aaron W.

description:
OH BOY, WHERE DO I START?!

AMAZEBALLS. Worth the drive form the East Bay. 

Hands down, my favorite Pizza spot in SF. 

If you're looking for a toasty, full-bodied slice of pizza; Golden Boy targets the spot. 

They turn pizza back into what pizza is meant to be; classic, flavorful, and satisfying. The texture is incompatible; gooey-cheese and toasted to perfection. The toppings, cheese and crust all work in perfect unison, not one over-powering the other. 

I love their Combination, Pepperoni, Vegetarian, and Clam/Garlic. 

Golden boy leaves me with the feeling of 'that was a well-worth chubby pizza eat' :D

My tummy just grumbled finishing up this review... :P''''''''
author: Chantal P.

description: Garlic and clam slice is every bit as good as you've heard or read about. Plus it's a cool place, with like a 70's punk rock vibe to it. Enjoy
author: Nick U.

description:
Vibe: Hip. 
The restaurant walls are coated with thousands of stickers and tags. Even the bathroom walls are. Love it.

Food: Bomb diggity. For you thick crust lovers, this is your home. 
Super cheesy but not in an overwhelming way, and no taste buds will be screaming "too much sauce!" In other words, the near-perfect combination of everything (I say 'near' because I recently had New York pizza...sorry.) 
As for the toppings, I actually like the combo more than the famous clam and garlic piece, so it is all personal preference. 

Service: Cash only, so watch out! 
Nothing else to complain about though. You'll have a good experience.

Would I come back? I already do, quite often!
author: Michelle Y.

description: It was good, but nothing special. I think part of it has to do with them always keeping a line out the door due to how small the place is. It's a good place to grab something and go, but I'd recommend trying out Tony's down the street if you have the time to sit down with a group.
author: Joshua W.

description: Omg I grew up eating these pizza.. Jus lived up 2 blocks from there.. And used to be like $1.50 a slice..need to go back some day n piggy out..
author: Crisy G.

description:
I'm torn between 5 and 4 stars.. Gonna go 5 because my favorite type of pizza is the greasy, orange-ish top, fol in half and eat NY-style slice.  But this being the "cheeseboard" type pizza, square but not quite sicilian pizza, was excellent.  Very crunchy crust, and excellent ingredients used to make delicious pizzas.  This is great by the slice but would be even better if I was having a party or had a large group and got a whole pie.  I could devour this stuff without thinking twice.

Loved the sit at the bar and have a soda or beer while the bar/pizza tender is behind the counter ambiance.. and I loved the decor and the whole feel of the place.  Also loved the huge sacks of flour next to the giant flour mixer.. Good to know they make their own dough!

A+ - Great location too (in the heart of North Beach but not on the main drag)
author: Robert K.

description:
Think bar scene meets family pizza joint without the families. 
Price - can order pizza by the slice for a reasonable price. They had all kinds of pizza ready to go.
Food - pizza was really good, not high end and not really fresh unless you arrive at the time they take out the pizza out of the oven. 
Seating - no seating had to walk a few blocks to find some steps to sit on. 
Atmosphere - pretty cool if you're into that bar like feel, not for families! 
Overall - definite must stop for any one visiting San Fran. Offers a quick grab and go to enjoy the scenery.
author: Ernesto M.

description: I like to go there with my buddies and drink some beers! Also if you like big crust, that's the best takeaway pizza you can find at night in North Beach!
author: Mathieu F.

description:
I came here with my buddy this week before going to the bar down the street.  The pizzas are displayed in the window so you know what it looks like before you order it.  

The girl at the counter was nice and kept the line moving pretty quick.  

I ordered the garlic clam and the combo and my buddy ordered the veggie pizza.  The combo and garlic clam pizzas were awesome.  I like the crust that they use and the combo had the perfect ratio of meat, cheese, crispy crust and sauce.  The veggie was ok, but I'm not a big fan of vegetarian anything.

I like the decor, the price, the service, and especially the food.

Definitely would recommend this place to my friends.
author: Richard T.

description: This pizza is the shiznitt!   We were passing by and someone mentioned the line out the door being worth it for the best pizza in town... Said it was the shiznitt.. He was right!  Awesome square slices.
author: Dave A.

description:
This is god tier pizza. 10/10. Still tastes amazing since my last visit in January.

Cash only though, which is a bummer.
author: Robert G.

description:
For a late-night place, they make pretty good pizza. Definitely a popular spot late at night, especially for really inebriated folks. The wait was not too bad, but of course the lines are usually out the door, and waiting outside could be a little cold.

I had the combination pizza, which had almost all the basic ingredients one usually eats with pizza. It was warmed up immediately, and it was good. Definitely better than delivery pizza.

Remember, CASH ONLY!
author: Kelley L.

description:
One of my favorite pizza place in SF given that I don't prefer to eat pizza at all (though they are very tasty).

Not your typical hold in the wall pizza shop. They charge $4 a piece and their pizzas are amazing. Very crusty crust, not terribly thin or thick. Decent amount of cheese and very fresh ingredient. I like the pepperoni with veggie the most. After putting on red pepper flake and cheese, the pizza tastes sooooo good.

Will limit myself to come back once a month to protect my artilieries.
author: Ruxin H.

description: Best pizza in North Beach! It's just what you would want from a whole in the wall pizza joint- greasy, cheesy, deliciousness fast! The place is small so better to take food togo if you have that option.
author: Ashley N.

description:
I'm from the LA area and I can't seem to find a pizza place as great as Golden Boy's.  Every time I visit SF and we walk through North Beach, there's always a huge line coming out of Golden Boy Pizza.  I'm always too hungry to wait in line for food; but, this time we finally decided to give this place a try line or no line. 

There are 6 pizza options at a time all lined up in the front window under a dull red light like hookers in the red light district.  The pizza's probably a lot cheaper, cleaner and a lot more delicious.  There was a selection of the classic pepperoni, sausage, cheese, combination, vegetarian and a one of a kind garlic and clam pizza.  Clam!?!  I decided that I gots to get myself one of thems.  Just in case, we got a sausage combination for backup.  Each slice is toasted right before going out which gives the crust a delicious crunch.  Mmmm I'm gonna go ahead and say, hands down, best crust I've ever had!  Toppings were super fresh too.

Note: those who like thin crusts will not like this place.
author: Anh L.

description:
Pizza - not bad
Ambiance - kick-ass
author: Josh W.

description: Cool place, good music. Grab a beer and late nite slice. Great idea but I thought the pizza is very ok. Not sure I'd return. Got the 3 stars for the atmosphere. I give the pizza a 2.
author: Todd H.

description:
CHEESE PIZZA!!! So good!!! My friends and I agreed this was the yummiest so far. It had tomato sauce inside the crust and of course lots of cheese (I LOVE CHEESE!).

Went here around 2:00am and it still had a super long line! Interesting place to go people watching...LOL.  We had the pesto pizza and the other one had everything in it. It was worth the walk from our hotel. Miss this place already! Will definitely come back here when I go back to SF.
author: Patricia L.

description: I'm a big fan of pizza so when I saw the Yelp reviews after going to Coit tower, I had to check it out! I had the combo and it was delicious. I really liked the vibe of the place and the employees were friendly too!
author: Ashley S.

description: My favorite spot for pizza and a beer on a bar stool in North Beach. The Vegetarian Pesto and Garlic Clam are consistently super tasty, topped with gooey cheese goodness served in a fat, square slice. Loud music, local flavor, and open late!
author: Lisa M.

description:
The place is punk rock all the way if that's the sort of thing you like (stuff all over the walls, dirty bathrooms, the kind of thing that seems cool when you're a kid and that you avoid as an adult). 

The pizza was just okay. It wasn't bad but not mind blowing. Again, sixteen year old me would have loved this place and drunk, stumbling me would probably visit it again. (He's not that discerning.)
author: Alex M.

description:
Unfortunately we came late afternoon when the pizzas had been sitting around for a LONG while. It took quite the effort just to seperate the slices apart from the pie.

They reheat it for you in the oven.

The Veggie slice was very tasty, while the Garlic/Clam was only alright since the toppings were really dried up. The Garlic DOES kick in later! The sodium kicked in later as well as I was drinking water like crazy.

At $3.75/slice - very filling/satisfying. It was A-OK, just not 5 stars. 

Perhaps it's better when you are drunk or have slices that are fresher.
author: Peter L.

description: This place is legit. Best pizza I've had in SF. The slices are loaded with super fresh toppings. The customer service is great and there are tons of beer on tap. Golden Boy will definitely be the go to pizza joint when we're in the area.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Yummy delish pizza slice $3.75 4for $15
Best combo pizza EVER! Late night snack after a night of bar crawling. goodtimes and goodeating.
author: Linda B.

description: Golden Boy is one of the best pizza joints in the city! Good food good service. Always make it a point to stop by whenever I'm on that side of town.
author: Arturo X.

description: First time I tried golden boy was a year ago before moving to San Francisco. By far one of the best pizzas I've had! Definitely recommend checking it out. Line does get a bit  long on weekends but worth the wait. There will always be pizza spots better than the next but why not just give them all a try.
author: Ana L.

description:
