Pizza on focaccia bread! Came here for a quick dinner after the Chinese New Year's parade. I ordered the combo (because you can't go wrong with that) and my slice was delicious. The ingredients were fresh and it was just an added bonus that all of the toppings laid on focaccia bread.

I also tried my friend's garlic clam and while the pizza was bursting with flavor, I think I may get tired of the pungent flavor throughout the whole slice (if that makes sense). 

At $3.25-$3.75 per slice, definitely affordable and will fill you up. They're also opened late til 2AM but I have heard that the line can get pretty long, especially since the restaurant isn't very big. 

Definitely one of the best pizza experiences I've ever had. I've never been big on pizza but this place makes me crave THEIR pizza.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Ohhhh golden boy. I have a deep love-hate relationship with myself when it comes to this place. Love, because it is delicious. Hate, because it is usually my fourth (and more unnecessary) meal of the day. Best late night snack in the entire city! 

The crust is thick, the sauce is tasty and its always served hot! Love the veggie and the combo. Service is great, I condone all of the people who work there for the late night crowd... that is never easy to deal with. There is almost always a line but it moves really fast. They have a bunch of different flavors so just peak in the window to see what delicious piece you want! 

Columbus Cafe next door will usually let you bring your slices in with you as well which is nice. If  you spend more than a few hours drinking there you are most likely going to notice those sweet sweet aromas of golden boy creeping through the front door... you cannot resist. Basically if you are in North Beach, you must go to Golden Boy. No need to wait an hour for a sit-down fancy shmancy pizza when you can get this on the go!
author: Mandy A.

description: My favorite pizza in the city.  Try to go during non peak times otherwise prepare to stand in line...it's worth the wait though.
author: Kris F.

description: Wow what a great experience.  There was a line but it moved quickly and we were rewarded with some of the best pizza I've had in years.  Great toppings & a magical crust proved to be a excellent combination. Plus they have a great selection of ice cold beer. A top spot to try
author: Greg F.

description:
If 

1) I am in San Francisco 
and 
2) I am going to eat pizza

Then I am going to eat at Golden Boy Pizza
author: Joe W.

description: Best pizza hands down!! We literally drive and 1 1/2 only for this. One slice is very big and the price is great.
author: Grace M.

description: Bomb pizza, great craft beer selection, great price, chill spot... what more can you ask for?? Quit deciding which pizza shop to go to and come here before you regret not doing it! Sorry I ate my pizza before I decided to post this.
author: Desmond P.

description: Delicious pizza and great service. Wish there was one back home(LA). We had the pep and it was sooo good! Cash only! A must go if you are in San Francisco.
author: Ingrid P.

description: This place is heaven. A warm comfy atmosphere with punk music playing in the background. Except for the line. Every time I take a bite out of the pepperoni or cheese square, I am lifted onto the softest cloud. Though it's pipping hot, I am sure to take beer sips in between to ensure the experience and pleasure from the Golden Boy. 10/10 perfect for dates or by your cheap-seeking beer drinker self
author: Laurie M.

description: Yum!!!! Had the garlic clam & combo (I think that's what it's called). Will come back next time I visit.
author: Celly B.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE!!

Usually only go for thin crust pizza, but golden boy's crust is AMAZINGGG.

If you come here after drankin around the hood, there will be a line.  Oh and TRUST, if you try to cut me in this line at 2:05am, you will get laid out. Alternatively, if you let me cut you, you will get a hug.
author: Josie A.

description:
One word describes this pizza: Edible.

The high ratings and the praise for this pizza are incredibly surprising. A friend suggested it and convinced me to make the trek to try "the most amazing pizza". Obviously, I can't pass up an opportunity to try the most amazing anything, so I decided to give it a try. The line was out the door and decently long, so the first thought that came to mind was "it must be great. why else would people wait on such a long line".

After a long wait, I was finally able to try "the most amazing pizza". I was really hungry so I ended up getting a plain slice and the pesto slice. I started with the plain slice and immediately I knew I had made a mistake. The pizza was incredibly plain and it seemed that Golden Boy had no concept of proper proportions. 90% of the pizza was this greasy, average bread. The rest consisted of a drop of sauce and a layer of hard, flaky cheese. The pesto slice was more or less the same, a greasy unappetizing mess.

This is easily the worst pizza I have ever paid money to consume. The pizza served in primary school cafeterias is better. Oven pizza you buy at Walgreens is better. Dominoes and Papa Johns are on a completely different level. I would eat this pizza if I needed it to survive, but otherwise... no thank you. I give it two stars simply because I didn't die after eating it. It was not an enjoyable experience.
author: Dan K.

description: Oh boy, that was good!!! Amazing pizza for an amazing price. One of the best I've ever tried and I tried a lot :)
author: Wojciech G.

description: This was the first pizza place my boyfriend and I tried the first day in San Fran..... It was the BOMB !!!!! MUST GOOO!!!
author: Ashley C.

description:
CASH ONLY.  I went to Golden Boy Pizza when I was in North Beach Sat 9/25/10.  It's a dive, but I like their pizza.

They have ready made pizza and if you just want a slice they just heat it up for you.

I got a Vegetarian slice for $3.75.  The guy heated it up for me and I paid for it and walked across the street & ate on the curb.

It was YUMMY!  Pretty good size, square, lots of cheese, olives, mushrooms.  I should have gotten the Clam Garlic $3.75 for the same price.  

Recommended.
author: Ann L.

description: Go for their pepperoni sausage pizza!!!!! You can order both outside and inside the palor. It's a hole in a wall so seating is very limited.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Awesome slice house
If I lived in the city, I would love to get a whole pie from here 
But for now, it will have to be my North Beach go-to square slice - can't beat it
author: Sam A.

description:
CASH ONLY! But know it's worth every penny of that hard earned green. The service is quick but they won't make a fuss. Just be ready to ask any questions when it's your turn. The pizza is by far one of the best I've had in a loooooooong time. Hard to find a solid deep dish and I've been searching ever since Chicago. To be entirely honest we had gone to Tony's first, but after their hostess basically shoo'd us away because they were closing in an hour we came here. BEST DECISION EVER. 

Don't miss out and get your ass over for a slice!
author: David G.

description: First time coming here , I have to say the place is something special. The pizza is really GOOD!! I mean delicious!!! The crust is just made right . Once you bite the pizza it's so crunchy . The staff is really friendly and I love the environment . I will def be back again . I highly recommend this place if looking for excellent pizza in the city .
author: Andres J.

description: Wow! Happen to yelp,pizza and was led to this super cool spot! We are from Los Angeles so automatically we have an opinion on how pizza should taste. Well this place is added to our list of "must have pizza" while in San Fran! Pizza is delicious, staff is super friendly and helpful and the environment is cool! We will be coming back for a slice as soon as we plan another trip to San Fran!
author: Merissa O.

description: I am so lucky to work just around the corner from this place and have decided it is time for me to leave a review! =) Today I stopped by here again for my lunch break and got a slice of the combo (zucchini, pepperoni, sausage, onions, and tomato) for $4. I really appreciate how they toast and warm up your pizza slice for a few minutes every single time before giving it to you. Anyways the pizza slices here come in squares and they are all really good! I usually get the clam & garlic but decided on the combo today. Didn't dissappoint! =) Oh and just a heads up but they only take cash here but there is a BoA, Wells Fargo, and Citibank super close by!
author: Mary C.

description:
This place was suggested by my buddy. It was an interesting punk pizza parlor. The pizza was cheap and really good. I went with the Clam and garlic, as suggested by the server. It wasn't bad. Not as flavorful as I expected, but then again, do clams really have much flavor? They taste like whatever sauce they're in, just a bit saltier and chewier. Anyway, it was good. My friend got some sort of multi-veggie slice, which was great - full of flavor. Thumbs up to free refills of soda.
And the pizza server was really pretty cool. It's actually unbelievable how cheap it was!
author: Corey L.

description: Pizza on focaccia bread needs to be the next food trend. Located in North Beach this place is the best for drunchies. It is a weird form of torture looking at the pizza through the front window as you wait in the loooong line. We got there about 2AM and the line was pretty long and took us about 20-25 minutes to get our slices- it was definitely worth the wait though! It's cash only and price per slice ranges from $3-$4. The staff is super friendly and calm considering the constant rush of people at that hour. I wish the place was bigger inside as it was pretty cramped and stuffy. It's probably a good thing that I don't live closer to this place or else I would be here ALL the time.
author: Prianka K.

description: Awesome pizza! Loved the crust, and the fact that you can see employees making the pizza! I had the classic cheese square and it was really good!
author: Marine S.

description: The line wasnt that long and there was sitting inside. I wasnt even drunk and the pizza was AMAZING got the clam one and cheese slice.. ate them both with the crust and all (i know im a fatty). I was super full after.
author: Hanlly S.

description:
We'd heard that Golden Boy was the place to go for pizza.  Especially after a few refreshing beverages.  That seemed to be exactly the case as we walked up to the last two pieces being sold for the night...to the people 5 people ahead of us.

I don't think I had seen a pizza place that has been sold out before so we vowed to come back another night.  Skip to Saturday night.  We walked up to a huge line and our mouths started watering.  This place must be awesome!  About 30 minutes and several new friends later, we had some pizza.

I opted for the sausage slice.  I don't know if it was amazing, more like pretty good.  Kind of reminded me of my old school cafeteria's pizza.  This is not an insult, by the way, I liked that stuff.  I can tell you, though, that it served its intended purpose very well.  It satisfied my late night craving, kept me from a terrible hangover and left me full up until about noon the next day. (and I'm not an "I'm full from the veggies and hummus" type of gal)

So I guess I would go back the next time I decide to hit up every bar I can find but I probably wouldn't wait in line just to have some pizza.
author: Andrea H.

description: Best focaccia /Sicilian style pizza we've ever had! Coming from NY, you don't expect good pizza anywhere but this was the perfect choice and lives up to the recommendations! Cash only, hand made pizza, helpful staff, bar stool seating, line was out the door but moved fast and was definitely worth it !
author: Josephine L.

description: The line wasn't too bad, I think we waited like 30 minutes. We had pepperoni and sausage slices, none of which were that great. It was not bad, but I definitely would not wait in line for it again.
author: Sharlene H.

description: Little pizza dive with the most awesome pizza ever.  As long as all your looking for is a great slice of pizza you won't be disappointed.  Drink a beer and sit at the bar.
author: Dunia A.

description:
This pizza is awesome if you enjoy such food as:

-McDonalds
-Red Baron Frozen Pizzas
-Jack in the Box
-High School Cafeteria Food
-Food Found In The Trash
-Raw Uncooked Dough
-Country Waffles
-Taco Bell Left Out All Night
-Canned Seafood
-Pesto From China
-Brown Cardboard Boxes


Also, if you absolutely hate tomato sauce and despise cheese on your pizza, this is the place for you! CASH ONLY FOLKS! Get there early and prepare to wait in a long line of people with similar culinary tastes of those listed above! You can share cooking tips for your next meal of Hot Pockets!
author: Jacob W.

description: Hits the spot for your late night craving if you are in North Beach. Good crust and toppings. Each bite is full of flavor.
author: Kenneth Z.

description:
Love love the no frills artisan pizza to go. You line up and order at the counter whether eat in or take out. 
Simple but great selection. The board behind the counter reads " If you  don't  see it, don't ask for  it " .... witty. 
If you see the clam wh garlic then you must ask for that. It's the best in the house I think. Even better if you  eat fresh from the oven. Probably the best slice of pizza you can ask for. 
The vegetable slice is good that you can taste the fresh vegetables.. excellent alternative to the  cheesy pepperoni. 
Did I mention how the cheesy abundance that makes the pizza exceptional. Then complimented by the crispy yet fluffy crust. 
At 10pm on fri after a hard week at work, the fresh from oven clam garlic pizza taste like the beginning of a great weekend. 
Have a great weekend
author: Nelle L.

description: Favorite pizza spot in the city! Clam and garlic is to die for. The perfect combination of flavor and crunch.
author: Alan L.

description: The idea of clam garlic pizza sounded like a great idea but it was not.... It was kind of gross! The combo slice was pretty good tho. I think these pizzas are also a little hard to hold too. Meh.
author: Oanh L.

description:
Holy hell. Great fucking pizza. 
I came in to grab legit pizza for the first time in a year since I was working in Korea and came to SF for vacation. I ordered the clam and garlic pizza slice.. for under $5. 
Put that stuff in my mouth and it was AMAZING.

It looks heavy because of the toppings and cheese... but the bottom is crisp and fluffy. it isn't heavy at all! It is so savory and delicious... def come by and grab a slice. COME!!!
author: Cacti B.

description:
Garlic clam pizza! Love the rectangular slice of pizza, toasted in the oven for a nice crispy crunch.  This place is cash only.
nice seating by the counter.  friendly service and they have beer options.
author: Linda T.

description: God bless this place for being open at 3am on NYE!  30 min line down the street and cash only but def helped with my hangover.   Delicious!
author: Clarissa C.

description: Delicious pizza! Crust can be a bit doughy, but flavors are fantastic. I've eaten here before and after a night out and both times were equally fantastic. Can't wait to return to Golden Boy Pizza!
author: Charlotte C.

description: Best best pizza I had so far! Love it every time I go. I love combo and clam&garlic those are the bomb! Its very different than other pizza I had before it's not too greasy nor the bread is heavy.
author: Sunflower C.

description:
This was the most delicious pizza I have had in the City so far! Its thick crust and crisped to perfection. The simple slice of cheese pizza has really great flavor and is so scrumptious! 

Definitely coming back here over and over again!
author: Aditi U.

description: Great Sicilian pizza! Good beer! Funky atmosphere. What more can you ask for! Psychedelic bathroom.
author: Alfred S.

description: This was a 5 star experience. The pizza was amazing! Definitely hit the spot. 420 approved
author: Raul F.

description:
Sometimes i day dream about this pizza because it was so delicious. It was really crowded when i went but just getting a slice to go took no time at all. I love places like this because you walk up and have plentiful options to choose from.  They have an amazing veggie pizza and the slices are freshly heated up.

There aren't  many places to sit but its good enough to eat on the go. You know a place is good when people are willing to stand outside eating the food.

I recommend this place with some beers with friends!
author: Kathleen D.

description: Stopped in for a quick slice and it was Ah-mazing!!!  If I'm ever in San Francisco, will definitely be back.
author: Miki O.

description:
This is the BEST late night or anytime pizza you can get in the city! It's fluffy, filling, flavorful, cheesy, and completely satisfying! It's not very pricey either. 

Late at night (I mean like 2 am late) there's no indoor seating and they just take orders from the window. My friends and I were happy to just stand outside and  chat while we enjoyed our yummy slices of pizza. 

When there is inside seating it's a great place to just chill, have great pizza with friends, and drink a couple beers. 

I highly recomend you check this place out to just chill with you buddies whether it's at the start of or after an epic night.
author: Marisol R.

description:
This was okay - pizzas served in sliced square pieces rather than from the usual round pizzas.  The flavor was okay and there was decent variety in terms of what kind of pizza you could order (cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, etc.).
 
The people who seem to really love this place are the ones who are enjoying an evening of partying.  If you're not partying, I'm not sure how much you'd love this pizza.  If you happen to be in the area and there's no line, it's worth trying out...I'm not sure if it's really a destination.
 
The unique thing about this place is that the pizzas are served on focaccia bread, which does give a nice richness to the dough portion of the pizza and interesting flavor.
author: Ken G.

description:
Generally, I'm not that into Sicilian style pizza.

I'm on the side of the pizza spectrum that believes good pizza should be thin, slightly crisp and be able to be folded for optimal consumption.

But good thing there always seems to be a good exception out there worth trying. Golden Boy pizza is one of them.

The pizza crust is a little dense with a nice crisp (almost like a fried bread). Unlike your typical California crust where you're not really looking forward to the edge without any toppings, I myself found those parts untouched by sauce or cheese to be my favorite parts. Not to say that the toppings were bad... they were certainly tasty and done in good proportion, but at the same time nothing to write home about 

A lot of other reviewers share the same sentiment in that this place is perhaps a savior when it comes to a night of drinking in North Beach. I'm sure plenty of hangovers were staved off by their greasy and delicious concoction. When you're kind of winding down and feeling like you've maybe had one too many, this place will hit the spot. Especially, when it comes to you piping hot with the fork and knife, you know it's go time.

Probably one of my favorite slices in SF (and in case you were wondering, all indications seem to say that this place is in no way affiliated with, endorsed or sponsored by Oscar De La Hoya).
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
This is a completely sober review. From my understanding, Golden Boy is a prime drunchies spot, but my friend has crowned it her favorite pizza of all time, so we came for a lucid dinner. The store front is next to Chubby Noodle and is quite small.

Golden Boy serves satisfying foccacia bread pizza. It's "baked-to-order," which means they reheat the slices in an oven for a fresh, quick aroma. I got a slice of the garlic and crab ($4) and my friend got her favorite, the combination. The breading is fluffy and soft ("Just like Pizza Hut!" in my friends' words. I'm not going to put myself on record that Pizza Hut is quality pizza, but there is admittedly something about that dough...). The garlic can be a bit overwhelming if you had more than one slice, but I thoroughly enjoyed this affordable dinner. One slice is enough if you are looking for a light meal.

For to go orders, boxes only come free if you order over 3 slices, but they will wrap up the slices in foil and a paper bag. Cash only!
author: Jessica F.

description: Awesome one slicers!  Pepperoni pizza was fresh out of the oven served on paper plates from the market.  The women behind the counter we attentive and happy to see customers.  This is a place to stop in for a quick bite.  The seating is a little awkward and the bathroom looks like it came out of a horror movie.  But all-in-all, the pizza is very good and worthwhile.
author: Ru S.

description: This is the BEST pizza I have ever had!!! OMG talk about GOOD!!!! Where have u been all my life!! So we were at Little Italy San Francisco and we wanted either pizza or pasta :). We ran into this place and immediately saw the pizza on the window and decided to try it, omg best pizza ever!! And the other best thing is that it's sold by the slice so you don't have to order the entire pizza pie, only what u want to eat. The ladies at the register are so friendly, very friendly.
author: Rosa R.

description: The clam and garlic pizza is a religious experience. Nice people. Very affordable. Best pizza in North Beach. Hours vary but always open until at least 11pm.
author: Jack P.

description: This place has the best pizza in norcal.so many fans can't be wrong. If your an east coast  transplant you will be suprised pleasantly as I am every time I get to this hole in the hills of sf. you can breeze in on a weeknight but weekends expect its standing room only.
author: James C.

description: Came here to try the pizza because of high reviews, service was extremely disappointing, we originally ordered to go but the pizza slices were smelling pretty appetizing so we decided to sit down and tried it out there but when asked for a plate and utensils (as we noticed other patrons have plates and utensils to eat their pizza), main server dude completely ignored our request and gave us no plate or utensils. Our hands were a bit dirty and we would appreciate some utensils to eat. What's sad the guy even argued and lied to my sister that he gave us plate and utensil. Overall experienced ruin, will not be back.
author: Philip H.

description:
If you don't mind your pizza squared and your wine options simply red or white - this is a place for you.  A slice of cheese and 2 glasses of red wine - served in small juice glasses will set you back $11.  To put that in perspective, right before stopping at Golden Boy I had a cocktail for the same price (and thought that wasn't a bad deal)!  

The atmosphere is unique - closest to a dive bar, the crowd was a good mix.  There was a UFC fight on the sole TV and a guy shredding block after block of cheese in the back.  There are stickers all over the walls and a good number of stools along the bar and the wall behind the bar.  You got all your usual pizza accompaniments such as parmesan cheese, oregano, garlic, and red pepper. 

This isn't the kind of place I would hang out in for a while - it's more the grab a drink, eat your fill of pizza, and get out kind of place, but that was part of its charm.  I am definitely a fan.
author: Marilyn C.

description: We're from NY and must say the pizza here is delish!!! Had the combo with meat and veggies and the garlic clam. Both were oozing with cheese and the crust was just perfect!!! Would def recommend for a pizza fix. The line was pretty short on a Sunday night and we got seating inside.
author: Tanji K.

description:
A friend brought me here when I was visiting SF a while back.  It's not a huge space.  Sort of like a bar that most people eat at with a few tables around.  I had been craving pizza so on her recommendation we came and Golden Boy did not disappoint.  The pizza was served in squares which were a fair size.  The crust was pretty thick if I remember correctly, and the sauce was perfect tasting.  Maybe a little too conservatively poured for my tastes but still it was good.  It was so good I ordered a second slice! 

It's also in a nice neighborhood for those who were visiting like me.  Beautiful view of the bay not too far from there and a nice park nearby perfect for people watching or taking your dog out!!!
author: Fabian A.

description: Pizza that will never be available in Los Angeles. And that makes me so sad. I highly recommend the combo. And that's all I have to say about that.
author: Rachel M.

description: Slices are really big!! I recommend getting one per person and more if you're hungry later. It's pretty much a piece of dough with very little toppings.
author: Anna F.

description: Everything is amazing at Golden Boy Pizza.  The sauce is off the hook.  My husband craves it all the time!  Thanks for great pizza and great service!
author: Susie G.

description: Soggiest Sicilian pizza I have ever had. It takes credit for the taste of cheese; no other flavors. Rip this slice.
author: Jeffrey T M.

description:
This was on the Foodie food tour and it was our last stop.

After a full day of eating, we were all given a choice of any 1 slice of pizza. I had the... gosh I dont remember the name but it had everything on it. There was just about every veggie you could imagine, also very cheesy. mmm

I will be honest I am not the biggest fan of pizza, unless I make my homemade pizza, with everything homemade. Well I must say, I actually enjoyed this pizza. I would maybe like the dough to be a little softer... maybe I was just too full at the point when I was eating the pizza.

The place was packed, we barely found a stool to sit on. There was a lot of people standing in the back. If you are planning a visit, I would maybe take it to go, expect to get very friendly with strangers.
author: Nataliya A.

description:
Great place if you don't want a complete lunch, but want a satisfying hot slice of pizza.

The garlic and clam was yummy.
author: Bradley C.

description: One of my favorite pizza places in the city !!! So good !!!! I can probably eat like 5 or 6 slices at once !!! Check this place out, you won't get disappointed!!!
author: Zoya M.

description: Despite the creepy name, this place has amazing food.  Some of the best drunk late night food you can scarf down in the city.
author: Kris B.

description:
Now the official pizza of KOFY's Creepy KOFY Movie Time, these slices were a new and wonderful addition to the already-fun taping experience. Imagine our joy when the boyfriend and I , along with the rest of the live audience, were treated to slices of cheese, veggie, or pepperoni during the lunch break.  Oh yeah!  
The veggie was the best thin-crust  veggie pizza I've had in quite some time.  
will definitely be visiting the storefront sometime.
author: Julie C.

description:
If you want a slice of Sicilian style pizza, you found the right place. The pesto vegetarian pizza is so good! 

Service was friendly. There is limited seating inside. 

Cash only.

Parking is on the street.
author: Cindy B.

description: No frill pizza by the slice place. My favorite is the garlic and clams ($4.00/slice), the crust is crunchy and thick enough so that it holds the toppings and doesn't turn soggy. Nothing better than a nice hot piece of pizza at night. There is a wait sometimes, but the line moves fast.
author: Kelly C.

description:
We originally wanted to go to a nice sit-down restaurant somewhere in North Beach, but right as we smelled and glanced at the deliciousness that was coming out of this tiny, dark, hole-in-the-wall, we couldn't refuse.

This no fuss kinda place served me possibly the best pizza I've ever had. Clams + garlic for the win! 

Worth the wait and totally worth the hype.
author: MyLinh P.

description: If you're hungry for a snack in North Beach, look no further. My favorite is the combo, but every slice is baked to perfection. Small local spot with divey interior, what's not to like? The pizza is heated up before it leaves the shop and one slice will do you in pretty good, but try them all regardless. Will be back when I'm in the area.
author: Wendie I.

description:
"Where It's Hip To Be Square"

Heard of this wonderous place, but never been. Then I was introduced to it through my GF and my pizza taste buds have changed forever. Everything about this place is unique. The restaurant's old timey diner like seating, ordering out of a side window, to the to go order area in the front. They serve beer on tap as well and you can never complain about that. The pizza really steals the show. The square shape uniqueness of the pizza slices are cool but past that the flavor of the pizza is awesome. No matter the kind you order you won't be let down. The crust is crunch yet soft. The slight buttery flavor in the crust us such a win. I've had it all from there. The cheese, vegetarian, crab, pepperoni, sausage... all are awesome! Try it out and you'll agree!

PS: CASH ONLY!
author: Jay V.

description:
I'm not much a pizza person, but this is some damn good pizza. The crust was crispy and every bite is filled with cheesy goodness.

Perfect place for late night munchies, but be prepared to wait in a long line along with other drunk and hungry kids.
author: Angela K.

description: Finally got a chance to drop in after being recommended from a few friends. Made it just in time as they were closing on a Tuesday. Got the combination, vegetarian pesto, and clam garlic. All were very good. Service was great. They have Italian sodas. Don't have ranch.
author: Suel S.

description: Dude this pizza is the best I've ever had.  But I like medium crust pizza. Not pan, not thin, but a decent thickness.  Awesome dough!  We had the pepperoni.  They put the pizza in an oven after ordering to crisp the bottom and "reheat" it.  It's sounds lame but trust me, it's served tasty and it comes out fresh!  I've never had such an awesome underneath bottom crisp like this before.  $3.95 a square (slice) and good cold $5 pint drafts.  Go there!
author: R. L.

description: Stopped by on our recent trip to San Francisco and I am a fan. We tried the combination, pesto and pep....so yummy! Paired it with some beer on tap and this girl was happy. Wanted to try the clam but Im saving that for our next trip! Not like I need an excuse to come back, this place is everything. Super cool chicks working the place, thanks for the hospitality.
author: Tracy G.

description: Wandered across this place while visiting San Fran. Pizza was great! Small place but fun hangout. Servers were fun to look at too!
author: Kim B.

description: Great pizza. Took my family and we all enjoyed the clam/Garlic pizza and the presto/vegetarian pizza. It's a small place but friendly. Parking on the street. If I'm in San Fransisco I'll definitely visit again.
author: Eid M.

description: The clam garlic pizza here is next-level ish. When I came on a Wednesday night there was a line out the door at 11PM. Cash only and there's beer available on draft to enjoy with your pizza.
author: Elissa S.

description: Good pie, good price, long lines. Well worth the wait. Who needs clam chowder when we can get good pizza.
author: Gus G.

description:
Small place, be prepared to queue(?). Well I had to anyway...

Pizza was worth it; very satisfying and friendly service. They only take cash, but there is an ATM inside.
author: Kira G.

description: Literally the best pizza I have ever had, hands down! Staff was super friendly and the interior was super groovy! Glad we decided to check it out! I might drive all the way the to city just to get pizza!! H
author: Jackie G.

description: Came here on a whim with a friend and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the pizza and the decor. It's a great place to catch up with an old friend over a few slices and a cold beer while listening to great music and being surrounded by a place that is truly it's own. The location is also great because it's in walking distance to a good number of Italian dessert places that are phenomenal! Definitely suggest coming here and trying the pesto veggie pizza - you'd be in for a treat!
author: Vicki W.

description: Not busy when we walked in for Valentine's Day. Tried clam and garlic plus the combo. Fast service, cold beer, and great flavor! Would definitely come back for more pizza. Not like anything else I've had in ever
author: Adriana R.

description:
Great pizza, limited variety, but fast and ready.
The only time they did not have a line up was when it was closed! But the service was fast and friendly. And the line up assured us that the food was fresh!
author: Wendy S.

description: It is a mediocre pizza place. The Place is not so clean either.  It is a very casual joint that you can just get a slice.  They only accept cash so be sure to have enough before you head over. Ppl work there are very nice. Customer service is much better than Tony's.
author: Eri F.

description:
Came here during halftime of the Niners vs Packers game because we were a few steps away at Columbus Cafe. Maybe my experience was not as great as everyone else's because there was a sudden rush for pizza during halftime and they were scrambling to get everyone taken care of.

I ordered the combination, and the price was right for the size. The crust, as everyone else mentions, was absolutely perfect, but the actual flavor of the pizza was just average. I didn't try this infamous clam one that everyone talks about, so maybe I need to give it another shot. Also, since there was this mad rush for pizza, I bet they had to compromise the quality just a bit to make sure they could keep the line down. So far my experience has been ok, but will give it another go.
author: Ada C.

description: Pretty damn good. Friendly service. Not crazy about sitting and eating in the restaurant (bar seating only), but taking the pizza to the park nearby makes for a lovely afternoon. Prices are fair.
author: Kat R.

description:
Not my favorite style of pizza but fun to try. 
Small eating area with bar stools and a small ledge to eat on. Would not be good for a large party. I ordered a square of each: pepperoni, sausage, and veggie. The sausage pizza was by far the best of my choices. 
I prefer the pizza at North Beach Pizza at Grant and Union.
author: DB Z.

description: One of the most delicious pizzas I've ever had. Golden boy is a well known late night favorite for the bar crowd but trust me, it's just as freakishly good during a sober afternoon. The place is small, all counters no tables. The service is exceptional considering the high volume of costumers, they are quick and friendly. Sit at the counter, order a beer and enjoy!
author: Maryam Z.

description: I like the light crust on focaccia bread and the easy square portions and the variety of toppings and a favorite for sure.... YUM!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Val L.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza, I commend you for not serving salad. I can get or make a salad anywhere but clam garlic pizza? That's something to go out of your way for. 

It's certainly nothing fancy, possibly even a bit grubby, but welcoming nonetheless. The joint has a small capacity and is covered in stickers and scribbles. I've come here a handful of times at night and ordered from the window that displays the tempting sheets of hearty foccacia-like pizza. If you want to sit there and eat, your options are limited to a stool at the bar. The alternatives are noshing curbside or taking it to go. It's an ideal spot for a late night bite to soak up the libations of the evening. 

If you're expecting some cutesy flat bread type of pizza with pretentious toppings, you have come to the wrong place. They serve a range of Sicilian style pies - plain cheese, pepperoni, sausage, vegetarian pesto, clam garlic, and the combo. Always a chewy crust, a generous amount of cheese, tasty sauces, and plentiful toppings. The thickness of the crust makes it really easy to eat without much of a mess or a landslide of cheese. 

Side note, if you're going to be kissing anyone, skip the clam garlic. No gum or mint will remedy the dragon breath. I'm dubious that anything but a good swish of listerine will do the trick. 

Bring cash money, a guilt free attitude, and aim for an extra crispy corner piece!
author: Ruby G.

description: Fast, Friendly and Cheap! We yelped this delicious place, and we weren't disappointed. There was a line of about 10 people or so out the door, the place is really small.. By the time we got to the front of the line, seats had opened up. So that was perfect. $4 slices! You can't beat that! $17 for 4 slices and a soda. Veggie Pesto, Pepperoni and Combo are all delicious! I will return to try the Pesto Clam!
author: Desiree H.

description: This place is awesome!!  I have been in the Bay Area along time and I'm sad I didn't stumble to this place before.  The pricing is great!  The service is fast!  But best of all the pizza is delicious!  And they have a BIG selection too.. To top it all off they have a lot of beer to choose from.  Highly recommended!
author: Cory F.

description: One of my favorite pizza places in SF. Cash only, and the square slices of pepperoni so hit the spot at 1am after drinking, or for dinner, or lunch, or a snack while walking around North Beach. I used to live right down the street so this was a weekly staple, and now I miss it so. Please put one in the Inner Sunset!
author: Tina W.

description: Best pizza in S.F. that I've had so far. Pepperoni, combo, clam and garlic are all excellent.
author: Rharrison79 ..

description: New favorite pizza, sober or not. We waited a long 20 minutes after a night in north beach, but the pizza was worth every minute of the wait. I tried the pesto vegetarian - originally thought I'd only eat half of it because of how large it was / my heavy dinner, but definitely finished the whole slice in minutes. Tons of toppings, light pesto flavors and the deep dish style was perfect - easy to pick up and eat as you make your way home!
author: Anu P.

description:
I was in town for a conference.
They wanted the serfs to wear name tags to dinner.
So I ran away.
Like a fucking direwolf.
I found this place.
I waited in line, I smelled the pizza in line, my eyes bulged at the pizza in the window as I waited in line.
I ordered.
I paid in cash.
The place is small and dark like an awesome pizza and beer cave.
The best part: you sit on stools next to total strangers that you talk to because like you, they are just as elated to be: 1) eating pizza, 2) drinking beer and 3) not wearing fucking name tags.
AHWoooooooooooo!
author: J S.

description: The whole experience in coming to this place is shit. No where to sit, and both waitresses had complete attitude. I had to ask four times for water, and got ignored every time. When the bitchy waitress finally acknowledged me, she filled my water cup 1/2 way and was rude to the max.  This place needs more staff, and preferably staff with common decency. I would never come back. The pizza was not even good....way tooooo much dough, and not authentic. Would not recommend this place, and get new staff :)
author: Paulia C.

description: This place is worth the uber ride from Bart! I had to try the famous clam and garlic pizza... it was pretty good but a little too salty. BEWARE: lots of garlic! The other pizzas were pretty tasty as well and the dough is amazing. I enjoyed the meal overall. The bathroom kinda smelled bad so I'm taking away one star and the mirror in it was covered in stickers too (which was annoying) and one of the staff member had a bit of an attitude. The vibe was pretty chill in the restaurant as a whole and the prices are GREAT. Thanks
author: Alpo P.

description:
I grew up in the North Beach neighborhood my whole life and Golden Boy Pizza has always been my go to pizza spot, so I'm pretty much a regular here. And hands down it's the best pizza I've ever had in SF. My favorite that I always go for is the combo, which is $4. A lot of people on yelp also rave about the clam and garlic slice as well, but I'm not a huge fan of it. 

The workers there would place your order in a small oven to heat it up a bit so that it is warm and tastier. I'd say their fresh pizza that comes straight out of the oven is even more delightful! The crust is warm and crispy while the cheese is still stringy and delicious. 

This place is also great for a midnight snack if you and your friends are out drinking around the area as well. The line gets pretty long after 12AM. I guess it's a good idea that they stay open until 2:30AM on Fridays and Saturdays!
author: Julia Y.

description:
Pesto vegetarian is so good, it makes me want to make out with my own mouth. 

Great music, lovely art and stickers (that have been there for over 15 years) on the wall, and cold beer on tap. 

One year I gave up Golden Boy pizza for Lent...longest 40 days of my life!
author: Louisa P.

description: This place is the best ever. I haven't had a bad slice yet! Cash only, and they close the door at 11:30 and sell from the window after that. When it's gone it's gone so get there before the bars let out! :)
author: Sam D.

description: Best pizza in town the bread they use is fluffy and the pizza slices are huge very filling this is my new favorite pizza spot by far fresh ingredients!
author: Steven K.

description:
They never have the garlic clam.

Waited like a hour behind 50 people for drunk pizza.

I'd never eat this pizza sober but it wasn't bad. Price is reasonable about $3 a slice.
author: Doug R.

description:
It's Hip To Be Square!

In the case of Golden Boy Pizza, the slices are square, thick, and full of fluffy and well-balanced goodness that nicely compliments a cold IPA. My home State of Iowa also serves square pizza, albeit in small pieces over the entire round thin crust pie. 

I stopped in last night before a Gogobot party of which I was advised to eat before as not to be part of a food scrum directed at the promised light bites. That sort of advice is solid, although this time around there was no scrum and plenty of Golden Boy Pizza was available at the Party!. So in 20-20 hindsight, maybe I could have skipped my stop here at this quiet stretch of North Beach. However and as with the Party, hanging out and enjoying the diverse clientele was well worth the price of admission.
author: Eric B.

description:
By far the best pizza I have ever eaten.  We waited in line for about 30 min.  They had 5 pizza options I believe.  We were only really interested in the garlic and clam pizza.  It was worth the wait and then some.  As for atmosphere, if you can enjoy plain and simple it is the best.  We enjoyed reading the walls.

This is a must try for anyone who thinks they have already had the best pizza.  It will change your life.
author: Chris M.

description: Amazing pizza when you're sober, amazing pizza when you're drunk. And I know the clam pizza sounds sketchy but it's probably their best one. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Eating pizza with a fork and knife...uh what? 

That was my first reaction when I looked across the room and saw everyone eat their pizza that way. Suddenly I felt so out of place with my pizza in my had. Haha.

I tried the cheese and then the sausage. Both were amazing for pizzas with such plain toppings. I tried a bite out of my friend's pesto and that was SO GOOD. The pizza was moist and soft while the bottom of it was super crunchy, just how I like it. Crusts are very thin, sometimes you don't get crust at all from the way they shape their pizza (squares!). Love, love, love.

Only thing I dislike is the constant traffic and super hard parking to find, but that's just the type of neighborhood it's in.
author: Cathy N.

description: The pizza was great!  Especially after drinks on Saturday night.  It was very garlicky but still amazing.
author: Kristen F.

description: Super yummy, Great Pizza!! Family friendly. Came with my six kids in tow. $1.25 drinks with refills. Place is tiny but bar runs along the side wall.
author: Sarah S.

description:
The pizza here is absolutely fantastic !
So is Amanda behind the counter !!!Always smiling and great customer service, regardless of how busy the place gets, which is almost always !!!
David too is jovial and helpful !
Thank you !!!
author: Pradeep P.

description:
Um.. yummy.
Waited 20 minutes on the street so I could devour 3 pieces of this wonderful pizza in like 10 bites.  Now.. how to fix the burns off the top of my mouth?

Seriously good pizza - look at my other reviews, I a quite picky in this regard.   If you go by the slice (especially at night) be prepared to wait a bit.    Understand that in that neighborhood, however, if there is a line at any pizza spot it is probably worth it..
author: Chris S.

description:
I have been is San Francisco for 2 years and I have spend all the rest of my life in Europe. 
It is really hard to find good pizza in SF and this place doesn't really break the rule.

I had better pizza in small places in the Mission area and various other locations.
I live really close by and I had tried a slice several times.I always add a lot of cheese on top to make the slice more tasty.
It is not bad, the materials they use seem to be good but guys, this is not a really good pizza.
Sitting inside to eat is a joke. I you have 10 inches to seat and 5 inches to put your paper plate on.

The place is highly overrated because it is "trendy" and stays open till late at night, which of course is a plus. I guess after a few drinks everything tastes much better...
author: Antony T.

description: This place was recommended by a friend that they serve good pesto vegetarian pizza. As soon as I walked in I felt it was like a hole in the wall kind of pizza place. I like how they have tons of stickers all over the place and restroom. I haven try any other slices but the pesto vegetarian one. To me it was tasty and better than other places I have tried. I wish the pesto was a bit more heavier because it was quite light. A tip is don't get the corner slices because it can be dry from the crust but the middle slices are the best. I have came here and sat there once to eat and received good fast service
author: Alex T.

description:
Clam Garlic Pizza 4/5

Why did it take so long for me to get to this place?!  This style pizza is on a focaccia type crust which is springy and about 1/2 to 3/4 inch tall. At first glance, it didn't seem appealing. However, the bottom and edges have excellent crunch, so you get the best of both worlds. Crunchy edges with soft moist center. The awesome sauce and flavor puts it all together for me.
author: John H.

description: Some of the tastiest damn pizza I have ever had!  The clam pizza rocks, friendly service and definitely worth a short wait in line.
author: Carole A.

description: Completely hit the spot for pizza & beer.  Crust was light and crispy for those crust lovers!
author: Jen C.

description:
The clam and garlic pizza is many a magical thing: it's the perfect soaker-upper of booze, the ideal tool for sabotaging your Paleo diet, a sure-fire way to prevent smooching and/or close-talking, and the best $3.75 you'll spend in North Beach (except perhaps for a cup-o-gelato). 

The crust is fluffy and foccacia-like with a crispy edge, a perfectly moderate amount of sauce and cheese, and then...the potent sprinkling of clams and garlic. It's like biting into a savory, odoriferous cloud of carboliciousness. 

Seriously, when you're friends insist on interrupting your pub crawl to wait in the seemingly eternal line for a square slice of Golden Boy grub, follow them. And then, stop at the corner store for some breath mints, gum, and toothpaste. They may be able to put a dent in that clammy-garlic aroma you'll be living with for the next 2 days.
author: Nique F.

description: Delicious pizza! The slices were huge and fresh. Super cool wall decor. Make sure to write your name on the wall. Great place for lunch.
author: Quintin W.

description: Bring cash! Worth the wait, if there is a line. I had just a slice of sausage and it was really good. The cheese was perfectly gooey. And crust was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. The guys sitting next to me had the clam slice and it looked intense in a good way lol! Only downside was there were only 4 little pieces of sausage on my pizza. Would've liked more toppings. I'd say this is one of the best Sicilian slices I've ever had.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Made the trek from my hotel in union square to golden boy pizza and it was well worth it. I shared the garlic clam, cheese, and combo slices. Aside from the lack of seating and garlicky breath afterwards, it's definitely worth going back.
author: k h.

description:
all their pizzas here are great and they have lines to prove it.. always gotten it to go

order of preference
-clam garlic: i know sounds like an odd pizza choice but so what.. i though indian pizza would be weird but i love it.. clam garlic is pretty darn yummy wo anything being too over powering

-pesto veggie: love a good veggie pizza

-combo

-pepperoni

dont be afraid of the clam garlic pizza.. try it for yourself!
author: Raquel T.

description:
Five Stars
Maybe this isn't a fair review because I've only been here after a night out.. But awesome pizza and fast-enough service! Can't beat them squares. 

Tips and Fun Facts
Cheese-licious in every bite, for real. Vegetarian friend loved it here.
author: Linda X.

description: Best pizza ever. I don't live in San Francisco but it's a must have when I travel here. Highly recommend
author: Jessica P.

description:
I love pizza. And a few people told me about how awesome this place is. errrrrr not so much. 

I have been enjoying the lovely happy hours at columbus cafe, maggies, and many other awesome North beach locations. A few of my friends and co workers like to stop by and grab some pizza after or even during bar hopping. 

There even tends to be a line. Skip to the pizza! Ive tried the combo, sausage, cheese only and pepporoni!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

ITs super crispy and reminds of little ceasars when they use to have those big giant blocks. Kinda taste like it too. ITs not bad but A ok. Good location and cool for mingling. Place is ok, small and cozy and hard to get in or out when a line is present. Drink more beer and it will taste better. And no Credit cards i believe. BOOO its 2012
author: Benjamin B.

description: Did like the pizza here a lot. The crust is crispy but soft as the same time. Very very good. They are open late too so a great place to eat after drinks
author: Kiyo O.

description:
The husband and I were treating a friend who lives in town to dinner and had wanted tonys pizza origionally but the wait was two hours! So we walked up the street to see if the reviews were true about this place and they so are!! 
After a short wait and a long line we got to the counter, seeing my husband using a crutch she told us to grab the seats next to her at the bar and continued to serve us from there and while managing the til managed to keep us happy with some help from the nice man behind the bar. Not only was the service great and the pizza delicious but the dough was so light and crunch! The pesto was not overbearing on the pesto pizza and I even ate the mushrooms, onion, and tomato ontop. That is a big deal for me!
Everything tasted fresh and the food was really cheap. 27$ covered 6 slices, a beer and 4 sodas.
Needless to say it is a definite thumbs up!! 

It is a small building so don't expect to be able to sit down and eat, though.
author: Kolleen S.

description:
Best pizza I've eaten hands down
Ordered the clam & garlic & cheese pizza 
Definitely coming back once I'm in the bay again !
author: Daniel C.

description: The BEST pizza I've ever had in my life. Came here after a night out with friends who were visiting from SoCal and they agreed it was delicious! The crust is sooo good; there is a good balance of toppings/sauce where it doesn't overpower the crust. I'm a huge fan and will return!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Oh heavenly pizza Gods -- thank you for smiling down upon us and gracing us with this small shop. I didn't know just how much I appreciated pizza until I visited this location while on vacation. So sumptuous, [good] salty, savory, thick, juicy, and melt-in-your-mouth DELICIOUSNESS!

I didn't understand the hype, I'll be honest. I figured it was just another hipsterish place that was probably filled with after-bar-hopping douchebags. But I was pleasantly surprised to find that this place had made me rekindle my love of pizza.

My only gripe is that there isn't a place like this in Los Angeles. Why must you make me fall in love with your pizzas only to make me realize I can't have it once I go back home. :( Cheesy tease.

I can't wait until I visit SF again so I can use my cheat day to GORGE on pizza from Golden Boy!!! I'm bringing wads of cash with me because that's what they take.

I'm going to make it rainnnnnnn in your store! Check check it.
author: Stace K.

description: Had the pepperoni pizza and the garlic and clam pizza and they were delicious. Great seasonings on the pizza
author: Josh H.

description:
I keep hearing about how light and crisp the pizza here is, and the fact that it is in the north beach area grants it some level of credence... I wouldn't put too much into it though...in terms of quality and freshness, its there, but how it breaks down is as follows....

Served in square pizza slices but like the 5 dollar deal you get at little Caesars...
Roughly 3-6 dollars per slice if i remember correctly depending on which slice..

The clam/pesto/veggie in particular lacks the actual clams in portions but you get that aroma you would expect from enjoying clam chowder or mussels from an italian restaurant.. (-1)

Cash only...(-1)

Given how the interior looks a bit gloomy but old fashioned, I'm not sure whether the sodas from their machine being pumped is fresh or not...meh i don't need to feel the tummy any time soon.

Its thicker in slices compared to benchmark/cheeseboard in Berkeley.
But lacks the depth in overall flavor and heartiness you can find at places like 
Bobby G's, Benchmark or Little star in east bay...

I think Golden Boys pizza is a place to go just out of sentiment than for preference. Like a to do list if you are curious of the city. I would probably go here instead of north beach pizza though..but still..i wouldnt put this as a top 3 to go to.
author: Eric C.

description:
What can I say? This is now my favorite place to eat pizza! 

There's only 4 or 5 choices and they're all laid out by the window for all to see. I usually get 1 combo and 1 clam/pesto. The pizza is fresh, tasty, and easy to eat with it's square shape. The prices are very reasonable. 

So far, I have only visited this place for lunch. I don't consider this to be a sit down restaurant. It can be uncomfortable to sit and there isn't too much room for everyone. Also, parking is difficult. Because of the sit down situation and the parking, I took off a star.
author: M L.

description:
What can you say? 
It's just straight up excellent! 
Best pizza in North Beach! 
Please keep it local!
author: Bryan E.

description: Sit at the long metal counter and take your pick of six different kinds of pizza.  It's thick crusty pizza served in large squares, with hot pies coming out of the oven every few minutes or so.  The big metal pans sit in the window and you can take your pick.  You can start with simple cheese and pepperoni for those who demand it or go for some greater culinary variety.  Try the combo with veggies and sausage, or the pesto garlic clam for some stand out flavors.  Now take a bite and savor it - the crust is thick and chewy but the toppings and sauce complement each other nicely.  It's a unique style of pizza, and one that is not often found elsewhere.  They have a bunch of great local beers on tap, so get a pint of that 6% hoppy IPA to complement your delicious pizza.  Be nice, chat with your neighbors and offer a friendly nod to the fast and efficient waitstaff who never fail to attend to your needs. Tip them well because they do their job very efficiently, and because they have to put up with more inebriated and demanding people later in the evening.  Then eat your slices (with a knife and fork) while watching the Giants play on the big screen overheard.  Pay up (in cash only) and head out into a cold North Beach evening.  Soak up the ambience of one of the best spots in S.F. for simple pizza and tasty beers.
author: David Z.

description:
Pizza with great sauce, great cheese, and service is efficient.  No, they're not that fast, but they try to be and they are super friendly!

I had the cheese, since it was my first time and I wanted to make sure that the base was good, and it was great!  Next time, I'll order a few slices... XD  Dough = perfect consistency.  If you're looking for thin, this is not the place for it.  However, if you want good dough, fresh flavors, and just delicious stuff--this is IT!

Seating = limited.  I stood outside and enjoyed my fresh slice, instead of trying to cram inside the place.  

Prices = reasonable. (My slice was $2.75, the specialty slices are around $3.75 to $4.00)  Cash only!
author: Fannie S.

description:
I've been disappointed with what gets sold as 'pizza' in SF coming from the holy land of NYC.

The pizza here though warms my heart. Need I say more? Nah, you have my full approval!

Fun story though, I found out about this joint from a bouncer in front of a strip club in North Beach. Dude casually comes up to me and asks me if I'm looking for work (-_-) and I reply: 'no but I'm looking for a decent slice' and he tells me about this place.
author: Mia F.

description: Golden Boy is a Golden Treasure in San Francisco.  The best Sicilian slice that will leave you stuffed till the next morning.  The combo slices are made my pizza professionals who know what they're doing.  Grab some slices, grab some beers, & get over to Golden Boy Pizza.
author: Gary B.

description: Old school no frills place.  I'm partial to that.  I prefer thin crust pizza, so I didn't here that often.  But when I did I enjoyed everything -- the pizza, the pricing, the environment & ambiance.  I'm in the mid-Atlantic now, and am not aware of anything close to me that compares to Golden Boy.
author: Steve S.

description:
Best slice is SF!  Great atmosphere too - head on in for a beer and some punk music.  Best part is that it's cheap too.

This place is an institution.  Great for lunch or dinner.  Expect to wait in line.

Go for 2 slices.  Highly recommend the sausage as well as the clam.

Truly GOLDEN.
author: Jason F.

description: The hype is real.  Golden Boy is legit.  I only tried the vegetarian pizza slice, but loved it.  I can't help but fall for a goof slice of Sicilian pizza, and they've figured it out.  The tricky part is that they're always busy, especially on weekend nights they get a huge crowd of people from the clubs so the line can take ages to get through.  Try to go here during off hours.  Can't wait to go back and try the clam pizza and cheese pizza.
author: Zach S.

description:
Who doesn't love GOLDEN BOY after a few drinks?? Golden Boy Pizza is right in the heart of North Beach in SF. It is easy to recognize as a giant red neon finger points down at the window. It is a by the slice type spot, with a line out the door on popular party nights in the city.

You walk up and they have 5 or 6 pizzas in the window, cooked in a square sheet. Slices are $3.25, and square and are about 5"x5". They are good when you are sober, and they are downright scrumptious when you are three sheets into the wind.

4.25 stars!
author: Joel V.

description: Ha-ha, what a great East Coast place on the West Coast.  You walk up, and see the pizza in the window, and guess what??  That is your menu, live and up front.  The line is always outside the door.  When you do get inside, have your order ready, and do not him and haw about what pizza to get, or you will piss off everyone behind you in line.  Just get in, order and get out of the way.  It is a total hole in the wall, but I love it.  The Pizza is really good and the slices are huge.
author: Paul G.

description: Best pizza spot in Little Italy. You can't beat the 3.50$ a slice, either. I love it.
author: Tatiana F.

description: Good, thick pizza. Stopped here late at night and there was a line of people waiting. I figured it must be a good place. I will be back.
author: T C.

description:
I think that this is a great place.  Great pizza, omg- clam pesto garlic, pep, etc, very very good.

Servers need to be polite...  Enjoy that job, Thank one for the $2 tip on an eight dollar order...
author: Dean P.

description:
GARLIC CLAM

i'm sold!
author: Tina A.

description: (Just had pepperoni) Super basic pizza. So much hype. Decent for the price. Bunch of bread super, light on the sauce, barely any pep. I have had pepperoni pizza that blows theirs out of the water. The other pizzas they had use the same sauce and cheese....not impressed. I feel if you can't build a shack don't try building a house (pepperoni/their other pizza)
author: Isaac V.

description: So good. Pizza is memorably good. Great place to hang with friends over a beer. Not kid-friendly and small place. Chick at the counter is rude. Will definitely come again.
author: Susannah K.

description: Good pizza by the slice and very friendly customer service. There always seems to be a line, so don't be in a hurry. The place has a lot of counter seating, but it's cramped and busy. The atmosphere is gritty and hip. They have beer on tap, plus San Pellegrino water and soda. Good place for a casual, cheap bite; not someplace to linger.
author: P S.

description:
5 stars for the pizza and, if possible, add an extra star for sentimentality. Since I practically grew up in SF and nearly know Little Italy inside out, I recommend a visit to this pizza joint whenever in town. 
-Besides the spectacular clam and garlic or vegetable pesto, the other choices are just as amazing. This place is for the thick crust, packed topping lovers out there like me.
- And although this place is not great for group hangouts due to it's minimal seating space, the general splendor of this place with the heavenly square pizza adds the extra umph to the the urbanesque experience to Little Italy. 

Overall this place is my go to location in SF for cheaper but still up to par with my high maintenance taste buds and my nearly empty college student wallet.
author: Lillian Q.

description: The pizza is between a 3.5 and a 4. The pizza dough felt and taste it very focaccia like. I like traditional NY style pizza and this is not it. The clam pizza was 3 star, good but I would not get again.
author: Elba A.

description: It ain't Tony's. But totally depends on the style of pizza you enjoy. On Tuesdays, when Tony's is closed, you can hit up Golden Boy. :)
author: Mel G.

description:
GOLDEN BOY - this is where you must command your legs to go when your hungry stomach needs transportation to sustenance. 

Their combo pizza (or two.. definitely two) and your favorite drink and you are set. I've always sat on the bar with some buddies and the staff are very friendly.

Gets packed once the sun sets, but goes by quickly due to their efficient service.
author: Wayne J.

description: Being able to live around this neighborhood is the best, because I love coming to this place for pizza.& if you're visiting North Beach, this is the spot to go to if you're craving for pizza. The pizzas are cut into squares and one of my favorites are the pepperoni & sausage and the clam & garlic. The price is also reasonable, its around $4 a piece. Expect long lines out the door especially during dinner times. && bring CASH! It's CASH ONLY! Overall, i had a good experience coming here.
author: Laura R.

description:
Shine On Golden Boy!!!

Was in the area looking for a restaurant we had been recommended. When we saw the menu, we realized was nothing spectacular compare to the prices so we looked around. Enter Golden Boy. And big thanks to Monica S who's review pushed me over the edge. 

The place is cool and simple. A counter, good beer, good pizza. If you need more then you don't know about the good things in life. 

I had a slice, or square, of the clam garlic, the combination and a cold Prohibition Ale. That moment was it. Even though there was 3 more people with me, at that point it was my pizza, my beer and me. Even better the fact that there was no clam garlic so I had to wait for fresh made one. The combination was just that, a combination of flavors that came together in my mouth, bite after bite. The beer, from a local brewery, was the perfect pair.
author: Lester M.

description:
I want to start by saying that the pizza was delicious! You should know that this pizza is on focaccia bread. That is what makes it so unique, but that could also be why some people don't like it. Just FYI :)

I was in SF for work, so I was spending a lot of time eating alone. This restaurant it perfect for dining solo. They actually have zero tables. It is only bar seating.

I hate going new places alone and feeling super out of place because I don't know what is going on. Assuming that other people have the same fear I want to let you know what I learned from visiting.... You walk in and order right away standing at the bar. You can order for here or to go. Then you pay, CASH ONLY! They hand you your slice and you either find a seat or head back out the front door. I didn't realize this and just took a seat and assumed I would order after. Not the case. Luckily one of the girls behind the bar was nice and accommodating. 

 Yummy and would return. Just know what to expect. 

Key takeaways
1. Not good for groups. Good for dining solo
2. Bar seating only
3. Cash only (ATM in back)
4. Order first, then find a seat.
author: Hannah W.

description: At first I thought it was an okay pizza place, probably because I was spoiled by my local pizza joint, but I think the charm comes from eating it bite after bite. Like Crack, I wanted more add I neared the end. SAUSAGE PIZZA was decent portion for $3.50. I enjoyed it enough that I would bring people to try it out.
author: Jack L.

description:
Great delicious pizza with fresh ingredients.

I love how their pizzas were cut. You get a nice square slice that was just the perfect portion for one. There were very little of those annoying pizza crust (or pizza bone as referred by some). Almost the entire slice was covered with delicious toppings.

I had the combination pizza and it was so good that I devoured the whole slice in no time. 

This place is cash only and there are not many seats available. It is perfect for just a quick bite.
author: Mona W.

description:
I freaking LOVE pizza! This place adds the freaking cherry on top of my pizza obsession! 

My Husband and I have been living in the city the last 6 months (we used to come to the city almost every weekend before moving here, hence the move)  and have tried PLENTY of pizza by the slice throughout the city. So when my husband found this place, I was ecstatic! Since then, the only pizza I ever crave is a Golden Boy slice! 

On our first visit we ordered a slice of cheese, pepperoni, veggie and the garlic clam. I am always on the lookout for that perfect cheese and pepperoni pizza. I feel like some places over cook the pepperoni, there is too much cheese and not enough sauce etc. This place however, has gotten it down!!! It was the right amount of cheese, the pepperoni isn't over cooked, it's till soft and I love how each of the slice had the right amount of cheese and sauce ratio! (a big deal in my book) 

Veggie slice- Your typical veggie pizza. If you are a vegetarian it has a lot of veggies so you can't go wrong.  For me, it had too many olives and mushrooms. 

Garlic & Clam- OMG! THIS IS AMAZING!!!! If you love garlic and if you love seafood, this is the slice for you! I cannot express to you how amazing this tasted!  I think that everyone should try this slice regardless of how you feel about seafood (unless you're allergic to seafood). 

BOTTOM LINE:  I can eat here every day and be happy!
author: Megha P.

description:
It's quite overhyped. The pizza is good but .. it's not amazing. I personally have a preference for Cheeseboard or Arizmendi's. The toppings on these pizzas are limited and not super flavorful. I mean, this place is probably a good drunchies place.

That's about it.
author: Joyce M.

description: Great local spot with a lot of flavor, good price for a slice a pizza on the go in Little Italy.
author: Brandon P.

description:
A few friends and I road tripped up here from LA and we were starving once we arrived. We originally wanted Clam Chowder, but once we got to the location which is right next door to Golden Boy, it was way more expensive than we thought. I happened to look to my left and saw this swank little pizza joint with no chairs and attractive young 20 year old women working behind the bar. We sat down on the stools and ordered. Two slices and two drinks for 10 bucks? DEAL! Not only was the price amazing, but the pizza was twice as delicious. Served by the square it's most definitely a fun place. The walls having stickers of old bands and the music that was playing kept us in there for long after we finished eating. 

Such an amazing place to eat, i will always remember Golden Boy Pizza being my first San Francisco food, and quite possibly my best.
author: Kyle G.

description:
friendly and attentive service when i came in early for lunch on a week day... tried a square of clam and garlic pizza which for the first time in my life had waaay to much (garlic)!

definitely come check out this punked-out pie parlor! i will try some of their brews on tap next time in am hungry in north beach.
author: Lorraine Y.

description:
Pizza with the perfect amt of crust. Slightly crispy on the bottom and soft in the center. 

All fast pizza should be square like golden boy. 

Cash only. 

Ordered the clam/garlic. Very tasty. Very garlicky. But there was 1 additional flavor that I couldn't figure out. Possibly due to one of the greens on it. Took away from the clam flavor. -.5

Ordered pepperoni. No surprises. But felt jipped on the lack of actual pepperoni. -.5
author: Brandon N.

description: Good pizza but make sure you don't complain when they make a mistake or you will get an attitude from the front counter. Called a phone order for a sheet & told her would be in at 1pm to pick up. Came at 1:15pm & the girl stated that they forgot to put it in so would be another 10 minutes. When I told her why wasn't ready, she told me to go elsewhere if I'm going to have an attitude. They made the mistake but didn't even care to apologize or care about my complaint. I understand that they make $$$ because they are so busy but that's no way to treat customers. With that kind of attitude, business will start to suffer.
author: Steve K.

description:
The food was 4 out of 5, I ordered the clam and garlic which was good but more intense than I expected.

There's a long line outside so you have to wait awhile to order, but it wasn't too long.

The service was a 2 out of 5, the girl handling the pizzas was just rude, major attitude.  If you don't want to serve pizza at a busy place, work somewhere else!

It's really popular with good pizza and kit so great service.
author: Jason J.

description: Yummmmy as always.  this is why the rank so high!!  I had a veggie and a pepperoni pizza.   Took it too go as seating was tight (its always busy)
author: Kenneth A.

description:
What is this mysterious clam and garlic pizza you speak of? It's easily the most talked about slice of pie on their menu, but I swear, every time I hit Golden Boy for a quick bite after sashaying through the neon-lit streets of North Beach, they never have it available. Wamp, wamp, wamp. But when the elusive clam pizza goes ghost and your mind is already set on devouring a cheesy piece of Sicilian-style comfort, I always end up setting on the second string, and it's not necessarily the worst thing in the world. 

I can't say that if I were stone sober in the middle of the day I'd crave a slice of Golden Boy's goods, but for late night food with a bit of a buzz rattling the dome, it's hard to argue there's any better option in all of San Francisco. Typically, by-the-slice pizza joints around town are utilitarian at best, with little to no thought being put into taste or ingredients. The only goal is to feed the zombie apocalypse of drunken twenty-somethings before complete anarchy ensues, but here, things are different. It's more than a calorically-dense sponge intended to soak up the liters of Fernet flowing through your veins, it's actually a quality bite time after time. For that reason alone, Golden Boy is king. 

Do your best to avoid during absolute peak hours, as the line has a tendency to grow 20 deep. But if you can manage to arrive just before the big rush, you're in the money.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Super fun pizza joint.  They have some pretty good beers on draft and grabbing a slice or two is the way to go here.  They had some good veggie pizzas when I was there so that was cool.  I really liked the atmosphere and the neighborhood too.

Real good prices, especially for SF.
author: Adam T.

description: Needed some eats after bar hopping in North Beach on a Friday night. Suddenly we spotted Golden Boy Pizza!  As we neared, the aroma made our mouths water.  We ended up getting a couple slices of pepperoni hot out of the oven.  After waiting to get the pizza, we couldn't wait to eat it!  The cheese and pepperoni were burning the roofs of our mouths as we took bite after bite, but after a long night of drinking it was pure delicious!
author: Elena N.

description: $4 for a slice of pizza isn't bad. Line goes by pretty quick if there's a line. Options are displayed at the window of the shop front, so my friends and I selected the one with onion, cheese, pepperoni, mushrooms and zucchini. I thought the pizza was just alright, and that I've tasted better. Maybe there's another topping that tastes better, but the one we chose was just alright. The bottom of the pizza was a bit crunchy which was what I liked, but 3 stars.
author: Amanda C.

description: It was ok at best, a lot if hype ok pizza  I would still try it but don't expect too much.
author: mariam n.

description:
I wouldn't say they are the best pizza spot in San Francisco or the best square Ive had in my life but the food is always fresh due to the high customer turnover.
I'm a little disappointed but the small little oven they have in the front to re-heat the pizza as well as the lack of options but overall, I do recommend them for a good square slice and I have been back often. 

The combo slice is definitely the best slice.
author: Chris L.

description: The pizza is always delicious! Although on a weekend night the line can be pretty long outside for a single slice.
author: Taylor L.

description:
Dear God this place is amazing. Maybe I think this because I was in a hungry haze wandering past, maybe it was because I'm a broke ass college kid, or maybe this place laces their pizza with magic pizza crack. I have eat a lot of pizza, all over the cardboard to artisan scale, and this is by far the best thick crust pizza I have every have. The dough is fluffy with a nice yeasty flavor and chewy structure, but the bottom is fried from all of the oil they put in the pan.

So far I've only had the cheese pizza and the clam. 

BEST CHEESE PIZZA EVER. OH DEAR GOD! It was the perfect amount of salty and garlic-y. The sauce was nice and tangy, and they had the perfect amount of too much (I'm the type of person that dips their pizza in a metric shit ton of extra marinara sauce). Totally worth burning off the roof of my mouth.

The clam pizza was meh to me, but that's because I don't like parsley, and man was there parsley all up in this sucker. the clams defiantly had a nice chewiness, and there was so much garlic Gilroy would be jealous (I love garlic). 

On a scale of 1-10 they get a solid 9 (points taken away for being so goddam hard to get to).

Now excuse me as I sniff my bag because it is super saturated with Golden Boy Pizza smell.
author: Maria D.

description:
Focaccia bread pizza, great idea.

It's your standard slice of pizza place, except that it's on focaccia bread, and that's a big enough difference that it's worth checking this place out.  It's got a punk rock vibe, tons of stickers of bands and stuff all over the walls, but it's not very big, so you're most likely not eating inside.

The pizza is tasty, not cheap, but about what you'd expect.  Probably not my favorite slice in the city, but it's a good change of pace from your standard options.
author: Dave S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were in Chinatown, and he kept telling me about this one pizza place close by his house when he was growing up. So we trekked all the way over to North Beach for this little gem. As soon as I got close enough I knew it was going to be good, I could smell the deliciousness and see all of the deliciousness through the window. Trays and trays of it. I got the combo, and boy did it not disappoint. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! I liked it so much I got another one on my way out and ate it while we walked around! (Don't judge.) I'm a fairly lazy person and I don't like to exercise, but I would definitely make the walk just to have a slice of pizza from here. I definitely want to try more!

The one thing that annoyed me is that I'm really short, so when sitting at the counter/bar my feet can't touch the floor or the little foot rest, so my feet just dangle the entire time. But whatever, the pizza more than makes up for it!
author: Cindy Y.

description: Square'ish' pizza just got served...here. Better than school square pizza times infinity with a cherry on top.
author: Heather H.

description: Great pepperoni pizza. Good clam and garlic pizza ( a bit too much garlic for me though). Cold, cheap beer! I'll be back
author: Bryan W.

description:
Recommend getting the combo pizza or the clam & garlic. Very tasty Sicilian style pizza. Good & reasonably priced pizza.

Cash only
author: Ephraim B.

description:
A sure thing when you're craving late night eats in the North Beach area.

Golden Boy is overflowing with tomato sauce charm. You can smell them from halfway down the block. Visiting GBP when the bars are starting to close up - is a classic SF tradition for many.

Don't be discouraged by the crowds flocking to the wafts of goodness. Golden Boy's lines move fast as do their square Sicilian style pizza slices. 

Their clam garlic pizza is beyond what's up. In fact take my advice now and if someone opts to share a slice with you - refuse. You'll want that whole thing for yourself.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Hands down the best pizza crust I've had. Crunch in every bite. 

The clams & garlic was ok.. the garlic was definitely present in each bite. A bit too much for me. But the combo and pepperoni were both delicious!

Service is really good here! Friendly staff.
author: Anne T.
