description: This place is utterly average. I came here late night and got a cheese, veggie pesto and clam & garlic. They were all semi average even for 11 pm. Probably never going to come here again unless I move in upstairs and am very hungry and its 11 pm. Everyone needs to calm down and try real pizza.
author: Mahmoud A.

description: The pizza was great, but it can get expensive when you buy it by the slice. It looks like a trashy bar and the ambience sucks. The employees were bitchy college girls and were unfriendly to my parents.
author: William A.

description:
Clams..garlic...pizza...uhhh what?? 
it works, its easy to eat (finished it in 2 min -_-) and best after a night of drinking
author: Katie C.

description:
This place is like Golden like the store name says.  yummmmmmmmy.  super delicious pizza.

I didn't know this place existed until one of my coworkers took me and after one bite. my head exploded like a warhead candy.  Wow super good.  This place always gets busy and once you are in the aroma of pizza will make you crave for more like a drug.

They have bar seating and usually have a game on the flat screen so you can enjoy pizza and watch the game.

Their pizza is square and smaller than your average slice of pizza; don't share because you can't resist wanting more.

Overall, this stuff is super duper good. 

**parking**

will suck since it's on green between Columbus and grant street.  Lots of bars left and right and it's always pack.  Park farther away and walk is my best bet, but if you brave enough u might be able find parking around golden boy.
 

***CASH ONLY***
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
Served hot (if you take it to go and you're not going to eat it within the next 5 minutes, you'll be wasting your time because it's not as good cold)

They serve the thicker bread (opposite of the thin crust) 

Oddly, the peparoni is better than the combo (unless you really prefer vegetables on your pizza)

Wish it was open past midnight

Slight crowd and line to wait on most nights
author: Jonah H.

description: Maybe my expectations were a bit too high after reading all these 5 star reviews or it's because I'm not used to reheated pizza slices. Pizza was ok and cheap and staff was friendly but no 5 star pizza.
author: Carson G.

description:
Expect to wait in line at Golden Boy Pizza if you're going late night. People will line up around the block for this place. 

Everyone raves about their clam pizza, but I just don't like it. I tried it once, didn't like it. Then I gave it another change 10 months later, nope, sorry I tried. It is too garlicy and the bits of chewy clams were just not my thing.

However I do love their other pizzas, Veggies and Sausage is my favorite. They make their crust really well, crusty on the bottom, and pillowy soft in the middle (I think this is pretty difficult feat to achieve).
author: Alvin Y.

description: Worth the trip worth the wait. Just very good pizza for everyone's tastes. Vegetarian with the pesto sauce is awesome.
author: Randy S.

description:
I just went, and couldn't of been happier with my experience.

That meeting said, I've come here many times, and occasionally, it has been better than other times. Nine times out of 10 it is the same and it is amazing.

My advice is to get there right at 11:30 when they open. You'll get fresh pies that way. They're fresh hot pizza is there always best. I know they reheat them, and they're still good later,but catching a fresh pot is a huge break. You know you'll have a better pizza that way.

All their pizzas are great. The combo the clam the pepperoni. Even the cheese is special. I recommend all of them.

The wait staff is friendly. The girls working there are always nice. It's easy for takeout is well. I like that they make the takeout easy. They have a streamlined process, interviewvery nice when you follow it.

I think it's great for what it is. It's a small dying in/takeout pizza bar. It's a fun place to go and check out. Parking is terrible, and it's very hard to get to, but if you can it's worth it.
author: Nick J.

description: Awesome pizza - perfect crispy crust. Hot the clam and garlic and the veggie and both were delicious. Great service and perfect mood music playing. Worth the walk from down by the Wharf.
author: Rebecca K.

description: The line is always worth it for Golden Boy Pizza after hitting the bars in North Beach. Quite frankly this is one of the better pizza spots in the city. The garlic and clam sounds a bit weird at first but it's surprisingly good!
author: Eric H.

description: I found the clam and garlic pizza to be the real winner here. The daily special (sausage, bell pepper, mushroom, etc.) was nothing to write home about. We came on Saturday at noontime and had no wait, but there was a line out the door when we left. I probably would get it again only if I was around the area and there was no wait.
author: Allison S.

description:
Came here a couple times already and couldn't be more happy with it!  The clam & garlic pizza is my favorite.  So much garlic with a slight hint of clam gets me jumping all inside.  The dough is the perfect combination of bread and crunch.  I don't know how else to explain it but SO GOOD!  Perfecto!  

Each time I've gone here has been either before or after the rush.  If you are considering eating here, I would try to strategize the timing since the joint resembles a small alley with bar stools.

And all the times I've been here, I was sober so its the real deal ;)
author: Nho C.

description: I don't just love this place, I adore it. It's pretty much THE pizza spot in the city to go to. Patxi's deep dish is pretty rockin' as well, but you really can't beat the price and quality of this joint. With the North Beach neighborhood feel on top of it all. This is definitely one of the gems in the neighborhood. You really can't go wrong with any of their succulent squares of goodness, and the pepperoni is always a sure-fire. Cash only and open late. Right around $3/slice with beer on tap, San Pelligrino sodas, and of course cans of Coke and the like.
author: Jared R.

description:
It's easy to find great slices that are different from Golden Boy but hard to find great slices that are better. 

I celebrate the differences, but more importantly, I celebrate the descent of a pepperoni pizza slice into my belly.
author: John M.

description:
Boy am I glad I don't live down the street from this place.. otherwise I'd be cast to be the next Fat Bastard in the upcoming Austin Powers movie. I don't care who you are, foodie or non foodie, you just can't not love the crust on the pizzas here. I almost feel sorry for the blokes who get the center pieces - its almost like getting a cheesecake without the crust - culinary sacrilege. 

Now, the other tip I'd offer is to get either the veggie pesto or the garlic clam. Its even better if you can get a slice when they are fresh from the oven, but re-warmed is a pretty close second as well. If they don't happen to have my favorite slice, just pre-order and wait at the bar/counter for it!! Totally worth it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Henry W.

description: YES! Clam slice! 6 stars, baby! Just make sure you're not going to breathe on anyone for the next 24 hours. That was one perfect slice and anyone who says CA can't make pizza hasn't been here. Why it's served with a knife and fork I have no idea though. I came upon this place and saw a huge line and several people staring in at the window display wistfully and ravenously, so I put it on the list to try later. Yeah, I'm glad I did. Nice square pies, great cheese, toppings, crust just perfect. Cute little place inside to eat with walls that remind me of a Philly punk rock bar.
author: Michele D.

description:
"This is the best pizza in the whole world!" exclaimed the little boy sitting next to me. I find it hard to disagree after eating at Golden Boy in North Beach. 

I've been fortunate to have had many a great pizza in my day. I like it thick or thin, traditional or non.  I've enjoyed a slice or more in almost every country I've visited. I just love pizza. And at Golden Boy, I've erased all memory of Little Caesar's square pies I'm sad to say I ate more than once in college. 

Two slices and a Fanta: pesto combo and cheese. The slices were each 25 square inches of happiness. The fork and knife came in handy.. So did the napkins. Everything about the pizza is awesome, but the crust is absolutely outstanding!

Service was friendly and efficient. Prices were a steal. Ambience was warm despite the hostile signage.

It was a treat to visit the neighborhood. Never really been a fan of North Beach. Always seemed like a tourist trap. I've avoided it since moving here. With time ti kill, I walked around and found myself reminded of Little Italy in New York. It's a little cheesy. There are Chinese establishments encroaching on their turf. And there are characters milling about. Loved feeling like a tourist in my city. 

Need to bring my wife with me next time!
author: Dave B.

description: All hail the drunken grease induced food coma caused by this incredible Detroit style pan pizza.... you're welcome!
author: Garrett L.

description:
My sister will be disappointed in this review, but here goes...

I've been to Golden Boy a few times after hearing rave reviews from my sister and brother in law. My fiance is a PIZZA LOVER so I knew we had to check this place out. 

Golden Boy is a small joint with a selected menu. Thats actually whats great about them. You come in, get your pizza within minutes and top it off with a beer - IN and OUT. Their pizza's are reheated when you order unless you order by the sheet which I assume comes fresh. 

I've tried all of their pizzas and I'm just not impressed. They should add more meat. I find myself biting around the pizza trying to locate a sausage or pepperoni. Same goes for their clam pizza, where are the clams?

I dont mind a doughy pizza, but the dough has to be something I can eat by itself. I felt like their dough was plain and was left craving for something more. Perhaps if the bottom was toasted longer for a nice crunch?

While I'm not in love with their pizzas, I will definitely be back. It is in a great location, staff is friendly and for $3.75 a slice, they had me at hello.
author: Charisa N.

description: One of the best pizza spots in SF. The garlic clam pizza is a must try. Cheap and good. That's all you need to know.
author: Lisa H.

description:
After almost an hour of walking through the neighborhood trying to find a sit down location for dinner at about 7:30 or 8pm, I just couldn't take it anymore. It's tourist season so each restaurant had at least a 30 minute wait. Feeling the hanger (read: hungry anger) building within, we thankfully came upon Golden Boy. We were able to get a couple of beers and slices of pizza within five minutes - glorious.

Now Golden Boy is not a back up restaurant, nay, it is a fantastic place in itself. It's not a sit down waiter service type of restaurant, which is probably the reason that it's easier to get into and has a faster turnover. It is set up more like a bar that serves fresh, awesome, focaccia bread pizza. Their sausage and combination were absolutely fantastic and I am looking forward to returning to try the clam/garlic pizza. Since it's made on focaccia bread the crust is totally different than anything that you have had in the past. It is a square pan style pizza that they will reheat and re-crisp to order.

They have a great line-up of beers on tap as well and everything for a very reasonable price. Just make sure you bring CASH!
author: Ben B.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is the very reason I spoon with my iPhone and whisper sweet nothings to the Yelp app. This Sicilian-style pizza join is just damn good. There's usually only a few options at any given time but there always good options.
author: Jerry S.

description: I've been wanting to try this spot to see what all the rave is about. I tried the famous clam garlic & combo and they're both very good. The clam garlic is very garlicy so if you love garlic like I do you will definitely enjoy it. Is it the best pizza I've had? No but if you're craving pizza and want to grab something good and quick with a cold beer on the side, this is a perfect spot.
author: Vida E.

description:
Out here in "farm-to-table"-obsessed SF, restaurants seem to forget sometimes that the most important role of a restaurant is to provide a service to their patrons. Thankfully, Golden Boy hasn't forgotten this. The service they provide -- a fresh and hearty slice of pizza after midnight -- is one that us Nor'easters perhaps take for granted back home.

Never again.

It might be instructive to learn about the Pizza Belt before reading on:

http://gawker.com/the-pizza-belt-the-most-important-pizza-theory-youll-743629037

If you've ever wondered -- as I have far too many times for a cardiologist -- why it's so difficult to find good pizza-by-the-slice in SF... I don't have an answer for you. I *can* tell you, though, that Arinell really does serve a delicious slice of New York cheese (for a whopping $2.50, however), and that Golden Boy makes decent Sicilian. Yet it's the fact that it's open late that bumps this place up to the 4-star stratum for me.

But really -- how is it that there are SO many great Italian restaurants and pizza-and-pasta places in SF yet no reliable set of late-night pizzerias? Do we really need another bland steel-and-glass high-rise apartment in SoMa?? I feel like I'm taking crazy pills, so to speak.
author: Albert L.

description:
Good Pizza and good service. The slices are huge and well worth $4. 
The Clam Pesto was really tasty and not horribly heavy. It's worth a taste!
author: Sherri E.

description:
My go-to hole in the wall pizza place in North Beach.  I've gotten the Sicilian pepperoni pizza slice for the last 10+ years.  Crust has the right kind of crispiness on outside and soft on inside (no chewy, dough-y), not too much sauce, cheese melts perfectly (not gummy or chewy) and the pepperoni is a little crisp.  

Service ok, a little slow.  I don't really care about service since this is a hole in the wall kind of place place and I don't feel obligated to tip whatsoever, just give me my slice of pizza.  They're open after bar hours.
author: Angelique B.

description: Hands down, best pizza around town. wasn't too stoked about the Clam and Garlic (I'm not too into seafood). but the pepperoni and sausage was AMAZINNNGGG.. this place is a must try whenever you're in the area.
author: Ramon S.

description:
Walked by this place many a time going to Sotto Mare which is next door.   So on my pizza hunt I figures, lets see what the line is about.  

Super slow service, so enjoy the line.  But when you get your slice it is the sicilian style pan pizza done up right.  Nice buttery dough.  Bit of crisp around the edges. 
( I like an end piece so you get more of the crisp and caramelized cheese and crust.)  Spicy sauce, somewhat heavily seasoned herbs on top of the cheese but it all works.  The basil garlic clam looked like a winner but I couldn't bring myself to do it since i was on pizza overload at this point so I went simple cheese which is the cornerstone of any great pizza place.

Clearly Golden Boy has many fans, mostly young with a few bar seats and loud 80's metal playing on the night I was there.  If you like a sicilian style pie this place has one of the better ones I've had.
author: Bruce M.

description:
Fantastic, inexpensive pizza served quickly right off the street. I only had pepperoni, which was excellent, but the other flavors looked great too. 

The best thing about this place in my opinion, is the fact that you can grab a slice of pizza while literally stepping in the doorway of the building, pay for it, and be on your way incredibly quickly. They also have killer hours. 

If you want a quick square of pizza, this is the place to get it.
author: Sam W.

description: Maybe I'm biased because I was raised in Brooklyn, the greatest place on earth for pizza, but I fail to see what's so special about this place. It's just your average square slice. Oh, but they put clams and garlic on their pizza. Whatever.
author: I G.

description:
I've never been here sober, but I had sober friends with me, and they'll all agree that the combination pizza is the bomb after a night out on the town. The line around 1:00 to 2am can be pretty ridonkilous, but worth the wait. Mmmm delicious delicious greasy pizzaaaaaaa..mmmmmmdroooollll. 

I've tried the following and the ranking is as follows:
1. Combination (The best)
2. Pepperoni
3. Cheese
4. Sausage
5. Garlic Clam (Not so great, and will leave your breath stinking like ass. If you can get a girl to make out with you afterwards it's love! Or she's drunk)
6. Vegetarians (Though, I haven't tried this, but I'l just say it's the worst since it's just vegetables. I don't do veggies, so I'm going to assume it taste like crap. Eat it you tree hugging hippies! JK...kinda: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bU3Oo3r9b9s)

Edit: Came here sober during the day. Still delicious, and almost no line.
author: Joon Y.

description:
This place is awesome. Really good pizza (you need to eat it with a fork and knife). Get at least two slices. The pizza is priced to move (like 3-bucks for a slice).

They also have a decent beer selection, and pitchers, so you can't really go wrong. Plus sweet music and bar stool seating.
author: Micah S.

description: Ok, as a NY'er, I really really wanted to hate this place when I saw the reviews..... But F*Ck, it's good! Thick, crispy edge pizza gooey goodness. And the staff is actually nice, not common for a pizzeria. Damn you SF... I kinda like you
author: Food E.

description: Awsome little place you need check it out !! Beer , Pizza is great,  the service is great too !!!
author: Ivan T.

description: Been to Golden Boy about a million times. Best pizza I've ever had, and I've eaten a lot of pizza. The place is like this: There are always two guys at the far end of the long and narrow restaurant who are making pizzas nonstop. The bring a tray out of the oven about every ten minutes and add it to trays of pizzas at the front of the restaurant in a display area. Each tray contains maybe a dozen pieces of pizza, sliced into squares. You select the pieces you want and if they're not hot, they are heated up in an oven. That takes a couple of minutes, during which time you pay up and order something to drink. They have a good selection of sofas, including a variety of Pelegrinos. Plus red or white wine in glasses filled to the rim for $5--a great deal. Beer too, of course. Plus the pizza is cheap--super-excellent and cheap, it doesn't get better than that. You eat at a counter on a bar stool. No tables. I drive all the way across San Francisco for Golden Boy pizza. I don't do that for any other pizza, and there are scores of good pizzerias in San Francisco. My only complaint about Golden Boy is there isn't one just down the block from me. That would be awesome!
author: Scott D.

description:
Dear Golden Boy, 
Please do not ever get rid of your clam garlic pizza, it's my favorite! I've never strayed from it during lunch and late nights.  I will drive across town just to get a slice. 
Love the single bar seating throughout the place.  Plenty of extra garlic powder, Parmesan, red peppers, n parsley shakers. 
Although you are cash only, I will always have an extra $5 in my pocket for one of your slices. 
Forever clam garlic middle pan slice fan.
author: Christi S.

description:
Stopped by Golden Boy with a friend on Sunday afternoon to catch the end of the Giants game and grab a slice or two that I was hoping would cure my hangover.

To start I ordered a slice of the combination. They had to reheat it for me because it had been out of the oven for a little while, but it was still amazing. It was a big square topped with mushrooms, onions, tomato, zucchini, Italian sausage, and pepperoni. After we let out first piece settle we decided that we both needed another one, my friends favorite pizza at Golden Boy is their garlic clam. He asked if one would be coming out soon and the chef said give him 10 minutes and he would have one ready. So we waited, it was SO worth the wait.

Generally I do not eat seafood, so I did not order my own slice of the garlic clam but I had a bite of my friends and it was amazing! It was fresh and hot out of the oven and it was topped with fresh parsley, loaded with garlic and clams. I would not recommend getting this pizza if you have a hot date later in the evening, it is a breath killer, but totally worth it.

For my 2nd piece I had a slice of the vegetarian pesto pizza. This was also really good, covered in veggies and black olives.

Lastly my friend and I split a piece of their cheese pizza. Very simple with just cheese and some seasonings. 

I will be coming back to Golden Boy again in the future, probably for my next hangover because the pizza definitely did the trick.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Golden boy salvaged our evening! Had terruble sushi at a restaurant nearby and was incredibly unwhelmed so we knew golden boy would hit the spot.  Short line at 7:30 pm so that was a plus. 

There's just something magical about those little square slices of pizza... so much flavor and savory goodness! Love it, go try it and get hooked!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
The best!! Clam and garlic..the best!! We always stop here when we are in North Beach because...it's the best!!! It's fun and funky and not trying to be.  the gal that seems to run the place is friendly and always calm, no matter how long the line is.Plus she gets your order right and remembers what you wanted when you order that third slice from your seat.
Sit at the end of the coin yet and you get to watch pizza ballet ... Three guys making pizza in a very small space.. It's choreographed movement.
It's a great place and dinner for two with drinks is less than $20.00.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Delicious pizza and beer? Count me in! 

This place looks like a hole in the wall, and that's because it kinda is. Walk past the long line in the tiny hallway and voila! there's actually seating back there! 

Not only do they have great pizza and beer choices, the ambiance of this place is unbeatable when you want to wind down from a long day at work or just grab a meal. Definitely one of my favs and a place to try if you haven't!
author: Mimi V.

description:
Square pizzas!!! My boyfriend introduced me to this place about a year and a half ago. I went back a year later just to rediscover how amaaazing this pizza is.  I didn't believe he when he said this was the best pizza he has ever had. OH, I AM A BELIEVER. I can have this all day, every day. I had two slices and still craved more the next day and then next week AND even as I type this. And get it when it's sizzling hot and fresh from the oven. *droooooool

I love the pepperoni. Good ol' pepperoni. You can't go wrong with it. I even loooove the vegetarian slice and I'm not even vegetarian!!! Next on my list to try is their garlic and clam pizza. Do it. Bring your friends, families, exes, coworkers, dogs, cats, everyone here. Trust me-- It is THAT GOOD.
author: Rosanne L.

description: Thanks Brendan!! For letting us order beer and pizza as soon as we sat down :) Got my stella w/in seconds and mah pizza soon after... Combo slice+Stella = best encore to Giants game ever!!! BTW.. This was my first time here.. The pizza is square shaped and absolutely delish.. I'm buzzed and I dgaf woooooooioo!!!!!!!
author: Megan O.

description:
The bf was pulled away from tony by their olive pizza, it was ok according to me. I wanted my thin crust from Tony's. :p
But their seafood was delightful with a mass amount of roasted bake garlic!!!!! It's just simply a different style. So get both pizza!
author: jasmin t.

description:
Perfect little pizza joint in SF (and boy do they like their pizza up there). The quadrilateral pizza arrangements in the window are definitely the clincher; you have to go in after that. The decor is super punk rawk but with a homey feel (check out the family photos on the pizza fridge). 

After having my Hemp Ale, I only had room for one slice so, after a meaty dinner the night before, I opted for the vegetarian pesto which was DELISH! Great crust-to-toppings ratio, flavor and variety. If I had room I would've tried the garlic clam pizza hands down - it smelled like garlicky heaven. 

Golden Boy Pizza is serious nommmm.
author: Tanya D.

description:
This is one of those places in North Beach that you have to venture to. Thank goodness they are open for lunch. Pizza in the window all cut into squares. About 6"x6" in size. All you have to do is point and say, "That one!". The best part about this place is the cost. $3.75 for a combination. CASH ONLY. But don't fret, there are at least four banks near by. Generally at Tony's By The Slice down the street will charge you about $6 per slice. So you pick out your slice and then they stick it in the oven to heat up. The crust has the taste and the texture like focaccia bread. So pretty much you are getting focaccia bread with all the fixins for just $3.75.

There are seats inside along the bar. Beer and all the other thirst quenching drinks are available. Generally what I do is have the pizza to go, walk down to Caffe Greco, order a Vanilla Latte, sit outside on the parklet, and eat and drink in the sun. A perfect way to relax and enjoy in North Beach.    

So the pizza ever so yummy and so is the price. Please try. You will not be disappointed.
 
Mangia!!!
author: William M.

description: Obsessed with the pizza here. They only have four flavored, veggie, combo (with sausage), cheese and clam. They range between 3-4 dollars I believe, and are cash only. They reheat up your slice on the spot, giving it the best, crispy bottom. I always try to only get one slice, then think oh why the hell not and get two haha. My favorite is the clam, but make sure you're not seeing anyone after you eat it because it's pretty damn garlicky (my favorite). Be sure to stop here after a night out, the line is worth it. I've also heard they have some good beers, but I really only care about the pizza
author: Samantha C.

description: Small, but lots of seating. If it's crowded, it clears up fairly quickly.  Good Sicilian pizza.  Nice beer selection.  Good classic rock music.  Great place.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description: Best pizza place in north beach! I'm not talking that gourmet crap you get at the fancy Italian sit-down restaurants that can only feed a rabbit... this is the saucy, cheesy, crave-worthy pizza you really secretly could eat every day of your life. It's hot, oozing cheese&sauce is flavorful, and the toppings make it out of this world :) My favorite is the meat lovers and pesto slices! Oh yeah, and did I mention they serve beer?!
author: Amanda R.

description: This place is delicious!  I tried the clam pizza and was very impressed (coming from Chicago).  The staff was really friendly and the pizza came out quickly.  Great spot for late night eats!
author: Zara P.

description:
Definitely a disappointment given the good ratings. I got the veggie pesto and it was just ok. I was excited because they just brought out a fresh pie and the cheese was all melty as she cut it, but the pizza itself was bland, I couldn't taste the pesto at all. And the crust was crumbly, it was almost like cornmeal. I like dough that is thin and chewy. $4 for slightly below average pizza, I wouldn't go back. I'd choose Tony's of extreme pizza instead. 

On the plus side, the veggies on the pizza were fresh and the service was good. 

Pizza gets 2 stars, service gets it 3 stars.
author: Maleenee B.

description:
If you've even been to Hodads down in San Diego, you'll know what I mean when I say that Golden Boy is to pizza as Hodads is to burgers. In fact, I even stumbled upon a Hodads sticker here.

The place is grungy with delicious food. Pesto veg is super good. Love the crust.

Check out the bathroom for some cool graffiti.
author: Christine M.

description: Delicious pizza. Served perfectly hot. Great seasonings. Love the neighborhood.
author: Delta N.

description:
CASH ONLY! Don't fret, they have an ATM machine inside. 

Their pizza is square shaped! If you're just like me, ask for the corners. Yes, they will honor your wishes! I've tried all the flavors, but I love the classic pepperoni! 

My fellow pizza lovers, the crust here is on point! It has crunch, but at the same time, it's not too hard and burnt. They have a bar that you can sit at with several tap beers to choose from. 

It's next to HRD by the way! So that's bonus points for me!
author: Malou M.

description:
I really don't understand the hype. The pizza is decent...it's not amazing. People who rave about this place must come only when they are drunk.

I like to ask for the pizza to be extra crispy, which means they just put it in the oven for a bit longer.
author: Margaret R.

description: Yes, it's cheap and yes the staff & music are great. But the pizza itself is doughy, chewy but not very tasty. The best one was clam & garlic but the cheese one or combination ones were a letdown. Got to Baonecci or Sotto Mare instead, a bit pricier but it's a more genuine real Italian experience.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description: Awesome pizza, service and beer!!! We came in a Wednesday after a concert at the San Francisco Symphony! Ambience & pizza was awesome!
author: Debra I.

description: Veggie is excellent. Cheese is good but nothing extra special. Like the bar setup and atmosphere.
author: Jason B.

description: Pretty good pizza. I got the combo slice and its tasty. The crust is crispy yet thick and soft and fluffy within. The slices are big so one was just enough for me. Will eat again.
author: Erica M.

description: Great reviews, but definitely not the best pizza place I've been too.  Great service, really tiny place, but the pizza was nothing special.  The pizza itself was pretty heavy with oil, but the plus was the fresh ingredients.  I feel this place is rated a little too high.
author: Jerod L.

description: Awesome place....surely recommend this place...better than the likes of Domino's and Pizza Hut
author: Priyesh P.

description: While visiting family my uncle told me "If you want the best pizza you ever had go to golden boy pizza" and he wasn't wrong
author: Cristian V.

description:
Nice spot up here in North Beach, hipster vibe good for chilling at the bar when it's not under siege. I've been lucky with finding times when it's relatively quiet: Sunday night, random weekday afternoons... Sweet that you can hear some real punk rock on the speakers here, though I'm not sure how I feel about coming in and having Minor Threat's "Guilty of Being White" blasting. uhhhh

So anyway the pizza. I don't know, the crazy top reviews of their pizza are puzzling to me. It's alright Sicilian style but not amaaaazing and it definitely doesn't hold a candle to the Sicilian slice at Arinell's. My main complaints: it's a little dry (in terms of sauce to dough ratio) and a little greasy. It's got a lot of focaccia style going for it, but I want my slices more moist and tender and...fresh tasting. I'll continue eating this bizness, but as much for the atmosphere as for the food.
author: Ted D.

description:
Stopped in here while waiting to be seated at Sotto Mare, so we just had a slice each - one pepperoni and one clam, garlic & parsley. This place is perfect for a quick slice, and their beer selection isn't bad, either! If you're looking for a quiet, romantic spot, this definitely isn't it. But for a filling slice of tasty pizza ready in just minutes, stop here! 
 
Is it the best pizza in the Bay Area? No way, but it's pretty delicious!
author: Laura D.

description:
Like the words of Rihanna... We found love in hopeless place. 

It was 2AM, drunken nights calls for not so drunken pizza

GB is great not only at the wee hours of clubrats, but a great option for lunch. I love pizza. It is one of my favorite American foods. And GB is my favorite spot after my nights of jameson on the rocks. The vegetable pesto is my favorite. Although every slice is amazingly delicious. I think what makes this pizza da bomb is the crust. The crust is crisp -- great crunch when you bite into it.  It is cut on a 4X6 slice and the toppings are thin and crunchy. I hear and clams and garlic is orgasmic. This will be on my checklist if there are any left!! 

Lines are long-- beware. Cash only!
author: Phuong V.

description:
My first time here was after a night of Manhattans at Gino & Carlo's. If you're familiar with hunting for post-bar crawl food, then you know that euphoric feeling of devouring a tasty snack after 1:30am and raving about how good it was!

I needed to go back sober to make sure I wasn't imagining things.

The pizza is all that; it's on a great focaccia crust, slathered with great tomato paste and whatever toppings you're there. I'm pretty much a pepperoni and cheese guy so I cannot speak to the variety (beyond cheese-only). It was great and worth repeat visits.

There's a healthy selection of draft and bottle beers as well as non-alcoholic drinks. You're there for the pizza though, not the drinks, etc.

I love everything about this place -- tight space down the bar leading to a less-cramped bar seating area (on either side). It almost makes me thing of a converted barracks into pizza cooker towards the back. Clearly this is a San Fran locale with Giants fans in the house! Lots of memorabilia adorn the walls as well as local stickers from local artists (Silly Pink Bunnies!).

Bottom line: good pizza, good vibe, the servers are always working their asses off and I appreciate the hustle they put in daily. You will wait when it's busy, but hey, I feel this is one of those places that's worth the wait.
author: Mike S.

description:
Honesty, if I could keep this place a secret I would but I can't help posting a review about it. 

I happened upon this place by accident. We were wandering around the city for the day exploring the ferry building and china town, we'd walked all the way to the end of the wharf and decided to walk up to North Beach. 

Naturally we got hungry and had a quite a selection of restaurants to go to but nothing stood out to us. At one point we looked up and noticed a line of people standing outside this tiny unassuming building. Coupled with the amazing smell wafting from the door we joined them immediately without knowing what was in store or what we were waiting for. Needless to say, I'm glad we did. 

Be advised it's cash only but there's an ATM in the back if you forget. The pizza comes out in sheets, hot out of the oven it's cut into generous squares, and each one is heated for you before being tossed on a wicker plate along with a fork and knife (the only way to eat this pizza). It is my strong belief that the fork and knife method is to keep you from attempting to fit the whole slice in your mouth at once. 

They have plain cheese, pepperoni or sausage, combo, pesto veggie, and clam and garlic. Not a single topping falls flat in my book. The crust is PERFECTION and I am VERY particular about my pizza crust. This is what pizza is supposed to be like!They also serve great beer on tap. 

I have tried every slice more than once now and none of them fall short of amazing. By far this is my favorite pizza place possibly of all times. Every chance we come to the city we make a point to get a few slices. Its worth standing in line for!
author: Jade C.

description:
Damn good pizza. Reasonable prices. I love the urban feel of this place. Its no place for date night but I would recommend it for just about anything else because... damn good pizza. 

-Cash only
-Limited seating
author: Sydney S.

description:
Hit or miss. Sometimes they make the pizzas really savory and there are a few times when the taste of the bread fell flat. I think the dough/bread makes or breaks a pizza.  Sometimes also, there's not enough topping so I feel like I'm just eating flavored bread. I'm not sure whether the times I thought their pizzas were really good was because I was extremely drunk....but it seems to frequently happen that way. I love it when I luck out and get a slice that was really new. You could tell if it's a brand new pizza when the bread is very fluffy and the meat toppings are still juicy. 

Usually if you go later in the evening, when the drunk monkeys are stumbling out of the bars, the line is obnoxiously long and there's nowhere to sit inside. When the line is really long, I try to avoid this place because in my opinion it is definitely not worth the wait. If you don't mind standing in the cold to satisfy your drunken munchies, it is worth a try.  Well....at least once.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: Very good rectangle pizza that melts in your mouth! Cash only.  Not like all the surrounding touristy Italian joints - this place is true San Francisco.
author: Gabe R.

description: Great pizza.  great beer selection.  Great service.  No matter how busy it gets, the girl in the front keeps smiling and serving up pizza. The line moves fast so don't get scared away. It's worth the 5 minutes you will spend waiting.
author: Charles H.

description: I heard about this place from a local dude who was our tour guide...in the coit tower area. Line was out the door on a Saturday night at 1800, which to me speaks volumes, but we got in pretty fast--30 min wait. I got the clam garlic which I think was really Good...did not taste fishy at all. The combination pizza was pretty good as well. Great friendly service is what makes me give these guys a 5!
author: Jim G.

description: The garlic in the garlic and clam slice was undercooked, so its strong acidic flavor overpowered the rest of the ingredients. Maybe I'll come back and try the cheese slice.
author: Amin S.

description:
The BF raved about this pizza for so long that when my daughter and I finally tried it - it was OK. I mean we weren't blown away are anything. 
Our favorite pizza place is Settebello in Henderson, NV. (where we live)
Anyhow, I wouldn't say that we wouldn't patronize Golden Boy cause I would- I'd try other pizza with different toppings - maybe the other toppings would add to my flavor bar. We just got a cheese for me and a cheese and pepperoni for my daughter. 
I think it was about $3.50 to $4.50 per square (no slices here) and you can always get it heated up.
Now, the BF on the other hand is a huge Golden Boy fan and I believe will be one till the day he enters SF 49er Heaven.

*** Small place with a line outside (in SF that means almost always in the cold) and you can't help but notice that the bar is completly covered in random stickers of or about everything & anything.....***
author: Ursula U.

description: Wow, what a find.  Went to this joint on a tip from a friend-of-a-friend, and so glad we did.  FANTASTIC pizza by the slice, TONS of atmosphere, and just a great all-around experience.  Ate at the counter and watched the pizzas being cooked and the eclectic clientele come and go.  Ended up having 3 huge slices, only because they were so good I couldn't resist #3.  If you're the least bit into pizza, and anywhere near North Beach, don't miss this outstanding SF experience.  Golden Boy earns the coveted 5-star stamp of excellence on the Brak-o-meter®, and would get a 6th if I could swing it.
author: Kevin C.

description: Phenomenal pizza. I like golden boy best for late night however. Partially because anything drunk just tasted better but also because it's just a short 3 blocks away from my apartment. It's creamy and tasty cheese on top of perfectly, crisp crust is so amazing. My favorite is definitely the combo pizza (mushroom, zucchini, tomato, onion, pepperoni, sausage) but I've also heard that the clams & garlic is delicious too (but your breath will smell like garlic for days). The combo piece is $3.50 while the clams & garlic is $4 and yes while more expensive than regular old pizza your paying for a premium pizza slice. Well worth it!!!!
author: Heather Y.

description: Good but not great I was suprised to see so many good reviews.  Pizza was good but not a good as a Chicago pizza.  Took it to go so maybe the expirience would ha e been better is we stayed but it was imposable to get 6 seats  near each other.
author: Gary D.

description: Flavors are great. Try the clam. This place is cash only, and the neighborhood is as big city as any. If you're used to Hollywood, CA, New York, N.Y., Chicago, etc, you'll get the point. Busy, crazy parking with a ton of signs, and people crawling the streets. Once you get the pizza, none of that matters. You'll recognize them, as their logo looks a lot like a certain hot sauce on almost every restaurant table...
author: Daron A.

description: This is by far the best pizza I have tried. I recommended the pepperoni or just plain cheese. The clam & garlic was a little too garlicky for my taste buds but still very delicious. This is a must try place!
author: Patricia R.

description:
My brother took me here when I was visiting the Bay Area. This is by far the best pizza I have ever had! Light, crispy, soft, pretty much cooked to perfection. And those squares brings me back to when I was a kid! I could literally have this every single day and be happy for the rest of my life.

Only lame part is that you can only choose from what is out. If you don't see it, you're out of luck, but all of the slices I tried there were bomb!
author: Torrance T.

description:
Be prepared for a long line at times but once you try it your patience will be rewarded. Excellent pizza and a decent selection of toppings. 

Seating inside is a bit cramped but you'll soon forget as you take your first bite. Staff is friendly and place itself is well maintained but definitely shows wear and tear from the sheer number of loyal patrons that frequent the place daily.
author: David B.

description:
I openly admit I am NOT a pizza fan, especially after smelling 5-dollar pepperoni pizza's from Little Caesar's every week for a YEAR (lil bro was obsessed)...  

BUT GOLDEN BOY PIZZA, YOU HAVE CHANGED ME.

I never heard of this place before the Yelp Drink&Hunt event which led us to the bar next door, and since I was done drinking, I wandered outside to admire those beautiful crisp pizza squares in the window. 

Remember that song about the little doggy in the window? I don't want a dog. I want Golden Boy Pizza. Right about now. I haven't even tried anything other than their combo and I want more. More more more!
author: Christine L.

description:
I have friends who swear that Golden Boy is the BEST PIZZA EVERRRRR. Needless to say, I had pretty absurdly high expectations going into it. The first time, my friend bought me a combo piece which was pretty good but not great. The actual pizza is pretty thick--but perfectly crisp on the outside and soft and doughy on the inside. In theory, it's the perfect slice of pizza. In reality, it was just pretty good.

I thought I'd give it a second try so a few days later, I dragged my boyfriend out to get some take out pizza. We got 2 pepperoni slices, the clam, and a combo. The clam one was interesting-- It didn't really taste like pizza. It actually reminded me more of a slab of focaccia with a spread. My boyfriend also thought the pepperoni was just okay. I'd imagine that if we were both drunk, this pizza would've been delicious. But sober, it was just pretty good. 

I might catch some heat for this but as far as pizza by the slice goes, I think Escape from NY's potato pizza is SO.MUCH.BETTER.
author: Angeline V.

description:
THE AROMA GRABS YOU AND SUCKS YAH IN.. like a vaccum
(3.75 stars)

When you think North Beach, you think little Italy. When you think little Italy, you think food. When you think of food you think of fancy italian restaurants or pizza?! I've been to North Beach to those fancy Italian restaurants on dates years ago. WHY, JUST, WHY couldn't a guy woo me with a slice of golden boy pizza. I'd actually be satisfied. So yummy. 

- Food, yummy
- Price, affordable
- Service, quick
- Ambiance, small

Friends and I use to hang out around the area Sunday evenings and I've always passed this place everytime I've circled the streets 500 times looking for gosh darn street parking. But it never dawned on me to GO IN AND EAT A SQUARE. After many years of seeing it, I finally came in. Was hanging out with some Elite Yelpers and playing the Drink & Hunt game around North Beach, our 2nd bar was next doors and instead of consuming alcohol on an elite discount price - some of us walked next door to eat instead. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

Cheese ($2.95) - kept it simple. was hoping to try the clam one because i love clam pizza but it wasn't out on display. First time ever having this pizza and saw that it wasn't slices they were serving, they were squares. It was greasy, it was cheesy and gooie, the crust had a crunch. IT WAS DELICIOUS.

Will I be back? Yes. I dont think I can ever walk by this place without getting a square.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
It's all about the clam and garlic pizza! A big luscious Sicilian square of cheese oozing over bits of clam and misc. herbs. The crust is quite thick, but since it's all so fresh and piping hot, it's super fluffy soft. Also tried the combination slice. Not quite as special, but still a solid slice o' pizza.

Always a line, but it moves pretty quickly.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yelpers were pretty right with this place! I came in on a weekday afternoon on new year's eve and there were plenty of places to sit.

Atmosphere: Pretty limited seating here with all bar-type seating (probably ~20-25 overall?). Definitely a hipster/indy feel to with random stickers and writing all over the place (including the bathroom mirrors). 

Food: It looked like you can only get what they have out, which isn't necessarily a bad thing since all the pizzas looked great! they're decent-sized square slices of thin crust pizza with awesome combinations of sauce/toppings (the kind I would normally have to special order). It was really solid pizza, but nothing extraordinary or unique in my opinion. They have a pretty good draught beer selection too! Lots of local stuff which is always a plus ($5 for a pint).

Service: The cashier/bartender was extremely nice and patient with us when we were deciding. Pizza only took less than 5 minutes.

Value: Eh, I would say it's slightly overpriced for what you get. I get that it's SF, but given their popularity I think they could afford to make it slightly cheaper per slice. Just my opinion though, definitely not crazy overpriced though so don't get me wrong!

Overall: This definitely hit the spot for my pizza craving and I dug the combinations of toppings. The service was great too! I try to save my 5-stars for places that are super unique and knock me down with awesomeness. But this place is pretty good and I would come back again (maybe closer to dinner time so I could try more than one beer).
author: Brad M.

description:
OMG I know this place got a lot of five stars but the pizza I had last night was terrible. The crust was shitty, the cheese was blah, the toppings were wilted and crappy. I had the combination pizza. I had taken someone there and I was so embarassed that I talked him into abandoning the meal and heading elsewhere. 

The beer was nice and cold through.

I have had pizza here before and I used to like it. Not last night though. Sorry Olden (sic) Boy!
author: Vic P.

description: Great pizza, long lines tho, if you want in and out as quick as possible ask them to not heat up your pizza.
author: tim y.

description:
For fast, delicious, focaccia style pizza, this place is top notch. I crave the stuff. They have some unique types too. Some sort of garlic and broccoli makes my mouth water.  And, I love the veggie. 

I like to grab a couple pieces, belly up to a cold beer and listen to the punkabilly radio mix they've got going. 

Golden Boy! I'm going right now.
author: Dusty B.

description:
Food: 3
Decor: 2
Service: 4

Came here for dinner around 9pm while in North Beach, and the place was packed. About 15 people in line, and I ended up waiting about 15+ minutes.

1. Clam / Garlic, 4
~Okay. Clam was a bit lost in all the garlic and sauce.

2. Pepperoni, 3.5
~Okay. Nothing particularly memorable, and I wish I had gotten the combination instead.

Service was friendly and fast. Overall, the focaccia's pretty good, but I'd still pick Cheeseboard over this any day.
author: David L.

description:
My favorite pizza place ever, i don't care if it's date night or I'm stumbling out of a bar, Golden Boy's is my spot. Pizzas are big enough to fill you up and small enough to eat on the go because the place is narrow and gets packed sometimes with the line. It's cash only, and they carry Arizonas, dope.

Only thing keeping it from a 5-star is the service, I can only remember one time where the server was nice and that's why I remember that one time. The other times are sort of like the Soup Nazi scenes from Seinfeld. Order. Give money. Leave. Forgot to get a drink? Fogettaboutit. Not quite literally, but you know what I mean.
author: Danny V.

description:
Oh Em Gee!!

My wife and I used to Live in the neighborhood, and LOVED coming to Golden Boy! I think it's a truly unique experience! The crust is thick, light, and fluffy....The toppings are quality and plentiful! The beer is cold and the women are hot! 

You can get lucky and get there when the pizzas are stocked and the place is practically empty.....But, give it a few minutes, and the place is a madhouse! The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is the bar-stools....They're cool, but uncomfortable....Maybe if they had some padding on 'em? 

It's Sicilian style pizza. So, don't go in there expecting to get a slice, because you'll get a square!

Go there!
author: T. G.

description:
I am not usually a fan of pizza made this way, but they do it right! I'm usually coming here after a night out drinking. The wait in line is usually pretty long, but well worth it. It's kind of thick pizza, but the cook it well done and it's usually coming straight out of the oven. 

They also have a good selection of Beer. 

MY GO-TO DISH: Pepperoni Pizza slice and a Beer, but I am sure the other pizzas are great too!
author: Scott T.

description:
I was pretty skeptical of this place, pizza has to be amazing for me to really enjoy it and I have had not-so-good pizza in North Beach. 

This is incredible, Sicilian style pizza (which is a lot like deep dish). It is cash only, a small bar-seating spot with beer and fresh pizza. 

YUM.
author: Arielle K.

description:
I watched my friend eat her slice that had fallen cheese down on the ground in front of the bar a couple doors away from Golden Boy. We could have just gotten back in line and gotten another slice, but she insisted that this was what the 10 second rule was created for. 

 The pizza is that good.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Good pizza, I've only been there drunk though.  It's only 4 a slice, pretty good buy.
author: David S.

description:
The pizza is GREAT!!! 

They've got 9 beers on tap including STELLA, & Heff.. more beers by the bottle!!!

Walls are covered by graff stickers (interesting to look@)... and the menu has some interesting slogans!!

Did I mention the pizza, and beer were GREAT? 

btw... kinda AwEsOMe!!!!
author: Anthony C.

description: Cash only. There was a small line at 630 on a Sunday evening but totally worth it! Tiny place but there's some seating at the bar. Pesto veggie pizza was delicious! Going back to try the cheese for sure
author: Pallavi K.

description:
My second time having pizza here was WAY better than the first, and my first slice here was already quite delicious. The clam and garlic pizza might as well be called garlic and garlic, because that's mostly what it is. There were some pieces of clam on the slice, but the garlic flavor is dominant. When eaten fresh out of the oven, the crust is also perfectly crunchy, while everything above it is soft and flavorful. It all melts in your mouth in a sort of way. Lots of texture, lots of flavor. 

The pizza is a definite must-try for garlic lovers.
author: Jason T.

description: Hands down one of the best pizza I've had. I got the cheese and veggie pesto and it Was off the hook. The crust was airy/crispy and the ingridents were fresh. Can't beat the awesome tap lineup either, I   had an ice cold Freshed squeezed IPA to wash it down. Two slices and a beer was $12. Can't beat it.
author: Manuel R.

description:
If you want a square of pizza, you can't do better.  I've been dropping in here since the 80's.  A slice and a budweiser is an amazing combination (unfortunately, I can't drink at the moment).
Atmosphere at the sit-down counter is great.  Top service.
Favorite is the pesto vegetarian.
author: Ric S.

description: My fave pizza in the city! Walk up and point at the slice you want. $2.75 - $3.75 for a giant square slice. Quick for to-go or sit at the bar and enjoy a slice (or 2) with a beer. I love the pesto veggie!
author: Kevin S.

description: Ordered 3 pizzas - Pesto Veggie, Pepperoni, and Cheese - for our colleague's going-away luncheon. We ordered it by phone at around 12 noon for pick-up at 12:30. Left the hotel at 12:15, took a taxi, and got to Golden Boy right at 12:30. There was a line but by the time we got to the cashier, our order was hot and ready! 3 pizzas came in 6 boxes and it was heavy! Tasted great and everyone loved it.. wish we were able to wash it down with beer since they have a lot of selections for such a small place. I mean, I've been to Golden Boy a few times before and each time it was consistent.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
After eating dinner at Vicoletto's next door.........which tasted great but was more like an appetizer in size and I paid $60.00........we where walking back to the car and the smell of amazing pizza hits me right in the face!! 
saw the line out the door and decided to investigate....through the window you can see the wonderful display of 5 different freshly made giant pans of delicious pizza!

Decided I couldn't resist having pizza for desert. That was a good decision!
After waiting in line for a few minutes......(reminded me of the soup Nazi episode,but way more fun)

I ordered a combination and a cheese slice. While waiting there was a huge wiff of some pungent herb wafting through the air(not the kind they use on the pizza) some nice metal music playing and the atmosphere was electric.......got the pizza and headed out the door. You could eat inside where it was nice and warm. 
The pizza was hot Delicious! and....$7.00!!! Wow. 

I think I will go back for breakfast!
author: K M.

description: The line is always long.  The pizza is thick, not thin and bitter like most pizza places.  I love coming here.  It's a great SF vibe!
author: Rene R.

description: Silly - hype has made this place successful and also it's great location and late opening hours - the pizza combinations are great but dang! The quality of the base is cheap cheap ... literally the only difference between frozen pizza's and this pizza is the trendy toppings and sexy drunk crowd lining outside ... Would Noor come again? Sorry!
author: Noor A.

description:
I am writing to inform you all that I have now been here whilst sober and it totally holds up!! 

Still pretty amazing while drunk though.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I'm not a big pizza fan, so I wasn't enthusiastic about going to Golden Boy Pizza.

But boy, was I proven WRONG!

This pizza is probably the best I've ever had in my LIFE! I got a slice of the vegetarian and it words cannot describe how delicious this slice of pizza is.  The pizza's here are shaped in a square, and they're a thicker crust. I don't like NY style pizza, so I was happy when I bit into the pizza that it was doughy and soft.  One slice was huge and I had trouble finishing it.  The price isn't too bad either, not too cheap but not crazy expensive. It's a small shop that can get busy, so try to go on an off hour.  And remember that it's cash only.
author: Noelle H.

description: You're not coming here for ambiance. You're not coming here for customer service. You're coming here for freaking delicious pizza at ridiculously cheap (for SF) prices. It's a down and dirty kind of place. Pizza nowadays is actually pretty expensive (even at like, Round Table - what's with that??) but at Golden Boy you can order a whole sheet that feeds a good amount of people for a very reasonable price. Crust is thick and soft and I really enjoy the pesto and vegetable combinations. This is definitely a spot I have repeatedly visited.
author: Anna J.

description: While the pizza was tasty, the person behind the counter, the shorter stocky guy, on the evening of 4/9 was incredibly disrespectful to us. We'd been drinking and all we wanted was to finish our slice and leave. We mistakenly took someone's seat and only realized after we sat at the bar after it he put the slices on the bar. We were half way through the slice when he realized it and we  wanted to just finish the slice. He then told us that everyone at the bar thinks we are rude (ironic since we'd only been there in the front and long enough to just order and get one slice) and told us to get out. As we were leaving, he even encouraged the patrons to mock us as we left, forcing us out in an old-school bullying way. I don't live here and have traveled to more than 35 countries and I have never felt so unsafe. I would expect more professionalism from an establishment with such history.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Best pizza place in SF hands down.

Coming from nyc, I've spent a lot of time looking for good pizza in SF. There are many nice sit down pizza places, but few quick slices. Golden Boy is amazing. Best pizza I've had in a long time.
author: Kevin K.

description: Cool little neighborhood pizza joint that serves square slices of pizza. You'll be lucky to get a seat in here, but if not, you can scarf your slice down while you walk around North Beach. Even though the pizza is more doughy than I prefer, it's still pretty delicious and it goes perfectly with an ice-cold beer. I loved the garlic and clam combo, but I can see how this wouldn't be for everybody, especially if you're on a first date.
author: Ruel G.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is one of these perfect hole in the wall joints that San Francisco is famous for. It's got some great atmosphere and some awesome pizza. I usually find myself chowing down some of there out-of-this world clam and garlic pizza. It is loaded with garlic( big fan of anything garlic) and sprinkled with superb clams. Anyway, I'm giving this place 5-stars for amazing food and some unique clientel.
author: Matt O.

description:
This place is a nice complement to the other place we ate at in the area (Cafe Baonecci) on this trip.  This is purely a pizza place and does a thicker style pizza that's thicker/heavier.  It's pretty unique.  You can order by the slice (about $3.50-$3.75 a slice) and you'll probably need 2 slices for lunch.

The selection of pizzas is a lot more limited but I have to say, you MUST try the clam and garlic one.  Yes it sounds weird, but the combination of tastes and the tasty crust underneath was absolutely delicious!
author: Katie F.

description: This place is bananas good and the dudes who run it are sweet, courteous and make a good thick piece of pizza. I had the pesto veggie and my husband gobbled up a sausage...cash only some come prepared but well worth it as it's incredibly affordable for a huge slice.
author: Brooke M.

description:
WHAT?!? This Garlic Clam pizza is AMAZING (that's exactly what I said after taking a bite).

Cherylynn N was right. The crust was caramelized and crunchy, the dough inside was chewy yet light, and the garlic clam topping was packed with garlicky goodness. Even if you don't think you'd want to eat this, believe me, you will! 

This pizza is the perfect hangover food. All you need is a blood mary to go with it. Then you can restart the cycle. ;-)
author: Amy M.

description: I love the checker wrapping paper on the pizza slices.  It's kind of steamy once you walk in & see the little bar inside.  Can only say great taste things about their slices, tons of calories.  Can't wait to go back again.  Now this is a neighborhood where just about anybody might know your name once you're a regular hang around.
author: BanBan B.

description: I Wasn't Sure What To Expect . Small Cafe Off Columbus, Limited Street Parking , However They Have A Delicious Array Of Pizza By The Slice . A Great Place For A a Quick Lunch !
author: Gregory P.

description: Spent the day in San Francisco with a friend.  We walked, we drank and we started to get hungry as only had a few appetizers.  We stopped for a couple of slices and I must say the clam and garlic pizza is my favorite!!!  I usually like my pizza super thin, but there is nothing wrong at all with Golden Boy Pizza!!!!!
author: Noel K.

description: Very very good. Unique crust. Excellent flavor combinations. Would have given 5 stars but there is practically no seating and it is beyond hot inside. Also the wine was not great.
author: India G.

description: The crust was super crispy!  There was so much cheese! I loved the veggie-sausage.  Pepperoni was good, service was quick, the slice was piping hot.  Although the pesto-clam was reputable, I didn't care for it.  I'm a fan of the classics!  I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Elise G.

description: This is the best pizza I've ever eaten.  I got the garlic clam and by boyfriend got the combination.  The crust is what makes it for sure.  It's thick, but not too thick and has just enough crunch to it.  I'll never be able to eat pizza anywhere else.  Thanks Golden Boy Pizza!
author: Marie N.

description: If you want pizza.. this is it. Simple, solid pizza. Everything about this place is great. Service, atmosphere and food are just spot on.
author: Tom F.

description:
Square Pizza is kind of irregular food like: 
use square white bread for a hamburger
or spam sushi, shit like that.
But this shit is Bad, it means GOOD, very GOOD SHIT!!!
The pizza is so hot and so square like bitch!
I love all of them, bitches and son of bitches.
It is so ghetto-food like. But, come to think of, most modern fancy foods are came from ghetto food, like Sushi as example. Sushi was once low-life people's snack in japan before. So as Ramen.

I must say, the best pizza by slice in the city.
I've been here for many times but I totally forgot to review, I think because I come here too often, there are many places I go but do not review.

Also, the place does not need Yelp reviews to get popular. 
The place is strong enough to keep the business going without all dombass YELP HIP STARS.

Hey Golden Boy, You Rock! 
You Don't Need the Stupid looking round red Yelp sticker.
author: Nobu K.

description: Really great pizza! Sold by the slice and in squares, very light, but cooked almost perfectly just the right crunchiness. Got the "combo" slice, sausage and pep, tomato, spinach and onion. Deliciousness, tried the cheese as well, excellentness. Atmosphere was cool, spinny bar stools and bring a sticker or a sharpie and mark your territory on the wall.
author: Ryne O.

description: Delicious! Go for the combination ! Music and ambiance is great. Service is quick and very welcoming .
author: Bryce M.

description:
This place would be glorious for anyone not sober. 
When I did eat here sober, however, I experienced a nostalgic satisfaction that paralleled the frozen Totino's pizza that I used to eat as an after-school snack. Actually, that's a good thing. Totino's doesn't taste like I remembered it, but GoldenBoy does!  

Cramped space, but the badass staff will hand your slice through the window when ready. Also, what is this clam and garlic pizza?? It's never available when I visit!
author: Diane N.

description: Amazing pizza. Crispy and square. Friendly staff. $3 per slice. $1.25 sodas. Veggie is with pesto.
author: Devon T.

description:
GOLDEN BOY PIZZA, YOU ARE DELICIOUS!!!!!

Late nigh grub at this place. its not your average sit down fancy pizzeria. Its more like a bar that offers pizza. the pizza is nicely displayed in their front window and you just pick what you want. we tried their combination(my favorite), pepperoni, sausage and: 
CLAM AND GARLIC-my take on this pizza is; its pretty good, its actually delicious, it sounds weird but it works so well. BUT your breath....well your breath will stink, maybe for days. so beware. at the end i think its worth it.

My favorite was the combination which pretty much has everything, the toppings are so generous. this pizza is not ur thin crust or your thick crust, its just perfect, two slices and you're full.
author: Matthew S.

description: This pizza was AMAZING!!!! One slice is plenty for one person, you can grab and go or sit inside. Definite worth waiting if they have a line.
author: Tiffany L.

description: all the way from stockton,ca. 50 dollars a box though :(
author: Aaliyah T.

description:
Yep, yelpers.

This place is good AND cheap. $5 for a combo slice and a large diet coke.  (I think I could eat this lunch everyday...)

Not much to add, but like a lot of meals, this could have been even better if I were drunk.  no worries still delish sober.

mmmmmm....mmmmmmm good
author: Amy W.

description:
There's something about walking on grant at 2 am, plastered out of your mind, barely standing up and having the responsibility to still be the sarcastic asshole that you usually are with your friends. Stumbling along that road packed with idiots trying to spit game at 2 am and the ones being kicked out of the bars just to return at opening time, that smell hits you.

It smells like garlic broth, ew. Undeterred you walk towards that smell. Hey look, there's more hipster dressed, zonked people standing in a queue. For a second  it makes me think that I'm back in London but then I remember that these people are way too civilized and there's no kebab shops around. Looking up there's a sign that proudly proclaims the history of California - GOLDEN boy pizza. See what I did there? No? Piss off.

Slowly you trudge along the line with other decrepits, telling your significant other to stay there while you run ahead and look at the goodies proudly displayed behind the window - cheese, pepperoni, pesto and the breath killer: Clam and Garlic. Then you realize that you have to go back to the end of the line :( where it's still okay because you can get a hug from your SO. 

10 minutes later....


You're finally there! Oh wait, this douchebag forgot to ask for some parmesan cheese. C'MON. You finally muster up a smile for the nice girl who is decent enough to keep serving pizza at 2 am and doesn't give two shits that you've just had to wait 15 minutes for a slice and order a "clam and garlic please". She picks it up and with the dexterity of someone who's done this multiple times before, puts it in the oven and makes you wait some more. You bloody tease.

It's okay though...the first bite is heaven and soon you've scarfed down all of it. Then you try to kiss your SO and she turns her head away :(. That's okay, you're still devious and give her the last bite. hahaha she can't not kiss you now, you both have the same bad breath. 

Smiling, you walk back onto grant and resume the walk, acknowledging that it was a great night.
author: Minks M.

description:
I try to hit up good ole golden boys when I make a trek back home.  It had been a while since I last visited GBs and its just how I remembered it.  A hole in the wall joint with nothing to prove and great pizzas. There isn't much to the place: a long bar that you can call dibs on a stool, mirrors layered with stickers, and the sweet smell of a perfectly kneaded dough baking in the oven.  

There are a variety of pizzas you can order. From a clam to your ordinary pepperoni, but the key part about these pizzas is the dough.  Its somewhat like a foccacia style dough, not to thick and not thin at all.  Just perfect. So grab a stool, plant your ass down, order a beer and a slice, and take in the moment as you bite into you slice of pizza.  

Pros:
The dough
Selection of beers

Cons:
Can be slow
Finding a place to sit
Homeless out front
author: T C.

description: This place was worth the hype.  I let my friend drag me here on a recent Friday, and was disappointed when there was a line as I was starving, but I'm glad we waited.  The clam and garlic was one of the best pizzas I've ever tasted - the crust, sauce, and toppings were just so delicious.  And the line moved relatively quickly, so the wait wasn't unreasonable for a Friday night.  Will definitely be back, and will be recommending it to others.
author: Joe T.

description:
Solid sicilian style pizza. Good crunch to the outside, soft and chewy on the inside, edges slightly burnt just enough to give it some texture. Fresh ingredients, heavier on the cheese and lighter on the sauce. 

Clam/ Garlic - awesome!! LOVE the intense garlic flavor. Didn't taste the clams much. But this is for all the garlic lovers out there!

Pesto/ Vegetarian - nice strong flavor on the pesto. 

Combination (tomatoes, onions, olives, sausage, pepperoni) - not much sausage to speak of! I had a quarter of a slice and didn't even get to try a piece. Otherwise good but doesn't stand out particularly in flavor.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
One of my favorite post- going out pizza joints.

Garlic clam parsley pizza and the mixed veggie pizza- win.

*The simultaneous crunchy/soft crust is the best part.

The line gets long after 1:00AM so come before the bars close to avoid them. Not much seating in there and if you do, you'll be awkwardly facing the wall or the oven while you and your friends sit in a line. :)

-HungryHungryPongy
author: Sangita A.

description: F-ING BOMB DOT COM!! One of the best tasting pizza spots and they just so happen to be fairly cheap! Highly recommend!
author: Kasandra S.

description: Have heard of this famous place for a while and finally went to the place to grab a piece today! I was hesitant between the garlic clam pizza and the combo and decided to play safe by getting the combo pizza. The crust is very thick and the toppings are very fresh. Also they have a good selection of beer on tab. Must be a favorite Sunday spot to grab pizza, drink beer, and watch Giants baseball on their flat screen. I agree with the other commenters that if think crust pizza is your thing, then this place is probably not for you.
author: Olivia H.

description: This is one of the best by-the-slice pizzas in the city. The rectangular slices are thick and filled with hearty toppings. The dough is slightly thicker and holds it's shape without being overcooked. It's CASH only, and there's usually a small queue, but the wait is short and it's so worth it!
author: Sofie G.

description: Yum. Solid good pizza. To bad is so far from me and parking sucks but if your out there is definitely a place to stop and get a slice.
author: Chiara M.

description: Small on space, big on taste.  Good ambiance for good pizza.  Brought the kids with us last time and even though it was a tight fit they loved the pizza.
author: Julieta O.

description: Hands down, not even close, the greatest pizza I've ever had (and I've had a lot). Got a combo slice and a garlic clam slice. I describe this as the LSD version of pizza: there is life before this pizza, and life after this pizza. This is essential.
author: Steven C.

description: The pizza is something of a religious experience. The clam and garlic pizza will change your life. The crust is great and the toppings galore. It is a hole in the wall with diner barstool seating with great pizza and music.
author: Charlie F.

description:
Nom Nom Nom.. I've only been here once, but I'm dying to come back!
I ordered the combo slice last time which has a combination of meat and veggies, and WHOLE veggies of that. I've never had a slice of pizza that had equal ratio of veggies to meat so it was a nice surprise to not eat fattiness dripped in oil. There's standard cheese, pepperoni and the interesting pesto clam! (which I want to try sooo badly) The best part of this place is that theres a glass window that lets you see the slices of pizza right in front of you. You can definitely see the difference between pipping hot-out-of-the-oven pizza versus stale-been-out-there-forever pizza. The slices are also not triangular shape but nice little squares. This means that you can be lucky and get the crust or some may prefer the gooeyness of the inside slice that falls right off. Anyways, I am totally salivating as I am writing you this because it is THAT good. It is open late, cheap than other gourmet pizza places and quick!!! The only downside is that it's a bit pricier than I normally pay for a slice. But then again, my latest pizza endeavors happen to be at costco or a whole pizza at dominos -_____-
author: Anh Thu P.

description:
Golden Boy has got some pretty criminal tactics. They've got no business displaying such delectable-looking slices in their shop window, for all to see. To think that they're located in the heart of North Beach's drinking district? Preying on those with poor, alcohol-compromised judgment? For shame! You call it marketing -- I say it's exploitation.

That said, I would gladly let Golden Boy exploit me (but only on my cheat days, please). The crust is as perfectly bready as a Sicilian slice should be, and delightfully crisped on the edges with oil. And those toppings... That clam and garlic combo should be illegal (!) but, um, I'm glad it's not.
author: Julie D.

description: There was a line but the pizza was really good (Thick, cheesy, perfectly crispy crust) and the two women working behind the counter were very friendly and patient despite the line never seeming to die down and a loud and rowdy bachelor party coming in.
author: Sylvia D.

description: I used to really love this place but I'm starting to think it's over rated. Don't get me wrong, it's still really good pizza, open late, service is fast and the people are chill. But more and more I realize there's more hype here than there is amazing pizza. I.E. the quality-to-hype ratio is diminishing.
author: Ben H.

description:
Tight space with low lighting. Much more narrow dive bar than traditional pizza parlor, but the sicilian styled slices are very good. They have some interesting styles and flavors so come with an open mind (and tummy). 

The perfect place to grab a quick bite after hitting a few bars or after a few good games of hoops!
author: Manny M.

description:
We were visiting SF for a friend's birthday, and one of the guests, upon realizing our hotel was so close to here, suggested that we come by.  We got to the golden boy pizza at 1:30 am, and there was a very long line.  Leo said "well, at least we know it'll be fresh!", so we tried to be cheery.  
The crowd here was loud, and a few seemed to be drunk... like out of their mind drunk, and this was accompanied with a strong smell of weed, so the 40 minutes wait was really unpleasant. 

I was disappointed by the pizza too.  The pizzas are already made, and are reheated in an oven.  So I guess this is the kind of place you go to after you've been bar hopping or clubbing; not the kind of place you'll go to if you are on a visit to San Francisco in search of something unique or amazing.
author: Moozhan T.

description:
I always try to stop by this place when in SF and have been here about a dozen times.  This is my favorite favorite favorite pizza place in North Beach/Italy Town. They offer thick crusted, square slices of pepperoni, clam and garlic, pesto veggie/combo, and a red sauce combo. They also heat your slice up in the oven. Crispy yumminess!

Parking is sometimes hard but if you drive around or park far enough you'll eventually get a spot. You'll need quarters as most of the meters are still the old ones that don't accept credit cards.

This is a bar.  I've had a beer here before and it's fun with the TV's but I usually prefer to get my pizza to-go. I say get the pizza to-go, walk over to the park that's at the bottom of the street, sit on the benches or grass and enjoy your pizza.

This would be a 5 star review if the worker that took my order on my last visit had listened when I only wanted one slice, wasn't condescending about ordering 1 slice, and didn't automatically put my $1.25 change into her change tip jar. I ain't tipping you lady! 

My (probably not needed but will say anyway) advice for Golden Boy: 
 
1. Realize that you sell pizza by the slice and that it is okay to sell one slice at a time. "Rome wasn't built in a day," has never rang truer!

I stopped by Golden Boy to grab a slice after a day of touring SF's other culinary treasures because I truly love you. 

Where's that great service I read about in another yelper's review saying they'll even cut your slices into smaller pieces so you can share?!

2. Don't steal your customers change, no matter how small or tempting it may be. Tips will be given when you give good service!

Perhaps this is one rotten worker in an otherwise awesome place. Here's to hoping for a nicer employee next time I come.
author: Cole T.

description:
Mouth waters thinking about Golden Boy. Man if you like sicilian pizza this place is great. They're quick about getting the pizza warm and out of the single serve window so don't get scared away by a line(especially at 12 am). 

The pesto clam pizza is great as is the all veggie. Really happy to have this place in the nieghborhood.
author: Nicholas H.

description: Best pizza EVER!! Absolutely delicious and flavorful .. only down side is that it's in a location that crowded and hardly has any street parking.
author: Mimi W.

description: So delicious!  I am addicted.  It is not your classic type of pizza.  It is even better on a slightly crunchy dough and great spices in the sauce.  I have a love/hate relationship living a block away.
author: Jillian C.

description: Great pizza made fresh and sold by the slice (or square).  All slices cut in squares and delicious!  Sit at the bar and mix with some tourists.  Only a few blocks from my office and worth the walk.
author: Paul S.

description: If you have been out in North Beach and haven't been here you're just a dummy. $3-4 slices of gooey amazingness.
author: Melissa R.

description:
I forgot the name of this place so I typed up "square pizza" in the search box. As expected, this showed up first on the list. The name clicked as I read the name out loud: Golden Boy Pizza. For me to not remember the name of a restaurant or in this case, a pizza joint, indicates trouble ahead...

My friend and I came here during a sunny, yet windy day. We really wanted breakfast food but the line at Mama's Restaurant was ridiculously long. I've heard amazing things about this pizza joint so we decided to walk over and grab a slice to eat. I ordered a slice of the veggie pizza with pesto sauce while my friend ordered a slice of the combination. Total cost came out to be about $8. Because the pizza are typically left out at room temperateure in the window display, the worker had to pop our pizza slices into the oven to reheat them. It was the longest five minutes of my life. My mouth salivated as I built up high expectations in my head about how orgasmically-delicious the pizza will taste.
