Luckily, a SF Giants game on one of their TV screens distracted me from the growling of my stomach.

When the pizzas finally came out of the oven, my eyes widened! ...but slowly drooped back down. The cheese wasn't bubbly. It looked rather plain. I took a bite. Hm, it was lukewarm. I added a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese and red pepper flakes. Nope, it didn't add any extra pizazz to the pizza. The only thing I really liked about their pizza is the crust. It's flaky and kind of buttery. 

Maybe my friend's right. Maybe Golden Boy Pizza tastes better when you're drunk.
author: Annie S.

description: Stop by this after a giants game and to my surprise wow!!! The pizza was amazing!!! Some of the best pizza I've had in the bay area!!! I had to come nation and the pepperoni pizza squares and boy were they delicious!!! There is a little bit of a line any waiting time but is well worth it once you taste their pizza you'll be a believer after one bite!!!
author: Carlos F.

description: Great pizza! The staff could be friendlier, and the fact that they don't accept ATM (debit or credit) is a little annoying. If your planning on coming here, parking is a little difficult to find, but the pizza is worth it! Would be 5 stars if the accepted ATM. CASH ONLY
author: Kenny C.

description:
'Tis my second time to the Bay area and only my second time to Golden Boy Pizza--how come? On my last trip--almost a year ago--I ended with pizza slices from Golden Boy, which left a great last memory. Now that I am back, and it is the start of my second trip, I begin with their pizza slices.

If you looking to grab a (very) late night bite or some dinner to go--they're open late!--Golden Boy Pizza is a great place to go if you are in the North Beach area, in my opinion. I do not think you can complain about the price and the quality of the pizza. I will however try to make it earlier next time so I can grab a beer.

The toppings--your meats, red sauce, cheese, veg etc.--are set atop a slightly thick, but light, soft, and moist crust. I must note that the veg has always looked and tasted very good.

A few notes and echoing as made by other Yelpers: it's cash only; don't be going in expecting a New York-style pizza; there can be a line--in other words, just be prepared. As a parting thought, I would suggest giving this place a try and see if you like it.
author: Larry Oliver C.

description:
Knowing Golden Boy Pizza serves Sicilian pizza.....I was in luv before I even came here 

Decided to enjoy the rare warm summer day & walk over on my lunch hour 

And for those who know me, I'm a now & later kind of girl so I got slices for now & slices for later.... 

For now - Pesto Vegetarian - doughy crust, lots of cheese, super-flavorful pesto, tons of olives & shrooms mixed w/ tomatoes & zucchini. I had an end piece & a middle piece & can say the crust was consistently crunchy on the bottom & doughy on top for both slices 

For later - Plain Cheese & there was nothing plain about it.....these babies were the same consistency w/ the crunchy-doughy crust 

If I had more time to spend, meandering around NoBch to get here, I'd come back in a heartbeat! 

And for the people who mention this is away from the tourist traps.....they forgot to mention that you'll have to wade *through* the sea of slow-moving, picture-taking, map-reading, sidewalk-hogging, gawking tourists to get here...

.....so plan accordingly 

Round trip from BofA Bldg? 1 hr 

CASH ONLY
author: Adrienne G.

description: Love Golden Boy! Best pizza in San Francisco. Favorite is the garlic & clam. Tip: order a full sheet.
author: Michael S.

description:
3.5 stars maybe?

Came here on a Saturday afternoon around 5PM when there was no line (score!). I've always wanted to try this place, but never wanted to wait in line. So when I passed by and noticed no line, I decided to give this place a try. I ended up getting the Garlic, Clam, and Parsley pizza, and while it was good, I'm not sure if it's worth the hype. I couldn't really taste ANY of the clam, which was a bit disappointing. However, I can see this as an awesome place to go to for drunk munchies!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I don't remember how my girlfriends and I got here the other night, but I do remember how clutch it was when we got in right before they closed the door around 1am!! The line and wait was ridiculously long, however all was forgiven once we got to make googly eyes at the pizzas by the window.

After claiming our wanted pizza slices, I stared at my combo for some time thinking theres no way I can pick it up and eat it. It was hot from the oven, crust-less, big in a square shaped, and too greasy and soft... So I clumsily stabbed it with a knife and fork.

While taking few bites of my pizza... I kept looking over friend's pesto vegetable pizza. It looked tastier and succulent than my combo for some odd reason. Luckily my dear friend notices and she kindly traded our pizzas. From then on I happily ate the slice.

So honestly... I can't review how the pizza tasted, but if you're in need for a better review then please check out my friend Jessica's yelp. :)

http://www.yelp.com/biz/golden-boy-pizza-san-francisco#hrid:BwLiAvzvWXeRn_olr7kFOw

-1 star for the wait. And another -1 for the sick feeling from the greasyness & crust-less.
author: Zha L.

description:
Thank you Yelp God for leading us to yet another yummy place to eat! I got a classic plain cheese pizza and it did not disappoint. This style of pizza is a mix between New York and Chicago pizza. Great sauce, buttery crust that's not too thin or too thick and golden cheese. Perfection at it's best. The place is cool as well.
Would I go back? Hell yes!
author: Ming T.

description: Really good pizza and really good service. I will eat here again and again.
author: David R.

description:
Great pizza, great prices, great service, excellent hours!

Open way late into the night, and if you're out on the town clubbing, partying, or what not and find yourself starved to death... Huzzah! Golden Boy Pizza is here to save the day!

Cash only is the only downfall. Seriously though, the pizza is always piping fresh, and is only around $3 for a rectangular slice of pizza. Focaccia bread pizza is the way to go. Godsent pizza in the AMs, I tell you.
author: Colleen M.

description:
This is my favorite pizza by the slice place (in SF). If you ever get the craving for just a solid slice of pizza, this is it....definitely it! The slices here are made well. Nice and greasy too! I like how the slices come in squares, I even like the nice checkered to go paper wrap your order comes in. They're of good size, and well priced too! Open late night!

Man, I can do a slice right about now! I'm fiending for that oh so cheesy goodness!

Paolo says: Perfect for late night drunken munchies!! 5 slices of what ever please!!
author: Paolo V.

description: Great little hole in the wall pizza place! Simply the best we have had in sf. Perfectly crispy crust and tasty sauce with the perfect amount of toppings make it worth the travel from wherever you are in the city!!
author: Michelle M.

description: The pepperoni slice of pizza I just ate melted in my mouth and went down without that heavy feeling.  So good,  reminds me of the pizza I had in Chicago.  Will be back!
author: Nate S.

description:
Three words: Clam. Garlic. Pizza.

I was a bit surprised when we arrived Golden Boy, after my friend went on and on about how their pizza is very good.  This is a tiny hole in the wall, and the pizza that you are about to order and eat are just sitting in the window, facing the street, waiting to be consumed.  I was a bit skeptical.

Friend told me to get the clam garlic pizza, and I was thinking to myself, clam on a pizza?  The garlic better be very strong to cover the fishy smell... nonetheless, I still got it because I am a total pushover. 

When I cut into the pizza, I was instantly amazed by how soft the top part was, yet the bottom of the pizza was crispy, and the amount of toppings they put on each square is plentiful! 

I loved the aroma of the garlic, yet it did not completely cover up the taste of the clam.  No fishiness to this clam pizza as the little clams tasted fresh, sweet and juicy.  The garlic and parsley bits were also a little crispy, making a contrasting texture against the soft, fluffy dough.

This is a great place to grab a quick bite, and the prices are good, too!
author: Peggy S.

description: The pizza was good, the restaurant was small, but there were places to sit down. I also felt like they were trying to get us out of there quick and they weren't even closing. I might give it another try if I'm in the area.
author: Gisel F.

description: To put it simply, best pizza in the universe. It's square, it's big enough to have to use a fork and knife when you eat, and it's served super fresh and super hot out of the oven.
author: Lissette V.

description: Goooood pizza and beer. I ordered mine and started eating as soon as it was handed to me. Swapped a bite with a friend and theirs had been heated in the oven, and mine was stone cold! Theirs was much better due to slightly crispier crust and hot cheese. However, since mine was still good cold, I will have to go again and rewrite a review if I get a hot piece :)
author: Sarah B.

description: I finally tried them during a regular weekday lunch hour and have to admit Golden Boy Pizza is definitely a cut above, at least their storied garlic & clam slice is.  I enjoyed the restaurant's stool-only slap-dash counter seating; very informal w/a diner-type vibe (half of the 20 or so seats were available during the late lunch period).  The young woman server was comely, personable and efficient.  All good good good.  Not only did the pizza come more or less fresh from the oven, but the ingredients were of high quality, provided a wonderful chewy consistency, and they absolutely do NOT scrimp on either the clams OR garlic (much to the probably dismay of some workmates after I returned).  I had a second piece of a sausage only pizza, and although it was good enough on its own, it simply didn't hold a candle to the G&C slice.  BTW, I'm not sure where else one can purchase slices-only of a garlic & clam pizza so that made GBP extra spectacular.  I had a couple of glasses of their house red which I thought to be a nice accompaniment (but I'll have the ubiquitous beer next time just for the tradition).  While the slice was large enough, I wasn't enamored with the rectangle shape -- obviously they make trays instead of round pans of pizza.  This didn't lend itself as convenient to eat the pizza with my hands (although I did here and there) -- I've had pizza in Naples before, but we're NOT in Italy.  Only because of that and the relative inferiority of the sausage slice compared to the G&C, I demoted a single star to an otherwise exemplary pizza experience but of course I WILL be returning (from here in the FiDi) THIS workweek.  I think that's about as sterling a testimonial to the overall enjoyment as one can give!
author: Michael B.

description:
Who doesn't love Golden Boy!?!? 
A North Beach classic, it's delicious, and they have a great atmosphere! I always stop in here for a slice whenever I'm in North Beach. Their pizza is always hot, the cheese is always melted goodness, and it makes you forget all about the calories for just one second. Needless to say, I always go back.
author: Ava W.

description: probably the best pizza I ever ate.  Well balanced and the crust is crunchy but yet soft. The waitress there name Lori I think, is a sweetheart. Just a beautiful personality. Highly recommend it to any pizza lover. Will come back with some friends.
author: Sal T.

description: Absolutely one of the best slices I've had in my entire life. My. Entire. Life. Eat there or your taste buds will hate you forever.
author: Brian W.

description:
This place is incredible. The service is quick, they prices are great, and the pizza is incredible. I recommend getting two slices to try multiple flavored. The clam and garlic was excellent, as was the pesto. I can't wait to go back to try the rest!

Remember to have cash on you! I got two slices in a to go box for $8.50.
author: Lillian E.

description: Unique and delish Pizza. An anchor steam on tap and a couple slices for a true San Fran Experience. I dream of this pie.i will be back someday.
author: Thomas A.

description: How can you not like pizza by the slice? It's perfect after drinking in the bars, or just to take a slice home to heat up the next morning.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
This place brings back fond memories of when i began exploring the city for food. My dad took me here to grab a slice way back in 2000 or 2003ish when i was just a kid/pre-teen while my mom was shopping for groceries. My first slice was the Veggie pizza, and I could remember as a kid biting into it. And immediately my taste buds were overloaded by it. Where to begin!?!

PROS
+Good Cheese - Follows you. No Pizza hut cheese here.
+Good Dough-Texture- Every bite, there's a CRUNCH from the dough they use. I've experienced this same kind of crunch but it was with much thinner pizza, and as a trade off it was less filling. But this is just WITCHCRAFT! Crunch in every bite and it's filling. (i think it's from a the second baking the slice gets when you order it)
+Fresh Ingredients (Fresh veggies on their veggie pizza, they used canned clams for the clam pizza, still amazingly delicious though)
+A very cool place to eat. The place is essentially a bar. With a plasma hanging near the door showing the latest sports game. There's seating in the back, but up front is mainly bar stools. 
+Bartender does double duty serving pizza. But whoever you get, they are usually super friendly and will strike up a conversation with you.

Cons
???
idk, maybe they don't have your favorite greek, Hawaiian, etc specialty pizza. They have Cheese, Pepperoni, Sausage, Combo, Veggie, or Garlic Clam. There is a part of their menu that says "If you don't see it, don't order it." which is pretty funny.

I re-discovered this place with some friends last week and i ordered 1 slice of Combo and 1 slice of Clam pizza. Let me just say, when i took that first bite, it was like that scene from ratatouille where the critic gets thrown back to his childhood. You can't really miss this place. Just follow the smell of the garlic from that Clam pizza. haha
author: Dustin T.

description:
While in San Fran on our way up the coast we Yelped ideas for lunch. So glad this spot was at the top of the list. 

Everyone working there was friendly as were the customers sitting at the bar. Service was quick and ordering is simple. They are cash only so keep that in mind. We tried a few different slices and they were all delicious. Their crust is AMAZING. 

The building is fun! Stickers and posters cover every inch of the walls and bathroom. Even with all the graffiti it seemed very clean.
author: Erin M.

description:
4 stars will probably turn into 5 after a second visit soon! My Girlfriend's brother stood in the quickly moving late-night Saturday line for such a short time, it was amazing. We took it to go back across the bay and the pies were still perfect when we got back home 20 minutes later. 
I had no idea what I was in for, but the rave reviews from my clan and jubilant outcries for a Golden Boy Pizza night by everyone else in the party were clue enough.
They ordered the Clam and Garlic pizza! Two of them! And they were easier to share and eat in the rectangular and square cut form. But seriously, who came up with such awesomeness as a Clam and Garlic pizza?! It was Outstanding! Though I was told I still smelled of garlic after several showers and several days later, I would get that one again. Can't wait to get back over to S.F. to try more of Golden Boy's Glories!
author: Mark T.

description: Delicious and well priced. Have loved all the kinds I've tried so far; always have done carry-out.
author: K. H.

description: This is one of the best Pizza especially if you out and about in town at night the staff is friendly the environment is great and the pizza is delicious. This is a must we had clam pizza pepperoni and special all were excellent we will be going back
author: Yolanda D.

description:
While visiting a cousin in San Francisco, she pointed out Golden Boy Pizza, stating the she heard it's "the best" pizza in the North Beach area.  On the hunt for grub after a busy day of solo walking and sightseeing, I popped in to grab a slice.  It's a small place, and apparently often very busy, with a line stretching out the door.  However, my visit was on a Wednesday night around 6 pm, and there were only a few other patrons there at the time.  I sidled up to an empty bar stool, and it was on.

I did not have the famous clam pizza, so I can't attest to it's degree of deliciousness, but if the plain cheese was any indicator of overall quality, I assume it lives up to its reputation.  The bartender will serve up drinks and big, fat squares of Sicilian style pizza, crunchy and doughy at the same time (served with knife and fork, if you're so inclined).  If I ever get back to SF, I'm going to make a point to get back to Golden Boy.
author: Christine S.

description: Great spot to get some pizza. Cool part of town for partying. I had slice of cheese and slice of pepperoni. Both really nice.
author: Mike W.

description:
Okay, this is just me, but, when I fly in to San Francisco, just after I check in, this is usually my first stop. I love this pizza!! I've tried several different pizzas, all I've had are good. The clam/garlic is unique, and excellent! My favorite is the Combination. 
The restaurant is small and often crowded. But then, I don't come here for plush, comfy seating. I come for the pizza. Good selection of beer to accompany.
author: Clint L.

description: We normally think that you have to pay a lot more to get a better meal, but Golden Boy blows that idea out of the water. The pizza here is simply incredible. The crust is perfectly done. The toppings are fantastic.  AND they have the best deal on beer in the city. We loved the pizza down to EVERY. LAST. BITE.
author: Liz L.

description:
I make a stop at the Golden Boy Pizza every time that I visit San Francisco. The "combination" pizza is superb! The dough, the ingredients, and  the taste are magnificent. The experience of visiting this place  will  go beyond your expectations.

This place is  a "MUST TRY" if you come to San Francisco.
author: I A.

description: Stopped by last night for a couple of squares and it was great! Had the cheese and the pesto veggie. The crust of the pie base is crispy and a little "stiff" (ends up providing a good stable base) - provides a very nice texture element. And the "inside" of the base is nice and soft. The sauce and the cheese are great, doesn't feel greasy at all. Very tasty!
author: Manjesh N.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. It is seriously one of North Beach's highlights. 

- Crust is essentially a deliciously tender yet firm Focaccia bread
- The variety of pizzas here are unique and worth exploring 
- The sausage pizza with red pepper flakes is OFF THE CHARTS! 
- Open into the wee hours of the night (until 2am) for drunken cravings, workaholics, post-dinner snacks, you name it. 
- Yes, there is almost always a line but I'm always impressed by the efficiency and friendliness of the staff 
- Giant square slices - you need only 1 on a normal day and maybe 2 on a gluttonous day

The reason I knocked off a star is because sometimes, when the pizza has been made an hour or so ago, the pizza slice is reheated for you. And it really doesn't taste as good as it does when it's freshly baked. 

But nonetheless, give this place a try and I guarantee your taste buds will love you and your abs will hate you.
author: Priya S.

description: Holy cow that's good pizza. Perfect space for the business. It's thick pizza. Don't go if you want a thin wedge: that is Tony's. This is its own thing and it's amazing.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Sensational slices of Sicilian pizza here. I was hyptonized first by the fact that Golden Boy has a window display of piping hot pizzas from their deck ovens. Walking past the narrow bar stool alley and situating myself in the rear while I waited for my friends, I was further hypnotized by the two chefs in the back going through the tedious routine of preparing dough, rotating pizzas currently in the oven, and slicing up finished pizzas. 

The dough preparation had a beautiful cadence to it, and a good sign that this is pizza worth a damn. When not preparing dough, the preparers would use nothing but a chef's knife and a towel to rotate the scorching hot pizza pan without so much of a though at burning their hands. Given my fear of burning myself in a toaster oven, I would fail miserably at this feat. 

At last, my party joined me and we prepared to indulge in some slices. After watching the preparers for the good part of 10 minutes like some starving creep, I proceeded to order 4 slices, doubling up on the works and rounding out my order with a pepperoni and a pesto slice. Why only 4? I had eaten dinner only two hours prior, and despite declaring myself as "stuffed," one snack during into a second dinner. 

Well, screw any remorse, because after my server provided me with four fresh slices of pizza and I took my first bite, holy hell was I in heaven. First of all, the Sicilian is just the perfect canvas for some quality low-moisture mozzarella, and Golden Boy matches that perfectly. The cheese marries the golden, crispy and doughy crust and sends you into pizza bliss, with each bite taking you closer to a culinary climax leaving you wanting more. 

The pepperoni was exceptional, with the perfect amount of sliced, rounded meat in every bite. The works was phenomenal too, just bursting with flavor without stealing the show from the marvelous cheese or crust. As for the pesto, I expected a little more basil flavor, but still enjoyed it enough to dream of my return to Golden Boy. Next time, I'm ordering a full pan and will eat it all.
author: Amir H.

description:
OMG. Clam and garlic pizza, is there anything else to say?! 

Where in the city can you get this in SQUARE form and on focaccia?! Nowhere (that I know of)!!!

My sister said she got two slices the last time she came here, so I happily ordered two slices for myself. She failed to mention that she only finished one and took the second slice to go! They are pretty large slices and they are hearty so it filled me up easily. 

The clam and garlic pizza was SO delicious. I mean you have to be a fan of clams and garlic or it'll be completely disgusting, but it wasn't to me! It was incredibly delicious. 

We got the sausage, pepperoni and combo slices as well. The Combo is totally worth it. They toss everything on there. The pepperoni and sausage were pretty laughable, only because the number of pepperoni on her "pepperoni" slice was 4 and her sausage slice also had four sausages as well. Why so skimpy on the meat but yet the combo is FILLED completely with toppings? So weird. 

Otherwise, the parking sucks here... it's North Beach/borderline Chinatown so what do you really expect? The pizza is totally worth the trip!

If only work was a little bit closer, I can see that slice of clam and garlic pizza in my life on a weekly basis!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Who says you can't judge a restaurant by the line out it's door? We wanted to see what all the hype was about while walking through the neighborhood so we waited in line. Be prepared to wait for a good couple minutes as all the pizza comes straight out of the oven. These pizzas are not your typical round sliced pizzas, their square and they pack lots of dough, cheese and delicious toppings with the perfect amount of crisp!

Worth the wait? I'd say so.
author: Andrew S.

description: Just around the corner from the amazing Tony's, Golden Boy is like a small, less visible, grungy version of Tony's, with its own excellent pizza. If you want the full restaurant experience and much more selection, go to Tony's; if you just want to dive into your pizza, Golden Boy is your dive.
author: Veg V.

description: Fantastic pizza with the perfect crust. Nice and light, not doughy, and a bit crisp around the edges. Amongst our family we ate sausage, pepperoni and combo slices. It's a very cramped location, but we found seats along the wall (where you sit literally face and knees to the wall). But since we were hungry and enjoyed the pizza so much, the location didn't bother us. In fact, it gives it a bit of personality. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Based on the line that formed behind us, it's obvious there are a lot of repeat customers. Wish there was one of these in San Diego.
author: Erin H.

description: Other than a long line, the pizza at Golden Boy was delicious. I tried the vegetarian pesto pizza but there was plenty of selection to suit your needs. Definitely worth a try if you're in the North Beach area.
author: Ubz D.

description: Been here a few times for a quick and cheap bite.  It's fantastic pizza, and it's fairly light.  Even with 2 or 3 slices, you won't leave feeling bogged down.  Friendly staff.  Good beer selection.  Insanely reasonable prices.
author: mario k.

description: The pizza was okay. The flavor was that of any chain restaurant. We had the cheese, veggie and pepperoni slices. The atmosphere is definitely geared to the college crowd. There was a line out the door when we arrived and we waited about fifteen minutes to order. Too long of a wait for mediocre pizza!
author: Jaki W.

description: So amazing, and so cheap! Will satiate drunkies roaming through North Beach just fine
author: Lauren R.

description: I saw a long line (out the door) and had to stop in and give it a try! The ordering is really simple, you let the girl (sorry, it's always been a girl) know which slice(s) you want and they stick them into an oven to warm them while you pay. ***CASH ONLY!*** You can have a seat along their bar, but I always take mine to go because it's a really tiny place. The pizza is delicious - I recommend their pepperoni and the veggie. I usually pay like $7.50 for two slices, which are surprisingly filling! Big fan, will (and have) returned! :)
author: Corrina S.

description: Easy, cheap (cash only by the way), and fun. The best part is when you're walking up to the restaurant and you get that amazing pizza/sausage/pepperoni/crust smell in the air, makes my mouth water. Lines for take-out get long so be prepared to wait a bit. Considering it's pretty small and crowded on the inside, the place seems pretty clean and very well organized. Staff is awesome- very helpful, humorous, and help keep the customers flowing in and out quickly. Great pizza by the slice! One of my favorites in the city for a quick and tasty pizza fix.
author: Charlotte C.

description: The pizza was delicious, the beers were cold and the atmosphere was rad. I was looking for a more hole in the wall divey pizza joint and I found it. There is awesome music on, TVs to watch the game, and fresh slices of pizza ready for you. I definitely recommend coming here, but it's hard to find a seat when it's busy. Just pop a squat at the bar. Staff was really friendly too so I would definitely go back.
author: Amy A.

description: Just had the best slice of pizza in my life! I had the veggie pesto. The crust was thick, but extremely light and crunchy. And all the vegetables had been roasted to perfection.
author: Earl B.

description:
This is the best Sicilian style pizza anywhere. Though I live in Los Angeles, I often work for a day or two in the Bay Area, and I almost always make a run to get a slice or a whole damn pie here.

The prices are reasonable, and the consistency is good.

Parking can be tricky as it's located in North Beach, but I usually arrive late in the evening so I've gotten lucky.

They also have a great beer selection.
author: Matt B.

description: The reviews are correct. This place is the bomb. If you want some real MF pizza, get on it.
author: Patrick B.

description: Great pizza!!  It's very fresh they have about 5 or 6 different varieties to choose from.  The space is very narrow but they have stools to sit and a few tables in the back.  They also offer beer :)
author: Lisa G.

description:
Pizza reminds me of the north end Boston 
Big difference from California pizza compared to Boston. recommended if you like a good pizza 

A must try.
author: Bill M.

description: My boyfriend and I smelled how good it was and made it definite must. The pizza was perfect with a thick crust and real Italian sausage. After getting one slice for dinner, and bar hopping a bit, we actually ended up going back for another piece! They have some great beers on tap too.
author: Hannah V.

description: Searched Yelp for an hour looking for a great pizza place. Found Golden Boy by chance in North Beach. We loved this place... Pizza was phenomenal! Reasonable prices. Roberto had his pizza craft on display in the kitchen like that of a prize fighter. If you have a chance... Head over and grab a slice.
author: Kristopher B.

description:
A decent spot to get a cheap slice of pizza. It's one of the best slices you can get in the area. Not the best place to sit down unless you've had a few. The music, which is mostly punk and metal, is annoyingly terrible and loud.

The pizza is tasty, and the crust is the real highlight here. Crunchy, thick and light at the same time. Never had anything like it. The restaurant is not a place where you would want to spend a lot of time. Basically eat and leave. But the pizza is satisfying.
author: Brian C.

description: I wanted to like this place based off of how highly rated it was on yelp, but after some pretty awful service, I couldn't bring myself to give money to this business.  Golden boy, you need to do something about your cashier with the trashy, bleached 'do, and a stink face to match.  I can understand if someone is having a bad day, but there's no excuse for bad service, or more specifically being a major B-word to a customer for no reason.  After that sour interaction, we had to leave & went to Calzones down the street, which was a WAY more pleasant experience.  Sorry golden boy, but that girl with the mop on top of her head lost you business with her crappy attitude.
author: Sarah L.

description: Best pizza in sf.  5 star no problem.  Be prepared for a line. 6 drinks 6 slices $31 . This is defiantly the late night joint to stop to
author: Mark S.

description:
Yes, I'm a fan again!  I should have updated my review at least 2-3 months ago and miraculously, everything appear to be back on track.  Is it the cook or ?  Don't know but I like the change...for the better for sure!

The pizza is once again piping hot with crispy crust, no more soggy undercooked pizza - YEAH!
author: Gloria H.

description:
Much better experience this time around. It could have been because I was absolutely starving and would have consumed a card board box had it been in front of me, but nonetheless, Golden Boy saved the day. 

We hit up the All Shook Down festival in North Beach on Sunday and for a quick bite at $3.75, I had to give it another change. Although I still wouldn't consider it one of my favorites pizza joints, GB's crust was crispy, had ample toppings and was all around pretty damn decent. Yay for square doughy goodness!
author: Julia N.

description:
How good is the clam and garlic pizza? Well, I am allergic to shellfish,  but I will still eat it. That is all you need to know.

Order it and drunken folk will visibly check out your pizza.
author: Steffi L.

description:
Some women like to look at diamonds and jewelry or at shoes in the when they window shop.... guess what I like to look at?? 

Good Crust... If I was not so full from all of the stuff I ate at the Ferry Building I would have had a whole slice instead of 1/6th of the slice. 

Dang it.. I knew I should have paced myself.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Great pizza, very unique pan style with lots of flavor.
The staff is very friendly and kind! Way to go!
author: Kostin D.

description:
Clam and garlic pizza....whoaaaaa!

It was SOO good and such a different flavor. Packed with garlic- which is my favorite thing on food.  My friends thought it was a sandwich because of the shape and how it was wrapped but once I opened it they were so jealous. I wish it had a teeny bit of salt on it to bring out the great flavors more. Or ranch? Oh well. Next time.
author: Cesie A.

description:
Great experience. My cousin took me here around 3PM on a Sunday. We were looking for a snack and cheap beers. Somehow this place runs with 2 people and  a line out the door. 
Pizza was good but not the best. Beer was good cold and priced right. For what we were looking for, everything worked out swimmingly.
author: Josh F.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the pizza is good. However, i am one grumpy customer if I feel I am being taken advantage of and treated with total lack of respect. 

I ordered a pizza on the phone, was quoted a price and was told that I have to pay cash only. So far, so good. I show up to pick up the pizza and suddenly the price of my pizza has gone up. When I pointed out that the price I was told on the phone and the price written on their ticket matched and were less than what they were now asking me to pay, all the had to say was "it's mistake, the price is _(new price)_".

So now I'm faced with two unhappy alternatives, let the pizza get cold and walk to the nearest Wells Fargo to get more cash or to pay $5 in ATM fees on their ATM machine.   With not as much of real apology or attempt to correct their error. I know this may not influence others, but out of principle I'm keeping my business away from this place. 

From a very very unhappy customer.
author: Anna J.

description: This pizza is fantastic. Especially the garlic & clam yummy!!
author: Tanisha F.

description: Cheese squares and IPA is my power lunch.
author: Ivan S.

description: The pizza here is great even though they have a few options. There is beer inside on tap and bar stools to sit in case it's cold outside. Friday and Saturday nights are packed with a long line especially after all the bars close.
author: Omar K.

description:
i don't get the hype?

seniores is better, so is gaspares, and village pizza.

its good, probably amazing when you're wasteyface, but i dunno man, i would never crave it.
author: Peter T.

description:
Care for a square? Great spot for a pizza pie, catching the game, or even to get hyphy? They need to give me their playlist. Eclectic mix of Talib, Kanye, 90's, and that Bay music! But enough about the awesome music, onto the pizza! Not a huge fan of their pesto because unfortunately, Little Star set the bar way too high for everyone else. But I loved my plain cheese pizza. I absolutely love love love cheesy gooey pizza, and Golden Boy's certainly hits that hearty spot. I also love that they give out knives and forks for those dining in. How did they know I've discovered my fancy self lately? 

P.S this is also a good place to er, recompose oneself, after a night of courage juice fueled shenanigans. Cheaps, delicious, filling, why not?
author: Jen L.

description: Very good, bready pizza. The crust is almost like focaccia, but with buttery, crispy edges. Great toppings. Fun, dive bar atmosphere with a counter facing the kitchen and beer taps. The clam pizza is special. Give it a try.
author: John P.

description: Quick stop in for slice, can be super crowded though. Cash only and limited menu but great pizza.
author: Janice R.

description: My friends and I were in little Italy looking for  a restaurant on Valentine's Day. I noticed this place while walking by from the long waiting line and I was like this pizza must be good. We had dinner and then went to a bar. Later we came out and the place was still open with another line of people waiting. I had to try it and it looked so good on the glass front. We got three slices, Pepperoni, Compo, and a vegetarian for me. Seriously good pizza and the crust was to die for. This is a legit pizza place! Take care, they take cash only. Thank God I had $5 :D
author: Sherihan E.

description: Perfect pizza but bad customer service , we wait for 20 mins in line 2 at the morning and the lady was very inpatient with us and she had the attitude like she was doing us a favor... Not coming back
author: jim e.

description: Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Topped off with lovely staff, a great beer selection and dive bar decor. We went with a friend from Northern Italy who confirmed that the quality was top notch. If you are in San Fran and don't eat here, you are a stupid moron.
author: Glenn R.

description: Golden Boy Pizza can best be described as Little Caesar's with quality ingredients. It's no-frills, it's convenient, and it satisfies on a small budget. Don't expect wood-fire or deep-dish goodness here; other than some fancy toppings like pesto and garlic, this one's strictly by the books.
author: Casey S.

description:
I'm not a pizza eater,especially having it for breakfast,considerring I work during graveyard-shift.

Wifey had a long day and was too lazy to cook tonight. So she passed by the crowded pizzeria and saw the pizza-man pulled the pizza straight out of the oven. She bought an assortment of slices of pizza to bring home for the 3 kids,including me. It was crowded at the time of the visit, because there was a football game.

I had the Vegetarian slice,which was amazingly delicious and still hot. The kids had a delicious combination slice, which also came straight out of the oven. This is my first time eating at Golden Boy Pizza and I enjoyed every bite of my breakfast, I mean pizza.
author: Matt G.

description:
There really isn't much to say other than that the pizza is a square, it's cheap (about $4 a slice) and it's tasty. 

It's open late so you can always count on this place after a late night in North Beach. 

The inside is pretty small so don't go thinking you'll be coming here with a crew of 20. Chances are you'll eat your pizza outside.
author: Carlos A.

description: Very delicious and addictive pizza!! the combo is a must to try! One of my favorite pizza joints in SF.
author: Roberto M.

description:
I rarely fall in love with just one pizza maker but I must admit that this here is love! I'm not only saying this because it was 2am and I've had a couple of drinks, because I've had pizza after 2am before. Not like this though. Not like this. 

I wasn't expecting much just a quick fill for my growling tummy. What I got was ooey gooey deliciousness!! The cheese stretched for days when I took a bite. The crust was airy, light and had just the right amount of thickness and crunch. The sauce was outta this world! Yup. Sure was. Saucy amazingness is all I can say about that. 

Ugh. Why must all my loves be so far away?! We shall meet again lover.
author: Giovanna F.

description:
Located in the North Beach district of SF. This place is the real deal. A local favorite serving up four different kinds of pizza slices with a variety of toppings, see the photo gallery! Great beer on tap and a hip vibe, lots of neon, edgy music and a big screen TV, rounded up with sheets of corrogated metal on the ceiling! Super friendly staff! 

Duck in and sit at the bar while you enjoy a few slices and wash it down with a fresh cold brew. Hey, I gotta go...I'm getting hungry for Golden Boy Pizza!
author: Carol H.

description: The most amazing pizza I have ever had!! The pesto is amazing. Perfect amount of pesto sauce and perfectly melted cheese, with tons of veggies. You can smell the pizza from down the street and your mouth begins to water. Nice selection of pizza toppings. The bartender also serves incoming guests so you might have to wait a few moments, but a little patience goes a long way and the pizza is SO worth it!
author: Crystal O.

description: The best pizza I had so far. We were there during the north beach festival. Even with the huge crowd the service was prompt and great! The pizza was fresh and tasty.
author: Linitha T.

description: Yeah that's really good pizza. I wish they would let you inside to sit down at the end of the night, but I'll come back anyway because that is really good pizza.
author: Amjad S.

description: The best, quickest, cheapest pizza you cab get in this side of the galaxy! A smuggler like myself resides in the cheap end. Those Nerf herders of Hutts don't pay well. Pull up a seat and grab a slice for a mere 3-4.50 credits ($)! Meaty slice , so good, so perfect :)
author: Johan Z.

description:
Good stuff. 

Square slices Sicilian-ish but soft dough.

Started with three cheeses but went back for a pepperoni that just came out of the oven. Three and a half would have been enough for me.
author: qirk z.

description:
You know when pizza tastes the absolute best? When you're drunk of course!!!

So we stumbled out of Amante and are instantly transfixed by the smell of pizza in the air. The line looks long but not too long that it discourages you. 

My review is mainly an ode to the garlic, clam and parsley pizza! I don't think the idea of clams on a pizza sound appealing to most of the people I've raved about the pizza slice from heaven about. But trust me!!! It's amazing....so amazing I want some more, just thinking about it makes my mouth water. I am soooo sad that I can't have it any time soon since I don't live in SF. But you bet your butt I'm making a beeline to this place the next time I'm in town. 

In the meantime my new goal in life is to search high and low for a local place that has clams on their pizza menu topping list!!!
author: Gabby A.

description:
I wish I could take the pizza squares from here and tile my entire house - floors, walls, and ceilings - with it. Full-access to goodness. 

Golden Boy's pizzas are square-shaped (which makes them more delicious for some odd reason), thick (more pan-pizza than new-york thin), and banging with flavor. For you garlic lovers, order the Clam & Garlic pizza. If you think clams don't go with pizza you are incredibly wrong. Golden Boy makes it happen.

Perfect bottom crust. Fresh ingredients. Cheese bound firmly to the dough so that it doesn't all slide off in one piece. Loads of garlic in every bite. Did I mention perfect bottom crust?
author: Jennifer M.

description: This place is awesome... Recommended by our driver Tony from the Big Red Fire Truck Tour Company.  Pizza is one of the best we have ever had!
author: Audra R.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in SF. The Pizza is really delicious and so different most, very traditional style pizza. I haven't eaten anything like this pizza before. Love going here!
author: Ravish C.

description:
A+++++++
clam and garlic pizza mist have. combo is good too. great crust.
author: Alexander Kiwi L.

description: My gawwwwd!! I'm not much of a pizza person but this pizza was amazing. I'm definitely going back to get some more!! Clam and garlic, combo is to die for!!!
author: Jei L.

description: We have been craving to try this place but there are always a huge line and parking in the area sucks! We finally get to try it on Saturday evening around 7:30-8:30 (go early to avoid long line and a chance to sit in and eat) we ordered garlic clams, sausage and pesto veggie omg it was soooo yummy, warm, soft and just the right portion! You order, paid, grab your food, try to find a seat... They have about no more than 30 bar stool seating. Also the bathroom looks like a hot mess BUT it's decently clean maybe because it's early before the drunks are out.. Anyway yes will return!
author: Joyce E.

description:
In the heart of overpriced bars and italian restaurants is this place.
I felt like I was in Detroit when I walked in.  Stickers and writing on the walls, friendly but reserved staff, and quick food.  Good music playing and really cheap pizza.  I couldn't be happier.  Great crowd of people drinking reasonably priced beers and eating really damn good thick crust pizza.  I stopped here 3 times in the week.  

Great place.
author: Chris M.

description: Every time I visit San Fran I make sure I stop and eat at Golden Boy! The clam pizza is the best! I give this place a 10! If you haven't tried this place it's truly a must.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
A pizza joint bumpin' Mac Dre and Livin Legends...say what!?

This is great place to go to for a late night pizza fix!  My boyfriend and I met with some friends here on a weeknight, close to 11 pm.  Parking is usually hard to find around the North Beach district, but we seemed to get one easily around this time.  

While standing in line (which goes out the door) to order your pizza, you'll have plenty of time to decide what you want.  Check out the menu board - it's one to stare at as you wait; plenty of hidden messages!  You'll also have a great view of  their Sicilian style pizza (aka square cut pizza) since they're showcased along the window.

I ordered slice of the Clam & Garlic and the Veggie Pesto.  I ate half of each slice because it was just so huge.  I knew I wasn't going to finish 2 slices but I wanted to try em both.  They were pretty darn tasty - if you're really hungry...go for the clam&garlic; if you want something light but filling...go for the veggie pesto.
author: jesiree b.

description: Found this little gem the other night while walking around north beach. There was a line half way down the block. I was curious so yes I waited and ys it was worth it! Great place for a slice. Its Square slices Sicily style so good!
author: Big B.

description: Pizza is UGH, so good here.  The crust has the perfect combination of outside crisp/crunch and the inside is like heaven.  Always expect a line at night on the weekend along with a staff that has very little patience.  I assume they get a lot of drunk people and don't want to have to repeat themselves 100 times a night.  5 stars if I got a smile from the staff every now and then...but that's rare.  Cash Only.
author: Durty D.

description: Yummy pizza. Nice, hot, and toasted when you get it. Except mine was a little bit too toasted and the bottom of one of my slices was burnt. Thick crust, too. My favorite! Tried a bit of my friend's garlic and clam slice, which was okay, but only because I don't like clam that much. The slices range from $3-4. Cheese used to be $2.75 like it says on their site, but they upped their prices. Still worth it. I was pretty full after two slices. Happy my office is a walkable distance to Golden Boy. Awesome for a cheap and delicious lunch!
author: Evie L.

description:
I guess North Beach needs more by-the-slice pizza places, because the lengthy line here is totally misleading. 

I thought the pizza was ok, but with a line like that I expect to be wowed. I'd been eyeing this place for years, just waiting for the perfect evening to get a slice ... and when I finally did, disappointment.

Even the famed clam & garlic pizza (which looks divine) was nothing but a big let down. Blandy McBland. 

Maybe I built it up too much ...
author: Colleen J.

description:
Best Sicilian slices in the city!

A little cramped, but I love the oldschool set-up. This place has been around forever, and it has always been great. My dad used to bring me here when I was little, and it hasn't changed much.

Definitely go for the pesto veggie slice..if it's too crowded get it to go, if not sit down and grab a beer and check out all the stuff hanging up and posted around. 
Definitely a no-fuss get it and go pizza shop. 

Also, usually has great music playing. Definitely an oldschool SF joint that is fantastic. 
Great location in North Beach..so you can either hit the bars, or take a walk down to the park and the wharfs.
author: Brighid F.

description: I came here a few weeks ago with a friend. My first thought was, "Okay, Focaccia style pizza..probably airy, bready..."  I had the garlic and clam pizza.  I was skeptical, but this was the pizza they are known for.  It was not what I expected at all..it had the perfect balance of garlic, cheese, sauce and clams.  The crust was crispy, and the amount of toppings, cheese and sauce was right on.  We walked in at a good time, there was no line, but within 5 minutes the line was out the door.  I normally wouldn't go to a place like There is a good flow of customers so the pizza is fresh.
author: Charla M.

description:
Came here when I was sober and it was BOMB! 

It's a small take out spot with a few bar chairs surrounding the walls inside. There was no line, so my friend and I sat at the bar.  They actually have the slices by the window and heat it up when you order.  They stopped serving alcohol by 12am?!, but the pizza was delicious and very affordable.  Ordered the combo pizza and the garlic clam.  

Garlic Clam Pizza FTW!!

I just had Ton'ys Pizza a few weeks before Golden Boy. I think golden boy pizza taste so much better!!
author: Chanel L.

description: By far one of the best pizza spots in all of the bay area, being from buffalo, ny my opinion is extremely valid.
author: Christopher F.

description:
Can't believe all the 5 stars, I guess these reviewers are saying that this is the best pizza they've had, best in San Fran, that a dive bar regular joe who makes the pizza with sauce from a can is years better than all else.

Please, that's pathetic.  It's bar pizza, you get a slice when you've been at the bars and you're drunk with the munchies.  Hell the piece of 6 day old pizza that was laying out in the box tasted 5 star to me after a night out on St Patty's day.

We ordered a whole pizza once when we had to work thru the weekend.  Not that good once it's cold, and I like cold pizza as well.

ok pizza when you're loaded and when it's right out of the oven, otherwise pretty damn below average.   My 1 star rating is rounded down, I don't want someone yelping and seeing this rated so high and thinking during their trip to San Fran North Beach that they should eat there.
author: P H.

description: Solid pizza for the line and price after a long night out.
author: Robin T.

description:
I had the garlic clam pizza and it was delicious. The crust on this pizza is perfect - thin and doughy but not dense.

Cash only. The inside is very relaxed.
author: D S.

description:
If you love pizza, you'll love this place. The ingredients are super fresh and the varieties are simple yet delicious! Nothing fancy but everything you would want from a pizza joint!

Believe it or not my favorite is the plain cheese pizza! Their most basic pizza is probably the best one! Go give it a try!!!
author: Philip K.

description: The clam & garlic pizza is amazing. It's a hidden gem for sure. Everyone is nice and busy and fast and inexpensive. Quality pizza in the city. You can't go wrong. Two thumbs up!
author: Nelli M.

description: Will spare you technical comments; just enjoyed the overall experience. Make more veggie pizza, Golden Boy!
author: Abhishek D.

description:
Good slices with high turnover but not an auteur's effort. Prohibition beer on tap a +.  Bar-like ambience pretty cool although stools not that conducive to conversation.

Great place to sit and grab a slice if you're going solo.
author: Michael T.

description:
This place serves outstanding pizza, easily the best in town.

Additionally, they are open super late, which makes it a great place to stop after an evening out at the bars.  However, be warned that it is very popular, and you'll be waiting in line with everyone else who had such a great idea.

Despite the long wait at 2am, it's a worthwhile endeavor.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Golden Boy is my North Beach bar snack pizza joint of choice!

It's a little hole-in-the wall pizza-by-the slice place on Green, with super friendly staff and excellent food. Cash only, in and out, perfect spices and toppings. The variety is pretty good too, ranging from pesto to clam. Who wouldn't swing in for a $4 snack after leaving Columbus Cafe or King of Thai Noodle?
author: Kristin F.

description: Thats a straight 5 stars without hesitation, one of the best pizza spots. I got a cheese pizza slice was hot and fresh. I will visit it again but i will order 2 slices because one is not enough.
author: Karim K.

description: Let's start with the bad - it's cash only. Now on to the good - great flavors! Pesto veggie, clam and garlic - although it can be a but overwhelming the first time. Tried three different slices and they all tasted fresh. The prices were reasonable too! Do yourself a favor and come here instead of Tony's!
author: Rohit B.

description:
Golden Boy, I must say is the best slice of Scilian style pizza I've ever had. Everytime I'm in North Beach, I make it a point to get a slice regardless if I have to wait in ridiculously long line. 
But hey, the line is long for a reason!
author: FILL S.

description:
Late night beverages may play a part in this is 5 star review ... but whatever the case Golden Boy Pizza rocks!!

Not being from the city, finding a late night pizza place wasn't easy (thank you Yelp! gods!). This place did not disappoint and the line outside was clear indication that I was in good (and happy company). 

Think crusty Focaccia was the base of the pizza and it was savory delicious. I ate my "slice" so fast, I'm not even sure which one I ordered! Went for a traditional cheese and a traditional sausage both were piping hot and the crust was crispy on the bottom, but warm and moist on the inside. Love it!!! Worth the wait in line!
author: Vivi T.

description: I love you golden boy.  I don't usually get into relationships with pizza joints, but you are my main man.  Especially when it's 2 in the morning and no one else is open, golden boy is here, ready to embrace you with a giant pan of pizza.  Now that's true love.
author: Sinan W.

description: Golden boy really has that thick booze absorbing pizza thing down. It's cheap, large and in charge and the clam garlic one is pretty powerful tasting. I mean it really tastes like an absurd amount of garlic but that's cool.
author: Misha T.

description:
I'm the minority giving this popular spot just a mere 3 stars. Although they make decent pizza, I felt it was a bit too greasy and not a great value. Their pizza reminds me a bit of Little Ceasers personal pan pan pizzas from back in the day... only with better ingredients. Actually, I think I like their cheese better! 

I swear half the five star reviews on this place was probably written the next day after getting hammered at a bar in the North Beach area, wandering obnoxiously and belligerently looking for hot food. When one is trashed from alcohol, anything greasy with dough tastes wonderful. Definitely worth a try but not worth a long wait or making a long trip just to eat here.
author: Andrew L.

description: Honestly, best pizza in SF for your buck. The way it melts in your mouth is awesome. Highly recommend this place to anyone. Walk up and order joint.
author: Luis R.

description: They have the best pizza by the slice in town! My favorite was the pesto vegetarian pizza. My husband likes the combo. It's a deep dish pizza. There's always a long line but goes by pretty quick. The place is very small. I usually take it to go. This is the place for deep dish pizza! It's the BEST and it's a MUST TRY!
author: Melissa Y.

description: I've gotta say, pizza isn't my first choice of food.  But when it comes to this joint, I love pizza.  On my last food trip to SF, my wife and I were recommended to Golden Boy by some locals we met at the bar.  We came here the next day.  I ordered the garlic clam pizza.  The flavor was extra ordinary.  Lots of clams and garlic and just the perfect amount of crust.  Yummy!!
author: Fred H.

description: Slightly better than Costco. I have no idea why this is 4 1/2 stars. The pizza isn't even fresh. They reheat it when you order your slice and then you sit at an uncomfortable bar to eat it. Yelp really let me down with this one.
author: Katie L.

description: Golden Boy pizza was delicious. Tasted fresh, service was prompt, and I love the open kitchen. The staff could have been friendlier but other than that, everything was great.
author: Ashli S.

description: You feel like the ultimate cool kid coming into this place. Walking up to it, you notice all the people gathered around, smoking, talking on their phones, having wonderful conversations that include "I was invited to an upscale swingers party" and "vanilla vodka, happy vicki!" .... it definitely had a certain ambiance I enjoy. The building has a small interior which adds to the uniqueness of the building as well as requiring humans to be in close contact with one another - something one does not always experience. Pizza is delicious, I was told it's Sicilian which means it has two crusts and it's delicious. The pizza is just pizza and it's so good. It's completely different than the pizza I had (The pizza of my dreams, the love of my life in Cambria), it's just simple and delicious and the right amount of greasy with perfect golden crusts. You can write on the walls but I mostly just saw stickers everywhere like "I hella love Oakland teachers." good stuff. Led Zeppelin was blaring while we ate our pizza. Hella cool place. Cash only because of course, its cash only. A place this cool doesn't take credit cards.
author: Nicole A.

description:
Are you drunk? Is it after midnight? Do you want square pizza?

Then golden boy pizza is for you!

Delicious and cheap!  What's the catch, you ask?  Well, you'll have to wait in line for a little while with a bunch of drunken retards, but it's a small price to pay!

Golden boy! Good enough to put up with the drunktards of North beach!
author: Yan L.

description: Having just eaten the cracker pizza next door at Baonecci and leaving unfulfilled, decided to get what looks like a Sicilian slice to go. Not bad but not as doughy as I'd like. San Francisco has some decent pizza, especially for the west coast so it doesn't hurt to give it a try.
author: John R.

description:
I love that you can come here at midnight and get pizza. At that point there isn't much of a selection left, but everything tastes good so it doesn't matter!
Going during the day is better, when they have pizza freshly made and all kinds too, I had never had clams on pizza until this place!
author: Roxanne R.

description:
Absolutely LOVE the pizza here!

We stumbled upon this place by accident, so glad we did!
The veggie is amazing, the cheese is amazing, it's all amazing!!
The space is small, and a little grungy. But they have beer, and they have pizza! What more could you ask for?

The gal behind the counter was being a little rude and pushy, that's just my opinion, but maybe she has to be because from what i  hear this place can get really crowded.

Highly recommend!
author: M K.

description: Clam pizza was out of style and terrible. Why would a 'biker' bar serve clam pizza? Figure it out
author: Abraham S.

description:
Awesome pizza and cheap. Yes, you'll have to deal with the line even at midnight! But just more reassurance that it IS awesome.

Highly recommend the vege pesto and garlic clam.  I always try to catch some golden boy when I'm in North Beach.  Even with the line halfway down the block!
author: C R.

description: OMG!!! Outstanding pizza!!! Probably the best in Cali! Vegi is my fav. Great vibe. You'll likely have to wait a bit to get in as there is usually a line. Unusual beer and wine license, they stop serving alcohol around 11p; eliminates drama. But don't let that stop you! And don't forget to take some home. Killer the next day! Tip: If you do take some home, don't have them fire the slice(s) going home; makes em dry. Enjoy!
author: B H.

description:
I have had pizza at 2 places in SOMA and this is the best. (The other forgettable bite was on Broadway)

PROS
- The price is right, slices $2.75-3.75
- Options- cheese, pepperoni, veggie, and clam and garlic!
- Note: Clam and garlic will leave u w/ garlic breath. Enjoy w/ platonic pizza partners
-  not TOO much cheese, and generous amount of sauce
- Since it's so popular, every slice is fresh and warm

CONS
- Cash only
- Skater boi music 
- Long line (20-40 minute wait is normal)
- Not a lot of sitting room
author: Stephanie T.

description: Listen to Buzzcocks, The Ramones, and Fugazi while eating bomb pizza. Excellent.
author: Jenna H.

description:
Dank pizza, affordable beer, nice waitstaff, fun barstools. 

boom. do it.
author: Eliza D.

description:
What night or day of barhopping in North Beach would be complete without at least one stop at Golden Boy, either at the end or along the way.  Hot, heavenly slices with plenty of toppings on square foccaccia bread (rumored to be from Liguria bakery!), it is the perfect complement to fun, alcohol-fueled, good times!

My good friend treated me here at the end of the night and I had a slice of the clam & garlic and a slice of pepperoni & sausage.  Delicious as always and the girl working behind the counter, Laurie from Fresno, was so friendly and sweet.  This was the final stop of the evening, stop #7.  The perfect ending to a most fun evening of drinking in North Beach.
author: Roy N.

description:
Golden Boy, how could you?

You were a late-night snack staple of my life when I was in college.  After hitting the bars in North Beach my friends and I would wonder over for a thick, yummy slice and recount the evenings antics.

Last Saturday night I convinced my boyfriend (who already despises North Beach anyways) to go for Golden Boy Pizza before going home.  I was nostalgic.  We'd been out late at 83 Proof (Best Bar Ever, btw), and nothing was open in the area.

Golden Boy, we even took a TAXI to come see you.

We waited in line, patiently.

Then we saw your employees nearly assault a customer.  He was behind us, in line, when the woman who was working slammed the door, shutting us all out.  We didn't know why she had closed the door, or if she intended on doing window service (she had not opened the window at that point.)  The guy behind us asked if we knew what the deal was, and when we didn't, he stuck his head in the door (as another customer was leaving) to ask.  We heard her yell at him and slam the door, on his FINGERS.  He yelled and flailed, and they told him to get lost.  He walked away (after yelling and cursing at them, as anyone would do, right?)

Incredible.  But wait...there is more.

We continued to wait for pizza, and when we got to the window, a very drunk, very sloppy woman pushed passed us to get to the window.  We told her that she couldn't cut, the EMPLOYEES of Golden Boy gestured her over to the door, opened it, and let her in!  I guess it's ok for them to treat anyone else with contempt, but their drunk, rude friend was allowed inside.

But still, I waited.  When I got to the front of the line, I tried to explain what had happened to the guy who got his fingers smashed.  They totally dismissed me, saying that he was "out of control."

So this is what I learned, Golden Boy.  Your employees are jerks.  They are unprofessional and rude and will assault your customers, but will gladly let their sloppy drunk friends disturb everyone else.

Never EVER again.  Pizza's not that good anyways.
author: Michelle P.

description: Had the combo and the pesto veggie slices and they were amazing!  I love that they're all the big square slices - always takes me back to elementary school and "pizza day" in the cafeteria.  Super friendly staff and the place has a great vibe, like an underground punk music club.  Probably because they're pumping out punk the whole time.  I'm definitely going back.
author: Tommy T.

description:
I love this place. GBP is a place to grab a quick bite that won't break the bank and tastes delicious!!!!!!! I love their clam garlic pizza. I will throw on loads of garlic powder, oregano, chili flakes, and cheese and devour the slice in 5 minutes tops. I also think it's so cute that the pizzas are square shaped.

Another thing is the girl that works there is so nice! She smiles and is super friendly which is rare nowadays in the service industry. Even under pressure with a line out the door, she manages to heat the pizza, take your order, and handle the cash register all at once. I appreciate good customer service!
author: Jenny T.

description:
I wanted to get take out pizza to for a picnic at Washington Square Park on a beautiful day.

My friend thought all the shady benches would be taken by homeless people so I acquiesced to her desire to stay at the restaurant.

Golden Boy only has backless bar stools, not my favorite form of seating.  They were playing loud rock music which meant we had to speak rather loudly to converse.

The person helping us was friendly & attentive during our whole visit.

They only offer slices or a whole pan, which is about 16 slices.  I tried slices of the pesto veggie & garlic with clams.  I preferred the garlic with clams.  It had a good amount of sauce & you could see the garlic & some clams.  Though I didn't really taste the garlic nor the clams.  The pesto veggie was far too cheesy.  So much so, the cheese overwhelmed the taste of the pesto sauce.

I prefer pizza with more flavorful sauce & less cheese!

There is a good selection of draft beer. 

They do not accpet credit cards, so bring cash.

So if you like cheesy pizza, with limited size selection, loud rock music, & sitting on bar stools...this is the place for you.
author: Saul M.

description: A must place to visit every time I visit San Fran!!! The pizza is great! The service is great! And the environment is energetic and great!!!
author: Chris R.

description:
Stumbled upon Golden Boy pizza while taking a friend on a tour of SF based off the recommendation of a sweet lady at the flower shop. Golden Boy pizza is pretty unremarkable on the outside, just a small red tent that says Golden Boy pizza. As you get closer, you know it's different from the rest, though. The pizza at the window is still fresh, the cheese still melting off it. Rock music blasts throughout the small bar-esque seating area, a myriad of stickers and signatures of patrons past adorn the walls, the oven's heat makes the environment warm but not to the point of being uncomfortable. 

The process at the cashier is simple: order your pizza, either by the slice or by the sheet (it's square pizzas here, kids). Slices range from 3-5 per and sheets, if I remember correctly, were 48 per. Pricy, in my opinion, but the slices are worth it. I had a Clam and Garlic slice and a Combo slice. At first, I was worried since it seemed like the Clam and Garlic was pretty unpopular - the sheet was still completely full save for one slice. The Combo, on the other hand, was already ravaged through halfway. Oh yes, another note: this place is Cash Only, no cards. Not sure if there's an ATM around. 

Anyways, seating is simple. Swiveling bar stools line the walls and you simply choose your seat. Kinda hard to mess up. Seating is definitely limited, so during rush hour I'd imagine it to be very difficult to get a seat inside. On to the pizza. 

Clam and Garlic had what I think was the Garlic adorned all over it. It had this beautiful green look to it. The garlic taste was surprisingly rather subtle for a pizza with garlic as a star in the dish. Clams, as you can imagine, were equally subtle since no pizza store can afford to throw on tons of clams onto a pizza. So, I felt like I was kinda just eating a regular cheese pizza with little bits of clams and garlic. But, the real star of the whole slice was the dough. This goes for the Combo pizza as well. The dough has all the features of a thin pizza crust: light, airy, crisp, yet it's a thick crust. It was amazing. The magic of the dough might have something to do with the fact that it's made in house. 
Combo pizza was great, it had onions, tomato, sausage and a few  other toppings I can't remember. The sausage had a great bite to it, definitely not your regular pizza hut sausage. Tomatoes and onions were nice and refreshing as well. I didn't add any red pepper or parmesan cheese since it just didn't seem appropriate to adulterate a pizza slice so good. 

All in all, four out of five stars. The pizza is in a class of it's own here, skip all those other pizza by the slice places. Clams and garlic could've stood out a bit more, so minus the one star. Really more like half star though, but no option for that. Its grungy, yet entirely at ease atmosphere makes for easy conversation and the pizza is outstanding. It's a great second date place where the conversations can flow freely and the meal is still wholly satisfying. Or, maybe even a first date place if you really want to come out of left field and leave an impression.
author: Eric T.

description:
I love Pizza so much the guy who takes my order at Papa Johns knows me by my voice on the telephone. And sometimes he calls me just to chat. Which is confusing. I am not confused because he is a man and I am straight. Gender Roles don't concern me. But Pizza Rolls dooooo

When I was looking for a place to eat late at night I walked from Union Square to this wonderful establishment and let my salivating orifices do the rest. 

Visit this place for the best pizza in San Francisco!
author: Daniel L.

description:
HOLY SMACKS. 

that garlic clam pizza is full of flavor especially when its out of the oven fresh and hot. and that combo? DEEEEMMMM SAUSAGES ARE BOMB. 

i wish they had an extra TV in there though. oh and ranch. i guess i'll just being my own next time for my pizza. cant complain tho, such a cheap meal but so satisfying
author: Kenny L.

description: Had dinner next door at HRD Smokin' Grill but we still stopped by to try a slice of the clam and garlic because it just looked too good to pass up. Surprisingly, there was only two people in line ahead of us. It was so yummy, wish I had more space in my stomach to try another slice. But that just means all the more reason to come back another time! Note to self for next time though, bring gum because the garlic really packs a punch.
author: Sarah L.

description: Absolutely the best hole in the wall pizza spot I've ever been to. They also have beer!  Win win. Fresh deep dish style pizza by the square. Quick and good fast food that doesn't leave you feeling bloated and asleep. Tastes great and filling yet is surprisingly light. I had 3 squares and wish I had more. Definitely be back.
author: AR D.

description:
Thanks to Golden Boy, SF holds its own amongst the Chicagos and the New Yorks of the world when it comes to pizza.  It's a slice of deliciousness! If you've had way too much to drink, or the "authentic" Italian pizza around you isn't really pizza according to you, this place is the place to go. There's always a line, but you won't be standing there too long.  There's cheap beer and wine too. 

I always request a middle piece, cause I don't like the sides.  And I always stick to plain cheese, but I've heard that the clam and garlic one is great too.
author: Anoo L.

description:
Ever since my friend told me about this place, I've been dying to try it! I've only heard good things about the pizza here, especially the clam garlic!

Well, I finally went and I can safely say that Golden Boy Pizza lives up to the hype! My friend and I shared a clam garlic and a pesto vegetarian, both of which were hot, cheesy deliciousness! I admit that the clam garlic was pretty garlic-y and I didn't think there was any sort of clam taste on it, so if you're not a huge fan of garlic don't get it. Bring breath mints too! 
The price is right too!! Only $3.75 for each of our slices!

My friend and I came here about 7:15ish and luckily, they still had a good variety of their pizzas. When we left though, there was no more clam garlic! I haven't been here enough to know what the "good" times are, but  I'm assuming the later in the night it gets, the busier since people will be going to the bars and/or looking for some late night munchies.

The workers are friendly, easy-going, and nice! The place is small, so when it gets really busy, you might have to stand outside and eat your slice.
author: Kei H.

description:
Sometimes I tell my Ladysitter I am going for a run....

And I run here...or run for a block and take a cab here.

Don't tell him I told you that.

I get back, huffing and puffing and I say "Whew, that was a great run!"

Golden Boy is what you expect of the West Coast's Little Italy...the "slices" are square and you can get a piece of clam pizza (how SF is that)

Fluffy, Golden crust that will have you sayin' "Boy oh Boy!"
author: Sarah M.

description:
Since I work close by and enjoy taking walks in North Beach, Golden Boy has become one of my new places to lunch at. Its cheap, quick, and tastes amazing! I love that they have the same selections (no surprises!) - cheese, pepperoni, combination, pesto vegetarian, clam and garlic, and sausage. My favorite is the combination and unfortunately today it was sold out, so I just had pepperoni. If you like deep dish, Sicilian style pizza then definitely stop by here. It can get packed, especially late-night on weekends - everyone has the drunk munchies, heh. This is just a great place to grab a quick bite and just hang out no matter the time.

Also they have a great George Harrison collage on the back wall that always seems to catch my eye, as well as the other stickers on the wall.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
CASH ONLY!

Could be one of my absolute favorite pizza spots in San Francisco.  We came here on our Wednesday pizza nights to help survive this tax season.  We arrived after a long day at work, and even at 9pm there's still a mini line out the door.  Their pizzas are SQUARE SHAPED and oh so DELICIOUS.  I'm not a fan of lines but this place is really worth waiting to grab a slice of heaven.

I crave their pesto tomato and when they don't have that available, my regular favorite is the COMBO!  The crust is crispy, the cheese is perfectly melted and i love the juiciness of all the veggies and meat.  Theyre smart in that they cook the pizza but if it sits out for even a few minutes before being purchased, they stick it in the oven to reheat so when you take a bite it's STEAMING HOT!  Slices range from $2.50-$4.  SO CHEAP!

They have bar stools along their long corridor but most people usually grab a slice to go and eat it on the curbside.  

they do serve alcohol so on the right day, an ice cold beer with a pizza can make a day complete.  I'm a fan!
author: Sandy L.

description:
I'm a semi-recent college grad still recovering from years of eating Hot-N-Ready. 

I stopped here for lunch because I was craving a slice of pizza and a coworker had heard the food was good. It was only a 10 minute walk from the office, so I didn't have to bother looking for parking. (Which is apparently difficult to find around the area.)

It was after 1 in the afternoon, so there were only a couple of people ahead of me in line. I ordered a slice of pepperoni to go- I'm not a fan of being in tight spaces for too long.  This place is cash only...I'm glad this was one of the days I happened to have some on hand!

By the time I got back to the office, my slice was still hot. It was a little on the oily side, but nothing a few dabs with a napkin couldn't handle. The pizza itself had good flavor, and the crust was nice and crisp. 

I'm not sure how I feel about paying $4 for a slice- again, I'm used to getting an entire pizza for $5! But if we're talking quality over quantity, Golden Boy Pizza is definitely worth giving another shot.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Squared slices of pizza? More like squared slices of heaven at a bargain. This place caught my attention a couple of summers ago (when I began exploring the different food options in the city), and I've never looked away. I love the pizza at this place. My favorite slice is the clam and garlic. They really go all out on both ingredients (you can barely see the cheese), and after finishing the slice, the taste from that slice lingers in your mouth, tempting you to order another slice. I love it!

The setting of this place is definitely a dive, open late into the night and the early morning next day. Attracting the different types of crowds all day long (from touristy/local crowd during the day, to the bar-crawling crowd after dark). The music is turned up pretty high (the only problem I have with this place), the servers are friendly, and Golden Boy is always busy with the line to order pizza going out the door. Overall, this place is perfect and worth the time and effort to travel to North Beach and wait in line for a slice.
author: Ethan T.

description:
I love Golden Boy Pizza. I don't care that they are cash only, the pizza is will blow your mind away, so a trip to an ATM is definitely worth it.

I had the cheese (heavenly) and vegetarian (hearty and heavenly) and was so happy that I ate another cheese. It was that good, I didn't care how full I was.

Ate at the bar stools admiring the workers working the dough. They noticed, and next thing you know I'm back there slamming dough down on the baking sheet. I was terrible, of course, but it was a doughy blast.

Great people, amazing food. What more can you ask for?
author: Sarah H.

description:
Having lived 6.5 years in NYC before moving to San Francisco, I am quite pizza biased.  Though I'm convinced you can't really beat  a quick NY slice with any slice on this left coast, I am beginning to appreciate the different styles and interpretations of pizza out here.  Golden Boy specializes in the doughy, almost focaccia-like, Sicilian-style slices.  There is no formal crust, but definitely ask for a corner edge since the texture contrast is way better than a floppy middle slice.

Cheese: Crispy edges with a slight butteryness where it had touched the pan.  Thick, bready dough.  A light smear of tomato sauce and tons of gooey cheese.  Light compared to the other slices and a great example of Sicilian-style pizza without the noise of toppings.

Clam & Garlic: Let me just disclose that I love clam & garlic pizza.  So this was a predestined win in my book, but proved even better because there was tomato sauce!  Perfect combo, don't know why most clam & garlic pizzas don't do this.  The parsley was a little bit overwhelming though, they should moderate a bit.

Vegetarian Pesto: Probably my least favorite slice.  The pesto is subtle so the thin smear gets lost amongst all the bread, cheese and toppings.  The veggies consisted of mushrooms, black olive slices (presumably from a can) and a lone zucchini slice.  None of them really had much personality making a pretty bland experience.
author: Adam B.

description:
I love Golden Boy. I've tried Patxi's (gave it 3 stars) and next on my list is Little Star, but so far Golden Boy is my favorite. Golden boy only serves the napoleon style (box shaped) pizza, they do 4-5 different topping combinations and are cash only. You'll notice a long line coming out of their small restaurant but that's partly because they put their cash register at the front of the restaurant which automatically generates a long line outside. So don't let the long line deter you. 

I love the casual/fun environment of the place, their service and of course their pizza. I've tried the supreme (I think they call it the combo pizza), cheese, pesto, vegentarian, and their garlic/clam. My favorite by far was the garlic/clam pizza.
