I'd recommend that to people even if they don't like seafood cause I didn't think it tasted too seafood-y. The service is great here too. The gal at the register is a machine. She asks very succinct questions when you reach the front so there's no dilly dallying which got us through the line quickly. 

As I was finished my first round of pizza's, I was thinking to myself, I'd love 2 more slices but I don't want to get back on that line. The other gal working there must've telepathically heard me and asked me what I wanted! She saved me a couple minutes by not having to jump back on the line. 

Okay so to recap: excellent pizza, great prices ($3-$4/slice), fun environment, and great service.
author: Ken C.

description: Great pizza and great beer selection. I had the garlic and clam, and the pepperoni. Looking forward to going back to try more.
author: Woody H.

description:
If you want thick, cheesy, topping-laden pizza then this is your place. If you're in North Beach and want a quick bite then this is definitely your place. 

I've eaten the pizza here both sober and not. Tasted about the same either way. At least they offer plenty of pieces without crust in their large sheet pizzas. Sure, an inside slice is a little messier to eat, but the topping bonus more than makes up for it.
author: Mike H.

description: Decent beer selection and the pizza is fine, but doesnt stand out to me and is always crowded with tourists. Definitely not my top choice in NB.
author: Allison Z.

description: Tried this today for spur of the moment lunch. Really great pizza by the slice, friendly staff also!
author: Shawn G.

description:
Being square is good. At least in the case of Golden Boy's pizza. Crispy edges, fresh ingredients, and reasonably thick crusts, this place is the perfect place for a quick on-the-go pit-stop or a drunchie pick-me-up. The Clam and Garlic pizza is delicious! The garlic gives this pizza a nice kick of flavor that'll make you eager for more and the clams add just the hint of seafood to make each slice packed with the cheesiness, saltiness, and garlic-ness that make it so good. Definitely worth ordering in my book.

I wasn't as impressed with the other slice I tried (which was the Combo slice), but the pizza here is definitely worth stopping by. Seems like a popular place given the line going out the door on a Friday night, but the staff is super friendly and efficient. You'll have your pizza served hot and crisp to perfection in no time.
author: Cheston W.

description:
All other pizza is ruined for me.

That's not actually accurate.  I'm a person who will not claim to like pizza.  In fact, if given the choice, I will choose anything but pizza.  Probably because I overdid it in college, and probably also because I lived right outside of Chicago, and once you've had a good Chicago pizza, you can't go back to crap.

But then there was Golden Boy.

This is the best pizza I've had ever.  The crust was perfect and had this light crispiness on the bottom. Cheese was not too heavy or greasy.  The sauce was amazing.  You can taste how fresh and awesome it is.  When was the last time you tasted your pizza sauce?  Yeah, I didn't think so.  The sausage on the combination was killer.  My only complaint is that there isn't enough sausage on it... but I guess not everyone likes tasty salted pig parts in such a high quantity. Everything is fresh and beautiful. The fresh tomatoes explode in your mouth.  It is the ultimate in pizza joy.

I will come here again and again, forever.

Word to the whiners:  Yes, it's a small joint.  You will probably have to wait in line if it's a weekend.  If that really bothers you, and if you can't enjoy delicious pizza while standing, then you don't deserve it in the first place.
author: Lindsay S.

description: The last few times I have been to Golden Boy I have experienced mushy pizza. I am not sure if it is the change in cheese, bread dough, or what but I have gone in a few extra times to give them another chance but just not impressed anymore. So sad!
author: Natalie R.

description: Oh boy. This place is ridonk and in the best possible way. I don't know how they make the interior of the dough so fluffy and yet the exterior so crispy. They're still making new pies before closing time at 11:30 on weekdays too. AND! On weekends, they're open super late. Gotta love this place. Also, the pizza toppings on top of the crust are also amazing. Really love it here, but gotta watch how many times I stop by.
author: Danny C.

description: Sooooo yummy! Decently priced. Employees have always been great, personable, and friendly. Only giving it a 4 because it's tiny inside. But LOVE this place
author: Haylee K.

description: Delicious ready to order pizza! It's open late, so all you drunk ppl will devour every inch of this pizza. I was sober and this was small square slice of cheese and pepperoni was heaven melting in my mouth! If i loved it this much being sober, I could only imagine how great it would be drunk! Good stuff.
author: Katherine X.

description:
Pizza was tasty, crust was thick n' crispy. Didn't get to try the clam pizza, but maybe I'll come back.

Best part of my visit was watching these drunk, wealthy folks order 2 pizzas through the service window. Fifteen minutes after they order, they drunkenly start complaining about not having their pizzas. Their pizzas have to take at least 30-40 minutes to bake. After they were told the pizzas needed more time to cook, they start complaining even louder and insulting the dude working the counter. This dude tells the drunk people to be quiet or he will have to shut the window. This causes one of the girls in the group to start yelling louder and faster and she got the window was shut on her. One of the other people in the group comes inside and starts complaining about how their pizzas are taking too long and they should just give them the pizzas. The guy working the counter lets this girl rant and when she's done, like a total badass, tells her "Do you really want a half cooked pizza?" She says "YES." "REALLY?? YOU WANT.. A HALF COOKED PIZZA??" "YES." They got served half-cooked pizzas. Which they then proceeded to eat. What the fuck is wrong with some people??
author: Brian S.

description: Cash only! I am not a fan of Sicilian style pizza generally, and found this to be not very flavorful. My man and I each got a slice of cheese, as we were caught off guard by the cash only (seriously, who does this anymore?), and didn't have enough on us to try any other flavors. I only ended up eating half of my slice.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Between this and Tony's the competition is fierce for best North Beach pizza slice.  This is the Sicilian version of a slice so expect a big fluffy square pie that feels like a pillow of italian heaven.  The Clam and Garlic is the best slice but all the others are totally serviceable.  

There's little room to form a queue so expect tight squeezes and awkward looks to be exchanged between customers.  The music is loud, the beer is cold and the slices are as hot as you'd like them to be directly from the tiny reheating oven behind the register.
author: Anthony V.

description: I'm a pizza snob and usually like thin "ny style" pizza, but this Sicilian style pizza is incredible!
author: Amy C.

description: Line out the door which is always a good thing. Little hidden hole in the wall that has a really cool interior like an underground punk bar, and playing some good tunes. Seating is limited but people keep moving. Cash only but you can get away with spending under $20 no problem (2 slices and a lagunitas ipa was $16). Pizza made right in front of the whole place and cooked as ordered. Pizza on a foccacia crust which creates a different taste that wasn't expected but fantastic. Not a huge selection of topings and no customization, but they offer enough options that if you are planning to order a crazy style pizza with 80 different toppings you shouldnt be here. If you want a beer and a couple of lighter filling slices check this place out. Worth the trip even if your just touring the area or the warf.
author: Jeff C.

description: Really goooood pizza here! & the prices aren't that bad, I went here 2 summers ago and I wish we had pizza like this in LA, I've gone to 2 pizza joints here in LA and none even come close to comparing to golden boy pizza, I wish we had one here in LA, that's how good the pizza was. The crust was fluffy, and the pizza had a very good amount of flavor. If I ever go back to San Fran I'll definitely be stopping by here again!
author: Gilbert S.

description: i'm not in North Beach often, but when I am, I almost always make it a point to stop by at Golden Boy for a quick slice or two of pizza. I live in the Haight so I frequent Escape From NY pretty often, which I also enjoy. But man.. if Golden Boy had a joint in the Upper Haight.. yeah. I'd probably make it my go-to quick grub spot.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco.  Hands down.  

Stop whatever you are doing and go to here.  The garlic clam on sourdough is heaven on dough.  You cannot go wrong here and they serve beer too.  Cash only, so make sure you are prepared and do not disrupt the line, which chances are I may be in on any night.

You cannot go wrong here and can preview your meal in the windows.  This is not thin crust NYC style, but sour-dough thicker style pie and in my opinion superior.  Selections are limited somewhat but I have never had a problem finding something I like vegetarian or meat-based.  

Writing this review actually makes me want to hop on the 30 to North Beach...yum!
author: Mark D.

description: The pizza slice is just amazing....!! I tried pepperoni for the first time and just loved it.. !!!
author: Binita B.

description:
3.5 STARS. If you're in the area late at night and want to get your pizza on, this is a good place to grab a slice. The Sicilian type of pizza reminds me of school lunches... and also of working in the cafeteria so I could get a free lunch everyday. Sorry it just made me think of my traumatic child/adolescent hood. The interior back-bar seemed kinda shady-looking, which reminds me of the past too! 

If you enjoy square-shaped and soft pizza, definitely swing by!
author: Yumi H.

description:
Great pizza! I'm usually very picky with my pizza being from New York, but I absolutely enjoyed this place. I got a regular pepperoni pizza but the crust was crispy, dough was fluffy, and had just the right thickness. The cheese was also nice and stringy.

With good pizza you never need to get anything complicated, even a simple regular cheese pizza can determine the quality of it.

One warning though, this place is quite small with some bar seating near the front and a few more in the back!

4 STARS.
author: Karen L.

description:
If I had a pizza joint to hang out in back when I was in highschool, it would have been like this. Alas, my hometown had nothing even remotely as cool (hello redneck Northern Ontario) so I get to try it out now and reminisce what it would have been like if I grew up somewhere much more awesome like San Francisco.

Pizza is ordered by the slice and you can get alcohol as well. Seating is a bit weird with benches along the walls mostly, so you feel like you're sitting at a bar, and the stools were a bit too tall for my short little legs, but you're not here for a high-end snooty dining experience. You're here for the wacked out stickers all over the wall, the loud punk music blaring through the speakers, and the amazingly awesome pizza. 

Price is spot on, service is fast, and there's a wide range of options for almost every taste (I don't think they have a vegan choices). Seating can be tricky, as we weren't able to get a spot at the bench right away, the place was pretty packed, but if you're polite and can get people to shuffle a bit (most people's cooties aren't shareable just by sitting next to them, trust me!) it shouldn't be difficult to get a spot. This isn't a place for long drawn-out conversations, get your food, enjoy the awesome ambiance and the taste sensation, then head on out to wherever you're going next. Unless, of course, there's room to just park your ass and drink yourself silly.

Highly recommended!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Oh Golden Boy, I didn't give you enough credit when I heard all the hoopla. I wondered, why do these crazy people care to stand in this insanely long line in the cold San Francisco weather? Can it be worth it? Yes, yes it can. While I struggle to fully recall my intoxicated encounter with you, I can still taste the perfectly cooked crust and toppings that will remain unnamed, mostly as I only remember pointing at the window and saying "that one." Alas, I was wrong to think that you were just another overhyped pizza joint. I do consider my authority on pizza to be pretty honorable, and I have given you my salute. My apologies to you Golden Boy, you are amazing.
author: Emma B.

description:
This is the only non-deep-dish pie that I'll eat with a knife and fork. I must confess that, like many people, I've never had Golden Boy before first downing a few beers. So perhaps my experience is tainted. But then again, maybe that's just how Golden Boy is meant to be!

GB is open late, and it's in a thicket of North Beach bars and restaurants. You can't miss it; it's the place with that huge neon sign pointing the way to pizza nirvana. 

I go for pepperoni almost every time, though anything with sausage is a sure bet, too. They even have a clam pizza, which looks good bu i don't know...best of luck on that one. 

This pizza, which is all Sicilian style, has a delicious, sturdy crust, fresh cheese (a substantial amount but not too much), great sauce, and something i can't put my finger on that lurks in the greasy wondrousness of every slice. Look, it's delicious, ok? 

As other reviewers have pointed out, a line usually forms at night on weekends and you gotta have a stomach for the drunkies that haunt this place. But no matter. Just stand still like a lamp post and they won't even see you, given that their sense of sight relies on motion.
author: Andrew K.

description:
H.S.D. (Holy Shit Delicious!)

My favorite pizza joint in the area.
Open late nights for you bar flies :P
Pizza seems hot and fresh, toppings are great.
I was very impressed and will visit when I come back to San Fran.
author: Shane H.

description: The best pizza ever.  Brendon was the best.  So happy I got to meet him.  Amanda was great too.  Best pizza ever.
author: Craig M.

description:
We were looking for some take-out pizza to eat while watching an out-door movie in Washington Square in North Beach.  I yelped around and Golden Boy seemed like a winner!

And indeed it is...great pizza, but not the kind I was expecting.  It's neither NY style or Chicago, but almost like a thick bready crust with toppings on it.  Really yummpy!

We ordered an array of choices, with the sausage and the clam/garlic slices being the favorites.  Really big pieces too that fill you up nicely.

The line wasn't too bad when we arrived, but their window displaying the pizzas was empty except for the clam!  This was a great sign, since we got fresh slices of all the rest!  And the line moved quick too.

I'd totally head back to Golden Boy for a slice if I'm in the neighborhood.  And their logo's pretty dope too!
author: Greg S.

description: Best pizza in North Beach. I had the calm garlic pizza was not dussapointed. Oh and the slices are big. More than one slice and your done this place is on point
author: Lalo V.

description: Solid piping hot deep dish style pizza. Open fairly late. Cool dive-y atmosphere with a sprinkle of hipster. Great grab and go and sit down. Some of the staff have a little sf smug-atude but in their defense, they do have to deal with drunk people in north beach late night.
author: Cody W.

description: Its late. Drunk? Hungry? Can't talk?  Neurons firing at slo-mo speed? Just come here and point to some pizza and pay (cash, atm nearby).  The place is easy to find, just find and follow the line.  You'll be happy with any slice.
author: Teresa P.

description: I can only sing Golden Boy's praises. We were nearby at a bar and needed food in our bellies immediately. The guy at the door pointed us to Golden Boy and we had no regrets. My friend and I shared 3 slices and regret not getting more just because it was so good. The crust is unique (not thin, regular, or deep but thick and light) and the three types we had were great. Would definitely recommend and will be visiting again.
author: Candace R.

description:
I usually stay away from pan pizza. We like our pie square! But as I walked by, a young lady put a fresh hot pan of pizza in the window, and well, I thought why not.

Anyhow, it's decent...really just a 3.5, but I'm in the mood to round up, cause I like the neighborhood. The crust is a little thicker than I liked, but it had a nice crunch with a fine crumb. Tasted fine. Won't win an award, but there is an inviting counter and 4 or 5 beers on tap. You could do worse.
author: Bruce K.

description: Add me to the enthusiasts! (Beware, clam and pesto is both very clammy and very pesto-y.)
author: Robert M.

description:
so here's the trick with this place...parking is ridiculous.  so make sure you bring a friend...one person runs in while the other person parks illegally at a fire hydrant or double park your booty somewhere.  grab the pizza...jump back into the car...and go go go!!!

we couldn't decide what to get...so we got 4 different slices..clams & garlic, pesto vegetarian, pepperoni, and combination.

MmMMmMMMMhMmMmmmm...what can i say?  there wasn't even a crumb left in the box.  everything tasted really fresh...and 4 slices cost $14.50...not too shabby.  my only complain which is probably one of my preferences...i would've liked a little more sauce on the pizza...wifey, on the other hand, thought it was perfect...

this place is the real deal...good pizza in an awesome poppin neighborhood...minus the parking...perfect for a drunken night out and needing some good ole carbs to prevent a hangover.  YUMMY!!!
author: Jen W.

description: I was skeptical! Yelp recently has been letting me down. Example being 2 dollar signs was really 4 so when I found a pizza place on Yelp with 4 stars and only 1 dollar sign I was excited. I'm not going to have buyers remorse after seeing the receipt!  So I asked what was best there and the kind server/waitress/host (order @ bar style restaurant) replied with its really up to who you ask. But followed with suggestions of most order. I enjoyed the Veggie Pesto, and Combination pizzas. Both were great and feeling. Toppings are more than adequate and the cheese laid on thick, but without all the grease! Id go back and until I find something better, I'm calling this my favorite pizza stop of SF.
author: Jesse L.

description:
Very very good Sicilian/Chicago style pizza.  Good atmosphere and plenty of choices.  More of a local backdoor feel to it than the tourist "get your slice right here" pizza joints all along NB.

The only thing that prevents me from giving them five stars was the difficult I had getting service and the fact that I was blown off by a server on a not so busy afternoon.  

Other than that it was a great experience and I recommend it to all that visit SF.
author: Jon C.

description: Pretty decent pizza. Long lines always.. worth it?  Ish. If there wasn't such a long wait isr say yes, but for the wait, I'd say no.  Pizza is good, not life altering.
author: Jeff M.

description: Wow, all I can say is I can see why there is line going out of this place always.  I am already craving another piece.
author: Briana S.

description: This place has been here for a long time and has stayed just as good. I love the pizza and it's fun to hang out here sometimes and have beer too. This place retains the spirit of how the neighborhood used to be before the tech take over. It's nice to go to places that remind me of the old San Francisco.
author: Joy H.

description: Golden Boy is like the Michael Fassbender of pizza places. Reliable, in demand, and almost too good to be true. For $5, you can get a fresh, hot, delicious pizza that's always satisfying. The dough is thick and crisp, there's never too much, and the tomato sauce has a light spice that really brings out its flavor. The only things that sweeten the deal are the fantastically cool cashiers, and the rock-n-roll background music; seriously, I can make an extensive playlist of all the music I bought after eating at that place. The place is pretty small, but for some reason, you can always find a seat (this is still a mystery to me). Golden Boy is definite must for quality pizza, just remember to BRING CASH!
author: Delilah S.

description:
I meant it when I answered the yelp "last meal on earth" question as Golden Boy Pizza. This place serves up perfection on the daily. I love the veggie and supreme (polar opposites, yes) the most. Fresh, garlic tinged veggies and the best round sausage balls. Crispy and chewy crust- on the thicker side. It should be mentioned they serve Sicilian style rectangular pizza, rather than the traditional round pies. Stepping inside, the overwhelming feeling of true SF pride comes over me. Sometimes I have to hold back tears- of joy and ecstasy! 

Most always, there's a line congregating outside, but you'll notice it moves very quickly.  The staff here is amazing, nothing but the best of what SF has to offer. Order, they toss your slices in the piping hot oven, and then in mere moments- voila, heaven awaits. Love it! 

Not too much standing or sitting room, BUT if you want to really bask in the glory that is North Beach/Little Italy- take a quick walk over to Washington Square Park in front of Sts. Peter and Paul Church and have yourself a glorious picnic or romantic moonlit dinner. Ta-DA! 

Thank me later.
author: Kaitlyn A.

description:
Always crowded but This pizza is worth every wait in line and hours driving around trying to find parking. Better yet double park and have a friend  wait in line. 

Combo, and pep is my fav
author: Sally Y.

description:
Went here last night with high expectations after my friend ranted & raved about "the best pizza place in the city"...Golden Boy Pizza TOTALLY exceeded my expectations.

The Good:
GREAT, flavorful pizza with tons of toppings
90s Alternative music playing - I LOVED it, I would sit there just to listen to the music
BEER ON TAP!
Leftovers were amazing & smelled so good!
Ideal for take-out

The Bad:
The stools are annoyingly close to the bar table and you can't move them because they are stationary

I will definitely be going here again and again and again...
author: Amy P.

description:
Oooh Golden Boy..... you never do me wrong. Ever.

If you're looking for a quick place to grab a slice of pizza, come to Golden Boy. It's not great for sitting down, because it's a tiny little venue, BUT, the pizza is worth the wait if there's a line, and it's worth standing up. It's an unassuming little sidewalk joint.

But let's get to the juicy stuff..... The slices are BIG. They have a thick crust, and they are cheesy, delicious, and just plain, finger lickin' good! My personal favorite is the pesto veggie, but the cheese, combo, and pepperoni are all equally as awesome.  Throw some parmesan, chili flakes and oregano, and you are about to get down to business!

The prices are between $3-4 per slice, which I think is pretty fair.  Usually I can only eat two slices anyway, which means you're getting an awesome pizza dinner for under $10 - Schaweeeet!  Also, the pieces are square which is different than most places.... not that this matters whatsoever, because you're going to eat the entire thing regardless of what shape it's in....

Long story short: If you're looking for a bombass slice of pizza, this is hands down where you need to go.
author: Taylor L.

description:
Came in today for the Clam Garlic Slice along with a coke for $5 - and have to admit the pizza was absolutely spot on as usual! It's a great spot for pescetarians and vegetarians here in San Francisco.

I recommend it - and will be back for sure!
author: Brian D.

description: Great Pizza! We ate there twice while we were in San Francisco because it was the gem we found while on vacation. The slices are HUGE and service is friendly.
author: Darcy N.

description: Great delicious pizza.  The place is cash only.  No tables, you either take out or eat at an uncomfortable counter.
author: Hector A.

description:
2.5

So..how did this place get such high ratings? 

This past weekend, i went up to SF for a quick weekend getaway.  We pretty much spent the majority of the time eating...

Golden Boy Pizza caught our eye since they had so many reviews and still maintained a 4.5 rating.

Maybe my expectations were too high?

Stood in line forever.  There was ONE person working the counter (he was not only the one serving the pizza, but also doing the money and the beer!) - I think the long line was coming from the lack of service and not because of the high demand for the food.

Seriously sat there watching ONE guy scramble around trying to do like 5 jobs. (He was pretty good....but c'mon! hire some more help!)

So finally get our pizza to go ($3.75 for a small square of pizza - REALLY?) This better be some damn good pizza

We ordered the combo (which had good fresh ingredients) - but it was not good enough for me to get over the line and the price.  

Pizza was watever. Service sucked. Price sucked. Would i go again?

Hell NO.
author: Susan B.

description: Great atmosphere and great pizza!! The servers were friendly and their menu was hilarious!! It's THE place to go!!! I highly recommend!!
author: Kimmy S.

description:
Truly average.  I ate here a couple of times several years ago and I recently returned.  It was a disappointment.  The last couple of times I've been to Golden Boy, it was late and I was getting the remains of their veggie pesto day.  I thought it was good, not great, and certainly not "OMG".  I recently tried it during primetime hours with the vegetarian pesto coming right out of the oven.  Have my taste buds changed?  Have my standards risen?  It's just nothing special.  In fact, after a slice or two, I was sick of it.  The crust was doughy, the sauce undetectable.

Other pizza ruined forever?  I don't think so.

Please note:  Cash Only.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
Do you know that little bit of spit that can sometimes vault from your tongue when you're really hungry and your taste buds know they're about to get some?  Both times I've eaten at Golden Boy, I've been fortunate enough to experience a mouthgasm.

Golden Boy serves easily the best pizza I've ever had.  The price is reasonable and though it's a bit tight inside, the pie is well worth it.  The pictures on the wall are very interesting from a musical history perspective and the crowd-sourced sticker garnishes on just about every available surface lend this place some 'tude.
author: El Palo M.

description:
If Zachary's is my 1a pizza in the Bay Area, this place is easily 1b. Veggie pesto on foccacia... game over!! When I come to Golden Boy Pizza, I pretend I'm Manny Pacquiao and just beat $h!+ up!!

I discovered this place accidentally on a drunken night in North Beach many moons ago, but I think I come here on every visit to SF. Drunk or sober, this is a can't miss spot. Never mind the fact that people will heckle you if come in Dodger gear... after taking a loss in AT&T park... *jerks* this pizza will allow you to re-energize, in tasty fashion so that you can take the trash talk from the City folk and ask them when the last time Giants won a World Series in SF?? Hahaha thanks for the pizza!!!
author: Jason V.

description: This was on a whim finding this place, but I'm so glad we did!! I ordered a slice of pepperoni and a slice which I thought was pesto pizza. As I started eating the "pesto" slice it tasted really funny I figured the spinach was rotten lol it wasn't at all it had clams on it! For someone who loves seafood this is the slice for you, but since I am allergic to shell fish this wasn't a good choice. Nevertheless Max was amazing and switched out my slice for something else so sweet!!! Deffinatley coming back!!
author: Victoria H.

description:
Amazing pizza!   A friend and I just happened to walk by this places and saw a long line and we stopped to look at the pizzas in the window.  We weren't even hungry but waited for half an hour to get a slice of heaven!

The dough is just right, not to heavy or packy.  Loved the combo pizza!
author: Mickey B.

description: Best to get it fresh out of the oven. The wait is worth it. The portions are awesome. Large slice of pizza with great tasting ingredients. This is my favorite pizza shop in San Francisco. We almost always get the combo :) eating inside is not always an option, but it pretty cool. Stickers and ads and posters cover the majority of the walls. They have several beers on tap as well. Definitely one thing about the city that needs to be tried!
author: Taryne W.

description:
Had to grab a slice from here! Walking by was enough to tantalize my taste buds, and get my girls attention as well.

A slice of cheese for the girls to split and a slice of Sausage and Veggie for me.

Deep dish, crispy, gooey, flavorful, and DAMN good. If I lived in the area I would hit this place OFTEN!

Sláinte!
author: George P.

description:
I'll tell you why this pizza joint does so well VS the rest of the options in North Beach. 
Drunks and Freshly made melted cheese. 
Yes while the other joints make  a bunch of pies than let them dry up in their window golden boy is always baking pies one at a time and bringing them out hot.  The pizza is good but is not a 5 star pizza like the rest of the drunks here claim. lol
author: Manny R.

description: My fave place to get pizza in North Beach! It's Sicilian style, so they're actually square cuts of pizza. I always get the veggie or the clam and garlic. They're both really good. The bf either gets pepperoni or cheese and is always satisfied. This place never gets old! If you're in the area, you gotta go here!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I had some friends visiting from out of town & we did a touristy Alcatraz tour. Afterward one of them suggested pizza in North Beach, but didn't know where to go. I texted my roommate. His response: "Golden Boy!" Good call on his part. 

It's definitely kind of a dive, but it's delicious and cheap and delicious. It's Sicilian style pizza, which I like and the place doesn't have a zillion toppings and weird kinds of pizzas, which I also like. Everything is pre-made, and they just heat it up. There's only five options (cheese, pepperoni, clam/garlic, veggie, and combo). I went with the combo which has pepperoni, sausage, peppers, onion, & mushroom.  It was yummy!  I could taste all the different toppings and the crust was chewy.  It didn't fall apart and wasn't too dry.  They also serve beer, which is also a plus. 

There's not a lot of seating, but who cares? It's only pizza. Stand and eat if you have to! It's been awhile since I've done the late night North Beach scene, but I can see where this place would get pretty crowded at the end of the night on the weekends :)
author: George A.

description: Got a combo slice and a pepperoni slice. 3.25 for pepperoni and 3.75 for combo. Pretty tasty square piece of pizza. Filling. Very cheesy.
author: Helena C.

description: This is an awesome small hole in the wall pizza joint, with huge flavor. I love the Chicago style pizza, but this Sicilian style pie is absolutely incredible.. probably one of the best pizza's I've ever had.. so good, I took to large pies back to L.A with me.
author: Dave C.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots for a very casual dinner with friends. They have excellent deep dish pizza, which is always fresh and just out of the oven. You can also get beer to accompany the excellent food. 

A must try for any San Franciscan :)
author: Doruk G.

description:
Late night drunk fix for chicago style pizza.
Cheap slices. 

The staff are super friendly despite always being busy.

If you happen to walk indoors, the music is pretty rad, too.
author: Bunty S.

description: If you are drunk and hungry,this place will suffice. Otherwise,the pizza is a doughy construction that works because it is made fresh. The prices are not competitive but probably could be given all the customers they get. Don't bother coming here sober.
author: Mag N.

description: Delicious pizza, and easily the hottest pizza slangers and makers west of the Mississippi. I will be returning here until the day I die.
author: Daniel G.

description: Garlic clam pizza of course!! Since I've never seen that kind of toppings offered before at a pizzeria. Served Sicilian style, the crust was thick and soft. There wasn't enough tomato sauce though. The clams were in little bits but you could still taste it. There was a strong taste of garlic within the slice. I'm only giving points to this place for the creativeness of the toppings and humor of the menu. I liked all the collages on the walls though and how it felt like I was in a trailer.
author: Virginia Y.

description:
It's good for the bready-square-type of pizza, but I prefer Cable Car pizza on Broadway for their gigantic, NY style thin-crust pizza. The good thing is that the pizza comes out piping hot, topped generously, and very cheesy. 

I thought the combo was better than the clam....who says you only have to have one slice?
author: Jess C.

description:
I was doing a food tour of North Beach on a Saturday evening in August. We see this long line in front of a pizza joint, and I'm very intrigued by the line.
We go back by a few hours later (late night now) and still a line? So I get in line too. Great aroma coming from inside this place, you can see the pizza and slices from the window. 

The pizza was good, not great, but really good. They were out of a few really interesting combos, that include pesto, and another with clam (guess I'll have to go back). Maybe more stars if I have a few specialty slices. 

The place is small and has an industrial look, but there are counters and stools in there. It's is packed so it's an eat and go spot. The guys working there are friendly and fast. 

Worth checking out.
author: Ahmad B.

description:
OH EM GEE! Golden Boy Pizza has been on my brain since it last touched my lips on Saturday evening!  I don't know how I have lived here for 6 months without it!  

The line was long but it was definitely worth the wait!  Yum! I can't wait to get another slice of the cheesy goodness!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Do you like clams?  Do you like garlic?  You'll love the clam/garlic pizza at Golden Boy's.  It's my favorite because it comes with chopped parsley - the way it's supposed to be.

We've had all the flavors - pepperoni, sausage and combo.  They're all delicious.

What makes their pizza special is that it is pan style (~1/2" deep) and the crust is light and crispy. It's a great place for a slice and beer although you can do take out as well.

The staff are also great - they serve everyone with respect and are super-friendly.  It's bar seating with maybe 10 seats but you can always do take out and sit in Washington Sq Park 1.5 blocks away.
author: Serena S.

description: Big square of fresh pizza and a glass of decent wine for $7? Wonder why I come here often? It's quick, cheap and the service is great. I sometimes bring a book and have two glasses of wine, The music they play can be anything from heavy metal to '80s new wave. The only complaint I have, and it's a small one, is that their barstools are too close to the counter and they are bolted to the floor so you can't move them. I know it's designed that way because it's a small place and they want room for people to be able to walk behind but it's slightly uncomfortable, but doesn't stop me from going there at least once a week.
author: Laurie K.

description:
LOVE this place! I never thought I'd find deep dish pizza as good as I experienced growing up in Chicago. Then I discovered Golden Boy Pizza. For ridiculously inexpensive prices, you can try out a variety of flavors, from the standard (cheese) to the more unusual (oysters). The line can get long, but the wait is worth it. And theyre open late!

I'm not in North Beach often, regrettably, but when I am the day is not complete without a stop at Golden Boy.
author: Denise B.

description:
Golden Boy pizza is the definitive place to go for pizza in North Beach!  

I decided to try this place after reading all of the positive reviews and was NOT disappointed. Thank you Yelpers!  

There's something about that wonderfully golden foccacia crust that gets me every time. Thank goodness they don't post the calorie counts of their slices. My personal favorite is the hot-out-of-the-oven pepperoni but really, everything they have is delicious. Makes for a cheap tasty dinner after a long day at work.

Even though I'll be moving out of North Beach soon, I know I'll be coming back for my Golden Boy fix!
author: Stella L.

description: Clam and garlic pizza. Bring breath mints or mouthwash. Pairs well with a forty or boxed wine.
author: John B.

description:
Late night food reviews are always a little bit controversial for me... did I like it because it's actually delicious? Or did I like it because I was drunk off my ass?

Golden Boy is the former. Definitely delicious regardless of blood alcohol level. I looove the cheese pizza. So much cheese! There's a lot going for these pizzas, great toppings, good crust... and... I know people hate on the middle piece but I really like the middle piece. There's something about the soft chewyness of pizza dough slathered in sauce that I love... (great... now I'm hungry, damnit!)

My favorites were the cheese, garlic clam, and the pepperoni. I'm sure they'd all be my favorite if I ever got to eating it all.

Be warned, cash only.
author: Karina G.

description: Delicious Rome style pizza, very nostalgic for us!  Great service and a good value.
author: Liz Y.

description:
Pros:
I found this place by accident, and they showed me a new permutation of pizza toppings I never thought possible: Garlic, clam, and parsley! You have to try it, weird as it may sound (assuming you don't have a shellfish allergy). I like having one slice of that and one slice of pepperoni to balance it out, but it really blew me away, and now I've been bakc several times to get it.

Cons:
There isn't really great inside seating; your best bet is to grab a slice and cruise around North Beach on foot eating it.

Fun:
At the North Beach Festival you can dodge the drunken hordes of people by going to the side and ordering in a much shorter line.
author: Mike G.

description: Very yummy pizza with crispy crusts. Good selection of beer on tap and its inexpensive.
author: Kristan B.

description: Clam and garlic?  On a pizza?  Ok, I'll try it...and I'm glad I did.  The flavors of the garlic, cheese, parsley, and clam worked it's magic coming together on top of a fluffy foccacia bread crust.  Perfect with a nice cold brew or to soak up your brew.  At $3.75 a slice it's cheap eats for sure.  Be prepared to stand in line, but it's so worth the wait!
author: Shirley C.

description: Stopped in here for a quick slice while bar hopping.   The slice size is great and the crust was supper tasty.  Of course, I had been drinking so most pizzas would have probably been good too.  The point I'm trying to make is that this pizza did not suck, the price was right and it was served by friendly staff.  I'll be back here.
author: Robert J.

description:
When you're drunk, Saturday night stumbling, wishing you could teleport into your bed or on to your bathroom floor, do not make the mistake of going straight home. Go to Golden Boy. He is a good boy, and his dough, cheese and toppings will be magic jewels in your tumultuous tummy that will improve your hangover potential by at least 33%.

Basically, this pizza is hangover liability insurance.

(+1 star for the crazy crap hanging on the walls to entertain my drunk, hungry ass)
author: Serena Q.

description: This is my favorite slice in SF.  Reminds me of the kind of pizza my momma use to make us.  Love the thick light crisp crust .. mmm!  I only eat here at lunch because will feel guilty for eating this in the evening.  Gotta keep slim, but if i didn't care, it would be on like donkey kong.  #bestpizzainsf #meltsinyourmouth #eatit
author: Lily S.

description:
I don't know what happened. 

Golden Boy must have had a bad day...or SOMETHING! We chose to have dinner here since Yelp told us we wouldn't be disappointed. You walk in and the feel of the restaurant is a divey one. We ordered slices of the Pesto Veggie, Garlic Clam, and Combo. I was excited about the 1st two since you can get Combo at any place. 

A fresh whole Combo had just come out of the oven and we were served a piece of that. As far as the Pesto Veggie and Garlic Clam, we were served a piece from the pie that was sitting in front of the window. The gentlemen helping us put those into the oven to heat them up. We sit down and have our fresh Combo slice. It was good, but I didn't think it even compared to Round Table's Combo.

Finally, the two that I really wanted to try came out and we dove into those. Disappointment. Both were dry and tasted bland. Maybe because they were reheated, the sauce dried up? I don't know, but I got cotton mouth with each bite. I tried to help it out by adding a lot of the oregano, Parmesan, and pepper, but nothing helped. 

I think I may have been unlucky and had a bad experience since Yelp says otherwise. Not so Golden, Boy.
author: David P.

description:
Good pizza, but can't say it is any style other than doughy.  It is very thick crust (we actually discussed this, that it wasn't Italian, was't New York and not Chicago either).

It is kind of delicious doughy squares.  We had every flavor.  The clam topping one, you don't quite get clam flavor other than texture.  I can't remember the rest anymore.

Think this is fantastic comfort pizza, but nothing more than that.  Decor is kind of cool hipster feel, not great for having a conversation or groups.  Good for a quick bite.  We had a group of four and it was very difficult to have a conversation.
author: Li Y.

description: My go-to pizza joint for quick (if there's no line) and cheap pizza slice with a PBR. Highly recommended!
author: P J.

description:
I love Golden Boy! 

The other weekend my friends and I decided to do an unofficial pizza crawl...buy 1 slice of pizza from a bunch of pizza places and split it between 5 people. Needless to say, we didn't get very far. Golden Boy was our second stop, and although I've had it before, the combination of the pizza staring at us through the window + the delightful smell was enough to just stop our 'pizza crawl' altogether and just order enough slices to fill everyone up. 

The line is usually out the door, but it goes by pretty fast. The pizzas are always freshly baked, but once you make your order, they pop it back in the oven for a few minutes so that the top is soft, doughy and cheesy, and the bottom has the perfect crisp. Affordable and open late!!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
If you're looking for marble counter tops and cute little candles at your table with a glass of white wine in an ultra sterile overly sanitized dining area then head to a pizza joint in the Fidi because this is a dive. City Health Card = 88

If you're looking for arguably the best pizza in San Francisco this is your first stop.  When I first started coming I stuck to the combination and pepperoni. The pepperoni is great and the combination is one of the best I've ever had. This isn't an overly glorified "gourmet" slice with Mousse-Filled Crust or some crap, its great down to earth classic pizza with an outstanding crust. This is a square pizza served with fork and knife for a reason so use the utensils. 

I really feel bad I didn't give Ms. Massachusetts a big enough tip so I'll catch you next time.

All the previous reviews are correct you must try the Clam and Garlic. WARNING: If your first slice is the clam you'll never be able to have another slice of pizza before comparing it to this. If you're local, start with the combination.

They have a lot of great beer on tap with classic rock on the radio and the Giants game playing in the background.

DO NOT come here if: You're afraid your Marina girlfriend will ask to turn off "More than a Feeling" because she wants to hear Lady Gaga.

DO come here if you want some of the best pizza in San Francisco. Let me know of a superior slice in the city. Sure there may be a slice of equal quality but better?
author: Justin S.

description: Only annoying thing was cash only. Great food for late night. Definite must try and worth the wait in line
author: Alex S.

description: A hole in the wall pizza bar that is well worth the $3-4  per slice. It's not classic Italian or Chicago Deep dish, but it can't be beat for a quick tasteful snack.  The $4 glass of wine is not a bad deal either: Ravenswood Cab, not too shabby. Easy 5 stars.
author: Anthony W.

description:
I am writing this review before I introduce this square pizza delicacy to my cousin when we dine together this evening.  I have bellied up to this pizza bar 4 times and this is my first review.

My wonderful father, God rest his soul, baked pizza in a rectangular pizza pan for my brother and me and I'm sure this is one of the reasons I am so fond of Golden Boy.

I am also certain that were the pans in which Gold Boy pizzas baked shaped like an Islamic crescent, I'd love this slice all the same.

Yeah, Golden Boy serves quite a slice and offers a fun atmosphere for two blokes out for a quick bite and a pint of beer.
author: Jay D.

description: The garlic/clam pizza was one of a kind.  The gooey cheese with a crunchy crust topped with garlic and clams was amazing.  A good place to get a late night bite or just a casual meal.  Absolutely love their pizza!
author: Brandon K.

description: I was looking forward to this place after reading all of the great reviews, but unfortunately left disappointed. The inside has a cool vibe and lots of character. But it is really crowded. My family and I are there and the stools are so close to the counter and I kept feeling like I was going to fall off. The service was very slow. And to too it all of my pizza was not good! Very doughy and flavorless. If I ever come here again I hope I have a better experience!
author: Madeline S.

description:
Scouring the streets of North Beach late at night looking for some good eats? Just look for the huge glowing neon finger pointing down at this little pizza joint.

After a few rounds at the bars in North Beach and waiting in line for 20+ minutes at 2:00 a.m. smelling the undeniably intoxicating aroma of a pizza being baked, it is literally the best slice of pizza you've ever had. After having returned here a number of times during the day to get a fair sampling of the pizza, I still really like it, but it's charm is still in being the late night pizza spot.
author: Erich D.

description: My boyfriend and I went to this spot after a night with some friends.  It had a line out the door on a Fri night I think it was 12am or 1am.  It was late and the line was long.  The pizza was worth the wait.  Loved the crunchy crust and the tasty toppings.  I had the chicken garlic and pepperoni.  We ended up going back a few days later but this time in the day time.  The pizza was still awesome as we remembered.  It's affordable but  when we sat in it was so hot that eating pizza was hard but I wanted the crunchy bread.  The seating is great on the bar but not so great near the restroom.  Seats where bolted on the floor so you are sitting too close to the wall and it's a good thing I'm petite I can sit on this but others had to lean on the stool sideways.  But hey we are here for the food.
author: jennifer p.

description:
The pizza is decent at best, also there is definitely better pizza places around the area that you should probably check out instead. 

To me being from new York my standards are quite high when it comes to pizza. And golden boys did not even come close. The bread of the pie slice felt and tasted almost like a microwave pizza, just mushy. Which sometimes is not a bad thing. But you need to have good sauce, and that was almost flavorless. And then the cheese was decent and pepperoni was.. Well... Pepperoni. 

Oh and wtf is up with square slices?! Who eats square pizza?! 

Over all I'll probably skip golden boys next time I'm near it and go somewhere better, especially for 8.$ for two slices and a soda. GTFO!
author: Adrian A.

description: Pizza here was tasty before and after drinking. :P There was a line, but no wait time after order, so thats cool. They had 4-5 options to pick from including a few vegetarian options. 2 slices were enough to fill me.
author: Rohit J.

description:
If you're in San Francisco and you don't go to Golden Boy for pizza, you're a missing out on something amazing!! This is the best pizza I have ever had. 
I had planned on going somewhere else for dinner and happened to see all of their pizza in the window as I was walking by... I couldn't resist. And you won't either.

They don't have a TON of flavors, but you won't be disappointed with what they do have. 

The atmosphere is fun and sort of hipster-ish, I love it. They're open real late on the weekends.. another PLUS! Also, the food is cheap but the quality is NOT! I've made many trips to the North Beach area just for this place.

Again, if you don't go here.. you're missing out on a slice of life (pun intended).
author: Marisa D.

description:
So i was hungry, and decided I wanted Pizza!

Got on my phone, got to Yelp, typed in Pizza in SF, and I found myself waiting in line for 20 minutes. Luckily, i became great friends with the guys behind me and the time passed by a lot faster. Note: PARKING IS HORRIBLE!!! 

Advice:get a friend to drive u so s/he can wait in the car while u get in line. 

This place opens until 2am on Saturday, and i was there at 11pm. Can't imagine how crowded this place would've been if it was 1:30am, when ppl from clubbing are hungry and searching for food!

Apparently, there are three types of pizza per day. Man, the pesto with zucchini and mushroom was SOOOOOOOOOO good. It was pan fried on a spongy bread type of thing (not chicago or NY style).

This place gets an extra star b/c the pizza are out on display, but they still pop them into the oven so they are hot and fresh! YUMMMMMMM

man, i want some right now!!!!!!!!!

the pizza guy was nice too when i told him it was first time there!
author: Jen H.

description:
Golden Boy is my favorite go-to spot for the late night munchies... even though I live a (Bay) bridge away. It is definitely worth the $5 toll. Sure there are a lot of open-til-late pizza joints in SF but Golden Boy is by far theee best!! And you know it has to be theee best because there is still a line out the door at 2 in the morning. 

The garlic clam, the pesto, the combo.. Ohh so golden in my mouth!!

TEAM SQUARE PIZZA!! :)

P.S. It is hard to miss this place, just look for the finger pointing right at it.
author: Krystal G.

description:
If you ever get the munchies in the North Beach area then you'll most likely end up Golden Boy Pizza.  Their lines are out the door , so expect a 5-10 min wait. Eat-in or take-out.  

6" by 6" Pizza slices: 
 Cheese $2.75  
 Pepperoni or Sausage $3.25 
 Clam/Garlic $3.75   
 Pesto/Vegetarian $3.75 
 Combination $3.75
author: Stacey L.

description:
Mmmmmm...love Golden Boy.

The atmosphere, the pizza, the pizza. Also the pizza is amazing.

Seriously it's gotta be the best pizza joint in SF. Sicilian style heaven. Everything is proportioned correctly and it's also easy on the wallet.

Only thing I wish is that I lived closer or they delivered.
author: Matt S.

description: Good pizza. Hip vibe. Quick service. What more do you want?
author: Syddie P.

description:
It's funny... I know SF really really well and never heard of Golden Boy Pizza till a few months ago. Funny thing is that this place has been here since the '70s. Ok, so I'm now a fan! When one thinks about it, it's actually hard to find a decent pizza by the slice in SF. Although I do have my favorites scattered around The City. I have yet to have found one in the North Beach area until now.

With a lot of the older establishments changing or closing it's nice to know that there are still some local haunts one can still go to!
author: Majid S.

description:
Real quick!

While I'm on the topic of awesome pizza. Golden Boy Pizza is arguably the best pizza I've ever had............past 2a and before 9a that is. 

Who says square pizza doesn't taste as good triangular. While we were stationary at Gino and Carlo during the hunt, I had and cube of the veggie and an Italian sausage and olives. I was actually satified after the first one, but I was "forced" to costume the second quadrilateral since we were running low on time and struggling to decode the next clue. Finally, after much belligerence and debauchery, we were off to the next node.

As for the Golden Boy, I made it back here during SantaCon two days later to try the fabled clam and garlic pizza. UHHhhhhh, SO GOOD! Anti-breath freshingly fantastic!! It was definitely worth the wait in a huge line of Xmas revelers and tipsy reindeer!
author: Andrew D.

description: Awesome fresh pizza for the economical traveler. Beer and wine is also available at a great low price. I had their "fine" red wine and it was lovely. The music was good and have the entire restaurant ambiance an alternative feel without the attitude. The server was beautiful and he was super friendly with all of my friends--he also has a sweet beard! Tip him well!
author: Salomon R.

description: We live in the Peninsula and my family drive up to Golden Boy for their awesome pizzas!
author: Ann I.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is the best. I've been going here for 20 years and they deliver every time. Same quality year after year. I love the sausage slice. Clam and garlic is good. Nothing here is bad. Great for late night after the bars, a quick slice before dinner or lunch. It's a Sicilian style focaccia bread. Thicker than regular pizza but its got that crispy Pizza Hut crust in the bottom. They have pizza ready in the window and they heat it up for you to order. The turn over is fast so pizzas don't sit out for more more than 30 mins. Go here!!!! Don't sweat the line! Goes pretty fast, sometimes. Just depends how hungry and drunk you are.
author: Ron B.

description:
It's missing that final punch to make it into a 5 star pizzeria but oh boy, their clam garlic sicilian pizza and the combo gets a nod from a new yorker.

All the flavors balanced out perfectly.  I think my buddy S R. said it the best "not too cheesy.  not too greasy.  dough is thick but not heavy and adds its own flavor to the pizza."  I this this sums up my experience here.  

Remember, you gotta get it when it is made fresh out of the oven.

Golden Boy is too young for credit cards....cash only...
author: Jang David K.

description:
First off this place just plain ROCKS!!!! They carry that rare square slice!!!! One that tastes o so good! They always have a variety but my fave is the plain ol' Sausage slice. Bread is soft with a slight crunchy edge. They usually play Rock/Metal songs but have also played alternative as well as classic rock.

If you go on a weekend you will most likely get a small line right outside. It's a popular place but it's worth the wait. The inside has a seating area but being the the layout is narrow the seating is limited. They also have some good beer on draft!

Go there!!!! Oh and bring cash. CASH ONLY! Come on now..it's only pizza! :D
author: Eddie G.

description: First, I have to say I am a pizza traditionalist, and grew up in NY. I love Sicilian that has a hard crisp base with a soft top. I read reviews on Golden Boy and saw others raved about the pizza. I ordered a piece from a sheet that came right from the oven and it was soft, and only marginally good. If the sauce had been super flavorful - I would have bumped up my rating, but it was pretty mediocre.
author: Marc R.

description: Maybe it's the drunchies... But whatever it is... Very good and affordable pizza! Cons? Cash only and limited seating. Not a fan of the garlic clam pizza though.
author: Katarina D.

description:
I woke up with this pizza in my refrigerator one morning.  Not knowing who got it or where it came from, I decided to be brave and eat it anyway.  Luckily, I didn't die from food poisoning.  Instead, it turned out to be so amazing that I ate all 3 slices left in my fridge.  I later found out from my friend that the pizza was from Golden Boy on a nighttime munchie run.  Since then, I have been back like 10 times.  The focaccia pizza base is like a golden brown, soft, chewy piece of heaven.  Yes kids, this is like God's pizza.  There really are no words to describe how good it is until you try it yourself.

As if the food didn't speak for itself, the ambiance of the actual location is the essence of North Beach.  It's a big metal, shed-like dive bar with a row of counter seating and walls that are covered in random amusing stickers.  I also like the pointy finger sign.

If you're going for the first time, don't be a boring cheese slice eater (unless that's "your thing").  Be bold and try the pesto veggie or the clam & garlic!!  Just make sure you're not about to go on the hottest date of your life, because your breath will smell like poo for hours after eating either of these.
author: Christy L.

description: After years of walking past and seeing the lines, I was in the area with a friend and had the hunger and needed something to eat, and decided to eat some pizza. Waited about 15mins in a short line (much shorter than all the lines I've seen previously) and sat at the bar where I was served. The pizza with sausage I had was hot with a thick crust, and very tasty. It was so good I had the garlic and clams and that was just as tasty! Very homey and delicious place, and the single unisex bathroom is "interestingly" decorated!! Great food and the beer I had was good too! Will return since I stay with sis who lives just a half mile away! I hate the plastic world BUT love the cash-only!! :)
author: Tony L.

description:
Dear Golden Boy,

Landed in SF last night at 11 on Thursday.  Hit North Beach at 12 and was very hungry. I got some of the very last slices and you were delicious. 
I Came to watch the Bills at the North Star on Saturday, and someone brought some Golden Boy, and you were delicious.
I love you. When I visit San Francisco, I come to visit you. If you were in DC I would have to buy bigger clothes 

Love,
Molly
author: Molly M.

description: I LOVE GOLDEN BOY PIZZA! They serve San Francisco's best deep dish pizza. It is open late, they serve pitchers of beer, and there is usually an attractive pizza girl behind the counter.  It is close to many of my favorite North Beach bars and is perfect for the late night munchies!  Be sure to bring cash!
author: Matt S.

description:
Saw this very promising star to money ratio rating on Yelp and headed straight to North Beach after 3 hours of kayaking on a sunny, 78 degree September day on the bay (what?!).

Definitely was not disappointed. We were lucky that we arrived when the lunch crowd had died, because it's one of those tiny alley-sized joints with very limited bar seating. I think the 4 of us pretty much sampled all the pizzas they had to offer. My favorite was the clam and garlic. SO SO GARLIC. And the dough/crust was just the right combination of bready and crunchy.

The lovely lady manning the front was also one of the best multi-taskers I've come across. She could hear every single order and request, even from halfway across the room while banging around cups and mashing the register. It was so bat-like and impressive.

Would definitely come back often if North Beach wasn't such a fiasco to get to every time.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Best. Pizza. Ever.

My friend took me here after a late night of drinking and I remember thinking the next morning that the pizza was delicious but it must have been a case of the drunken munchies.

It isn't. I have had pizza from Golden Boy several more times since then and every time it delivers on all levels. Herbs baked into the dough, perfectly melted cheese, flavorful sauce, great toppings.

The line is indeed long at the later hours but it is worth the wait. Decently priced as well and worth the money.
author: Brittany L.

description: Was deeply disappointed with this place. I read amazing reviews about it and came to check it out. I'm visiting San Francisco for two days and walked about 30 min to get to Golden Boy Pizza. When we got there, the line was pretty long but we didn't mind waiting because the pizza looked good and the servers seemed fast. I sat down with my girlfriend and we each got a slice and a beer. We sat down and talked and chilled and when I realized my bag was gone. I had my purse stolen INSIDE the restaurant. I talked to the staff and no one did anything about it. They didn't even look around or ask the patrons about it. NOTHING. We asked about the surveillance camera and they refused to give us access to it. Inside my bag I had my wallet with my cards and my drivers license, I had my sweaters, my go pro , a bottle of champagne for the night and much more. I'm from Brazil and I've been to some grungy places , but I've NEVER had anything stolen from me INSIDE A RESTAURANT. that's absurd !!! What kind of trashy place is this ??? What really upset me is that no one moved a single finger to help us out. Because I chose to sit down in this place, I'm gonna have to cancel my trip and leave two days earlier than planned because someone stole my bag inside the restaurant and I have nothing left on me. Thanks golden boy. Your patrons are real trashy and your staff doesn't give a fuck about what happens to their customers.
author: Juliana B.

description:
On a recent tour of old San Francisco haunts we stopped here for lunch. As a  Portland resident I have to admit there is no Sicialian pizza available in Portland that compares with Golden Boy. The pizza is enjoyably olive oil moist with a crunchy crust. The tomato sauce is perfect. You either want to get a single slice and eat very very slowly to savor it or order way too much and stuff yourself. The selections available run the usual gamut - cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, clam/garlic and a favorite of mine, pesto.

It's a great place to stop by and grab a slice, but if the line is out on the sidewalk like it was the day we visited, you'll need patience. The counter person was cheerful and efficient, but not in any hurry. "Hey, there's a huge line of people standing out on the sidewalk, let's get in line and see what the wait is for.".
author: Steve R.

description: My fiance and I came to this joint after being turned down from another restaurant that was full. It's a very casual place (places at bar); staff is friendly and quick! Very good and cheap supper option! I know why all the good reviews.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Delicious late night food stop!!! The pizzas are squares and the flavor is just explosive and divine. Don't be turned off by the line, it goes really quick. There is practically no wait for the pizza either, and they heat it up for you, etc. 

Check out which ones they made fresh as something to do while you're waiting in line, and get that one! All the flavors are yummy yummy yummy.

Also, they only accept cash (late night at least).  They will guide you to an ATM if you do not have such bills on you.
author: Adele Z.

description:
Soooo worth it!  

Make the trip to North Beach for this pizza or stumble in on a bar crawl.  If you're anywhere near it, the smells will lure you in.

It's a low-key pizza place with a pretty decent beer selection and plenty of wall graffiti to zone out at whilst devouring slice by slice.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
BEST. AFTER PARTYING PIZZA. EVER.

I don't care what you say, New York pizzerias, I will stay loyal to Golden Boy's. Thick crispy crust, melty gooey cheese, oil dripping everywhere, delicious toppings...the smell enough while waiting in line is enough to make me go crazy. Slices are huge too!

Only minus is that there's always a line and you have to wait out in the cold :( But even then, the sacrifice is WORTH IT! :)
author: Joyce H.

description:
Great place for a slice of pizza late night.  They have tons of different kinds (pepperoni, cheese, combo, garlic and clam (!)).  Prices are about $3-4 a slice and there's always a line late night.

Cash only.
author: Wally W.

description: I've had pizza from many pizzas in the city, as for this one I get the hype and uniqueness but the overall quality...I've had better. And after waiting 45 min for two large pizzas to be delivered didn't expect to have to wait another hour before we could eat it, reason being the cheese pizza we ordered...had no cheese bc it was all stuck to the cardboard box.. talk about cheap. if your going to charge as much for pizzas and slices as you do...buy some 20 cent spacers for your boxes like most pizzeria's do so u don't get complaining and disappointed customers such as myself and our company!!
author: Tiffani L.

description: Yum! Huge squares for $4 or less! I've tried the cheese pizza as well a the clam & garlic. The dough is thick, chewy, and flavorful. Clam & garlic leaves a STRONG garlic taste/smell in your mouth the rest of the day, but that just means it's doing its job right?? Love it!
author: Lynn K.

description:
fluffy delicious large sized square pizza slices for cheap.

me likey. 

bring cash if you want to avoid an ATM fee.
author: Renalen C.

description: A unique light and airy square pizza that will please even the die hard round pizza eater. The pizza are on display in front of the window so you can make your choice before you enter the counter inside. Very very reasonably price for such heavenly pizza. No lines for me on a Good Friday before Easter around noon!
author: Wolfy W.

description: The best late night pizza place after a night out in North Beach! The combination pizza and Garlic Pesto/Clam are the BEST! Brace yourself though, your breath will be smelling like garlic the rest of the night! Sometimes there's a line out the door after 12am, but service is quick, and they always spend the time to heat the pizza back up for you!
author: Cynthia L.

description: I used to come here all the time, I went for my lunch break. Last week Miss Cranky pants was quite rude to me and other tourists. She needs some cranky pills or to simply not work there.  Good thing little Italy is loaded with other pizza places because I would like to enjoy my lunch break for now on.
author: M B.

description:
Golden Boy catered my company's lunch today, so I was excited for free pizza.  Ordered the cheese, pepperoni and combo.  Unlike the usual triangular slices, these pizzas were cut up into squares and rectangles.  It was easier to grab and in a lesser portion size - perfect for me since I wanted to try a little bit of everything!

The dough is soft and fluffy, with just the right amount of sauce and cheese.  I hate it when pizzas don't have a good ratio between the sauce and cheese.  My favorite was the combo.  It looked a little weird to me that this was a combo since it looked more like a veggie, but with small pieces of sausages.  I would say it's one of the better combos I've had so far.  It came with onions, zucchini, tomato slices and few pieces of sausages on each slice, making it a lighter slice of pizza rather than the overpowering on numerous of toppings on other combo pizzas.  

My slices were a bit cold when I got to eat them, but it was still very good.  Can't wait to try it when it's fresh and hot out of the oven!
author: Nancy S.

description:
Very good pizza!! I was looking for an amazing slice of pizza and didnt want to go to a chain place like round table or pizza hut. I ran into this place after reading all the reviews on yelp and was not dissapointed at all!! 

2 to 3 bucks a slice. They only take cash only which kinda sucks.
I found parking rather quick but the reason this place doesn't get 5 starts is because of location, and tigh seats and no room to eat in the actual place. 

I will come back though for another slice
author: Joe B.

description:
I had the clam and garlic and it's overrated. The clams were tiny and overcooked so I barely noticed eating any clams on this pizza. I thought it was a cheese pizza. 
I would have given this place a 3/5 if I didn't try the combo pizza next. That was my favorite as it wasn't too overwhelming, it had the right proportion of meat and veggies, plus these pizzas are healthy. You won't be getting an oozing of oil from the cheese if you reheat this (i saved a slice for lunch the next day). 
This is an awesome pizza for the health conscious and I love how they used foccacia bread, a nice change.

As for sitting area, come with a small group of people at most. There are only those tall single seats facing the wall with a strip of table across the wall. I think there are about 15 seats in all.
author: Jayme N.

description:
Holy cow. What a pleasant surprise this place is! My girlfriend took me here on one of our weekend excursions and what a jaw dropping experience it was! 

First off, the interrior is pretty cool. I dig the whole urban vibe of it. The music was equally as hip and the staff was super friendly. Our meal was very affordable too.

The pizza sets itself apart from all other pizzas I've had-- and I've had plenty. If someone were to bring me a slice, without telling me where it's from, I'd be able to say, "Yep, that's Golden Boy Pizza." It's that good. I love those little squares!

I WILL BE RETURNING!!!
author: Estevan D.

description: Yummy late night pizzaaaaaaaaaaa! Pesto and garlic and clam ... what more can you ask for!
author: Stella L.

description: The service is fast, the interior is fun and cool. I wouldn't exactly call it a "locals" place, but its definitely nice and small, not like some giant pizza restaurant. The pizza is relatively good here. Personally, I love it, and this tends to be one of our favorite pizza places in the Bay.
author: Ashley D.

description: Excellent for your late night pizza. Line outside says it all. Good quality, well topped and thin crispy slice for $3.50.
author: Robert K.

description: Got lost looking on my walk in search of Katanaya, a top rated Bay Area ramen house. Ended up all the way in North Beach and saw Golden Boy Pizza, a restaurant that I hadn't been to since I was 13. Damn good quality pizza with friendly customer service and nice size portions. From the 3 songs that I heard play within the time of enjoying my meal I do have to say they have some good taste with their music choice as well. Only downfall which happens to be a huge pet peeve of mine, especially when I only have debit on me. Cash only.
author: Patrick O.

description:
COMBO. SLICE. LOVE. IT.

Great for a late night snack to ward off drunken tendencies. Slice of the combo is the absolute best. though for some reason i just want a middle slice or edge instead of the corners. 

Remember to bring cash and tip the hard working peeps behind the counter...they put up with a lot of shit every day.

Too bad they don't sell half pies like their San Mateo location.
author: Siri S.

description:
I grew up in North Beach and nostalgic memories of Golden Boy Pizza fill my mind whenever I think of my elementary and middle school days... My friends and I would mosy on over to Golden Boy's in our catholic school uniforms and order a slice or two of pizza after school. We thought we were so cool... Ha.

The square-cut pizza here is simple, cheap, and delicious. Not super greasy, generous toppings, and freshly baked on a tasty crust. The place itself is small and exudes a dive bar hole-in-the-wall vibe, but it's all part of the magic. Metal stools line the wall and bar counter. Local flyers are tacked on the walls and windows. Beers on tap. Cash only.

All the pizzas are amazing, but the clam and garlic is BOMB.
author: Michelle C.

description: This is a hard review to write because I have such mixed feelings. There are things I like a lot: The location, the atmosphere inside, the promptness of getting a slice. Conversely, I don't think the slice is great. It is quite greasy even if one gets a vegetarian slice. Also, the sauce hasn't much flavor. I feel like it needs to be doctored up a bit. I realize all of this is subjective, but I am just yelping.
author: S. G.

description: Love this place! Pizza is amazing and the employees are amazing.. Especially that cute little blond Mexican girl  she makes my day every time I go in there.
author: Chad H.

description:
i hiked up to Golden Boy from Market and Montgomery.  totally worth it.  some of the best pizza i've had in the city.  when you enter, it's like you're in an airplane hanger where they're blasting Dead Kennedys.  got a pepperoni and the clam/garlic special.  they heat it up before they bring it over to you and it comes out just the way i like - melty, cheesy top with a chewy crust.

just an fyi... if you plan on getting the clam/garlic special, bring some industrial strenth gum with you.
author: Tina L.

description:
Planning a trip back to west coast and Im thinking- "yea, what was that slice I dogged out there late nite, stuff was good, why cant you pump gas in Oregon, it had a big neon finger, multi variable calculus, good cheese and tasty spices"

So I search yelp and YES, got it! This place is great, very happy to find a tasty, unique slice on the West Coast. After treading through the rest of the state to find a regular pizzeria with a good slice, figures that it takes me to Joe D's hometown to find it.
author: Andrzrej K.

description: I tried the Yelp favorites, the pesto vegetarian pizza and the clam and garlic pizza. Both was delicious, but the winner for me was the pesto vegetarian. All the slices/pies had a generous amount of toppings and packed with flavor. The line can get really long... Instead of ordering through the window its faster if you go inside and order there.
author: Uyen L.

description: This is a 4 star pizza when you eat it fresh. Its a terrible pizza if you have leftovers. The foccacia becomes really hard as does the cheese and pepperoni.
author: Rod W.

description:
I have walked by this place many times, and just never felt the inclination to give it a try . . . WTF is wrong with me?! I've been missing out! 

I really wanted to give that clam and garlic one a try, but I was afraid . . . and, now I see that I must ignore these stupid thoughts and just go for it . . . next visit. 

This time, I went for the combination. The pepperoni factor seems to be a bit lacking on both the combo and pepperoni pizzas, but damn it... the pizza is good. And, the crust is wonderful. 

I was also surprised in a happy way to see that along with the typical offerings of Parmesan cheese and crushed red pepper . . . they also offer oregano, and garlic powder! LOVELY! The more I get to play with my food, the better! 

You can eat this pizza like a normal hand-held pizza, but I recommend using the fork and knife they supply with your slice. 

I also wasn't expecting this little place to have beer on tap, and quite a nice little variety . . . don't ask me what kind, as I opted for bottled water . . . just check it out for yourself . . . if you can get in. It is tiny and gets packed... but, the wait is worth it. 

They are also very nice there. They didn't even flinch when I inadvertently did a "dine and dash" number. As we were walking down the block, someone in our group says "did you already pay, no . . . did you?" . . . Ooops! Running back in there, the gal there just said "oh, I was just thinking . . . maybe they'll come back... and, thank you for being so honest." Yes, they are busy . . . so don't go in there trying to pull a fast one, because this is a place you WILL want to frequent on a regular basis.
author: Kara B.

description: I had the garlic clam pizza and it was amazing! My husband got cheese which was awesome too. Small little place, line out the door, but well worth the wait!
author: Emily S.

description: Pizza is hot, crispy, cheap, and tasty. Decor is nothing fancy. There's often a line but it moves pretty fast. I've been here 3  times for lunch and will continue to go.
author: Linda W.

description:
This place is far from fancy, I like to refer to it as a "pizza joint". 
Seating is limited, no tables just bar stools. 

CASH ONLY, as are most of the Northbeach neighborhood establishments. They do however have an ATM machine in the back before the bathrooms. 

Square pizzas, good size, great flavors (Pepperoni, Pesto, Clam & Garlic, Combination, Sausage, Cheese), tasty dough. 
*ask for yours to be toasted, it tastes even better. 

Regarding the ambiance, well this is a chill, relaxed setting with a flatscreen playing sports and pints of beer going around. The walls are covered with stickers, ceiling to floor, so make your visit extra special by bringing your own sticker and add to the collection. 

Lunchtime and weekends bring in the crowds so be aware of the wait.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
It's 9:30 in the morning and I vaguely remember waking up at 1 am to my brother sneaking around the house with Golden Boy Pizza in tow!  It was about 3 hours since my munchies died down, but the smell of garlic was emanating from the box and woke me from my dream state...

Brother thank you for introducing me to GBP!  I have been on a search for the PERFECT clam and garlic pizza for years... I've had a few that I've loved, but never CRAVED like this!
author: Chrysantha C.

description: I normally prefer thin crust pizza but this place was great. While most restaurants were closing shop, we were happy to find a pizza place that was still open. We figured that the line out the door was a good sign and Golden Boy has a cool window display showing you the available pizza. I ordered 1 slice of the pepperoni. It had a great flavor and it hit the spot. If it wasn't so close to closing time, I might have ordered more. Well worth the stop.
author: David M.

description:
If this place wasn't located in North Beach, it would be the best place. But it's located in North Beach. The setting is simple. You have the bar opposite from the ovens and its a steel plate bar with plenty of room and view of the television. Then you have the back seating area although I have no idea why you'd want to go back there. The pizza is delish. It's not like New York Pizza. It's not like Chicago Pizza. It's tasty though, and I've been eating pizza since I could chew. It was my favorite place. Beers aren't expensive and the staff is so, so nice. They are always smiling and friendly and they don't rush you. It's such a nice set-up.

That said, if you go on a weekend or around 9 on a Friday, be prepared to be around some of the dumbest people you've ever been around in your life. 

I went there when the Bulls were playing in the playoffs. It was so pleasant. They changed the channel from the hockey that was on after there was no veto over my request. And the music is always good too, oldies stuff usually.
