If this place were in The Mission or Castro or Portero Hill, it would be excellent.

They're cash only but they do have an ATM at the back.
author: Sergi A.

description:
The fact that this is so highly rated makes me really pessimistic that there's actually good pizza in SF.  Sorry, I'm from the Northeast where there's no excuse for bad pizza.  I know there's tons of East Coast transplants here so I still have some hope that something either exists already or finally will someday.

That said, this place isn't bad, so long as theres no line, and there always is.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
This fluffy, square slice reminds me of roller rink pizza. While I prefer the cracker thin cousin, it's fair to give this shop a star above the rest. I've had my fill of North Beach on-the-go slices and this one is certainly a head above the rest. 

Plus, extra points for being able to sit at the counter and order a crisp pilsner while you wait. So yeah, when you're looking for something quick and easy or just want a chill spot to enjoy a beer, Golden Boy's alright by me.
author: Monica S.

description: Nothing too much to add here...awesome pizza.  Square.  Focaccia.  Stickers.  Lines.  Thrash metal.  You get the picture.  My new favorite greasy pizza joint in SF.
author: James S.

description: Good pizzas. Perfect crust to topping ratio. The focaccia bread is a great foundation for the perfect amount of delicious toppings. We had a group of 17 so 5 different varieties of pizza was sampled. Loved them all. Clams & garlic on a pizza works. The vegetarian is moist & flavorful.  I will be back here again.  Service is quick.
author: t d.

description:
I got the garlic clam pizza because I had never tried the combination before, but it was a mistake. Maybe I'm just not a fan, but these particular toppings didn't really go well together. However, the rest of the pizza was great. The crust was the perfect size, not too thin and not too thick and very fluffy, and the pizza was made fresh. Not dry nor too greasy.

I did also get a few bites of my friend's pepperoni, which was delicious, and is what I would recommend.
author: Richard Z.

description:
I love their Clam + Garlic. It's been a favorite of mine for about 10 years! Perfect combo of flavors, plus that amazing buttery crust.

$3.75 for a slice.
author: Allison P.

description: Their clam pizza never disappoints! Other pizzas are also delicious, but I always find myself ordering a clam slice or two. I love the crust, with its crispy bottom and fluffy middle, and the toppings are always fresh tasting. Can't wait to head back!
author: Annette A.

description:
I give Golden Boy 3 out of 5 just because I can not understand the hype around this place. Some times you will find people standing in a long line waiting to grab their take out pizza slices.

I believe most of the people standing in this line are tourists that have been recommended to try this place out.

I would rather go to any other place around here, theres a lot of restaurants to choose from (see my other reviews).

If the line is short and you don't have to wait you'll find cheap beer and great slices to an affordable price. My recommendation is to go for the clam & garlic or the veggie. The Combo slice is subpar compared to the others.
author: Mattias A.

description: Awesome pizza. Reasonable price, large slice, good toppings and I enjoyed the garlic bread-like crust. I will definitely be back to get some beers and pizza late on a Friday or Saturday night. Open until 2:30? Yes please!
author: C K.

description: Great pizza slices. Hearty, full of toppings. A good assortment to choose from. And they're fast. Which is important after you've been drinking and have a hankering for a slice of 'za!
author: Ray G.

description: The garlic and clam pizza was amazing!!!! There's so much garlic on it. I love garlic so I love this pizza!The combo pizza is pretty good too. the place is small but it's got some seating along the wall. i would recomment this place to a friend but it's not a place if you want to sit and eat with a group of friends.
author: Xinyi T.

description:
This pizza is amazing!! It is one of the best tasting pizza I have ever had. I go here every time I am on this side of the city. 
Seriously the best pizza in SF for sure.

That being said, the lines are always long. It might take quite a while to get some.
author: Erica L.

description:
I stopped by Golden Boy Pizza with a friend the other weekend.  We were craving a simple snack, and I was definitely not disappointed.  In fact, I've already returned!  As another review already mentioned, the Garlic Clam/Clam Garlic slice was delicious.  The pizza slices are fresh, the ingredients are of high quality and the setting is unique.  I also appreciate the small squares.  It reminds me of how a lot of thin-crust pizzas are cut in Chicago (the rare moments when you don't opt for the deep-dish.)  The bar style is a nice touch in North Beach on a busy night as well.  The prices are not ridiculously expensive, unless you consider a few dollars to be highway robbery.  The service here is also efficient and friendly.  

I asked a strange tourist if I should tip or not.  He looked at me with glazed eyes and muttered "Yuuuuuuh."  Was that a yes?  That can give you an indication of the clientele.  However, if you do stroll in here with your Financial District suit on, no one will really care.  So as I was leaving, I dropped in a bit of change because I thought that we definitely got what we paid for.
author: Jay P.

description:
Awesome Sicilian squares... Pepperoni and the Combo were all we had, but they were stellar.  The girl at the counter was amazing and was able to multi-task with a crowd that building by the second.  

It was refreshing to see that they gave the option to get a pitcher of soda for the family.
author: Dan C.

description: Really tasty pizza! Grabbed a slice while designated driving a group of friends and it hit the spot. I will definitely be coming back again.
author: Joshua K.

description: golden boy pizza has some good pizza if you havnt tried it yet youve missed out! the pizza here is just the way pizza should be
author: Johnson Y.

description: One of the best slices of pie in the city. The line and seating situation can be challenging, but seems to be worth the hassle. Cool ambiance and I have it on good authority that NYC-pizza-elitists approve of this place.
author: Stephen R.

description: Really liked this place. Love the clam and  garlic. Yummy. The place is hip, good size slice and cheap. Ive had to make a small line before but it goes by quick.
author: Jaquelyn P.

description: Couldn't help but stumble upon this joint after ordering our burrito's from HRD Grill next door. They had a line out the door and these incredibly displayed square pizza's in the front window saying, "You want me! Yes you do!" It was at that moment, I regretted ordering a burrito from next door. I couldn't resist any longer, I ordered a slice and their pizza was off the HOOK!! The crust was perfect almost like a Focaccia bread and the cheese was just oozing with goodness. Pound for pound this pizza doesn't compare to the others. The taste is a true knock out! Highly recommend this place.
author: Yvette R.

description:
I can't believe I had never been to Golden Boy's Pizza until last week.

We were walking in north beach about two blocks away from this place and my friend asked a bunch of Italians hanging out in front of a bar "Where's a good place to get pizza by the slide?" They totally laughed at us and gestured down the road. I mean, there IS a neon sign with a hand pointing to this place after all.

I got the pesto vegetarian and I could have eaten three pieces. Reasonably priced and great quality. I can't wait to come back.

Apparently it's awesome drunk food, too, but I can verify it is EQUALLY excellent sober food. This place is great. I am definitely trying the clam garlic next time.
author: Courtney A.

description:
Stay away...it's a horrible addiction.  Second best pizza in SF!

Delicious!
author: Mike W.

description: This place is just so good. Here's the thing. I know me some pizza, I'm from New Jersey. Here's the other thing; a lot of people have never even heard of a sicilian pizza (weirdos). So to have this place in Northern California that knows how to keep it simple and keep my belly full is beyond amazing. I only come to Golden Boy's when I visit San Fran and I make sure everyone I know who is visiting for even one hour goes there because it's THAT good. Just make sure to have cash, its cash only and be prepared that you may have to take your slice to go! The location is also in a great area with lots of bars and cafes that have more authentic Italian treats. GO HERE ASAP!
author: Michelle M.

description:
MMMM Golden Boy.  I don't come here nearly as often as I used to, but every time i walk by I'm reminded how finger-licking good this place is.  

Tips
* Gotta get an edge piece - crunchy crust, gooey/chewy center
* Pepperoni, Sausage or Both - the best!
* Cash Only
* Loooong lines on the weekends - so beware!

I'm more of a thin-crust gal, but when i'm in the mood for something a bit more substantial, Golden Boy is where it's at!
author: Renae K.

description: Occasionally I'll get a slice of cheese pizza from here.  I like that it's nearby and has cheap pizza and soda.  It doesn't get me too excited but hey, I'm glad it's there for if I'm broke or have a random craving.
author: Paige W.

description: Great place in Little Italy to get a quick bite.  Great deep dish type pizza.  Try the Clam and Garlic Pizza Slice.  Very reasonable prices.
author: Bill S.

description:
great signage going on that would attract anyone's attention! (big red hand pointing to pizza shop) and as soon as you realize it's pizza beckoning to you at 1am...well why the fuck NOT?!? 

the slices are about 6 by 6 inches, square.  trays of pizza are displayed prominently behind the window in front, so that you can intensely eye the slices that you want (pesto vegetable!) during your 20 minute wait in line.

the pizza is good, in the way that ALL pizza (except for domino's) is good. very greasy...but there's a good amount of cheese and toppings (although the cheese slips off the slices way too easily). the slices are fluffy and and the dough has that soft, slightly undercooked characteristic. there is barely any crust, which was very disappointing. but i like that the dough has flecks of herbs throughout. it kind of tasted like focaccia.

i wish the slices were less soggy, and BIGGER for $3.75! when it comes to pizza...bigger is ALWAYS better  

i also went crazy with the GARLIC SALT that they provide...and it was excellent.
author: Jessica C.

description:
The pizza is AWESOME!!! This is currently my favorite pizza spot in San Francisco.

I went on a Tuesday night - Valentine's Day to be exact - and was able to find myself a spot right at the counter. It was a rather busy night, but I stayed for about 2 hours. I had 2 slices of pepperoni and 1 slice of italian sausage. They were all delicious and piping hot right out of the oven.

Towards the later part of the evening, they turned the TV to Fuel which was showing some UFC fights. That made the night even better.

I plan to return to Golden Boy Pizza often.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Yet another time, my sense of smell did not let me down
Pizza was perfect. Just what we wanted after a night out in North Beach. No complaints at all.
author: Séamus C.

description: Really solid pizza! Come here for great metal music, interesting stickers all over the walls, and super friendly staff. Not to mention the convenient location. Seriously, the pizza is bomb. I had Veggie and Cheese. Loved both.
author: Amanda H.

description:
The atmosphere - small, crowded hangar/garage.

The music - loud, but beyond that, non-discerning.

The employees - ain't taking any shit from you.

The smell -  IS WHAT'S GONNA GETCHA.

When you walk by this place, and smell that amazing, spicy, pizza-ey smell, you will be tempted.  And when you stand in the line, waiting to get your hands on a slice, the smell will just kill you.

The taste?  I thought the combo was awesome, but the peperoni was just eh.  I think it has a lot to do with the geographical origination of your slice (corner, edge, center), and the amount of alcohol that you have had to drink before your visit.

Overall - solid, decent, and worth a stop.
author: Mariah M.

description: Great slice!  I had the cheese and it didn't disappoint. The crust was crispy (even though I took it to go) and the sauce was fresh with a hint of spicy mixed in. They have white clam and pesto vegetable options which I'll be sure to try the next time. I'm a flight attendant and it's hard to please my palate for pizza but that they did. Great option for take out but it looks like they have several beers on tap and other drink options as well if you decide to eat in. It's tiny inside with bar stool seating. No tables so dont look for table service. They're old school... they only take cash so stop by one of the many bank branches near by for your atm fix first.
author: Andi J.

description:
It was cheat day and my then friend (now boyfriend) and I made a deal.  He would introduce me to his favorite meal at the place he deems makes it the best and I would take him to my spot for dinner.  It was President's Day weekend and what better way to absorb the beautiful weather and long weekend than with good food, and a walk on the Golden Gate Bridge to burn it off.  

I had been hearing him talk about Golden Boy Pizza almost to the point where he was beginning to sound stubborn.  Hahaha.  No other pizza could match up, in his opinion.  I never heard anyone talk about pizza the way he did and even dismiss other beloved pizzas joints here in the Bay.  I thought, geez this pizza better take me over the moon and back.  So he is super excited as we're walking towards GBP and it's nice to see that someone other than myself can get so giddy over something like food.  

Upon entering the place is small and there are a handful of people in front of us.  The menu is pretty small as well with only several options:  Cheese, Pepperoni, Veggie, Combination, and Clam and Garlic.  No slice over $4.  Oh, and its all square slices which I never had before.  The pizzas were already made and waiting for you in the window.  You choose what you want and they reheat it for you and bring it to your seat.  If you're not too hungry, one slice will do ya.  But, if hungry, two slices would be perfect.  I chose (2) Clam and Garlic since I gave a few things up for Lent.  After Lent, I'll come back for the others.  

It took a while for me to get used to the seats and the counter space as it didn't leave much room to maneuver around.  Seats are not movable so I can only imagine someone much bigger than me trying to sit on there.  Anyways, that's beside the point.  Its a no frills place and you definitely aren't coming here for the ambiance.  Our slices made its way to us and yes, I had tasted pizza heaven.  They use focaccia bread and that makes a huge difference.  I was worried the clam and garlic (2x) would make me a vampire's nightmare, but not so.  I thought it would be overwhelming to eat, but it wasn't.  The crust was great, the garlic was diced up finely enough that you didn't feel as if you were swallowing whole pieces.  Every bite tasted great and I can see why a lot of people, especially my friend, loves it here.  The Clam and Garlic was a great choice and very delicious.  The crust helps to make the pizza and the ratio of crust to toppings are perfect.  I enjoyed so much I actually told my friend that we have to go back again soon.  I'm already looking up reasons why we need another cheat day.
author: Heizel M.

description:
This pizza kicks ass. If the strong mouthwatering scent doesn't lure you in from several doors away, you need to get your nasal passages checked out.

Slices are thick, hot, gooey and quadrilateral. Sometimes I opt for a fork and knife, other times I choose to scarf a slice down by hand. I don't think it's too gooey nor too doughy at all. Uhhh, have you people ever heard of Blondies or Fat Slice? Don't get me started about those. Golden Boy slices still hold their form while you eat it. It doesn't melt all over you and the toppings don't drip off the side. Props.

You can either sit inside during the day in the cramped aisle, huddled over the bar, squeezing to let others by behind you, or you can order late at night at the window should you be leaving a nearby bar or club around closing time. Remember, pizza and beer/soda/water only! No salad, breadsticks or calzones. They stick to the basics, and just have a few variety of pies. The clam and garlic is my favorite while their veggie pesto comes in at second and then the combination.

I think the Sicilian slices here are better than Arinells. Service is quick. Slices are bomb.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Perfect place to get your hangover food. Probably the cheapest pizza joint in this area. Service is nice and quick (looking at how small and crowded the place is normally). They serve alcohol as well which really compliments the pizza they serve.
author: Roy R.

description:
I'm from San Diego so I'm used to walking to the local taco shop and getting legit Mexican food to seal the deal on my late night drunchies after the bar(s). I've always been on pizza's fan-base for as long as I can remember though so here I am yelping about another pizza joint.

Anyway, I hit up this place after a night at the bar. I was hungry. I saw a line. But I didn't care. I saw people stoked on getting their late night grub on here so I had to join in and get a slice. I just got a standard pepperoni slice.. but SHOOT, it was good. I had to wait with a few others until everyone in our group was gathered together for our ride so the line went away and I had to get another because it was that good.

two thumbs up in my book
author: Nicole W.

description:
At first I was afraid, I was petrified...
There were so many drunks screaming by my side.
I spent so many minutes standing in the freakin' cold.
But when I took my first bite, hey, I was kinda sold!

I wouldn't call it the world's #1 pizza but it hit the spot. Sure, it's not loaded with toppings (I think my "slice" of pepperoni had like 5 peps), but it does the job. $3.25 for the slice, neither cheap nor expensive to me----I think that's a fair price for the size of the slice and the quality. Cash only and only 6 choices of pizza makes things easy for them and us: quicker transactions and less confusion for the drunkies. Win-win!

Ooey, gooey and saucy...hot and fresh...and GREASY! I can see why this place is Mecca for the heavily inebriated. I was sober at the time and still enjoyed my slice. I also thoroughly enjoyed people-watching----who doesn't love watching a fat drunk screaming "BOOTIE! BOOTIE!" and making kissy noises at the gal in the window grabbing our slices?

Drunk man: "HEY! I LOVE you! (kissy noises at window, turns around to woman) Eyy, you think I gots a chance?"
Drunk woman: "Ummm... I'm not sure about that, hun."
author: Ongie C.

description: Clam and garlic. $3.75. I don't need to say more. It's perfect for those after North Beach drinking munchies. Staff here is always friendly and the quality is great.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Love the atmosphere and service.  Hip and cool.

Garlic clam pizza -- good for the first 2 bites.  after that, ugh.  Gotta wash it down with something.  Sooo much garlic....and I usually love garlic!

Greasy fast joint pizza.   Inexpensive.
author: Nancy M.

description: I ventured here one night after work looking for a quick bite to carry home. I walked into the shotgun style eatery to discover the wonderful aroma of pizza and the laid back vibe of Cheers. The girl behind the counter was warm and approachable and took my order right away. A few minutes later I was headed out the door with 2 slices of piping hot pizza for less than $7. I got home to discover a thick, yet light, pizza with great flavor. It's not dense like Chicago pizza, which I like, but it still has a nice crust texture. Definitely recommend the food. I didn't hang out in the establishment, but it looked like a decent place to get a beer and a slice if you wanted to eat there.
author: Kristen G.

description: I love this place. Best slices in SF in my opinion. They are square shaped slices and the smell alone is to die for. You can smell the aroma of garlic and fresh ingredients down the street. This place captures the essence of SF North beach therefore I give it 5 stars, cause you get a whole experience for your senses.
author: Mario W.

description:
3.5 stars.

What a great way to end a night of bar hopping in North Beach! The cheese was super gooey and delicious with a nice crispy, slightly burnt crust, and yummy pepperoni! With the first bite, the cheese just started oozing out! MmMmMmmm! The only  thing is that the dough was a little undercooked as it just came out of the over. Boo.

Be prepared to wait in line at least 5-10 minutes, but well worth the wait! Servers here are also super nice.
author: Ling H.

description:
Huge fan of this place. The veggie pesto is where its at, or the combo. All of there slices are great for either a 130am slice after bar hopping in North Beach or just for lunch. 

It seems like the same two people have worked there forever too. Fast as hell and friendly service. Be sure to throw some cash in there tip jar!

That pizza is coming out of the oven at 400 degrees so be careful. I freaking love this place and thank my best friend for introducing me to it. Will stop here every time i get a chance.
author: Chris L.

description:
A random night in the city lead me to this pizza joint.  They offer Sicilian style pizza, which I decided is my new favorite.  I tried their clam garlic pizza which was no joke intense.  Don't plan on talking to anyone after you eat this bad boy.  I don't think I'll ever order this again, I thought the classic pepperoni was way better.  

The seating is pretty basic, you have a couple of barstools to pick from.  You can enjoy your reasonably priced pizza and beer while watching a game on their tv if they have it on.  Cash only  :(
author: Agent X.

description:
Unique - thick crust, square pizza.  Great though.
The sausage is really flavorful, so make sure your pizza has some.  The pepperoni is average.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
Solid cheap eats in North Beach, and a very good choice if you're looking for a quick bite to hold you over until your next meal. 

They had three types of pizza available on Saturday afternoon: pesto vegetarian, sausage combo, and pepperoni. $3.75 for a generous square, which is then heated up and handed to you on parchment paper. Obviously not the best pizza you'll ever eat considering it's not fresh out of the oven, but surprisingly decent. And ten times better than that oily mess they serve up at Blondie's. 

Rather than sitting at the grungy bar, we took our slices outside and claimed at bench at Washington Square, where we were able to enjoy our little snack along with the perfectly gorgeous January sunshine.
author: Joanne G.

description: Hands down the best pizza I've ever eaten. The slices are only $3-4 and they're humongous - lots of toppings piled onto a thick, fluffy crust. The restaurant itself was very crowded and didn't have any space to sit, but we took our pizza to go and ate it at Washington Square Park right down the block which made it even better.
author: Anna W.

description: Delicious! Yum! Favorite pizza in the city. I always bring friends here to show them great North Beach and SF pizza. The employees are always nice :-)
author: Aili P.

description: Awww man! This pizza joint is real good! A must in SF!! Reminded me of some spots in Chitown as my current city (PDX) fails to deliver on pizza.  Highly recommend this pizza joint. Small & friendly staff.
author: phil m.

description: Awesome pizza and good tap beer selection. Great prices too! We both ate pizza with beer for under 20 bucks.
author: Nichole H.

description:
This is awesome drunk pizza! Other than it, it really isn't anything special. The service was prompt and the slice was prepared quickly. The lady who helped me was really nice asking if I wanted to put any peppers or parm cheese on it and asking if I would like it wrapped. 

I took it like it is with a root beer all for only 4.25. I wish I could have tried all the different slices so I could give a more accurate review, but I'll probably never be back so I have to go based off the cheese slice I ordered.

A great pizza has a good crust, a great sauce, and fresh ingredients. The crust nice, buttery, and thick the way I like it. Flavor wise tough, the crust wasn't special is any sense, just a plain pizza crust. The sauce had a good flavor to it, but I wish there was a little more of it since the crust was so hefty. The biggest disappointment was the cheese. When I order a plain cheese pizza I expect it to be cheesy. Unfortunately for me it wasn't. It had barely enough to cover the crust and sauce.

All in all if you are drunk and want an okay slice for a good price this is the place.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
Some days life can treat you quite squarely and make you feel like a square.  I had one of those days recently.  What to do, what to do?  

I'll tell you what I did.  I headed down to North Beach and Golden Boy Pizza to enjoy a couple of squares of their delicious, bready Sicilian style pizza.  I can always count on Golden Boy for inexpensive delicious pizza from fast, friendly servers.  The process is so easy too.  You walk in, you order your pizza and drink and you take a seat on one of their comfortable thick-cushioned bar stools.  If your pizza needs reheating they'll do that for you and bring the food to you.

They serve the big 5 inch by 5 inch squares with fork and knife on a couple of sheets of white paper on a rattan sandwich tray.  The crust is very similar to focaccia, but not quite as oily.  The bread is firm and soft, and the bottoms are usually crispy.  They use a tangy tomato sauce here that actually stands out.  I've noticed that the amount of cheese varies depending on the topping.  The single topping slices seem to have a thicker layer of cheese than the combination slices.

On my most recent visit I had a sausage slice with big chunks of sausage and a combination slice with pepperoni, sausage, fresh tomato and zucchini.  Both were outstanding.  Interesting decor, too!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
The sausage is bomb, yo. But get the combo.
The line is ALWAYS out the door. Well, you order at the door so if there's even one person in line, you're probably standing outside. We've gotten there about 15 mins. before they opened and had to wait in line. BUT IT IS SO WORTH IT. The Boyfriend is from the East Coast and he says this is the best pizza in California. We went for the first time at night and it was CRAZY PACKED like, there were no seats so we were worried we just wasted an hour trying to park and weren't going to be able to sit down and enjoy our pizza and beer. But, as if the gods were speaking to us, 2 seats cleared up just as we ordered, they had Prohibition on tap and the sausage was fresh out the oven. Every single time we go to SF, we go here and we're not stopping any time soon. Oh and I'm pumped I got a Golden Boy hoodie because nothing beats a sweatshirt with boxing gloves, wings and a cheesy slice of pizza on the back.
author: Lllllll S.

description:
Randomly walking around North Beach with my friends looking for a cafe when we pass by something that smelled SO heavenly. My friends and I HAD TO stop and search for the source which turned out to be this tiny little pizza place with a line out the door. The pizzas they served was displayed at the window to tempt passerbys as if the smell wasn't tempting enough. As we stood in line, people in front of us and coming out were all commenting about how great this place was, which DEFINITELY says something. 

The people in front were talking about the Clam and Garlic Pizza, which was apparently their specialty. I decided on the safer combination pizza with vegetables and delicious sausages. My friends ordered the Vegetarian Pesto and the Clam and Garlic. The prices are good. Cheap yet big slices. The best flavor WAS the Clam and Garlic. It was so delicious that I regretted not getting it although mines was delicious too.

Overall, great great pizza with GREAT prices! SO delicious!! GET THE CLAM AND GARLIC! It will NOT let you down :) BUT, remember to bring some cash. They do have an atm, but I'm assuming they charge...so, be warned. This place is cash only.
author: Linda J.

description: Okay pizza joint where I grabbed a re-heated slice of the sausage combo. The service is quick and the price reasonable. I wouldn't make a mad dash here, but if you are in the neighborhood this is a nice find. Might try the clam pizza for the next time.
author: Derek N.

description: The garlic clam pizza is to die for!! There is never any spots to sit and eat, I would take my meal to go! Then, walk down the street to Stella's bakery for dessert:)
author: Phoebe B.

description:
03122007: 

Dearest Golden Boy:

I'm feeling crowded.  I think we should spend some time apart.  You ran out of my favorite drink tonight and it was only 9 o'clock.  You try so hard to please too many people.  I think I need to see other pizzas.  You drive me to the point of dessert madness.  And my family & friends say you are no good for me.

==============
03102007: No more updates.  Celeste L. says this is my Golden Boy journal:

Dearest Golden Boy:

It was great to see you again today.  You were so hot and fresh.  Your aroma makes me weak in the knees.  I can't have enough of you.  I want to take you home to meet the family.

==============
03062007 update: minus one star cuz they ran out of draft root beer & it was only 10p.  plus one star cuz I noticed the James Dean poster/shrine tonight. 

==============
03052007 update: 

Objectively, 2 slices of cheese pizza were just as heavenly tonight after a perfect evening of smooth-sailing assembly of a full-sized bed frame for a full-sized mattress.   Ahhh.  I love when my initial euphoric assessment of a place is just as valid & true with every additional experience.  I'm such a sucker for this place, and North Beach, in general.  Don't be surprised if you see me bust out with a Golden Boy Pizza tshirt in the near future.  

=============

Disclaimer: this review is extremely subjective.

I had the best frickin cheese pizza from the best frickin pizza bar after a frickin grueling full moon hike on Saturday which kicked my a**, AND a day of Ikea shopping, loading, unloading, and moving between all over the frickin peninsula to North Beach, up a frickin stairway to hell, only to have spent three frickin hours building a Queen-sized bed frame - all by my frickin self - when we purchased a Full-sized mattress, mattress foam, wooden slats and sheet sets!!!

Aaaaahhhh.  

And to top it off - Golden Boy's vegetarian has a pesto sauce - I don't do pesto.

So, in summary.  If you've been to hell and need to come back fast, go to Golden Boy's, grab a slice or two or six and get some root beer on tap.  Because of GB, my weekend ended just as wonderfully as it began (glorious full moon hike on Mission Peak in Fremont - unbelievable experience).

Seriously - this is my new go-to pizza joint when in North Beach.
author: Olma M.

description:
As a teenager (and to this day, really) I was really into Philip K. Dick.  The guy was some kind of twisted genius.  His short story "The Golden Man" (which was turned into an entertaining although entirely unfaithful movie staring Nick Cage) about a semi-retarded but physically adept mutant who can see about 30 seconds into the future was always one of my favorites.  Every time I think of Golden Boy Pizza I think of The Golden Man and his shimmering coat of thin gold fur, and amazing prescient ability to avoid capture, by about 30 seconds.  But I digress.

The first time I ever came to San Francisco was Spring Break, 1987.  I came with a bunch of friends, and one of our "grown up" friends back home told my buddy Matt (still my BFF to this day) and me to check out the pie at Tomaso's.  Sadly, when we got there and looked at the menu we realized that she had been woefully deluded about the budgetary means of college students.  $20 for a pizza?  In 1987?  When I didn't really even have a job?  You've got to be fucking kidding me.  

So Matt and I kept walking - having walked all day long.  We were hungry.  We were tired.  We were frustrated and discouraged by the mere concept of a $20 pizza.  We wandered up Grant street, took a random left down Green, and suddenly saw Golden Boy pizza by the slice!  Yesssss!

Now, back in Madison at that time there was a local chain (it's probably still there) called Rocky Rococo's.  They sold pseudo-Chicago-style deep dish slices, cut square.  Their table top Galaga machine ate thousands of my quarters when I was in high school.  I was a Galaga addict, and a Galaga demi-god as far as that goes.  Another amusing thing was that the fancy label on the bin where the sausage and mushroom slices came up said "S&M."  We always got a laugh out of that - every time.  I am easily amused. But I digress.

When Matt and I, back in spring of 1987, randomly stumbled into Golden Boy and saw their lovely deep-dish square-cut pepperoni slices for I suspect about $1.50 a slice back then, we were in affordable comfort food heaven.  

21 years later, 19 of which I've lived in San Francisco, I still love Golden Boy for a quick lunch slice, a post-North-Beach-boozing slice, or just generally, a slice.  Or two.  It's good pie, it's affordable pie, it's a cool joint that has hardly changed in any way in the last 20 years, and god damn it, I love that.  If there were more than 5 stars to award, I'd give them all to Golden Boy.  And they'd be gold stars, not red.  GOLD!  Just like the Golden Man, and whatever golden boy this swell pizza joint is named after!
author: Joe C.

description: Hands down one of my favorite late night pizza joint in the city. clam & garlic and pepperoni gives me butterflies in my stomach...
author: Linlin L.

description: Okay, don't walk away because this place is too busy or too small or the fact that the staff has crazy hair/body piercings/tatoos...  This pizza is good and the staff is so friendly.  We came here one night when we couldn't get in to Tony's Neopolitana (around the corner).  We got a couple slices fo cheese and a sausauge and we were able to get a couple counter seats (that's all they have).  It's small in there but the music is great (ex: punk, rock but not the annoying/aggressive) and it's great pizza.  The dough is thick and cooked well and tastes great, it really picks up the seasonings they use (standard salt/olive oil, garlic, oregano, basil).  It's more along the lines of a thick crust pizza, great tasting cheese and the sauce is not overwhelming, it's just a great slice.  Enjoy!
author: J P.

description:
Stopped by after having a Pad Kee Mao at King of Thai...some friends wanted to get it, and it looked pretty damn good from the window.  The square slices stood out, and I was convinced I had to have one.

I found out the slice I spied from the sidewalk was the CLAM pizza, which sounded amazing (not everyday you run into Clam Pizza).  I was a bit disappointed, as it was kinda bland a tasteles (topping wise). The dough/crust was damn good though!

Nothing bad, but not spectacular, and this is all judging off one slice of Clam pizza (I'm sure the pepperoni was great, as my friends loved theirs).  My only warning is that they have the slices sitting out, and pop it into the oven to heat it up once you order it...not my cup of tea.
author: Michael C.

description:
I like my pizza hot, fresh, fast, and square.  Yeah that's right - sQUARE.

This little place is a great stop in North Beach for a fast slice of pizza - you basically stand in the doorway and choose a piece, they put it in the oven for a minute or two, and you get a big cheesy square of goodness!  The regular cheese slice was okay, but I especially recommend the Italian sausage.  I personally like the slices with crust - since the tray is rectangular there are a bunch of "middle" pieces with no edges.  But that's just me - my boyfriend prefers the crustless pieces because of the larger ratio of cheese and greasiness.  Definitely a must-try.
author: Laura W.

description: OMG! Visiting a friend here in SF and he tells me this place has the best pizza! Not only do they have the best pizza but great prices! The crust is light with a bit of crunch and that in itself makes it a four star! The goodies on top complete the last star!
author: Sheila F.

description:
Me and my girlfriend came here during the North Beach Festival looking for some tasty pizza. Saw the pizza at the window and it looked amazing. It was SQUARE PIZZA, how awesome is that? Im use to the triangular pizza.

Anyways I got a pepperoni and my girlfriend got the plain old cheese pizza. Both cost me an even $6. Totally worth it. Pizza had lots of toppings, tasted awesome and the crust was awesome. I usually dont like crust but I LOVED their crust. 

Will definitely be back. Love their pizza! =)
author: Daniel S.

description:
I'll just say the clam garlic pizza is absolutely the best in the entire world and I can't wait to go back for more.

Also, don't come here planning to sit down and eat -it's more of a grab and go place as seating is very limited.
author: Lucia D.

description: There was a line for this small pizza shop and it was worth the short wait. The thick, focaccia-like crust was very tasty and both the cheese and the sausage were excellent--the sausage a little more excellent. The clam also looks very good and I might try that next time. It's in a lovely neighborhood and had plenty of empty seats inside--it looks like most people take away.
author: Sharon G.

description: Excellent pepperoni pizza - good ratio of ingredients, light slightly fluffy dough (doesn't leave me feeling heavy) and a flavorful sauce. Pizza by the slice - get it while it's hot, but damn good once cooled off, too!  My recommendation: grab slices with a friend and head up to Twin Peaks or Washington Square Park to enjoy it.
author: Heather M.

description: I give the pizza a 5 stars, but the service not so much. Everyone here looks like they hate their job, but the pizza is excellent! They have a few beers on tap and in bottles which is nice, and the line is constantly out of the door. It's a nice little laid back spot. The veggie pesto pizza is awesome! It's hot and fresh, not being heated by a lamp. I would definitely come back, but just don't expect great service when you come.
author: Davina K.

description: Really, really good pizza. Rock American music (while I was there, Metallica, Incubus, The Offspring, Pearl Jam, etc.). What more do you want? Oh and it's as cheap as it's good. So sad I found this place on my last evening at SF. Go for it!
author: Charles E.

description:
This is a great neighborhood pizza joint. The crust on Goldenboy's pizza is exceptional, and all the ingredients tasted fresh. I really enjoyed my visit and would go back again!

I do have specific reasons though for giving Golden Boy "4 stars" rather than "5 stars." First, the pizza was good--better than your average pizza place---but it wasn't near the best I've had. I live on the East coast now (and maybe I'm spoiled by the pizza there) but this just isn't 5 stars for me. And for 3.75 a slice, I'd argue it's a little pricey for what it is. If I include Golden Boy in a comparison of all the different types of pizza in SF, I'd prefer to go to Zachary's or Blondie's instead.

My second caveat with Golden Boy is that this is a definitive late night, college co-ed pizza joint with little to no seating and a hipster vibe. That means Golden Boy serves a specific demographic, and there's a specific experience of the restaurant. As a UC Santa Cruz graduate, Golden Boy felt homey and bohemian in all the right ways. However, a couple going on a date, or a family with tons of little kids, would perhaps not feel the same.
author: Colleen T.

description: Was in town for the weekend and found this little gem through yelp. A must try pizza place! Slices look small (maybe because they are squared)  but they are very filling. I tried the combination, pepperoni and garlic clam. All were delicious!
author: Daisy P.

description: There is nothing more delicious than their Garlic and Clam pizza. Get you some. You can thank me later!
author: Rick W.

description:
Square pizza?!?!?

So used to the triangle way of pizza, some large, some extra large,
and others "large" and "toppings". As I roamed around North Beach,
found some "inspiration" from above, a hand pointing to this place
on Green Street between Bannam & Jasper Place.  Was it a sign?

I went in... found various kinds of pie, squared!  In cheese to
various toppings and combos!  From $2.75-3.75 for a slice.
Had the sausage and it was delicious! The foccacia bread tasty and
flavorful, nice amount of sauce, cheese and with sausage placed on the
corners.  Nice presentation.

The gal behind the counter was great, taking care of her customers
and letting others in line know she will get to them ASAP.  That scored
brownie points!  Overall, a nice find!

To totally twist (or screw up) an Adam Smith term... a visible hand from above will guide you to great pizza.  Enjoy!
author: W L.

description: Come on, where else can you find a place like this?  Consistently great cheap pizza, nice cold beer selection, cool staff, galvanized siding and harsh loud music. I honestly don't know how they make money. I go to every time I'm in the city. Detractors need to shut up and go elsewhere. The line needs to be filled with fans only. I love this place.
author: Ray F.

description:
I love the pizzas here. The bottom of the crust is nice and crisp while the rest of it is soft. Not very salty so I can't get sick of it. Sometimes it's fresh from the oven, sometimes its freshly reheated from the oven. Looks dirty, feels dirty, tastes great. The folks working there are really cool too.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I love that it is pan pizza.  It is perfect when you've been walking around all day and need something quick and tasty to eat.  I wish the crust was seasoned a little bit more ... but that's just me.  The entrance is very crowded because that's where the line to order starts.  It was really windy and cold outside when I went so that was frustrating.
author: Kristen S.

description:
I love the fact that they rock Slayer, Sabbath, or Rage everytime I go in here. I even took my int'l ESL students here during a tour of North Beach and some of them were rockin it while they chowed down on tasty square pizza.

Extra stars for  head bangin' tunes, beer selection, and the picture of Jim Jarmusch posted on the fridge. 

This place just brings out the old Hessian in me.
author: Art O.

description:
EXCELLENT absorber for the alcohol.  At 2 a.m, you will think this place is a 10.  At other hours, you probably would go to Tony's or North Beach Pizza if you wanted "good pizza"  4 stars because I really am a fan nevertheless :)

-The pesto veg is off the hook, any time of day.  I ask them to always cook it a little extra, I personally don't like it too doughy.

-Steer clear of the garlic clam unless you want your breath (and/or car) to hum for the next 2 days.

Golden Boy is a funny place to people watch anytime between 1:30 - 2:30 a.m.

BOYS BEWARE of trollups cutting you in line pretending to be drunk so they can work you for free food. It's not bad enough that you buy them all they can manage (or mismanage) to drink, but here, you will be able to buy them pizza to sober them up!   Seen this a few times and it's not funny, actually pathetic...
North Beach has definitely changed.  Golden Boy hasn't, though - same prices since we used to go to Gino & Carlo's before we were old enough to legally be there (several years ago!) Golden Boy saved us from a few DUI's before we headed home.  Um....thanks?!?
author: Athena S.

description: Just normal pizza. Nothing amazing but still good if you're in the mood for pizza. About $4 a slice, got two slices. They're kinda small
author: Alexis S.

description: The pizza reminded me of a frozen DiGiorno pizza that you get at the grocery store.  Didn't taste very good at all, very bland.  I had a slice of pepperoni and the garlic clam and they were both below average.  There's some small letters up on the menu that says "cash only", so on top of having bad pizza, I had to run down the street to the BofA ATM to get cash.  There's definitely better pizza in North Beach and SF such as Baretta, Zero Zero, or Tony's.  Very disappointing.
author: Josh G.

description:
I hate giving this 5-stars, because its one of those places you hope DON'T become popular. However, Golden Boy has given me so many pleasant, stand-out moments in my life that I owe them all the custom they can handle. Maybe they will open another one in a more out of the way spot :)?

Contrary to all the stuff here about lines out of the door, I've usually managed to come here on lazy afternoons with some friend visiting the city. After a couple of hours stomping around the city, its great just to kick back with something warm and slippery sliding over the back of the tongue. You just sit there, sun streaming in the open door in this little sun trap, drinking great SF beer, eating this lovely pizza and watching life go by. Really, as life moments go, these times have been fantastic.

I havent been in a while, but when I started going, the price was about $2 - now I read its closer to $4. Sad, but understandable.

My recommendation is to head there in the afternoon, in the sunshine, although last time I went they didnt have the clam and garlic in the afternoon - and yes, this is my favorite all-time pizza ever. Yes, its oily. How do you think you get a fried-crisp bottom you hear a glassy crunch through as you bite?  Take some time, you and a buddy, when the place is half-empty and chilled out. Watch the motes flit in the sunbeams. Remember you are in North Beach, and that maybe some famous writers munched here. Then forget it as the huge gob of half-masticated parsley, cheese, clams and loads of garlic slides into your throat and oblivion.

If you go at rush time, you're just getting the pizza - stlll good, but you're missing out on the existential experience.

Not for yuppies, preppies, or other people who insist on clean floors, walls and toilets, foot-long pepper grinders in their face, and constant enquiries as to whether you're enjoying your food by underpaid waiters.
author: Sard O.

description: Favorite pizza place on the planet.  Cash only and sold by the slice, I usually buy my pizza and eat it at Washington Square park.  Definitely recommend it!
author: Dustin C.

description:
Is Golden Boy the best pizza I've ever had? Not exactly. Is it right around the corner from my apartment and pretty satisfying when I have it? Yup.

The cheese pizza is always a safe bet, the clam garlic yummy when you're in a reeeally seafoody mood. I think I've had the pesto veg before, but can't recall..hmm.. maybe I'll have that one next! But who wouldn't like pizza on foccacia bread? Yum.

The line is usually long at peak hours (around dinner and then the late night rush) but the staff is cool. If you're waiting in the late night line expect a fight or argument to break out at some point... the 2-3 times I've done the late night thing, there has always been some kind of push and shove. 

So for a happy experience head over to Golden Boy, grab your slice and go...and try not to push anyone in the process.

Oh and seriously, stop pee-ing in Jasper Alley...people live there!
author: Shafaq C.

description: This place tends to get pretty busy at night when people are coming to/from the bars in the area so you might think that it's one of those places that's "only good when you're drunk", but trust me, Golden Boy is ALWAYS delicious. My favorite pizza place in the area... actually maybe my favorite pizza place period.
author: Alison B.

description:
On my out of the city, I saw a pizza by the slice joint and figured to check out what Yelp would have to recommend near my area at that time.  Which took me to this establishment, just a mile away.  I am very happy to have Yelp on my iPhone, let me tell ya!  I ordered 2 pepperoni slices and a pesto veggie.  Piping hot, very tasty and the bread was just right.  I wish I had this place near my home (actually i'd be about 20 pounds fatter if I did, so maybe not)   A brought a slice home for my step daughter who had no knowledge of Golden Boy's rep and commented that this was the best pizza she had ever eaten. 

Love this place... definitely a stopping point while in the city.
author: Ivan D.

description: Love this place!!!  LONG waits after bar hours!!!!   My SF favorite pizza joint!!!!  Enough said.
author: Dmitry K.

description: This was an amazing, spontaneous meal.  Top 5 pizza for me!  Yes, it's a total dive.  But that makes the pizza more special!
author: Jeff N.

description:
Came here after a night of drinking and god damn this place is good! I recommend getting the sausage pizza, it is un real This is a thicker style pizza and is cut into squares. 

I believe it was something like $3 for a slice of pizza and it was really filling. I am now what you would consider a golden boy pizza fan. The next time i am in this neighborhood and i am hungry or drunkin hungry, i am gonna grab a slice of heaven.
author: Skyler W.

description: Sometimes you don't want fancy pants pizza that comes with ingredients on it you have to google to figure out what the heck it is (I'm looking at you guanciale) and lots of times when that's what I'm in the mood for it's when I'm wandering around after a drink (ummm North Beach?). Golden Boy Pizza delivers! Square slices, super tasty, good bread. Gimme me! Go Go Golden Boy!
author: Stephen S.

description: Average at best. The girl serving the pizza was rude even after being tipped. The pizza was nothing really to write home about either, bland in flavour and nuclear hot. I'm not sure what all these other 5 star reviews are about?
author: Symon H.

description:
GBP takes pizza to whole different level. well at least deep dish. So my elite foodie friend from seattle ian m. and I went on our foodie extravaganza, and I will have to admit. The pizza in the display didn't look so good, but once I bit into their their pesto vegetarian pizza, it was freaking game over! I could have eaten two slices! and trust me, their slices are not little. 

As for the their clam, and garlic pizza. It wasn't for me. I thought I liked garlic, but I don't like thattttttttttttt much garlic. But I am not saying the flavors weren't good. They just weren't for me. 

best description: light fluffy goodness with sweet sauce, and airy heaven melting in your mouth! IF YOU LIKE PIZZA, MOSTLY DEEP DISH...... you'll love gbp!!!!! better than little star, better than any pizza I have had in sf.... not sure if it beats zachery's, but it definitely is up there!!!!!

note to self : get cheese pizza next time
author: Nina M.

description:
I have only been once, and I'm VERY sad about that! I went a few weeks ago while I was visiting San Francisco for an extended weekend. My boyfriend and I found this place on yelp, looked at the reviews and locals' opinions on it, and decided to give it a try.

When we arrived, they were pretty packed - we sat at the bar, which has a very tiny walkway right next to the entrance behind it. The Giants game was on, and we'd debated buying tickets to actually go to it, so it was nice to be able to watch it. Service was very quick! Our orders were taken, drinks were put in front of us, and the pizza arrived all in around 10minutes. He got the combination, and I decided to judge solely on pepperoni and cheese - if a pizza place can't get this flavor combo right, then they're dead to me.

We've been talking about Golden Boy's affordable, quick, DELICIOUS pizza ever since!!! We almost went back the next day for more, but decided to try more places while we were visiting. I almost wish we'd just gone back for more pizza!

A word to others from out of town: The place is pretty small, so I wouldn't recommend bringing a large group or a family of 4+ people here, unless you plan to take it with you to go - and it would be very worth picking some up and taking it back to a hotel!

Next time I will ignore the fear of garlic breath (since it was a romantic weekend getaway? Pfft, next time he can just deal with the sweet aroma left after  dinner!) and shoot for the garlic clam pizza I was eyeing. Thanks for the wonderful dinner on a budget, Golden Boy Pizza!!!
author: Toni M.

description: So this review is 1 month late. I am a transplant from South Chicago..... So like every other Chicagoan I like pizza just as much as every New Yorker. I lived in North Beach for a long while but every time I would walk by Golden Boy nothing but long lines. I have tried many many pizza places and will say little Italy in San Francisco Doesn't impress me pizza wise at all. The dough and sauces are all off IMO. Eventually I was strolling through the area with my best friend and saw that there wasn't a line! So we jumped on it and went in. The woman who was working was extremely polite very cool enthusiastic employee I wish I remembered her name she does deserve credit. I purchased 8 slices of pizza. Four for me four for my friend. The pepperoni and pesto slices 2 each for me. I can't remember what my friend ordered, but we were both impressed with  the quality
author: Kyle R.

description:
I love love LOVE Golden Boy!!! 
Whenever I am somewhere near the vicinity, I automatically pencil a slice in! There is always a line, but it moves quickly. In all actuality I think in this line I go from wanting one slice to two...The ale on tap is the perfect match to a perfect pizza! It is an addiction! Cash only! My favorite is the pepperoni :)
author: Tiffany L.

description:
If you like thick crusted pizza and you are cold and hungry late at night - this place smells amazing and the wafts draw you towards the long line outside this joint. 

Just a fill for pizza.
author: Jamie T.

description:
I ate pizza all weekend. What do you expect when you're hanging out in Northbeach, The little Italy in SF?
After a night of debauchery, my friends and I stood in line for Golden Boy pizza. I got not one, but two squared-shaped size pizza slices. I ordered the vegetarian with pesto sauce and plain ol' cheese. Since I'm a babe on a budget, I was ecstatic about the affordable price! The pizza was very delicious, affordable, and convenient! 
I love carb-loading!
author: Jojo N.

description: Was visiting from out of town and yelp reviews didn't let us down. The wife and I both enjoyed some darn good pizza and sodas (haha, I said good Sodas!). The one man show (besides one other in the back) was fun to watch too. He was quick and efficient. He took orders, put pizza to get re toasted, served drinks and collected CASH as it's cash only. Diffidently a local hot spot, which we Always like to eat what the local enjoy to eat. Great atmosphere too. I was hesitant to ask for paper cups to take half full sodas but he had no problem and he topped them off. If ever back in San Fran will try to get back for sure.
author: Jacob J.

description: Possibly the seediest, dingiest, and best tasting pizza place in the entire city.
author: Lia R.

description:
Until very recently, I had never had pizza from Golden Boy while sober. I never wrote a review despite eating there multiple times because I never felt qualified in my inebriated state. Yet two weeks ago I tried Golden Boy Pizza for the first time and now feel I can writer a review.

I've had multiple pizzas there: the pepperoni, the clam garlic, the pesto and the combo. I've tried all the rectangular sicilian style slices and I've come to the conclusion that most of the time, it's just okay. 

The toppings are good and the crust can be crisp, but I have had slightly soggy crust before. It's a thicker crust (more like foccaccia) and the line is exceedingly long at various times of day. At $3.75, it seems a bit steep for a pizza slice that gets reheated when you order it, but they are large and filling. The clam garlic pizza is by far my favorite slice with such pungent flavors and aromas. 

I'm still not sure if Golden Boy is worthwhile all the time, but I do know it's still completely worth it for me on late evenings. I will keep going back to Golden Boy, even if it's not the best.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Great place! The atmosphere was great with a small bar style seating area. The pizza was amazing! I had a piece of sausage and it was incredible! I loved it do much I ordered another. Great pizza place. Recommend to all.
author: John T.

description: This is a really tight spot for thick crust.  There was a short line, but the pie was worth it.  I generally go for thin crust, and don't expect much out of west coast pie, but this spot is well worth a detour.  Great beer selection, & a very chill atmosphere.
author: Jason F.

description: Awesome. I didn't even want to write this review because I don't want people to know about Golden Boy. But, with 1500 reviews, my battle is futile. Really excellent pizza, nice crispy crust, hot cheese, fresh pepperoni. Stop reading this and GO!
author: Steven L.

description: Tried the garlic and clam. Even though it looks deep dish, it has a thin crust with a thick topping. It gas lots of garlic though, so beware if you have a meeting after:)
author: Sasan A.

description:
UPDATE: still haven't tried the clam and garlic, but their veggie is delicious (and as you can see from my previous note, I don't even like pesto). AND to top it off they're nice! let us sit in the actual restaurant (if you can call it that) past 2 and once my roommate went and didn't have cash, and they gave her a few slices of leftover pizza at the end of the night they were going to throw away anyways. BALLIN'.

I live three blocks from this place. DANGEROUS.

I've only made it here between 1-2am after a night out when I am in the mood for some munchies. Their combo rocks, I don't know what it is exactly that makes it so good (it very well could be the alcohol in my system at the time) but it's magical.

Clam and garlic is on my list to try. I've heard the veggie pesto is also delicious, but I'm not a big pesto fan.

Cash only. You'll definitely wait at least 15-20 minutes if you go late night. In order to get the clam and garlic (they've been sold out every time I go), you have to go during normal meal hours.

Oh, Golden Boy.
author: Nicole W.

description: The pizza is really good - but very limited choice.  The pizza is designed to go with the drinks so you can talk to people and enjoy.  This is a place you have got to try.  Be ready for a long wait but it is worth it!!
author: Ramona L.

description: The pizza here is decent but not as great as my friend claimed.  I had the garlic and clam pizza, and the pesto veggie. I wish the pesto had...more pesto! The garlic and clam was pure garlic and I could only make out a few tiny pieces of clam. At $3.75 a slice, it doesn't necessarily yell overboard, but it would take at least 3 slices for me to feel content, which makes it over $11 for 3 slices of pizza!
author: Wilson T.

description:
Cash only.

Shared a slice of combination and a slice of pepperoni with the boyfriend this past weekend.  And we both have fallen in love with these square slices of pizza, they are so good.
There's really no way to describe it - you just need to go try it for yourself! (And bring me a slice while your at it ;D)
author: Katie J.

description:
I love Sicilian style pizza. It's not so heavy that you need to be in the mood to handle it (a la Chicago Style) and the dough is not too crunchy/thin that the pizza loses most of the doughiness (Neapolitan/NY). It's got a nice buttery crunch that gives way to a soft chewy dough.

Golden Boy does this style very well. They focus on the strengths in its dough and they don't overpower it with too much sauce or overload it with cheese. It's very balanced. We had three slices: Clam Garlic, Pepperoni, and Pesto Vegetarian.

Pepperoni - Can't go wrong. It was my favorite, simple and cheesy; exactly what you want from a slice of Sicilian pepperoni.

Clam Garlic - I had never had this combination of toppings before and I was very pleasantly surprised. The garlic really jumps out at you. My only complaint was towards the end of the slice the parsley was a bit overpowering.

Pesto Vegetarian - As fresh and light as this particular brand of pizza could be the pesto really was a nice change of pace from the other two types. Liked the combination of toppings.

I think Sicilian pizza does not get enough play when it comes to delicious pies but if you head to Golden Boy I'm pretty sure you'll be a believer.

Cheers!
author: Andrew B.

description:
Ok, pizza is definitely a very difficult food item to rate (in my books) because I generally find all types of pizza pretty much the same (after having tried pizza all over the world), but Golden Boy Pizza definitely pizzazz that puts it over a 3 star rating. 

I've only ordered takeout from this place, so I won't be able to give a complete review of the restaurant but I can attest to the fact that Golden Boy Pizza is a must-try if you're a pizza lover. Sicilian is my favorite and Garlic Clams is a close second (although its a bit too salty in my opinion).

Pizza is pizza, but it takes a really good pizza place to put it over the marks  of average and that is exactly what Golden Boy does. 

The only negative about this place is the wait (took about 30 minutes) just for a slice of pizza and parking is pretty difficult, especially on a weekend. But if you are around and have time to kill, have a slice over at Golden Boy's.
author: David W.

description: LATE NIGHT SNACK AT ITS BEST!!! They close pretty late on the weekends and its location is fairly convenient if you've been partying on Broadway. There's usually a line, but it goes by pretty fast as does the pizza. Stop by here if you in the area.
author: rae m.

description:
Mmmmm crispity...crunchity...peanut..oh wait that's butterfinger

K lemme start over

Mmmm crispity..crunchity..thick and chewity in all the right places.  The dough kiiiiiiiinda reminds me of Arizmendi pizza chewy..but not exactly.

Some may say the clam and garlic is a hit or miss, but I say bring on the garlic, I could take it.  I got some Wrigley's spearmint in my pocket, shoooot.  Their pepperoni and even the plain cheese are yumski nation as well.

Expect to wait in line, but if you're a pan pizza type of person, you'll be glad you did.  4.5 and roundin up!
author: Rho T.

description: It ain't a New York slice, but it is the closest to a NY slice that I've had in San Francisco. I order the plain cheese square, eat it and order another. It's great. Daytime is best as there is rarely a line. At night fugetaboutit, the line can stretch out.
author: Carl M.

description:
What's not to love? Fresh, delicious pizza. Cheap, and the line moves quickly. Very casual with stools and a metal counter to eat at, and plenty of pizza condiments available.

I love garlic and I love clams, so of course I had to try the garlic clam. Different and pretty tasty, but be sure to bring some breath mints for after. The taste lingers for a LONG time. Would also recommend the combo slice...yum!
author: Tammi H.

description: This pizza is SO AMAZING! We wanted a quick bite but somewhere we could sit down. The cashier was super nice & very fast. Since we were starving the food was ready very fast. Pizza was crunchy & so delicious. Highly recommended it here!
author: Karina A.

description: The wait is kind of long, but once you take a bite of the clam and garlic pizza...you'll realize the wait was SO WORTH IT. I would eat this pizza any day...during a normal lazy Sunday, when I'm drunk, or even after a stressful day at work. Yum.
author: Sandra C.

description:
Someone I was with said it very well.

"It's cheese on crunchy toast"

Now, that said I recognize there is a whole pizza school based on square slices of ready made square pies, displayed in a front window and reheated.

There is also another school of just light-and-crunchy-crust square pizza, like Frankie's in Miami.

Safe to say, I don't like that school.  
At the same time, it's pizza.
And most pizza is at least 2 stars good.

Plus it's open late.
And it's near the bars.
And they have beers.
And it's pretty cheap.
And the place has no pretense.

But I would much rather you consider going to Giordano Bros. for one of their hot meat-cheese-fry-slaw sandwiches.  Go for the gusto, and get it with the fried egg for an additional 50 cents.
author: Daniel B.

description: After so many many years, I am really surprised that this Golden Boy Pizza has been here in business for such a very long time... I have eaten their yummy pizza before... But  it has been such a very long time since,  I have not eaten their pizza's in a long time... Until today on a monday afternoon since, I was at the San Francisco Chinatown area just having fun in the sun...Then, I said to myself lets go to the Golden Boy Pizza... I have not eaten Golden Boy Pizza in years!!! My favorite slice of pizza from the Golden Boy Pizza... That, I enjoy eating the most would be the Sausage Pizza yummmmmy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: William B.

description: RIDICULOUS and completely not worth the wait! Plenty of other better pizza parlors worth your time. Should not have to wait an insane amount of time for just pizza.
author: Bobby C.

description:
This place is SO legit - whether you are in a hurry and just want to grab something quick or looking for munchies after going out at 2am, Golden Boy Pizza is there for you (yes, it opens late!)

This is the only non-thick crust pizza place I like, usually I am not a fan of those, but this place does things right! My favorite here are the the combination and vegetarian. The vegetarian pizza even uses pesto sauce instead of tomato sauce...adds a bougie touch to this hole-in-the-wall :) Perhaps it's because the pizza has a tons of toppings but one slice is enough to fill you up and pizza here is not cheap ($3.75 for a slice that's not just cheese or peperroni) 

Complete hole-in-the-wall (ie. small, not exactly the cleanest place, quick, friendly waiters) but definitely one of the most famous pizza places, if not most, in North Beach aka Little Italy with a bunch of other legit Italian places. It's a must try!
author: Melody L.

description: Garlic and clam pizza was pretty good. Deep-dish like crust (like Pizza Hut variety) in square slices, each slice is $3-4.  My only complaint was that there wasn't a whole lot of clam on my slice.  Tons of garlic though, which I love. Just be careful if you're having beers after, beer burps + garlic = complaining friends all night.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Pesto vegetarian pizza was so very good here. Good service very nice place one of San Franciscos finest
author: Sara H.

description: One random night in the city I am hungry for food at 2 in the night and I found this location open showing pizza slices fresh off the oven. Since then every other time I am in the neighborhood I make it a point to stop by and get a quick slice of the cheese or the clams pizza. I'd say it's one of the best to-go pizza places in San Francisco.
author: Sachit K.

description:
I've probably eaten here 2-4 times a week for the past few months.  It's worth to note that nothing has changed.

Best tasting crust, friendly servers, friendly price, friendly tap beers, excellent music on the iPod (never fails), and Christopher Walken.

If they only served CHAMPAAAAAG-NIA...
author: David D.

description: A slice of heaven located in North Beach. Great friendly service too. Any slice you order will taste awesome to the max!
author: Jinny K.

description: I had sausage, vegetable, and pepperoni over the course of an hour while sitting here. You order and then sit down. They throw the slice into the oven to heat it up before they give it to you. Its good and cheap. The staff is friendly. There is a decent selection of beers to choose from. The atmosphere is fun. There's an eclectic mix of music playing and jokes on the menu board. Getting a seat can be difficult, otherwise this place is a gem.
author: Eden R.

description:
If Golden Boy ever needs a Golden Girl - well he need not look to the 80's t.v. show.

I will come running.

This was the 4th stop of the night, having switched from my Ruby Slippers to REAL slippers, I was down for a run through the dirty ass city streets in my little black dress and Isotoners to this Golden Destination.

There is nothing more in life than the hot pizza on your drunken tounge. We chose our Golden selections. We waited as it baked and the aroma permeated our dulled senses. Even buzzed, this Golden pizza smelled of deliciousness. 

We snuck it back in to the nearby bar and ate and ate our fat Golden squares of hot, crispy dough, chewy salty Golden cheese and toppings. Mine of veg and pesto, others of meat, glorious Golden meat.

There is nothing not Golden about a Golden Boy slice. 
It practically glows.
Golden.
author: Katie W.

description:
Took my hungry family here for lunch today after visiting the Exploratorium. I asked Siri for "nearby pizza" and we picked the highest-rated place within walking distance (btw - it was a long walk, straight uphill.)  

What a fantastic find!  Quick and delicious - loved how it's sold by the slice so everyone could get what they wanted.

I'm not one for writing reviews, but after lunch my entire family said "we have to write a Yelp review for this place!"  It's not fancy and seating is limited, and they only take cash, but the pizza is terrific.
author: Barbara L.

description:
The classic NB spot after some drinks on Friday and Saturday night. The meat combo is the way to go. Clam and garlic is also good. Expect a line on weekend nights.
Cash only. Grab a mirror pond ale with your pizza
author: Dave C.

description:
i am lactose intolerant and i love this place so much i am willing to suffer!!!

its soooo good especially when its freshly out of the oven..still good when they reheat it but the BEST when its fresh out of the oven....

it is sooooo goood

i stick with the pepperoni or the sausage....can't go wrong with those....
author: Brendan L.

description:
This is my favorite pizza in SF. Why? Because it's not trying to be "California Style" or 
"New Your Style"...it is it's own pizza...it's down-n-dirty Sicilian Square deliciousness. 

My mouth waters just thinking about it and I can't believe I haven't made the effort to review.

Crunchy corners, yummy sauce...lots of toppings... always get myself an extra slice for the next day. Also...I find myself taking out of towners here... I mean...it's pizza in North Beach...they can totally get on board with that and you're not breaking the bank.

2 Supreme Slices - 2 Cokes - $10. Perfection.
author: Katy A.

description:
Delicious-oney! 

Golden Boy Pizza is an excellent option for those who want to spend $4-$6 dollars on a solid piece of pizza.  I have gone to three *strictly* pizza joints in North Beach and as of now, GBP is my favsies.

Don't laugh, but my friends always laugh at me for eating pizza with a fork and knife.  I don't know where I picked-up the habit, but the good news is..Golden Boy's pizza is PERFECT for us fork/knife users.  The crust is a crispy, sourdough parcel that balances well with a sweeter tomato sauce; add your choice of fresh ingredients and be prepared, it's hot!

The staff is always super friendly and upbeat.  And oddly enough, I find the eating area (or feeding troff) super festive and moderately comfortable, which is a bonus for a small pizza place. 

GO if...you are on a budget, in North Beach, not on a diet, want something quick, and/or beer buzzed.  

ENJOY!
author: Johanna M.

description: WOWOWOWOWOWOWOWOW. Seriously SO GOOD! And I'm not even a fan of pizza! We first got 2 slices and then ended up order 2 more bc it was so good! We got the pepperoni, combination, pesto and garlic/clam pizza. My favorite was the garlic/clam pizza. It was so flavorful and just so amazing. It's cash only but they have an ATM inside. It's really small on the inside. It's all seating against the wall. I really enjoyed this place and definitely will be back!
author: Nari L.

description:
My boyfriend and I make an annual trek to our favorite city, San Francisco from the deep depths of San Bernarghetto. Last year we wanted to save some fundage on our trip and looked for lesser-priced alternatives when eating out. We fell in LOVE with Golden Boy Pizza. It reminded me of days when I visited Queens, NY and my friends and I would hit the all-night pizza joints for a slice or two of awesome pizza. The place is small, so don't expect to bring in a party of 8 and get a table. At the most you'll stretch out across a small bar facing a wall, but that wall is fabulous with its vast sticker collection ranging from Kurt Cobain's mug to Beatles lyrics. 
 The day we went a young woman was the barmaid/waitress/pizza guru and she was perfect. Took our order (2 combos, one with 2 slices of pepperoni and the other with 1 clam/garlic one cheese). She made sure everyone in the joint was comfortable, had drinks in front of them and even talked sports with the locals. 
 The pizza was amazing! The garlic clam pizza has left me dreaming of my return this July. I cannot recommend it enough. GET.IT.
 Do yourselves a favor and try it out. If you find yourself wanting great food at a low price then make the trek to Golden Boy. You won't regret it.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Good pizza place in North Beach.

I don't think it lives up to most reviews, but place is good for late night pizza slices and definitely hits the spot.
author: Ayall S.

description: Late night pizza stop... I thought it was yummy to my tummy... but it hurts to say this because the people there were GREAT, but it wasn't my fav.... :(  Sorry... I'm kinda a pizza snob I guess... more of an NY style then a chicago deep dish.. but it was ordered for me so I don't know if they have other types.... until next time boys!!!
author: Mike H.

description: While this place has apparently been an icon of North Beach since 1978, I've only been there a couple of times --but it's already one of my favorites. Unfortunately, I don't live right in the city and can only come occasionally, but it's worth traveling for. It's a small, unpretentious place that always seems to have a line. Among other things, this means the pizza is always fresh from the oven. One of the main problems with average pizzerias is that you get stale slices that have been sitting around for a while. That never happens here. I generally prefer plain cheese, but they have a variety of other kinds as well, such as pesto, vegetable and various meat toppings. The only bad thing I can say about a place like this is that it makes ordinary pizza, which you get in most places around the country, harder to tolerate. But I appreciate that there are still people who make quality, reasonably priced and delicious foods the traditional way.
author: Larry C.

description: After a long day of walking, I decided to reward my tired legs and empty stomach with some Italian food from north beach.  When I saw the line out the door for Golden Boys, I knew I had found the place.  It's a dump, and it's cash only, but when I took a bite of this pizza, it became one of my favorite pizza places.  All the slices had a nice and think (but still crunchy) crust, the sausage was juicy, and the tomato slices had a sharp flavor.  Clearly very fresh ingredients, which not many pizza places do nowadays.  I recommend this to everyone who wants some bomb pizza in sanfran.  It's worth the 20 minute wait.
author: Ben S.

description: My favorite slice place in Bay Area. They get a ton of business, so your slice is always fresh, not reheated like pizza my heart. The Sicilian slices are good size. 2 slices for a guy and 1 for  girl. or if she's watching her weight 1.5 slices for the guy and .5 slice for your date. It may be a little boring, but i like the plain cheese, with a ton of garlic sprinkled on top. The place is also next to a lot of bars so you can get your grub on after you drink.
author: Lee X.

description:
Beer goggles?  Yeah, I had on my thick ones.  

Nostalgia?  So Golden Boy reminds me of a hole-in-the-wall in Boston's North End where slices were 85 cents, dixie cups of wine were two-for-a-dollar, regulars ordered in Italian, and I was in love.

What matters here is the garlic-clam-parsley slice, cheese molten from the oven, which still has me mesmerized and scheming a way to get back for a sober second date.
author: Dana S.

description: Pizza by the slice in a cool atmosphere, counter and some seating. Service was friendly. Definitely good for those hungry and on a budget while out and about. $4.00 house wine helps complement your slice.
author: Sean K.

description: Got the clam and garlic slice..so good! Very different from any slice I've ever had any where else.. And the crust is just as delicious as everyone says it is! Cash only tho ={
author: Beverly T.

description: Its good pizza - even for thin crust pizza loving people, golden boy pizza is delicious.  The clam and garlic is very garlicky but they do it right here.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Golden Boy is the champ for on the run/in between bars, food.

Nothing like hitting up Columbus Cafe for its money HH and then walking over to Golden Boy, for a couple of square slices of pizza....and then continuing the party in North Beach.

SF is not really known for pizza, but this is one of the better spots in the city.

FYI - Cash Only
author: Kyle W.

description:
I really like the pizza here!!

It's a small restaurant that seems to be a local favorite.  The line was out the door, but it moved quite quickly.   Pizzas were placed right in front of the window and the aroma just drifted outside.  Mmmmm....I'm getting hungry just waiting!

Finally, I get to order...1 Slice of Combination, 1 slice of pesto vegetarian and 1 slice of pepperoni please!  I made sure to try a little bit of each, but I definitely had some help!!  Each one came out just oozing with cheese.  The crust was crispy and definitely not greasy.  The toppings were generously layered on top of the gooey cheese.  It was delicious.  Cash Only and reasonably priced
author: Lulu W.

description:
There is a reason why hordes of drunk people wait in line here at 2am.  That is because it is LITERALLY THE BEST PIZZA BY THE SLICE IN THE CITY!  POW! BAMMM!  

It isn't exactly like GBP is the only pizza place open at 2am, there are tons of places- but none of them touch GBP quality.  In other words, it is totally worth the wait if you see a long line right after last call.  If you are standing in line reading this now then raise your hand and look out for me.  If you see me then say hi and let me cut in line with you ;)
