I gotta give a special shout out to the staff of this place.  These people put up with a lot but are always friendly and willing to make one more pizza if it means serving a few more folks after hours.  

Thanks for sopping up that beer in my tummy year after year GBP.
author: Ryan S.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Prolly Combo Pizza = I forget specifics, but just remember it was gooooood

SERVICE:
Order and eat at at counter

ATMOSPHERE:
Pretty small, nothing fancy, just counter seating, few tvs playing sports
author: Angela L.

description: This is a good place to visit after an evening in North Beach.  A nice square of pizza goes down well with a draft beer.
author: Jon L.

description: I'm one of the owners at the Mercato (http://goo.gl/pP0eD) and always see the lines out the door here, so I decided to try it, and it instantly became my favorite pizza place in North Beach.  Others love the clam pizza, but I prefer the other flavors.
author: Joyce G.

description: I will add this to some of my long lifetime theories in life/experience. .Some experiences fare more better on the time and place as opposed to the ACTUAL experience itself..I.e...food at the golf turn..for one you just played 9 holes. .anything is good...late night slice of pizza..greasy burger or taco..you've been up all night walking the streets little buzz on...man that good looking roof burning your top of your mouth slice of pizza "sure hits the spot" ..this place perfect example. We need something to eat..open all night..line out the door.. $20.00 covers 2 slices 2 sodas..no problem. .but at 4:30 in the afternoon. . 3 $ tars only
author: Mark C.

description: What do you do when it's 1 AM and your group has just finished drinking in the tenderloin and has a sudden serious need for pizza? Well certainly you high-tail it towards North Beach and get on your Yelp app stat! Golden Boy had great reviews and upon our arrival, a massive line so we jumped on in and did our time. The payoff was a new Foursquare friend formed while in line plus several large rectangles of doughy, cheesy goodness, perfect for balancing out our cocktail-fueled evening. We're talking heavy duty pizza here, not exactly what I'd chose to grab for a light lunch but absolutely perfect for late night needs and everyone in line already knows that.
author: Hilary P.

description: Great square pizza with just the right amount of char. It gets busy but the waitresses are upbeat and friendly. Cash only.
author: Debra M.

description: I have some friends that give this place a bad rap...  But I've always enjoyed it here.  Pizza is great and hot.  Service is fast and pleasant.  Seating is limited but it has a great vibe.  I regularly eat here.
author: R G.

description:
Its so standard to get pizza after a late night of partying in San Francisco but Golden Boy Pizza is just a little more unique and yummier than your regular pizza by the slice. 

You would think that by that late of an hour it wouldn't matter what you ate but trust me your taste buds are happier when they get better stuff in their mouth.  Other than coming here late at night I would def come in the day too. 

I totally dig the Sicilian style- square pizza thing.  My only quip is that its on the greasy side but that's nothing a typical napkin dab won't fix. They wrap it up in this cute red and white checkered paper and you're ready to go!

I got the vegetarian pesto one and it was delicious.  I wouldn't mind trying one of the meat ones next time.  I'm lucky my friend lives in North Beach because I am def coming back.
author: Anya R.

description:
I tend to be a pretty tough reviewer of pizza because it is not my favorite food... Golden Boy really gets the job done though! They have great sicilian style pizza by the slice with many great topping options. The crust is thick and particularly amazing. Usually a lot of the pizza is hot or they can fairly quickly heat you up a slice of whatever type you choose.

Golden Boy also has a great selection of beer which is always a big plus. Gotta love the Hefeweizen!

As the night gets later, the line gets longer. The line can really get quite long as this is the main place near the Grant bars in North Beach that serves up pizza by the slice (North Beach Pizza is great but you have to buy a whole pizza...).

Some of my guy friends might not survive without Golden Boy... part way through a big day of day-drinking, they refuel and sober up a little with Golden Boy and then either a) pass out in their nearby apartment or b) keep drinking only to return to Golden Boy a few hours later!!!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Cheap, filling, super tasty pizza!

Garlic clam pizza ? Well worth the wait. Crunchy, thick, chewy. If it only had mushrooms, I'd give it a 5.


CASH ONLY. ATM inside
author: Christina C.

description: Delicious. Cash only. Not a ton of space.
author: Bree M.

description: Small place, cute, girl at the counter was super nice. Pizza was good, the crust is not thin but it's not thick either, chewy, crisp and a little buttery. Overall good pizza, great prices.
author: Bertamus R.

description:
Over-rated!  It's Sicilian style and service is spotty.  The prices are fine...but SF is strange about their acceptance of Credit Cards.  

We sat at the counter and ordered from there.  Slices ranged from $3.25 - $3.75 depending on which slice you get.  I had a slice of Supreme and Pepperoni and it was plenty filling.  There were about 6 beers on draft and they were reasonably priced at about $4.00 / pint.  The slices are light on sauce...so maybe that's just a personal preference...but they were more so average as opposed to the 4 stars this place is receiving.

They had 1 employee attempting to serve about 30 people and put slices in the oven at the same time.  Ultimately...I think you'd be better off being drunk eating here after the bars and not going there sober.
author: Chris R.

description: Ate here again on the late end. Best pizza I've had in North Beach. I'm not usually a Sicilian style pizza eater but they know what the hell they are doing. Be prepared for a wait if you go on the later end. Everyone likes to hit up this spot after having drinks.
author: Celia C.

description:
We visited this place by pure chance, we were in the neighborhood to go to a near by restaurant but they had a two hour wait. We passed by this pizza joint three times and on the third time we finally decided to just try it. 

They have five different pizzas and the one we tried was the clam and garlic pizza. WOW!!!!! Who would have thought up that combo, but whoever it was is a genius. I love garlic and that pizza had tons of it and I love clams and the pizza was filled with little clams. This place was such a great find and I'm so glad we decided to try it. 

The line may look intimidating but it's not bad. Just try it as an appetizer before dinner or as a snack. I can't wait to go back.
author: Karen C.

description:
BEST PIZZA EVER!  MUST HAVE THEIR UNIQUE SQUARE PIZZAS! 
No parking? Who cares! Walk there and GET SOME!  Oh god... I'm drooling... It's that good.
author: Anni M.

description: I'm from so cal. I make it my business to stop by this little gem everytime I'm in town. Now for the review. Damn it,  too hard to write a review for this place. Nothing I say makes any sense. .  The garlic pizza is the best and the pepporoni pizza is the best! %$%# argh!!!
author: Hieu V.

description: Great pizza, at good prices. I have eaten here twice and the quality was great. There are only 5/6 options and always a massive queue, but I guess that is a sign of how good the place is.
author: Barry O.

description:
Excellent pizza and always a favorite stop when I'm in SF.  The slices are in the style of street food in Italy...square, greasy, and served in paper...but significantly thicker and more substantial.

The clam pizza is a bit different (maybe too different for me), but everything else is delicious.

Cash only, and lines can get a bit long at times (although they do move quickly), so come prepared.
author: Phillip M.

description: My boyfriend and I were on vacation, and found this spot. Must say best pizza we have ever had! Just perfect and the guy that took our order was very friendly. Will definitely be craving this pizza! Can't wait to go back to SF!!
author: Stephanie P.

description: This is my go to place for late night pizza. There's just something about that buttery crust and melting cheese that makes this the perfect late food. Surprisingly the pizza taste great even when you're not drunk but try to get here early to beat the late night drinking crowd.  My personal fav is the garlic and clams pizza.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Sieu C.

description:
Family never lets me down! 

we love to share "our fave spots" with each other when we visit each others hoods. 

The cousins newest find was Golden Boy Pizza! 

The Hubby has been craving a competitor to the old school Square Pan Pizza... Golden Boy has definitely come close according to him... and that says alot because he's a picky eater! 

had the veggie and the cheese... definitely deserves a go back!
author: Bernadette D.

description: Yes. I am a NY pizza snob and Golden Boy is up at the top of pizza kingdom. The crust is light for its depth and the crust has its own unique focaccia taste.  I had it three nights in a row on SF trip with 2am runs each night. The wait is long but the crowd knows it is worth it.
author: John K.

description: Its pretty good pizza; the crust is what makes it.  Crispy, cooked to perfection.  I tried the clam pizza.  Not bad, but not my cup of tea.  I really liked the veggie and works options better.  The staff are really, really nice, and for a dinky hole in the wall, they really have a good selection of pizza's and beers.  My kids loved it too.  In fact my 10 year old asks almost daily when we can go again, lol.
author: Rob B.

description:
This place reminds me of the little shop I visited every day in Florence.

the crust was thick almost like focaccia and had fresh sauce and oooey gooey cheese!

It's definitely worth searching for parking and waiting in line for.  I tried the pepperoni, cheese, and the veggie with pesto sauce.  All of the ingredients were so fresh, the sauce was awesome, the dough was cooked perfectly!

I can't explain it, but it's just good!  Simple ingredients made into some mouth watering pizza that I crave whether I'm sober or not!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Best pizza in the city hand's down.

As mentioned by others: order the clam garlic, but really all the different flavors are great.

Cash only

Draft beers + pizza = zomg perfect start to a night of bar hopping around north beach.

If you are having trouble finding the place and the huge line doesn't give it away (line moves fast), looking for the sign - a huge lighted neon hand with a finger pointed toward the door :)
author: Noah P.

description:
Hello delicious little rectangles of melted cheese, pepperoni, and large sausage meatballs!

No wonder the line was all the way down the sidewalk...Pizza Orgasmica, you have quite the competition!
author: Misha F.

description: Bring your cash for this joint.  Vlad Crazy about the garlic clam sliceroo
author: Vlad A.

description:
The vegetable toppings are shockingly good.  Even zucchini (which I normally dislike) took on a crunchy delightful texture on this pizza.  

I raved about it while walking up an enormous nearby hill.
author: Niniane W.

description: Golden Boy rocks! Everytime I visit San Fran, this is one of the first places I stop at. Clam and garlic, YUM! Pesto vegetarian, yes please! CASH ONLY!
author: emily n.

description:
well I finally made it to golden boys pizza after reading all the reviews and I have to sat
y I've had better but it was good and a nice place to go to think I'll stick to ZA's pizza
Also they had no clam and garlic pizza the reason i went there bummer.
Really good clam and garlic pizza in Capitola Pizza my heart
author: Jim W.

description:
I am giving Golden Boy Pizza five stars for the pizza itself. Wow! The pizza is delicious and served up hot, a treat! 

I went to Golden Boy this past Tuesday with a friend and while the place is a dive it is really a great place to get good pizza. 

It is NOT a tourist place. It is a place for locals. The place is clean and well kept. And it is good to be around everyday people. The rock music is good. But sometimes the staff can play it a bit too loud. 

Or maybe, that's just me as I am getting older. Still I think the place is fun and service is friendly. Prices are a bargain. 

On this visit I had the pesto vegetarian. I was surprised because I expected the pesto to be really overpowering. But it for me it was subtle with a nice balance of flavor. 

I also had an Italian lemonade soda. It is very satisfying, not too sweet. And, with a fresh hot pizza it is a real treat. For the two of us, we had a large square slice of pizza and a lemonade soda. Total cost $10.00 even. That's a real bargain! 

Oh and guess who I spotted as I was leaving Golden Boy! 

The veteran local journalist Warren Hinckle was leaving the pub next door to Golden Boy and was and about to step into a taxi. 

For those of you who do not know who Warren Hinckle is, he has been an established journalist who used to write for the SF Independent and other papers for years. 

I almost did not recognize him. He was wearing shorts and green knee high socks. If it was not for his trademark eye patch and faithful dog, I would have missed him. I approached him respectfully and introduced myself. 

Age has slowed him down. But with those knee high green socks I guess he is still the outgoing and fun raising character. 

Incidentally, at one of the places near Golden Boy Pizza, the legendary Carol Doda sings and entertains. 

Perhaps, next time I visit Golden Boy who knows, maybe I will run into Carol Doda or some other colorful character that makes San Francisco a fun and fascinating city.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
This is more my style of Pizza. Square slices are not as messy, and the gentle spices added to each slice are sublime! Thick crusts and thick pizza topped with plenty of cheese and not overdone with the tomato. 
Parking is near impossible of course but I had no idea so many crackheads and tweakers lived in this part of town. Good for them, movin on up!
author: Jim L.

description:
Been going here for over 20 years, and it's still the bomb.  Don't decide what you want until you see what's been freshly pulled out of the oven when you get up there.  And don't fret -- the line moves fast.  

And make sure to bring cash!
author: Kimberly Q.

description: The pizza was awesome, but the service was terrible. The girl working the register was extremely rude, and refused to pour us a beer that we had paid for because she was confused on the number of beers we had ordered. Again, the pizza was very good. The garlic clam was something different and very good.
author: Hannah T.

description:
Really good pizza, served quickly by cute waitresses. It's a different style than I'm used to, thick rectangle slices with plenty of sauce and cheese, and a menagerie of toppings. I definitely make the trek down to North Beach just for this pizza, you just can't beat the price or the quality.

I'm a big fan of the vegetarian, but the other's look really good too. Its nice to grab a slice and walk over to Washington Square and enjoy a sunny day with a great slice of pizza.
author: Glenn J.

description: Me and my three friends watched the guy making pizza spread the sauce on the pizza with his bare hands.   Pretty gross...
author: Nikki J.

description:
I was walking by and I seen the pizza in the window it look so fresh!!!
So I try it!!  It was so good. The pizza crust  was not too thick it was just right.. I will go back be for I go back to Vegas..
author: Kim C.

description:
Once you've had square, you'll always go there.
Yummy. Had the pepperoni. Very good. I always see the pizza on it's way to Caffe Trieste and finally had the opportunity to try some.
Tasty, cheap, filling, hot out of the oven. Perfect rainy day food.
Cash only.
author: Johanna S.

description:
Nevermind any place else, but I think Golden Boy Pizza has the best pizza in North Beach, if not The City! The lines for this place are always so long, but I'd wait in this line forever if I got to have the combination pizza all nice and freshly made... melted... gooey... delicious. It's a place you can hit up during the day, and of course after all the bars are kicking people out and you're hungry. Their pizza never disappoints. 

The pieces are square and nicely sized. I love the combination pizza the most, although the pepperoni is pretty good too. I have to someday order something else, but seeing the fresh pieces glistening in the window and begging me to eat them are just too tempting to pass up.
author: Caroline L.

description: This is one of my favorite "pizza-by-the-slice" spots in SF. Definitely a must try. My favorite is the combination -- but you can't go wrong with whatever you choose. Worth the wait!!
author: Jenna P.

description: We spent 35 min walking up Columbus from Pier 39. We were directed to a small hole in the wall pizza joint in North Beach. It was the best pizza we have ever had. The ratio of crust to sauce to cheese was perfect. The price was very reasonable. This will definitely be a stop on my next trip to San Fran!
author: Andrew J.

description:
I LOVE GOLDEN BOY. Beyond my certification in professional burrito eating, I also hold a certification in professional pizza eating. I have no hesitation waiting in line for a square of this heavenly succulence. This is the best pizza in town. 

I used to live a block away from this place, and let me tell you, my ass is another inch wider thanks to Golden Boy.
author: Katie H.

description:
Two words DRUNK MUNCHIES!!!!  This place is the best not only because its around a lot of bars I like but it's really good too.  The closer it gets to closing time the longer the line gets, but it's worth the wait.  

I love the vegi pizza and there is something about their crust that just melts in your mouth.  You can get by the slice or a whole sheet.  There is usually a good crowd that at times can be entertaining after a night of drinking.  The people that work there are usually nice and quick!!!  

Remember to save a few bucks because they do not take credit cards.  It's good cheap pizza that you can get into the wee hours of the night it doesn't get much better then that.
author: Corynne O.

description:
Square pizza? Yes!

And it tastes gooooood.  My favorite is the clam and garlic. The only problem is timing. If you don't show up at the right time, your favorite flavor might be gone. 

Last night I had a slice of cheese and a slice of sausage. Both were yummy, but I REALLY wanted that clam & garlic. 

This was also the first time I ate inside. I usually get it to go. I love the look and feel  of this place. Kind of gritty and industrial with the stainless steel counters and corrugated tin walls. I also saw shrines to James Dean and George Harrison amidst all of the random stickers on the walls. Very cool. 

And if that wasn't enough, they crank out some great rock tunes while you're sitting there enjoying your slice. Good times.

Before drafting this review, I was hovering between 3 and 4 stars. The fact that this place is open til 2:00 AM on Fridays and Saturdays bumps it up to that fourth star. Late night munchies can be a very high priority at times.
author: Rory O.

description: Is it the best pizza in the world? No. But they do one thing and they do it well. You can always count on tasty, fast, fresh, cheap pizza by the slice (square) here, whether you come by after work on a weeknight, 1am on a Saturday, or for lunch on the weekend. I know I should branch out, but after trying the clam and garlic pizza, I'm unable to order anything else. Salty, crispy, cheesy, garlicky, parsley-y, and delicious every time.
author: Alison S.

description: Garlic and clam pizza, Delish!  Love the atmosphere
author: Kimmy D.

description: Was just ok. I wouldn't come back. Had a slice of the pepperoni and a slice of the clam.
author: Tay T.

description: A good slice of pizza! Wanted a place to eat before a concert at the Warfield. We trekked it over here from Montgomery Bart since my friends had a craving for the Clam Pizza. I decided to try it out as well since they always talk about it. I'd call it more of a garlic pizza since the clams are pretty hidden within the slice. But overall it taste pretty good! I'd say the crust is the star of the  pizza. You could probably put anything on that crust and it would be an awesome slice. (Although I don't know if I'd make the same walk for another slice) Next time I'll just drive or have my bike at least.
author: Alister A.

description:
I'm swimming against the tide on this one.

Although I live a block away from Golden Boy, I hadn't been there for almost a year until this evening. And today I recalled why.

Yes, it's a tasteful pizza, if you are into Sicilian style (aka squared, thick crust, cheese placed beneath the sauce). They have 6 options: cheese, pepperoni, clam, pesto vegetarian, vegetables and sausage. And it's cheap. Period. 

After yoga and some grocery shopping this evening, the thought of cooking dinner was unbearable. I walk past Golden Boy and think "Why not? Cheap and easy". I walk in. The place, like many reviewers already mentioned, is a hole in the wall. I remember eating in just once, when I had just moved to SF, and never again feeling tempted to repeat it. I was reminded today the reason why - the service just sucks! That just kills it for me!

I order my pizza, the guy barely acknowledges me, as he is in a conversation with another customer about why his alter-ego is 'mayor Giuliani". He warms up my pizza, asks me if it's 'to go', then when he takes it out of the oven, he asks me if I want him to wrap it up. What I am supposed to say?!?!?! It's TO GO!!! OF COURSE!!! Argh!!! 

I wrap it up, regretting stopping by to buy it, and having a total deja-vu - service ALWAYS sucked when I went there before and that's why I never came back!  But it gets worse - after taking a nice shower, putting some nice Billie Holliday on, and getting ready to eat my pizza with a nice glass of wine, I take the first bite, and realize that the crust was burned! No, seriously! He warmed it up too long! Way to go!

Maybe I need to party hard one night and go face the long lines late at night (and with the munchies)  to  be able to appreciate this place. Or maybe I just need to give in - it's not for me! :-(
author: Simone W.

description:
I just did a review on how much I thought Little Star Pizza SUCKS and then thought, "Why don't I balance things out by writing a review on my favorite pizza place?" 

Here it is! This pizza has that good buttery, doughy, flavorful crust that I wish all pizzas could have. There's plenty of cheese, they really load on the right amount of toppings, you're in and out really quickly, and the sauce is nice and subtle. It's nice and cheap, and you can eat it in the park. And the best part: it isn't crawling with hipsters who think they're cool because they like a $30 pizza place.
author: Heidi G.

description:
When I first arrived in San Francisco, Hungry Monster Bobbin had flared full-force. So my boyfriend and I threw our bags down in our hotel and made the downhill walk to Golden Boy Pizza. Huge trays of square pie taunted me from the window, the golden boy boxing logo greeting me at the door. I chose the Combo Slice: zucchini, pepperoni, sausage and fresh tomato atop a thick, chewy, just-right crust.

After destroying my lunch, I was able to turn around on my stool and absorb my surroundings. Corrugated tin covers the arched ceiling and walls, spotted with signs and stickers. I was most intrigued by a sticker for the Duck Apocalypse band: a roughly sketched duck waddling in front of a mushroom explosion. I also appreciated the George Harrison collage, arranged and hanging on a golden tray.

Post pizza, I felt like a Golden Girl--not like Blanche but like a fighter with a mean upper cut.
author: Bobbin W.

description: Homer Simpson would say '' Hmmmmmm Golden Boy Pizza .. ''  you can get hooked on the garlic & clam pizza here ...... really tasty pizza in North Beach... legendary , popular place ..... quick service- fair pricing ... disregard the naysayers -- this place has a strong,loyal following for good reason --- its very good pizza .
author: Sonny B.

description:
This place is great because it makes it's pizza with a thick crust (not exactly deep dish, but thick enough to sop up massive amounts of alcohol).  The pizza is good, but not great.  

Also, the line on a Saturday night takes FOREVER.  The line doesn't move until people get their pizza paid for and heated up.  If the line moved faster I'd be inclined to give out more stars, but as is I'll only go here when it isn't busy.
author: Lara O.

description: By far the best pizza I've had on the west coast so far.  5 stars up from a New Yorker, plus really chill spot too hang out with friends and grab a beer.
author: Sean M.

description: Possibly the best pizza I've had. Delicious, non-greasy and fast service. Try it - you might like it!
author: Shannon H.

description:
It's an oldie but goodie.   The sign out front reads  "Golden (est) Boy (1978) Pizza.  

As native North Beach goer, sadly, I've been here just once before.  How is that possible?  Well, there's North Beach Pizza, Tomasso's... and many more- some newly discovered, some I've o.d. on.

It's nice to have an old neighbor favorite around when the mood strikes.

The menu was 
A slice of vegetarian
A slice of sausage
A glass of Mirror Pond on tap
A glass of water

+ two semi hungry people

+hard rock tunes I couldn't identify (but my dinner mate could)

= a nice early dinner.

Nappy time.
author: Jen L.

description: This place is open till late in the night, which is great as there are many times when you need food late. The pizza (pesto and cheese) was delicious, right out of the oven and extremely soft. The ambience is really funky, with posters all around. It seems that you are having a pizza party in a college dorm. I am definitely going back.
author: Shubhi T.

description:
Best in town, hands down! The sausage wholly impressed my Chicago friend and its very difficult to argue with their clam slice, though the combo is my favorite.

Thank you Dad for taking your son here long before he could reach the counter.
author: Jordan Reis C.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza holds a special place in my heart.

I have been coming here since the summer of 2005 and fell in love from first bite.  The pizza here is sold by rectangular slices and you can also by a rectangular sheet if you're feeling frisky.  The crust is fantastic -- always delicious and perfectly crispy.  The sauce is just the right amount of tomato goodness and always hits the spot.  My favorite flavor is the supreme but you really can't go wrong with any of them.

As you walk up, you will likely find the employees near the window where they lay all of the pizzas that come freshly out of the oven.  They're cut into rectangles and your mouth will start to salivate once you get inside.  The aromas of the freshly baked pizza and the sound of ice cold beer flowing into pitchers and glasses is a sure sign that you're in for a good meal. 

The staff is always great and friendly.  Sit at the bar in front of the beer taps if you're going to need many re-fills and you can also sit in the back for more privacy.  This place is always packed and it's a great place to grab a slice or two whether you're in a hurry or have time to stay a while.  Golden Boy Pizza has become a staple of North Beach and I can't wait to go back.
author: Dan J.

description:
I love pizzas cut into squares... it reminds me of my vacation in Roma, and who doesn't like feeling nostalgic when it comes to grub?  Had both the Clam and Garlic slice as well as the Combo slice... that's right folks, I'm a glutton, and I don't give a damn!

They were both so scrumptious and tasty, and my mouth is salivating now just thinking about it.  There was a bit of a wait for the combo slice... and they take cash only... which prevents me from giving them 5 stars.  Other than that, the pizza was fantastic.  There was some combo pizza left for the next day, and it tasted even better!
author: mariel v.

description: Golden Boy Pizza, A North Beach legend. It has been there about 33 years, and always on weekends when bars are closing there is a long line but it was worth the wait. I always get a combo or the pesto veggie. Golden Boy is now in San Mateo, So I don't have to make the drive to North Beach anymore!
author: Brian B.

description:
Wow! This place is fantastic!

Whenever I go to North Beach, I am bombarded by restaurant managers trying to force me into their place of business for a bite to eat. This is why Golden Boy Pizza is such a breath of fresh air. It doesn't need to sell itself on the streets. It is downright great pizza. I had a plain cheese and the clam pizza. They were both delectable. 

My love for this pizza is now an issue as it is preventing me from visiting other places when I am in this part of town. It has now made me culinarily close minded.
author: rebecca p.

description: the BEST pizza but the service has went down.  my family would go to san Francisco all the way from Manteca  every weekend to get pizza here and now we barely come because the new pizza ladies don't heat the pizza correctly and aren't friendly.  When Laurie was there the pizza was always prepared correctly and the service was great. now if e go there we take our pizza all the way home which is about an hr away and we heat it up our selves.
author: Mia P.

description:
I'm pretty sure I'd still love this pizza even if I wasn't always intoxicated while eating here.

I vote for combo.
author: Poppy C.

description:
I'll paint the picture.  You're out late after a night of drinks and taxiing around from Rick House to Tunnle Top to Ambassador and then back to North Beach. It's late and you just want to get home, but suddenly your mesmerized by the glow of the giant finger pointing down to your new destination.  All you can think of is a perfect square of soft thick cheesy pizza goodness.  No crust, you love crust, but tonite you don't give a crap about it.  All you want is that slice of goodness.  You pay the taxi driver and walk towards your dream Pizza.  You suddenly realize that you're way to tired to wait in the long line so you just keep walking to North Beach pizza and buy an almost equally satisfying slice.  
Next time Golden Boy, Next time....
author: Robert S.

description: A good friend of mine took me to this place last month after a night of drinking. I'm glad that he did as the pizza here is great! It's tasty and cheap! Once slice cost only $3.50 for a nice big square of foccaccia bread pizza! When I first saw the pizza in the window while we were bar hopping, I said that pizza looks good and that we have to go back here after a few drinks. This place is casual but nice. The woman who was working there is friendly. She talked to us while we were eating. They have a lot of different kinds of pizza from the typical pepperoni and sausage ones to pizza with clams on it. The pizza was fresh and delicious. This place does live up to the yelp hype!
author: Butterfly A.

description:
My new favorite lunch spot!  Since I moved to this city I have been on the hunt for good pizza. Not only had I not found any that was more than "okay", it was all obscenely expensive. 

My friend and I strolled in here around 12:15 and there were abundant seats at the counter. We had our food within about 5 minutes of ordering. I got a soda and a slice of sausage, he got a pint and a slice of veggie. These are huuuuge slices, so don't order two like I almost did! 

First, the pizza had great flavor, second this Sicilian style was spot on and had great texture with a crispy flakey crust. The sausage was also good. My friend's veg pizza was loaded with veggies, not just a few specks like some places.

My bill came to $4.50, the cheapest lunch I've had in the city that wasn't sketchy Chinese. The place started to fill up right as we were leaving so it's probably best to come before 12:40.
author: Beth D.

description: Awesome Sicilian style pizza in North Beach.  Waited in the not-too-long line for a slice of clam and garlic and took a slice of sausage to go for later.  Really delicious - much better than expected!  Worth the wait.
author: B. Y.

description:
Buy your slice based on what looks good in the window, not what's on the menu.  Just go with your gut since you can't see the menu until the line snakes it's inside the door, at which point it's time to order and get out because there are hungry people behind you!

When you do order what looks like the best slice and find out that it is in fact clam-garlic pizza, do not panic, for it is filled with awesomeness that will rock your socks off even if you aren't all that into clams.

Conveniently located near parks and towers, but sadly, your slice will not survive until the end of the block, despite your grand plans for a picnic.  And you will want to eat it outside--the place is tiny.
author: Sydney H.

description:
This was an add on to my SF food tour since my friend called it the best slice in the city, with the preface that this isn't Chicago pizza.  I just walked in and took a few slices to go for lunch since parking is somewhat an adventure around here.  I walked in and there was a mom and her kids in front of us and there were a couple of guys inside eating.  The place is kind of a hole in the wall.  One of the creepshows sitting in the bar told the mom she needed to come back at 1am, when the line is out the door.  They needed to kick this guy out cuz really, his attempt at marketing for them failed miserably.  Why would someone want to wait in a longer line that is full of creepshows like him for this?  

The pizza itself was actually decent, though I like mine a bit more crispy.  It is Sicilian style, so crispy it is not.  It is actually more like focaccia.  Since I ordered quite a few slices, they gave me a large box for them.  The slices are about 7" squares.  When asked how many I got for myself, I said 4.  Apparently this is another example of me eating way more than normal humans, as anytime anyone asked about where I had eaten, they looked at me in a mixture of disgust and amazement when the 4 slices at one sitting was mentioned.
author: Jason P.

description: Golden Boy's is the perfect place if you have the late night munches. Be warned, you will need to be patient if you go at peak hours. You can get by the slice and I highly recommend the pesto when available. Cash only and four dollars a piece, so bring your Benjamins.
author: Megan F.

description: Good crisp crust pizza. Especially late at night. Worth the wait in line
author: Charles K.

description: Get their Clam and Garlic pizza. Oddly, a very good pizza slice that I would recommend to anyone. If you want a further review, here is my food blog on the place: http://wp.me/p2Arlk-71
author: Sonlay V.

description:
SQUARE PIZZA!

I got very excited when I looked through the window and saw that the pizza was in squares and not triangles. 

I got two slices, the pepperoni and the combo. The combo was pretty good. The pizza dough is really fluffy and soft and it's pretty thick. I took the pepperoni home and when I got home, the bag was all oily. Normally, I would think that it would be gross but it proved that the pizza was good. It was greasy and it was still delicious when I got home. I just had to reheat it again. 

They only have a few options for pizza toppings but the place is also pretty small too. 

I've only come here once but when I get the chance to make the trip again, I would want to come back.
author: Jenny L.

description: My god people!  this pizza is so overrated I really dont understand the hype!  We tried the clam& garlic and the pesto. It was oily, flat snd heavy.  The crust was disappointing and no real sauce. The service was good and the atmosphere great but other than that there are way better places in North Beach. Will Never try again
author: Yaya P.

description:
The real best pizza in the city of San Francisco.. 

One time @ Northbeach, my friend and I are getting ready to party but we need to find a place to have quick dinner. We were driving around and saw this Golden Boy Pizza.. it looks hot and fresh. We ate inside our car. How good is the pizza? sooo good that when a little piece of my friends pizza fell on my car's dirty carpet he picked it up and still ate it disregarding the dirt and germs. Well there goes the 5 second rule.. Haha it's that GOOD...
author: Faustino R.

description: This pizza was so scrumptious. Absolutely love it! The crispiness on the bottom surprises me every time. Golden Boy Pizza knows good pizza.
author: Ally V.

description:
I promise to keep this one plain and simple.
"GOLDEN BOY... I F#@king LOVE YOU!"
author: Tatiana W.

description:
quality sicilian style pizza. clam and garlic is the best imo 

also, a great spot post drinking in north beach
author: Jason G.

description: Great food here love the pizza here. Great people that works here love the crunch on the pizza.  My favorite pizza is the clam yummy   Every time I vist sf I go there and eat
author: Ja L.

description:
Strollin around in the city and had a craving for some Good Ol' Golden Boy...after driving around North Beach for about an hour looking for parking...(yes it is/was that good).....

Told about 6 of my friends that this was the SPOT for a few squares and a beer.

We were greeted by a "not too excited to be there" Lindsay...Seemed like she was tired or just plain over it. 

We waited about 10 minutes for some fresh sheets to come out of the oven. So we decided to get two pitchers...Stella & Hef were the winners. Nothin like beer and pizza...especially on a SUNDAY.

We all pretty much got the same thing...Pep or Combo...

Since I had been there before...I knew what Golden Boy's complete potential was... and it wasn't the pizza I had yesterday.

i asked Lindsay if they changed the recipe in the dough... she said no believe it or not, the weather has an effect on it... I bought it... it made sense...

Anyway....I miss the old crew who worked here...they were lively and super friendly...However, Lindsay did her job...but didn't exceed expectations. A few of my GFs said that she ignored them. We tipped her 12 on 60....hopefully that made her day a little better...

I'll go back in the summer time when the dough and energy levels are higher...
author: Maronita I.

description:
Last stop of the night..."It's hip to be square!"

Kinda reminds me of Nizarios Pizza in richmond dist. Long lines, but without the rowdy teens and drunkards... well less rowdy drunkards. 

1 Combo
1 Pepperoni
1 Clams/ garlic

Make sure you get something to drink if you get the clams and garlic pizza...its topped with a layer of herbs...will dry your mouth out...still good tho :)

I sleep best with a full stomach!
author: Lynn T.

description:
Like Hip-hop?..
Like Pizza?..

Then come HERE!!.

Visiting from san diego , me and some friends stumbled in here late  night after the aroma in the air ran through out nostrils. We came in and i was shocked to hear the likes of jay-z transitioning to the beatnuts on the stereo...I instsantly knew this place was going to be epic.

Great pizza for a very affordable price. A little cramped but well worth it. Will be back again on next visit!
author: Derrick B.

description: Golden Boy! Square pizza with a focaccia crust: so quirky, and also quite yummy. I will admit to a teensy nostalgia bias in that it reminds of pizza that existed in the town where I went to college, which may be the reason for the fifth star. Nonetheless, the other Yelpers' reviews illustrate that GB is clearly an institution. That doesn't happen without some level of awesomeness... trust the masses, my friends, and go square.
author: Janna M.

description: If you like your pizza thick and full of toppings, this is your place.  Get a pitcher, and bring your iPod for the bartender.  They have good taste.  Perfect "base" before North Beach Bar hopping.
author: Mike V.

description:
I tried the pizza here the other night when I was sober and it was damn good.  After a pitcher of microbrew for only $10, I am sure it will be even better.

Not the best pizza in town but for $3 or $3.50 a slice, it is cheap and filling.  And after reheating in a very hot oven, the pizza re-emerges as good as new - hot, crisp, and gooey.  

Definitely reminds me of some of the pizzerias in Boston, and not a fou-fou New American or Nopolitan place.  Sure, I love the pies and Italian wines at A16, but there are some nights where grease, protein, and crust, washed down with copious amounts of beer really hits the spot and the price is right.
author: Peter L.

description:
OMG!  This pizza is soooo good!  Freak yeah!  I was walking through North Beach searching for North Beach Pizza, and asked this guy where it was at.  He showed me, then said that place two shops down is my personal favorite(Golden Boy Pizza).  Of course I went to the favorite place.  He was so right they sell by the slices range $2.50-$4.00?

The place is small, but you'll most likely find a place to sit, or you can stroll down the street and eat at the park.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Stumbled across it on our way to meet up with some friends. Figured we'd stop and get a bite to eat, and this place smelled awesome so we decided to eat there.

It was super cramped and tiny. The pizza slices are of decent size, but were rather bland.

The pizza wasn't terrible, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
Pros:  Fast and cheap.  Really crowded, hard to find somewhere to sit, but if you order and walk--it is easy.  The pizza was good, but it was not great.  I definitely think they get more credit than they should have.  All the ingredients were good, but being in San Francisco, which late night greasy pizza should be really on point, but I really had better in San Jose.  Like a Slice of NY.

Cons:  I really wanted to like the clam pizza, but i can't get the taste of the herbs out of my mouth.  I hate to be a ball-buster, but I think my high expectations made it a bust.  Nonetheless, the pizza was still appetizing, ingredients were fresh, and good.  Just don't expect something out of this world.
author: Kimmy N.

description: This was one of the first places I discovered when I first came to San Fran. This pizza just hits the nail on the head. With a crisp, yet medium sized crust, just enough cheese, and tastey toppings, it's the best bite for the best price in town. Plus, I love the red checkered paper. It's a nice touch. Be sure to stop at an ATM before you go, they are cash only.
author: Dia Z.

description: Great late night pizza!!! Get in line, order  slice, grab a seat and wash it down with a great beer selection. Perfect start or end to an evening in North Beach.
author: John V.

description: Best place to get pizza after bar hopping in North Beach! Can't go wrong with pizza and beer!
author: Diana D.

description:
I'm a musician and have played in the nightclubs that line Grant Street for the better part of a quarter century.

Golden Boy used to be my standard pre-gig dinner stop since the pizza was tasty and service was quick. But about a decade ago I got a nasty case of food poisoning after eating a slice of pepperoni pizza there. It was a truly horrible experience, and I've never gone back since then.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Nirvana.  "Spot-hiiting."  Irresistible.

Yum, you are a square.
Yay, your line moves fast.
Yippee, you are open late.
Yagats, you make me swoon.

"If I could dream at all, it would be about you. And I'm not ashamed of it." - E.C.
author: Jane L.

description:
Who ever said square pizza was not good? Must have been someone who never tried Golden Boy Pizza. This place is LEGIT! HUGE pieces of pizza topped with all kinds of good stuff.

A whole bunch of friends ordered 2 TRAYS of the combination...man o man was this pizza good. Ate ONLY 3 slices and I was STUFFED. 

The staff was friendly and made an exception for us...usually they don't make trays after a certain time, but the guy was nice enough to do it for us. I will definitely be coming back here when I'm in the area.
author: Nick C.

description:
Spent the day wandering around San Francisco and decided to find a place for a quick lunch in North Beach.  I passed 20 different Italian cafes, restaurants, and pizza joints and decided on Golden Boy Pizza based on so many YELP reviews.  

So, a little bit off the main road sits this very small pizza place.  They only serve Sicilian style pizza, with the pizza already made and sitting on trays in the window.  Now, this way of presenting pizza has never really worked for me.  I prefer fresh, right out of the oven pizza. But, I said let's try it.  The young woman working there was great and very helpful.  I got a nice beer and one piece of pizza with everything on it.  After a few minutes of being heated in the pizza oven, I started to eat.  There is NOTHING wrong with this pizza, BUT, it is NOT the best pizza ever!  I have eaten lots of great pizza, and lots of bad pizza.  This pizza is good, but not great.

I appreciate the effort Golden Boy Pizza, but I will not be returning.  Thanks!
author: Mike H.

description:
Delicious. There's no such thing as not hungry for Golden Boy Pizza.

I'm not normally into the thick crust style, but Golden Boy just does it right. Some pizza places seem to operate like the crust is just there to hold up the toppings, but here it holds its own in a beautiful two part harmony. The slices are inexpensive yet wonderful. I know I might get things thrown at me for saying this, but their 'famous' clam garlic pesto really does nothing for me, which is odd because I like all the things separately...

There is some limited seating inside, which is nice in the afternoon for a slice and a pint, but by the evening the window opens up to outside and the line starts to form. Thankfully they stay open late, for when you have the epiphany that you just can't live without another slice before you stumble home.
author: Mark K.

description: Pizza tastes like cardboard.. "Owner tried to intimidate us to leave because someone was throwing noise makers in the street for Chinese New Years.... Food sucked and they were intolerant jerks!
author: Michael S.

description:
By far my favorite pizza by the slice place in the city.  Unlike most pizza by the slice places in the city where the slice is soggy and thin, GBP makes square pizzas that are just the right size and texture.  I've tried 3 of the kind they serve (cheese, pepperoni, and their combination pizza) and each was absolutely delicious.  They also have bar style seating at the place if you want to eat on site.  

So if you're in north beach and looking for some good pizza - GO HERE!
author: Eric A.

description:
This "hole it the wall" is probably one of the better pizza parlors in town. I drive 30 minutes from out of town to pick up a few slices and catch the fresh San Francisco atmosphere. So much flavor within every bite leaves you interested and yearning for more. There is not much to say but this is as simple as it gets. The pizza is stacked to the top with fresh toppings and you do not need to be afraid to use a fork and knife for it is a very respectful piece of pizza. A nice selection, but not a wide one but it surely is enough to finish you off. 

I am always leaving thinking when will I be returning. A sure go to spot when your travailing the streets of the North Beach area of San Francisco.
author: Vincent D.

description:
I've got this great picture from the right out of college drunk days of me and a friend staring lovingly at a slice from Golden Boy. I don't think the slice lasted much longer afterwards. And then we probably had another.

Fast forward a few years and I'm in the hood for other reasons, decide to get a slice for fuel before what turned out to be an epic Roger Shah show. The scene was familiar. Two absolutely loaded girls (it's the afternoon, mind you) were slurring their words debating whether to have another slice. Yes they did. Inside a guy at the counter struggled to stay awake, occasionally perking his head up to nibble on his slice.

The scene made for an amusing way to pass time as I waited for my cheap, greasy, and A-OK slice. Nice to see some things never change.
author: Jason B.

description: Fantastic Pizza, far better than I expected for a thick crust, sicilian style. One of the best in SF. This is the place you need to go to for a slice of pie. It's a tiny narrow place, just a pizza slice joint should be. The pizza is hot and fresh, the staff is rocken. I'm going back for sure!  I'm not a 'square' pizza believer but this crust was crisp and didnt flop over in your hand. the toppings were stellar as well. One thing I would warn folks, it's cash only, so be prepared.
author: Trevor N.

description: No need to get fancy - You can't go wrong with classic pepperoni pizza at Golden Boy. Plus, the square slices make it more fun to eat!
author: Shanley P.

description: I have to give this place a bad review based on my experience last night. We got here pretty late, but had a few friends from out of town visiting. We had taken a cab to get over here just in time before they closed, and were in line by 215am. After waiting for over 30 minutes and we were the last people in line, as soon as we came up to the window, they slammed everything on us and closed up. This is ridiculous, we were the LAST people in line, could have just served us. What's another 2 minutes? Food would have helped a lot with my hangover today. Never coming back here again, nor bringing people, a bad taste was left in my mouth, and it could have at least been from the pizza.
author: Phan H.

description:
The first time I tried Golden Boy's was very much like the time Squidward had his first Krabby Patty. 

Located in the wonderful North Beach district, SF's own little Italy, lies Golden Boy Pizza! I'm very grateful our friend Cameron has a car and drove us all because in my experience North Beach isn't so easy to reach via public trans. 

ANYWAYS, parking on such a nice day was rather hard to find so we did have to do some walking, which was fine. When we finally got to GB's the place was damn near empty! -- Usually not a great sign but they're known for their night crowd anyways, or so Cameron told me. But hey, not having to wait was okay in my book. I ordered a slice of the combination pie, with sausage, zucchini, tomatoes, and some other goodies I'm forgetting to mention, with a root beer. The boyfriend, Cameron, and our other friend Wyatt ordered slices of pepperoni, with sodas and beer. Not much talking occurred after we took our first bites because we were all too busy chowing down! Fresh tasting and hot with reeeeeally great toppings on an easy to enjoy, well-put-together piece of pizza! It wasn't falling apart or anything! The crust was just perfect and being that all the slices are square shaped I was fortunate enough to get the divine corner piece .. I am actually salivating at the thought of that slice. We all had only one slice each but afterwards we were regretting not getting two each, though one was plenty since our eyes always seem bigger than our stomachs, amirite?

The total for ALL of our pizzas and drinks came out to just a little over $16 (not including tip)! The guy working behind the counter actually didn't charge us for the boyfriend's beer, which we aren't really sure if that was on purpose or not, so we tipped pretty generously anyway. 

The atmosphere of the place is kind of grungy but it really isn't at all, though the place itself is very narrow shaped so can feel a little cramped. The wall is covered in stickers and other cool things to read and look at!

I'll be sure to return some day to try one of their more creative pies once I figure out how to get there on my own. Highly recommend you go see for yourself.

Cash-only!
author: Sheena W.

description: Love their pizza here! One of my favorite pizza establishments for YEARS! Usually get a slice in between work or after so I never have to wait! Hate that it's CASH ONLY. With all the damn laws in the city, you think they made a law where all businesses are required to have a credit processor.
author: Charles L.

description:
My favorite pizza in the city.

Sure you're limited to the selection they have, but that's how these peeps made a name for themselves.

Nice doughy pizza with a good crust (if you get an edge slice). Solid ingredients. Maybe they put a little too much green stuff (basil?) on the garlic & clam, but I forgive them. Perfect amount of cheese.

Beer, beer, beer. Beer is good. Right into my belly.

Line could be long sometimes, but shit, get over it.
author: Harold C.

description:
This place is so amazing..i remember coming here as a little girl with my mom and the place hasn't changed a bit.

Imagine a bar...super chill funny regular place with beer and wine and a bartender lady (super cute) now add the best F**ing pizza ever at the most reasonable price ever and you've got golden boy.

This place was awesome. Loved it. Cash only a little tiny bit of a drag but overall fast, efficient service, you want pizza? no confusion.....(they even have a sign) IF YOU CAN'T SEE IT, DON'T ASK FOR IT. So easy and simple and straightforward and mind blowingly normal. no bells no whistles just killer deep-dish style pizza that rocks.

cheers!
author: jeanine w.

description:
Stumbled over to Golden Boy after a screening during the 48 Hour Film Festival. 

We had been at Joey and Eddie's, or was it Eddie and Joey's?  Either way the dinner service was crap and we all had had one too many drinks and had won, sooooo we needed something hot, cheesy, and greasy to sop up the alcohol.

i had 2 slices of cheese, and it did more than hit the spot.  The guy behind the counter was extremely nice, and didn't seem the least bit phased with my drunken banter.  Even brought my piping hot slices out to me as I sat talking up a fellow drunk screening goer.  Major plus my man.

Plus for the ATM outside since they are cash only.  Only bad thing I was just drunk enough to be down with the $2.75 surcharge associated with using the ATM.  But hey, what's drunk me gonna do? 

She's gonna eat some pizza, that's what she's gonna do.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Sup ya'll.  Everyone knows that Cool J likes pizza.  Pizza is one of those foods that even though it "sucks", it still tastes pretty good compared to other shiet I've had.  Nevertheless, I enjoy some pizza places more than others.  Golden Boy has to be one of them.

Honestly I never really noticed Golden Boy's glowing marquee, even though I've been to North Beach dozens of times in the past few years.  I guess with an abundance of glowing signs in the neighborhood, it's hard to stand out.  For some reason I always remember Amante's though.  I think it has to do more with me knowing someone with that last name.

After a night of a few drinks, my friend suggests Golden Boy Pizza.   Of course I said yes since I love pizza and I was drinking.  I was used to going to North Beach Pizza in the area so I was happy to try something new.  Most of the time I don't find much difference between pizzas but since there was a good line there,I figured I'd try it out.

Wow.  This is pretty good pizza.  Cool J doesn't really have discriminating taste but I thought this pizza was delicious.  I think I got the pepperoni slice but there was something special about that pizza.  It was nice and crispy and the crust was awesome.  I immediately wanted another one but decided against it since I am a fat ass enough.  

This is a really popular spot since it's close to a lot of bars and lounges.  Expect to wait in line on a weekend and even on a weekday.  I think they close a little later during the weekend so if you feel like a slice at 1am in the morning,they'll be open.  There's a small area for in-restaurant eating.  Plenty of people like myself have eaten right outside the establishment.  Damn I could go for another.

Parking here is always crappy, especially during the weekend.  You'll find something most likely on the weekday during the day.  The prices are a lil higher than most pizza slice spots but what you do expect?  You're in North Beach.

Overall, check it out. I like it  a lot.
author: Jason Y.

description: Great pizza, this place has saved me many times after a night out in the city.
author: S J.

description: Hubby decides to bring home pizza, and I thought "oh great, pizza A-gain".  Hmmm, there's two boxes that he brought home, why?  I open them up and I blink twice, whoa...that's different.  Eight square slices of different kinds of pizza (I get kind of excited).  We take our bites and mmm, sooooo delicious.  Ever had a really good thick piece of foccacia?  Well, imagine that with some delicious toppings...that's Golden Boy.  Now I understand the line outside the door.  Gotta get back to some more.
author: Emy B.

description: this place is alright , nothing amazing , especially considering the long ass lines. its kinda plain and bland tasting. id rather have Tony's or northbeach pizza
author: Phillip J F.

description: Pizza is off the hooook!! Perfect Late night grub after biking the whole city. this place is gonna be a regular stop when im in SF late night!
author: Duran P.

description:
Bread: check
Melty cheese: check
Beer: check
Veggies: sometimes check
Using pizza as an alcohol-soaker-upper: check

I've heard many people say Golden Boy Pizza is not good pizza. Clearly they have not enjoyed Golden Boy for its true purpose. It's not a stop along the SF Gastronomical road of inspired cuisine. It is, however, a stop for those who have stumbled out of one of the fine nearby drinking establishments and possibly still have a poker chip in their pocket from Columbus Cafe that their friends suggested they not use . . . yet. 

It is the glorious last stop before heading home or the pit stop on a Friday Happy Hour Marathon. Well done Golden Boy, well done.
author: Claudia T.

description: The reviews and line of people outside don't lie.  Just as good as you have heard.  Always a line of 10-15 outside, and still quick.  Perfect late night slice.  Really good, and cheap.  It's the place that everyone knows and everyone goes!
author: Rich F.

description: I rarely give 5 stars to pizza joints, but it was so tough not to with Golden Boy, it's my favorite pizza place in the city and I love the double toasted square slices. The cheese and the pesto-vegetarian slices are outstanding and the service is quick. I've never eaten inside, I always get it to go, and you can't beat the price point. It's also a great late night spot after a night out drinking. I've never had a bad slice and I've eaten here dozens of times. Great, great, great pizza spot!
author: mehul p.

description: I thought the pizza was pretty good, especially because I enjoy thicker crust. The combination pizza was more bland than I thought it would be, though I think something like the pepperoni would've been good. However, for the wait time (on St. Patrick's Day) I probably would have to be craving pizza pretty badly to wait again for it. Prices are very affordable too and the workers are great though.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Loved this surprise find!  We stumbled across Golden Boy after a night time walking tour of North Beach, attracted by the smell and the line out the door.  
The pizza was fresh and delicious, we especially loved the crust, so light and still crispy.  We went back again the next night!
author: Susanne B.

description: I just want to go back there and eat there veggie squared pizza with pesto on it!
author: Khaloud D.

description: The best take-away pizza in the city!!! Nothing better than grubbing on a slice while checking out North Beach.
author: Jeramiah W.

description:
I'm so hooked. So desperately hooked! 

Two slices and two beers $16. Awesomeness!!!
author: Marianne A.

description:
Looks like this is the hot spot for pizza in North Beach. Had a slice of the Combo and a slice of the veggie pizza. Both golden. Finished it off with a cold class of Stella. Ultimate win.

The long walk from our office was definitely worth it. We'll miss you Sam (if you ever read this)
author: Jamie C.

description: Their cheese is pretty good, but hands down the veggie pesto pizza is 2 die 4...you have to check them out.
author: Samir S.

description:
Square Pizza!

This isn't your typical looking pizza slice which makes Golden Boy Pizza quite unique. It's not unusual, but it's more like a concept maximizing surface space to eat. Late business hours makes this place the best hang out spot after a long night drinking or dancing.

Cheap prices, friendly customer service, and tasty selections always win repeat customers whether you dine-in or take-out. A group of us strolled up to Golden Boy Pizza after having a few drinks at La Trappe and the line was pretty short at 12:15am. By 12:30am, the line was 20 people deep but it flowed fast. At first, I didn't want any pizza, but by the time I stood in the doorway, I smelled the pizza fragrance blowing from the heavy duty fan above and couldn't resist. My friend ordered four slices of combo and he topped it off with oregano and chili. I grabbed the massive slice and was able to control it by positioning every fingertip on each of the four corners. Cheese was oozing off, toppings were huge, and flavor hit the spot.

POW! Off the hook! 

This has got to be a marvel of the world. With each bite, more cheese oozed off, and I kept trying to balance the tomatoes and sausages from falling off the top. Generous topping of zucchini, pepperoni, mushrooms, and sausage were infused in the mozzarella. I had to pick out most onions, but ate some by accident. Advice: You really just can't use one napkin and you need a drink or soda to wash everything down.

I was definitely satisfied. If I didn't have as much beer and alcohol in my body as I did; I would've inhaled another piece. I bet these slices taste good even for breakfast the next morning too!  Overall, I think they priced these heavenly slices below what they're really worth. At $3.75 a slice of combo, this was a steal in San Francisco. I can't wait for the day I'll be able to stop by again and try something new!
author: Hogan W.

description: Wandering around North Beach on a rainy Friday night when we came upon this place. I had the plain cheese and the hubby had the clam pizza. This place is tiny and it was crowded and loud- but in a good way! Everyone was friendly and having a good time. We got a seat while waiting for the pizza to be warmed up. $6.50 later and we were enjoying some mighty tasty pizza. It was piping hot, the crust was slightly crispy, the warm dough in the middle was chewy and hot, the cheese was thick and stringy with a nice saltiness. The hubby's clam pizza was LOADED with garlic- it was delicious! Both pieces were absolutely delicious! I will definitely come back here next time I am in North Beach! Great, cheap pizza in a friendly environment!
author: Grace G.

description: We wondered into Golden Boy after a night of imbibing, and it was the answer to our prayers. Late night quality eats are not too hard to find in the city, but Golden Boy is situated in a great spot, and doesn't lack the charm that some late night eateries can. It's a clean spot, offers a slice of cheesy, saucy heaven and even offers beer on tap.
author: Kelly B.

description: Maybe 2.5 stars for average at best. Not sure what the hype is all about. The crust is good which better be if you have the word Pizza in your store name, no bonus there. Ingredients, including cheese, average and lacks flavor. The staff is nice. Enjoy the long wait for an ok pizza.
author: Ifred M.

description:
amazing - especially at 2 am after a night of drinking. The line gets SUPER ridiculous though. I think I waited one time for 30 minutes. But when I got that fresh out of the oven pizza I died after the first bite. You know this place is good because I still think it's worth it after a 30 minute wait at 2am! 

I love the combo and I love asking for the crust. 

Very cheesy and tasty!
author: Keara C.

description: the BF and I have been exploring as many pizza places in SF as we could after coming back from NY (and having mediocre pizza at Lombardi's).  I found this place and yelp and it was definitely not what i expected.  The place plays super loud music and is pretty narrow in the front.  We both ordered the clam and garlic pizza and i thought it was okay but the BF hated it.  I think he was more turned off by the atmosphere than the pizza.  Maybe next time (if there is a next time) we'll order to go?
author: JUDY L.

description: I've been here twice and liked the pizza both times.  It's a hip little spot and it is definitely a place to stop in when you're running around Little Italy.  Love the vibe and the pizza is pretty good too.  Be prepared for a line but it goes quickly.  Definitely check it out and I will stop in whenever I'm nearby to get another taste of the clam pizza, it's GOOD!!!
author: BellaLissa B.

description:
I've been coming here on and off for years. If I had reviewed them a couple of years ago I would have given them 5 stars. This past Sunday my sister and I stopped by Golden boy to get a couple of slices.The line wasn't to long but it took forever because there was only one person working. I felt sorry for her working so hard to take care of everyone herself. You would think on a busy Sunday they would have more workers.
We shared a combo slice and a cheese slice. 
Both were good just not anything special and needed more cheese.
The pizza just wasn't as great as in the past.We were going to eat there but we soon realized that the stools and counter are only for VERY VERY SKINNY PEOPLE.
I could only fit half my butt on the stool and I'm not that big just a little thick.
I guess baby's got back who knew.
I don't think it was worth the wait and next time I'd go to Tony's Slice House down the street. If you like thick focaccia bread style pizza and have a small butt or your drunk you will love Golden boy pizza.
author: Bill H.

description:
Great pizza, nice selection of beer on tap.  The pizza is square style, the crust is really light and crunchy, good bread to cheese ratio.  I had one and then had to have another.  Good for a meal or quick stop in, especially if your in the area on a night out. 

Also good pictures and eye candy on the walls, my favorite being a shot of the owner (i think) with Jim Jarmusch and Tom Waits.  So if they think its cool, and they are cool, then this place is definitely cool.
author: Casey H.

description:
Best drunken munchie pizza I have ever had.

Open late.
3 dollar slices.
Amazing flavor...even the sober would swear by it.

Seriously, a MUST eat if partying anywhere in North Beach!
author: Samantha R.

description: one of my favorite pizza place. pretty nice place to eat pizza with beer.
author: Jay H.

description:
The clam and garlic pizza is amazing. If you have ever uttered the phrase "too much garlic" then this pizza is not for you. But if you are obsessed with garlic like I am, you must stop by. Your opinion of clams is irrelevant, the garlic easily overwhelms them.

I tried the plain cheese too. It might have been good, but unfortunately I tried it second and I could not stop wishing it was more garlic & clam. It's probably the better bet if you're on a date, or if you're planning to go on one in the next 4 or 5 days.
author: Adam B.

description:
I went to Golden Boy for the first time Saturday night, but *NEVER AGAIN* after seeing how their employees treat their customers. We saw them assault one of the customers! Read on for the details...

We got to Golden Boy somewhat late (around 1:20 a.m.), so there was quite a line. My girlfriend assured me that the line would move quickly, so we decided to stay. After waiting for 15 - 20 minutes, we were almost at the front of the line when an employee suddenly shut the door and put cardboard over the window of the door. No explanation, nothing. I figured they might be switching over to window service, but I really wasn't sure. The guy behind us was a little confused, so he tried to pop his head in and ask as a customer was exiting. The employees yelled at him, and one of the female employees slammed the door shut *on his fingers*. When he tried to tell them what they had done, one of the other employees rudely pointed for him to leave. Talk about adding insult to injury!

I understand that they have to deal with a bunch of drunken idiots every night, but this guy was being respectful. We had been talking to him earlier in line, and he certainly was not one of the many obnoxious drunks we experienced while waiting. But regardless of the situation, it is NEVER ok to assault someone (yes, that is assault, my friends). I didn't get a chance to talk to him after that (he was so angry, he stormed off), so I have no idea if they broke one of his fingers or not. If they did, I hope he sues their asses.

When it was finally our turn in line, my girlfriend tried to talk to the employees to tell them that they had really injured the guy. They couldn't have cared less and started arguing with her. At that point, we simply left and vowed never to return. I cannot and will not support a business that treats people so poorly. So if the owner is reading this--you need to fire those employees.
author: Brett L.

description:
Granted I wasn't in Sicily, but I didn't eat pizza that looked like this in Florence. It wasn't what I was expecting for classic, Italian North Beach but that's ok! It was really worthwhile. In fact, nothing about the place looks like Italy. "golden boy"? The decor inside? Nah.. But onto the food..

I was boring and got plain but it had great flavor and was the perfect size for a between meals boost. If I went around lunch or dinner and wasn't already a little full I may go for a more filling option like the popular pesto veggie or maybe just 2 slices of plain.
author: Cristiana C.

description: Best pizza in North Beach!! Sry North Beach Pizza; Golden Boy wins! Love that you guys are open til 2 am too.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Cash only but it is worth it. We got three slices of pizza and two cups of soda for $12, can't beat that. Cheap and very good pizza. They always come out with different types of pizza but all of them are very good. So get in line and wait your turn. 

After you ordered your pizza go in and grab your spot and they will bring it to you or even better take it to go and enjoy stuffing your face with pizza. It is hard to find a parking spot but luckily we found one right in front of the place, which is nice. Really nice staff as long as you don't irritate them. Nice people who come here for a quick bite after work or those who are watching the Giants game on TV, basically the people are local and friendly. Some are Irish and some are Italian and all of them are very friendly. 

Btw, they have BAGGY HOOKS! There are hooks underneath the bar/table where you can hook your purse on it. Really cool and keeps your stuff off the floor and out of your way while you are eating. I loved this!!! 

A good place for pizza and beer/soda while enjoying watching sports on TV. Will be coming back w/ friends. Nothing like it. 

Enjoy!!!
author: Nana R.

description: Damn good, not Tony's good though. They're different styles of pizza, so one should definitely give both a try. Don't be afraid of the clam and garlic slice or the thrash-metal music blaring from the speakers.
author: Brett W.

description:
Why have I not heard about this until now?

I thought I had experienced the best drunken munchie food, but I was gladly mistaken.  Golden Boy's definitely topped my list.

For $5, you get a soda and a huge slice of pizza, with nothing but a sheet of wax paper to hold your hot out-of-the-oven slice.

The food is bomb, the wait is short, and you meet quite a lot of interested inebriated characters.  What's not to like?
author: Eric C.

description: They make a great pizza parlor, but you know what? They're also awesome to work with when you've got 75 mouths to feed. Unfortunately due to a scheduling conflict, we weren't able to work with them for the conference my company was hosting, but I thought I'd give a shout out to their flexibility with "catering." They went above and beyond by figuring out how many pizzas to get, how to break up the pizza so we could put them on different platters; they were even going to make the delivery 10 minutes before they actually opened. That's dedication, folks. Great place, but also great people. Cheers, GB.
author: Melissa W.

description: Tried the garlic clam pizza here and I was not too impressed. Maybe there wasn't enough garlic or enough clams but it just didnt hit the spot and tasted like eating bland pizza. The other possible reason why I wasn't impressed is that I ate a $40 steak dinner about 3 hours prior. I might give this place another shot.
author: Robert Y.

description:
BEST whole in a wall pizza joint! I was there once and I have to go back! My friend Mike and I were waiting to watch a show and had an hour to kill and we were both really hungry, couldn't decide where to go because restaurants on a Saturday night in SF is super busy most of the time! So we walked by Golden Boy Pizza and the smell from there was AMAZING!!!!!! There is a window you can order from or walk in and sit on their long bar. It is not a fancy place at all, but you will  NOT be disappointed. Their pizza's are small but they hit the spot! They have many choices to choose from, so the size of the pizza is just perfect, this way you won't feel guilty for eating couple of 4 slices! hee hee

I aet a pepperoni with black olives, sausage and mushrooms and a combo! OMG, I wanted to eat MORE, but had to walk away...I enjoyed a Diet Pepsi but if you like beer, they have plenty of beer on tab and bottles. 

The service was great, friendly people.

PLEASE if you are in San Francisco, check this place out!
author: Samira A.

description:
Yuuuuuuge Golden Boy fan as my  Jersey crowd likes to say. I made my way here after sampling some delectable beers at the Rogue bar right down the street. Tony's, another SF pizza tradition, was closed and there Golden Boy was welcoming me with open arms.

Upon walking there, I noticed a drunk fool, only a couple stores before GB, inhaling a greased up mouth-watering delight. The taste buds were fully warmed up at this point, so, I made my way to the 5-6 person line on the sidewalk. The combo was the pizza of choice at the time, although the lady said pepperoni and cheese were warming up in the oven, but the medley of toppings and the fact I would have to wait a mere 2 minutes made my decision rather easy.

Wow, if you like sicilian pizza, a.k.a square pies, then Golden Boy is a place on your bucket list. I'm actually writing this review the next day and my hands are still so greasy that my keyboard is indeed a well-oiled machine. Optimal balance of meat toppings (pepperoni/sausage) and veggie toppings (peppers, onions, tomatoes).

I love the fact that you order right from the street and never even had to make my way inside the join, where you almost get that street cart vibe. However, Golden Boy will not be closed up like any of those vendors for a long, long time.
author: Chas W.

description: Square pizza slices are so much fun!  And especially at $3 for pure deliciousness in North Beach .. just across from the wine bar this place is perfecto. I dig it and will definitely be back to try the other pizzas.. only got cheese last week. step 1.
author: Melody T.

description:
Even though I can only speak for pepperoni, because that's always what I get here, it is sooo good. This is the kind of pizza that really hits the spot-thick deep dish style square slices. 

Of course it's greasy, but hey it's pizza-it's supposed to be! Always a great place to come grab a beer and a slice. They don't have a huge selection of different toppings, but enough to satisfy. 

One thing I love here, is their menu on the wall filled with funny little quotes and stuff-gives the place personality. The guys that work here are really nice too, definitely recommend it!
author: Andrea K.

description: Cheese, peperoni, combo, veggie pesto or clam and garlic. They're all tasty.
author: Merri K.

description:
It's been a couple months since I last went to Golden Boy, but I still remember the experience fondly. I'd been out with some friends at House of Shields, when we decided to embark on a journey to find some delicious and relatively cheap food. Golden Boy was a total win. We took a walk -- It was only a mile but I do not recommend doing it in high-heeled boots -- and were there in minutes. The line formed out the door, but we were able to split up so a few of us could grab seats for everyone while the rest waited to order. For five people, we ended up getting a cheese Sicilian sheet pizza and a pitcher of beer. Per person I don't remember exactly how much it rang to but I remember thinking, "Wow, that's awesome." Crunchy crust, chewy melted cheese, and spices such as basil and oregano, along with a tangy sauce, made this pizza stick in my mind as one I'll revisit again, for sure. Everyone was happy and full, and we even had leftovers to give to the homeless on our walk back to SOMA. 

The Verdict: Quick, cheap, and delicious with good beer to boot. Some of the best pizza I've tried in Bay Area.
author: Cara S.

description: I stumbled, I mean walked into this place and wanted some food. I didn't realize I was about to experience a foodgasm!! I was in the mood for out of the ordinary pepperoni and cheese so I order a clams and garlic slice. OMG! it was sooo deliciously good! I did take some garlic off my slice cause it was a little overwhelming but definitely worth it. It didn't bother me at all. I will for sure come back for more...
author: Carla F.

description:
Pizza comes in 3 categories
Italian
Sicilian
Italian american... which is Golden Boy.

You won't find this in Italy or Sicily and you also won't find it in generic-ized America. You find this shit only in parts of NJ, Brooklyn and North Beach and other places knee deep in Cosa Nostra

F**king Righteous Scilian Foccacia Pizza!! Eat only 2 slices and call it....  any more than that and you are a wasted douche who shouldn't be writing reviews on anything (even the sex you claim you had),
author: Nik D.

description:
Golden Boy pizza is truly O R G A S M I C . 

i don't usually eat pizza when I'm sober, but I get excited thinking about Golden Boy. And it's a guilt-ridden exception that I shamelessly make every now and then. It's loooove, and I never fake it!
author: Deanna T.

description:
I haven't written a Yelp review in about two years. Now that I'm living in San Francisco, I think I need to get back into the swing of things. So let's start with Golden Boy Pizza. It's just good. It's thick, it's cheesy, it's greasy. It's pretty much everything you need it to be.
