Its a small place and gets crowded, so you might be eating in the cold, but it's so warm and delicious, you won't even care.

GO NOW!
author: Allison A.

description: Love this place. Order your slice(s) and go sit or get your slices to go. The quality is reflected in its popularity; the joint is always hoppin'. Don't be afraid to try the clam pizza if you don't mind garlic or the hemp ale if you love beer. ;) The bar stickers are always amusing too.
author: Lucca W.

description:
I work in the financial district, and regularly walk over to Golden Boy Pizza on my lunch break.

I'm a pretty lazy person, and have a hard time motivating to leave my hood to eat lunch. But it's good enough pizza to drag my lazy ass there on my lunch break.

I've been making the trek out to Golden Boy for about 10 years now and I still think it's totally worth it.

Is it the best piece of pizza in town? No way. But is there a 50% chance you'll hear a Slayer song while you're eating pizza there? Absolutely.
author: Zach C.

description: I just love the menu board. Take a minute and read all the little messages on it. It's a crack up. The Garlic/Clam pizza is awesome, crispy, slightly burnt bottom on the crust, just the way I like it. The place is tiny, and packed for a reason.
author: Yolo C.

description: love coming here at the end of the night!! Try to come around 1 because the line gets long! My favorite choice is the one with the clams. The slices are toasted and are fairly priced!
author: Lisa N.

description: So good! It's pretty rare to find pizza this delicious in slice form. The crust is definitely the best part (and I'm usually a thin crust fan). I only wish there were more seating inside...and an east bay location!
author: Erica S.

description:
came here around 10:30pm after a short
bar crawl in north beach.

the pesto vegetarian was super duper. the
pizza is sitting in the window but somehow
when they bring it to you it tastes like they
just baked it. the bottom of the crust is crispy,
the top is fluffy and full of toppings. yum.

four bucks for a 5"x5" square of the good stuff.

respect for the girls here who keep it friendly
even when it gets crowded with rowdy bros!
author: Shawn C.

description: Super convenient when you do not feel like waiting for a slice of pizza. There is often a moderate line outside during late hours on the weekend but overall a fantastic place for a grab and go meal. Not to mention, the pizza is fantastic! :)
author: Maria D.

description:
Probably not the best pizza I have ever had but one of the best. I give it 5 stars for the overall greatness of this place. They are open late and you got to get there before 2am to get some pizza. 

Great for after the club or mid-day. Beer on tap is usually great and the prices are perfect. Pizza is da bomb bay. I wish I lived closer so I could go more often. Oh and the ambiance is killer with a big flat screen with sports on and a swag picture of Christopher Walken on the wall lookin bad ass.
author: Samuel B.

description:
OVERALL:3.8   FOOD:4   SERVICE:4   AMBIANCE:3   VALUE:4
I'd take Neapolitan over this softer, breadier Sicilian-style any day, but Golden Boy still scores high based on rich flavors, generous toppings, and freshness.  Might have to brave the drunken masses (even at lunch), but these square slices are a solid option for a quick bite @ $3+/- apiece.  Also tap beer & fun bartenders if you're down for the sit-down version.

High popularity + foot traffic = constant stream of fresh-baked pies.
Slices are popped in the oven when ordered and served piping fresh.
Scarce bar seating, so get a box, a wad of napkins, and head to Washington Sq for a cheesy, saucy picnic!  Try the Pesto Vegetarian!
author: Amy K.

description: Okay pizza great punk rock graffitti atmosphere SUPER SMALL
author: Hellbilly M.

description: Another great spot for pizza besides Tony's Pizza. The only 2 places I recommend. This place is good for late nights and when you had a few drinks.
author: Lady L.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco.

The slices are big, thick crust, and cheesy. I'm a huge fan. I generally get cheese but I've had the pesto vegetarian as well and it was just as satisfying. It's a little expensive - $3 for a slice of cheese - but worth it. Be warned: late at night this place is packed!
author: Jeanette L.

description: Typical post-bar drunk food. Nothing special here. In fact, I'm pretty sure I've had better pizza down the street at any of the other NB establishments. Wait is long and pricey for what it is.
author: Ruth H.

description:
Best Pizza Ever. 
A splendid square slice of veggie pizza. The pesto, and tomato, veggies yum! 
small place with bar stools and friendly staff. Every time I go to SF I make it to Golden Boy and hope that I can make it another 6 months till the next slice.
author: jeri s.

description:
Pretty sure we just weren't drunk enough to really enjoy this pizza but it's decent. 

-Liked the square slices wrapped in paper for easy eating.
-Open LATE!
-Good crust.
author: Tysen C.

description: Perfect little rectangles of delicious cheesy and tomato-y goodness. It hits the spot when there's nothing else. Its perfect late at night. Its satisfying when seriously hungry and can't fathom cooking! The pesto vegetable slice is the best.
author: Janel A.

description: A friend of mine who lived in SF for a few years recommended this place to me because I am a big pizza fan. I don't know, but I must have come on a bad day because the pizza wasn't good at all. I mean it wasn't horrible, but it wasn't the "best-pizza-I-ever-had" like I had expected. To be honest, the pizza was comparable to pizza hut. Maybe it's one of those places to eat at in the middle of the night coming back plastered from a bar thinking this is the greatest food ever invented at the time. I can see that.
author: Ron B.

description: I've eaten a lot of pizza in my day, but Golden Boy is the best in my opinion. The crust is crunchy, the toppings are tasty and fresh, and I like the square shape. My favorite is the Clam and Garlic. It is soooooooo good. Never had Clam and Garlic pizza anywhere else. Whenever I get the chance, I come here for it. I also really like their combo pizza, they put zucchini on it which I love! They put on just enough sauce rather than slathering it like some places do, so you can still taste all the toppings. Their prices are pretty reasonable too. The inside is fairly small so its def more of a take out place. The only downside in my opinion is that even late at night there is often a huge line. Takes a while to move through it too but to me the wait is worth it. Just don't expect to stop by to quickly grab a slice because there is nearly always a wait. Its great they are open late too, it makes a perfect snack after a night out. Golden Boy certainly knows how to do pizza right!
author: Erica M.

description:
Another homerun for a great pizza spot! I walked around the north beach area not sure which of the plenty of pizza spots I should check out and I remembered golden boy being one of the suggestions I've heard from friends. 

I went in, ordered one of the combo slices, got a speak easy prohibition and enjoyed my delicious dinner. So glad this place is a short walk from my apt. I will def be back for more. 

I was actually surprised about how crowded it was on a Tuesday night there. There was a line about 10 people at one point waiting for a slice.
author: omid a.

description:
Great delicious pizza with fresh gradients.

Dammnit I have been missing out on golden boy! This is seriously one of the best pizza ive ever had......

3 Dollars slice, to have the pizza melts in your mouth! The pizza comes in Cheese, Pepperoni or Sausage, pesto, garlic clam, and combinational.
 
Drunken munchies, here I come!
author: terence t.

description:
I came here for a slice of pizza with husband and his buddy per a recommendation. We all had the combo slices.

The place was packed and dark inside. Definitely NOT a place you want to have the pizza at. Fortunately, it was a beautiful day outside, so we took the pizza to the nearest park and gulfed it out.

The pizza was delicious. The zucchinis were a good addition. Very flavorful. Will definitely come here again.
author: Dee Y.

description:
I arrived to the area, planning to meet friends at Dell'Uva - the wine bar across the street on Green. But when I parked my bike, and smelled the wafting smell of oregano and sausage coming out of the window, I had to go check it out.

They have an everything or "combo" square slice of Siclian, that along with a beer was a perfect snack. 

I have to tell you - this was a great 1-2 punch. And while you pay almost $9 for a beer and a "square" (instead of a slice), it still makes my mouth water a little, which means that I will have to go back.

This may be one of the best "slices" (or squares) of pizza in the city!
author: Rick V.

description: Delicious pizza! And the smell is just as good. Great for a late night meal or for a slice for dinner or whenever! I vote best pizza in SF
author: Sonia S.

description:
the large display case of pizza in the window taunts passerby's with sheets of sicilian pizza just minding its own business, looking delicious... cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, supreme, pesto.

the bottoms of those tasty squares are crispy and the inside is doughy and warm.  the sauce-to-cheese ratio is fantastic and the toppings are generous.

- order a slice or two (one veggie, one pepperoni, please)
- grab a beer (whatever IPA they have on tap)
- sit down and enjoy (don't talk to me, i'm eating)

it's cash only and this establishment also does not appear to be wheelchair friendly as the aisle is quite narrow, but since the staff is super nice, i bet they would do whatever they could to accommodate.

if you stay to enjoy your food, read their menu board... you might find a few funny notes and messages scattered about.
author: Lauren P.

description: Cheese vs. Pesto- the vegetarian pizza battle. Thankfully, Golden Boy has perfected both so no need to fret, just come prepared to enjoy a little slice of heaven.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
I don't usually like very cheezy pizza, but maybe I was just hungry, because the slice of cheese and slice of clam/garlic disappeared within 3 minutes.  

For $3.75, I thought the slice is just average in size, but I'll be back for the clam/garlic!
author: daphne w.

description: My first go-to pizza place in the city. Golden Boy is the bomb.com! Service is always friendly & fast. It's usually pretty nice and quiet during the day time, and can be pretty hectic at night. Everyone's drunk & stoned which is fine. Pizza is very good, has never failed me!
author: Diamond B.

description:
It was the hottest day of summer by far. The high in the City was estimated to be 91 freaking degrees, a definite difference from the typical foggy SF day. My friend and I decided to do the Land's End Hike which left us exhausted, thirsty, hungry and ten shades darker than when we came. 

With our new sexy sports bra tan lines, we found our way across the city to Golden Boy pizza where we both ordered a chilled glass of Hef and a toasty slice of their combo pizza. What a way to top off our afternoon. The Pizza was just the right amount of crispy and the toppings added just the right amount of flavor. In those 20 minutes that I savored my delectable slice of pizza with my refreshing beer, I was in heaven. 

I'm pretty sure I wasn't in some sort of delusion from dehydration, but Golden Boy Pizza was definitely a "come back and have a great time" sort of pizza bar. I'll be back to try their veggie and clam pizza. Except maybe I'll come back when I'm not burned out from the sun.

PS. They're CASH ONLY
author: Charlene S.

description:
The clam and garlic pizza is amazing.  Indeed, the crust is crunchy, yet thick enough to hold the generous toppings.  One thing that was a initially bit off-putting (at least visually) were these crunchy flower-like things that were all over my pizza slice . . . 

After my first bite, I realized that they were simply sprigs of curly parsley.  Curly parsley?  Usually, aside from being the de riguer garnish next to your burger and fries at your local diner, you don't see too much of it.  Definitely not within the food itself.  As for its taste, I remember having chewing on springs of curly parsley on one or two occasions after being told its wondrous breath cleansing properties.  Bleeech, I remember my then-teenage palette reacting . . . 

In any case, to this day, I wouldn't eat it on purpose . . . but now that it was baked into my pizza, I was sorta forced to do so (I'm not a fan of people who pick at food, so I would never do that myself).  And the verdict?  

Surprisingly delicious.

Now, yes, the parsley was on the darker side of well-done (having been popped into an oven for a couple minutes before being served) , but tasting it did add a bit of . . . something (I was going to sound counterpoint, but we're talking about pizza here and . . . well . . . I couldn't think of a less pretentious sounding alternative) that balances out the overpowering garlic slices (lovely) and clams.  With limited char on the actual pizza crust itself, the bolus that I ended up with in my mouth (yeah, I know, such a sexy and not-at-all-disgusting term) brought up pleasant memories of eating great wood-fire oven pizzas.  Without a hit to the the pocketbook.  Or the fifteeen-minute wait.

They seemed to have a lovely selection of beers on tap -- but after a night of partying for New Year's Eve, I wasn't too eager to drink, just yet . . . 

Great pizza, though.  And definitely a great way to start 2010!
author: Robert M.

description:
as we all know, pizz joints in SF are VERY hit or miss

Golden Boy has killer pizza, some decent beers on tap, and as most spots in that hood, they are cool with the occasional dog hanging out... (c.c. has a hayday there eating the sausages off the floor!)
author: mar m.

description:
Ladies and gentleman, its 30 seconds into the first round of the fight, and boy is it epic! The Golden Boy Pizza vs. All its competitors. It's a tough fight, but Golden Boy's quick service, distinct taste and ability to save you a buck a two has the upper hand. Uh oh! Here comes the Pizza Orgazmica chain.. a nice jab, but not enough to do damage. Tony's around the corner tries to slip a hook, not fast enough to make any impact. 'Mr.Dominohutman' a special haymaker by three popular chains attempts to change the pace of the game, too oily and they take an embarrasing spill. The Golden Boy takes a step back, taunts the competion and a quick hook! K.O. 

Still undefeated, still the champ
author: Sani S.

description:
I'm not a big fan of deep dish, but Golden Boy's is still legit! The crust is still extra crispy, especially if you order by the slice. It's always pretty packed in here with people coming and going, but it doesn't disappoint. It's also located on Green St. which is the Italian food jackpot of The City, so come hungry!

This place has a cool old school vibe with a diner-like theme. The employees are nice, laid back people. You can order by the slice or a whole sheet with 16 slices! We ordered a sheet of half pepperoni and half cheese and it came out to around $40. Kinda pricey but it filled all 10 of us perfectly. I love the use of the fork and knives cause it keeps everything nice and clean. I'm coming back soon for another slice f'sho!
author: Dennis C.

description:
Meh.

Thats how this place made me feel. Meh. It was pizza. Ingredients were there. It was edible. Someone told me i HAD to try this place when I was around. And I did, but I guess maybe I wasnt drunk enough truly enjoy it? I dunno. I guess I have my favorite pizza place and I make all comparisons to them.

Sorry guys. You were just...Meh.

Ok I just noticed theres actually a "Meh" rating. I dont feel it was 2 stars though, so Im not going there.

***Edit*** 

Ok so The pepperoni is really good. The time I was writing my review I had only had the combo. I guess here, less is more. Ask for the edge or corner pieces. The crispy cheese that builds up around the edges is super delicious.

Oh. And dont sit down until you order. Or you will get yelled at. The memo must have got lost in the mail and I wasnt aware.
author: Alfredo R.

description: Great fresh slices and a pint  what else do u need.
author: Chris D.

description:
THIS PIZZA WAS EITHER REALLY GOOD OR I WAS REALLY DRUNK AND HUNGRY!!!

... naw, it was pretty good. you can smell it in the streets and they display it in the window, like a pet store displays new born kittens or puppies, so you are sold as soon as you walk by... its cut from a square pan and is full of awesomeness!!! honestly, i want to start drinking in bars that are in walkable distance from golden boy pizza... a must stop on your way home from a night of boozin
author: Nic M.

description: This place is so delicious!!!! I was doing a bar crawl with a group of friends and we were getting closer to our end destination when we came upon this glorious pizza place. The line was a little long but I could see why after I was given my pizza square; it was warm, toasty and the toppings were perfect. I don't remember what I chose but I was very happy with it! One of my friends bought the clam pizza, wish I would have bought that one, it's super bomb!!! No really, if you like clams, you should get that one! He liked it so much he bought 2!!!  I can not wait for my next trip to Golden Boy PIzza, they are truly golden!
author: Constance D.

description: I decided to tough the traffic and any parking issues to try Golden Boy Pizza because of the reviews and the photos. I ended up ordering a pepperoni, sausage, and combo. In all honesty, there's nothing too special about the pepperoni or sausage. The combo was good, but not worth the trip. Price is kinda pricey. Not cheesy enough for my taste.
author: Richard B.

description:
This is possibly the best "by the slice" pizza in town and my new North Beach addiction.

20 years ago when I worked downtown there was a pizza place on Kearny, it was a walk up window really, that made big square pizzas in a big pan and sliced it in square pieces. I can't remember the name of the place and it's long gone but they had awesome pizza.

I don't know what it is about square pizza that's so good but but this place usually has a line out the door. 

Golden Boy pizza is honestly worth traveling to North Beach for, and I haven't tried their famous clam and garlic yet.

Try to get a corner piece, or at least an edge.
author: Manny F.

description: Super good pizza!!! It's a little hidden spot, but super good! Cash only- ATM in the back :)
author: Kelsey L.

description: Three stars because pizza was already made and sitting in the window.  More of a fast food atmosphere and not really suitable for families or groups of more than 2 people due to bar stool seating only.  Pizza was just ok and nothing over the top.
author: Ripcurl A.

description:
Let me preface this by saying first and foremost - the best slice in America is in NYC period (I won't say the world, because Italy takes the cake of course).

On a recent vacation, we ventured into North Beach for a street fair of drinking and debauchery.  Drinking leads to rumbling tummies, so when we got to Golden Boy, the line for the window service was at least a 25 minute wait..  Lucky for us, we were smarter than THAT crowd and waited in line at the door for the counter (why no one else in that other line thought of this is beyond my comprehension).  We got our slices in 5 minutes.

Piping hot and oozing with gooey mozzarella cheese fleckled with oreggano, I took my first bite of this delicious concoction.  I'm not one to like a sicilian style pizza, but this baby proved me wrong. SO wrong.  

I couldn't belive how good it was.  It was a party in my mouth.  I was dancing with my pizza in hand, gloating to the other people who were stupid enough to stand at the 25-min wait window line as I scarfed down my delicious pizza.  I'm an ess-hoooole when I drink, But my tastebuds know good pizza.  This is damn good pizza.
author: Thu V.

description:
This is one of San Francisco's hidden gems. If you want a good, hearty, thick Sicilian pizza slice, this is where it's at. It's hidden and off Columbus street; many that come here aren't tourist--it's for those that are in the know! 

Golden Boy offers 'unique' flavorings that isn't your typical mainstream pizzeria. My personal favorite is the clam, spinach, garlic, and pesto (I think? All I know is there's clam and garlic, haha!) but man, it's tasty and you can't go wrong. 

The staff here are usually pretty friendly and chill though there are sometimes they are a bit standoffish and rude. Well, maybe if we didn't go at 11 o'clock at night and the place was packed, they would've been nicer.
author: K. E.

description: This is another place I will go there every time when I go to SF....is next to the seafood place that I mention it before....there pizza dough are so chewing, soft....always long line waiting....MUST try...i love their garlic clam pesto....full of clam on top of it...yummy....
author: Jessie Y.

description:
someone once told me "OMGOMG HAVEYOUHAD GOLDENBOYPIZZA ITS THE BEST PIZZA EVAR I SWER"

ok, so if they have the best pizza, where is it? 

staff is super friendly though. 

pizza isn't bad, it just doesn't stand out, especially at 4$ a slice when the line is down the street. and they're out of clam pizza.
author: Ben T.

description: I didn't spend too much time here as I only picked up a couple of slices to go. I tried the vegetarian pizza. It's really gooood, so smoky, has a perfect crust thickness, and tasty toppings. One of the best pizzas I've ever had.
author: Novalina N.

description: Clam Pizza??? Hell Yeah! This spot slays. My friend & I enjoyed a couple slices of the clam pizza, and 2 of the combos. After a long night of beers and general mayhem this hit the spot!
author: Joey E.

description: BEST DAMN PIZZA IN SAN FRANCISCO PERIOD!!! I dont know what the hell they put in their pizza but its by far the best pizza in SF. The service is great as long as you dont piss them off. If you are visiting SF check this place out
author: Ed G.

description:
This place rocks.
Always the same pizza
Always fresh
Always deep chewy, thick and tasty.

When they have a good thing, they dont change it and havent. Having helped work at another pizza place, I know how touchy they can be at changing the recipe. And they havent for years. And its a good thing as it keeps regulars, tourist and me coming back.

Don't mind the an ugly women being catty and hateful who expect to be daunted on. This is a small and very busy place with great pizza, tasty beer, and very good service. But if it gets busy, you might have to wait in line - thats the price to pay. The "i" in pizza is not solely for you "Miss I" ! Get over yourself.

PS- the same person who served me was very prompt, smiling, and very personable. It was a gorgeous sunny Sunday and I remember that conversation. Who wouldn't wanna be outside that day instead of in-doors - thats called honesty!  I'm still amazed by some people who obviously have never worked in the service industry and think the world revolves around them. I guarantee you "Miss I", sunshine does not shine out your ass, nor should anyone to tell you that it does.
author: Brian F.

description: Ask for the center piece.  I usually come here on the weekends and line is long with drunk a-holes.  Coming during the day is cool too.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
This pizza is sooooo good! It definitely hits the spot after a fun night out drinking with your pals in North Beach. I had a slice of the combo pizza and was in heaven. I beieve my slice was $3.25, which is a good deal for SF.

The only con - the line is ridiculously LONG @ 2 AM.
author: Susana M.

description:
I've been going to Golden Boy Pizza all my life and go there every time I go visit family in the area!!!

My Favorite Pizza!!!
author: Adam C.

description:
i can see how the pizza here would be really good if you're getting it after a night of bars/clubbing/drinking... but then again, pretty much everything is good in that situation

i tried slices of the combination and garlic and clam and it was really salty and just tasted like those frozen supermarket pizzas reheated. im not sure how long my slices has been just sitting out there but the toppings didn't taste fresh at all.

unless you're coming here to satisfy a late night pizza crave and nothing else is open in the area... stick to tony's for pizza!
author: Katherine C.

description: If you're looking for cheap, tasty pizza go here. My sis saw Jay Leno step out of this tiny hole in the wall a while ago. The slices are about $2-4 so if you're not looking to break the bank or fall prey to the tourist traps that surround North Beach, then try Golden Boy. A full sized pizza is a little more pricey but if a slice is what you crave then this is definitely for you. The square sized combination I ordered was probably the size of two. It's the type of pizza slice where a knife and fork are practically mandatory. The staff are friendly and they were blaring some old school 80s hair metal. I grew up on that stuff thanks to my older brother so I couldn't help but reminisce about that. This is more of a place locals visit so if you want to blend in with the SF folk, stop in and have a slice or two.
author: Amy J.

description: Ah, the Sicilian type pizza. A perfectly proofed square of dough, topped with a melange of Sicilian herbs, sauce, cheese, vegetables. The mouthfeel of this pie is kind of like what Spongebob would taste like, being under the sea for so long, soggy on the outside but still holding it's own on the inside, and salty yet with bright flavors. Unfortunately, this isn't for me. Although there is nothing wrong with the pizza, it still reminds me of those from the elementary school cafeteria. If I want a pizza nostalgia trip, I want it to be of that one summer I spent eating pizzas in NY. So, for now, I'll be sticking to the NY pies.
author: Ray C.

description:
Very, very good pizza. 4.5 stars
Their combo slice was one of the best slices I have had in a long time. Sauce and crust close to perfect. (Hints of wine in the sauce?) Cheese not bad. I'd give them 5 stars except that the sausage had too much of a herb (couldn't tell which herb it was -- think it might have been thyme or something similar), which imparted a somewhat medicinal taste. And the restaurant could use some elbow grease -- just doesn't look all that clean.

Will return next time I am in town.
author: Aris F.

description: Between the Yelp reviews and the stomach growling window display of square, cheesy slices of pizza I had such high expectations. We had the following slices; pesto, cheese and pepperoni. I thought the overall flavor was dull and the dough wasn't anything to write home about.. It's just ok pizza in my opinion.
author: Jessica S.

description: The best pizza in San Francisco. Try the pesto vegetarian you won't be disappointed.
author: Christopher D.

description:
was here on sat 4/13/13 and trickled in for a bite after a night filled with festivities.
ordered the combo & it was pretty tasty. 
the line was long but the service is pretty fast.
and we were lucky enough to have a little bit of sidewalk entertainment!
author: Enjoying Each Momen T.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is really really good. I had the Combination jam packed with veggies and meat. It was delicious and extremely filling. Not only does this place have great pizza but they also have good beers on tap! Nothing better than standing at the bar stuffing your face with pizza. 

The place is casual and small but it's not small enough to make you feel crammed. I must mention that although I didn't use the restroom a friend of mine told me it was pretty bad. Other than that I have nothing bad to say about this place. The pizza is great and it's in the perfect location.

This place is definitely going to be my go to pizza place in North Beach.

Eat here!
author: Denise S.

description:
Products: (5 stars) Their pizza is just freaking good. Always served piping hot. Served in square pieces bout the size of your hand.

Selection: (4 stars) kind of minimalistic but it works. No hadn't name signature pizzas, bout 5 varieties if I remember right.

Atmosphere: (5 stars) Classic hole in the wall pizza eatery decor. Good use of space to produce max seating.

Customer Service: (5 stars) Good quick service and hot food served on the fly. Ate there, but they also do to go orders.

Final Thoughts: (5 stars) If your looking for a late night pizza fix look no further. Just good hot pizza.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Introduced by a friend, I am now a fan of Golden Boy Pizza. Sicilian style pan pizza..super delicious.
I've tried the combination and the pesto vegetarian. They have a good selection of beers, on tap or bottle. 
Definitely a must try if you're even in North Beach/Telegraph Hill area or whenever you crave for pizza.
author: Mika D.

description: We found this place in Little Italy the other day after having it recommended by a friend.  The garlic pizza was great, as was the simple solo-cheese topped slice.  The dough was fluffy and airy, which was definitely a positive departure from your typical pizza places.  The overall atmosphere was somewhat touristy, but that was expected and did not detract from the pizza.  I imagine that it could get quite busy, so plan accordingly or prepare to wait a bit, especially if you wanted to eat inside.
author: Justin G.

description:
Taking a break from a city-wide party/event, a friend convinced me this is the place to get a fast bite of deliciousness. I was wary, as I'm a New York style loyalist, and these pizzas just seemed pretty generic looking. 


Don't be fooled! A slice of pizza from this place is pizza joy. I think it has something to do with the cheese. They use lots of it. And it's delicious. I had to double back after I was finished to get another slice-even tho I wasn't hungry.

I wonder if they deliver. And I wonder if they'd consider delivering to Austin.
author: Steve A.

description: This is my boyfriend's go-to place for pizza since he lives in North Beach. Boy do I envy him, cuz they sure know how to do pizza right at Golden Boy's! I think I've had every one of their slices and I have no complaints whatsoever! Great toppings on buttery, airy focaccia (such a genius combo)!
author: Caralisa L.

description: I don't understand how this place isn't a chain by now. Their awesome and unique tastking pizza is worth a trip to NB within itself. Try and go during the day, otherwise you will be there with tons of drunk people at 130 in the morning...
author: Jim B.

description:
After reading all the great yelp review, I made Golden Boy my last stop for this SF visit. After going up and down slopes & circling around for a good 10 minutes, I  finally found parking & got to the restaurant by 10:30pm. 

I wasn't really hungry, but wanted to give this place a shot and see if they were all that amazing. As I pedaled to the store, the front glass window had a very tempting display of all the Sicilian style pan pizza. To my surprise, I had this sudden  urge of hunger/cravings. I guess visual displays does work its own charm

I quickly placed my order on the garlic clam as I only saw 3 slices left. This was the highly reviewed/raved  topping and I would've been totally bummed if I wasn't able to give this a try. Although the garlic clam was the only one I had in mind, I couldn't resist ordering another slice of the combination. The friendly waitress scooped up the two slice and tossed it back to the oven for a quick bake for crispness. 

The pizza came out perfect. IT was warm and the crust was very crispy. The cheese was nice and all toppings were bubbling with the fresh out of oven look. I immediately dug my fork/knife into the slice of heavenly goodness. First thought in mind was.."wow this is quite garlicky".  The greatest difference I felt about the Sicilian styled pizza vs typical american pizza chain store were that the crust is thick/crispy but not greasy at all. The tomato spread is rather light and does not carry that strong tomato paste taste. The layer of cheese was thin and isn't loaded with the typical chewy/stretchiness. Toppings were very generous as mine was just smothered with garlic/herbs and a hint of clam. I'm honestly a chicago style pizza fan and loves anything with thick buttery crust and loads of cheese. I would say that I still steer towards BJs' chicago style pizza and Pizza Huts Pan pizza. If not then I love the classic Italian at "Bollinis" over in LA. 

However, this was overall a good slice of pizza that would definitely be satisfying when you crave that hot fresh pizza with a thick/crispy crust. Service was fast. Pizza would be ready in 5 minutes and an order of beer would be paired pefectly for a late hang out with friends. Place is very cramp but with a fair amount of seat. It was rather pricey for a small rectangular slice at $3.75 but would be well worth it when you're craving some good pizza on the go.
author: Susan T.

description:
This place has awesome pizza! It's by far my favorite slice in town.

The slices are thick, square, and packed with flavor. The combos are the best, as they offer a good mixture of veggies and meat.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is a little dreary for me. It feels more like bar: dirty, dark, with loud and rocking music.

There is a high likelihood that the person taking the orders is a cutie, but that doesn't affect the pizza flavor.
author: Nik D.

description:
Ok there's pizza and there's pizza!  You've heard of the pizza and sex metaphor? Well it is somewhat true...sometimes any pizza is good and satisfying, but life is too short to eat average pizza!  Golden Boy is not average pizza...it's delicious...if you love thicker crust, square cut like you can get on the streets in Italy.  I love all kinds of pizza and cannot say which is the best, otherwise that would be like picking one wine.  For this style, it is the best in the city! 
See my other reviews for other types...
author: Susanna S.

description: Best. Pizza. Ever.  Been coming here for 15 years and have never been disappointed.  I love this place more than some family members.
author: Valerie B.

description:
Perhaps you need to be drunk to enjoy the pizza here. You know the frozen pizzas you get from the grocery store and put in the microwave? That's what this pizza tasted like, but twice as greasy.

Not sure why everyone likes this place so much.
author: Brooks S.

description:
BEST cheap pizza in SF hands down. It's Sicilian style so the slices comes in squares. I always request an edge slice because I'm an edge whore. This place is also a late night spot perfect for drunken hunger.

A slice of pepperoni runs you around $3. Anything fancier than that might cost you an extra .50 cents. Whenever out of town guests come to town this is definitely one of the spots I take them to and it never disappoints. This place has a lot of personality and the service is efficient and friendly. You can also order pitchers of beer which is a double whammy. Delicious pizza and pitcher beer is the best!
author: David C.

description:
Ultimate fantasy:

When the big quake hits, I will happen to be enjoying a slice at Golden Boy. Coincidentally, Mila Jovavitch and Nicole Kidman will be eating there as well. The counter person and cook happened to have stepped out briefly.

Then-quake. I am trapped inside for two glorious weeks with Nicole and Mila. As rescue workers frantically try to rescue us, Nicole, Mila and myself will survive making delicious pizzas and sweet, sweet love.

But seriously and logically, this place may be my most favorite place I have ever eaten. I groan in ecstasy with each bite and, taste per dollar, it's the greatest meal value in the U.S.

Dammit, I love this place. it's what NY sicilian style is all about and even just a tiny bit better. There, I admitted it. It's my favorite pizza place ever.
author: Robert V.

description: Best Sicilian Pizza I've ever had.  Good slices on the cheap.  You'll find this place packed on weekend nights.
author: Robert B.

description: We stopped by this place after kicking around China Town for a few hours.  It didn't disappoint!  We tried the pesto veggie, meat and veggie combo and the clam and garlic.  Wow!  All three were good, but the clam and garlic was amazing!  It's definitely worth making your way to North Beach for.  We'll be back next time we're visiting SF!
author: Rebekah W.

description:
4.5 stars

I've only tried two places so far (this and Goat Hill) and this is my favorite of the two but only by a little.  The 3 most important parts of a pizza are the:  crust/doug, sauce, and ingredients.  The ingredients were very fresh and you could taste everything in each bite.  The sauce was very very good!  The crust on the other hand was well . . . there wasn't any.  This is a square styled Sicilian pizza.  I'm not feeling that because I like the Neopolitan style better but regardless of my preference, this place was top notch.

Still looking for a NY "quality" pizza . . .
author: Sean Y.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is about the best that it gets for me.  This pizza has a nice fairly thin crust yet strong enough to hold up all the topping that are quite thick.  My fav is the Calm and Garlic.  It's just loaded with flavor and all ingredients are fresh and plentiful.  Great also, is their on tap beer selection as you enjoy this succulent pie.

This should be a once a week deal for me to visit but haven't been in a few weeks.  Looks like I need to plan a trip to North Beach soon.
author: Louis E.

description: Mmm!!!!! Love their pizzas! My fav(s): pepperoni and combo! It's a great place for a midnight snack!
author: Sharon G.

description:
I thought it was aiiiiite. After a night of bar hopping around the city, we decided to end the night in North Beach since one of our friends lived in the area. 

I only got the pizza so I can say I've had the pizza so I wasn't excited, but the pizza wasn't gross so I was satisfied. I like how the crust was soft and the toppings were good on the combo slice.
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
I can't say I'm a fan. I can see the draw when your drunk and wanting something greasy. But this just doesn't scream pizza to me...but then again I'm partial to the huge floppy (snicker) slices ala NY pizza.

I find that the crust is too greasy...and they are kinda sparce on the toppings. I like my pizzas loaded.
author: David H.

description: Awesome pizza by the slice. Just walk up and point out the slice you want.  They warm it in the oven and its just perfect.  Nice big square slices!  I tried the garlic/clam pizza and my friend had plain cheese - both were so good.  One of the best tasting pizzas I've ever had!
author: Carolyn P.

description:
drunk or sober, sleepy or awake, golden boy pizza is the shit. after a night of crazy partying i will stop here, eat a slice, sober up and then walk home. on a sunny afternoon i will grab a slice and eat it in the park. when friends are in town i will take them here. 

my personal favorite is the combination. pepperoni is a bit too greasy for my tastes. even though the clam and garlic pizza is delicious, i shy away from it because it has the worst aftertaste and you burp up garlic-infused air for the next 6 hours. no thank you.
author: Melody C.

description:
Yum! Pesto Vegetarian hits the spot...its the only thing I get here so that says a lot. I love how they're open really late but if you dont want to wait in line with a bunch of drunk people on Friday/Saturday nights then I would not suggest coming here.

The pizza is great though and I love how thick the dough is. Reminds me a lot of foccacia and I am such a sucker for some nice toasty italian dough. Slice @ $3.25 is kind of expensive but its still a great eating experience!
author: Shiela D.

description: The pizza was fine, but not worth the wait. There's a lot more pizzas in San Francisco that are way better
author: Luis C.

description:
Best. Pizza. Ever.

Okay in making this statement I fully realize that beauty is in the eye of the beholder.  Some love NY pizza, others love Chicago, and the list goes on.  I am a NY style lover to be sure.  Deep dish is not my thing at all.  But Golden Boy- oh how I do love a late night slice of your pizza!

After a night out (usually with copious amounts of alcohol involved) there is nothing better than a piping hot square of Golden Boy.

It is thicker than NY style, but with similar flavors and grease levels.  They bake the pizza on huge rectangular sheets, which means you get retangular/square slices.

I just can't begin to tell you how delicious this pizza really is.  Only pizza I ever liked better was in Italy.  Seriously, you must try this pizza.
author: Karey G.

description: Golden ticket: Golden Boy Pizza!  I'm always a fan of Dive places, and this one is the crowning glory of pizza joints... The line out front is a good indicator of what's to come. Step up to the cashier to order any one of their amazing choices(I prefer the clam). While u wait, enjoy a cold draft beer at th
author: Alisa F.

description:
What I love about food---really great food--is that it reminds that what we left behind is not, in fact, behind us. 

This place did that for me. The garlic/clam pizza reminded me of Pete's Pizza in DC and the various hole in the wall places up and down the East Coast that serve clam pizza. 

Californians rarely get clam pizza right--this place does.

I also loved the veggie slice with the pesto. Ambience is great. Tattoos are required to enter the place, or so it seems. I do not have any but I still felt welcome. Another bonus. 

Not sure why I am docking a star. I guess I wanted the rude attitude that comes with East Coast pizza joints. This place, thankfully, lacked that.
author: George J.

description: Strolled over after midnight on New Years and decided to wait in line for a piece of pizza. About 45 minutes. Definitely worth the wait. Excellent! One of best I ever had hands down and I've eaten some great pizza.  Ordered the sausage but will try the clam next time. Can't wait to go back.
author: Don P.

description: After hearing my boyfriend talk about this place for years, we finally stopped by on a Monday night.   Well, he was right.  It was great.  We both had the combo slice and a draft beer.  The huge square slice was yummy with perfect tangy sauce and lots of toppings.   It was a quick andeasy stop by, friendly staff., and great music.. I will be coming back for more whenever i visit San Fran.
author: Heidi S.

description:
I have to start off by saying I'm not much of a pizza fan. In fact, I can't stand the thought of pizza most of the time. However, I came across this place a while ago on a game night. Lakers! Whoop whoop! Anyway, it was kind of late night, didn't feel like going into an overpriced restaurant when I'd rather be watching the game. The pizza there is actually REALLY good. Finger lickin' good! I had the pesto vegetarian. Bomb! 

If you're looking to just chill, hang out, have a slice or two and enjoy a beer, this is the spot. Chill spot for game nights at least!
author: MJ T.

description:
I was starving after work and a friend had mentioned Golden Boy Pizza.  I tried the veggie pesto slice.  Yummy!  Glorious strands of oozing cheese, perfect crust with the right amount of crunch and chewiness, and spectacular flavor.  

I took my order to go because it was quite crowded; a testament to the quality and popularity of the establishment.  I'll definitely come again!
author: Robert M.

description: I am from Chicago, owned several different restaurants, managed large scale food & music operations and can undoubtedly say that  GOLDEN BOY is my favorite pizza joint. Its truly amazing pie. I bring every visiting friend there and everyone loves it every time. It is an Italian family run operation, I believe third generation. The 2 brothers who run it are very cool, nice guys. They play the best music and the staff is always on their game..quick friendly and crank it out.  All their slices are incredible but my favorite is cheeze and sausage. I believe they get the fennel sausage from Chicago...super fresh.... their slices melt in your mouth. Don't get discouraged if there is a line out the door.. it moves quickly and is well worth the wait.
author: John L.

description: The best pizza I have ever had, South Beach is known for its bars....but  this pizza is unreal
author: james w.

description: Mmm, yum. To be honest, the pizza was good, and fun in it's square-like shape, but it's not the best pizza I've had. Maybe I should have tried a flavor other than pepperoni? Cash only.
author: Melody L.

description:
Pizza. Oh, pizza.

While I love pizza and am convinced that there's no real way one could mess it up, there is a real way one could make it soooooo good. And Golden Boy Pizza does make it soooooo good (imagine me pumping my hips rhythmically while you read that).

There sizable squares of gooey cheese and crispy crust take me straight to heaven. Seriously, you have got to try Golden Boy Pizza if you want to meet me there!
author: Judy F.

description:
I was seriously craving pizza one day (I blame google reader for sending me all these links to delicious food reviews and pics), but I was also super lazy and did not want to walk far (that I blame all on the awesome & cheap drinks from North Star Cafe the previous night).  So I dragged Laura along with me to check out Golden Boy. 

There was barely a line since we were sniffing around at 6p.  Most of the inside sitting was filled, but was able to squeeze into a corner.  

I ordered two slices: pepperoni was just awesomeness: love the sauce, gooey cheese, & chewy focaccia bottom.  Clam & garlic was strong in the garlic so don't eat if you're gonna be hanging with people right after, it was also a bit too juicy for me and by the end of the slice it was pretty soggy, though Laura who also got the clam&garlic said her piece wasn't sweating as much as mine was, so maybe it's all in the location of the slice.

Overall fantastic meal, came out stuffed, a fountain drink + 2 slices was under $10.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Pretty good pizza if you're on the go. Line was long, cash only. Stopped here before Beach Blanket Babylon show. Service - HORRIBLE. The blond cashier girl with glasses is a douchelord. Many reviews say that so I'm not sure why she hasn't been replaced?? Bye Felicia.
author: Melissa M.

description: Cheap square pizza. Loved my cheese slice. The ambiance is really cool - so many random stickers and whatnots while you chow down on your slice of yumminess. I think it's the perfect beer + quick pizza-by-the-slice joint around!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Sicilian Style Pan Pizza. WTF! Cheese, Combination, Vegetarian, Pesto Vegetarian, Pepperoni and 2 root beers...bombay combination.And yes, that can be in one sitting if you pack it all in right.

Dont wait for window service. Go through the door, smell what you're about to scarf, listen to some Mac Dre and straight real Bay Area hip hop and tip the people inside what's due. 'nuff said.
author: Nick V.

description: The clam and garlic was definitely delicious, but overall, I'd prefer going to Marcello's for a slice of Sicilian if convenience/proximity were not an issue.
author: Jenn C.

description: Uhhh yup. Nuff said. The original and the best. Be nice to the counter girl/guy and don't forget to tip.
author: David K.

description:
I was hungry after walking 4 hills cause we parked really far. It's hard to find parking there! I tihnk we spent almost an hr finding parking. Well, that's SF for you! 
I think I had their combination pizza, and it was okay. It did taste different than your ordinary pizza. This place is small, but lines get long! There's always a line outside the door. It was a nice place to chill and I liked their music that night. I'll try another kind some other time.
author: Jenny L.

description:
We live in North Beach and have tried the other pizza establishments - North Beach Pizza, Tony's, and Tomasso's. We find ourselves at Golden Boy more often because it is delicious and much cheaper than the others. One slice of pizza here (about $4) is usually enough for me.

While you have to wait in line outside some times, it's never usually too crowded on the inside, so it's easy to sit down and have a beer along with your pizza.
author: Amy K.

description:
Drunk. Hot. Sticky. Firm. Crust. In a dive bar.
The best pizza in San Francisco. 



*Not advisable for those on Weight Watchers or other calorie restricted diets.
author: Angie O.

description:
Every time I go here I am convinced I am eating the best pizza ever.

I'm pretty sure I'd still think that about Golden Boy if I weren't intoxicated at each visit, but we'll have to see.  It's hard to get me to North Beach sober.
author: Emily P.

description: Mediocre pizza.  I guess that thick crust, greasy pizza just isn't my scene.  I got a cheese slice, and it was rather bland.  There wasn't much personality or flavor, and the crust was REALLY thick.  The service was friendly, and it would be a chill place to grab a beer.  However, I wouldn't eat here again.  Bar seating only, by the slice only unless you're ordering a sheet, which is like 4 feet long.  It's really inexpensive, but for me it totally wasn't worth the calories.  Cash only.
author: Alex R.

description: Probably one of my most favorite pizza joints around the city. Their combination pizza is probably the most solid out of them all-wasn't too big of a fan of their garlic clam pizza. Regardless it's definitely a place I would come back to or refer friends when they have the late night munchies. Be sure to have cash!!!
author: Jason K.

description:
Very good pizza. I finally ate at Tony's and Tomasso's and can tell you where I find their food very traditional italian, Golden Boys is all American pizza. The sauce at GB is awesome, slightly sweet. The crust is ever so crunchy and delicious. Points for the fact they serve by the slice.

Perfect for a day off light food faire as you mozy around the city (e.g. nick's tacos, golden boy slice, naia for dessert). Make a food day out of it people... and make Golden Boy a stop on your journey.
author: Nelson C.

description:
In my quest to find the best frozen yogurt, my traveling companion and I went to Golden Boy between yogurts to "cleanse the palate," as it were.  he introduced me to this fine establishment back in February, and I've always enjoyed it since!

The best thing about their product is that although their crust is a deep dish sort of thing, the crust is still very crispy on the bottom.  Their prices are a little high for the size slice you get (Nizario's, for instance, charges the same for a much larger slice with comparable quality if different style), but it's North Beach, so expect prices to be higher.  The Veggie Pesto pizza is nice, with lots of fresh veggies, and although I'm not a huge pesto fan, it works well in this situation.

The jars of red pepper flakes on the bar are stale and lack much heat, so I had to keep shaking some out onto the pizza to feel any kind of bite, but the powdered Parmesan cheese was salty and cheesy, so that was good.

The staff is attentive and friendly and flirty, even considering how busy it was, so extra bonus point!  

All told, this is a great slice of pie!
author: Paul B.

description: Good Sicilian Pizza! Gets cowded but worth the wait!
author: M F.

description: They dont offer tons of choices but they are able to sparkle all the kinds that they offer. Very good pizza and pretty cute little hub. At first, you might think its ridiculous to stand and wait on line since there are hella people but once you tried them, you would love to wait no matter what. LOL Holding her or his hand while you are waiting, because he or she might fall in love with those little pizza but not you any more! (=
author: Hailey K.

description:
I've been here at least 20 times, so I'm not sure how I haven't reviewed you yet Golden Boy. Amazing pizza. If you go, try the pesto veggie. I live up the street, so I walk by here daily and it's really tempting to not get a piece of pizza here every time I walk by. Why wouldn't I? It's so good! 

Avoid this place between 12am-2am thur-sat...there will probably be a long line and lots of hungry drunks outside. But don't avoid it at all if you're into that sort of thing. There's not enough space and they don't take cards, but that doesn't stop me from coming back again and again for the delicious pesto veggie pizza.
author: Julie F.

description:
It is a great place to meet up with a friend or two after work and grab a casual bite.  We sat at the bar and had a slice of delicious pizza and beer.  

The pizza is fresh and done right.  They use focaccia bread with the perfect amount of sauce and cheese.  Lets just say they do pizza right.

Its a comfortable place to have a meal in north beach without dealing with all of the tourists.  

I had the combo and it was perfect.

CASH ONLY
author: saum z.

description:
Waiting in line at Golden Boy is like a passage into a ride at Disneyland for the first time. The anticipation builds. The smells, the sounds, and the sights are all heightened. And then - BAM. Only this pleasure ride lasts longer than a minute of screaming and a few minutes of nausea. This is satisfying, cheesy euphoria the likes of which, I dare say, you won't find ANYWHERE else. The crust is soooo buttery and delicious. The Golden Boy name is well earned, as you can imagine.

When you get in line, you'll be in single file probably out the door. If it's a late night and people have been drinking, you'll be waiting awhile. Have no fear. Totally worth it. The pleasant aroma of golden baked crust with smooth tomato sauce and fresh ingredients wafts from the open window...you know they do it on purpose. My favorite slice is the combo pizza, with a little bit of everything. The pepperoni is good too, as is the pesto. A slice will range from roughly $3-4...I'd advise buying two. A beer or a soda washes it down reeeeeally well! 

I don't know how I avoided writing a review about this place for this long? This is the place where I brought a girl for dinner, and she was swooning by the end of her first bite, proclaiming it the best she's ever had. Yep.

THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID.

p.s. Cash only. Be johnny on the spot with it too, cause the line is long and merciless. And have your pizza heated up there. It only takes a minute or so.
p.p.s. Please do not waste time hitting on the semi cute female bartender/server. She does not want to hear your pathetic pre-pizza chatter. And I'm hungry now, dammit. So move, b*tch. Get out the way.
author: Aaron F.

description:
Hot, fresh out of the oven pepperoni corner slice while out in North Beach = Heaven.  'nuff said.


(The line gets long at night so if you dislike lines, like I do, try to hit it up earlier)
author: Katie W.

description:
I have found my SF Pizza life mate. EXCITE!

So in the midwest we have this chain pizza joint called Rocky Rococo's Pizza. Its this square, thick crust.. amazingness... Of course they do not have it out here..  until I walked into Golden Boy for the first time...

The pizza, which is 2.75-3.25 a slice (YAY) is a non chain, aka more delicious version of Rocky Rococo's... Pure pizza heaven. I had a slice of pepperoni, and after that I debated for about a minute before I got another slice, this time the sausage (which is by far the best). 

In addition to serving the best thick crust pizza for the lowest price the staff is incredible. The wonderful gentleman working behind the bar was extremely friendly, helpful, and even gave a dude a slice for free when he tried to pay with a credit card. There are very few places that can boast service at this quality... I wanted to give him a big hug and ask him to be my BFF (hoping for the benefit of free pizza) 

I think the pizza has some medicinal qualities as well.. my girlfriends and I ventured out afterwards for 3 dollar Jameson, after 4 of those and a shot of tequilla I expected myself to be plenty hungover for work and class today.. but I feel great, and I owe it all to Golden Boy! 

XOXO
author: Hailey P.

description:
Ribs falling off the bone as to golden boy pizza melt-in-your-mouth.  The hubby has been raving about this place so we were in the area one weekday for lunch & wa-la, its by far the best pizza I've had.  The slices are square shaped & its just so good.  I tried the cheese & the combo & it just melts in your mouth.  The crust is cooked to perfection, not too soft nor crispy.  

Beware: the restaurant is high stool seating only.  Don't bring your kids here, no high chair or boosters.  
P.S.  They also have beers on tap.
author: Jo B.

description:
This is such a money spot for late night snackage.  The pizza is warm and delicious, thick and doughy and perfect to soak up that extra shot you really should not have taken.  

Never been inside... is there an inside?  I've only ever been up to the window.  The line gets pretty long after all the bars/clubs/lounges close but they're pretty efficient.  Excellent way to end a fun night out!
author: Dee Dee X.

description:
Two slices and a pint from this place is my place of solitude.

Great mix of music and old movie flicks playing in the background. I got to slug down my pizza and brew while watching "Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey"

I will review the movie separately.
author: Luis M.

description:
Is it me or is their crust (focaccia bread) getting more bland?

I've been coming here for YEARS and always love their delish toppings....even though i havent had a clam garlic the last 5 visits!! =(
But that crust is starting to taste just like...well...dough.  It needs some major salt, garlic powder, or some seasoning.  Although the bites with toppings are lovely, the parts with just bread and sauce are so not worth the calories.
author: Tammy H.

description:
I'm fiercely loyal to thin crust pizza, but, bite by bite, Golden Boy's clam and garlic pizza inched its way into my heart. The thick crust -- crispy skin on the bottom, yeasty and fluffy on top -- is the perfect base for the thick layer of lemony parsley, pungent clams and smell-it-from-a-block away garlic on top. The perfect proportions of sauce and cheese allow the toppings to shine. 

I also tried the combo, which was brimming with some excellent sausage and thickly cut pepperoni, but it just didn't have the same magic. It's all about the bright green, truly unique clam and garlic pizza that's the REAL San Francisco treat in my book!
author: Eeeeestar T.

description:
medium grade dog food.

Low quality cheese. Decent dough.  Ok Sausage. 

The vegetarian was fine.  Prices are OK for San Francisco but $3.00 for  a cheese?  Really!??

I was not impressed with the food or service. Where am I the haight? 

Interesting, kitchy kind of feel to the place.  Willnot go out of my way to come back here.  

They are sicilian style, fine if you like it but considering they cut corners on key ingredients like cheese and then charge $3 for it is kind of insulting.
author: Spanky M.

description:
Walking through north beach, it's nearly impossible to miss Golden Boy, right off the historic corner Grant and Green.  The delicious waft of pizza attacks your nostrils with a fiery force, as their powerful fans blow it mercilessly onto the sidewalk.  The melty gooey and delicious pizza stares at you ominously through the glass, slowly cooling on the cliche pizza trays.

Once you make it through the (torturous -1 star) line, you arrive at a beautiful smiling girl (or big tattoed guy, whatever you're into..) who serves you paradise on a piece of wax paper.

Thick slices, (the only way they should be) and a gloriously simple menu give golden boy the amazing vibe it deserves.  Don't worry about what toppings you WANT, take whatever's fresh at the time; trust me, somethign will be.

For the bold, there's the famous garlic clam which screams "fishermans wharf", while the meat lovers will stick with the combo.

All in all? Amazing.   And No, i'm not bias just because I live upstairs!
author: Joseph F.

description: I love this pizza!  This is the best pizza in the neighborhood.  It is the perfect food for when you're night of drinking is nearing an end.  There is always a line out the door, but I wouldn't hesitate to wait. The pizza is that good and the line moves pretty quickly.  I don't go out in this neighborhood that often, but I try to make a point of grabbing a piece of this yummy square pizza when I do.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Little math lesson:
Long Lines ALWAYS = Good Food

The whole crust/cheese/toppings ration is balanced out perfectly into the perfect size slice.  This is so worth the waiting in line.  

Cash only but there's an ATM machine inside.
author: PukaShell s.

description: Best late night food ever!  The line sometimes gets long, but it moves fast.  Combo slices are to die for.
author: Owen S.

description:
Worse than Pizzelle.  Worse than North Beach Pizza.  Worse than Pizza Hut.

Yet on busy weekend nights, there's a line around the block.

Location. Location. Location.

Golden Boy Pizza, late-night bastion of sub-par slices, won the jackpot in terms of location.  Surrounded by bars, closed sub-par Italian-American restaurants, a new trendy wine bar and not much else in terms of late night eateries, GBP proves that convenience trumps quality.

...because that shit they're shilling ain't quality.
author: Justin C.

description:
If you love pizza then you'll love this slice of pie! Golden Boy is what I always dreamed of when dreaming of pizza. This is a quaint little pizza spot/bar. I love the feeling of sitting at a bar drinking a cold one, but wait.... PIZZA??? Yes, pizza in all its simplistic glory! I had the clam, combo, and pepperoni! That only leaves the cheese for me to try! 

Love them all but my favorite is the clam or combo! The crust is fantastic and it's where I go for my pizza when in the city!
author: Chris A.

description:
Hands down the place I want to go after a night of mingling, dancing, and listening to bands in North Beach.  After the first "whiff" of bubbling cheese, garlicky pesto, and bready, yeasty crust, you too will be dreaming about Golden Boy Pizza.
I've had too many pieces to admit, yet not enough to satisfy my cravings!  (what to do, what to do?) But seriously, if you're around Grant and Green and see the line form out the from under the red awning, you need to get into that line (it may be 20 deep, but worth it).  Prices are cheap compared to the power of the punch in just one slice.  They must put the money towards better products.  It's definitely not going to the establishment itself since I'm sure the majority of their business occurs once the doors close and only the window is where you can order.
*It has an inside which I have been in only once before (years ago so I won't review that).
author: Becka C.

description: The dough is nice and chewy, the edges crisp.  Pepperoni & sausage are tasty and cost $3.25/slice.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Ate here three times in two days!!! Best Pan Pizza by far!!! Love the operation and style!!!!
author: Chuckin B.

description:
LOVE this place!  The two times I've been here, I've had two amaaaazing memories.  I was first told about this place in '04 by a local a friend of mine and I met at Mario's Cigar Shop.  Very cool and friendly guy -- took us here and showed us some great spots in North Beach.  We ate here late night and then went to some bars in the NB area.  The pizza is excellent, the place is open late, and usually about the time you craving pizza during a night of drinking, the Golden Boy is just what you need to re-fuel and keep going.  

The second time I came here was in '06 when a group our friends met in SF for our annual trip.  After hours of drinking I single handedly led a pilgrimage of about 20 of us to this joint where we chowed down on pizza and beer, jammed out to good tunes, and then GB gave us our second wind and the night picked up back into stage of crunkiness where it belonged.  I love you Golden Boy, you're so dependable, you rock!
author: Jen C.

description: short and sweet.. open late. Get the supreme. Worth driving for after party munchies..the pizza is heavenly.  Great with a heineken on tap from next door.  5/5 hiyaaaaaaas (while buzzin of course not sure when sober ^,^)
author: Dustin G.

description: I've been here several times. Always solid, delicious pizza. Never fails. Cheap too!
author: Ji C.

description: FANTASTIC pizza. I had the Vegetarian Pesto and Pepperoni (I wanted the Clam and Garlic, but they were out). The dough is SO soft and the slices are enormous. The perfect meal before drinking! Be warned, there is very limited seating so be prepared to stand outside and eat if it's busy.
author: Ann V.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is perfect for a late night fix after hitting the local bars. The pizza is delicious and not too expensive and the slices are fairly large. Even though there seems to always be a line ( 10-15  min wait) i would eat here again in a heartbeat!
author: L W.

description: Great value. Local hole in the wall. Rock music, beer and a slice
author: Michael T.

description: Clam garlic pizza is money hands down! Only thing that sucks is that it's not big in size.. but it is huge on taste. The texture of their dough is what makes their sicillian style pizza so great. It's crispy and flaky on the edges and soft, doughy and fluffy on the inside. I always have to order at least two just to snack on.
author: Patrick L.

description: OMG my veggie pizza was Fin amazing! will post a picture JUST TO PROVE IT!
author: B C.

description: Fair pizza, Only if you are in North Beach after 11pm, and need greasy cheese Pizza, gO ahead. But !!!! If you want out of this world, Ill drive from anywhere because the Pizza is calling YOU, This isnt It. Just Saying!!!
author: Veronica B.

description: It was ok, nothing to write home about. I feel like a lot of people eat this after a night out when everything tastes great.
author: Laura N.

description:
After watching Beach Blanket Babylon and bar hopping in North Beach, one of us in the group has this "ritual" of going over to Golden Boy Pizza, so alright, away we go!
Mind you, it was one of the most heavy rainy nights in the city.  The kind of rainy night that soaks the bottom of your jeans just from walking 10 steps and you're clutching your umbrella in a desperate attempt to be protected from being completely drenched.  I remember thinking, okay, this place BETTER be good!

And it was!  From the window, you can see the kind of pizza this place pops out.  The toppings look fresh and everything looks absolutely delicious!  And the smell, oh mann.  There was a line out the door, but believe me, staring at the pizzas in the window will hypnotize and keep you occupied till it's your turn.  The place is pretty small and cramped and there isn't too much of a seating area.  We walked all the way to the back and ate our pizzas at the counter right by the oven.

Pretty damn good pizza, perfect after all the drinking you do in North Beach -- I think I might just have to adopt this ritual!
author: Crys L.

description: They're all business in here.  Get you in, get you out, often with a bit of attitude.  It's cash only.  And there's often a decently long line out the front door, particularly late at night.  But it's worth it -- the pizza is super cheap and super tasty, they have Mirror Pond Pale Ale on tap, and the TV is usually tuned to a Giants or Warriors game.  Best cheap and fast meal in North Beach.
author: Paul W.

description:
This place has heavenly goodness shaped in the form of square pizzas.

We stumbled upon this place one night after dinner nearby.  The pizza was calling to us from the store window.  We made a pact to come back and try it out.  We've been back three times since!  This is hole in the wall place that serves pizza, beer, wine, and soda - nothing else!  That is why they do the pizza right.

Clam and garlic - a must have
Combo and pepperoni are also very good
All less than $4 each for a big square.  Once ordered, they pop your slice into a hot toaster oven to heat up!

So delicious that my bff and I came here after dinner last Sunday.  We sat down, ordered beer and split a clam and garlic slice.  Needless to say, that is not recommended after you've already had dinner, but what can I say, I was seriously craving this pizza!
author: Sharon S.

description: It's about 1:00am & I'm leaving one of those bar/lounges conveniently located around the corner from this place. Next to Blondies, its my second favorite SF pizza joint. Delicious square bundles of flavor. Perfect for the late-night munchies, or the quick grab lunch/dinner. ENJOY!
author: Jasmine S.

description: i think you've gotten the hint by now that this place is good so i'll make this short. Tried the clam pizza and veggie, both solid. Waited for about 10 minutes and ate my tasty, greasy box shaped pizza slice and left with a smile on face. Brownie points for being open late and being able to order a beer while you wait. Bring cash and your appetite.
author: sasha h.

description:
I managed to check this place out earlyish on a saturday night and there was no line which is fantastic because the pizza is good..but not wait in line for over 10 minutes good.

I sat at the bar, enojoyed my slice and speedy service. If you get a corner peice the crust is oh so crunchy and delicious!

I will definitly be back because its a stones throw from my apartment, but probably not during busy hours!
author: Britney K.

description: Mmm.  This is true Italian style pizza. Square, focaccia, a bit thicker... I love it. The line may seem long but they are quick.
author: Richa A.

description:
Dear Golden Boy Pizza,

You're trying to make me fat, and what's worse than this initial crime is that you are succeeding. I would hate you, if I wasn't stuck in the paradox of loving you so much.

Your thick, juicy slices of pepperoni, veggie, Greek, and Hawaiian are going to be the death of me one day, but the irony is they'll also be my salvation.

I guess they call you Golden Boy because you can get away with murder and still be loved.

Lurv,
Chunky Thighs and Clogged Arteries
author: Anna S.

description:
Goddam this is some seriously yummy pizza.  I'm not normally a big fan of Sicilian style pizzas but I was sure floored when I sunk my teeth into its hot, greasy and cheesy gloriousness.  

Perhaps it was my heightened senses from an evening of libations that convinced me this was one of the tastiest slices around.  Or maybe it was the bad beer from earlier.  Cheap commercial beer can have that affect on normally reliable taste buds.  Whatever the case, Golden Boy can definitely satisfy any greasy craving -- at 1am on a Friday night.
author: Jim D.

description: awesome atmosphere & Amazing pizza. square slices & super hot pizza guy named Max. Pizza & ber & HOT GUys what more can you ask for & only like 5 bucks a slice..sf has my heart with this one =)
author: Lisa G.

description: I've eaten here several times in the past and this time was just as good as I remember.  Hot bubbly cheese, crispy crust, and always fresh.  Absolutely delicious!
author: Erica L.

description:
Let me tell you about Golden Boy Pizza
I came here with my Padre one cold winter afternoon for lunch. I've had pizza about twice already that week so at that point, I was kind of sick of pizza. Let me just say that this place was crackinnnnnnnnnn :D
Basically, no matter how tired of pizza I am, I will ALWAYS be down for this place!
First lets start of with the pizza. They don't do these basic circular pizzas that everywhere else has. They have SQUARE pizzas. Pizzas cut into SQUARES. Now if you're sexually attracted to Spongebob-shaped objects or if you have a fear of circles, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU.
The pizza was DELICIOUS. I ordered two pepperoni slices and after finishing my first one, I was kinda already full to be honest because they aren't dinky little slices. But I really couldn't wait to get back home to eat the other slice! It was SO GOOD. The pepperoni was crispy and the crust on the bread was ON POINT. It was thick, crispy, fluffy, and saucy. OMG so good
The only complains I have is that the place is extremely small and cramped. So for my large fatass, I kind of had to get used to it. But my padre is quite petite vertically so he kind of just fit right in. There's limited seating so I suppose you have to make due. Also, when my padre ordered the pizza, it wasn't very saucy, as if it was lacking the sauce.
But aside from that, if you're ever drunk or are looking for some late night munchies after cheating on your wife at the strip club around the corner, COME HERE.
author: Johnny C.

description:
It's Tuesday.  Midnight.  You're hungry.  Not really in the mood for full service, but you are in the mood for tasty food.  What about pizza, you think?  You don't really feel like paying for a stale and lukewarm slice of pizza.  And then you turn the corner.  Bells are ringing.  Fat ladies are singing.  A boys' choir chimes in.  It's Golden Boy Pizza.  Your wish is fulfilled.

Their pizza is damn good.  Crispy, oily, Sicilian pizza.  Mmmm.
author: Alexis N.

description: Good pizza, worth the line. The veggie pesto is great, and the place has good atmosphere.
author: David J.

description: No outting to North Beach for pub crawls is complete without a trip to Golden Boy pizza. Thick square slices that are piping hot and full of flavor. Seriously, if I'm ever in the city for casual times, then I will try to find my way there...I first tried it about 15 years ago and it hasn't changed a bit....great, now I want a slice...sigh.
author: Patrick G.

description:
When I first moved to SF, I live 3 blocks up the hill on Green.

After I tried Golden Boy, this was my go to dinner spot for the first few months. Amazing focaccia crust and the supreme is fantastic.

I miss cutting in front of people at 2 am to get one of the last pieces...
author: Howie F.

description:
Hit this place up bar hopping after santacon.  Pizza smelled great and the line while out the door wasn't too long.  And they had beer!

Slices are very good sized, served hot and taste great.  For what I was looking for this place is perfect!
author: R P.

description: Admit, not a huge fan of pan pizza so wasn't living up to the hype for me. Amongst my sf pizza eating experiences, Arinells is still the best.
author: Amy S.

description: Great crust.. Humboldt brown hemp ale...
author: Robert F.

description: I don't come here after the bars in North Beach. I come here on Monday nights after a long weekend, long day at work and I just need to not think. I used to do clam garlic, veggie slices etc. I think the straight cheese pizza is the best here though. It really just highlights all that is simple and good in this world.
author: Jessica H.

description:
A friend recommended this place to me off-handedly. Since that one recommendation, I have returned here scores of times and brought many others along the way.

Their Sicilian square pizza slices are wonderful and varied for all palates. One piece is rarely enough, the taste will tempt you for seconds or thirds. They offer veggie slices too. Bring cash with you they don't take plastic.

The location is very narrow and cramped for seating. You can order pizza then and take a walk over to Washington Square to enjoy it. I once attempted to order an entire sheet pizza over the phone. The gentleman began to take my order and then just left the phone off the hook as he sounded too busy to be bothered.

Love love love their pizza and I suppose I'll always come back if the pizza stays the same.
author: Derek B.

description: My favorite go-to place in San Francisco! I live a few blocks away and after a long day of work...all I want is a slice of pizza from this place. It's cheap, it's fast, all you need to bring is cash because they don't accept credit cards :)
author: Joanna L.

description:
This is one of my favorite pizza places in the city. I grew up in Detroit, where the pizza is very similar to this. In fact, this is the only pizza in San Francisco that my Dad considers as good as what he can get in Detroit, and he's way picky. I've always wondered if there was a Detroit connection to GB, but whenever I've asked, the answer has been 'I doubt it'. Unless you're from Detroit, you probably couldn't care less about my fascination, but for fellow former-Detroiters, this is your Buddy's/Louis'/Cloverleaf/Jets' style, and it's very good. The dough is slightly lighter, but every bit as good.

It seems people's tastes in pizza has a lot to do with what they're used to. They had this challenge once on FoodTV between Chicago style and New York style - fire fighters from Chicago and police officers from NY both tasting both. As you might guess, the fire fighters picked Chicago style and the police officers picked NY. I have a hunch that people that don't like GB are used to thin crust California style pizza. I actually happen to love all four styles - Chicago (Little Star is best), New York (I don't know, is Tomasso's NY style? If so, it's my favorite), Detroit (GB), and California (Gialina's, Arizmendi's, Cheese Board, maybe Delfina's, or Flour & Water?, which I have yet to try). All best in class.
author: Bib G.

description:
The best pizza crust ever! Just got back from Golden Boy and boy are we in love! The hubs had the classic pepperoni and I had the pesto vegetarian.  When we heard a garlic and clam tray was coming fresh out of the oven we ordered a slice of that too.  Yum!  

Good music, great service, delicious pizza and reasonable prices.  Only downside was searching for parking, but its the city and we are willing to overlook this detail.

Sorry no pics, in my mouthwatering stupor I forgot to take any.
author: Melissa P.

description: We ate the garlic pizza which was super good and the clams were perfectly seasoned. We also had the combo which was so full of mushrooms, sausage, tomatoes, onions and melted mozzarella--lots of it. The crust was crispy on the outside but on the thicker side. It was amazing! However, seating is limited and the music was quite loud. If they also had salad, that'd be a bonus to the delicious pizza! Overall though, I was EXTREMELY satisfied by the pizza and would go back in a heartbeat!
author: Myra S.

description:
I've never been here while drunk or at night, strangely enough. So, take this useful tidbit from this stone-sober (at least when I was there) gal: this stuff is pretty good, and it's cheap.

These square little pieces of happy (you pretty much just need one, and it's about $4 a square) saved me most recently after a wedding ceremony at nearby Sts. Peter and Paul. You know how you sit there for a while toward the end of a ceremony, then realize you won't be eating for another three hours so the wedding party can take pictures before the reception? It's perhaps no surprise we made a beeline for GB as soon as he kissed the bride.

It's very punk-rock-industrial inside (stickers and corrugated wall decor abound), and will feel like your favorite, casual neighborhood bar, but with yums.
