A handful of beers on tap to go with your pizza, and plenty of seating if you're not there between 12 midnight and 2 a.m. on a Thursday-Saturday.

To sum up:

Golden Boy: Good even when you're sober.
author: Tara R.

description:
By far my favorite pizza in the city!  

It's especially good at 2am!
...& cold at 9am to help cure your hangover
....& fresh out of the oven when you're sitting at the bar w/ a beer

Golden Boy is the best sicilian on the West Coast
author: Lauren C.

description:
cheesus, their pizzas are so easy to eat.

i find it exceptionally hard to stop from continually biting into the focaccia goodness. filling and at the same time so light. coming in here with the munchies? holy.

had too many bites of slices of the cheese, sausage, combination, and clam pizzas. no regrets. sauce on the face and greasy fingers galore. terribly hard to share or stop at just one square slice.

eating in is just as fun as taking your slices to-go and having them in the park, by the water, or at vesuvio. wherever you choose to be, just eat the damn pizza and find happiness.

PS: follow up with dessert; traipse into chinatown and get them egg tarts at golden gate bakery. i think you've found your weekend daytime plan before hitting up the bars. ya welcome.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Absolutely love this place.  I live close by.   Mark is a great guy.  Love sodini's .........love this place.  He's the only guy Italian guy I know in the North Beach district, so I really have to support him.............Gotta support my peeps even though I am Chinese........hahahaha.  

Great place for a quick pizza.  Went drinking at the lost and found and needed some food.  Wasn't in the mood for North Beach Pizza so I went to this place.  You can get whatever you want here.  You really can't go wrong.  very rare that I give a five star rating for a pizza joint.............I don't even like pizzas.  This place ROCKS!!!!
author: jason g.

description: I was looking for a good place when I went to San Francisco and found this on yelp so I decided to give it a shot. Little did I know that I was going to fall in love. The line was pretty long considering the fact that I went like at midnight so I decided to get a slice of each. Cheese, pepperoni and vegetarian. Soooo good and super affordable too! We paid like $10.00 for 4 slices that were pretty big in size and big in flavor. I wanna go back!!!!!!
author: Evelyn V.

description: Learned about this place during a Bar Crawl and I have to say I love this place. Their clam and Garlic pizza is a must try. The flavors of everything will melt in your mouth to form a perfect combination of awesome! A must try!
author: Michael N.

description: This is one of the best slices you can get in SF. You could probably just eat the toasted, seasoned, and lightly oil brushed focaccia bread by itself and be satisfied, but they top it off with tomato sauce and delicious gooey cheese. There are a variety of different slices, but I usually opt for just cheese since it's already so, so good. I've had the combo and clam and garlic as well, both of which are also very good. You really can't go wrong with any slice cause its core ingredients are just perfect. Tip - look for a sheet that's just come out to get the freshest slice possible. Or not, it's awesome either way.
author: Andrew N.

description:
I like this pizza.  Like, not love.  It's tasty and all and fills your belly when you need it.  It's fluffy.  I like fluffy, not always with pizza but it's not a dealbreaker.  If you get a corner piece you are golden, a side piece and your okay sorta, but you get a middle piece and you are fuct.  I don't care how great they are at their wax paper origami, holding on to a fluffy square piece of pizza is just not the greatest thing in the world.  I don't want to put that much effort into eating my pizza.

And while it's wonderful that they are open late at night I would caution against it unless *loose off the goose* twits and chodes are your kind of people.
author: Luis M.

description: I really like this pizza a lot....i mean i will brave the Douchebagery and Euro's that make up North beach just for a few slices so its gotta be good right? The menu is limited...it you dont see it they dont have it. Cash only and lunch/ late night means you will have to wait in line deal with it. They have beer and soda. It is usually warm in there from the people and ovens so order two beers with your pizza.
author: Raul R.

description:
I found it on accident. We were trying to walk back to the muni metro from chinatown and went the wrong way like the noobs we were. We got hungry and proceeded to look for a place that was cheep. The place was so small that we almost missed.

This place though small is actually pretty delicious. I had pooped bricks. It was delcious and only a couple dollars.
will go back again soon.
author: Israel C.

description: Nothing like standing in line after a late night of drinking for some pizza.  I tried the combination pizza.  They have square slices with generous toppings.  It was crunchy and gooey in all the right places.  I will be back.
author: Tea T.

description: HANDS DOWN!!! BEST PIZZA PLACE EVER, i dont care what anyone else says! This place shits on other pizza joints in the bay. Just thinking of this place right now makes me hungry. I always order their vegetarian pizza and have tried the clams/garlic pizza. Both were extremely satisfying. On top of it, ITS DIRT CHEAP! I love how they dont look like regular sliced pizzas, but are in square pieces. And its hot when you get it too. MMMMMMmmmM. Dont even bother looking for parking, because chances are you're not going to find any!
author: Colette P.

description: best pizza slice in sf hands down and if you want to contend me you are wrong. so wrong. the price is right and the slice is right.
author: Qui K.

description:
What I remember from Golden Boy Pizza:
There was a line
The line moved fast
The pizza was cheap
I ate a piece of cheese pizza
It tasted good and I don't even like pizza
They think there needs to be Less Gucci more Coochie in the world
author: Me H.

description:
O-M-G. 

Best Pizza EVER! Came here last night with Jenny K. and her friend. I got the combo ($3.75) and the clam/garlic ($3.75). I have fallen in LOVE with the clam/garlic! Stinky breath? WHO CARES! mmmm. If I lived near this place, not only will I be broke but I would also be expediting the clogging of my arteries! 

BTW, CASH ONLY!
author: Eugenia G.

description: This place is great and worth the wait in line. I had the garlic clam pizza and was satisfied to the max. I like the decor and the people that worked there were nice.  I wanna go back soon.
author: Jason S.

description:
are you there golden boy? it's me, kris....

i've been a loyal follower ever since that first religious experience after grant and green when an unexpectedly excellent local band inspired two hours of heavy drinking and heavier dancing, and salvation from complete inebriation was found at your door. i was brought up thin-crust, and not sicilian-style, but you have shown me the light, and i'm born again. and like any good disciple, i'm studying all of your important works: cheese, sausage, clam, and all the rest. 

at around $3 a slice, you know i'll be there every sunday. promptly at 2am.
author: Kris G.

description:
Hands down, the worst pizza I have had in the city...
it has nothing to do with the square shape of the pizza either -
the pizza was hella greasy, not tasty, lacking in sauce and just YUCK! 
the atmosphere was that of a college town bar which was cool - but I wouldn't recommend going here unless you are piss drunk and you will eat just about anything.
author: Neha A.

description: Thought it was totally overrated, greasy mess. Bad toppings selection, not enough sauce. Yuckish.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Maybe it was my inability to be coherent at the time, but through my drunken self I could comprehend the only mediocre taste of my pizza. And also considering a big chunk of cheese with my combo toppings wobbled off my precious pizza onto the ground (OH NOz!)...it was enough to satisfy my belly! 

I chomped down the fresh out of the oven square slice late at night after standing in the crowded line (which seems to never die down!)

Everyone loves that cookie sheet baked pizza! And be aware, it is tiny in there, so probably not ideal to sit and each with a bunch of buddies. Always ideal for a quick pick up for late night munchies. 

When I'm hungry at 1AM, this is a Golden idea! Now if only I could keep  my toppings on next time! ;)
author: Catherine O.

description: Definitely the best pizza slice joint in North Beach. There's always a long line and for good reason. They only do Sicilian style pizza but it's always really fresh and really delicious. Do yourself a favor and skip all the other pizza spots along Columbus St. and head to Golden Boy instead.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Open late and by the slice, two points in their favor. Sicilian pizza is not my favorite, but for a snack while at a bar, it does a good job. The price is right, as well.

I could go in to detail to explain why I wasn't 100% satisfied by the pizza, but really, do you care? It's fine, but lacking in some dimensions. Crude yet effective.
author: neil c.

description:
UUMMMM!!!
their pizza are so tasty. Its the bread and the fixings.....also the employees. Its like being back in Rome and having a pizza pie and a nice red wine.....I just love Golden Boy Pizza!!!!
author: Der Maibaum L.

description: We went again and I got the clam and garlic and it was definitely not as exciting as I wanted it to be.  I'll be going back to my veggie pesto choice next time around.
author: Autumn B.

description: Nice, thick crust-vegetarian pizza is excellent. Family had pepperoni and enjoyed it as well. Loved it!
author: Jessica F.

description:
I've always been a fan. 
It's just that usually I'm coming from Amante a few doors over and I don't always recall just how yummy these "slices" are after a few cocktails. Stopped in early on friday and myself and my companion ordered veggie and garlic-clam and perched ourselves on the bar stools to people watch. The garlic-clam was fantastic, the perfect blend of cheeses and sweet, mellow roasted garlic offset the clams wonderfully.  Woe is me for taking a break from drinking this first week of the new year 'cause right then & there with slice in hand a beer would have been the perfect pairing. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
Cool little neighborhood in the Italian area. We were "food hiking" and so popped in here at about 2:00pm when it was slow. It was slow so we were able to sit at the main counter and chat with the owner and order beers and wonderful pizza. A really great time.
We went back again the next night at about 8pm and the tiny place was hopping. We waited a couple minutes in line to get in. We ordered and were served our pizzas and beer and it was up to us to find a spot in the back to eat. Four of us found two stools so it worked out ok. 
Wonderful pizza- choose your time for the vibe of your choice!
author: Rose C.

description: 2 Johnny Walkers on the rocks x 1 Clam and Pesto pizza from Golden Boy = happy tummy and sweet dreams.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Today's lunch--Clam and garlic pizza slice with fresh draft (on tap) root beer for a total of $5.25. Put some parmesean on it and take it to sunny Washington Sq. with two friends from work. Sit in the sun next to the shade so everyone gets what they want.

I used to come here alot...but it's been a while. Nice to come back.
author: Liza B.

description:
Wow, I am speechless.  They have the best pizza (by the slice) I have ever tasted in my life :-)! 


Two Words: CLAM GARLIC
Three Words: PABST on TAP
*FIVE WHOLE STARS*

I'll probably be at Golden Boy Pizza at least once a week starting in March so my rating and review of this place will be updated/edited often!

CASH ONLY.
author: Celeste M.

description:
Oh, how I adore these unconventional square pieces of deliciousness.   Brimming full of orgasmic cheese, this pizza is seriously as addicting as everyone makes it seem.  The crispy foccacia crust is crunchy, the cheese is gooey and the toppings are mouth-wateringly delicious.  Fresh, cheap and quick.  What more can a girl ask for at 2am in the morning?  

I know...the pizza without the wait.  

Got to work on that one ;)
author: Lisa W.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is where it's at!  Sooooo good.  This is not a fancy place.  Don't go here looking for atmosphere.  Come for the pizza and leave very happy.
author: Chloe M.

description: Fantastic, easy pizza. It always hits the spot, especially after a night of drinking or the morning after.
author: Celine S.

description:
Needed a booze bite in the middle of happy hour at Magnet so I wandered over w/ my roomie to Golden Boy.  We took a seat and ordered a beer and pizza.  

It was served immediately and the punky server told us to enjoy and enjoy we did!!  That is some tasty ass pizza!!!  The best is that the guy behind the counter is super nice or super flirty.  He gave us a free refill of beer and told us to stick around.  

Cheesy salty herblicious pizza....oh!!  It's a square slice of pizza.  I don't know why but that makes it even more tastier.
author: Jay H.

description:
For sure you won't see Oscar De La Hoya in here - since they only serve WINNERS in this pizza joint.

Had a pepperoni slice and a fresh from-the-back oven hot combination slice.  All I have to say is that I didn't want to leave the place.  Nothing beats pipin' hot pizza.  

Their style is like Blondies down on Powell.  But about 1000 times better.  It's more of a pan pizza, but not deep dish.  The crust is awesome, so be sure to order a side or corner.  The crust is definitely buttery (not in a bad way) the middle is oh-so-fluffy-like-a-Southern-breakfast-biscuit.  The topping was semi-loaded - not too much - but definitely the right amounts - if not more generous.  I hate it when there's TOO much on top where at the end of the slice, half the pizza is on the plate.  The cheese was super cheesy and the tomato sauce was rich but not overly tangy.  Score.

The waitress was super cool, helping us decide what the signature pizzas out and then also just dishing out smiles the whole time.

They have a beer bar but what sucked was no happy hour specials.

The only have stool setting in the whole joint - no date tables.  But I kinda like the stool setting - it gives it a nice vibe.

Surrounding area is I would say heart or left ventricle of North Beach with bars, restaurants, and Washington Square just minutes away.

Two slices and a small soda = $8.25
author: Isaac L.

description:
This has to be the best pizza I have ever had. Any time I am in the City I always try to stop by for a slice. 

And they are open late! It is about a half block from some of the bar that have dancing. When you have worked up an appetite and it is late you can just pop around the corner and dig in. 

Every year I bring my son and a friend up to the City for a long weekend just before Christmas and we always stop off here for a late lunch. The kids love it and since you can buy it by the slice everyone can walk away from a clean plate.
author: Scott C.

description:
OK, so there are already 590 reviews, but I have to add my 5 stars!

I love Golden Boy with all my heart.  Wonderful, fantastic, tasty pizza.  Square slices are brilliant (you can attack it from any angle!).  Toppings are always fresh and flavorful.  Cheese is gooey goodness.  Crust has a perfect amount of crunch.

Anyone who gives Golden Boy less than 4 stars is completely nuts, or they don't accurately remember their visit because they were too drunk/high that night.

A great place to visit whether you are just in the neighborhood on a random afternoon, or have been enjoying adult beverages all night at a nearby saloon.

Don't ever pass up a chance at Golden Boy...
author: Matthew D.

description:
Ok, so this is my 1st Yelp review & I wanted to make it a good one which is why I picked Golden Boy Pizza.
This was seriously the BEST pizza I have ever had! Ever! Of course, you have to be a fan of deep dish, but it is outstanding! & not expensive at all! I belive a plain cheese slice was about $2.25.
The only bummer is that they only accept cash. Can't wait to visit San Fran again for another slice! :)
author: Lesley M.

description: I went here for a late night bite and the combination pizza was good. I had a fresh piece, just right from the oven. I think the most enjoyable thing was the crust, it was flaky and just right. Other than that, the topping of the pizza and everything else was just ordinary.
author: Nhung T.

description: I dream of this place when I come to San Francisco.  As an out of towner, I always make a point of stopping by Golden Boy when I'm traveling to San Francisco.  They never disappoint.  The pizza is delicious, the staff are simple and straight-forward, and the atmosphere relaxing.  And I agree with all the other reviews. Its the crust!! Deep crunchy crust!
author: Amy S.

description:
If you like new york pizza, come here. If you like Sicilian pizza, come here. 

On the hunt for good pizza since moving to the bay area, this is the best Sicilian slice I've had yet. 

Oh, and dont forget some beer..mmm beer
author: Christian K.

description: Clam garlic pizza is really delish!!! Pesto was pretty good too.
author: Jangalina J.

description:
One of the best places in north beach to get a quick cheap slice and drink a good draft beer.

Great ambiance when you sit at the bar.
author: Eric H.

description:
sooooo bomb!! Pizza by the slice - im a fan. 

It was funny because my friends and I were kind of hungry, buzzed, and were walking around in SF for food....

Turned on Yelp on our iphone and found this place

BEST DECISION EVER!! LOL

Get the garlic clam pizza. u can't go wrong. Stop by!! you won't regret it
author: Joey L.

description: I don't really get it. Golden Boy makes some square-shaped pizza that gets reheated upon ordering, and it only tastes okay. Am I missing something?
author: Kathleen M.

description: The BEST PIZZA EVER!! I always end up at this spot after clubs let out or any time in the city. Great location probably the best pizza ive had in my life.
author: Ryan R.

description: I was visiting SF from texas and I accidently stumbled upon this hidden gem of a pizza place.  First you have to understand I'm not a pizza fan... I really don't care for it, but holy crap these square pizza are like crack.  My wife ordered a clam pizza and it was frigging awesome... that I decided to buy another pizza slice, which I came to find out the combo wasn't as good as the clam and my pizza limit is 1 slice. That still didn't change my impression of the clam pizza that's why i'm giving this place a 5 star.  I would give this place 3 stars for service, but I've come to realize that almost everyone in SF is pretty unfriendly.
author: Vu N.

description:
The best pizza ever!!
I love the clam and garlic. 
I also love that they serve draft Rootbeer.
author: Karlee D.

description:
I thought we were missing something when we went to North Beach Pizza for pizza and beer... but everything was there - nice waitress who remembered us, our order, where we sat, what we drank (I love that), clean tables and seats, nice salads and pizza lots of pizza... But I got a tip from someone about Golden Boy, so we tried it out one evening after work instead of North Beach. And I realized I WAS missing something! The best pizza experience in North Beach.

I love the combo pizza!

I like the bar and beer selection, the other people that come in, how casual it is, how there are two stereos going on at once, plus a big tele above the hot pizzas. 

I like the people that work here. No pressure. It feels like North Beach.

And there are lots of neat things to look at on the walls, pictures, mementos.

The pizza is delicious - the crust is perfect to me. I don't know if I will go again to North Beach Pizza knowing Golden Boy is around the corner, although I like that they deliver. But I really like Golden Boy's pizza so much more.
author: Holly F.

description: Great late night pizza after a night of boozing!  There's a reason why you may wait in line for 20 minutes.
author: Bill K.

description: We bought a few different slices (cheese, pepperoni, and clam). It was delicious with the bottom slightly crunchy and the rest super hot and soft. The cheese and pepperoni were our favorite! Will definitely go back to try the other slices and get a whole pie for gatherings!!!
author: H C.

description:
I had one slice of clam and garlic pizza and it was ono!  

The problem is, this morning I'm paying for all the garlic on the pie.  I must smell like Gilroy.   It's like eating garlic fries from Gordon Biersch.

You get free refills on soft drinks.  

Fresh out of the oven is the only way to go.  It's well worth waiting for.
author: Randal P.

description:
too bad this place has been ruined by yelp or some tour group. it's impossible to go here for lunch anymore during work hours. the establishment used to allow regulars to skip the long tourist line, sit at the bar if a spot was available, and order in between the ridiculous line of orders. one of the relatively new female workers won't allow this anymore. it's unfortunate that care for the regular lunch visitor gets slighted over the prospect of temporary business.  

yes, the pizza is solid but the overall atmosphere and friendly staff used to make golden boy special. now it's just another pizza place in north beach.
author: M F.

description:
Dear Golden Boy,

You have saved my life on more than one occasion.  That may be a bit of an exaggeration... I was never really "in danger" when I visited you in the sense that I might not see another day... but I was "in danger" of calling Ralph on the big white telephone if I didn't get some substance into my tummy to soak up all the egregious amount of libations I had just consumed at one of the surrounding drinking establishments.  So I thank you... from the bottom of my heart... for providing me with some much needed nourishment on those fateful evenings.  I must say as well that, sober or not, I am always in the mood for a slice of your ever tasty pepperoni!

xoxo
~ Ms. M.
author: Ms. M. M.

description:
True Equation:

152 drinks + 1 slice of Golden Boy = 23% decrease in severe hangover

Everyone who has been there knows this is true.  It's not the best pizza in the city and they never have the pizza combo you want but who cares?  It is good and hot plus they serve beer.  

The one time I made a daytime sojourn I barely recognized the place.
author: Amber B.

description: Square pizza!  Yay, just like the beanery back in the school lunch days, when you could smell the curiously strong cheese smell wafting through the hallways...  Okay, luckily its not just like the school lunch pizza or else it would not be four stars.  This pizza is light and on foccacia like bread.  Yummy late night snack.
author: Tony And Candace T.

description: went here the day of the SF Giants parade on 11/3/2010  We didnt know which pizza spot to go to so we chose this one.  Isnt a very big building only a handful of customers fit but some of the best pizza i've had.  Big slices for 3-4 dollars and cold beers on draft.  Next time I'm in SF again i'll be going here again for pizza.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Oops, I guess I'm new to this vegetarian thing... I've only been doing it for a week now, and I just screwed up tonight by ordering the Clam Garlic pizza... I guess I wanted garlic so badly that it completely didn't cross my mind that clam is meat until I took a bite of the pizza. Oh well, I'll take the -10 karma.

About the pizza joint itself... Well, after reading Yelp reviews I was expecting to be BLOWN AWAY, but I was just kinda like "meh". I mean, it wasn't bad, but it really wasn't the best pizza I've had... It kinda reminded me vaguely of Pizza Hut due to the really heavy, greasy consistency of it... So I guess I can expect to be hungry again in a few hours.

The price seemed just a little bit high; you could easily breach $10 just by ordering two slices, a beer, and a tip. The service environment itself is just insane. One lady was running to and fro, doing EVERYTHING in this heavily crowded place where you couldn't even move without rubbing your body into at least 5 people! Despite this, she was still very friendly and I wish I could have tipped her, but I've been avoiding tips on take-out orders due to the fact that I'm a broke art school student. But judging by the hefty amounts of bills stuffed into the tip pitchers and she being the only person working, I don't think she'll do too bad!

I give Golden Boy 3 stars for being a decent pizza place; not bad but not like "WOW" either.

EDIT: I decided to bump them up to 4 stars. The girl that's always working here is cute, hard-working, and friendly. Their pizza is tasty and unique, and probably the best deal I've found in the area.
author: P A U L.

description:
It took me about two slices on Saturday night to realize what a stinking hypocrite I am.
Alright, so it's not perfect. It is saucy and too spongy, but it serves a vital purpose. Without it, we'd be slogging through vomit ankle-deep on Columbus Ave, and the B&T crowd would probably thin to a weekend trickle on account of the alcohol poisoning.
Plus sometimes there's fights outside. Yea fights! Also, once I was standing outside not eating pizza and saw someone lob a yogurt cup at a cop. Yoplait is the new.... uh... broken bottle or something.
author: Chris R.

description: You win.  I like you.  Fine.  I'll see you next saturday night at 2 am.
author: jessica b.

description:
After reading all the glowing Yelp reviews, I was more than ready to try out Golden Boy for myself.  Last Friday, I finally got the chance...

When we walked up looking for a late-night slice,  there was a line snaking out the door.  So we shuffled in and readied ourselves for the wait, discussing which types of pizza looked better through the window.  After about ten minutes, we placed our orders and received our steaming slices.  The pizza, as promised, was oohey-gooey and delicious.  I had especially been looking forward to the crust, and boy was it yummy!  We opted to eat our pizza outside under the streetlights as the place was a bit cramped, but hey, it's a pizza joint.  Whattaya expect?  Golden Boy gets fours stars for living up to great expectations.
author: Karl B.

description:
I heart Golden boy!! i would have to say some of the best pizza in the city. the crust is thick and delicious, the size of the slices is generous, and you can buy a few slices and take them into columbus cafe and drink a beer or 4 with them

Brick pizza 4 life!!
author: C B.

description: The pizza was very very good, though I don't believe probably quite the best in the city. The crust is thick and fluffy and it's light on sauce. It wasn't greasy at all which was awesome. I really like the atmosphere. It's a small dark hole in the wall with lots of random things and stickers on a wall from past patrons. They were playing heavy metal music pretty loudly which fit those that were working there. Although it doesn't seem like a family friendly place, the help was very friendly and interactive with the kids when they wanted to watch them make the pizza. It's a perfect place to get a slice to go, but it's also a fun lively place to stay and eat if there's a stool available.
author: Curtis H.

description:
Yum! I don't go out for pizza very much. I'd rather make homemade pizza, because I'm pretty particular about my pizza (not too much cheese, not too yeasty, no overly-hard crust, fresh toppings, etc, etc) and I'm somewhat of a health freak to boot. My husband is at least as picky as I am. So when he decided to introduce me to Golden Boy some four or five years ago, I knew it must be something special. 

I was right.

The crust is light and tasty. There's just the right amount of sauce. There's just enough cheese to give it the right taste and texture (no ooey-gooeyness) and the toppings are up to par (get the veggie or the clams & garlic combo). That and a nice choice of beer make this the perfect place to stop in for a bite on a sunny afternoon.
author: Amy K.

description: My go to pizza joint. I love foccacia. Slice of sausage. Slice of pepperoni. Never had a bad slice.
author: Aj S.

description: Locals know.  Mount a bar stool and evince beat worn nonchalance. Patience pays. Sports viewing is guaranteed. A flash baked slice of combo rivets the tongue. Late night reveals a tableaux of drunken goofs, and there is no doubt reason for such chaos.
author: Dana B.

description:
I lived up the street and enjoyed this place quite often for lunch.  The place is usually pretty empty during the day.  It wasn't until my first 
Friday night there that I realized how great this place was.  My ex and I went in for a slice and had to wade through the crowd like we were at a concert,  no problem,  our slices were out in two mins and we were out the door.  Great food,  great atmosphere,  even in the daytime,  and great people.
author: Kevin G.

description:
While making a homemade pizza with my boyfriend tonight,  far away from San Francisco, I thought of Golden Boy and their lovely pizza. This is my favorite SF pizza joint (I'm a Zachary's girl in the east bay), and I try to eat here whenever I am in the city. The pizza is fresh, hot, and the toppings are delicious. It's also casual and inexpensive and the servers have always been friendly.

I can hardly wait to get back home and pay a visit to GB.
author: Lane H.

description:
Calling all pizza lovers: If you haven't been to Golden Boy, you're missing out!

From the veggie combo to their pesto pizza, it hits the spot every time.  The thick crust is reminiscent of a focaccia bread. So yummy!

Pluses:
-Relaxed atmosphere
-Cheap eats
-Pizza by the slice so you can order any of their specialties without having to buy a whole pie.
-Open late night for take out
author: Lauren T.

description: Just like Italy only cheaper! I loved it. The beauty was in the simplicity, 6 flavors to choose from at $3.50 a slice ( more like a hunk o pizza). Delish!
author: Brooke C.

description:
It was my itty bitty little Asian legs that prevented me from seeing in through the window of this place.  

Then it was my deep-seeded desire to die an early heart-disease event that kept me walking through the door and sat at the counter.  A whole baking tray worth of pizza.  Fluffy crust.  Melty cheese with caramelized bits like sun spots.  Very little exposed cheese-less crust.

The boy behind the counter was cute.  If I was more bold, drunk, or from out of town and hanging out in North Beach because I thought it was the snap, I would have hit on him.  But because it was cold, rainy, I wasn't wearing enough layers and b/c I have a BF, I didn't.  

The slices here are rectangular like in public school lunches.  Unlike public school lunch pizza, this was not raw in the middle.  The crust held up to the cheese and the sauce.  The bread was chewy and substantial yet not thick and gummy.  I ate it with a knife and fork.  I am a lady.

The only downside of this pizza was that too much sauce pooled in the center of the pan resulting in too much sauce at the edge of the pizza.  I liked the sauce.  It had nice flavor.  I just wish I had more pizza to go with it.

I think there are around 50 gazillion pizza places I need to try first before coming back here for seconds.
author: Christina C.

description:
Their cheese pizza is pretty standard, tastes a lot like Pizza Huts pan pizza.  Their pesto vegetarian, however, is the best pesto pizza I've ever had.  It's more like thin focaccia than pizza but it's delicious none the less.  A slice of pesto and a drink, for $5, makes a pretty awesome lunch.

The lady working the counter is also very quick and friendly.  The place itself is very laid back and casual with stools against the wall, light rock music and cool air flowing. 

The cash only rule is the only reason it's not a 5 star place for me.
author: Mack D.

description: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Yes, all the rumors are true. This is the BEST pizza in SF. I know its a bold statement, but it is true. My litmus test for pizza is that it tastes as good during the day as it did the night before. Golden Boy is amazing for lunch as it is after a few pints in North Beach.
author: Sagar P.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

Odd that Olma never mentioned that her new boyfriend was Sicilian. It's nice to find that here. I've been looking for a Sicilian slice for about 8 years. It's not my absolute favorite but I like to have it sometimes.

This place is cramped and quick. The server was cool under pressure and helpful to customers that asked for the bathroom, an explanation of the slices present, an account of what kind of pizza was freshest out of the oven (he even told the guy what was coming out in the next few minutes).

$2.50 for a decent sized square reheated to order. All the requisite spices nearby. Would hate to be here when it is busy though.
author: Bob R.

description:
I think this is my favourite pizza in the city.  What is more, I always end up getting it completely blotto, drunken ripe in a santa costume around christmas time for Santa Con.

This pizza has always made me happier than any pizza I have ever eaten.  I promise I won't say it is the best pizza ever, but every situation I have ever had in getting this za.... has ended up being one of the best pizza experience I have ever had.  Multiple times.

Hooray for that.  Hooray.  

I will be there in the next couple days.  That happens sometimes... when the memory of the joint I am reviewing is so strong I need to have it again.

This is one of those reviews... oh joy!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Seriously, I live for late night pizza.  Ok, pizza anytime.   I like the pizza here, seriously.   The only downside is that i got food poisoning here 2x.  My guess is that its from the pizza that sits in the WINDOW, with all the dirty north beach germs and other crap floating in.   
Please move the pizza away from the window so no one else gets puking ill.
author: Dan G.

description:
Kept hearing about Golden Boy from a fellow PHXer. It was his kids' favorite pizza in the world and he always had to take them to Golden Boy when they visited SF. 

Eventually we made it, and it was worth the trip. That was several years ago. Just went again a few weeks ago and finally remembered to YELP it. Lo and behold, one of those kids is all growed up and is just a few reviews down on this page. Hi, Soph B!!!

Anyway, GB is just really simple, good sheet pan pizza. Usually not my style, but something about the pans in the window, the punky bar counter and the hundreds of photos and stickers everywhere make it a fun and tasty stop for a slice or 3. The toppings are fairly sparse, so if I were ordering a whole pan, I'd double up, especially on sausage. Have yet to try the clam pizza, but that's next up.

Also, nearly impossible not to get a Stella when the tap is right in front of you.
author: Ron B.

description:
my boy alex and his family own this place.  I came here one night and tried the pizza. it was like 2 am and there was still a fat line outside.... but i finally got my pizza.

wow thats some damn good pizza i would definately reccomend it.  i tried a combo and clam and garlic.  keepin it OG wit the square slices, but pretty good texture fresh ingredients... 

i gotta actually eat there next time tho.  kinda by broadway too.. so u can hit up strip clubs, pizza n beer.. mmmmm ahaha

good job sodini's
author: Eli G.

description: My girlfriend and I were searching for a tasty inexpensive pizza joint in the north beach area and came across this hidden gem. We were intrigued by the pizza on display. Seemed like there pizza was very fresh and tasty. We decided to give it a try, and sure enough we were very pleased. My only disappointment is the lack options with flavors they have to offer. Otherwise the service was great, and the food was great. They also serve beer on tap which is a plus. Overall a great environment, and a good time. Highly recommended.
author: Lennin L.

description:
This place is a gem tucked in North Beach. Forget all the tourist traps on the main drag on Columbus Ave. Walk up Green St. and check out Golden Boy. It is the perfect casual date place or for a late nite snack. It is Sicilian style square slices of perfection. It is a little divey bar and very small inside. Cash only. I was sad that I had only discovered this place recently, I definitely felt like I had been missing out on a staple San Francisco treat! (It's been around since 1978). Seriously, if you want a good cheap slice of pizza or want to get a drink in North Beach, or want to sit in Washington Square Park, stop at Golden Boy. You will not be disappointed. I love the combination slice. It is amazing! 
Also ...they're open til 2:30am on Fri/Sat which is always a plus.. it's always hard to find a late nite snack!
author: Kristy H.

description:
Square pizza? Yeah, I can dig it like that. This pizza fills me up and I like the sauce here for some reason. They got some tasty beers on tap too.

But they gotta ease up on the attitude sometimes and turn down that scary death metal music....Otherwise I'd stay longer and spend more money and get drunk.
author: Tyrone B.

description: Best pizza in the city.  Single slice with only a few choices but what amazing choices.  The place is always busy and for good reason. Have a beer and a slice and you won't regret it.
author: Kevin M.

description: Hot damn!  Satisfied my craving for delicious pizza. I love smart phones for pointing me in the right direction. Keep up the great work!
author: Aaron L.

description: Good pizza with a very thick crust. I enjoyed the combo and clam slices.
author: Karin Z.

description: My mom loves pizza.  Picture a cute and sweet little old Chinese lady chomping down some pizza.  She doesn't get to eat it often because of her diet, but as a treat when I go visit her in Chinatown, I stop by here to get her a slice of the combination slice of pizza. She loves the thick crust and how soft it is.  And it's very tasty!  I've also tried the veggie pizza and it's very good.  I'm not a pizza fan, but sometimes I can't resist taking a bite of mom's pizza...LOL!
author: Lucky M.

description:
My second favorite pizza in San Francisco.  Ask for a corner when you go.

-KB
author: Kattya B.

description:
The negative reviews for this place always try to compare this pizza to other styles of pizza.  Thin crust?  Thick crust?  East/West/Cali? No.
Golden Boy pizza is a square slice kind of like the Ellio's frozen pizza that I'd ate as a kid.  Sicilian slice, we'd call it.
Is it great?
No, but it's brought me and friends temporary carbohydrate happiness.  And this is a funky cool place with loud music playing, a good selection of tap beers and counters to munch your slice.
I've seen the long lines and I don't wait either.  Go when your friends are looking for post-boozing bite before they jump in their cars.
author: Kev M.

description: I recently ate at Paxti's in Lafayette and they have the best pizza to date.. see my review for why. this place is still freakin' amazing but i tend to only give 5 stars to the best of the best, hence the update. this, by no means, however, reduces my want to go here, right. now.
author: Edibleocea N.

description:
When it comes to pizza, it's pretty clear cut... either you're trying to get from point A to point B or you're looking for the perfect blend of ingredients that will send you off into euphoria land after that first bite.

With Golden Boy, the whole "am i getting a good deal" issue just totally vanishes because this place will make you forget all about it.

...and i guess it's one thing to hear it from a local yocal like Alex vs. hearing it from the mothership herself...

So here's the golden formula...personally tried and tested to work instantly...

1. Schedule a Happy Hour at a bar like Columbus cafe
2. Gather your friends/coworkers 
3. Tell them to come straight from work
4. After a few drinks get everybody to try out the Golden boy
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
Like hordes of other drunk belligerents on a Sat night, my friend and Iwandered over to Golden Boy after a night of hopping around Broadway. We were tired, hungry, and our feet hurt like hell.  And then she mentions Golden Boy pizza.  Pizza sounded WONDERFUL so we hiked up to Golden Boy....to find a line of 20+ disgruntled people in line waiting.  It was ridiculous.  But she swore by their pizza, so we waited. 

And waited.

And waited some more.

Oh yes and waited.  "All that waiting for slice of pizza??" youre wondering.  Yes my friend.  20 minutes waiting in line, freezing cold, painful 3 inch heels for a slice of pizza....because the ONLY lady workin the register that night was texting away, not giving a flying rats ass about the line of hungry drunks waiting outside.  I mean c'mon lady, I'm sure your booty text can wait while you finish up the rest of your shift, aiight?  the people got increasingly hostile and belligerent waiting, and then people started to think it was okay to cut in line...and it was just all bad. 

The pizza itself? Very doughy, and very crispy on the bottom.  I've had better pizza elsewhere, and I just wanted to try this for the experience.  But next time I know better and will be heading to Buster's for a cheesesteak sandwich.  And the pizza here ain't cheap, either...$3.75 a slice of combo.  Maybe I've been spoiled by $1.50 fat slices in Berkeley but Golden Boy gets no love from me.
author: Peggy W.

description:
Recently dug up a picture of me in a rocker under the bar here, and now I understand why I crave this place like the air I breathe.

I swear, everytime I go back it gets better (and that would be 25+ years of eating this stuff).

Shout out to Julien and the rest of the boys and girls working the counter and cookin up the magic- you guys rock
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
Many people have made the ridiculous claim that pizza is 1) always good, and 2) hard to screw up.

Wrong on both counts. The truth is that good pizza is very hard to find and Golden Boy is one of the few places to get a decent slice in SF.
author: Jason R.

description: For "greasy" pan pizza, this is as good as it gets. And by "greasy" I mean the oils from the cheese oozing out to glaze the top and drip down your chin as you eat.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Dear Golden Boy,

Why do you not have another location on the central or south end of town?  The clam and garlic is definitely worth the drive/cab ride, but I would certainly indulge in more than a late night, post-drinking nosh if you could see your way to creating a closer outlet...say the Mission? 

Thanks for considering!
author: Julie T.

description:
Their clam & garlic pizza is my most favorite pizza in the whole wide world. It's absolutely covered with fresh garlic, parsley, and clams--my idea of comfort food heaven. The crust is thick and soft, almost like focaccia, but is nicely crispy around the edges.
I love the corrugated metal walls and sitting at the counter. I always feel like I'm on some weird train blaring classic rock that's manned by beer-loving boys. 
It's cheap too--yay all around.
author: Marissa R.

description:
I decided it was finally time to review my beloved Golden Boy Pizza after hitting it up for a hot slice last night right before midnight. Normally, I do not get the late night munchies....but last night I somehow missed dinner and hit up three different bars in the area to visit friends and see a band. I was starving and my crew was not going to make it to the band without something on their stomaches...

As we made our way across Columbus heading up to Grant and Green's, I saw the iconic neon hand in the sky. "Let's get a quick slice at Golden Boy!!" Everyone followed me after my look of horror that they had never been there. How can you live in SF and not have experienced Golden Boy Pizza????

It's delicious, it's hot, its fresh and cheesy and saucy and all those wonderful pizza-esque adjectives you want in a late night snack. Plus they cut it in perfectly portable squares and it's fairly inexpensive. The staff are sarcastic and annoyed with the public....which i kind of like. They play loud punk and rock music and serve beer up until 10pm I think.

All my GBP love aside, I have to say Chad P's review was pretty entertaining to read. That's a pretty common scene in North Beach.
author: Lynsey C.

description:
By far, one of my favorite places in the city and yes, it is worth the wait! I took my boyfriend there on Friday night since he had never been but has heard me rave about it over & over. He couldn't believe how fantastic it was! The crust looks as if it's going to be super thick, but it tastes like a light breadstick with a whole lot of gooey yumminess on top! We had a slice of cheese, pepperoni, & sausage with a glass of cold beer. Great date night! 

If they only delivered.... :)
author: Kim D.

description: Excellent pizza! Love the "by the slice" so we could try a couple different ones.
author: Robin R.

description:
Self-proclaimed Saturday night pubcrawl with 2 girlfriends....$62.00

Potential cab fare to the only 24hour cafe in the city after aforementioned pub crawl.....$51.00

Happily eating a slice of golden boy pizza whilst holding your friend's hair as she yacks in the alley behind it....priceless
author: Nik S.

description:
In a drunken stuper, my cousin says "OH MY GAWwwwwD! WEEEEEEEE HAFT OOH GO TWOO GOLDEN BOY PEEEEESAH!  IT's SOOOOOOOOOO GOOD THERE!!!!  OH MY GAWWWWWWWWWWWWD!!!"

I was sober.  It was okay...nothing great.  Ha, and I love pizza...so, uh...yeah.  

Um, it's good DRUNK food, I guess.  

I prefer Cable Car....*see next review*  =)~
author: Ladi Da A.

description: This is the best place to grab a slice after the bar. Fast service, tastes great! Only bummer is that sometimes they have a line but it's worth the wait.
author: Adam M.

description: Great pizza!  2nd trip w my kids during 5 day stay.  Only complaint is there is not much room to sit...more like a long skinny bar...so we took it to go and ate at the park.  Bring cash!
author: Diane T.

description:
What else is there to say about Golden Boy that hasn't already been said...

OK, how about the root beer refills are free and the clam and garlic will keep even the most ferocious vampires away.

Golden Boy Rocks!
author: Rob K.

description:
Two days ago I drove over sidewalks and yippy pocket dogs to get there and back on a half-hour lunch break's how good.

You think I'm lyin'? I still have tinkerbells wedged in the tire tread.
author: Missy B.

description:
Pepperoni makes me happy. The squares so, so good... especially the pieces without crust.

I'm a fan, day or night. Thanks for keeping me happy.


Cash only though - which can be a bummer for us diehard visa/MC/amex ppl.
author: laura f.

description: If you like pizza then you have got to stop and get a slice here- its amazing! The line can get a bit long but most of the crowds hit the road after they grab a slice to finding a seat inside is usually pretty easy. Next time I am in North Beach I will be having another slice (and probably every time after that!).
author: Shanna T.

description:
someone i know told me about this place and how good it is. i just thought...any pizza in north beach after 1 am is good. so i decided to come here during fleet week with some very nice marines that i wanted to show the real sf. we weren't that tipsy but we knew that in order to keep the night going we needed something greasy to soak up those "support our troops" free shots.  this is the first place we decided to go.

damn... thats all we could say. i think  we must have ordered at least 3 slices each and were just passing the box around for a good 30 minutes letting all the juice drip down our already uncoordinated hands. it was hot and fresh with ample amounts of cheese and the right ratio of sauce to dough. from now on i will make that trek up the hill to get real pizza instead of those little store fronts on columbus or broadway.
author: Ashley H.

description: Grabbed a few slices and a beer before the fireworks on the 4th. I am a pizza purist so I would not normally order any pizza but a classic Neapolitan pie. For what it is this is pretty good stuff especially after a Giants game and with a belly full of $10 beers. Two slices and two beers what was not much more then one of those $10 beers. A great value in North Beach.
author: Raymond L V.

description:
BOTTOM LINE
Solid place for a late night craving of a sicilian slice and a brew in NoBe.
author: christopher r.

description: Wow stumbled on this place last year during the North Beach faire. Awesome pizza. They used foccacia and I had a vegetarian and it was friggin awesome! WooHoo! The place is like a trailer in a bad part of town, but who cares the pizza is kick ass and a beer on a warm day...life is good. I'm sure this place has been there forever and is a part of the North Beach history, so don't just walk by....ORDER....and Crunch away.
author: Susan D.

description:
I've been coming here my whole life.

The pizza is not bad. It's actually OK. And shaped like a square.
author: Stacy M.

description: If you like greasy & crispy, Golden Boy Pizza is it.  My favorite pizza in the city even when I'm not drunk.
author: Duke K.

description:
Most people say otherwise, but I actually enjoy the pizza. It's relatively thick, like you've dumped all your favorite toppings on a generous square of focaccia. It's like the comfort food of pizza for me. 

(As I recall,) Squares start at $3.25 for cheese. And strangely enough, around 2am, a line forms outside. But, I've learned to be patient and ogle which Hangover Helper I'll be selecting.
author: Erin M.

description:
Yeah, so I like this pizza... a lot.  There's been some disagreement with friends, but I'm not here to discuss other people's questionable pizza palates.  

The only thing square about this place is the slices - friendly people, good music and a great beer selection.  On weekend nights there's a line down the street (for takeout), but squeeze your way inside and you can usually grab a spot at the bar.
author: Trevor F.

description:
Perfect North Beach fuel. 
Quick service, good music, nice people, and good pizza. 
I had a slice of cheese and the sauce was superb!

Came in here on a Sunday around 4 after a hike to Coit tower.
Sat at the counter and enjoyed the original atmosphere. 

At tourist destinations its always good to know where you can get a quick cheap bite. Noted.
author: Sari G.

description:
Probably unnecessary to be writing the 208th review for this place, but my opinion of Golden Boy's has escalated after moving to the 'hood.  I have a theory that  this pizza's "quadrilateralness" is its inherent strength.  Does it feel like you're getting more than a traditional "isosceles" piece?  This is a great slice of pizza in North Beach.  They often make a sheet of clam, garlic, and cilantro (?) .  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Keep in mind:  most pizza places are crowded, sub-par, and attempting to close up right around the time that you are drunkely stumbling around Green St. on a weekend night.  If you had a bad experience, give it another shot at an earlier hour.
author: Kerry D.

description: Wowsers. If I could say enough about the crust alone. Slightly crumbly and buttery all at once, heaped with veggies...what an excellent late night snack.
author: Dee I.

description:
Fun and simple pizza.
Not a big menu, not a big price.
Your sitting in a pizza nook in San Francisco, you arnt going to forget that when you are here.  The smell is perfect, taste amazing.
Its fresh, its young, its hot.
author: Chelle B.

description: Perfect combo pizza - lots of rich great flavors, super fast service, neat divey atmosphere... Gotta love North Beach... will definitely be back!
author: Jodie B.

description: I live almost directly above this place so I am tempted to get a slice every day after work.  Be warned that this is not like the traditional napoletana pizza you will find throughout most of little italy.  This is made on thicker focaccia bread in a square baking pan and the slices are square as well.  I have tried most of their different slices and the clam and garlic is by far my favorite.  Grab a slice and cruise around North Beach, you won't be dissappointed.
author: Scott G.

description: Best pizza ever. That's all you need to know. Be prepared to wait in line because the pizza is that good and that worth it.
author: Dariana S.

description: Best sicilian pizza in the city, the same day as the best pizza I've had. I love that they are open late with window service. There was a line at 1am on a Saturday, but took maybe 10 minutes. I had a slice of sausage and a slice of pepperoni, both were excellent.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
Hands down, the best pizza in the world can be found right here!  Anytime I venture over to North Beach, I must finish up the night with a slice or two.  

A date once took me here after drinks and I was hooked (on the pizza).  The place feels like a dive-bar, well, because it is.  Grab a PBR and ask them to turn the Motley Crue up!
author: Dave L.

description:
I really wanted to give this place 4 1/2 with a little bit of a reduction for no available seating and their cash only policy but since i cant, this will have to do.

I just tried this place over the weekend and it is very good.  I ordered their combination pizza and i have to say that it is very good! The thing i liked most about it is its reasonable prices in proportion to their size portions.  I felt like for the 3 bucks i spent on a slice of combo, i got a pretty big slice.    Every kind of pizza in this place looked amazing!  

The other thing i enjoyed about this place was that they re-heat your pizza when you order it.  I know this doesn't sound very appetizing, but if you think of the pizza places that actually make you a fresh slice of pizza when you order it...this is pretty remarkable.  It is not to not just get a pizza that was made in the morning and sat under a heat lamp all day.  Their pizza sits at the window to draw customers in i suppose,  and when you order a slice, they put it back in the oven to re-heat for you.  

Like i mentioned before this place does lose some points for their cash only policy and little to no seating.  A few places in North Beach are cash only also, so i guess this isn't too much of a new problem.  This place is also a bar which means good news for alcohol choice, but bad news for looking for a place to sit.  If you don't come early before the lunch rush or even after the lunch rush, don't expect to find a place to eat.  But hey, its pizza, you can eat it and walk :-)

If your in the area and are looking for very good pizza at a very reasonable price in a very short amount of time, then this place is for you! 

Good Pizza + Reasonable Prices + Fast Service = YUM :-P
author: Mark R.

description: Found this spot on yelp when we were in the city looking for a good pizza joint. Parking is a PITA but once you do find parking you are greeted with a long line. This is a result of having such great tasting pizza. After we went through the line we were able to eat our pizza. It was very delicious. It reminded me of my mom's home cooked pizza. The staff was great. There was one thing that kind of raised an eyebrow. I had asked for them to go but we ended up eating it there and the waiter questioned about eating it to go but was friendly thereafter.
author: zia h.

description: Easily the best pizza I've had in SF.  I live nowhere near here, and make special trips out to North Beach for this pizza.
author: Phil J.

description: Probably one of the best Pizza places in the city! I grew up having pizza from this place since I was young, and enjoyed it ever since. The slices, the flavor, the overall experience of coming here is wonderful. Long lines is a bit of a hassle. But, nevertheless, it's worth it/
author: Daniel C.

description: Best pizza by the slice in north beach! They load it up with danky goodness and it's just as cheap or cheaper than other places. Beer on tap!
author: Jen N.

description: Don't fall for the hype, the pepperoni is the money maker here.
author: eric w.

description:
I LOVE YOU, GOLDEN BOY.

True, it may not be the *best* slice I have ever had.  BUT it does what I need it to do, without fail, every damn time.  
....and what would that be?
1) Fills any room in my belly that is not already sloshing in alcoholic indulgence.
2) One hot fat slice costs less than a beer at any of the local watering holes...  how can that be a bad thing?
3) Unlike most ill advised 2am pizza munching sessions, this slice o' pie actually leaves me feeling just fine in the morning...
maybe even *better* than if I had not gotten greasy fingers while chowing on the gritty sidewalk with a crew of like minded drunks.
4) I LOVE YOU, GOLDEN BOY.



I do have to ask, who in the world would take the time to read a review of Golden Boy *before* eating there?  It needs to be spontaneous, it needs to be an alcohol fueled decision, and trust me...  You will give it 5 stars too.  (Ignore the "hair comments" and have another...  that is just the sort of thing that sobriety will make you notice.)

Cheers!
....oh and I LOVE YOU, GOLDEN BOY!!!
author: Luke D.

description:
They say you can't find good pizza on the West Coast, but to that I say Golden Boy! Just a few different types of slices to choose from, but each is chocked full of tasty items, gooey delicious cheese and a crust that is nice and chewy on the inside and that right amount of crispy on the outside. 

They also have a picture up of the time Tom Waits and Jim Jarmusch stopped in for a slice. If this place is good enough for Tom Waits, then who are you to disagree? Eat it and enjoy.
author: Drew H.

description: I had not been in a while and for the first time, got a slice straight from the oven and took over to Columbus Cafe and it was real good.  It holds it's own above and beyond simple drunk food and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good slice.  Nice sauce and a perfect size for a small snack with your 2 for 1 beer.
author: Marc S.

description: OK, stopped by during a trip cross town over to North Beach.  Haven't been to this place in years, this was my spot back in circa '97 - '99.  Pizza was same but was a little bummed on the service.  I remember '99 ish just strolling  in, taking a seat at the bar and being served.  While waiting you check out all the skateboard and other stickers plastered on walls, frig etc.  Now it appears you stand in a line when you walk in, order, wait for the server to reheat a slice, then find a spot.
author: Eric Z.

description:
Living right across from it has its up and downs. For one, it's an easy fix when you have nothing in the fridge and Chinatown's closed. The combo is just delicious. "Get me the meatiest one!" is what I'd say when I ask my roommate to grab a slice for me. 

It's no Za, but it's decent. 

Down side, despite knowing it's a bad idea, you'd still be tempted to get it for breakfast out of laziness.
author: Fiona S.

description: Great pizza for pennies.  It's a must go...especially bringing it back to Columbus Cafe to eat.
author: Jason E.

description:
Golden Boy was good for what it was, a slice of pizza. It was a long day of drinking and it was time to get some grub in the tummy-tum-tum. We ended up at Golden Boy in efforts to meet a friend we had parted with earlier in the day. She was gone by the time we got there which obviously didn't matter at that point. 

Took a seat at the bar and proceeded to order some pizza and beer. Enjoyed conversing with the bartender. Enjoyed a good slice. Enjoyed good beer. What else can you ask for?
author: alexa c.

description: Came here on a Friday during lunchtime and there was a line outside the door.  I was initially shocked, but then I realized the cashier is right next to the door, so the line wasn't actually that long.  Inside is very small, with the kitchen and bar stools everywhere.  But despite the small space, I didn't find myself squished on the stools.  I ordered the combination pizza which was very good.  I liked the minimal crust and the dough and the topics.  The sauce wasn't soggy which is definitely good, and there was a generous application of cheese and toppings.  My friend ordered the pesto vegetarian (those vegetarians...jk!) and said it was very good.  We probably should have gotten water instead of the Arizona iced tea, but we were ridiculously thirsty.  I'd come back here again, the pizza was a good price, in my opinion.
author: Mabel Y.

description: This was some delicious pizza. I was a little nervous given that it is "thicker". Yes the crust was thicker but it wasn't deap dish style as we know it in Chicago. I had a chance to speak with the guys behind the counter and they told me the reason there crust is airy and not dense is due to the fact that they do not add cornmeal and a bit more yeast to their dough (I was a little intoxicated at this point but I'm pretty sure this is what he said). The sauce was rich and had a little kick to it while the toppings were fresh and flavorful. Big fan of Golden Boy pizza and I will certainly stop by the next time I'm in SF.
author: James Michael S.

description: Square pizza fanatic.  Loved the San Mateo one, this one is absolutely amazing.  Need more soon.  Also they have a fun beer selection, nothing too fancy but enough to please.
author: Kyle M.

description:
I ate here for dinner at least 3x a week on my daily stroll home from work. Whether I was intentionally going that route or not, Golden Boy's tractor beam of warm delicious pizza smell made it difficult to go any other way. 

The thick, crispy 'golden' crust and seasoned sauce should be your first clue that this is not NY-style or Chi-town style pizza, but it's still superb. It's hard to beat 2 super tasty slices and pitcher of beer for $16, especially in North Beach. I like the combo the best, but the pesto veggie is pretty good too. 

The take-out window stays opens past bar time, until they're sold out, or until a fight breaks out between some guidos (probably my cousins) outside of Gino and Carlo.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Yummy in the tummy.

Love this place.  Never full of tourists.... great, friendly staff.  Delicious yummy hot pizza and crack in the oregano makes you want to eat more and more slices.

$3 for a slice of pepperoni... yes please!
author: Derek B.

description: Best drunk food ever! Garlic clam, soooo good. Their Veggie pesto is good as well.. It's all good. Best economy meal: grab slices to go and head to Columbus Caffe for happy hour 2 for 1 drinks.
author: Yessica W.

description:
Best pizza we had on our recent trip to San Francisco.  I'm sure there are other places that are good as well, but Golden Boy was superb!

After having a bad pizza experience (Luigi's on Pier 39), we were really looking to have some good pizza before going home.  We asked a local who they would recommend, and Golden Boy was mentioned.  Learning our lesson, we also checked Yelp! and were happy to see that they had a good rating there as well.

We gave them a try and were not disappointed.  Really great pizza.  We ordered a few slices to go, because the one downside is that Golden Boy isn't a restaurant, but more of a pizza bar.  Only bar seating is available.  We took our pizza and went to check out another pizza place.  However, they were booked and we wouldn't be able to get any pizza from them.  So we went back to Golden Boy and got some more slices to go.  Took them back to our hotel and enjoyed them so much.

Really great pizza.  We loved the crust and toppings.  According to my wife and son, best pesto pizza they've ever had.  Only reason they don't get a full 5 stars is the seating situation.

Recommend this to anyone.  As my wife said afterward, "If I had the money, I'd pay someone to fly down and get me some more Golden Boy Pizza."
author: Daniel G.

description:
I've been here both drunk AND sober and it's delicious each time I go.  This is THE best place to go for a slice of pizza.

The only problem is that it's sooo hard to park here that it can actually be a deterrent.  But, Golden Boy, don't be sad.  It's not your fault.
author: Dianne d.

description:
The pizza here reminds me of the pizza my mom makes at home.  So I guess I'm slightly biased.  Anyway, I love square pizza.  I just love the crust.  love to have a nice corner piece, extra crispy with some crushed red pepper, Parmesan and salt.  

Golden Boy Pizza has a great crust.  simple, traditional toppings and tasty sauce.  No avocado or artichoke hearts at this place...thank god.  

Its great to stroll in here on a Sunday afternoon, grab a slice or two, maybe a beer and watch the football game.  Damn, I wish it was Sunday right now!
author: Raymond F.

description: I love this pizza, This is one of the best places to go if you are craving pizza. I also love the fact that it closes late. Go early on the weekends tho, it packs up quick on Friday & Saturday nights. As a matter of fact, I think I'm gonna go there right now!!!
author: Andre B.

description:
This place by far has the best pizza EVER.
It's a great place to kick back and grab a beer, and pizza. 
Definitely our favorite pizza spot in San Francisco! 
A little bit on the pricey side $2.99-$3.99 but most definitely worth it.
author: Jess K.

description:
First things first...don't let this little place fool you! 
The pizza is AMAZING! I drool over this pizza like the Ninja Turtles used to! (Don't act like you don't remember!) Not only is the pizza good, but it's cheap. 

This place is great after having a few drinks and you want to sober up, or even to stop by on your lunch break if you work nearby! 
You walk in...place your order..have a seat..and they bring the pizza to you. BE SURE TO BRING CASH, SINCE THEY DON'T TAKE CREDIT CARDS! 


This place looks like a typical hole-in-the-wall, but another great surprise is that their bathroom is CLEAN! I couldn't believe it and that to me deserves 5 stars in its own right.

The only problem is they sometimes run out of silverware and you're stuck trying to cut your slices with a plastic fork and knife, which is a huge chore! Also, even though there is a tiny parking lot across the street you have to pay for...parking on the street for free is a little bit of an issue since the North Beach area ALWAYS seems to be busy!
author: Christine S.

description:
Best pizza in the city!!!!!!!!

I can't tell you how many times I have drunkenly found my way to this place.  It has saved me from numerous hangovers.

Deep dish deliciousness.
author: Jules G.

description:
Yummy square pizzas, reminds me of being in Roma!! Everything looked so good and piping hot.
We got the pesto vegetarian (it had tons of veggies and black olives) and the clams & garlic-  (it was green, what was that? green garlic? parsley??) who cares, it was so garlicky GOOD!
author: Heidi L.

description:
My favorite cheapie pizza in the city.
It is what it is; greasy "gutterpunk" pan style.
We have planned entire day trips to North Beach  centered around a stop there.
The music, stickers, and impressive selection of draught beers make me happy.
author: Rachel D.

description: I love love love love love this pizza.  First time I had it was ages ago with my cousin who lived up the street. We were on "the piss" and so were hungry from all the drink we'd had.  This place is truly golden in it's deliciousness.  I've hooked my boyfriend on this pizza and whenever we're hungry and in North Beach we head to this place.  I have to say I'm unbelievably excited to see there is one on the peninsula now.  The delicousness is closer!!!!
author: Colleen M.

description: Golden boy is da truth! The veggie is on point!
author: L. M.

description: After a night of healthy drinking in North Beach, I always crave the delicious bakery style pizza of Golden Boy. The pizza is so good, highly reccomend it if your in the area!
author: Michael C.

description: I've been eating Golden Boy's Pizza for years and it's still my most favorite pizza in the city. It hits the spot so good. Try the Clam Garlic or Combo...the best of the best!
author: Sarah Z.

description: I had always wanted to get a slice somewhere in North Beach as I am not from the area and don't make it up to the city too often.  So when Yelp led me to Golden Boy Pizza, this self-proclaimed pizza afficionado was pleasantly surprised by the light, buttery crust and the perfect spices on their pepperoni slice.  The pesto was also pretty good, but I wish they had more flavor options.  Maybe a pep/sausage???  I would definitely go back.  Nothing fancy, but it hit the spot!
author: Jason B.

description:
My mouth waters just thinking about the pizza at this place.  

Came here to try out what everyone swears by after a night at the North Beach bars.  The aroma of the pizza just knocks you right out as you stand in that line that never goes away.  Pretty quick and friendly service.  The combination pizza that I got was topped with meat and veggies without a single spot missed!  Those wonderful toppings were supported by a layer of thick, gooey, yuuuumy cheese! Crust was not burned or soggy.... everything was made just right!  I literally inhaled this whole thing before I reach the end of the block.  Too bad the slices are a little too small.  I'm definitely looking forward on trying the rest of their menu.  Can't wait!
author: Maggie L.

description:
An excellent choice for pizza in North Beach. I like that there's a different assortment of pizzas displayed by the window. Once you choose your slice(s), the guy behind the counter puts your pizza in a salamander broiler (I think that's what the machine is called) and toasts up the pizza. It only takes a few minutes (depending if there is a large crowd or not) and then serves you the pizza piping hot! 

This place has character, too. There's stickers, drawings, and pictures all around the walls. There's nothing pretentious about this joint.

As for the pizza itself, it's made on foccacia dough with a good amount of toppings . . . it's delicious, it's wonderful, it's terrific. My favourite is the pesto, cheese vegetarian. Golden Boy also has a pretty good beer selection.

The only downer is that this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Audrey S.

description:
Golden Boy has many interesting varieties of thick pan pizza. I like it. Personally, I'm not the hugest fan of thick pizza, but it has it's place in the pantheon of pizza styles.

This is a unique San Francisco hole-in-the-wall, that has honed its craft. They have earned their stars, so to speak, among the myriad of North Beach pizzerias.

I like the quirky overdone decor inside. The beers on tap don't hamper my enthusiasm either.

I'll stop by for a square, whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Berg W.

description: Pizzas are growing on me, all because of I came one night at Golden Boy. The square pizzas were an open invitation so I gulped them down with joy.  It's always packed and each time I almost had to squeeze myself through the door. But I'll wait even if it takes a long time, it's worth it and I won't regret.
author: Kenneth L.

description: Best.  Pizza.  In.  SF.  Don't know how I could state this any better.  Cash only, so come prepared!  I highly recommend the veggie pesto pizza (my number one favorite), and I also had an affair with the clam pizza.  Downside - there is always a long line.  And it's a hell of a trek from the Mission to North Beach.  But the price is right, and the pizza is fabulous.  Golden Boy, I love you dearly.
author: Jenna C.

description: If you are drunk enough you will not mind the getting cold standing in line at 1am because you know the joy of finally sitting on a stool and chowing down a spectacular slice of pizza.  (You may claim it's the best thing you've ever eaten, but that's the booze talking.)
author: Rob Z.

description: Strolled in here late on a Monday night and was in Heaven. Got the combo and a pepperoni. The combo was great but the pep was even better simply because you could just taste the simple flavors together instead of everything thrown together on the combo. The sauce is...yowzers. Delicious. Loved sitting against the wall looking at all of the little stickers. The slices are cheap but big. My girlfriend and I shared a 3rd piece and were done for the night. I really want to come back here the next time I visit.
author: Jet S.

description:
Wow!   I just happened to stumble upon this gem while wandering through the North Beach area.  With a hunger in my belly, I yearned for a nice pizza slice, except not at the fancy Italian places that lined Columbus.  Lo and behold, here is a place for your hunger pangs and pizza craves.

Golden Boy Pizza doesn't try to be something that it isn't.  The plain inside, stickers on the wall, simple beer choices (btw, Hemp Ale is one of the best microbrews I've tasted from the area), and no nonsense pizza. 

The pizza is Roman-style, cut into giant rectangles, and toasted for ya in the oven.  I'll be sure to come back when I am in the area.  A+.
author: Dan D.

description: Great place to go after an evening of drinking or for a quick snack. The pizza is great and they usually have a lot of options to choose from. It's a bummer that it's cash only but definitely worth the wait if you are craving a good pizza by the slice. The crust is what sets them apart from the other by the slice places and the service is fun and nice. During the day it's mostly tourist but at night you have to fight the drunken crowd, which is great if you are in the mood to make new friends.
author: Hayley H.

description: I will give it up to Golden Boy.  The best pizza in SF.  I am always satisfied when I eat here and recommend it to everyone, even pizza snobs like myself.
author: Jessica B.

description: This place has pizza, soda and beer and I think that is pretty much the whole menu. The pizza is delicious and comes in square slices. I believe they have about 5 varieties of pizza. You can get 2 slices and a drink for under $10 I think so it is a good quick lunch spot. If you need an easy pizza place in SF this is the place for you.
author: Patrick G.

description:
I absolutely love this pizza joint. Their garlic & clam pizza is to die for. Only thing is that it's usually all gone by the late evening, but they have a veggie combo that's pretty tits too.

They have a good beer selection and it's relatively cheap for what you get (Note: ask the guys to warm up the pizza until it's a little bit crispier). Staff is kool and not that big of douches go there.
What I really love about this place is they all ways have sports playing which is perfect if you just got off work and you wanna catch a game, brew, and a slice!!
author: geritol S.

description:
amazing pizza at amazing prices, i feel if this was a chain store and had commercials all up in your tv they would probably use a generic motto like this,

but luckily its a nice little pizza parlor/bar with that little italy feeling.

Walking back home from union square i would get golden boy pizza after reviewing it on yelp.

firstly the price for a pizza slice is hella cheap 
secondly the size of that pizza slice is hella big
thirdly the deliciousness of that pizza slice is helllllla amazing

especially when it comes fresh out of the oven.
i would basically recommend EERYTHANG but be careful you have to REALLY LOVE garlic to get the clam/garlic
author: Ryan S.

description:
Got a pepperoni slice, a cheese slice and a coke.  The place is really small, and I couldn't deal with the potential claustraphobia, so I got mine to go.  Fast and friendly service, and tastey food.  I think the dough is garlic dough which makes the pizza have a special quality.  The pizza is pretty greasy, so not for the "pizza blotters".  Worth the wait in line.

I wrote this on another site, but it pretty much sums up how I feel about Golden Boy, especially since I haven't had it in months....:

"I will trek 9 blocks uphill to eat this pizza. It is just that good. I will buy it and stand out on the street because it is too crowded. It is just that good. I will think about day after day until I have it. It is just that good."
author: Asha H.

description:
Would I love Golden Boy Pizza as much if I wasn't drunk every time I ate it?  I'm not so sure... drunken me would probably post 4 stars, sober me is posting 3 stars. 

The crust is a tad too thick and the slices a bit too greasy but you can't beat the price, service and ease since it's located just a mere block away from my apartment.
author: Lan H.

description:
I'm in the minority camp here and have to say I'm not impressed at all with Golden Boy Pizza.  Came here around the ever popular time of 11 p.m.  It is a typical spot for the north beach drunkards and homeless which is to be expected around these parts.   

The pizza itself was lifeless and there was nothing to it.  In fact after I had a slice I was disappointed and wanted to eat more ... just not here.  Sure the french bread crust was crispy and hot but  the sauce was lacking and honestly where was the cheese here?  

When I think of good late night pizza, this place will not come to mind.  A boring piece of pizza and a boring review; nothing golden about either.
author: Bill P.

description:
damn, all i think about is golden boy when someone talks about pizza. I mean seniores is good but, not golden boy good. This place is GO! GREEN LIGHT! The pizza crust is made from focaccia bread... which makes the pizza just that perfect pizza. The crust is so light, flaky and buttery! ugh... *drooling*. 

The pizza is priced at $3.50 and it's a pretty big slice, but i can eat 2 for sure. I'm a man, i need more than two slices. When i come here i always order the pepperoni or the combo slice. They both come with an ample amount of meat which is what i look for when i get pizza as well! I love pepperoni and i love sausage! 

Whenever you're in north beach make sure you stop by golden boy... the line is long on the weekend nights.. and make sure you walk there from you're current location, parking is difficult! AGAIN PARKING IS DIFFICULT!
author: Brian P.

description:
As much as I don't like "bready" pizza, the garlic-clam pizza is really damn tasty. The standard slices, not so much, but the garlic-clam? Oh yeah.

I try not to think of it as "pizza", I try to think of it as a "hot, open-face sandwich" that I have to eat with a fork and knife. Once I get my head around that, it really hits the spot. Plus it's a cheap meal for the area, has plenty of beverage options and the counter girl is friendly. What's not to like? Just don't make a special trip out here, unless you are REALLY into cheesy bread smothered in garlic, clams and parsley.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Pizza is decent here, ONLY if you eat it right after they heat it up. If you take it home, it won't taste as good even if you reheat again. 

Came here tonight to pick up some pizza to-go because my boyfriend was craving it and a weird guy who was sitting on the stools literally got off his seat and pushed me out the door.
