He pretended to look at the pizzas by the window and just pushed me hard, then laughed it off and said some stupid things. Hurted my back and neck.  Didn't know what his freaking problem was. The server girl just laughed it off like it was NORMAL, and said "Oh look, now you've scared her and she looks like she wants to run away."

Maybe Golden Boy Pizza needs to hire a security guard soon.  (plus its located next to a bar!)

Minus one star for the rude server and customer. 

Minus one star for the price, and minus a last star for its pizza being nothing special.
author: C L.

description: Two slices, a bud lite, and a cup of SF's finest water for $10 flat. Not bad. Cash only. I dropped by here during the North Beach Festival with my husband. We heard from my friend that we needed to try the pesto clam pizza which was very garlicky. It was good but I think I am going to just get the sausage with veggie slice next time. The crust is nice and chewy with the right amount of crisp on the bottom. My husband had a slice of the pepperoni pizza. He enjoyed it. Line was long but the guy who served us was nice. There were two lines, one outside which was moving slower than the line inside.  We grabbed two stools in the back and enjoyed our pizza there.
author: Bling L.

description:
cant go wrong. i cant even explain it. its sO frkn good. 

my only complaint is that so man others know about it. so the wait is always tooo long! =(
author: Lisa N.

description:
No, I wasn't drunk when I ate here. In fact, I was hungry and grumpy. I don't live in the Bay Area anymore, so I don't have a default pizza place to go to. I wanted to check Golden Boy's out after some shopping, so I dragged my bf for a mile and half from the heart of Union Square, through Chinatown, past Broadway's ta-ta bars, and straight past all the other Italian joints. We (read "He")  almost gave up on trying to find this place (hungry and grumpy)....until BAM,  we see the "magic finger."

We're thin crust type of peoples, but we thought the pizza was pretty good. Then again, maybe I was just really hungry and my bf was just relieved. 

I must say though - you gotta try a clam and garlic slice....I mean, where else can you find that?
author: Giselle U.

description: My boyfriend took me here last weekend and it was probably the best pizza I've ever tasted, hands down. We got here around 11PM on a Saturday night, and there was already a line outside of the door with a couple drunk people here and there. Took a little over 5 minutes to order our food. We ordered a slice of garlic clam pizza and combination. The garlic clam pizza was TOO garlicy for me (and I usually LOVE garlic), but my boyfriend said it usually isn't that much garlic so I don't know. The combination was really good though! I also like how the pizza slice is a rectangle. Mmm, Golden Boys made me love Sicilian pizza.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Apparently, I have not researched Yelp long enough to have found this place.  How did I NOT know about Golden Boy until last Friday??  I actually met someone at a Meet Up and was told to go eat there for dinner.  So I did...and it was the best $7.50 I have spent in a long long time.  I got there around 9:30 and it wasn't too crowded but all the seats were taken inside.  The service was good and quick and we took our to-go orders out the door in less than 5 minutes! 

My friends and I practically ran home (1 1/2 blocks away) to eat the pizza because it smelled so good.  We tried Veggie Pesto, Clam Garlic, and Combo. BUT don't let those square pieces deceive you....I ordered two thinking it would be just perfect...but I barely made it through my first piece.  And I just haaad to try my second piece so I took a couple bites and was defeated.  I saved it for lunch the next day...and still good!  

I can't wait to try this place AFTER a night out in North Beach!
author: Helen V.

description: Only had the cheese. Great in a thick crust, ample cheese. 4 stars even after accounting for the patriotic regalia, which is over the top.
author: Mark T.

description:
I love Golden Boy... my favorite meal from our trip to San Francisco cost about 8.00 for both of us.  It's cheap and really good.  

Very rich and garlicky, vampires beware!
author: Stacy L.

description: Went here  on a Friday night.  The line was long and we had to wait outside.  The girl at the counter was very rude and charged us for 3 slices when we had only bought 2.  The pizza was good but service was bad.
author: Kelly E.

description: I ordered two sheets of combination and pesto on the phone in advance.  I didn't expect they took phone order because it was not available on Yelp description. However, it took one hour to pick it up due to heavy demanding from walk in order. Overall it tasted wonderful. crust and dough is quality. I will definitely come back. I might try to come to another branch in San Mateo.
author: Jae R.

description: I tried it for the first time when my bf got a whole sheet for take out. I liked that they have no crusts, which means more pizza!  Individual slices are shaped in a square so you get a huge serving of thick doughy goodness. It's pretty small inside so we took it to-go and ate it in the park down the street.
author: Queena T.

description: AMAZING pizza! And really friendly and quick service. I just with they had had the clam garlic pizza so I could try it.
author: Nichole R.

description: good, cheap and next to Gino & Carlo
author: Susanne C.

description:
Quintessential San Francisco spot; like a old friend you know you can count on.  Oh, dear friend, you are always there at the right time. 

Out drinking? check. In No Beach? check. Need something to soak up the booze? check.  Go no further. Golden Boy will be your golden boy!  This is fabulously doughy pizza with the right amount of sauce, cheese and pepperoni - you can taste the fat content and it is good..  (order pepperoni; it's perfect!).  Turns out they event have been and 'fine wine' (ha!) - never looked for that before, but good to know.

Yes, there will likely be a line.  Yes, there is amazingly limited seating inside.  Not meant for the dining culinary experience.  Meant to serve up good, quick, cheap pizza for your walk to the next bard!  Oh, and um, why oh why would anyone ever order pizza with clams on it? eeewwww. It's your own fault if you didn't like that.
author: Danielle R.

description:
I love crispy square pizza! mmmmmm...Golden Boy! The 15 minute trek from the office up to your loving arms was worth every step. 

Clam & Garlic...'nuff said. 

Recommendations: 
Clam & Garlic 
Pesto 
Combination 

All extra crispy please!
author: Lisa T.

description: I may have been hammered at the time, but the pizza here is absolutely delicious!  They have kept their menu simple, their prices reasonable, they stay open late, their service is fast, and everyone loves a cheesy, thick pizza.  Yummmmm.
author: Kim N.

description:
After a night of bar-hopping in North Beach, Golden Boy Pizza is cheap and delicious.  Lots of cheese, good sauce, nice crust.

The best part?  You can go there when sober and it still tastes good.  Haven't gone past plain cheese or pepperoni yet, but I'm sure the other kinds are just as good.
author: Matt N.

description: Are you kidding me???   This place is awesome... (and I hate using that word).  Well worth the walk up from Fisherman's Wharf.  Words cannot express how badly I want a piece of that pizza right this second...
author: Kirk T.

description: Cheap fast late night spot in North Beach. The square pizza is a real hit, and served up later into the evening. Really like the sausage pizza, along with veggie.
author: James B.

description:
Great place.  Good pizza, tasty beer and cool atmosphere.

Good veggie slice,sausage&pepperoni as well.  Hemp Ale =A++

I highly recommend this place.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Watch out Arinell's!  I think Golden Boy might be my new favorite skeezer pizza dump.  

First of all, hi, they have beer here.  Which just gives me an excuse to sit there and lust after pizza boys longer.  Unfortunately, the one workin today wasn't very hot, but he WAS a total cock.  I knew this was the spot when he told two patrons that he doesn't wash glasses after 4 o'clock, so they'd be getting beer in plastic cups.  If this weren't in North Beach, I would think he was an ass, but I mean, really, have you seen the kind of people who hang out in that neighborhood?  I'd be committing homicide up and down the street if I had to serve those douchebags day in and day out. 

So, yeah.  I plan on going back and ogling other pizza boys there, who I just gotta believe will be HOTT.

Oh, the pizza?  Yeah, it's alright.  Hearty squares, reasonably priced.  I think maybe the sauce is kind of watery though, because all my cheese kept wanting to slide off my slice.  But I gave up on certifiably good pizza in SF years ago, so I'm just in it for the skanky dudes who serve it up now.
author: Coco D.

description: Best pizza in the hood even though I once had slice with a screw in it back in the day when I was a kid; jamming "green onions" on the old school juke box.  Also, 5 stars to the server who has to deal with all the late night drunk doops.
author: D A.

description: The perfect spot to grab a great tasting slice of pizza and a beer before taking a nice stroll through North Beach.  It's got a cool dive bar appeal to it and the gal working the counter was super nice. Not ideal for large parties or parents with kids in tow.  Warning, they play explicit Gangsta Rap so be forewarned you may hear the B, F, and P word while dinning, one could be so fortunate ; )
author: Robert M.

description: Great doughy crust but the slices could use more heft. Very friendly staff and appealing urban decor. I tend to come here if I am in the area and want something quick. Do you think they knew what Golden Boy means when they named it?
author: Alex A.

description: This square pizza is so dank. Good deal too as the pieces are massive. Lots of types to choose from. I'm headed there right now!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: It's a bummer that they don't deliver but making the journey there is totally worth it. They have a good beer selection and the pizza is awesome. And they have a matt cain poster.
author: Amanda M.

description: Seriously, how is this place anything BUT  a 5 star? The pizza is unreal! They've got a good selection of beer, the music is great and the staff is wicked cool! Bar-none, best pizza around. And for the price, it can't be beat!
author: Rich P.

description: Still my fave pizza place in North Beach; so good, esp after hours....YUM! My fave here is the Clam & garlic- 1 slice @ $3.75. Just right for a light lunch
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
OK,

I love Golden Boy slices.  Love it...tasty as hell.  I've never had it sober though.

And would you Left Coast freaks stop calling it Sicilian?  Sicilian Pizza is rectangular but approaches 2 inches in thickness....this stuff is more like Red Baron...3/4 inch thick.

It's tasty food anytime past 1 AM.  But, and pay attention because I'm not going to repeat myself IT.IS.NOT.SICILIAN.

And "Best Pizza in SF?!?!"  Dude, who's your dealer, because my guy retired and you obviously get some good shit.
author: Jay W.

description:
Sicilian-style pizza always reminds me of being a little kid, it's the kind of pizza my mom liked best and we'd almost always get this style growing up. 

I need to remember to bring mom to Golden Boy's next time she's visiting, because it's the BESTEST Sicilian-style pizza I've had in forever. The crust is deep dish and walks that delicate balance between perfectly crispy and soft and chewy with ease. 

Skip the Italian tourist traps in North Beach and walk up the hill to Golden Boys instead!
author: Jeska D.

description:
YUM! Pizza was super yummy and great service. What I love about this place is the atmosphere and decor. It's super casual with stickers plastered all the over wall with random music (last, I was listening to classical music). Oh, and they serve beer on tap. 

I noticed that a lot of people come by after work for a quick bite and they're usually reading. Except for me, I was yapping away with my friend and enjoying myself - no one seemed to mind. :-) 

Bar seating only. 

**Cash only**
author: Gladys C.

description:
For the lazies, bullets for quick reading:
- Light, tasty pizza that ranks above average
- Fab service coming from the 2 man/woman team in a sea of dozens of customers
- They don't care about wasting a couple of dollars to let you have fresh slices.
- Neat-o facts on the walls (try to find the blurb on George Harrison)
- Suitable prices for biggie slices

M: YUMMMMMYY!

 After biking around s.f. for two hours friends and I decided that we were hungry!! Considering that we were in North Beach, what was better to eat other than the infamous North Beach Pizza that we have eaten only twice. But the Lombard St. Hill beat us up and the nearest location was too far for us to catch the bart on time to go back home to Berkeley. Wandering little Italy it became quite clear that we should follow that neon Pizza sign in the distance. 

The place is a counter and stool kind of place- not the sit down and enjoy the ambiance of the room kind of thing. When you walk in, its quite dark and has a grungy kind of feel to it judging by the free form flyer/poster/ stickering on the walls. Despite the avant art on the wall and the grungy feel to the room you are welcomed with the aroma of pizza, great two team service, and unlimited fountain soda refills.

 Being famished and rolling four deep, I thought it impossible to actually get counter space and stools altogether. BUT we did it. After deciding that a whole pie is kinda pricey to be split amongst us and would require a thirty minute wait- we decided to get individual slices (we have to catch the bart!!) 

The pizza was amazing! It had great flavor and the texture was perfect, it crust was crisp but light and airy. I had the obligatory pepperoni slice as a tester slice and just to tell you- they don't skimp on the meat! I also split half a combo slice with Zack that had yummy sausage, pepp., and some veggies. After one and a half slices I was stuffed! What a perfect ending to our biking adventure in San Fran. 

Z: Exactly true! The server helping us, awesome! In the midst of the rush that followed us, she just totaled our order and saved it for the end, very nice. She didn't rush us like the usual hole in the wall in SF. The final price was a couple of dollar shy of the full sheet of combo that we were intending to buy - but keep in mind, we did buy drinks and left sufficiently stuffed. Fabuloso!

The lady also suggested to wait a bit for a fresh pizza to come out... what a relief! There is still a place that cares. This does not make sense to me since the old pizza will probably not make profit and will go into the bellies of the workers. Very nice gesture.

We both felt this place doesn't get much attention, so we decided to give a great pizza place a good review. Great place to catch a slice, but I would imagine that getting a seat would be hard during the afternoon.
author: ZacKandMeL M.

description: The Mighty Golden Boy oh how I loathe for you at times. Un-Healthy as you may be,  your Sicilian-style, square sliced deliciousness is worth the wait in line! There is absolutely nothing better to combine with the Alcohol flowing through my body at 2am on a Saturday night,  than a slice of Golden Za!
author: Cord N.

description: This is the very best Sicilian style pizza I've ever had. I don't eat pizza often becuase I am a tough critic, but this place is my new favorite!  Too bad I live six hours away!  ..Except that I would probably get fat on Golden Boy if I lived in SF.  Enjoy!
author: Mandy H.

description:
I'm already craving it and I just had 2 savory slices last night! I had some before I went drinking so I could really enjoy it, but as many know, it's the only place to be for a slice after too many spirits! You may have to wait in line at the window but that's part of the fun. Once you get it, sit down on the sidewalk and consume pure square-cut pleasure while the rest just drool.

If you haven't had Golden Boy, go now! Hell, I would cab it across town just to get a slice.
author: Dave R.

description:
1:30am, Friday night.
Wandering North Beach, drunk.

"Hey, I'm hungry. Let's find some pizza."
   "There's a place very there called 'Golden Boy'"

"Hey lady, how much for two slices?"
   "$6"

10 minutes later...

"I'm stuffed. Thank you, patron saint of late night pizza-by-the-slice"

Considering the deliciously satisfying-while-drunk pizza as well as the cute drunk chick who started feeling everyone up in line while yelling "Today's my birthday!" and "LET'S GO BRONC-OS," Golden Boy gets my seal of approval for making me not hungry, when I had been just a moment before I saw it's neon sign shining through the middle of the foggy night.
Yum.
author: Aaron J.

description:
Best pizza in the city after a night of drinking. The fact that this place also serves beer makes Golden Boy close to perfect. Be sure to get here before they close the doors and make you wait in line outside. As fun as the people watching can be at that time of night I'd prefer to sit inside with my beer and slice.

Golden Boy is where it's at!
author: Jessica C.

description: Great great pizza! Awesome service, variety of beers and alcohol options, amazing vibe, will definitely come again !
author: Omer P.

description: Best sicilian pizza I've had in SF.  Really cool little pizza joint.  Beware going here late night you're bound to stand in long lines.  Going in the middle of the day isn't so bad.  The pizza is placed in the window for you to view before you order at the counter.  They re-heat the pizza pefectly.
author: Sean W.

description: Great late night option in north beach. Cheesy goodness.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
Oh. My. God.  Best pizza in the city, served in a square. I love square pizza (yeah, yeah, Sicilian. I call it SQUARE).  Their vegetable pizza is worth getting out in the rain for.  So is their cheese.  And their pepperoni.  Great place to stop in for a quick slice and a beer (or for pizza as dessert if you had the misfortune to dine at LaFelce).

Four stars because they don't deliver, which forces me to call North Beach Pizza.  Because just because it's WORTH going out in the rain for doesn't mean I actually want to.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Clam & Garlic: Delicious...so good, I think they put crack in it

The fight to the death over the last few slices of pizza once last call hits is also quite entertaining.
author: Ellen B.

description: as a huge fan and lover of pizza i have to say this is the best pizza ever! and i come from homemade authentic Italian pizza that my nono makes. the sauce is not to sweet and the atmosphere is awesome i love all the stickers. Im planning a trip back to SF just for this pizza.
author: Angelina A.

description: this by far has been the best pizza i have ate. The dough alone is amazing, buttery, with a crispy bottom and fluffy top layer with not so much cheese and sauce. Hits the spot and no u just cant eat one slice. awsome pizza.
author: Humberto L.

description:
IT"S EXCELLENT - AFTER A NIGHT OF A LOT OF DRINKING...

Other then that, hit up North Beach pizza if they're open.  WAY BETTER.
author: Noneya B.

description: I have a love affair with Golden Boy Pizza. It's absolutely delish. It's not like North Beach Pizza or Blondies. It's better! I can't ever order just one warm slice. I have to have two, with a soda. Speaking of ordering, it's CASH ONLY. You'll find that Golden Boy gets busy with people coming from other clubs and bars in the area. I hate that parking is so troublesome in North Beach. I guess I'd drive around for an hour for Golden Boy Pizza. He does mean that much to me.
author: Audrey B.

description: Good Beers on Tap. Pizzas unique and Tasty, butwatch out for the Hot Sauce. Made me cry.
author: Matthew H.

description: Yum!  My alcohol infused body thanks you for bringing out a fresh sheet of pizza just as we were sitting down at the counter.
author: brewgirl b.

description:
I wouldn't make this a destination location, but I think that's the point.  It's good for a quick bite if you're in the area.   If you're not in the mood for a sit-down restaurant or only have $4 in your pocket, this place is a good bet.  

If you dine-in, the pizza, which is reheated in their oven, is crispy and less doughy.  If you take a few slices home, it's too bread-like if you don't heat it properly.  They've got good flavor but the dough is too focaccia like for me...
author: Bruce B.

description:
When looking for Tony's pizza (around the corner) we found this place. Glad we did!  Great pie. Thick crust. Great sauce.

Not going to win awards for decor and definitely does not send the "families welcome" message but still a great pizza place.

With that said we did take the kiddos here.  But we were here before the assumed 20-30s crowd showed up.  Had to explain a few "odd" stickers on the walls to our kids.  But other than that service was friendly, and fast.  Pizza was great.  Soda was good.  

Counter seating only so don't expect to sit down across from friends and chat it up.

Large TV showing mostly sports was welcome.  

A little dark in there and bathroom was...well.....tired looking.

I'd put this place on my walk-by-hungry-for-a-great-slice list.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: I might give this place a try again sometime if I'm ever in the area, but for now it's gonna get 3 stars since I got a lukewarm combo slice ($3.75) which didn't taste much different than a slice of Costco pizza ($1.99)
author: Leily P.

description: Best Pizza in the city.  Go there and get a beer and a pizza with a good friend and it will be a great day.  Enjoy!!
author: Tim J.

description: Every time I've been to this place it's been in the wee hours of the morning & there has been a long line each time but is well worth the wait.  The pizza is so tasty.  Go & find out for yourself.....you won't regret it.
author: Natacha M.

description:
They were out of the clam and garlic!  So I can only rate them on the Pesto Vegetarian and the Combination - both "A-OK".  Feeling a little guilty about the 3 star rating but that's what these particular pizzas were worth.  

At least the wait wasn't too long, they had fast service, and they're open late night after I tried to hit up both Escape from New York AND Pizza Orgasmica, only to find them both already closed.  I'll update this review after I try the clam.
author: Virginia L.

description:
Oh my guilty pleasures....

If this didn't make me gain massive amounts of weight in a short period of time, I would eat here everyday.  After almost 4 years in the neighborhood, I've realized that not everyone in the city knows of this place which is bit shocking to me.  Don't be fooled by the dark hole in the wall, the square vs your traditional triangle shape, or the fact that the pizza slices look like they've been out for awhile.  The turnover is high and the pizza is amazing.  

How I like it:  EXTRA crispy.  I would order it for here and eat it at the bar for the optimal amount of crispiness and melty cheesiness... yum!!
author: hanh b.

description:
Born and raised in the Bay Area and I've yet to discover they many treasures found in heart of San Francisco, and by George I think I've found one!!! I was brought here by one of my friends who grew up eating in the area. We had a late night pizza craving and boy did this place "hit the spot!" 

Golden Boy Pizza opens late for those late night cravings (like we had). We went out on a Wednesday night, so "late night" was until midnight. Although there are many places to eat pizza in the North Beach area, I think this is by far the best pizza I've tasted.  Arriving there I was expecting a full blown restaurant with tables, chairs and your typical Parmesan and red pepper flake shakers placed on the table, I was totally off. This place is a small building big enough for the kitchen, workers and of course the pizza. They display their pizza by the window which allowed me to pick what I wanted. Being that it was late and 3 minutes after midnight there was only one type of pizza left, I believe it was a combination, with zucchini, if I may add, MM! The person working behind the window was kind enough to heat it up for us. I was surprised by its size for the price we paid which was a little under 4 bucks. 

Biting into their pizza was the most awesome pizza eating experience ever!. The crust was toasty (how I like it), the cheese was cheesy and there was just enough toppings on the square sized pizza. We shared one slice which was just about right for a snack. If you love pizza, visit Golden Boy! I can't wait to try their other pizzas!! MM
author: Marilou A.

description:
as a foodie, everywhere you go in the world, you look for those "hole in the wall secrets of the city".  well here it is, pizza in a cold bar with tables that people rarely sit at, a counter that's always full and a line out the door.

there's a reason for this, the pizza is incredible.  you can't go wrong!  i even liked the vegetarian pesto pizza.  it is a thick crusted square pizza about the size of your hand.  coming out of the oven, the top and bottom have a crunchy toasted consistency with a soft/gooey interior.  (i'm not italian) but the flavor is what i imagine to be "a taste of italy".
author: Wayne L.

description:
I had a fantastic experience here with my wife. After farting around union square for awhile, we decided to walk up to north beach and I told her she had to try this place because she had never been. I already knew it was yum, but I wanted to score some points on the marriage scale. She looked it up on her fancy smart phone thing and wanted to try the clam and garlic pizza. She also had the veggie pesto, which I tried and thought was delicious. I opted for a cheese slice (the true test of a pizza place) and the deluxe style with sausage. Both were very good, and the cheese slice and clam slice were fresh out of the oven so double awesome there. I noticed there was one last cheese slice in the window when I ordered, but the cashier waited for the new pie to come out and that's a nice perk. This place is completely unassuming from the outside and only has a few stools inside, but damn it's tasty.

Good thing I don't live near north beach or I'd be there all the time and they'd have to cart me out on a gurney and hook me up to a tomato sauce intravenous to prevent me from going into spastic withdrawals.
author: Sherry G.

description: So good! Cash only. Great atmosphere. Seating along long bars in the back looking at walls covered with stickers. Casual. Accepting. Wonderful slice of pizza with beer, wine, or soft drink.
author: lisa j.

description: great thick crust pizza! sauce tastes like they make it with wine or some other delicious secret ingredient. Great for dinner when out drinking in north beach!
author: Jennifer K.

description: I defy anyone to try this pizza and tell me it isn't one of the best pizza's ever. Just stroll by Golden Boy, take a look and a sniff of that fabulous pizza as it sits in the front window and you're hooked.  I'm a vegetarian so the Pesto Vegetarian is my favorite but there are varieties of pizza for vegetarians and carnivores alike.  I just had a slice today and it was to die for.  I love everything about Golden Boy Pizza and would even go so far to say it is one of the top 10 pizzas in San Francisco.  So do yourself a favor and get yourself to Golden Boy.  You will be so glad you did.
author: Rabbit B.

description: The pizza is good, I had vegetarian which was a bit bland compared to the supreme. The pizza sauce is good.
author: Mandy D.

description: Yummy is what I think of even when I get within a 5 block radius of Golden Boy.  I salivate and drool and have to get e some of that loving every time.  Even if I have to take it home cause I just ate.
author: Nik C.

description: Another of my "all name" team.  Golden Boy is an SF legend.  Square slices tasty with good herbs but not thin.  Good service.  Beer on tap and a website that lists their slice prices - $2.75 for cheese - my usual.  They get it.
author: Jeff J.

description: Love the atmosphere and music! Very relaxing and laid- back, server was very friendly. We ordered a slice of garlic & clam, pepperoni, pesto vegetarian. Pesto vegetarian was our favorite! We went ahead and got a second order of that.
author: J C.

description: Close to 10pm, 9 months pregnant. Must have pizza right this second. A big, satisfying pizza. These giant, doughy squares of hot cheesy goodness hit the spot big time.
author: Emily S.

description:
So the huge line here drew us to the place, walking around little italy in SF.   We were a little wary when we realized that everyone in line was pretty wasted looking.  Looks like the perfect place to go to right after having a few rounds.  We read the reviews on Yelp and decided to go with the highly praised clam garlic slices.  It came out fresh right as we ordered it, tons of parsley, tons of garlic, and possibly some clam.  I think this is where the benefit of being drunk would help here - now, pay attention because I've NEVER said this before - there was way too much going on here.  I think if our tongues were doused in alcohol, it would have been perfect, but my sober tongue was bombarded by (and i can't believe I'm saying this) too much garlic and too much parsley.  If they would have cut that back by 50%, it would have been awesome - but as it was, i felt like I was chewing on grass a few times.  I could only taste the clam when I realized I was crunching on sand.  

Now that being said, the pizza dough was AWESOME, cheese was great, sauce was perfect.  I REALLY should have gone with something simpler to try, so that's on me.  I think this place is still great for where it is and what it's for.  I'd try it again, though the stars reflect my experience this time around.
author: Ken P.

description:
This pizza is fantastic.. I trek to North Beach on a weekly basis to get me a slice (or two)!  It is always worth it.

I love the staff here.. Super cool and chilled out.

Go here and try it!  You will not be disappointed.
author: Che P.

description: Delicious square pizza that just hit the spot after a night of North Beach bar hopping.  The focaccia crust just kills it.  Really friendly servers too.  Oh and decent beers in case you weren't hammered enough for your pizza.
author: William S.

description:
This place is great!!! I came here after a late night out with some friends...It's located near so many bars and the line is ridiculous...luckily the night i went wasn't that bad...i think we just beat the rush. 

They have a few selections as they serve you. I ordered a cheese pizza and the garlic and clams. Seeing as it was late I decided to save the pizza's for the next day. I popped those suckers in the toaster over and they were FABULOUS! The cheese pizza was by far my FAV of the two. It was just so delicious I can't explain it. It wasn't topped with tons of marinara sauce...and it had the perfect amount of cheese...but the crust was so good too! 

I will be coming back here FOR SURE!!!
author: Jazmine S.

description: Wow. Golden Boy Pizza has become a new staple in my life since moving to the city. The pizza is amazing, i find myself craving it whether I am extremely drunk or completely sober and i find myself there at least once a week it seems. Sometimes I find myself wanting to leave bars early just to go to Golden Boy, its kind of sad actually. Besides the food, the hours are great (2am or 3am r we kidding? perfect), and the plethora of drunk people outside at all hours proves to be a new hilarious place to hang out before going home. I recommend stealing a Parmesan shaker or two, they like that (whoops)
author: Denys A.

description: Love Golden Boy especially the clam and garlic.  Laurie provides amazing service.
author: Jeanne B.

description:
Read their menu board... it's rude and funny.  "If ya don't see it here, it aint here" or some crude comment like that.  

Clam garlic is just loaded with Italian Parsley.  I had to ask, "What is that green one?"  "Clam and gahlik!" "Really?  I don't see no clams," I thought to myself.  "Oh, I'll take that one!"  I said outloud trying not to look foolish.  It was surprisingly sweet.  I am not a parsley fan nor are my toothy teeth that tends to trap blueberry and spinach bits!  ;D~  But it wasn't bad, but there wasn't a big clam or garlic taste... just cheese and parsley.  

The vegie pesto is a bit too oily but and their combo is just so-so, but I can definitely see how this place is so popular.  It's just surrounded by bars and drunken venues.  Of course, people will rave about square pizza at 2am!  Yeah we'll eat beer bottles covered in butter.  

Try to get a piece with crust.  The dough is often soggy and sometimes you just want a crunchy piece to sop up the shots of jaeger.
author: Chris T.

description:
Okay, I'm five beers into the night, and the girls at the Savoy are lookin' a bit better than they did earlier.

I really should leave, but not before grabbing something to eat.

Golden Boy is just around the corner, maybe we should stop by for a slice? I know it's not fine dining, but I need something in my stomach that's greasy and tastes good, no matter what it is.
author: Patrick N.

description: One of the best slices of pizza i've ever had. Great crust, square slices, good stuff.
author: Julie K.

description: Ok, Ive only been living in the city for about 6 months but I live in Lower Nob Hill and there are tons of subpar pizza places in the Tenderloin and Union Square area. Today I got 2 nice slices of pizza and a coke from Golden Boy in North Beach and it was a little over 8 bucks. OMG THE CRUST was to die for!!! What you want is a slice from a pie right outta the oven. I will be making my trip to North Beach for pizza from now on, because I THINK I may have found my favorite slice in San Francisco! Good Job Golden Boy!!
author: Brandon R.

description:
It was a dark and stormy night. We forgot to eat dinner in our haste to make it over the bridge to get to a friend's birthday party at Maggie McGarry's, and after a few pints we were starving. 

"Have you tried Golden Boy's?" the birthday boy asked.

We had not. We hastened over puddles to get in line for a hot slice. Unfortunately, El Volado, the Mexican party bus, was parked out front and the line was long. Add to this the fact that the girl at the counter seemed to be engaged in an epic phone conversation, and you have a long line of starving, soggy, drunk folks clamoring for pizza. 

It could have turned into a mutiny,  but the pizza was good enough to overcome these obstacles.
author: Vandana M.

description:
Any chance you grew up in an area of the country with Rocky Roccoco's like I did? Well then you have a sense of what Golden Boy is all about... it's baked in a rectangular pan with a thick crust and lots of gooey cheese. It makes me nostalgic for childhood and Midwestern eating habits, which didn't care about calories as long as something tasted good. They would have laughed at thin crust and gourmet toppings. 

That said, I always enjoy grabbing a slice here before or after bars. it's great to have on hand in North Beach. I wouldn't go out of my way just to eat here though... for deep dish pizza go to Zachary's in the East Bay, Patxi's in Hayes Valley, or Little Star (on Divis and in the Mission).
author: Shoshana D.

description:
Best pizza in the whole city - hands down!

I'd suggest the combo with a tall glass of pilsner urquel to chase it. Yumm.... If you're with a bunch of friends, try ordering "the sheet." BUT beware, this thing feeds many many mouths and has been known to scare small children. Caveat emptor, as they say - literally.
author: Juiceman G.

description: This place is the real deal!  The smell and window made me grab a slice after eating dinner.  Best choice on sf trip!  Crust is to die for.
author: RJ P.

description: Greasy, oh yep.  Flavor, oh so tasty.  Originally ordered two different slices, or squares, whatever, two flavors, took a bite, the taste washed through my mouth with so much delight, then scarfed it down in about 3 bites.  Attacked the next one, felt an anxious feeling for more, got back in line and wolfed another two down.  Metallica's "wherever I may roam" was playing in the background.  I think I'm going to have to roam back to Golden Boy.
author: Edwin G.

description: It was the Giants parade and there was only one girl working, so I waited online for about twenty minutes. The pizza was great, but as a New Yorker I don't deal well with lines, especially long ones. I recommend the only one I tried, the combination - yum!
author: Nicole E.

description: Yes, I have a weakness for square format. (Photography/gastronomy combo pun, stand back!) Golden Boy makes the best Sicilian I've ever had, and that's it. Also the only reason that readily springs to mind for being in North Beach.
author: Peter B.

description:
i love love love this place!!!  another reason to drive forty-five minutes to the city!  i dont come to the city for shopping, just the food.  I've never had a DELICIOUS square shaped pizza until four years ago when he first took me here.  

i don't normally like thick crust pizza, but this is an acception!  i hate pan pizzas because the extra dough right underneath the toppings taste under cook and it grosses me out... but not here!!  crisp, light, yummy.  oh my.  

the walls are entertaining with all the pictures and stuff too.
author: chelley L.

description:
So far, this is my favorite pizza in San Francisco.

Thick crust with fun toppings and oh so yummy. Yum.
author: Monika M.

description:
The boss sent me to the post office down the street to take care of some certified mail.  There were about 40 of them.  I got to the counter and the clerk just looked at me.  He said, "It's gonna be a while.  Why don't you go get lunch or something?"  I told him I was fine.  15 minutes later, he'd only made it through about 5 of them.  OK, I'll go get some lunch.

I walked past the maze of customers waiting in line, glaring at me for having taken so much time and knowing that clerk was out of commission for a good time more.  OK, whatever I was gonna get had to be quick, so I could come back and at least share in this misery.

I walked around the corner and Golden Boy called my name.  It was about 2pm and I could hardly open the door there were so many people crowded around the bar.  I managed to get in and ordered just a simple slice of pepperoni.

I had no desire to sandwich in at the bar so I stepped outside with my cheesy, greasy, juicy slice of goodness.  Thick crust...mmmmmmmm.....  Hit the spot after missing lunch and took all of ten minutes from the time I left the North Beach Post Office.

I got back to the clerk, my tummy satisfied--and proceeded to wait another 25 minutes.  Damn, am I glad he suggested food!

Summing up:  Quick.  Cheap.  Filling.  Solid slice of pizza.
author: Melissa Q.

description: Yahoo!  Great slices.  I mean GREAT!
author: T-Bone L.

description: Came in here for a couple of slices and ended up staying a while. We ordered "two slices with the works." Delicious. Turns out they have beer on tap too. Great little pizza place/bar.
author: Kevin L.

description: Stopped by here for a late night snack...aka the munchies. I loved the combo pizza and my friend and I shared a slize of pesto vegetarian - both very good. Good place if you're out 'n' about in North Beach.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Golden Boy is just good stuff. I don't know if its the actual quality, the atmosphere, the nostalgia or what, but Golden Boy always makes me happy the way pizza used to when I was a kid. I generally stick with pepperoni slices, but its all good. The place is best when its slow, a rare thing. Ordering from the window is fun as long as a family of tourists isn't sitting there thinking out loud about what they want and if they need to bring a slice back to Grandma. Last time I had Golden Boy was around midnight, so I know they are open late.

Golden Boy Pizza was one of the first spots I ever ate at in SF. I must have been all of 18 at the time and a bunch of old punkers took me here. It hasn't changed much which is a good thing. The ephemera on the wall is worth looking into. It gives an interesting history of both the city and Golden Boy. Check this place out oif you want to get away from tourist traps in Northbeach. Now I pop in every other week or so on my lunch break and the occasional night out on Columbus.
author: Zac H.

description:
small place.
best pizza. 

love love love their pizza! 
i always used to have my golden boy fix. i moved but hey! they opened one up in san mateo so the lower half of the peninsula can enjoy some too!

the boys that work here are so nice and polite, i know some of them are brothers
author: Antoinette M.

description: Golden boy is quite simply, one of the best cheap, quick and easy pizza places in the city.
author: Tony D.

description: Just what i needed after a heavy night of drinking.  My SF friend Spike took me to his favorite place for pizza in the city. And i was not disappointed. I'm used to thick east coast Sicialian slices but Golden Boy was a nice thinner change of pace. They will be a new staple of my San Francisco eating. I'll be thinking about my next slice for months.
author: Tim O.

description:
$3.50 for a slice of the combo eh?  I expected it to see a thick sicilian slice loaded with 3 or maybe even 4 layers of toppings.  Ok maybe that's way way way overkill but I would have settled for at least overkill.  

It had lots of cheese and it tasted pretty fresh but I expected more.
author: Shyam P.

description:
I wanted to, i REALLY wanted to, love this place. It just has that je ne sais quoi that exudes cool. the pizza looked good, and i guess it tasted good, but i guess it just didn't do it for me. I've tried it a couple times, and both times, I found the crust and sauce to be a little bland. I also think for 3 bucks, the slices are a tad on the small side of things.

I don't know what i think of the service - sometimes I'm in the mood for surly, sometimes I'm not. maybe that's just something people get used to, or maybe it's just the people who are there at lunch time. but i was wavering between a 3 and a 4, and the service sort of brought it down a bit.

All that said, I will go back at least a few more times, for the large part because it's the only place to get a decent (but not great) slice in the north beach area during the workday.
author: Bernie L.

description:
Thick. Square. Pizza. 

Really pretty good.

It'll get the job done, no questions asked.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Golden Boyee, I love you!
Personally my favoritest pizza.  Made even more tasty when you need something to eat after getting out of the bars.  I also want to use this opportunity to thank the lady that serves the pizza to all the drunks who show up when I do: your patience is incredible!
Former Canadians may recognize the flavor of this pizza - it tastes like the Kraft pizza kits sold in Safeway!  I think so at least ...
author: Ed P.

description:
Hailed by many of my friends as the bets pizza in the city, or anywhere.

My only problem is that one sqaure (err, one "Sicilian") is totally not enough.
author: Shannon V.

description:
When I moved back from the city 18 months ago I had to readjust my expectations of different neighborhoods in the city.  I always thought that North Beach was for people from Walnut Creek, Danville, and the South Bay to come and 'play metropolitan for the weekend.'

Well, I was right.  Recently I was out on a Saturday night in Oakland and that is what I found.  A bunch of crappy people that I wouldn't want to associate with on any level.

What I didn't know is that there are still some little gems that during the week are great choices for the masses of locals.

One of them is Golden Boy.  Very no frills.  Walk up to the little counter and order from outside.  Pay the cash. Wait a minute (drink from your brown bagged tall can) and get the thick crusted square piece of pie... Then, if you are me... go back and do the same about 5 minutes later.  One is never enough for your friend Thadd when it comes to pizza.  I love the stuff.

I have to knock one star in general as North Beach is one of the most difficult spots to get to in SF.  Just silly, that being said, this will never be a destination worth the headache of getting to NB, but a pleasant treat upon arrival.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Great tasting pizza and very filling. I have been known to put away a full pie on my own from other places but Golden Boy is great for 1-2 slices satisfying your afternoon belly rumblings.

Get there early to avoid the lunch rush though. Last time my co-workers and I pulled up to the counter at about 11:30 am and 15 mins later people were lined up out front waiting for a seat.
author: Geoff W.

description:
Cheap and delicious.  Golden Boy is unequivocally the best pizza in North Beach, and possibly the best in San Francisco.

The bread on the bottom is crispy and yet soft and fluffly on the inside.

Golden Boy feels like the inside of a subway train or silver motor home on the inside, giving the place some character and reminds me of a 1989 Mazda 323 (aka my "shitty old car"), and somehow adds to the charm.  If you're the type who insists on Lexus (or better) then go somewhere else down the block, but IMHO sometimes it's nice to just let go and not give a ____.
author: Jin D.

description:
Best Drunk Food Ever! (well next to hot dogs with cream cheese in Seattle...)

After a late night of drinking... and spending your money on drinks... there is nothing more satisfying than an affordable slice of square pizza.  The line speaks for itself. 

And remember, there is barely any seating, so it is a buy the pizza, walk and eat - or stumble your way over to the park and enjoy it on the nice vacant benches... :)
author: Lisa L.

description:
Great for late night after watching a show at the Comedy Club.

The agony of waiting in line. As if that's not enough, they tease you by placing their signature pizzas in the window and all you can do is just stare.

The vegetarian is absolutely perfect. My boyfriend's a meat- eater and he loved this one. We also tried the pesto pizza which was equally good. You can't go wrong here. 

FYI. Good hang over food. =)
author: Gerard B.

description:
OH EM GEE!!!
Basil Garlic Clam Pizza!!!!!!!

Seriously, this is probably hands down one of my favorite pizza places.  I can't believe people in the city still haven't discovered this little gem.  It's a great place for late night pizza or a quick bite to eat.

The pizza is served in sheets but ordering a slice of the Combo and a slice of the Garlic Clam is the way to go!

The prices are great too.
author: Curt L.

description: love the garlic clam! their specialty! thats the only thing i get here because its so good. had 2 slices! a good slice of pizza is hard to find and golden boy delivers! big time!
author: Q W.

description: Amazing PIZZA!!! Always in the mood for their combination slice. And a good beer on tap isn't bad either!
author: Cameron P.

description: Hands down, the best pizza in North Beach...  I've had a lot of pizza in the area, but my favorite is Golden Boy.  It's a total neighborhood icon.  Big red finger pointing down at it and they're open late.  Once the bars are near closing, this place is poppin' which means a line out the door!  People don't mind waiting while they're faded and chilly outside for it which means it is that good!  $2.75 for a rectangle slice of cheese, $3.25 for a rectangle slice of pepperoni or sausage, $3.75 for a rectangle slice of the clam, and there's more.  You visually get to see what slices are available.  Also, read their menu board, it's super funny.  One of the quotes is "If you don't see it, don't ask".  Meaning, if you don't see your slice of pizza available, then don't bother asking.  But once a tray is gone, they work right away to get another out there.  Wait for them to come out with it or order what's available.  They also have beer and wine there...  Such a local spot and the pizza is so good!  So good, that I am satisfied with a slice of cheese!  But if I have the funds, I'm always up for a slice of pepperoni or sausage.  Gotta have it!
author: Limzer L.

description:
In a search for a pizza place in north beach, my friends and I had stumbled here on a Sunday early afternoon. This place was away from the main street and looked like a hole in the wall. It's so ghetto that the menu on the wall looked like it was there since the early 80s! There was no one there around 11:45am so we took the bar seating. Then the pizza's were just being made. 

I knew it was going to be a great place when I saw the writing on the walls. Any place that bitches out customers such as please tip the server or no cell phones means they don't need everyone's business. I ordered the combo slice and it was super hot. I burned my tongue on the first bite. 

The sauce is definitely really tangy. I loved it and there was a lot of cheese. The crust was hard on the bottom which I liked. It was great. Then I tried the good ole pepperoni and it was also super hot. Overall it's a nice place to grab some pizza. 

I probably saw about 25 customers walk in within 30 mins so it could be busy. I'll go back if i'm ever around town and craving pizza!
author: Tony L.

description: Aahhh golden boy!  Best Sicilian in the city.  I crave these delicious thick slices of heaven like none other. Parking sucks, but it well worth the hassle.
author: Thomas R.

description: Just great pizza by the slice I would say that for a non New York style pizza this has to be the best.  The pesto one is very good not too much toppings and fun to eat it with a fork and knife.  It a rectangular style shaped slice not a triangle.
author: Stevezee C.

description: Probably the best sicilian style pizza you can get in North Beach, let alone San Francisco. The texture of the pizzas are just right and every slice is piping hot. The clam garlic and combination are definitely the must-trys. However, for some reason, I don't see how a joint with a hard rock background goes hand in hand with a knife and fork when eating pizza...
author: Gerry L.

description:
The best pizza in North Beach.

Get the clam & garlic if you can, otherwise just get what's hot. The lines are long, but it's worth the wait. Try sitting inside for faster service. Great beers on tap and friendly service.
author: Angelica M.

description: Oh baby, this is great pizza.  The ingredients are damn near perfect (the sauce is probably the best I've ever tasted) and the crust is some sort of architectural miracle.  I'd suggest keeping it simple -- too many toppings obscures the majesty of the slice.
author: Jon B.

description: I mean, it's pizza situated by a farkton of bars. Is it really that good? I couldn't tell you, but I can tell you this - I eat the shit out of this pizza when I go out in north beahc.
author: Kevin L.

description: Though they have fewer varieties of pizza, they are damn good..worth a try
author: Praveen I.

description: The pizza is very good and chunky, so it will fill you up! I love how it comes in square shapes, pretty unique. Only bad part is the place has a limited amount of room :( But the pizza is fantastic :)
author: Moe L.

description: Wether you come here for a lunch time slice (or rather square) or after a night of bar hopping with the drunchies, it is always good. often for me it is paired with beer which makes it that much better. easily the best pizza in the city. If you havent made the trek across the city to try some you should its well worth it.
author: Dominic S.

description:
So on the way home from church today, I decided to stop by Golden Boy after all the great reviews I have gotten from my friends and also read about. 
Hooray, they had the clam garlic pie available right away. I decided to eat there and took a seat at the back area of the bar, where I had a great view of the unsmiling dough-kneader. The female server was very personable, however, and even brought my slice out to me after a short fire in the oven. She also gave me a cup of ice water at no charge, which she wasn't snotty about either. Too bad, my joy was shortlived.
First of all, there were only about 4 teensy shriveled clams on my big square slice. The slice of pizza is about the size of a big notecard, and the amount of clams looked very sad as a ratio of clams to dough.
Secondly, there were several blackened garlic cloves decorating the top. Burnt garlic imparts a reaallly strong and unavoidable taste; this basically turned me off the taste of the entire slice.
Lastly, there were black olives on the pie. Black. Olives. Who the F puts black olives on a clam & garlic pie??? There were more black olives than clams on the pie - unforgivable.
I am awarding one star for the friendly service, and one star for the nice char on the crust - otherwise, Golden Boy is a bit tarnished in my opinion. Maybe I just need to be drunker?

I will keep going back to Tony's - I just wish they served their clam pie by the slice.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I've actually been here sober once and it was even better than the other times when I wasn't. You can't say anything bad about hot, fresh slices of goodness...

Update: best bet is to wait for a fresh pan if its not too crowded, otherwise you run the risk of it being under/over cooked...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Oh my Friggin' God!
Best damn Pizza this lifetime.. Thicker than thin crust, little lower than Chicago style.  So damn fresh and tasty, a  real treat anytime of day or night.. Cornmeal crust is the Awesomest!
Gotta try this at least a dozen times!
author: JASON L.

description:
the line out the door was initially daunting...well worth the wait though.
Good pie!!!
author: Dpb T.

description:
Good for the drunkard. I like to look at what i'm going to eat, preferably through the front window store. I'm like a girl who needs to go shopping when I look for food. My criterias... 1. I need food, lots of it 2. What are my options?  3. How fast can I get.

Golden boy accomplishes all those with the super pizza lady who remembers the asian dude who ordered the pepperoni and sausage.
author: Wil M.

description:
Awesome fluffy pan pizza
Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer
Luscious creative toppings

Heavenly toppings, more please. Just the same great pizza as I remember from pre-earthquake years.
author: Susie W.

description:
There I was, standing amongst fellow bar-hopping douchebags in North Beach, preparing to grab a couple of slices of the legendary Golden Boy Pizza.  My friends and I bypassed the chaotic line outside, sat at the bar, ordered our slices and got some beers.  After waiting a few minutes, our thick steamy slices of pizza arrived, and I eagerly bit into mine - and I was definitely disappointed.

It's not that this pizza isn't good, it's just nothing special.  This surprised me, because usually my tastes are in line with the yelpers' concensus.  I'm willing to give it another shot, afterall it's cool that they serve beer and it's not like it's an expensive meal.  Think of it more as a bar that serves decent pizza, and you'll be fine.

Like I said, I'll try it again, but it seems to me like just a bunch of hype.
author: Joseph N.

description:
Why I give 4 stars:

1. Best pan pizza I've tasted in SF (maybe because I was drunk..not sure)
2. Friendly staff. The pizza lady with the long frizzy hair was nice. 
3. Small place but I've always got the pizza to go. 
4. Gets really crowded after club hours. 

Definitely a great place to get a pizza fix if you're drunk or sober.
author: David W.

description:
Two words. Clam pizza. This is my favorite treat in North Beach besides coffee at Trieste. This is sheet pizza as we used to call it in NY. The crust is like focassia, bready, crispy, chewy. Yum, my high school buddies mom used to make this style of pizza and Claire, I think of you every time I eat here.
Minus one star for cash only and attitude from the people working here. But hey, if i worked in NB and was used to dealing with all the amateur drunks I'd be bitter too.
author: James S.

description:
Golden Boy, Golden Boy - how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways.

1. Rosemary focaccia crust- it's crun-chewy
2. Fab sausage
3. punk rock - loud
4. cold beer
5. by the slice
6. open late
author: Peter P.

description:
Such a great slice of pie... esp after hitting up a few bars in North Beach.  I've been here quite a few times but stopped for a some crazy reason!  

Anyway, I returned on the Saturday of Fleet Week.  We were at an amazing roof party and our friends went to go pick it up and bring it to the roof.  It was perfect!  Great day, great pizza.

I think I prefer getting one slice from their cute little take-out window but its good even when it comes in a sheet in a massive box!
author: Angela S.

description: This is BY FAR the best pizza I ever had. Every combination from cheese to veggie is the best,  the price is perfect, its easy to get to, everyone that works there is really cool.  I have tried the one in San Mateo and its good although the crust taste a lil stiffer...doesnt seem to have that light fluffy crust like the city.....but you will have to judge for yourself
author: Rock L.

description: Best Pizza ever!!!  Everyone that has come to visit from back home in Texas, I have taken to Golden Boy.  And they always say 'yeah sure whatever, pizza is pizza.'  Then they take a bite and say "OH MY GOSH, THIS IS AWESOME!"
author: Michael M.

description:
Golden Boy = Clam & Garlic RULES!
It's an odd combo, only popular in SF--but once you try it, you'll be hooked!  Their other combos are decent; good mix of crust/sauce/cheese--but Clam+Garlic is the BEST!
author: steve c.

description:
Overall, very good pizzas. It is not exactly a deep dish, but not thin crush. It was somewhere in the middle. The pizza itself was fluffy, with a thin crispy crust on the bottom. Just the right amount of cheese, sauce, toppings for the flavors to blend together perfectly. 

We tried the following:
Garlic Clam Parsley - no contest, this is the best (and the most special!). Never had clams in my pizzas before, and I became a fan! Came out with parsley and claims all over. The smell of garlic was enticing. Within the first bite, I know there was no "too strong" flavor of anything. The parsley, the clams, garlic, and the cheese were perfectly in balance.

Pesto Vegetarian - My second favorite. Pesto was not too strong.Wish there was less olives, and more tomatoes or something.. But still delicious.

Combination - Very good. This place's pizzas is above average, and by the default, above average combination pizzas. 

Tips --Get here early (6ish or so) so you get a stool to sit on. Order a beer on draft and whatever pizzas that just came out of the oven. We wanted the garlic clam, but it wouldn't be ready for another 10 minutes, so we ordered the combination to start and let the server know we are waiting on the clam pizza. When it was ready, the server remembered and brought a slice straight to us (did not to stand in line again to order another slice). 

I like this place a lot. Will come back for sure!
author: Alexandra V.

description: Good - just not great. Tasty Sicilian style slices, but very few options. I would also prefer more sauce to compete with the thick dough, but all in all, a decent slice for cheap.
author: Matt D.

description: ummm HELL YES.  This is my very favorite pizza in SF.  And kudos to the dude behind the counter that has to deal with drunk douche bags at 2am in North Beach.  You rock my socks, dude.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Better than average, but I have to say I don't get the whole Golden-Boy-as-religious-experience vibe I've heard from so many people.  It's tasty, it's thick & rich, it's near a bunch of bars so it makes good pre / post drinking food, and the crispy focaccia crust is interesting and different.  On the other hand, it's kind of overpriced, there's always a line, and there isn't usually space to eat inside (especially on a weekend).  I think I still tend to go there because it is pretty tasty, it's open late, & I don't know North Beach that well so I tend to frequent the same spots over and over.  If you're going to take your out-of-town peeps to one pizza joint in SF, though, I'm not sure I see any real reason to make it this one.
author: Angela B.

description:
Scenario: I get hungry when I drink. Probably why I tend to yelp bars and pizza holes simultaneously.

Product: Square pan pizza.  But NOT that Little Caeser's cardboard BS!  It was fresh, well-proportioned, fair-priced and different. I had never had garlic clam pizza before but I'm craving it right now.  I should talk more about the pizza.  The pepperoni slices were thick and girthy (gets you all excited doesn't it?).  There were more than enough veggies like tomato, olive and green pepper.  The cheese is prolific.  I like cheese.

Service: Nothing to report other than a cute, friendly cashier.  A group of us tried to order a couple pizzas but they were too "busy." In other words, everyone else would've had to wait for fresh pizza to come out of the oven.  Got what we wanted individually without trouble.

Atmosphere: I don't know, I just got my pizza and went back to the bar.  Cash only is always annoying.

Uniquity: The pizza variety and price were the perfect prescription for my hunger. Unfortunately, there was no cow bell.  4 stars instead of 5 because of the cash and their unwillingness to bestow two whole pizzas on our group at once.
author: Robert R.

description: The combination and clam/garlic are supremely good. Considering how cheap it is for a slice, you cant eat just one...unless you're on a diet!
author: Tony V.

description: Square slices, crisp, foccaccia style crust.  Sauce is a little sweeter than NY style. Cheese was good but not memorable. Not greasy at all and it was so hot it burned my mouth so I'll give it 4 stars, instead of 3.
author: Kirk H.

description: If you are ever in SF and want great pizza.... This is your place.. I just wish they were opened later.  As I find myself in SF going to the clubs and or bars, if they served past the 2 am mark they would get my business.
author: Flexoh B.

description: For quick slices of delicious pizza, Golden Boy is the best around.
author: Addie B.

description: The pizza was amazing, and in a really cool area of Little Italy. The prices where very low, and the atmosphere really pleasant.  We sat at the counter an got quick service.
author: Rachel S.

description:
OK - I LOVE THIS PLACE FOR TWO SIMPLE REASONS: 

1 - You can buy by the slice
2 - For 2 pieces, it's 5 bucks! 

Not only is it cheap, it is hella good! This is the perfect place after a long day at work - with a beer and a slice!!! mmmmm.....heaven!
author: Lindsay C.

description:
You are drunk, and in North Beach, for whatever reason. And you and your friends are hungry. And most of these places look either closed, or beyond your budget, or dirty and crowded. Then someone says "hey, I know a pizza place, that's pretty good."

"Where is it?"

"It's around here."

"Where?"

"Like, around here somewhere."

"How do we get there?"

"You wander around and you look for the hand."

Not entirely sure what this means but unwilling to argue, you play along. You walk down one block, then up another. You pass by a cheesesteak place that looks passable, and try to get everyone to stop, but they're all engaged in a conversation about Borat or something.

Another block, cross the street, backtrack. Whatever. It is a good thing to walk; it gets the blood flowing, and the blood will suck the alcohol out of your brain and ferry it down to your liver, where some science thing will happen and it will all go away, and then you'll have the presence of mind to escape this hopeless task...

Rounding a corner and halfway down the next block, and there it is: The big neon hand, pointing you toward the door. Those directions were spot on the money. You try to make a mental note of the name (Golden ... Boy ... Pizza) but the next time you come here it will still just be "that place, you walk around until you see the hand..."

The pizza is delicious (if you ever try it sober, it turns out to be pretty bad, actually). And there's beer. But there's nowhere to sit, and barely anywhere to stand. Eventually you edge your way to a stool five seats away from your friends (which, at this point in the evening, is not an entirely unwelcome turn of events). You eat slowly, using too many napkins, and try to let the sea of torsos pressing up against you fall from your mind...

I can understand why some people love it, but ultimately Golden Boy's just another dirty hole-in-the-wall pizza/beer joint that looks and feels for a moment like it might be something more, but never delivers. And it's always inexplicably packed (maybe because the rest of the drunk food in the area is so much worse). It does however make a good first impression. I recommend giving it a try, when the time is right.
author: Wayne W.

description:
What I loved about North Beach was that during the day you really felt like it was your neighborhood. Golden Boy was a block away from me and I was in there once a week. 

Lisa Pizza knew my name and started pouring on tap rootbeer the minute I walked in. It's not Sicilian, New York or Chicago style, it's Golden Boy square pizza.

Come during the day and listen to loud music, talk about your favorite books and wonder at the mass of neighborhood regulars pictures on the fridge.

At night be prepared to wait in a long drunken line for a perfect greasy solution to your late night hunger.
author: Angela K.

description:
Golden Boy pizza is the single greatest pre-drinking food known to man-kind.  Interestingly enough, it is just as amazing after you are already drunk.  They pizza is made on foccacia crust with only 4 (5?) available varieties.  My personal favorites are the plain cheese & pesto vegetarian.

They have several beers on tap and it's quite inexpensive to compliment your hot squares of pie with a pitcher of Sierra, Bud Light, or other weapon of choice.  The crowd there is always a great mix of stoners, local North Beach homeless folk, yuppies, and tourists.  They usually only staff 1 individual at the front, and he/she is incredibly efficient at serving multiple customers.

I would stay away from this place after 11 pm on Fri & Sat nights because the line becomes very VERY long.  They re-heat every slice before serving...patience is critical.
author: T D.

description:
Great late night snack. 
The clam and garlic was tasty, the pesto vegetarian a great runner up and the crust was thick, chewy and crunchy.
author: Blu n.

description: I moved to northbeach a few months ago and my friend recommended Golden Boy pizza so i thought id give it a try.  The place is only a block away from my new place and when i got there... the smell was heaven!  Ive tried the meat combo, clam & garlic, and the pepperoni... but by far.. hands down the pesto vegetarian is just damn amazing!!!! i love my meat pizzas..... but the flavors in the pesto vegetarian is just devine!!! Best pizza in North Beach!
author: Jasen L.

description: I got my first taste of Golden Boy combination pizza tonight....By far, best damn sheet of pizza EVER!  Plus, great customer service. I called around 11:30pm to order a full sheet of combination pizza. Usually they don't make them that late but the girl that helped me on the phone totally accommodated our request. When I went to go pick it up, she was so nice to us even though there were drunk ass idiots being retarded. Great food + great employees = Success!
author: Ann L.

description:
If you like being treated like scum and berated by the owner then go here, if not, DON'T BOTHER!

I will never go to Golden Boy Pizza again, the owner is a complete jerk. I was with a group who had been drinking a bit and strolled in for some pizza Saturday afternoon. After a couple comments on the louder side we were told to "shut the F up or we would be told to leave." Not exactly great customer service. 

After we made one more loud laugh the owner eyed down one girl in our group and said "what part of be quiet don't you F'ing understand" (she wasnt' even the one who made the noice BTW). The owner proceeded to rant on us about how frustrating it is dealing with drunk idiots like us who come in 7 days a week (sorry, but us drunk idiots pay your rent stupid, so probably not a good idea to insult us). 

When my friend said we were customers and should be treated well he ripped the beer out of her hands and said "Now you're just loitering" The Jerk then actually threatened to CALL THE POLICE ON US!

ALL THIS FOR MAKING A COUPLE LOUD NOISES IN A PIZZA JOINT!!!???

We said nothing innapropriate or rude, were not causing a public scene or making any other customer upset (I was sober the entire time so I know excatly how loud, ect. we were and we did NOT justifiy getting kicked out).

This guy is a loser and this place is pathetic  - Cable Car pizza is just around the corner and it's just as good...
author: Joe L.

description:
This is classic San Francisco!  Little places in random neighborhoods serviing delicious foods.

This place has been around since the 70's and after tasting their square pizzas you'll know how they survived all these years.  @ under 4$ a slice you get a nice big square of goodness.  If your lucky enough to stroll by when its fresh you are truly in for a treat, but otherwise the taste is still just as good once toasted in their little oven.  I had the vegi with pesto and while I'm more of a sausage and peperroni kind of guy I was quite satisfied with my selection.  What made me even happier was to see that they served HEMP ALE.  Couldn't pass on a pint of that!  If your ever in North Beach be sure to check this place out, you wont be dissappointed!  Happy DiNNing...
author: Nader A.

description: The cheese pizza is good here.  The veggie not so much.  I would go back if I happen to walk by it.
author: Fatty A.

description: A great find in SF, open late, cool decor with inviting staff. I had the cheese my wife got the loaded, she thought hers was better than mine but I thought mine was awesome. Was reheated from the window and cheese was melted, tongue burning hot. Love it !
author: Chris R.

description:
This is probably the best pizza in North Beach.  The crust is chewy and crisp and their tomato sauce is nice and tangy.  Toppings are always high quality.  They also have some pizza with pesto, if you're into that.  Great for a real meal or for when you need something in your tummy after a night on the town.  They have a nice beer selection too!  

I love the sheet metal interior and all the stickers!
author: Steve B.

description: I ran into Golden Boy Pizza between sets at Grant and Green.  I couldn't resist the square slices of cheesy goodness I spied from Golden Boy's window.  I selected a slice of cheese pizza for about two dollars and fifty cents (including tax, I guess!).  It didn't take long for the server to warm the pizza for me and hand it over.  This pizza tasted so much better than the pizza I have delivered from the chain stores in The East Bay.  I enjoyed every delicious bite.  It's a good thing I don't live in the city because I would certainly eat this regularly.
author: Camille K.

description: mmm, good pizza.  great place to wander too late night for a  square slice and a cold beer.  A north beach classic.  I've burned the top of my mouth on plenty a slice and will continue to do so whenever I'm around.
author: J. B.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review about this place yet!  I've been here many times, and I think they've all been right after drinking heavily next door at the Columbus Cafe.  Or, during a quick break from drinking heavily over there. 

Quality- excellent. Little square slices of Heaven. I'm a cheese pizza kinda guy, and they have excellent greasy pizza to soak up all the newcastle and whiskey. They also have beer on tap, so you can keep the buzz going. 

Service- Always been good to me. Can get a bit hectic over there, but they're always nice about it. Cash only of course! 

I wish it was closer to my place, but I always try to get over there when I'm in north beach...
author: Matthew S.

description:
I've been on a quest to find the best pizza in SF since I've moved here and this place is definitely at the top of my list so far.
If you happen to be in North Beach at the end of an evening, Golden Boy is the perfect place to get a late night snack (translation: fulfill your post-drinking munchies). The line isn't the fastest thing ever, but it's worth the wait.
I too - before knowing that it was the posh thing to do after seeing these other reviews - requested a coveted corner slice of the square pizza (mmmm crust) - the vegetable one - and it did not disappoint. If you don't mind a bad breath special, the clam garlic is pretty much to die for.
Cash only - and while there was a time when I might have thought that 3.50 was kind of pricey for a slice of pizza, well, now it seems almost...cheap.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Some of the best pizza I've had in SF.  I still think that Little Star may beat it out as far as pure pizza goes, but for by the slice (or when I'm drunk and stumbling around North Beach) this is by far the best pizza around.  The magic to Golden Boy (like every pizza) is primarily in the crust.  Golden Boy serves their pizza on focaccia bread, and they toast up the bottom so you have that perfect "toasty on the outside, melt-in-your-mouth on the inside".

I've sat inside on the bar stools and had a beer with my pizza while listening to the classic rock with some friends, but my preference is getting it to go - either as a greasy foundation for a night out in North Beach or as the oft-needed nightcap to said evening.

Don't forget - cash only.
author: Brian W.

description:
Great late/drunk night snack, they're cash only(like all the other good cheap places) and somewhat quick with the service.  

I'm a big fan of the sausage pizza, each slice has 4 mini-meatball sized sausages that are seasoned just right to mix with the cheese and tomato sauce.  The crust has a nice buttery oil complexion and asking for extra crispy just makes a good slice better.  

I used to like the clam pizza but...now I'm just a fan of the sausage

...not that kind of sausage
author: Kevin C.

description:
Hangover heaven, but notsomuch when North B*tch is a beach to get to..did I say that right?  Stickersonthewall, punk palace...

Did I mention that it's part-owned by self-proclaimed cross-dresser and pro-boxer, Oscar Dela Hoya?  (hence the name Golden Boy)

Anywhoo~their pizza is pretty damn good, but if you get it to go, make sure you eat it right away, otherwise the paper sticks to the crust.
author: C Q.

description:
Total one-two punch,
Slices that'll knock you out, 
Clams and garlic please.
author: Brian J.

description:
I'm not going to say Golden Boys is the best pizza I have ever had but it is damn good late at night. It has a fairly thick crust (making it great drinking food) that strikes the perfect balance between being crunchy and soft. The other thing I really love about their pizza is the tomato sauce which has a slight tangy kick. 

The service has always been good, but expect a decent line around 1:30am.
author: Mark B.

description: Had a slice of peperoni and a Stella on draft at the All Shook Down music festival a few weeks ago. They were busy and the line was out the door but they still dished out the slices quickly. The pizza was hot, the beer was cold, and there were a few open seats inside. Couldn't ask for more.
author: Robin M.

description: i love this place - the food probably warrants only a 4 star rating, but i'm giving it 5 for one special reason - it's OPEN LATE! there is nothing better than being able to get a late night pizza for $5 at 2am.  sometimes you're just hungry at the end of the night and you want something good, fast and cheap, and that's where golden boy comes in. the convenience, location, hours, price, and good pizza combined make it a 5 for me. do not come here if you are looking for gourmet pizza - come here if you're drunk after the bars and want something warm, cheesy, and delicious!
author: Rachel S.

description: The best place to go after the bars in north beach!  The pesto vegetarian is my favorite, but I wish the line wasn't so long on weekend nights!
author: Sameer D.

description:
best pizza in North Beach , BRING BACK THE DRAFT ROOT BEER 
 love the place , bath room scarrrry , part of its charm
author: matt p.

description:
yummy.  clam and garlic or the combination. long line after bar hopping or clubbin though.

french bread style pizza....definitely fills you up...
author: J G.

description:
Can I say anything new? I have eaten delicious pizza at the most random times. I think I waited an hour on Halloween for a slice of Golden Boy, which in retrospect is a little bit crazy, and have met numerous interesting people while waiting in line.

In general I prefer the marinara-based pizza and not the pesto/oil pizza simply because the marinara has more flavor and the oil base is somewhat lacking in zest.
author: Abigail R.

description: I don't go to North Beach very often because...I fucking hate North Beach. I'm not trying to hate, it's just not my cup of tea, ya dig? So because of my feelings I so rarely get to eat Golden Boy. I occasionally act as auxillary-substitute-trivia-mistress at the Church Key, so when I do that I always duck in for a slice of the garlic clam pizza. This pizza sounds not good, but, it is very not NOT good! Maybe I'll head down for a slice tomorrow, if I think I can bear it!
author: Jessica R.

description: Great pizza!  Anytime I am in North Beach I stop into Golden Boy for a quick slice and a beer.  It is sicialian style pizza served by the slice and because so many people go here there are always fresh slices.  The beer selection is also awesome, always different brews on tap incluing some of my favorite micros.  All this said, be prepared for a line-especially when the weekend bar crowd is out.
author: Ryan D.

description: OMG. So freaking good! My husband and I were at a bar in North Beach with his co-workers and we were craving pizza. So of course I used Yelp on my iPhone to find pizza places nearby. We made sure to leave the bar by 11:00pm to get to Golden Boy Pizza before they closed at 11:30pm. We ordered 2 slices of cheese and 1 slice of spinach. Oh my goodness...deeeeelicious. Golden Boy Pizza is now the pizza standard for my husband and me. It's just too bad it's not close to a BART station.
author: Roenna A.

description:
no parking.

okay besides that problem...there is no problem.  except that if you come at a bad time...they don't have their famous garlic clam pizza.  now, i don't like seafood or even eat anything other than fish n chips.  this pizza is sooo good and smells so good that YOU HAVE TO TRY IT.  

I mean how often do you smell something SO DELICIOUS that you have to try it?  this place is it.  clam garlic.
