otherwise you won't be sad that you had something else either.  come in for a slice and be on your way and walk around the north beach.  laugh a bit to yourself after you're done with your slice of pizza because you want to go back and order another slice.

thats why i suggest you eat the slice there and when you're done you can get yourself another slice.
author: Bing D.

description:
Awesome 'ZA....I usually come here for lunch but they are open late night for those with the beer munchies! It's square style pizza, and its all reasonably priced and yummy.

The combo is really really good, but so are the simpler slices as well. Great fast service, only downside is they are cash only.
author: Nick A.

description: Really like Golden Boy Pizza!  It's fresh and it's really good (and busy) late at night - especially on a friday/ saturday night.  I usually get the combo or pepperoni - price is a little on the higher side - but it's an "once in a while" treat.
author: MissJ J.

description:
A really good place for a slice of pizza. The first thing that I noticed about it was that the pizza isn't in Pie form. The pizza is a long inch thick piece of pizza crust that has stuff on it. It's about what I'd expect pizza was like before it came to America, or at least how it returned to Italy. 

The conistency of the crust reminded me of the deep dish pizza that domino's used to do (or still does). The edges had a nice little crispness to it. There really isn't a "end crust" like you get in a pie.

The downside to the pizza I had there was that the pepperoni pizza had like 5 pieces of pepperoni per slice. The combination slice, though, was chalk full of toppings. So if you're gonna go here take a look at the slices before you order and make sure you aren't going to get what is essentially a slice of cheese pizza. The pepperoni wasn't anything special. 

I wouldn't make this a destination but might go out of my way while walking around North Beach to get a slice here. I'd definitely only get the combination slice from them.

Totally worth the visit, but not the end all slice either.
author: H B.

description: MY FAVORITE PLACE TO GRAB PIZZA BY THE SLICE AND A BEER!! yupyup.. i LOVE the CLAM GARLIC but really you can't go wrong with any of the selections they have.
author: A L.

description:
Greasy, cheesy, golden goodness. 
After a drunken evening with the boyfriend and his friends we stumbled over to Golden Boy where I was told I would experience one of the best pizza slices of my life....and it was just that. We got there around 2a.m. and the line wasn't too bad- we waited for about 10 minutes. I would have waited an hour because it was nothing short of amazing. Oh, and if you're way inebriated as I'm sure most people are when they come here at 2a.m., there's a huge fluorescent finger pointing at the joint so you don't get lost or confused (I tend to fall into both of those categories....and not just when I'm drunk). 
I was simple and got a slice of cheese ($2.75/slice). How can a cheese pizza be THAT good you ask??? I have no freakin clue, but it was everything I would imagine the perfect slice of cheese to be- piping hot, perfectly crisp crust on the bottom, doughy center, just the right amount of pizza sauce, all topped with greasy, melted, gooey mozzarella goodness. A sprinkle of red pepper flakes on top and I was in pizza heaven. 
I had a bite of the garlic and clam ($3.75/slice) which everybody was raving about. It was definitely good, but I was way more into my slice of cheese. 
*Sigh* If only I didn't live in LaLa Land a.k.a. Los Angeles a.k.a the land of crap pizza. 
I hope to see you one of these days soon Golden Boy...until then you'll live in my hopes and dreams.
author: Shani D.

description:
This is LITERALLY THE BEST PIZZA BY THE SLICE IN THE CITY!  POW! BAMMM!  

It isn't exactly like GBP is the only pizza place open at 2am, there are tons of places in North Beach- but none of them touch GBP quality.  In other words, it is totally worth the wait if you see a long line right after last call.

I gotta give a special shout out to the staff of this place.  These people put up with a lot but are always friendly and willing to make one more pizza if it means serving a few more folks after hours.  


.
author: David E.

description: Hands down my favorite late night pizza! A great place to stop by to sober up ;-)
author: Dahlia S.

description: If you want your quick pizza fix, come here and get it, because you will have the doughiest, cheesiest, pizza orgasm in your mouth.  Plus you get the full on Italian experience with it being located right in the smack of Little Italy and even better if you get the guy with the tats on his forearm that straight up says "ITALIAN."
author: Caren K.

description: We stopped in on a Monday to get a couple of slices - took them to go - $7.   That is as good as it gets.   Many other places we intended on going to were closed on Mondays so we decided to just get a couple slices and go sit in the park (the place is a small bar).  Sodas were $1.25 each.   Thick Crust Pizza was excellent.  Cash only.   And you don't have to be drunk to enjoy.
author: David M.

description:
wow this pizza is good.
when other pizzerias recommend this place for slices, then it must be good, and s*** it was good.

alcohol probably helped too, but i think this pizza was very good.
tried their 'combo' which has meat and veggies, and it was super tasty. Tasted fresh, and it wasn't too oily. not a thin crust pizza.
author: H C.

description:
Yup, its good, check it out. 
Clam garlic parsley is the hit.
author: Ross J.

description: The line was long, the slices in big squares.  All ten of of us waited in line and happily ate it.
author: Meg W.

description: The pizza is good, but it's by no means mindblowing. It's perfect if you're hungry in the middle of a drunken night in North Beach, but I wouldn't come here sober.
author: Franklin H.

description: If I am ever on death row, I might likely request to have a Golden Boy slice and a beer as my final meal.
author: Charlie B.

description:
I absolutely love pizza.  If I had to pick one food to eat for the rest of my life, pizza would probably be it.  Being from the East Coast originally, I'm pretty picky about my pizza.  Don't get me wrong, I like pizza in many varieties, but this place really hit the spot for being pretty reminiscent of the stuff I remember from home.

The pizza is served in squares and although the slices may look a little small in the window, the crust is thick, doughy and filling.  It's not quite like the square pizzas I've had in the past, but it sure is tasty.  The last time I was here, I chose a slice of combination, since it looked the best of the variety.  I was pleasantly surprised by a nice mix of veggies including zucchini with some pepperoni and sausage.

It is certainly a dependable spot for a cheap, tasty slice of pizza.
author: Frances R.

description:
Hands down the best pizza I've ever had.  It's so good I try not to think about it when I'm not in San Francisco, because it makes me want to book a flight just for Golden Boy.  Hugely thick slices, and that's thick with cheese and toppings.  I've never been able to put down more than two, and I'm a big eater.  Take a chance and go for the clam and fresh parsley slice, if they have it.  It took me a few trips to get gutsy enough to try, but damn was it worth it.  Unless you order a whole pie, you have two pizzas in the window to choose from but I've never been even slightly displeased with any of their slices.  I'm also a big fan of meat and all-meat pizza, but I always go for at least one veggie pesto slice because the vegetables, especially the zucchini, always taste super fresh and delicious.

Cool staff too, skater type dudes generally.  You gotta love any place that has a picture of Christopher Walken placed prominently on the wall, and that plays skate DVDs as the entertainment.  Once I was there and the server noticed my jacket covered with punk rock patches, and started talking to me about punk.  I was drinking a Red Hook--as I'm almost done with the pint he grabs the glass and refills it.  Before you know it, I got 4 beers for the price of one.  I don't remember the guys name, but he was possibly the friendliest server I've ever had outside of a strip club.  Another time I was there before a show, and was tired and in an insanely bad mood, not even wanting to go to the show afterward.  The female server they had at the time (this is over ten years ago btw) was so nice that just talking to her put me in a good mood again.  Of course, that life-changing slice didn't hurt either.

It's a small place with two metal counters, so it can be crazy on Friday or Saturday nights.  I've never found that to be an issue either though, since everybody is so blissed-out on the pizza I've had nothing but good times there (I've gone at least 40-50 times).  I'm not sure why anyone wouldn't like this place, someone else pointed out the level of the reviewer's drunkenness may be a factor.  Maybe so, but drunk or sober, Golden Boy's slabs of loveliness do it for me every time.
author: The D.

description:
A great place to grab a slice in North Beach.  They usually have four different choices ready, if they've cooled off a bit, they'll just pop your slices back in the oven for a few minutes, and there you go, pipin' hot pizza.  

I usually go with two slices of their combination - pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, onions, zucchini, and tomatoes. Delicious!
author: Edwin L.

description: I'm not sure if its the amazing pizza, or the always entertaining lines forming at this spot, but it definitely gets all five stars from me.
author: Drew C.

description: Fluffy, cheesey and thick.. At first bite I couldn't make up my mind whether I liked it or not but as I took bite after bite I realized that I had become a fan of this type of pizza. Damn you Golden Boy!
author: Roger H.

description: Good square pizza slice, descent prices, quick and friendly.  Worth it if you are in the neighborhood.  Its open pretty late, serves beer.  Parking isn't easy.  And its cash only.
author: Kra C.

description: do you like pizza and really oily hands?  If so this is your place.  Good stuff, just not for the salad eaters.
author: christopher h.

description:
This little joint holds a special place in my heart, and is certainly a must destination whenever I visit S.F. The cravings start as soon as I spot the Transamerica Pyramid as the plane SLOWLY begins its descent. First the growling in the bottomless pit starts, then followed by small biological tremors as the withdrawals for this place continue to ensue. 
   Golden Boy also provides me with beautiful little reminiscent vignettes of my time in this wonderful city. I guess the Sicilian pies in the window were a beacon to me and other young art students at the time. We would meet here to discuss concepts for new projects and pieces, while many pieces were consumed. Even though the place has its obvious deterrents at times, the long lines and nowhere to sit, the little squares of gastronomic heaven make up for it. Beyond the pizza itself you get an interesting mix people at this place ranging from tourists, art students, and the Beat Patriarchs of the neighborhood. This melange of personalities is here for one thing, and one thing only their craving for SAUCE and CHEESE. 
   So until my next trek up from the South, I guess I can only savor the slices and the moments pleasure from my last visit to the Golden Boy and the Bay City.
author: Aaron T.

description: What to say? If you dont know about Golden Boy you are missing out! Go grab a square and enjoy!
author: Brent M.

description: This doesn't do it for me at all... The dough/crust, the sauce, the cheese, the spices.  My friends raved about it and I didn't get the hype. I was sorely disappointed. I guess it's a good deal, money-wise, but I can find better slices elsewhere.  This just isn't the place for me.
author: Jenn H. H.

description: Pretty damn good pizza and it is quick. 1 star for being cash only. Other than that its great. They sell those Pellegrino flavored waters which are delicious.
author: Darius A.

description: I love pizza. I mean LOVE pizza! This place could possibly serve the best slice of pizza I've ever had at 2am! The only reason I get excited to go out with my straight roommates in North Beach is because I know Golden Boy is in my near future!
author: Steven M.

description:
Sicilian Style with a crunchy crust for cold hard cashy.  

The cost is 3ish which is a bit steep, but doesn't matter to the mindless pouring out of the closing bars if you can wait in line.

This is better than N. Beach Pizza, but Tomasso's is much better than both.
author: Po L.

description:
I love this place. The pizza is nicely square or rectangle, and the crust is wonderful.  There is beer too, what else could you ask for?

It is set up like a small pub and has a selection of 5 or 6 beers on tap. They've got a soda fountain as well. 

Take it from a repeat customer. 

Be prepared to keep eating slice after slice at a reasonable price!
author: Alex S.

description:
GOLDEN BOY IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!

I've been going there since i was in diapers. they definitely have some of the best pizzas in town. plus, the people there are super nice.

i always take my friends here and everyone is always amazed at the different things to look at and the cool music. 

golden boy pizza is a hidden treasure in north beach.
author: angela s.

description: Barely lost pizza wars today to Tony's Coal Fired Pizza.
author: David J S.

description: Stopped in on a Fri. Night. Very good cheese pizza. It was crowded but service was fast and friendly. Really loud punk rock playing adding to the noise level. Otherwise would've had a 5 star rating.
author: Debbie S.

description: I've eaten here a lot.  Always tasty pizza, always tasty beer, always friendly peeps.  What more could you ask for?
author: F M.

description: It's a cool place with an interesting deco, but not for a long stay! Good for just to get a quick quality bite! The crust was really good and I really liked it! I think I'll go back again :)
author: Adi K.

description: AMAZING! Love the veggie pesto pizza! Totally worth spending 20 mins to find parking.
author: Taryn O.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is Amazing!! It is a "hip to be square" Sicilian style slice in the heart of North Beach and every bite brings back memories of fun nights out. It is cheap and easy, and I love how its straight to the point. Don't even think of asking for ranch. Get the Pesto Vegetarian! Mmmmmm, delicious. 

Beer on tap, too... :)
author: Rebecca W.

description: We're a Golden Boy Pizza family.  It's a dive bar with excellent slices of sicilian style pizza.  It's crowded, sometimes loud, and a bit on the dark side.  The local rock&roll bar crowd is seated at the counter, drinking fresh beer and crunching on their slices.  We've been going for years... it's consistently delicious.  Go expecting an unpretentious atmosphere at this tiny little hole in the wall - and enjoy the tasty slices.
author: Zen M.

description: I usually write five-star reviews b/c I write 'em when happy and sated.  I just got on the six-speed and rolled over to G-Boy for a quick light dinner (one slice) before the spring concert here at school.  Very satisfying and good North Beach flavor.  This place is no frills and always reliable.  I am not a big pizza guy but G-Boy is good.  Good stickers, good view of Green St, good.
author: Michael G.

description: The long night of vodka tonics probably influenced my high rating of this place but MAN that pepperoni pizza satisfied every pizza craving I have had over the past month!  It was square and easy to cut into devour-able pieces (to prevent burning the roof off of my mouth).  I wish I had more to write...but Golden Boy can be the last stop of my night any time.
author: Samantha S.

description: Depends on which misnomer slice you feel like ordering.  Good luck.  You'll definitely get it with a slice of attitude.
author: Vincent L.

description: Golden boy is overrated. It's not terrible, but it's overrated. The best part of it is the flaky, buttery crust. It's light and crispy and really, really good - texturally at least. The problem with golden boy is that the pizza doesn't really have much flavor. It's just pretty bland pizza at the end of the day. If you're gonna go, get the clam or something with a lot of flavor on top, because the core pizza itself is just meh. If you want really good NY-style by the slice pizza, go two blocks north to Tony's. Way better than this mediocre pizza.
author: Joshua E.

description: This pizza is amazing! Visiting my friend for the weekend and we went out for a few drinks and coming back to this pizza was heaven. Right size, great taste. Just perfect.
author: Alex N.

description: A review based solely on the pizza at Golden Boy Pizza would have been a full five stars; the quality of the service is what significantly brought the rating down. The cheese pizza was absolutely delicious, and had the perfect combination of sauce and spices and just the right amount of cheese. The fact that the pizza was served in squares brought back wonderful memories of eating pizza in Rome; in fact the pizza was almost as good as the pizza in Rome I compare all pizzas to nowadays. The service is another story; the waitress was quite snooty and attempted to get us in and out as quickly and inefficiently as possible once we asked for the pizza to-go. She even refused to give us a small box for our slices of pizza until we attempted to bribe her with money (which luckily she did not accept). If there was better service I would definitely be back during my next adventure to San Francisco.
author: Lindsey D.

description: For me this is THE BEST California style pizza in SF, I luv luv luv this place! The pizza is so delicious, its always fresh and ready to go and its filling and all of the ingrediants are delicious. Its a good thing I dont live in the North Beach area - I'd be here all the time! So good!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Staff are very friendly and nice. Food price reasonable. Quality is awesome for the price. Good menu selection. I taste their Pep,Italian Sauage, Combination their good. Have good crust flat bread style.  If you like pizza i would recommend this place to you.
author: Gruber T.

description: Great pizza and beer for under ten bucks.  Best time to go is around noon.  It's open late night but thats when the line tends to form, so i avoid all that.
author: Buddy R.

description: I have been here twice now and both times no luck with there famous clam pizza. But I am pretty simple when it comes to pizza. I love the pepperoni. I tried the combo but it was soggy like it was not cooked all the way. But I other than that I really like it. They are always really busy but worth the wait! Fresh ingredients and good pizza dough.
author: Yadira G.

description: Thick, squares of hot, cheesy heaven served up quick and easy.  I usually prefer a New York/thin crust style pie, but this place has made me rethink that preference.  Lots of beer on tap...you can't go wrong!  Did not rate it 5 stars due to it being Cash only and very small inside, so when it's busy you have to wait or get it to go.
author: Autumn C.

description: I've been looking for a place like this for months here in the Bay Area.  It's big-fat-square-pizza by the slice loaded with fresh toppings.  The dough, the cheese, the sauce; all flavors come together to create an Italian-American master piece.  Also, try the dark brew Hemp Ale on draft.  When it comes to sloppy pizza joints, it doesn't get any better than this.
author: Shane O.

description: omg omg omg i lavaaa youuu golden boy pizza omg omg omg omg. nomnomnomnomnom you so delicioussss nomnom especially at 2am nomnomnom i sometimes even go out of my way to north beach just so i can devour a slice of your cheesy goodness nomnomnom. my favorite is the sausage pizza nomnomnomnom the crust is delicious nomnomnom omg i lavaaa youuuuu. you my favoriteeeeeee sicilian pizzaaaa. nom!
author: Felicia C.

description: Golden Boy Pizza does not judge you.... Golden Boy will not say " You know those bowl cut bangs don't really suit your moon shaped face" or    " Fool! You shouldn't have drunk dialed all your high school exes!" NO! Golden Boy will comfort all your aches with it's piping hot, delicious, crispy on the outside, gooey on the inside, squares of goodness. You don't need to look any further, because Golden Boy will satiate your crazy pizza craving. Try the combo, pop a squat at the bus stop and eat that sucker while it's hot. You won't be sorry!
author: Lummi B.

description: Went here last night with a slight beer buzz.  It was decent pizza but didn't sing.  Would I go back?  Yeah, if I was looking for a late night snack, but it's certainly not destination pizza for me.  I'd probably stick with Bowzers or Little Star.
author: Ankur P.

description: I didnt wanna like it because it reminds me of all the pizza joints on Washington in South Beach Miami, FL- but Golden Boy is so much better than those dives! I eat here every other night about 11pm and my ass is still tight.
author: Sunny Joy B.

description: I don't come to North Beach very often but after enjoying my 2 for 1 beers at the bar next door (or 2 down) I came here for a bite. I can see why there was such a crowd outside. Only drawback, it's cash only...boo. I can't wait to come back though...it WAS yummy...
author: Christina D.

description: Great pizza, good friendly service.  The line might seem intimidating at night, but it's worth the wait for a late night snack, or even a light meal.
author: Jon S.

description:
This is the best slice I've found in SF.  I go here for lunch all the time for a slice of their combo ($3.75 I think).  It ALWAYS has two pieces of pep & sausage respectively.  Gotta love the attention to detail.

They also consistently have pretty good music going (i.e. Queens of the Stone Age) with espn on in the background.  The people are friendly, but not phonies, good draft beer options, AND the slices are square!  None of this triangle bullshit.  

I never bought into the mantra that the crust is the "best part", but seriously ask for a side piece here.  I'd suggest going for lunch, or before last call on the weekends, because it's no secret that this is THE place for "drunchies"!

~enjoy
author: Chazo G.

description: Last night I finally tried this pizza. My friends kept telling me about how good it was so I wanted to see for myself. I actually didn't really like it that much. Plus the woman who took my order was pretty rude. After dealing with her I didn't want to ask her anymore questions for fear that she might lose it. It also kind a bothers me that this restaurant doesn't deliver. If they are doing such good business because it's very popular, you'd think that the owner would consider at least trying out a delivery service. It would probably improve the long line because people would be so glad that they can just order from home. Plus there are pan handlers and other people who like to harass those who wait in the long line and that happened to me also. I'm not saying there pizza is horrible, but  this place definitely has it's negative points.
author: Alex W.

description: this is my go to place for fast pizza when my boyfriend and i crave pizza. they always have fresh baked pizza at the window and you can have your pick with what you fancy. the pizza is a perfect ratio of pizza dough with the cheese and toppings. each bite is very delectable. just one slice is not enough. just try this place if ever you are in north beach.
author: Aileen F.

description: A friend of mine had a Total Recall party at her house in North Beach.  (yes the movie Total Recall). Every time they said the word Mars we would all have to drink....Damm they said Mars a lot.  Ok im off the subject but that night we ordered Pizza from Golden Boy, we ordered a peperoni pizza and a plain cheese pizza.  The pizza had pretty good flavor but it was to doughy.  Im a huge fan of NY style pizza, the thinner the crust the better.  So all in all i wouldn't order from here but I would eat it.
author: Mike K.

description: The service is kind of shit, and the people are kind of trashy, but the pizza is spot-on. Unfortunately this place still hasn't accomplished packing flavor into their vegetarian slice by way of better or more sauce, perhaps more seasoning, it's still more fattening than anything. But this place satisfies when I'm drunk, sober, cold, or hot, and the delicious crunchy pepperoni atop these pillowy crusts make me happy.
author: Y K.

description: I Love Golden Boy Pizza, Its the real deal. I love eating at the bar. I brought my boyfriend  with me this past weekend because he had to try it (since he's from OC) and I've talked enough about it SO when he saw the line of people waiting for a slice he said that's always a good sign!  He loved the garlic pizza, I stuck with the OG, pepperoni pizza YUummm. I love the simplicity of it all. I hope you'll get to go one day. Its my favorite place in the city! (O and cash only)
author: Rose L.

description:
A good place for a quick and tasty meal on a focaccia type bread. 

The slices are deceptively filling. We ordered a beer and 2 slices each and had a hard time finishing. I appreciated the simple slices of pepperoni more than the complex pesto.  Was entertaining and filling and nice to catch part of a Giants game.

It was kinda hard to get our waitresses attention when we wanted to leave but all in all a good experience.
author: Cynthia J.

description: Nothing new to add,...it's predictably delicious every time i visit north beach, sober or smashed!!!
author: Kevin B.

description: The crust is what makes the pizza here.  It's crunchy without being hard and soft on the inside.  If I lived around the area, North Beach Pizza would get zero play from me.  Golden Boy shits all over North Beach.  Definitely top 3 pizza place in the city for me.
author: Per C.

description: Tangy sweat sauce, its own crust, decent cheese! Do not need to be drunk to enjoy! I've been coming here for a while when I'm in North Beach for a slice of pizza. Always satifying... always a great treat.
author: Mike D.

description: Great pizza, nothing like throwing down a slice of zza as your stumble home from the bars in Northbeach.
author: Dan M.

description: Did I hear square pizza! If you are in Northbeach you need to grab a slice of Golden Boy, it's been here ages that should speak for itself. So good.
author: Karen T.

description: Love Golden Boy pizza, the clam and garlic, the veggie, any combo....so good and not too thick!  So good if you drank some.  They do sell their focaccia at some high end grocery stores-YUM!
author: Gina G.

description: The place to grab a late night bite after drinking in North Beach!  I loved the Sicilian slices.
author: Brent F.

description: make sure to leave the neighboring bars before 1 am to ensure that you'll get a slice of heaven. and for those that think it is just drunk food, know it is just as good sober. my personal fav is tried and true pepperoni but i know the specials are always a hit too. its got the right amount of sauce to cheese to bread ratio, hot out of the oven, and just plain delicious. don't forget to tip the nice woman who works the stand late nights on the weekend. she deserves it!
author: Cathy L.

description: Best pizza I've had in a while. Place is a total shithole but those places usually breed the best pizza. Don't expect nice service but you get what you pay for. one or two slices of 3 dollar pizza was enough to eat. Well worth the price. YUM
author: Nicki M.

description:
when I'm craving pizza there are three places i would go -

little star, if i want a sit down meal, 
pizza orgasmica if a want a delivery meal  
AND
golden boy if i want a quick stand up meal

drunk or not, golden boy is delicious - the flavors are strong, salty, juicy, tangy and spongy as some have said.   be careful not to be too eager and burn your lips with the steamy cheese!  and always get the pizza that just came out of the oven, not the cold ones that need to be reheated.   

it really is so perfect.  just be prepared to drink a gallon of water afterwards.
author: Josie M.

description:
This place has been such an important part of my North Beach existence.  The cheese, veggie pesto, or garlic clam slices with a Trumer Pils make for my classic proletariate food pairing, not that I'd usually admit to thinking in such terms.  I've spent my last few bucks on Earth here numerous times and when my hands shake, my heart reverberates, seriously.

I've lived in Brooklyn for many years and I honestly never had such sentimental feelings for any NYC pizza spot as I do for here... I was born in SF and it makes me really-fucking-happy to see local kids making loot and being themselves working at this spot.  I like watching sports (I never tell that I'm a Padres fan) or skate videos on fuel tv at Golden Boy, and I even forgive the occasionally alterna-emo radio station some of them play while working.  

Feels like home, yo.
author: roland b.

description: I live up the hill, and this place has been one of my usual staples for a place to get a cheap dinner when I don't feel like cooking.  In the past, this place has served pretty good "west coast pizza" (I'm from the east coast, so I have to modify my pizza expectations out here).  Lately however, the past few times I've ordered a few squares to bring home, the crust has been totally wet and salty.  I'm not sure what is going on there, but quality recently has taken a swan dive.  I'll curb my desire to give this place one star, based on past trips, and cross my fingers that they get their act together.
author: Perry W.

description: So, I am not usually the biggest fan of pizza...I am also pretty picky as I worked at a pizza restaurant for years and am kind of burnt out on it. Well, the Golden Boy has rocked my world.  I had the combination and they put plenty of toppings and sauce, it was fresh, cheap and very hearty - this is no pansy slice of pizza.  It may also have helped that I was a tad wasted.  They get extra points for being open so late to accommodate SF's riff raff.  I didn't give five stars because the line was long and we had to wait a while in the cold - I know this is part of the hole-in-the-wall charm, but that doesn't make waiting in the cold any less annoying. That said,  I will definitely be going back for more.
author: Erin E.

description: This place was okay, and if it weren't for the crazy number of five star reviews I would probably give it three, but... really? The best pizza you've ever had?? Do you live in a box?? Have you not been to Delfina, Flour+Water, Little Star, Zero Zero? I was craving pizza the other night and hopped onto Yelp. This place had really high reviews so my husband and I headed over to North Beach. It was like 11:30pm on a Saturday night, so we got to stand in line in front of a bar where a myriad mix of drunk sloppy people hobbled in and out, many of them deciding to join us in line. My guess is that this is where most of their Yelp reviews come from-- if you are drunk and hungry on a Saturday night and you are near this place, then get in line and you will be greatly rewarded. The Sicilian crust will do its best to absorb your Kamikaze shots. One thing I will say about this place is that the sauce was very flavorful. I would totally come back here again if I were nearby and hungry for a quick bite, but it's not worth traveling to and is definitely not close to the best pizza you can get in the city.
author: Kathryn M.

description: The fact that this place has such a high rating has further reinforced my belief that people on the West Coast don't know what good pizza is. It's completely bland; I have a hunch that folks like this place more for its hole-in-the-wall diner-like atmosphere than its food.
author: V R.

description: When I was 17 I used to go here and eat several slices of pizza with a root beer.  I also used to order it to go, the issue was the pizza never made it home.  I've revisited since and coupled the pepperoni with a guinness, now that does the job. While it may be lost on some I always enjoyed looking up at the ceiling pretending you're eating in a train car.  Warning: the pizza is addicting and will power won't help you.
author: J P.

description: Best Pizza in SF ...small place with fewer choices and square pizza slices....but undoubtedly the best in SF...Combo and veggie are awesome...yet to try others but certain they'll be as good as these....
author: Nilesh J.

description: Came here with a few friends on a late night snack on Saturday! If you want to eat some good pizza by the slice, go here! The pizza a good size square cuts. I has the clam and garlic which was so tasty! Also, and spicy sausage pepperoni combo.  You have to try it!!! This place is very busy late night and parking will be a challenge but well worth it. I say it has to be one of the best pizza I have ate so far.
author: Jhermaine S.

description: Love this place, if I can find parking or walk! They got a nice friendly staff and good selection of beers. Lets not forget the unique square pizza, you hardly ever see it anymore. It taste good but is a tad bit more expensive as the years have gone on. I'll continue to come back here for years. Oh, don't expect a sitdown, its all bar seating!
author: Steven C.

description:
The following is an actual IM conversation i intercepted between Skeletor from HeMan and Betty White from Golden Girls....ill just post the parts about GoldenBoy Pizza.

GlDnGrrrl: wb!

HeManH8R: *sweet
GlDnGrrrl: does Lord and Taylor turn you on?
HeManH8R: im more of a purple skin, spandex guy, but wtf? y not?
GlDnGrrrl: mmmmmmm :p

*************************************

It was about this point that i got the idea they werent discussing Golden Boy anymore....
author: Mick F.

description: Even though I am pretty exclusive with crispy thin crusts when it comes to pizza, I tried this popular, old North Beach favorite for a little Sicilian-style action. Sitting at the creepy counter is really fun, actually, as you get to watch them slinging slices for the diverse clientele who wander in, as well as read all of the cheeky comments slipped on the menu board. As for the pizza itself, it's not my thing. Maybe I'm just not "Eye-talian" enough, as it was too thick, too cheesy, and un-saucy for my taste, but their unique atmosphere alone is enough to garner three stars.
author: Gregor G.

description: Good value pizza. $3 for a slice. Fun atmosphere. Was expecting a little better pizza after seeing so many reviews. I guess I'm spoiled with Chicago and NY Pizza.
author: B A.

description: Took the boyf here for his b-day. He's pretty much obsessed with pizza and Little Star was closed for lunch so this was my #2 pick. It was pretty small inside but it wasn't busy, surprising for a Saturday afternoon. Most people just got slices to go but we dined in. I got a slice of cheese and it was very tasty. I probably could have eaten a second slice but thought I'd stick to one. When we left, I felt hungry again. It's was a decent sized slice but it felt really light - not heavy and oily like other places. I (not a huge pizza fan) was still raving about it 2 days later. I will be back - with or without the boyfriend. This place is good!
author: Lita J.

description:
Disclaimer: I've never had Golden Boy pizza sober.

It's really, really good at 3am.  The pepperoni slice really hits the spot.  I love this place.
author: suzie k.

description: This north beach is a gem and must for pizza lovers in the area.   I recently moved further away...but still make the trek back regularly to grab a corner slice of the veggie pesto.  Bar staff is great, rarely too long of a wait except circa 2am.  Only downside is cash only...but at their great prices, not enough of a hurdle to miss out.
author: Ben R.

description: Great pizza by the slice! After a 3mi hike on Telegraph Hill, a drink at the local bar "Grant and Green", a take out slice from Golden Boy was just what I needed.  The square sliced vegetarian (heated) was thick, cheesy, greasy in a good way and different than what I usually get when I order a pizza. We also tried the combo which was also good but the veggie was my favorite. One local recommended it and another said it wasn't his favorite but since I loved it I'm now on the hunt for the next local slice.
author: Dianne M.

description: The best slice in the city. Amazing foccacia crust with tons of cheese. I am not a huge fan of sauce so this stuff is perfect. I love the veggie - the toppings are so fresh. There's usually a line after midnight but so worth it!
author: Jody B.

description:
I have to disagree with the masses.  The pizza from Golden Boy is not that great.  It seems like most positive reviewers come here after a fun night of inebriation, which usually tends to alter the senses.  I, on the other hand, have yet to try these square slices under the influence because each time I've been here, I'm left unimpressed and unsatisfied (just the other night, I had a slice at Golden Boy, and went home to make my own Trader Joe's bbq chicken pizza).  In my sober state of mind, the pizza is always bland and the crust is always lacking oomph.  It's a bit thicker than normal pizza crust, but it lacks a crispiness.  It's like eating focaccia pizza, ugh.  Each time I've been here, they have been out of their notoriously tasty garlic clam pizza, so I've always opted with the combo slice.  You can never go wrong with combo slices, right?  But at $3.75 for a slice, it's pricey and not that tasty.  To avoid the long wait and the obnoxious drunks, get here an hour or two before last call.

I was once excited to come here since they serve up Sicilian-style pizza, which is reminiscent of all the pizzerias I went to in Italy (fyi: best pizza in the entire world as far as I know: L'Antica Bottica della Pizza in Rome!!!)  But unfortunately for me, Golden Boy doesn't live up to its true Sicilian standards.
author: Diane L.

description: This is certainly not the best pizza or the best late night slice in San Francisco. True, its owned by its classic next door neighbor Sodini's, but just because you cut a pizza into squares rather than triangles does not a best slice make.  Once you overcome the geometric illusion and regain your senses, you realize that this pizza is really just fair.
author: Rick H.

description: I could go for a slice of Golden Boy clam and garlic pizza right about now.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
momma meeah, poppa peeah....my pee pee loves this pizzariahhh...ooh lah lah cha cha cha...dont you wish you could place your drooling lips around one of their big slices.
best pizza.  nice crew. tiny place as tiny can get...
who says a slice of pizza doesnt go great with armpit stink...they dont know rome!
a "must be seen eating here place"- get in there!
author: Sasha P.

description: If you like shi**y pizza that tastes frozen then Golden Boy Pizza is for you...  If you like to stand in long lines and wait for shi**y pizza then golden boy is for you.   Save your money and starve...
author: kristy g.

description: I was just walking by for a quick snack on Sunday night. I saw Golden Boy Pizza and have always heard great reviews about their Pizza. BOY was everyone right. I had a slice of combination pizza and it was absolutely amazing. The crust was crispy and the toppings were juicy!  Must try! The staff there was also very nice people.
author: HENRY M.

description: THE pizza spot in North Beach. Sit at the bar or counter and your piping hot squares will be out in minutes. Pair with one of the beers have in tap and it's an unbeatable combo. I think the move here is the Pesto Vegetarian. Oh, and they play the illest jams. A definite must go.
author: Natalie T.

description: At first it seems to be your typical pizza joint. However, once you have a seat on their vintage stools and sink you teeth into one of their "Sicilian" style slices, it's anything but ordinary. This place is great and is now in my top 2 places for pie in SF. The staff, first of all, were really cool. They have beer on tap and the place is plastered with autographed memorabilia and funny things to look at. All the pizza is served Sicilian style (deep dish some may call it) which happens to be what I ate a lot of as a kid and in Little Italy (NYC).  I love it! The toppings were good and there was a nice variety of "flavors" to choose from...a classic "all-meat", a pesto and olive, veggie and a couple others in there too. All together I think I saw 5 different choices, not bad. Not too far from some local watering holes so location shouldn't be too much of an issue. I'll be back!
author: Gabriel R.

description: Food was inexpensive and really good! Kind of a hole-in-the-wall place. Very casual, seating at the bar, lots of fun!
author: Alex A.

description: So good! A sheet of their pizza can literally feed a whole army! Will definitely be coming back to try the veggie, it looked mouth watering. The lady behind the counter could've been much nicer but it wasn't a horrible first visit. The look of the place is very different, kinda grungy, but not in a dirty way. Would def recommend.
author: D D.

description: Tasty pizza! I love that they give you a knife and fork. My advice is to take it to go and eat somewhere else though. It's not so much that it's small, it's that the setup doesn't really accommodate people in line ordering and people sitting at the bar at the same time. And with a park just one block away, why not eat outside?
author: Tamara M.

description:
Golden Boy Pizza is especially yummy if you are out drinking all night, hungry and freezing cold with only $6 in your pocket. The sheets of pizzas are FRESH off the oven. They are warm since they are very popular. The slices are in square. I would have given them 4 stars if they just put a little more tomato sauce in their pizzas. 

The place closes at midnight. Golden Boy has to watch out for Tony's pizza. It has taken over the now closed La Spiaggia Delicatessen and will sell pizza by the slice.
author: Ed W.

description:
hello lover...

fluffy dough, perfect sauce, lots of toppings. and CHEAP! screw the touristy italian places around this neighborhood...go here
author: Hanna K.

description: What a dive? What a pie? Awesome service. They do only one thing and they do it sooo well. 2nd best in the city
author: Njon W.

description:
around 830 pm tonight, i tried to go to houstons, but when i got there, there was a 25 minute wait.  by this time, i was already feeling faint from starvation, so it was suggested that we go to north beach for golden boy pizza.  i was not easily convinced, b/c i was too tired to even walk back to the car, but hey, i've never been one to turn down pizza.  i thought i knew every pizza joint in sf already, but apparently i did not.  

the pizzas here are basically sold by the slice and have a nice thick crust.  the cheese pizza was still in the oven when we arrived, so we started out w/ the veggie pesto slice, which was pretty good.  i was told, however, that the cheese pizza was the way to go, b/c their pizza sauce is really good.  when the cheese slices came out, we got one of those, and i was not disappointed.  the tomato sauce was piping hot, and the cheese was oozing.  the crust here is hearty, so a slice and a half for me was more than enuf.  i left happy, satiated, and able to walk back to the car 5 blocks away.
author: Helen T.

description: It's SICILIAN, not square, you west coast wusses. Delisious both drunk & sober.
author: Maria D.

description: My boyfriend introduced me to this pizza place, and I've got to say I'm hooked! Best pizza by the slice place in North Beach, by far. The pizza is always boooomb, and they have several selections to choose from already made, and just pop it in this little oven behind the register to reheat it (which I don't mind at all since the pizza is always so so good!) Also, they have very limited seating and they tend to get pretty packed on the weekends between 10-2 am when the North Beach drunk crowd decides they're hungry, so I usually take my slice to go. Best place to go for a quick, thick, tasty slice of pizza. And I hear they've opened up a location in San Mateo recently so it'll be good to have a Golden Boy on the Peninsula! Knocking one star off because this place is CASH ONLY! Ugh!!
author: Norma B.

description: This place rules! I spent a day walking around the city with a buddy when he suggested getting the clam pizza, which, was f&*king amazing! i Don't usually like square pizza,i don't know why i understand it's weird maybe it's the shape who knows, and clam on a pizza? But the pizza was amazing. It's a odd little hole in the wall with limited space but the beer was great, the atmosphere was super chill. I would for sure suggest going to this place for whatever reason it may be, your sure to be satisfied.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Best eaten after a few too many drinks, as you can see by the line out the door on a Thursday-Saturday after 10 pm. Ask them to reheat your pizza and put it in a box. If you get it in a bag it ends up sticking to the sides and being a much less enjoyable Golden Boy experience. The guys who serve up the delicious squares of pizza are chill.  The best thing about this place is I have to walk uphill on the way home so I feel way less guilty about the splurge!
author: Lauren H.

description: My bf has been raving about this place since we started dating and I finally made it there this week.  I was sober, but I can see how much better the slice would be if I wasn't...slightly greasy, nice, thick crust, crispy and cheesy.  Yum.
author: Mitzi C.

description: I'm from New York and always complaining that I cannot get a good slice of pizza. Until I discovered Golden Boy. Pizza by the slice, cheap, eat-in, and one of the few places that actually heats their pizza hot enough. I don't have a car so I wish that they delivered, but I'm usually willing to trek up to North Beach for it.
author: A S.

description: I have to say I think this whole place is way over rated. Maybe just because I hated the crust. Really, it was more like toast. From Texas. I absolutely love pizza, but damn folks...this was my first and last time.
author: Travis H.

description: I sat in last night with a freinds band at the Grant & Green, and nothing could top off those tequila shots better than a thick slice of Golden Boy. Then off to shots of Jack at a friends... then into a cab, off to bed with the phone still ringing... Had a street cleaning ticket this morning becasue i left my parking open in case anyone came over... $50. Gotta love SF.
author: Adam X.

description: A square of sausage pizza and a can of San Pelligrino Aranciata and a park bench at Washington Square,  it's one of my favorite experiences.
author: .James A.

description: Scillian pizza rocked. Crust was thick and tasty. We had the veggie pizza and it was fantastic. Loved the atmosphere as it's totally small, narrow and local type spot.
author: Reagan H.

description: Ok so who knew square pizzas could taste as good as the round ones;-)  Im not too keen on thick style pizzas because they have a tendency to be too doughy and not bake well with the sauce- but here its well done-- not too airy and cooked through!!! I usually get the one with all the veggies or simply the mushroom-- deliciousssss!  Luv it...decor is bar style with hard rock music on the background- servers are kewl and chatty :-)
author: Arissa C.

description: This is not only the best pizza in San Francisco, it's better than any pizza I've had nation wide. I dream of Golden Boy pizza at night. Enough said?
author: Edward H.

description: Who doesn't crave pizza after a night out in North Beach? Golden Boy serves up the best pizza you'll find after 2am. Of course, the pizza is yummy no matter what time it is. Be cautious of belligerent drunks standing in line with you. The wait drives some people mad.
author: Connie C.

description: 405 people have already weighed in... I just felt like saying something positive about pizza today.
author: charlotte c.

description:
golden boy pizza looks so different during the day when there isn't a long line of hungry drunkards waiting to buy a slice.

if pizza's the main thing they serve, why didn't they have the combo or the sausages slices available at the moment i wanted them? why? whatever, i got over it in a second.

the crust of their sicilian slices ... deliciously thick and crunchy. but they don't have a marinara option. they so should. then maybe this'd turn into "my favorite" hole in the wall.
author: spiff e.

description:
Okay...there are BETTER pizza places..and even around the block in the city.

BUT..and a BIG BUTT....

This pizza place somehow hits the spot at the right time of night.
Maybe it's a late night snack after bar hopping and you just need that pizza fix.

I'm not sure what it is..but this place GETS IT.

The slices are these doughy yet crispy squares that come out on a flat sheet.

WE grabbed a slice while we were waiting to be seated at the HOUSE down the street.  What better way to eat Asian Fusion food but starting off w/a slice of pizza!

The GREAT PART of GOlden BOY pizza..is that it's situated like a bar and you can just stand in line to get a slice to go.  The slices are ALWAYS fresh out of the oven. 

The great part is the wam crunchy texture of the pizza and just enough sauce to satisfy the back part of the mouth.

Lots of European toursity patrons the day I was there.  Dunno if they all heard of this place..or just a coincidence.

The slices are relatively cheap..but you just can't beat the fresh out of the oven..crunchy goodness..

I'll be back here for a starter slice..if I try ANY of the italian places or the HOUSE again...
author: Michael L.

description: Thick tasty foccacia crust for this pizza. Toppings are fresh & well-proportioned. By the slice is their thing. There was a short line out the door when we got there, so it was bound to be good.
author: Sara W.

description:
One of my all time favorite pizza joints.  Cool staff, delicious pizza.  The Garlic and clam is awesome.  Thinking about it, while writing this review, is making me drool.  The Veggie is also a must try....

Definitely go!...

Now! haha...
author: Carleton C.

description: Stopped in for a quick sample, a combo and a cheese. Both were good, but I took away a star because it had a little too much oregano. There is nothing like New Haven pizza!
author: Douglas P.

description: The "IT" spot for late night grub in North Beach. Just look for the window with a line half way down the block and you've discovered Golden Boy. If you go at the right times, they have garlic clam pizza which is just the best slice of pizza you'll ever have in your life. I'm happy with just a simple slice of pepperoni, but the garlic clam is borderline orgasmic. Every time I've been here, I've had to wait at least 20-30 minutes before getting to the window, and this is at 2 in the morning, mind you. Good luck trying to find a seat inside. Just take your food outside and mingle with all the other pizza lovers - it's the San Francisco way.
author: Michelle W.

description:
i love going to the window to order a slice.  yum yum in the tum tum.  on my way to film night at the park, i thought what would make the evening even better?  how about a square (or really rectangle) of the calm and garlic?  the best thing EVAH!  it's love in the tum.  i love that it's open late and if you are bar hopping on grant, just swing down green for some delicousness.  remember they at the end of the day when they run out don't be the sorry fellow on the curb without a slice.  you'll be sorry.

the squares are priced $2.50-3.50 with the pricer being my fav, calms and garlic, along with some specials they produce.  the service is fast and friendly.  if you want to eat there, the bar allows for limited space.
author: Sharlene C.

description: I was on a pizza mission and had stopped (on 2 different days) to sample the very thin designer pizzas offered at high rated places in North Beach.  Those pizzas were pretty good but after I had one a few doors down from Golden Boy, I was still hungry.  Walked into the bar and ordered a slice of cheese.  One word, heavenly.  The 1/2 to 3/4 of an inch crust was light and airy.  Great flavor.  The young lady that attended to the heating of slices  was wonderful.....full of smiles and asked multiple times if I'd like a refill on my diet coke.  Just a great experience at about 1/4 the price of the designer pies.  Will return on my next trip to the area.
author: Tom L.

description: This is an excellent option when you had a couple of glasses of wine across the street to pop over for some great slices.  It's our go to for years and we still love to make a stop when visiting the Bay Area.
author: Carol K.

description: narrow bar-stool seating..mostly a pizza by the slice joint.....averaging $3 a slice...pick your pie..vegetarian, pepperoni, sausage, cheese....sometimes fresh from the back...sometimes not...reheated in the front mini-oven....basket overlayed with wax paper and on goes your slice......thick...bready...rectangular sicilian pan pizza style slices.....wash it all down with a pitcher of brew...shy over $10 for a pitcher...
author: Hen A.

description: Was stumbling around in north beach searching for food and happen to walk into golden boy for a bite. little did I know I was going to fall in love with this little spot. I tried the vegetarian pesto pizza.....then ordered another one 5 minutes later. amazing pizza.
author: nick h.

description: Although the crust was a bit soggy and the pizza itself was nearly parsleyed to death, the delicious and generously sized clam and garlic slice totally hit the spot for late night munchies. Lots of garlic and clams, too.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Anyone who has been drunk more than once in North Beach has been to Golden Boys.  It is the place to o to pick up a slice or 3 when you know you may wake-up hungover or drunk.
author: Shiho F.

description: Best pizza in the city.  This is not a mantle to be taken lightly, so I'll repeat it slowly: BEST. PIZZA. IN. SAN FRANCISCO.  Go for dinner or during a light-traffic time so you can sit down and watch the staff play Gran Turismo from across the room using wireless PS2 controllers.  Open til 3 AM, but after 1:30 or so you have to deal with the Broadway types who come in droves to dilute their cultured sashimi-and-sake buzz with pepperoni-and-cheese.
author: Mike O.

description: If you didn't know:  the best slice in the city.    So now you know.    They warm if up for you nice and toasty, serve you a beer, and make you a GOLDEN BOY.    I get a golden tingley feeling in my pants just thinking about it.
author: Pej A.

description: I had heard this place was good and in a two-for-one-at-Columbus-Cafe haze I decided to try it. Let me just say that it's super greasy -- and I love grease -- and it did me wrong. It probably saved my life that night but I'd never eat it again.
author: Christopher M.

description: Love the vibe of this place and the cheap eats.  The clam and garlic is a little rough for the uninitiated so you may just want to stick to sausage.
author: dan d.

description: Delishimiso.. I was just here this past weekend and the pizza slices (combination and veggie) hit the spot. Place has a nice look,the place is clean, and the staff is friendly. It's a popular spot and it gets busy so you will need to be patient but good things come to those who wait, agree?
author: Alden M.

description: Yummy authentic Italian style pizza. My scilian friend Joey loves this joint (I'm Chinese so my pizza opinions are only worth so much). It's golden!
author: Peter S.

description: Always fresh and quick. This place is definitely a neighborhood spot. Their veggie is good and sometimes when I feel adventurous I get their garlic and clam. Super Yummy!  -1 star because now they are charging for take out boxes!
author: Jackie M.

description: The lines don't lie, all the drunk people at the end of the night knows what they crave, and they crave for THEEE BESTT pizza. I haven't gotten any further than the Cheese pizza.  I SHOULD try other stuff but, why fix what's not broken? The crust is unbelievable. It's crustilicious. And the cheese!! omg!! it's mind blowing!! damnit! I want some now... :(
author: My C.

description: good pizza, but if you just wanna pick up slices, you kinda have to just get what's available. I wish they always had mushrooms and sausage
author: grant l.

description:
Best  Italian-style pizza in North Beach if not a huge chunk of SF. I don't mess around with pizza. I know what I'm talking about. The New York styles are OK but Golden Boy serves up more than a snack. Their focaccia crust is made by hand and a slice can serve as a meal.  It's a narrow, shotgun floor plan so it gets cramped during a rush. I love the locale and the girls are hot!

Two slices and an import beer $10-$14
author: Denver R.

description: I love this pizza especially after long work week or a couple of cocktails with the co-workers. I can't eat it at lunch time or I fall into a blissful pizza coma!
author: William L.

description: There aren't too many things in life more satisfying than a 1am hot slice of sausage pizza @ Golden Boy after a few rounds of drinks.  Just make sure you're not here too late or you'll find yourself in the back of a long line praying to the man above that a slice remains when your number's up!
author: Jason G.

description: go get the clam/garlic! one of the best pizzas I've ever had.
author: Kaan L C.

description: I don't know if I have told all of you, but pizaa is my thing. This place has been my thing for years! When I lived here in 2001, I was there three, maybe four times a week. I lived close by and I was a poor  college kid trying to eat and have enough for a beer too.  I'm sure many of you understand. Well, I moved back  to the city and I am still addicted to this place! Same crew working in the joint. Just a little older like me and a little funnier. I think it comes with age. Still rockin' the same beats and good cheap beer! I have a bit more cash now, so I like to get a piece to go. Incase I need a late night snack or don't want to make dinner the next night. Just stick it in the oven for 7 minutes and dinner is ready! The greatest people work there and the greatest pizza ever. God Bless GOLDEN BOY!
author: monika l.

description: Best pizza in town. Minus one star because it's cash only. Who carries cash?
author: Erin D.

description: I was trying to think of a reason not to give this place a 5 and all I could come up with is: "I don't give 5 stars because nothing is that perfect." F that, this place deserves more than a 4. The pizza is the best I've had in the city, and the 2nd best I've had outside of NY (Pagliaccis in Seattle takes that honor). Atmosphere and decor are perfect for a slice joint, I wouldn't change a thing. Fantastic.
author: Danny S.

description: This pizza is amazing! It is completely fresh and smells better than any other pizza I've ever smelled. The slices are fairly large and super cheap. They're all great, but the combo is my absolute fave!
author: Ashley B.

description: Lisa always rocks and takes good good care of us.  Great hole in the wall!  See ya at the track this summer Lisa and Peter!
author: Catherine R.

description: I give it five stars because when its 1:30am and you've been at the Grant & Green for the past 2 hours rockin out, anything greasy, cheesy and doughly is the best damn thing thats ever happened to you.
author: Erin F.

description: I swear this is the best Sicilian-style pizza in the Bay Area!! Seniore's and Pizza Chicago have nothing on this joint! The lines and the cash only may want you to leave but after grabbing a slice (or two) and a pint you'll feel right at home next to people from all over the city!
author: Eric A.

description: its my SHI**....man got two mondo-slices here. I had cheese and a meat combo. I should have not had 2...but I didn't find that out until I got home and they were looking up at me. WIth their broiled cheese eyes, and tomato sauce smiles saying...eat us Jess...eat us. So I did. And felt like a fat ass the rest of the night. And yet, it was undoubedly worth it!
author: Jess V.

description: Golden Boy Pizza is by far the best pizza in San Francisco! I usually only end up getting pizza from here when I hit the bars in North Beach because it is so convenient. I always get a slice....or two of the combination pizza and it is delicious every time!
author: Brian C.

description: Okay, being from NYC I am a tough critic of pizza and considering that the thing in California seems to load bad pizza with tons of great toppings to make it taste good- this place is a diamond in the rough. Thank god I can walk there any time I want. It is worth the wait on line!
author: Jess W.

description: Golden Boy Pizza has some delicious pizza!  The crust is just buttery enough and the sauce has the perfect amount of tang.  I like their pizza with extra sauce and double meat (they are a little bit skimpy on the meat).
author: Ryan C.

description:
Ate here during a bar crawl two weeks ago.

Waited in line and walked out with an open pizza box with my friends' and my slices. Then, the unthinkable happened: My pepperoni slice slid down the top of the box, onto the concrete below, cheese side down.

I literally got down on my knees, crying to the heavens "NOOO!" before looking down and trying to pick it up quickly with my fingers. But alas it was no good. The cheese was so hot it burned my fingers and were melted onto the ground. I felt like crying.

Luckily, another friend was still ordering so I yelled at him to get me another slice. He could tell I wasn't fucking around and promptly brought me my new slice. And it was damn good. i think what it is is that the sauce is super garlicky and the cheese is super cheesy.

Would stop here whenever I'm in the neighborhood though I think it's a little pricey. I could eat like $20 worth of pizza as a snack probably.
author: K C.

description: This has got to be the best of all the late night pizza joints in the city. It's so good, I'll go during the day! That says a lot for a late night joint. This pizza is not like many around the city. What does it is the interesting crust, it's actually foccacia. It's fluffy and moist on the inside, and crispy, greasy golden on the outside. They also make their pies fresh throughout the night, big plus. You can't just have once slice.
author: Al L.

description: This place is a must if you are visiting North Beach. They are generally open late and serve pizza out of a window. Who doesn't love that? Their veggie pizzas are great and they have beer which is a plus too. Tiny shoe box of a place to dine in, but then again.....how cool is it to order from the window and be on your way?
author: Lauren J.

description: After a night in the city this starts to taste pretty good. Although, I'm less inclined to enjoy pizza cut into cafeteria style squares if it isn't at least an inch thick. Sorry. Also, its a little pricey for what you get, I feel.
author: Andrew W.

description: I'm not sure if this is my favorite slice in the City (not that there's alot of competition for that honor... unfortunately the dearth of quality pizza is one of the few deficiencies in SF's food scene), but I will say that I never hesitate to stop in here if I happen to be going out in North Beach.  The square slices (particularly the combo, which is delicious) are just as easily enjoyed to go or by grabbing a stool at the bar.  The lines can be long after 1am as the bars start to empty out, but it's worth the extra wait.  By the way, if you order your pizza to go and they ask if you want it "wrapped up", I'd advise against it.  The cheese ends up sticking to the paper .
author: Andrew E.

description:
i purposely park on Kearby and Greene just so on the way back i can say "hey guys lets get some pizza real quick" 

why? because the pizza is delicious, u can grab a corona inside as you wait for heaven to come out of the oven. and after that you can treck the 10% incline of a hill to the car unknowingly sculpting your buttocks and stuffing your face with cheesy goodness bought @ $3.00 a slice.

what a deal almost compares to nordstroms anniversary sale.
author: Paola L.

description: This is an absolute MUST if you come to SF!  They have the BEST clam pizza!  I love going here for a late night snack after a post bar/club hopping rendezvous!!  Now that I'm thinking about it...I wouldn't mind having some RIGHT NOW!
author: Jin B.

description: Wow is the pizza here good or what? I really love the walk up window and grab a slice and be gone in less than 2 minutes. Can you get better service? I've been coming here for ages and my parents used to buy sheets of this pizza for my birthday parties when I was a kid. As long as they don't change, I'll keep coming back whenever I'm close by.
author: D J.

description: We went on a late Saturday night, We were very hungry and MAN OH MAN what a wonderful delight!!!!!!!!!!!!  great combo.... we will be going back!!
author: april b.

description: Everything tastes good, but I just walk in and ask for the freshest thing they got. Usually is awesome!!
author: Tony F.

description:
hot pizza -- try the clam pizza if that's you're thing
+ beer on tap
+ lines out the door that move like *snap* that
+ open late
+ cheesy greasiness to stave off that impending hangover
= my favorite post-bar rendezvous

four stars only because i've never patronized it when i'm sober, so i need to notch down my buzzed exuberance one star
author: Selina W.

description: Apples-to-apples disclaimer: this is the best pizza you will ever order through a window and wait to be re-heated.  No hand-crushed, locally grown organic spelt grain crust with special Napa goat cheese toppings here.  This is more like those big puffy squares of pizza they gave you in elementary school except the dough is delicious and crispy and not nearly as puffy, the sauce is pleasantly spicy and the toppings are "all growed up."  I try not to leave any visit to SF w/o picking up at least one slice to take home.  Usually the clam and usually accompanied by at least a second slice of pesto.  Plus I think I met Amos Lee here but I can't be sure.  That is neither here nor there, I suppose.
author: J. W.

description: Golden Boy is one damn good pizza.  The absolute best time to go is when they open and the pizza has just come out of the oven.  Sooooo yummy.
author: Kandi K.

description: Love this place! It's good after a night on the town in NB, and it's good when you are just hungry for pizza. Recently tried the vegetarian pesto and it knocked my socks off! The only issue with this place is that is it pretty small and always crowded, which can make things a little awkward. But not awkward enough to not grab a slice of the Golden Boy goodness.
author: Jen B.

description: friend from Atlanta was shocked that i had not been to golden boy pizza (which he apparently tries to stop at whenever he makes it to SF) several months ago.  did not seek it out.  drunk one day, wandering back from bar, found the deliciousness that is golden boy.  damn, that was a decent slice. didn't actively try and return.  friend moved into neighborhood.  stopped by for quick bite. doh.  now i am hooked.  great pizza, ok beer selection, friendly staff. doesn't dethrone  Pino's Pizza in boston, which holds a special place in my heart, but a very good (square) slice.
author: Daniel W.

description: Good late night pizza place after hanging out in North Beach.  The pizzas are thick Sicilian slices.  Pepperoni, meat, vegetables.  These slices really hit the spot when you are hungry.  I like the crispy crust and the raw doughy flavor.  I know that doesn't sound good, but it really is.  Try it and see.
author: apple r.

description:
I had such high hopes for this place.  There is always a line.  But I'm guessing the line is for the bathroom, because the pizza ain't all that.

What a disappointment.

I agree with Brian W. serve me up some tube socks.
author: Ashley Q.

description:
i was wandering arounf north beach looking for an atm machine during last night's yelp gathering at the magnet.  i'd had a few drinks, when some one asked me for change.  i looke dup, and there was the golden boy.  i knew the place would be tasty with bums hanging out outside of it, and it was.

golden boy has pretty decent sicilian (square) pizza by the slice.  the sauce is tasty, the crust is good, and its cheap.  plus, they were playing ridiculous death metal.  

truly a hole in the wall experience i hope to enjoy again
author: Steve S.

description: Small joint with superb pizzas!!!  Their clam and garlic, cheese, and pepperoni pizzas are great.  I haven't tried the rest of the others yet, but I am sure they are absolutely great.  My girlfriend and I sat at the pizza shop to have a few slices and a drink...Tony, who served us our pizza, was warm and funny.  Almost felt like we've been going there for years.  Thanks for the peer cider and the snake bite, Tony!
author: Angie K.

description: Best atmosphere!  This cute little place has great pizza and nice staff.  Their menu is clean and simple-no need to worry about odds and ends.
author: Kat D.

description: The pizza was delicious.  The staff was nice enough but nothing out of the ordinary.  Everyone sits at the bar or a counter.  There's a TV for people to watch.  Also, the price seemed fairly decent.  Overall, a really good place.  Nothing I'd travel to North Beach for but if you're in the area, definitely check it out.  Oh and can't forget, cash only.
author: Patrick T.

description: This has been my favorite, favorite, favorite pepperoni pizza since I was in high school.  This square sliced pizza, comes with a mystery sauce, with italian seasoning melted in cheese & pepperoni.  Two slices and now that I am legal, a Hefenweizen....I'm in sports heaven.  Yes the flat screen games, but very littel wiggle room and also a must for midnight munch if you should be in North Beach at that yay hour.
author: Tania S.

description: I must admit they make a solid sicilian slice.  Probably the best in the city.. but remember that doesn't say much.  What can I say, I'm a pizza snob.  Anyway, definitely make your way over for a really good slice and even better service.
author: Tom C.

description: Pizza and F#ckin' Hard Speed Rock.  I love this place!
author: Jim S.

description:
i went on saturday (st. patrick's day).  i'm not gonna fault them for the long line and crazy wait.  despite being super busy and dealing with drunks all day (i'm sure), the staff was still pretty peppy.

but the fact of the matter is, i had a good buzz going...

...and yet, i've had tube socks that tasted better.
author: brian w.

description: So we've always passed this place and most of the time, there's a line out the door. So after watching the giants game, we decided to go get some pizza. What better place to go to than go to Golden Boy Pizza. We got there around 12:30... I've never tried their pizzas but let me tell you...One of the best slices of pizzas I've ever had. Too bad there isn't another Golden Boy pizza location somewhere in the peninsula.
author: robert c.

description: For the life of me I can't understand a negative review for this place. Good prices? Check. Good service?Check. Kick ass pizza? Of course!!! Try the Clam and Garlic Pizza or anyone of them for that matter. Think of the place as a pizza bar. Take a seat, order your favorite slice and a pint and have a good time. Thats what Golden Boy is all about.
author: Sean S.

description: Who would have thought that a square pizza pair with a orange soda could be so good..... Its not fancy just plain with bar stools that line up the narrow hallway. It's a gem and worth going in... I never experimented with the calm garlic pizza. But their veggie pizza or plain cheese is awesome. And yes, its open late very convenient for the after the club munchies. Warning you might have to wait in long line on the weekends.
author: Teresa H.

description: Good place to grab a beer and a slice before or after you go out.  During festivals its good to pre-party here.  Pizza is cheap.  Not 5 stars because they do not take credit cards.
author: Joel M.

description: After living in NYC, I became a pizza snob. There's hardly a pizza anywhere that compares to anything I've had there--except Golden Boy. It's Sicilain style, so I know it's a different breed than the super thin, gotta-fold-it-over-so-you-can-eat-it-while-you-walk pizza in New York. But it's good. Damn good. And they play good music too.
author: Melissa A.

description: First we tried one pepperoni and one cheese slice and was impressed, then after the tip from Yelp, we tried a clam garlic slice...tadow!  I only regret not having ordered this first...amazing!  I ordered the 2nd to last slice then two women came up and noticed only one was left...she made it very clear to me non-verbally that I had just ordered HER pizza.  Haha!  It tasted even better knowing that this was THE SPOT and we had THE SLICE.   Nice!  Lastly, my wife and I did think this joint is best for older kids, though our 1 and 3 year olds had a bit of a difficult time.
author: Chris L.

description:
Flat out... Ridiculously TASTY!!!  The combo of veggies on that "Zaaaa" were so fresh that with every bite, you wanted just one more.  I also had the sausage zaaa - which were excellently seasoned - and that too was out of this world... with a pislner back made it that much more satisfying.  As you everyone can see on this post on Yelp - Golden Boy is thee Golden Champion that rises above all the rest for Pi-zzaaaaa!

Dooo It! Dooo It!
author: KEN S.

description:
You're out late in North Beach, and you really want some sidewalk grub.  Golden boy is your money spot.  

Sicilian square slices of all of your staples (cheese, pep, supreme..), and more.  It's sort of like eating a focaccia pizza. Spend your time in line ogling sheets through the glass.
author: Jon F.

description: Best drunk slice in North Beach.
author: Stephen W.

description: Best pizza i have ever had, i come here way to much now but its worth the travel across the city. i hear the clam garlic is great but i haven't had it yet but i can tell you the sausage, peperoni, and cheese are great every time. OH! and if you get a corner piece you are very lucky cause thats the best piece out of the sheet .
author: T L.

description: This place is really delicious.  It's cheesy, but not overwhelmingly so.  The crust is crunchy but soft.  The toppings are great too.  I think my only complaint is that the veggie has pesto sauce as opposed to normal red sauce.  I love veggie pizza but don't love pesto so much.  I forgot about the pesto sauce and ordered a slice of veggie and was pretty disappointed.  My boyfriend was kind enough to trade slices with me, yay!  Definitely a great spot to grab a slice!
author: Lauren H.

description: Golden Boy is some mmm...mmm...pizza. Our tour guide in San Fran recommended the pizza joint where there's a giant finger pointing towards it. Uhh...yea we had no idea how to look that up on Google maps, but we found it regardless. Crunchy crust, well seasoned sauce, stretchy warm cheese, and yummy veggies on top, what more could you ask for?
author: K C.

description: I am not sorry I love this place to death and consider myself lucky that I work within walking distance. The crust whether crispy re-heated or fresh from the oven doughy is such a joy of cheesy goodness. This is such a fun place to be in as it's set up like a bar that serves pizza so you feel like you are up to no good when you go to lunch here from work. There is always a buzz and if it's cold outside it's warm in here. If it's warm outside get your slices to go and have them in the square. Become a local here if you can.
author: William R.

description: Ditto: best drunk slice in North Beach.
author: Patrick B.

description: I want to try the Sodini's place next door to this, but only this Pizza spin-off was listed in Yelp (at the time of this writing).
author: Todd R.

description: Once again im back with an exciting review! golden boy is it when it comes to deep dish pizza its cash only but they have an atm they have to best music inside and a great atmosphere if you want good pizza look no further than golden boy
author: C. M.

description: Okay, maybe it's just that it's always 2:00 in the morning when I'm eating here, and I tend to be starving, and I've usually had a few cocktails, but I still think this is the best pizza in the city.  Well, maybe it's a tie with Tomasso's.  Tomasso's is pretty tough to beat.
author: Erica G.

description: My fantastic friend introduced me to one of her favorite pizza places and, it was love at first bite.  Did I just say that?  Yes I did.  But Golden Boy evokes that kind of cheesiness because it is just that good.  I don't need any toppings.  I just need the fantastic cheese.  I stood in the rain and ate this pizza and I wouldn't have changed a thing about that experience.  I would stand in the snow and eat it.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Goes together with a night at Gino & Carlo like...well...beer and pizza.
author: Megan W.

description: You're naughty Golden Boy finger sign, lit up in the fog, pointing me towards two things I absolutely need no more of:  Pizza and Beer.  But I love you anyway, in all your naughtiness.  Naysayers be damned, Golden Boy is a great place.  The pizza and the beer always hit the spot--and it is open late.  I don't live in the hood and I don't eat here very often, but when I do I'm always hoping to come back sooner than later.
author: Blake W.

description: Back in SF on vacation and walking around North Beach. Obviously had to get a slice and sit in the park with it. YUM. New York is currently experiencing a square pizza craze but this spot has been offering up the goodness for years.
author: Jessica M.

description: A perfect cross between the Town School for Boys cafeteria circa 1988 and an abercrombie catalog. Again, weird.
author: Nicholas E.

description:
Have you ever thought to yourself,  "Gawd, I'd love to have a piece of that!"?
That is what I  think when I see a tray of Goldies veggie pizza. The best.
author: Jeff B.

description: Golden Boy came to the rescue one night out in NB. We were meeting up at Rosewood and I was starving. After walking up Columbus asking everyone where to go for a slice, the Italian waiter at Steps of Rome said oakaayya gooaa uppa tua blacks anda taka righta anda keepa tua youra lefta. I thought he was screwing with us, especially with phony accent. But low and behold we found it and the slices were incredible.
author: Phil M.

description: Ah the church of Golden Boy Pizza. You are amazed and wowed and can't wait to tell everyone about it afterwards.
author: lindsay w.

description: THREE WORDS GAR  LIC  CLAMs. the best. hole in the wall joint. cashier with attitude and sasyness. is that a word? ....neither is hella.
author: Mark F.
