description: Totallah! My boyfriend eats here practically every week. The crust is perfect and crunchy.  the cheese and the sauce work together  to make my tongue and tummy happy. my mouth is watering as i type this.
author: Anita C.

description: I get really excited when I come to North Beach, because that means a trip to Golden Boy Pizza.  Sometimes I sit inside, other times I take a slice to go.  They've got a few options to order from, and I usually just order a slice of the supreme.  I got the veggie once, but didn't like it because it didn't have tomato sauce, but rather white sauce.  The bottom of the pizza is fried to a crisp, but the inside is super soft and fluffy.  The tomato sauce is very zesty.  This place definitely gets a drunken crowd at its window late at night, since it's so close to the Broadway clubs.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Having grown up in New York City, I have definitely had my fair share of good NY pizza so everywhere I go, I find myself comparing everything to good ol' NY.  Golden Boy is not on the same level as the best in NY, but its definitely one of the better slices I've had since I have lived in San Francisco.  The thick, tasty slices and the lively atmosphere make this place a great quick food stop on any North Beach excursion.
author: Michael R.

description: The best pizza in NB!   Always great to squeeze up at the counter (slightly drunk), listen to the hungry sots around you while you wait for your slice to warm in the pizza ovens, look dreamily at the old boxing gloves hanging behind the counter while dreaming of dancing circles around your latest enemy, and then shake parmesan and hot pepper flakes on your steamy cheesy rectangular chunk of pizza as its tossed down on the counter in front of you, as the warm aroma wafts up over your face.  YUM, i think i'm drooling now.
author: Today Y.

description:
the perfect portable meal: focaccia style pizza with a tangy-sweet layer of tomato sauce topped off with bed of juicy veggies + thick doughy crust burnt at the edges = lots of textures going on. 

very few pizzas, sadly, have all these key elements to make it a success.
author: jennifer y.

description: As I approached the location, the smell was amazing.  They only offer a few varieties (cheese, pepperoni, sausage, clam/garlic, vegetarian, and combination), which is a good thing because they do those few very well.  The texture and consistency were perfect, soft and chewy, but not soggy, with a bit of crsipness around the egdes (nothing near a teeth-breaking crunch).  It is a small place with limited seating, and I ended up eating my pizza out on the sidewalk out of a piece of wax paper and my hands smelled and felt like pizza until I got home.  I would have rather enjoyed the moment with my pizza while seated, with ample napkins and the chance to wash my hands afterward.  But other than inconvenience of the limited seating, it's worth stopping by if you're looking for a quick bite to eat and enjoy a wholesome pice of pizza.
author: Damon Z.

description: It may be better because i've never had it sober, but it's damn tasty. Thick but still crispy on the bottom. Yum. Loses 1/2 a star because they only have deep dish- but gets that same 1/2 back because it's...you guessed it...walkable...which is particularly convenient when  I'm eating this pizza since, as I said, I have not ever had it sober-- has anyone?!?!
author: Diane S.

description:
a lunch break several months ago:

coworkers: WOO!  PIZZA AND BEER!  we should get a pitcher!
me: COOL
c: WOO!  LET'S GET ANOTHER PITCHER
m: (slurred) hnnn..OKAY
together: (slurred) we should... we should get back... *thud*
enter lisa pizza, holding third pitcher
lisa: hooold on, kids, this one's on me. 
coworkers: AWESOME
me: *fuck*

the rest is a haze.  

cliff notes: delicious pizza, HUGE pitchers, AWESOME workers, countless forgotten lunch breaks (and difficult afternoons)
author: Mooni P.

description:
Yum.  Pizza can bring happiness.  I brought a friend here who was visiting from North Carolina and he said it was the best he'd ever had...now he's back and really wants to go.  I just thought it was funny that he remembered the place considering that we were both, um, a little jolly and had managed to walk through the Stockton tunnel without getting robbed or molested.  Oh my god.  I was walking through the Stockton tunnel yesterday, day-dreaming about something inarguably stupid, and slipped on someone's vomit.  We're not talking about a little oopsie slip, I mean my leg swung out from underneath me..I could have knocked myself out with a kick to my own head.  I saw the puke getting close and I thought for sure I was going to land in it.  Somehow I was spared and only ended up with a minor scrape on my hand from slapping the wall.  Yes, I screamed too, which of course echoed, drawing attention to the whole embarassing scene.  I stayed in the present after that.

How I am going to walk around North Beach with no one seeing me....That's another trick.
author: Susan C.

description: pizza.....4 stars! Service 1 star. i would have given this place 5 stars had it not been for the poor attitude of one of the young girls that took the orders. the pizza itself is great. i had actually come here once before and it was closed and so on my next trip to san fran i vowed to go back. i asked the young lady if they had pepperoni and sausage together on one pizza and she said that they were separate and the only one that came with both meats together was a combo pizza with mushrooms and other stuff. so my friend ordered the combo and i said i just wanted the pepperoni for myself. so they brought out a sausage and we were confused as to why they did that and the order taker comes over and says that i ordered the sausage AND the pepperoni, which i did not as i told her that. instead of just saying ok and preparing a pepperoni pizza, she proceeds to tell me that she can make me a pepperoni pizza but she has to charge me for the sausage one too. SORRY that's when this place failed epically. Whether she heard wrong or got things confused or whatever, she should have just said ok, no problem, it will be 5 or 10 minutes for the pepperoni and that would have been fine. But no, after i told her i WAS NOT going to pay for something i didn't order, she clearly was frustrated, had an attitude and snatched the sausage pizza from the counter and throws it away in a trashcan in front of me with an attitude and says something like "fine" and says she will make the pepperoni one. i told her she could save the attitude as it was uncalled for. i will never come back to this place. the pizza is great but i did not appreciate that. i just wanted what i ordered. if she got the order wrong, no problem. fix it and move on but dont argue with customers. never coming back.
author: Food C.

description: Definitely solid pizza. I think the sauce gives it a little something different. If you want a sit down place this is not the restaurant for you. The space is pretty small and tends to be packed but that's because the pizza is so good! The employees are pretty friendly and efficient. If you are ever in north beach this place is certainly worth a visit! Oh ps did I mention that for a slice of cheese it is only $2.75. Cheaper than every other pizza place in north beach. Yay!
author: Juliana S.

description: Guess you have to love the thick focaccia-style crust to really appreciate this pizza.  Not my thing.  And at $3.50/slice, you are paying for lots of blah dough and very little on top.
author: Don N.

description: we had just come from a small dinner, but i was pretty full. because of this, i didn't even have my own slice. just a couple bites. but what i tasted was the best sicilian i've ever had. the pizza was thick, cheesy, packed with toppings, and at a perfect temperature. the sauce was amazing. the prices were awesome($2.75-$3.75 per slice). there was plenty of counter seating. and the young lady working was very sweet despite how many people were there. they have beer on tap and they are conveniently located in the heart of north beach. i will surely be back to have many slices.
author: Andrew T.

description: 3.5 reminds me of pizza rustica in miami.  slices go out pretty quickly.  sausage slice -- need to cut into 4s to get 1 sausage on each piece.  stopped by to check out the canada/usa hockey game...
author: Rob C.

description: Sicilian Pizza! I love it! I accidently came across this place and saw square shaped pizzas.  They were WONDERFUL.  WIth just the right amount of topping on each slice I must say was a nice way to start my day in Little Italy. I had the meat combo and the pesto, both were delicious! I cannot wait to come back and try the others.
author: Kenny K.

description: One of my favorite pizza places in San Francisco. Hands down. Pizza is terrific, and root beer on tap is making me want to drive out there this very moment, despite after just eating lunch! The record store across the street is always a nice place to check out on a full stomach!
author: Allan A.

description: Some of the best Sicilian style pizza I have ever had. It's fast, delicious and reminds me of New York.
author: Zhenya S.

description: Homemade and authentic. This is like my Grandmother's foccacia  pizza that my Mother , Aunts, and all my Italian Friend's Moms would make from scratch. NYC and Chicago have their own style pies, this is definitely San Franciscan style pizza.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Pretty good place to grab a square thick pizza piyaaa. 

Very small inside but a cool italian atmosphere. Short wait in line usually and the slices are only 3$

open late and they have a good selection of Beer. 
Beer and Pizza, top it off by walking a block to the strip club, what else do you need?

What I like most about this place is walking by and smelling the fresh pizza coming out of the oven. The smell just pulls you in... its amazing and when I watch Ninja Turtles, I imagine the pizza in the movie smelling like that.
author: John c.

description: Best Pizza. If you're in the area or just want the best slice in SF, go here. There are other spots with good pizza but not the best. I say weight your distance and hunger to getting to North Beach.
author: edgar s.

description: I'm not usually a fan of the thick slice, but Golden Boy is tasty! We tried the cheese and clam and garlic. Both were good, the clam and garlic really caters to garlic lovers. Convenient by the slice, eat in or take out. Very accomodating, heating cold slices, boxing them up nicely. Great for an afternoon snack or late night craving.
author: foxy b.

description: The best part about this place is the punk music and the draft beers + root beer. If you like Sicilian style crust, you may like their pizza. I am more of a Neopolitan person so this was not my favorite.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
neither here nor there....

definitely not thin crust, or ny style pizza, but square 'deep dish' pizza, well not really deep dish either....

little star is way better for deep dish. even BJ's is deep dish. this is NOT deep dish pizza.....

i came here thinking it was super delish b/c of its 200+ reviews and their strong 4 star average. 

mehhh.... i should have looked at the reviews harder before i went, looks like their reviews are mostly from people who love eating their pizza when they are NOT sober, or suffering from a hangover.

well, no wonder it wasn't that great when i went....

service was attentive, the place is plastered with stuff everywhere. it has character. 

pizza here is WAAAAAAY better than some of the places on broadway thats for sure.

CASH ONLY!!!!
author: Irene C.

description: I've heard it said that this is the best pizza in the city... The pizza is pretty damn good, but I guess I'm just a snob, cause I'll stick with the cheeseboard in berkeley any day.
author: jenna p.

description: Everyone already knows this is incredible pizza. But I am still dealing with the pizza burn. Eat with caution.
author: Stacy H.

description: Sicilian pizza done right. Grab a beer, a bar stool and enjoy! Cheese is the best.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Perfect Sicilian-style pizza (focaccia crust), by the slice, and open LATE. Beer too.
author: Don H.

description: Love the Golden Boy! I mean seriously... where else can you go and just jump on a bar stool, order a slice and a stella? I love this place.
author: Anna S.

description: I have a tendency to need pizza at 2AM, and Golden Boy is always my choice. I am awe of the girl who works there- its always the same person, she never gets snippy with the scores of drunk people who scream for pizza. I always make a drunken promise to bring her flowers.  I always feel less hungover when I have a slice so maybe it has restorative powers.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Love this place and always will. It's quick, tasty and you feel oh-so-hip for coming here.  The place can be a bit messy and dirty from patrons before you but who cares? Have a pitcher of beer, eat some pizza and head out again satisfied.
author: Allison J.

description: Best pizza ever - minus one star for the ugly stupid corrugated metal remodel.
author: Chris E.

description: Definitely best in class. There were times when the domestic thing didn't get organized, and Golden Boy kept the marriage intact by being there with the perfect slice of pizza and the nicely chilled glass of  small brew ale to make everything alright.
author: Bibi R. R.

description: Serving up hot retro trailer park chic by-the-slice.
author: Bob G.

description: Average rectangle shaped pizza.  If it wasn't for the pepper that I put on it, then the "pepperoni" pizza would've been pretty bland.  But I gave them three stars because the service was great, and they had a pic of Christopher Walken on the wall...sweet....
author: Mark D.

description: You don't have to be drunk to enjoy their pizza....you can get drunk while you're there!  They have Sicilian style and its good...nothing like Zachary's but its warm and good, especially when you get in from walking in the cold breeze outside.  Lots of good beers on tap and a huge TV to watch the Warriors lose in OT :(  Bring a neck brace as the TV is mounted high on the left side of the bar.  Great for take out too...the girl working there was really efficient at wrapping the slices for takeout.
author: Summit S.

description: Big slices, cheap, and worth waiting in line for when it's late and you're hungry and have had a bit too much to drink in North Beach.  They have plenty of different toppings to chose from, but only have a certain selection at any given time.  If you come inside and sit, they also have cheap beer.  FYI - cash only!
author: Lindsay B.

description: For reheated pizza at $3.50/slice, it's certainly not a bad deal, and the server was really nice.  When I was in there, a couple of girls walk in and look at the beers on tap, and one says to the other, I don't know any of these!  Yeah, sorry honey, they've got Trumer Pils, not Miller Lite (well, they do have those in the bottle, I think).
author: Gina K.

description: By far the BEST Sicilian style pizzas in the city. Great spot to build a base before going out to drink. And a great spot to go after you've had enough and need something in your stomach.
author: John Eric S.

description: Not a big fan of Pizza but I really like Golden Boy's crust-super tasty.  I really like this place cuz it's cheap and hit's the spot and also good to grab a beer and hang for a while.
author: Francis M.

description: I'd say it's the best sicilian in SF. Barely ever a wait, cheap, beer/rootbeer on tap. good shit I say.
author: Dave R.

description: I adore their garlic and clam pizza, and their vegetarian slice is tasty, too.  But $3 for a slice isn't that cheap, and they're on the small side so I don't feel quite sated after eating just one like I do at some other by-the-slice places.  I'd give them 3.5 stars if I could do that--the pizzas are 4 stars but the price and service are only 3 stars.  Last time I went there and ordered the garlic and clam, they told me one of those just went in the oven so I should order something else while I wait.  I ordered a veggie slice and waited around for the clam pizza to be done, and after a while I asked about it and the SAME PERSON who told me one just went in the oven now informed me that they're not making clam pizza for the rest of the night.  I was sitting right in front of her the whole time, so I guess someone told her that by ESP while I waited.  Boo!  Hiss!
author: maiko h.

description: Tasty, crispy-licous crust! Great to munch on after bar hopping in NB.
author: Charm N.

description: Great Pizza (well, probably just good, but who would know because everyone there is wasted.)
author: Andy D.

description: We passed by this place slightly after midnite and there was a massive line of people waiting to be fed. We weren't drunk and we were not hungry but figured we had to succumb to try a slice. Two girls were hesitant to stand in line but someone in line mentioned that it's the "Golden" Boy pizza and if you want to be Golden Girls, they should definitely have a slice each so the girls were sold of a slice each. Bf and I shared the pepperoni and sausage slice but we both felt it was just ok and the crust wasn't very crispy nor tasty. Sigh....I guess were just too sober to really enjoy a good slice of greasy delight.
author: Yan M.

description: Famous for its square pizza in the heart of North Beach.  Pizza was okay.
author: ITesh J.

description: Ever come here and there's along line... and there's just a few slices left... and you're panicking the meat heads / yuppie scum in front of you will snap up YOUR slices before you get your chance?!   I fuckin' hate that.
author: Larry A.

description: Great little place to grab a slice of pizza (or 3) alone, or after having drinks in North Beach (although they close before 2). I love, love, LOVE this pizza.  Anytime someone comes to S.F. to visit me I bring them here and they end up loving it as much as I do.  I'm all about the sauce, and this place does it right.  The cheese and the combo are my favorites! Also, I don't know what people mean about the rude service, I have NEVER once had rude service! Everyone who works there seems really nice and attentive.  But maybe it's because they've seen me in there one too many times!
author: Jennifer H.

description: This pizza is great because it is unique.  The crust is really really thick, and not to tough.  The sauce is a bit one dimentional, however the crust makes up for it! Plus is quick as hell and cheap!
author: Rachel P.

description: I'd say Golden Boy Pizza is very unique.  Most places do not make their pizza in a Foccacia Style Crust so I will say they are a very "different" kind of pizza experience.  They do a very good job with it too.  I can't say it is my favorite and would drive down here just to get one but for sure if I am in the neighborhood. sure I'll grab a slice!
author: Mark W.

description: Came here for Sunday lunch today and had myself a slice of the pesto vegetarian. Mmmm mmmm.... sweet watery mouth goodness. The pizza (at least the one I ate) wasn't overly greasy, so I didn't finish lunch feeling like I needed to wash my face. Pretty big slice for $3.50. Service was good and speedy. Good place to swing by for a fast lunch if you're in the North Beach area.
author: Teresa Y.

description: I don't normally like pizza but oh my god this pizza is SO GOOD. It's not like regular pizza or deep dish pizza, it's served on this focaccia like bread and it's AMAZING. The sauce is delectable and it oozes over the soft bread with crispy crust and the cheese is delicious and the pepperoni is delicious and it's just very DELICIOUS. Go now.
author: Cathy T.

description:
Delicious silician-style square pan style, perfectly crispy on the outside.  

Super-satisfying, good location (unless you need parking), fun to sit at the bar when it's not too crowded and have a beer with your slice(s).
author: Ritch G.

description: I think I need to come back again in order to make it 5 stars as I was super drunk the first time I was here.  As far as I can remember, the pizza was YUMMY!  We lucked out and ordered the slices that were fresh from the oven.  We waited hald an hour for a crispy, foccacia crust with lots of toppings at 3AM in the morning...and it was all worth it.
author: Abby E.

description: Delicious thick-crust pizza. Great place to pick up pizza after goin out in north beach.
author: Steve C.

description: Amazing pizza when you're in a rush.  Staff is great!  Besides a weekend night place, it's a great place after work too.
author: N O.

description: golden boy's is the perfect food after a night out in north beach.   so yummy especially when you get one fresh out of the oven.  my go to's are the  combination or the vegetarian.
author: Helen T.

description: Cross your fingers and hope your favorite deep dish slice is still there when you order as lines are quite common at this local establishment.  But what can I say, one of the best slices you can get for $3.50.  Especially after a night out at one of the local clubs or bars in the area.  Hey that slice is very satisfying after a night of drinking and guess what, its cheaper than your beer.  I've been a fan of this place for more than 25 years and no matter what slice you order, your tummy would be happy :)
author: Koa K.

description: Ahh Golden Boy. I don't have much new to say. It's also probaby my favorite pizza joint in the city. Deep dish, sooo cheesy and warm. If only they delivered....
author: Allison B.

description: Golden Boy is a true pizza joint - a place where you can sip a beer, munch a slice and appreciate some punk rock. Not to mention, the staff is incredibly friendly - mind-boggling considering how busy they get. If you're lucky, they may even put on the wrestling mask...
author: Eric ..

description: This is the only pizza joint I will touch in North Beach and I live here!   Good place to go after 12am to get a piece of pizza and  nurse that impending headache when you wake up the next morning.   I love their veggie pizza.
author: Chris C.

description: Great slices of pizza. I love them all! Combo, clam garlic, pesto veggie, cheese, pepperoni. It's all good. They can run out a little alter in the day and sometimes the music is a little loud but I don't eat in so it's cool.
author: cyndi L.

description: Better people watching than pizza but an old stand-by any time of day.
author: Mara H.

description: My bf and I decided to have a night out in the city. We took a long stroll from Union Square to South Beach. We found this pizza parlor basically a hole in the wall. We considered ourselves lucky to manage grab 2 stools. I also managed to snatch the last slice of garlic clam of the night. I wish the cashier/waiter/server had enough time to reheat my pizza properly. It was still a big cold in the middle. My bf, on the other hand, had 2 slices of fresh pipin' hot Pepperoni pizzas. The non-alcoholic fountain drinks have unlimited refills. We weren't rushed to empty the stools for the long waiting line outside. Overall it was a very yummy experience.
author: Angela Y.

description:
nothing like a piping hot slice of golden boy pizza after the north beach bars. there are always interesting and friendly characters around too...yesterday, it was two old men sporting ascots. nice. 

it's not the tastiest pizza-by-the-slice ever (i leave that to cheeseboard and arizmendi's)...but is cheeseboard's fancy ass open at 2 AM? no.
author: sarah i.

description:
w/o a doubt GB is the best pizza in the city! for you east coasters who appreciate the thin crust....... even you will love it italian style on focaccia!
i am a sf native and have been making trips across the city my entire life to eat their grubbin' pizza. the decor or lack thereof is funky but, one doesnt necessarily go there to be wooed by the ambiance! you go for good down home pizza. get it to go and enojoy =)
author: nicole d.

description:
great pizza, get a slice right out of the oven..

will go back soon!
author: Jippers C.

description: Golden Boy, you are the Chosen One for the drunk munchies. HOLLA!
author: Jen Y.

description: Who doesn't like pizza??!? well, me actually. I must admit, i'm not a huge fan, at all. But, after one drunken night at northstar i stumbled upon Golden Boy and my friends wanted pizza. So I ate...and ate, and before I knew it i pretty much gobbled up the best pizza slice i'd ever had..ever.
author: Natalie J.

description: Mmmmm...this is thick slice pizza I can handle. The ingredients are wonderful and the sauce is super flavorful, and sure it's greasy but it's oh so good. If you got a bad slice it must have been a fluke! My stomach is wanting it so much! Take it to go and hang out in the park if it's nice and sunny!
author: Gina R.

description: Thick, deep-dish perfection! Love the sauce and the toppings. Go there and take a slice back to Columbus Cafe, 2 for 1 beers (4-8 daily). We do this at least twice a month!
author: Mel C.

description: The Clam and Garlic Pizza is the Bomb!  Nuff Said!
author: Ed B.

description: Not bad for a fix when in a jam. By the slice and to-go paper. Makes multitasking easy.
author: Not U.

description: i was actually waiting for a table next door at vicoletto's when i smelled something incredible. i looked over and saw trays of pizza facing the window, filled with cheese and toppings galore! after dinner at vicoletto's, we came over to buy some pizza to go and it was AMAZING! the crust is perfect and the toppings are so creative and delicious!
author: Charissa L.

description:
For those who crave cheesy, cheesy, cheesy pizza...this is the spot.
I grew up in the North Beach, so TRUST me when i say this IS THE SPOT! I always stop and get a slice when Im out on Grant and Green on those crazy Friday nights, or on Broadway gettin some tipper love on Saturdays, its always good.

FYI Dont bite on the pizza too quick you'll burn the roof of your mouth...do it and you'll see what Im talking about..HAHAHA
author: Sleep E.

description: Best in the city.  Very tasty thick crust, unique combinations and a true original.  Love it when I'm craving a good slice of 'za and cold draft beer.
author: Brent R.

description: Oooh dependable Golden Boy. I so wanted to eat that third slice, but couldn't find the space. Maybe I should have declined on that second pint of Lagunitas IPA, but beer and pizza just taste so good together. It's nice to know this place is around, and the staff and people always make you feel welcome. Please don't ever leave.
author: Tim S.

description: The service might not be great, but you cannot find a better slice of pizza at 2:00am leaving the bars.  I have walked miles for Golden Boy pizza (figuratively) to complete my night.
author: Bobby J.

description:
oh, i love Golden Boy with all of my face.
~~
though i must say: good luck finding parking, dodging tourists and homeless ghosts. 
~~
the BEST Sicilian-style slice of pizza awaits you. 
~~~
notice West Coast bikers make this place a recurrent pitstop. That just about sums it up.
author: Tomas V.

description: Golden Boy is THE perfect spot for refueling during your drunken stagger home from the bars and nightclubs in the area.  Nothing beats a greasy Sicilian slice when you're too hammered to make it home without sustenance.  Don't bother to park. Don't try to find it.  But when you stumble into it (literally?), definitely get a slice.
author: Jess S.

description: Certainly the best pizza of this style that I've had. The slices are cheap and tasty, the music is loud and the beer is cold. What more can you ask for in a "by-the-slice" joint of this type. I usually avoid places like this because they are dirty or the pizza generally sucks but this place nails it. The veggie and the combo are great choices; the sauce makes this pizza what it is. From time to time I've been known to say that this is the best pizza I've ever had and depending on my mood that's certainly true.
author: Nicholas B.

description: After making that bank shot at Gino and Carlo's, step next door and get a slice of Pizza. Along with Cafe Trieste, this is one of my favorite stops in North Beach. Stop by for a quick slice of some of the best pizza in the city when you're out cruising on the sportster. If I run the table in a game of 9 ball, I'll even buy you a slice!
author: Arlene C.

description: Awesome sicilian style pizza, which is good for the price.  The clam one is by far the best one available...Dive bar atmosphere with a pretty decent draught selection for a pizza place...Crowd varies but can be interesting and fun....A north beach staple for a reason...some of the best square slices on the west coast...but still not on the nyc level....regardless, it's a classic....
author: Francis K.

description: Great crust even if it's just on the bottom.  Crispy on the bottom while the top is soft and cheesy.  Had the Pesto Vegetarian...loved it!  Pesto, olives, onions, tomato...great deal, good pizza.  I had it with Limonata San Pelligrino...so Italian!
author: Sonic D.

description: Solid slice of sicilian style pie. Cheap and fast with a pretty good beer selection. Being from boston i am still on the hunt for some real deal east coast pizza. Unfortunately to no avail yet, but golden boy will do till then.
author: mike m.

description: Alright - it's a short review. I've found a surprising amount of SF locals that STILL have never been to Golden Boy. It's a North Beach staple. Ya gotta go. Oddly enough, my favorite is the clam and garlic pizza (yeah - you wanna make out after that?). You can get a BIG slice of quality pizza for less than $5 ($3.75 I believe). Great to take and walk. Or sit at the bar and have a slice with a pint of beer. Makes for a great night. There's normally a line if you show up after 10:00 - but it's worth the wait.
author: Eli S.

description: Extra large cookie sheets filled with square pizza sit right in their window, and an enticing aroma wafting out the door makes it difficult to pass by. Take it to go or grab a pint at the bar in this rustic little joint. The combo or the pesto rock my world.
author: Sonya Y.

description:
a review of golden boy is 2 parts, sober and drunk
sober: the is thick bread with sauce and cheese and toppings. edible, but nothing golden about it
drunk: assuming i can deal with standing on line with everyone else, who doesn't love fresh hot pizza out of the oven!
and did i just waste an hour waiting for this... ugh
author: Rich B.

description: Best pizza ever. I'm drooling right now remembering how delicious it is. I have only gotten my pizza to go, so I don't know how dine-in service is. From my quick glances it seems that seating is a little cramped.
author: A C.

description:
While I love this city mainly because you can get pizza by the slice no matter what neighborhood you are in!, Golden Boy Pizza is a place I usually walk right past. Surprisingly, the line is usually out the door, and since it sells so fast, the pizza always looks fresh (that's rare!) but the pizza is always lacking. Maybe because it's in that annoying square shape, they only accept cash, are pretty rude (the people that work there swear they are so cool) and never put enough toppings on the pizza to accomodate the massive amounts of dough they use in making them. 

not a fan.
author: Sarah I.

description: This place rocks, fast, fresh, cheap and some of the best pizza I have ever had!
author: James B.

description:
If you like Sicilian style pizza, then you should definitely check this place out. I've had most of the slices there and have yet to be disappointed. The atmosphere is pretty authentic as well. 

It's worth the trip to North Beach for a slice (or two) and a beer. FYI, it is cash only.
author: Andrea S.

description: Really People?  I know food tastes better when you're wasted-high-etc, but how drunk WERE you when you tasted this pizza?  Really thick, doughy crust, mediocre toppings.  Meh.
author: Michelle A.

description: I've figured out why I haven't tried all the different restaurants that North Beach has to offer ... all I want to do when I'm in the area is go to Golden Boy for a couple slices.  You can't go wrong with whatever coming directly out of the oven, sit at the counter and enjoy a slice and a beer.
author: Jon P.

description: LOVE the Golden Boy. Fantastic Sicillian pizza and a nice selection of draft beers in a cool, clean little place tucked away in North Beach.
author: David C.

description: Not to many Sicilian pizza joints in SF, but this ones pretty damn good. Plus they've got all the extra stuff - grated cheese, red pepper, oregano - in shakers which makes a slice all the more better. A good selection of draft beer too. It's off the beaten path in North Beach, so it's not filled with a bunch of tourists - You've kind of gotta' now about it.
author: Tom P.

description: I LOVE this pizza after a long night of booze! Nothing will ever taste so good! And as I am walking away with ten pieces of pizza becuase they all looked so tempting in the window, I will feel content and nervous becuse I know I will also feel slightly ill in the morning.
author: michelle k.

description: Hands down I know this pizza is good because I burn my mouth every time I eat there just because of  the excitement that over takes my body and all the patience I used to have, fades away. I can't tell if it is because I always end up there after 2:00am or if the pizza is that good. But I have a strong suspicion that it would taste just as good at 2:00pm.You be the decider.
author: stash e.

description: A great place!  My boyfriend and I wanted to grab a quick bite before meeting some friends out at a bar.  We didn't really know where to go, but stumbled upon this place as it was right near Royale, where we were meeting friends.  This was the perfect spot to find.  They had lots of beers on tap (and for us East Coasters who can't get Fat Tire, we were happy to see it) and the pizza slices were perfect!  Just the right consistency, plenty of options, and served piping hot.  We sat at the bar, and the bartender/server was awesome.  We chatted with him a little while he served a steady stream of locals either eating at the bar or getting takeout.  The beer and food were cheap, and we almost didn't want to leave.  Even though I was full, I ordered a third slice because it was that good.  It was the perfect low-key place to eat.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Love the pepperoni pizza.  My favorite in the city - perfect crust/sauce/cheese ratio.  And you can carry a slice next door to Columbus Cafe!
author: Lena J.

description: While I wouldn't say it's the best pizza in the world, I would have to say that there are times when I would believe that it is.  Like this past Saturday night around 12:30am.  I was drunk and it was my salvation.
author: Jessica B.

description: I love foccacia bread, so if the pizza is made on foccacia?! I am in serious munchie mode!
author: Claire S.

description: If you ever find yourself stumbling home from the North Beach bars on a weekend night, stop by this place. Most of the stuff backing up this suggestion seems to have already been said, so I'll leave it at that. My favorite is usually the combo.
author: Donald R.

description: DEEEEELICIOUS! an awesome snack anytime of the day. ANd the service rocks
author: Rachel S.

description: Golden Boy has the best pizza I have ever eaten in my life. I have been living in San Francisco for years. I think Golden Boy Pizza has the best pizza in the city. A few months ago, I invited a friend to join me and have pizza at Golden Boy. My friend is Italian, and he was visiting San Francisco for the first time in his life. He had never eaten at Golden Boy Pizza. After my friend had finished eating his slice of pizza, he told me that it was excellent. Sometimes, lines of up to 15-30 people form at the front door, especially during the evening on Fridays and Saturdays anywhere from around 6PM to after midnight. However, on those occasions when there is a line, it moves quickly. The service is fast. Obviously, all of those people think that the wait of a few minutes to eat Golden Boy pizza is worth the time. Golden Boy serves a whole lot of pizza. It is always fresh. The freshly baked pizza goes from the oven to the front display case. When a customer places an order at the front register, one of the staff places the pizza in the microwave to heat it up to maximum palatable temperature. The pizza always tastes fresh and delicious because any pizza in the front display came out of the oven only a few seconds or a few minutes before you placed your order. I eat pizza at no other place. When I want pizza, I'm off to the Golden Boy.
author: Jack T.

description: Everything you could ask for in a pizza place plus a nostalgic 90's vibe. Expect to enjoy a little Rage Against the Machine, Nirvana or Metallica with your slice. Plus a television in  a non-distracting area. nice. Excellent service -- trays of pizza are cooked as needed and slices are heated up when you order them --- THE WAY IT'S SUPPOSED TO BE DONE! A small bar dining area -- perfect -- any more space would be intolerable. Perfect cheese/sauce/crust/topping ratio.
author: Zasu T.

description: the corner slice of pepperoni is the only reason i continue living.
author: krispee o.

description: When you see the line outside of Golden Boy Pizza on a  Saturday night (or Sunday morning I suppose) at 3am you realize one of two things, it is either very good, or its popularity is driven by the first drunk who jumps in line. I would like to say that my one and only experience at Golden Boy was done in a sober state, so my review has some merit. Anyway, the pizza is pretty good, but not what I had been hoping for, I had heard soooo much about this place that I had some high expectations. First of all, Golden Boy is Sicilian style pizza, so if you're not into the doughy nature of that style, like me, this won't be an amazing slice for you. I recommend giving it a try, but definitely go during the week when you can skip the line. I'm sure the pizza tastes better in the early hours of a Saturday or Sunday morning, but if you really wan't to see what you think of the place, try and go sober (I know, it can be hard sometimes).
author: Nick C.

description: Well worth driving from the east bay just for a slice.  Hands down the best Pizza in the bay area.  Tastes the best at around 2AM after a few bears in.
author: Jane R.

description: Golden Boy comes through again.  Saturday night after a LOOOOOOOOONG night at O Malleys, the squares hit the spot.  My friends were in town and LOVED IT.
author: Bill C.

description: Great place to pick up a few slices and have a beer. Pesto vegetarian is wonderful.
author: Jared C.

description: Good pizza. I wouldn't go there after midnight though. You'll see nothing but drunk preppy guys looking to start a fight. I had to throw down 2x in 10 minutes.
author: Mike C.

description:
THIS IS THE BEST PIZZA

I would go with the Pesto.....especially after a long night of boozing.
author: Cris A.

description: YES!  Golden Boy Pizza was so good and worth the short wait for the fresh slices.  The girl behind the counter was really sweet and all the ingrediants were fresh and so delicious.  Where else can you get pizza this amazing for only $3!?  Not quite a five star, but better than a four... Try it!
author: Nate V.

description: For a quick cheap slice, there's nothing better.  The crust is delightfully crisp yet doughy.  If I'm in North Beach and need something quick (and sometimes even when I don't), I hit Golden Boy and am never disappointed.
author: David G.

description: Working down the street from this place hasn't done my belt line any good! If you're on the hunt for some of the best pizza around north beach stop by Golden Boy! Just thinking about their combination has me drooling! Y U M!
author: Rex Q.

description: I can't give this place 5 stars because it was midnight and we had a few beers in us and almost anything would have tasted ok, but this pizza tasted great. We actually decided to turn around on our walk back to the hotel and get more, but by the time we got back, there was a line of drunks, 20 deep out the door. :(. I WILL be back.
author: George D.

description: Just delicious. I love Golden Boy Pizza it is the best Sicilian-Style Pizza in the city!!!!! The vegetarian pesto pizza is amazing.
author: Rosa H.

description:
love this place! my family and i were in san fran and once we passed by the wonderful aroma of golden boy, there was no turning back.  we got a couple pitchers of beer and sat and enjoyed a wonderful slice of pesto vegetable pizza.  never had anything like it before.  

i will come back here very soon
author: lauren m.

description: Never changed and shouldn't. The combo veggie is just unreal even though I'm a major meat eater I still get the Veggie. It's that good.
author: Jack M.

description: Best pizza in SF - and that's saying something since I'm from the east coast.  Awesome that they're open so late w/ window service for the post-bar time.  Grab a combo slice, or 2, and you're all set.
author: jeff d.

description: Best pizza in San Francisco if you've been drinking. Get a corner slice. One cannot go out drinking in North beach and not go here.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: I do not see where the big hype about Golden Boy comes from. Sure... it's a tradition for post-drinking in North Beach, but during regular, sober business hours... when there are other choices available???  It's OK, but not that great.
author: Matt W.

description: Easily the best pizza in San Francisco. Some people would argue Amicis. Not I. As good sicilian thick crust pizza that you will ever find. Super bonus point: Open really late, and even though I live in SOMA, always worth the detour.
author: Patrick M.

description: The best Square slice Pizza in the city.  I have been eating here for at least the last 15 years.  I cant live without a slice at least once a week
author: sfc j.

description: I hadn't been here for a long time. It is still the same but I was sober and a few years older. Probably should have gone somewhere else. Oh, well.
author: Art S.

description: I love their combo slices... you just need to wait for a hot and fresh tray to come out of the oven.... then pick your slice... if you like it harder/crustier... ask for a corner piece and for even crustier they'll stick it in the front warming oven for as long as you like.... it can be made to order.... so the "doughy" comment means you've got to try again.  As a former New Yorker... I did not expect to like this pizza... but instead I hate North Beach Pizza and Pizza Orgasmic because they can't touch NY pizza... but golden boy is uniquely San Francisco.... and it's the first deep dish (probably cause it's not that deep) I've liked... and in my book it's the best pizza in the city... certainly the best in North Beach which I've found incredibly disappointing for the "Little Italy" of the city.
author: Rob R.

description: If you are in the mood for a slice of pizza and a beer, Golden Boy is the perfect establishment.  The pizza is awesome, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is fun.  Although a line can form on weekend nights, it moves quickly.  This place has the best Sicilian style pizza in the city and is by far the best place to get a slice in North Beach.
author: Jonas M.

description: This place is a great option if you want an inexpensive place for lunch.  It's small, so don't expect seating but if you're patient a place will probably open up shortly after you've ordered.  Get a slice and a beer and hang out for a half hour and you won't be disappointed!
author: Tabitha S.

description: I liked this place.  Simple bar like setting.  I had the combination pizza and liked it a lot!  It was better than the other place I went to a couple doors down.  Last weekend I was on the search for the best pizza in North Beach that was served in a bar/cafe like setting . Only made it to 3 places before I got full.
author: Deana B.

description: great sicilian, square pie in north beach. love the vibe in this off columbus locale. don't know of better pizza in north beach oddly.
author: casey c.

description: let me just say that like Chinese food, pizza in this city is mostly gross but this place has the best pizza I've ever had! the garlic clam and veggie combo slices are the best!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
You haven't had pizza until you had GB's clam and garlic! Order a glass of beer, and relax in the faux dive atmosphere.

If the game is a good slice of pizza without the fancy restaurant, this place is the clear winner. Only con is that the slices are thicker than average, so if you like thin crust, this is not your place.
author: Hakan K.

description: Best place to go at 2 AM for a slice of pizza!  I highly recommend the pesto pizza.
author: Jen N.

description: One of the best slices of pizza I have ever had in my life.  Or maybe I was a little intoxicated at 1:30 in the morning, but it was still yummy.  I will try it sober one day.  If you're catching a slice after the club or bar, you might want to get in line asap because you don't want to end up at the end of the block.  There was only one girl working behind the window so service was a bit slow.  However, she did offer me a corner slice. :o)
author: Miss Bag on Head A.

description: This place rules!  Thick crust pizza.  Great for grabbing a quick slice and a beer.  Perfect location - seeing as I live in North Beach.  I highly recommend Golden Boy to anyone looking for a great slice.  This is also the place where my friend and I came up with http://www.slicefinder.com - a place to find and review pizza.
author: Tom F.

description: damn good. super addictive. favorite thing to eat after dancing. get the combination + an arizona sweet tea, you'll walk away happy and ready to pass out in bed. prices are good, service is fast, food is clutch. just do it.
author: linda t.

description: Good pizza hard to find parking. (unless you want to pay $10 across the street at the garage) Don't order the pizza sheet (whole pie). Takes 45 minutes to make and feeds 1000 people. Get individual slices. They bake them again to get them all crispy and nice. The combo is the best. If your feeling a little daring try the clam pizza. You wouldn't even realize its clam till they told you. Good friendly neighborhood pizza joint. A few beers on tap and a nice plasma TV with the game on. So far the best pizza in the city.
author: Howard C.

description: NOT the best pizza in North Beach! I went to four different pizza places in one day, and this was the worst of the four by far. North Beach and Tony's are better options. The tomato sauce is flavorless, the dough can't decide what it wants to be, and the cheese is just o.k. Interior made me feel like I was in a surf town, also.
author: Ben G.

description: A couple of Saturdays ago I found myself walking around North Beach, just checking out the scene and sipping a few drinks (I am from Seattle so I was just exploring)...On my first pass up the street around 9:00pm I noticed a fairly long line coming from this place...didn't think much about it until I came wandering back down the street about an hour later, and noticed that the line had shrunk to only 4 people...so I walk up to one of the people in line and asked "Hey what's the story with this place?"  The guy I asked turns slowly around to me and says"You don't know?"..."this place is THE BEST PIZZA IN THE WORLD" ..So I say well then I better give it a try, and proceed to order a slice and a beer and sit at the bar...Then my favorite band (Pearl Jam) comes on the pleasantly loud stereo speakers and the beer is frosty cold...and then it happens...I take a bite of what I can hands down say is THE VERY BEST PIECE OF PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD..then a sip of my ice cold frosty beer...while the PJ song hits it's chorus...A little tear wells up in my eye...Perfect moment accomplished..thank you Golden Boy Pizza!!!!!
author: Savoy B.

description:
i can't get too worked up over this pizza.  the crust needs...something.  it's not substantial enough.  it's not crispy enough.  it's lacking...something.  

the clam pizza's pretty good tho.  

warning:  don't go here if you hate really friggen loud heavy metal with your so-so pizza.  

i imagine beavis and butthead would really dig this joint.
author: Nathan Z.

description: Normally, I would never even think of eating a square piece of pie, but I got off work late and had a mad craving for pizza. It was close to the house.  So I finally broke down and tried the square pizza.  To my surprise it was pretty good.  The crust was nice, soft, and full of flavor.   There were plenty of toppings that went to the edge of every last square piece of pizza.  If you go in there before all the bars let out, you can sit inside and drink beer with you square piece of pie.  if you don't make it in time, they serve pieces through the window. Over all, I will be back again.
author: Christine M.

description: Pretty delicious and even better the next day. A piece of this is easily split into 2 small meals. For $3.75! The pesto vegetarian is a favorite.
author: n b.

description: excellent pizza. the employees arent always the friendliest but i give them credit since the place is always pretty busy. a very cozy atmosphere, and good for a quick eat. a must try if you're in to pizza.
author: Andrew D.

description: Pizza here is interesting and tasty. My first time I had a Pesto slice and the second time the clam and garlic. Both were delicious and went well with the Lagunitas IPA. Since I am new to the city it is nice to find a place where you can fly solo and have a great time. Both times I arrived there was a fun group of people sitting on the bar stools. They also have a ipod plugged into an amp so that you can hear the unique taste of the server/bartender. The only downside was the kooky way that they would line up people waiting for a spot. This place is small and very good so it is understandable that you will have a line on a Friday night. Where it became annoying was that they did not manage the line well and some people were able to sneak in while others patiently waited longer then necessary. They also allowed a couple of especially pushy fellas take a seat and order a beer without waiting in line and then would not serve them pizza until their place in line came in. It was a little awkward.
author: Eric G.

description: It's ok......I don't love the pastry crust, but if you get a  fresh slice, it's still real good.
author: The P.

description: when i'm driving around SF and i see someone eating a pizza slice that is triangle i get sad. its never actually made me cry, but still sad. why you ask? well because the best pizza in the whole world is made at golden boy. and their pizza happens to be rectangle. it also happens to be affordable. come to think of it its also very filling. as for toppings theyve got just about any thing youd think of, and some you probably wouldnt think of. sausage? check! mushroom? check! clam? yes! make that a resounding yes! clam and garlic pizza is the shtuff, and i feel sorry for you if youre too scared. slices run from 3ish to almost 5 per. they open at 11 i think and are open late. beers on tap. wine. soft drinks. its kind of small, and finding a seat is hard (only bar seating available) but its good there or on the go. seriously, listen closely. if you dont know about golden boy pizza youre missing out on one of SFs best kept secrets.
author: Jarred D.

description: I have never found the best slice of pizza in the Bay Area until I came here, not intentionally. I actually had just finish lunch not long ago, maybe 30 minutes? We were walking around the neighborhood and right when I turned my head, I saw  a big sheet pan of hot, fragrant pizza right at my nose level in the front open window. I know I'm a pig and I admit that to anyone and everyone. I really was full but the smell just kept me walking towards the door. I went in and got a slice of heaven! The fact that the pizza is made on foccacia dough, it's a plus already with out tasting it. It's slathered with lots of topping! After taking one bit, I couldn't stop and finished it in literally 2 minutes top. I was SO FULL, I was gonna die from food coma. Worth every pain I had to go through in my stomach after eating that. Not that the pizza had made me sick but because I ate so much food, it made have the BIGGEST food coma I've ever had, and trust me, I've had a lot!
author: Juliane N.

description: It pains me to write this one because I use to love this place sooooo damn much.  I mean 8 out of 10 times the pizza was fresh and even if it wasn't they put it in the oven and heat it up for you.  OK NOW HERES THE BAD PART.  The last two times I went there, there was HAIR in the pizza.  The first time I was like ok things happen, but I waited a good 2 months before I went back.  I'm craving pizza I'm in the area I stop by get some pizza ( JUST OUT OF THE OVEN)  I cut into just to be on the safe side and there's a long black hair, JESUS MARY JOSEPH I couldn't believe it.  I go back inside just hand the pizza back and was like peace. Is it that hard to put a hair net on.
author: Jay S.

description: this has been my pizza place for the past 10 yrs!!! this place brings me good memorys! i was brought here when my brother decided we should go out for pizza. and since that day i became a fan!!! after school which at that point i was in middle school i'd invite all my friends for a slice. now im college. that was the kicking spot when ever my cousins and i went out. which was like every sunday. the pizza there is soooooooo good! and soooo fresh! omg! this place is better than blondies!!! i dont know if they still do that, but the time i went with my friends from middle school, they took us a picture. next time we went in they had post it on the fridge. you have to give this place a shot, who knows maybe you'll look back like i do. and fall in love with it!
author: Silvia C.

description: Any of these slices are delicious! I first started coming here when a local merchant invited me to grab a bite. I will be eternally grateful to him. These slices are so generous, cheesy and flavorful. Plus the poster of Christopher Walken is too perfect. I love it so much that I went here with friends for an entire week and I'm still craving it! One star off because when it gets really crowded t's a bummer to stand outside in the cold, especially when it's raining.
author: Nicole R.

description: a tiny little pizza place in north beach that sells 'em by the slice 'silician style'. a really good pizza! this the perfect place to come after one of those late nights out at the bars. they even have bar you can sit at to eat.
author: Michelle I.

description: I have lived in the city for 5 years.  My first 2 years were in post-college mode, i.e. going out 3 nights a week, most of the time in N Beach, and getting shit-faced.....very classy!  This pizza was my go-to drunk food and oh mama it has served me well.  I finally had to stop eating here though because i was getting killer heartburn every time I had a slice (hard to tell whether it was the copious amounts of booze, or the pizza, or the combination of both - one of life's great mysteries)... anyways I still think this pizza is solid, and I like the casual vibe and the walkup window late-nite style (although I do not dig the late-nite line).  Coincidentally, in my 28 years the closest I have EVER come to getting into an actual physical altercation was right otuside this place!  The story goes a little something like this - we were next in line, there was half a sheet of cheese pizza left and NOTHING else, and my friends and I decided to be complete a-holes and order the whole sheet, despite the 20 peeps in line behind us.... the resulting scene was not pretty.  I have never felt more hated.  But the pizza was SO WORTH IT :)
author: A B.

description: very average.  only good when you're drunk. come here after your clubbing rendezvous on broadway, but otherwise avoid.
author: Allen L.

description: something in their sauce...is it cocaine?  whatever it is, i'm addicted, plus a pitcher of hemp ale (a ha more illegal substances???) is really cheap and tasty.  if i'm in north beach, you can bet i'm there.  oh yeah, its just far enough off columbus to keep the tourists away.  for me, that's a good thing.
author: Daryl W.

description: good slices.  this place is a nice for simple late night food.
author: J R.

description: have you ever had better?! the crust is crispy, sauce is especially savory. if they run out even well past closing time, they'll make you more if you're standing in line. the price is right. a NB classic!!
author: lindaven p.

description: Somehow every time I try to eat here the fates work against me and it never happens. Last time I was in line for a slice and they closed the front door on my face. Jerks.
author: Jeremy K.

description: If you are in North Beach, then drop by this tiny hole in the world for a great slice of pizza
author: Cow H.

description: Some of the best pizza in the city. There is nothing like a smoking hot center slice of chess from this place.  Sicilian slices at their best flavor and value.  Great hardworking staff too.
author: Alexander F.

description: SUCH a good and legit pizza place. the place itself is small and narrow and it gets a bit stuffy towards the back of the joint but its worth it. i got the pesto vegetarian pizza which was sooooooooooo good. i havent really had anything like it and i loved the dough-iness of the pizza. my boyfriend and i were craving it the day after we had it. were definitely going to go back!!!
author: Melanie F.

description: delicious sicilian style pizza.  tasty anytime of the day, and at it's best after 2am!
author: Sheri N.

description: what looks to be an ordinary piece of pizza is actually something thats way beyond the level of palatable. the pepperoni pizza itself is thick, has a nice texture to it, and above all, is delicious. slices are decent at around $3 each. only drawback of this place is it's small size. good luck locating a place to sit on saturday nights, and expect to eat standing up on the sidewalk as i have twice out of the three times i ate there so far. on a side note, theres a place called 101 music down the street from golden boy pizza. stay away and do not entertain the thought of soliciting this place.
author: XO Dosia G.

description: yes. good pizza. not your traditional triangular shape though, but thick and rectangular and full of flavorful toppings.  its best when they have it fresh from the oven.  friendly staff and great food - an awesome straight to the point joint in north beach. and just a note, beware of the long lines that form on the sidewalk.  you know what that means, you should line up too =)
author: Paul A.

description: not exciting taste-wise, but a good way to soak up liquor!
author: Jill k.

description: It will knock ya out!!!  Fast, fresh, great for what it is.  Nice place to take a breather from the bars and get some grub.
author: Ry G.

description: not particularly enamored with the $3.50 lukewarm veggie combo slice (omg, it's square!  omg, cornmeal crust!), but after a $10 pitcher of stella, i have fond (albeit hazy) memories of this place.
author: Katherine K.

description: Whenever I'm in north beach, i absolutely have to get a slice here everytime. they have long lines but it goes by quickly.
author: Tomas V.

description: This is my FAVORITE pizza place in the bay. I have never been disappointed. I have been to sooooo many pizza places in SF and just been plain grossed out. Get the clam pizza... it's the best. ohhh sweet sweet clams...
author: John B.

description: so good.  the best of course when you're drunk and hungry.  but pretty much great any time of day.
author: a g.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in the Bay Area. Great  location, fun atmosphere, delicious pizza, friendly staff.  Highly recommended. Have a drink after at Columbus Cafe, also nice.
author: Mike G.

description: WOW - if you are staying in Union Square, or anywhere near North Beach, and you love pizza, you've got to stop in to Golden Boy.  Don't expect much atmosphere or service.  It's a bare bones kind of place.  The staff was definitely friendly.  The pizza - just a real good taste.  Different for sure.  Not greasy, and didn't 'bother' us after dinner at all.  After walking for hours that day, that pizza was the bomb!  Check it out.
author: Dena P.

description: Got the clam/garlic pizza, due to the popularity of it on here. Was not disappointed! It just came out of the oven and was nice and hot.  Just make sure to have a mint afterwards.
author: Jonathan M.

description: i expected great things and found it to be over hyped, go to tony's a block away
author: Michael M.

description: Got into San Francisco late and Sodini's was closed and we were starving. Saw Golden Boy was opened and there were some empty seats at the bar so we went in. Loved the hot, thick crust pizza very much. It reminded me of the deep dish pizza I used to get in Philadelphia as a kid. We all loved it and I was able to get a cold beer and my friend was able to get a glass of wine. The waiter/bartender was awesome. He was very friendly and did a great job of making sure everyone was taken care of in a very efficient manner.
author: Susan P.

description: Hands down the BEST "slice" in the city. Everything is fresh, from the hand made dough to the daily delivered veggies. Its all done Sicilian style and very simple. It makes me laugh when someone pops in looking confused and says "..what've you got?" when there are plainly only five styles laid out in front of 'em (although the clam and garlic slices are conspicouously concealed at the end of the cheese slices)The pesto-veggie is great and the combo is packed with tons of great stuff. Good beers on tap, and a great root-beer on tap for the kiddies (free refils).   If you can get a stool at the main counter on the weekend you are in for a treat. Tony is a freakin' riot...loud music and lotsa laughs ask him for the wireless controller if you wanna try your skills at the playstation hidden behind the counter. I know everyone has their favorite spot for pizza, and I have my favorite for an entire pie, but the heavy-weight champ of pizza by the slice is definitely Golden Boy.
author: Manny V.

description: I don't crave anything in North beach. except This pizza. it's so good i can't even explain. there's only a couple places that make me want to start eating meat again. this is one of them. their pepperoni pizzas make me salivate to no end. i'm salivating as i write this. what a palette tease. (sigh)
author: bloopie s.

description: best pizza in sf. nuff said.
author: Kathy K.

description: almost 5 stars for this dump... really???  golden boy is only good when you have had 15 beers, 10 shots of whiskey and 5 car bombs!  their pizza sucks!  the BS hipsters love it though.  they think, "its square it has to be cool!"  frankly, it's square, greasy and will give you the shits in the morning.  what the fuck, is everyone out of their mind today?  it's crap pizza that gives you the craps!  hell no and no way will i go ever again.  i don't care how hip you get.  fuck this shit hole!
author: T D.

description: their square pizza is to die for! i always get the vegetarian pesto pizza. i think the magic is in the crust. it's the perfect thickness and it has such a nice crisp!
author: Oleya P.

description: golden crust, golden delicious!  why is pizza so tastey when you're drunk?  i recently had golden boy when i was sober and it was just as tastey!  that deserves 5 stars.
author: jen b.

description: best pizza in the city. and i know this to be true because i've had it somber and drunk!
author: jen v.

description: I've only been here twice, but both times the pizza was delicious and the people behind the counter were very, very nice. I'll be coming back soon!
author: Gregory G.

description: This place is soooo good!!!  The long line is what caught my attention in 2003 - and till this day I go there with friends when were in the city.  I like the garlic clam, combination, sausage and pesto with veggies!!!!  YUMMM!  The service is excellent as well!  Also to top it off with the pizza make sure to have their Root beer on tap - its good stuff!!!!!  GO THERE!!!
author: Indira M.

description:
who doesn't love golden boy at 2AM??? okay so i have to admit - they're most sicilian style pizza and not really deep dish but it's ok. this place is super busy late night - this pizza orgasmica at 2AM busy. 

it's fast and cheap. only downside is that when you're sober it doesn't really taste as good. my advice - if you're in north beach for some late night action and hungry - go here.
author: Miss O.

description: Really tasty pizza.  I'm from Chicago and can be very picky regarding pizza, but Golden Boy is always good.  You do not need to be drunk.  I usually go there sober.
author: Tom Z.

description: Save the calories from not ordering that last beer and rewardy ourself with a slice of golden boy pizza..........
author: Erica K.

description: if only every bar was next to a pizza place like golden boy.  i may never wash my sweater again since it's home to a stain i got from a slice.  when you order two slices to go, they wrap each one in wax paper and then slide them into a small bag.  so convenient for the cab ride home.  brilliant.  serious bt.
author: boner time j.

description: Awesome pizza, great crust!  Love getting pizza from here after a night of drinking.  Definite must if you are in the area and in the mood for a slice.
author: amy l.

description:
It might seem as though i give 5 stars to everything, but the way i see it i only take time to write reviews for places i feel deserve 5 stars.  why publicly bag on other places.  they know they're bad.  and i'm not talking michael jackson bad.

So me and my brother and cousin stumbled upon this heavenly spot on my 21st birthday (a few years back), so naturally drunkeness leads to hunger.  This was the closest spot open past the bar hours, so we said f it, let's just get this.  we thought we were in heaven.  we got the pesto vegetarian (because that's what was left), and were more than pleased.   but then again we were drunk....

...which spurned a second trip to golden boy when my brother visited me again.  oddly we kept thinking about this spot individually ever since, it went a little something like this:
me: what do you wanna do when you're up here? you wanna go anywhere in particular?
brother: no, not really.
me: are you sure?
brother:  no...
me: okay...
brother:  well, this is gonna sound a little stupid...
me: what?
brother:... you remember when we got drunk in... what is it called... north bea...
me:  I WANNA GO BACK AND EAT PIZZA TOO!!!!!
brother:  BUT WE WERE DRUNK!! DO YOU EVEN REMEMBER WHERE WE WERE?!?!?
me:  DAMMIT!!!!! that's right....

so we ever so desperately combed the north beach area, trying to piece together that night, and after much strain in trying to resurrect the brain cells we killed that night and some sheer luck in recognizing random things from mental snap shots of the night AND LOTS OF WALKING/CIRCLING the same 6 block area, we finally found the hole in the wall.  literally, the hole in the wall, they were doing some facade reconstruction and past it many times during our quest.

so sober taste buds agree with drunk taste buds.  it was delicious.  okay, honestly, the pesto vegetarian could have a little more flavor, but the pros outweigh the cons.  the crust is PERFECTION.  it's like light crispy focaccia.  toppings are tasty.  and even though someone else could label it bland, it still gives me and my brother a sense of satisfaction when we bite into the crispy deliciousness.  clam garlic is DELICIOUS.  you could get cheese, pepperoni, etc, but why? you can get that everywhere else.  and root beer on tap.  what a GREAT idea.  we always make it a point to visit our favorite west coast pizza stop every time he visits me.  the only thing better on the west coast to us is pizzarito in SoCal.  but i heard they closed the one on the west side/manhattan beach.  so golden boy is now number one.  but to me blondies is a close second due to slice size and the blanket of cheese.  I take that back.  what is up with blondie's???  It's seriously been going downhill lately.  sucks, it used to be such a good deal back in the day.  so sad when you cross a good pizza place off your list.  but i had cheesy sticks from west coast the other night, and thankfully those are still delicious.
author: Lei Z.

description: Good hangover reliever after a night of drinking. Mariissa rules on Friday and Saturday too.  They are a little cheap on cheese or else five stars.
author: Heidi P.

description: Perhaps my favorite pizza in town - you can taste the oregano, herbs, garlic, olive oil - all my friends that I have taken there are hooked.  The simple pizzas are my favorite: cheese, or pepperoni, and the sausage is great.  Tip: if you're taking some home and want to reheat a slice or more, the best way is to turn up your oven to the highest on bake, wait for it to get really hot and then throw in the slices on a cookie sheet for about 5-7 mins.  Taste SO much better than reheating them at say 375 degrees for a longer period of time.  I know it might be a waste of energy, but you can't fuck around with good pizza.
author: Adrian M.

description: the best pizza ever, if you go once I guarantee you, you will want to go every day.
author: mike t.

description: I'm not going to lie, I prefer my pie, well, pie shaped, and less doughy.  HOWEVER, this pizza ain't crap.  I was super stoked on my veggie slice (is that right terminology? Their portions are square.  I mean, you don't get a slice of brownie.  But I digress.).  It had lots of different veggies piled on top of mozzarella and pesto, served with real silverware at a bar with plenty of seating and a nice selection of beer (Racer 5 IPA? Yes, please).  Now, I'm that asshole who likes to have my cake (pie?) and eat it too, so if my pizza has pesto sauce solomente, I'm going to want some marinara to boot.  The pizza jerk behind the counter (he was very nice) obliged and apologized that it would be cold.  It didn't matter.  Everything was tasty and satisfying, and for a Wednesday night they were doing quite the tidy window service business.  Definitely a good spot if you're in the mood for a quick bite and you're over on that side of town.  Especially when you're drinking.  I have seen the window service get pretty busy on weekend nights.
author: Amanda B.
